comment: Useless class. All I learned was how to follow a tutorial-turns out I already knew how to do that. Basically, you follow tutorials for points in order to become familiar w/SAP. 2 tests on material in book, 1 test at end of course on SAP using tutorials again, 1 presentation on SAP to class. Theuta Cata is pleasant and laid back for this course.
No Comments

The tests are impossible, 80 multiple choice questions based off powerpoints with over 60 slides a piece. There's no way to retain all of the information especially since all of it is simply talked over in the lecture and nothing else. The projects are the only thing that keeps the grades in the class decent. As far as the teacher goes, she's nice.

She is the professor to take for this class. Extremely helpful on projects and exams are tough, but she warns you ahead of time. Just read the chapters three times and you can get an A on them. She will do anything to help you out with your projects, and overall cares about her students. Would take again.
Needs to learn to read and to speak English....she is a horrible educator

What a waste.  She cannot teach.  She does not provide assistance when asked about exams and quizzes.  There was no book for SAP, only screen shots, and it is a SAP class.  She doesn't return emails consistently.  This is the most poorly taught class I have taken in this program.  Save yourself:  do not put yourself through the confusion.
How she continues to be allowed to be a professor it is beyond me.  Provide zero instruction for online classes.

This instructor is the worst instructor I'v encountered.  There is a severe language barrier and test questions are not clear.  I took this as an online class & was required to attend class at least 5 times.  She did not teach one session online.  She did not return emails most of the time.  This was a total waste of time and money.  Inexcusable.

Please avoid taking her classes. Unprofessional , Knows very little about her subjects but act as if she knows everything. Never replies to emails or questions. Worst professor and class I have taken. Exams are horrible. Very Rude and mean to students.

Worst of the worst. Guess she is having a fake doctorate ... Why did NKU hire uneducated people. We poor students have to suffer. PLEASE AVOID for your own good. If you have a class with her its time to drop it else get a failing grade.
Worst teacher I've ever had
Cannot speak correct english, does not answer emails, is not a reasonable person!
She explained the chapters well. She gave extra time for assignments when the class was struggling with them. I feel she was a very good professor for this topic.

Very stressful 8 weeks. Lots of homework and in depth assignments with very confusing instructions. Be prepared to spend a ton of time outside of online class researching how to do certain requirements. But if you go out of your way to get ahold of her (so that you can understand her instructions, etc) then she will help you  and you will pass.

Will tell you ok to send something in late then will deduct points for being late. Unreasonable!! You get 30 seconds for each questions on the test. Doesn't answer emails or returns message. Doesn't care!

Going on last comment READ THE SYLLABUS, she tells you that you can turn it in late with reduced points. She also reccomends Blackboard for questions, I found that she responds to emails frequently.(as long as you put class name in the subject line like she asks)Time limit makes tests hard but considering they are multi choice, it could be worse

I think she is very good teacher to my opinion. She have a good empathy to students to help. She is strict on points and grades when you late. No exception!! when she cut the points on you. Rather than she is OK to take her if you don't have any choice to take. BIS 300

I happen to think that she was an excellent professor.  She laid everything out that was expected of students clearly in the syllabus.  She always replied to emails and on blackboard.  I felt as though she really cared about students and teaching in general.  The assignments were as expected for a Master's degree level.  I would recommend her.

Worst teacher ever.. Very unclear and you only get 30 seconds per question on an 80 question M/C exam. The questions are not simple t/f they take time to anwser. Things in the class are not well explained...Why did you have to be my last class in college? I was having a okay time untill now...
Recommended. Just complete the asinments on time and you'll succeed. A little effort will reward you with an A.

I like her no nonsense professionalism. The class is straight forward. I hate the group assignments, but other than that she is a good professor. Tests are long but multiple choice and straight out of book. Assignments are clear, and she will go over them in class.

I had Dr. Cata for undergrad and her teaching style is similar at both levels. She reads straight from power points and it completely BORING. Class is pretty much useless. Just make sure to read the chapters to do well on the exams... they're not so hard if you study!
Was wrong about the subject matter on several occasions. When presented with evidence that she was wrong, she continued to deny it.
No Comments

Nice teacher who cares about the subject.  She's from Albania and sometimes I had trouble understanding her English.  Her tests are difficult but it's possible to score well because of all the projects (2 group and 3 individual).  Lots of work, I wish they'd change books because the test questions come from the test bank and the book is just awful
No Comments
nice set of legs too ;)

Dr Cata contacted me with help even before I stepped foot in her classroom.  She takes a real interest in her students and will go above and beyond to see that you achieve your goals - so long as you put in the effort.  She expects you to work, which is extremely fair.  The work load was not at all unreasonable and she does draw heavily fromthebook

Not a bad professor at all. Pretty standard, test questions are MC and directly from the book. There is a long research project required with a paper/presentation but you have plenty of time to do it and get a good grade if you work hard. She is there to help!
Hardest tests I've ever taken, webcam required. You aren't allowed to email her. She never gets back to you in a timely fashion. Offers virtually no help whatsoever.
Clear on the material and gives good lectures.
She is my favorite professor.  Take one of her classes and you'll find out how good she is. She is very hot too!!

She was great in my opinion, very clear into what needs to be done and how to do it, very open to talk to and I  feel she was there to guide you thru anything that was unclear or confusing.  The ability to take everything theorical and apply it on to real world cases was one of the best things I took from the way she formats the class, I enjoyed it

Ok, so didn't get the best of grades this semester, but I appreciate Dr. Cata's fairness and honesty in grading me.  This is my second class with her, and the thing I most like is her energy in putting her classes together and especially in her lecture style.  She's a stickler on grading, do not underestimate this class!

There is a lot of comments about this teacher and I was scared to take her class b/c all of them but as long as you do the work and read the chapters, you will do fine. She is a good teacher! The people who are saying that she is hard is saying that b/c they didn't read the book.
Very able, a trainer, encouraging.

The most difficult frustrating course I have ever taken! Huge language barrier and she's ver unrealistic and doesn't understand the subject! Avoid at all cost to spare your GPA!! Don't say I didn't warn you !!!!
stay away from this teacher at all cost

She really cares about her students and is reasonable. You do have to show up to class to sign in she gives attendance bonus points as well as points for going to events on campus that she is hosting. If you have any problems she is willing to help you. You have to read and the exams are timed but open book open notes which is how all bis300 are.

Classwork was clearly stated in the syllabus. A demanding and time consuming, a lot of work, its a graduate class so its par for the course.  The projects were very time consuming.  I struggled on the quizzes but got by, simply reading the book and going to class weren’t enough for me. You are forced to learn the subject if you hope to pass.
Buy the ebook. All test are online and open book

Language barrier. Lectures or any interaction with this professor are useless. Nothing she says is covered on quizzes or tests. Read the (online) textbook, take very diligent notes, and you'll survive. A bit condescending, especially if you request review of a question (I gave the textbook answer, got a test question wrong, but she didn't care).

I have never worked so hard in a class in my life. She has projects through RStudio and Excel and gives little to no explanation of the assignments or how to do them. The GA was amazing, only reason I passed. She was extremely unhelpful and when you did ask for help she would say that the instructions were clear. Obviously not if I need help!

Stupidest class I've ever had to take. 70 minutes timed lockdown browser test with 70 questions, so basically she expects you to have a robotic mind that has everything mugged up and instantly know the answer when you see the question in the test because you don't get time to think, forget about rechecking what you have done.

Dr. Cata genuinely cares about her students and is more than happy to work with you if she senses that you care as well. She pulls the majority of her material from the text book, so be sure to read! There are many quizzes / tests and always a cumulative group project. Also, absolutely no language barrier! :)
Very nice professor. Highly rec.

This has a high-level class about IS's and there was no depth, making it harder. I made at least 50 notecards per chapter and we covered 2 chapters a week. Literally memorizing definitions, taking a quiz online, never getting to see correct answers (only what was missed) - overall very little to no learning, frustrating in an MBA class

Her online class isn't difficult. You read the chapter, listen to the recorded lecture, and then take quiz. She grades easy if you clearly hit all of the points she puts on the rubic. I enjoyed this class. The group project isn't too bad either.

MBA level class but all I did was try to memorize abbreviations. The quizzes were on a lockdown video recorded browser and you just had to try to remember the random abbreviations from a chapter twice a week. The class might as well have been on zooology or astronomy, because I learned nothing. Zero application of learning to real world.

Dr. Miller was an amazing professor. Stats is a difficult class however he made it easy to learn. I would HIGHLY recommend Dr. Miller for any stats class. If you don't understand something don't be afraid to ask questions; he will find a way to help you understand!

Dr. Miller is a great guy. Material can get difficult, but he is very helpful, and will meet with you whenever.  Very particular about sentence form so know what he likes.  Class is not mandatory but if you miss class you will fall behind, and it is hard to catch back up.

Great professor! I have ALWAYS hated math and he helped me get over that fear. This class is very time consuming but well worth the time and effort. He will work with his students to make sure they comprehend the material.
Pretty good professor. i would take him again if it wasnt for something as rough as statistics. He's really nice and he seems to genuinely be concerned when he sees the class grades declining.
Best Sta212 teacher!!

I hate statistics but he was great. Was dreading this class. Have to come every day to learn but he explains it so well that you just get it.  If you have trouble, speak up and he will continue until you do. Got an A and I hate Stats!! Gives little quizzes but they are pretty easy.  Excellent professor!!
He is a nice guy and is willing to help but he wasn't very clear on his problems.

He is a nice guy, and always willing to help. He is very smart, but I think it gets in the way of his teaching sometimes and makes it hard to understand the content. He gives alot of notes on topics, but does not always work through example problems which for me is a problem because that is how I learn and comprehend.
Dr. Miller is a very cool/nice person - always willing to chat. He may not always be very clear in class when going over the material but when you do the homework and assignments it all makes sense.

Carl is a really sweet guy and awesome to chat with. But he seems to not understand that the students all don't have Phds in the subject like he does. He never stops for questions and you're confused by the material until you work the homework. If you're natural at the concepts you'll be fine but don't take him if math can be a struggle.

Mr. Miller is a straightforward teacher that is willing to help you, IF YOU ASK FOR IT. Clearly knows hos stuff and can explain it so well I believe my eight year-old sisters can do the homework.But you have to put in the time that is needed to understand the material.

Cmill is a great professor when it comes to comparing him to the rest of the statistics professors the nku has to offer. He does give a study guide and some opportunities for extra credit.  But he is not very clear in his teaching method. Also he does not allow you to work with classmates on homework and will give a zero if you are caught.

Although the class isn't very interesting, he made it as good as he possibly could.  You can get by without doing any homework if you are confident enough, and it is difficult not to do well on tests and quizzes.  Always allows cheat sheets.  Very good.
awesome teacher
No Comments

From someone who struggles in math, I highly reccomend him. Do your homeowork and attend class and you will pass. He is very helpful and approachable. It not EASY but not difficult to pass if you try. He wants you to do well
Great professor.  Very good at explaining the concepts.  Just go to class, pay attention and you'll be fine.
One of the best prof's i have ever had.  he explains the material so well.  do your homework, go to class, and pay attention...easy pass.
I liked him. Explain good. If you study, easy grade.
great teacher, explains everything, you need to go to class though because he gives you mini quizes

This man is very helpful. He is funny too, which makes the class enjoyable. He is very supportive if you dont understand something. He will explain it until you get it. The guy is really cool, and he does hold u until the last minute of class. But other than that, you should definitely take him.
Very nice, hard I thought. Did work with you to try and make you understand it

Awesome teacher. Very good at explaining the subject and very easy to follow. Very helpful, if you get stuck just go to his office and he’ll help you out. I HIGHLY recommend taking him for stats. You won’t regret it.
TAKE HIM IF YOU WANT TO PASS!!!
Best STA teacher at NKU! Very Helpful and understanding.  I had to miss class for a week and he gave me all notes and assignments ahead of time.  Take him if you can.
amazing professor the best teacher i have ever had. take him no matter what!!!

Dr. Miller is a wonderful STATS Professor!  But the class can be difficult with all that MINITAB work, and the aweful book...but I believe they are using a new one this semester.  He or Dr. Baggett are your best STATS options...I thought that both were great.  You are in good hands....don't worry.

This was the hardest course I've taken so far, but he made it as easy as he could.  He doesn't let you skate through though.  MAKE SURE you attend EVERY class-the next day after you miss, it will be like he's speaking a different language.  It's difficult, but as long as you show up and put in as much effort as possible, you'll be fine.

He is an amazing teacher.  He had such an easy way of teaching Statistics, and I really understood what he was saying.  Tests are not too hard, and as long as you pay attention and take notes, you'll do fine.

He is a good guy just not a very good teacher. I tried everything, got tutors and stayed after class, studied for every test long and hard and he never cut me a break, i just am not good at stats. Awful teacher, good guy, terrible class
This class was neither hard nor easy for me.  He is very helpful and wants you to do well in his class.  Plus he gives out EXTRA CREDIT!!!!
Great teacher!! very helpful, he made stats not so stressfull, you have to study alot but it's not that bad

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS with this professor! NOTHING was made clear! Every lecture was jargen I didn't understand (but was apparently expected to already know), and he leaves ZERO room for error. I did all the homework, attended every lecture, and still nearly failed because of how poorly he conveyed the info. Seems like a nice guy, HORRID professor

AWESOME. A lot of people hate stats, but I honestly didn't mind it. I'm good at math but if it weren't for Dr. Miller, it would have been way harder. He makes sure to clearly explain everything and as long as you come to class and pay attention, it's easy! He never let us leave early but  he's an all around great guy and awesome at teaching.

I was extremely intimidated going into a Statistics class (I have not taken a math course in about 6 years) I had also heard it was extremely hard to take online but Dr. Miller was extremely helpful, was quick to respond to emails, and held video chats twice a week to study.  It is not a class you can sail through without putting in some time!

Really seems to know what he is talking about. If you need help he'll certainly help out. Homework is straight forward and you can continue to do until you can an A (only in MyStatLab though). If you miss a day it isn't the end of the world. He posts everything online and is quick to respond to emails. Would definitely take again!

If you don't study, you won't do well. If you have questions you should ask; he's very helpful and wants everyone to do well. The class is hard, so be prepared to work for a good grade. He was a great teacher though and he is a savage.. it's awesome.
Doesn't fully explain in great detail. Not bad professor.
Great teacher.  Stats is very hard, but he made things so clear and understandable.  If you take Stats, take it with him.
Obviously knows the class material but really unclear when he explains things.  There are lots of assignments but class notes don't help much.  Take someone else if you can.
Funny and easy to understand

Worst math professor of I've had.  Spends half of class on something then says, "But that's the long way." No graded HW. Quizzes and tests only - tests are heavily weighted & most of class didn't even have time to finish.  Have to ask same question 10 times to get an answer, so expect to self teach. Never made below A in math until this class.

Very helpful, made an effort to give good explanations. The class can be a bit difficult but Prof Miller is often in his office and is always excited to answer questions. Would definitely take his class again.

He is very helpful during class, and he makes the material easy to understand.  I think if you're going to take 205 then try to get him. His tests are straight forward and he announces most quizzes, which they are totally easy.

HE GIVES OUT TOO MANY HOMEWORKS AND QUIZZES ONE AFTER THE OTHER, AND MAJOR TESTS, TOO. YOU WON'T LEARN ANYTHING ONLINE, AS HE WOULD POST VIDEOS OF LECTURES IN TEGRITY, BUT JUST BASICALLY READ TO YOU WHAT THE POWERPOINT IS. I REPEAT, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM. FIND A DIFFERENT PROFESSOR.

I took his STA205 class last semester and loved it. very easily understood from his lectures. very lenient about homework, all of it was online but he always extended the deadlines. The tests we're fairly simple, he doesn't try and trick you, its all basic concepts. wish I could take him for every math class!!
the bad teacher ever, i took his class in summer 2012, he never explain very well,no late homework, no late quiz, and doesn't offer extra credit until our grad so bad.
Great teacher!

He is such a nice guy and will help you outside of class if you ask for it, though he does not explain things in lass at all and doesn't work through practice problems.Great guy but not a great professor

GREAT PROFESSOR, I was nervous about taking Stats but Dr. Miller made it easier to understand and was always available to help. I recommend taking him for Stats if you have to take the course, you won't be disappointed.
He expected us to already know the information. There was no teaching only homework and quizzes thrown at us. Worse math teacher I've had...

He is not clear at all. There were no notes whatsoever. He only had problems with answers but never how to do anything and it's an intro. class. I felt like he expected us to know info about it already which I didn't at all...hence the intro. part....
Very good teacher. Makes things easy to understand.

The class tested by standards, and you have multiple opportunities to earn mastery on them. If you didn't get the standard on the test right, you can retake the standard. If you do the retakes and the learning checks you will get a good grade. He is very understanding and wants you to pass!

The best stats teacher you will find!! Trust me- take his class! He is super compassionate and will go out of his way to help you! He makes it super easy to understand the material. Awesome teaching and test style! I failed stats before I took him and I received an A in his class!! 10/10 professor :)

I have never been good at math, but Dr. Miller was the best professor I've ever had. He explains concepts extremely well and is very easy to talk to. He explained intricate concepts in such great detail that made it easy for me to understand. You definitely do have to put in effort for this class, but as long as you do, you will do fine!

Awesome professor, he has everything set up as modules, its hard to understand the set up at first but its very easy. I already like math so I may be biased but he made me love statistics, he explains very well and if you don't understand math he will help you. I would definitely recommend him. You can retake every test and get full credit.

He was very helpful and good at explaining things. Fairly easy as long as you pay attention in class and do your homework. I started out dreading this class and came out of it really liking statistics. I would definitely take him again if I got the chance.
Dr. Miller, was a great professor and a nice guy. I'd recommend taking him.

Mr. Miller made stats easy to understand! He puts effort into helping with homework questions and goes into detail about concepts. Tests aren't complex and you get to retake two of them. His practice tests set you up for success. Homework can be a bit difficult but he is willing to help you!
Professor Miller is very caring and his lectures are easy to understand.
Not the best. Doesn't explain things very well and likes to watch you take quizzes and tests (this was an online class for me). Deadlines moved around all the time, making it difficult to keep up.

Carl is the only person who has taught me anything math related and I have not cried in frustration because of not understanding. Hes really sweet and sincere! 10/10 would take again but not really because I no longer need math based classes!

Miller does not explain things very well and when you don't understand, he makes it your fault. Not only does he not explain well, but he does not go as in-depth as he should, and the stuff he does go in-depth, you do not need to know. Be ready to teach yourself the majority of this information.
Good teacher.. just come to class everyday, listen and its a piece of cake.
I Love Hilde!She has such a sweet and gentle personality which makes her very approachable. She really likes what she is teaching and wants you to do well in the class!
She is very helpful and cares about her students....
Professor Baldridge was very helpful and made the subject easy to lear if you attend class.
She is very smart, has a great personality, and although the class content is very difficult she makes it enjoyable.

She is a really good prof. I enjoyed her alot. She has a cute personality. she's not boring. Her exams arent that hard you just got to look over the notes and you'll do fine. Just don't miss to many class because she does tell you what you need to know n wat you dnt. And she does give some extra credit. One of my fav. profs!

I love this professor! Her tests are easy for the most part and she explains everything! Go to class though because her powerpoints have missing sections that you have to fill in. I would deff. take her again!

By far the best anatomy lecturer NKU has.  The tests come directly from her power points and are very straightforward.  I had her for A&P 209 lab as well and definitely would have taken her for 209 lecture if she was an option.

Dr. Baldridge was a great professor! She's always very willing to help, really knows her stuff and is able to communicate it in a way that makes it easy to understand. Her tests were somewhat difficult but easy if you try. A WORD OF CAUTION! Dont waste 150 bucks on the textbook! She never uses it!
Couldn't imagine a better Anatomy professor. She really knows her stuff and makes it easy to learn. Just make sure to not miss class, and you don't really use the textbook.
Great teacher, professional, helpful.

Pick Professor Baldridge! She knows what she's talking about. I had her for BIO 208 and BIO 209 Lab. She's so sweet and helpful. If you need her to explain something, she will explain it until she knows that you understand it. Anatomy is going to be hard no matter the teacher, but Professor Baldridge really cares.

She's amazing! I am not getting a good grade but it's all my fault. She's my favorite professor! She is so willing to help and meet with you anytime! All the test questions come from the notes. I have NEVER used the textbook. It's a really challenging class, but if you have to take it, pick her!
Hard to understand, never opened the book in class. Hated the class. Do not recommend.

She is the best anatomy professor NKU has. This class is going to be hard no matter who you take, but she is so willing to help and meet with you. She's just great! Study hard for the exams! they are no cake walk

Dr. Baldridge is a sweetheart! She ALWAYS offers to answer any questions you may have. Tests are the only grade other than a couple small extra credit assignments. They are also straight from the notes though so go to class!

This professor is great. Hard material but if you study straight out of the book you should do fine. Do well on the first test, it will make the class easier. I had to take a remedial math class and got a B+ in this class. You don't have to be smart to do well, just look at the material a lot
She is a great professor! She is very knowledgeable about anatomy and will answer any questions you ask. She is the sweetest lady! Although, her tests are difficult, must study hard!

She was very profesional and answered even the most odd questions with calm assurance.  She was willing to answer questions.  Her tests were not easy, but neither were they hard.  The only possible problem was her slight german accent.

Her class was super easy but she was boring. The only reason I even went to class was to get the study guides because her tests were hard and because she took attendance. (Which is a stupid thing since I was paying her to teach me.)
I hated this class, it was boring, and I couldn't stand it and neither could any of my friends.

easy easy easy easy easy. she puts all the notes online so you don't REALLY have to go to class. she takes her exams straight from the notes, don't bother getting the book or reading it. exams are easy. just study the notes for a few hours and you'll be fine. it's a lot of information, but she gives it all to you and it's up to you to study so don't be a slacker.

She is very understanding and helpful. A&P is never an easy class, but she does try and make it understandable. I felt sometimes it was hard to ask a question, but if you do, she makes sure you understand it before moving on. I would take her again!
Excellent professor. She explains the material so that you can understand it. She is very helpful, if you have a question. She is the best.

Very good teacher, will answer any questions you have and typically offers SI with her courses.  The accent sometimes get to you but she knows her stuff.   There are worse teachers for the same section.  Her test are not hard, her lecture is verbatium from her powerpoint notes, but attending really helps.
very dry and doesn't make anything interesting
excellent professor, keeps you interested!
Very Dry.  Straight foreward scantron tests. Get a section with SI available.  If you study the SI study guides you'll do great.
Very good teacher, but reads straight from power point notes...try to get a section with SI very helpful...they pretty much go right over all the test questions...very very helpful
Don't take her, the SI is like another class in its own. She has a 100 question final, and no clue what to study for.

TAKE SCOLIA THE ONLY GRADE YOUR GRADE IS ASED ON IT YOUR TEST.  SO IF YOU FREEZE A LITTLE ON TEST, DONT TAKE HER. I PASSED HER CLASS, I COULD HAVE DONE BETTER WITH  A STUDY GUIDE ATTENDENCE DOESN'T HELP NOR CLASS PARTICIPATION. I WAS TOLDYOU NEED A CERTAIN GRADE PERCENTAGE  TO PASS, I  ASKED IF SHE ROUNDED UP. EXAMPLE  79.6 TO A 80.  SHE SAID NO.

i loved her, but you have to want to learn... you have to come class to get the notes, but they're all posted on blackboard so you can print out the powerpoints and then just fill in the blanks in for yourself.. do the reviews (on BB) and go to class, and you should do fine.. but have to want to learn this subject really understand any of it..

She is originally from Germany so her accent is still very thick so kida hard to understand. Good notes but you have to go to class to get the important blanks on the powerpoint. Best way to pass is follow the outline on black board that she posts way ahead of time..use SI!!! SHE IS HORRIBLE FOR LAB TAKE MICHELL OTTERSBACH FOR LAB SHES EASIEST 4 LA
No Comments

I think Dr. Baldridge is great. She knows her stuff! She isn't a hard professor, it's just that the material is hard and you have to want to put a lot of effort into it. If you study hard, you can get an A. Make sure you attend SI, everyone who is attending SI is outscoring everyone else on the tests.

ANATOMY IS HARD no matter who the teacher is, but Mrs. Baldridge makes it easier.  Her exams come straight from the powerpoint notes SHE GIVES YOU.  She usually provides an SI instructor which is very helpful.  Her tests were super clear, she never gives you trick questions.  Go to SI, come to class, review the material and you are guaranteed an A.

She was very helpful and knew her material. For labs, I could always go after class and ask questions and she really made me feel like she wanted to help! LOVED HER LAB CLASS! lecture is kinda boring though.

I loved Dr. Baldridge!  She is sweet and very helpful. She does post power points, but it's best to come to class because there are blanks to fill in, and she also explains things well.  Her tests were kind of easy.  No trick questions.  She is soft spoken, so I recommend sitting up front if you are serious about the class.
Baldridge is great.  She wants you to know the really important stuff and doesn't pressure you to know every little detail.  I really like her!
Very helpful. Knows what she is talking about.

Had her for lecture in 208. Thought I would take her for 209 Lab. What a mistake. Very difficult! Hard to understand but ask her to make your class study guides, it helps a lot. You have to really want to learn the material and spend a good amount of time studying. In the end it will pay off. Baldridge likes to teach anatomy and it really shows.

She is really hard to understand because she speaks so slow. She also doesn't explain things very well if you ask her a question. You have to go to all her classes and take lots of notes if you want to pass.

She uses PP notes and has you fill in blanks so you have to go to class to get her notes. Studied hard for 2-3 days before exams and then you take them and realize they are pretty easy (she can make them so much harder but doesn't-simple MC ?s) she gives ECr asst week before exam but only for 2.5pts, her exams (4 exams) come straight from her ppts
Boring class and test are very hard
HORRIBLE. You can't understand her and her classes are so boring. I've emailed her multiple times about helping me out and she never responded. I don't recommend her.

I have her for 208 lab, she is excellent!  she explains it well and her exams are straight forward, no tricks.  If you study and know the info, you'll be fine.  Go to open lab!!!  If you don't study, you won't do well regardless of the instructor.  I have an A+, but I work hard!

This was a hybrid course.  Part online and part on campus.  She is a great professor!  Hilde knows her stuff and makes Anatomy, which is difficult, do-able.  There is a lot of information, but if you study her notes and go to class, you can get a good grade.  She is very clear on what you need to study and know for exams.  She is also very helpful.
Baldridge is amazing. Absolutely loved her lectures. They may be long, but she makes sure you understand the curriculum. Must study for the tests!
Hilde is the best! She makes lectures fun, and she does have an accent, but she's not hard to understand AT ALL. Loved her and the class.
average professor; tests aren't very difficult
doesn't speak loud enough, her lectures are vague. Doesn't emphasize what to study for tests. It's like pulling teeth to get answers from her!

She was very boring and hard to understand. I don't think that her tests were that bad though and she was very nice and helpful. She seems to be a very nice and caring lady but just kind of boring. Several people skipped her class a lot because they all became very bored.
amazing teacher... i mean she likes her job and she makes stats sooo clear!!! probably my favorite teacher ever!!!

I took the online section of STA205 and I was really nervous it about first, but professor Sisson made the class so much less stressful than it could have been. Her lectures are amazingly clear and she always makes sure to let you know what to expect on exams, etc.. Very helpful with concerns and responded to e-mails quick. Take her!

I am terrible at math and was dreading this class. Patsy was amazing!! Her ability to explain the material is perfection and she genuienly cares about how you are doing in her class and is MORe than willing to help you with any questions. I HIGHLY recommend her...you wont regret it.

I stayed away from math until I absolutely had to take it. Took it over the summer, which helped, but Professor Sisson is the best. She has you print out a worksheet for class and fills it in during the class. She is understandable, easy to talk to and a wonderful stats teacher! You do have to use the book to study and get a good grade.
A very knowledgable teacher. Always answered qustions and helped with homework assignments. Highly recommended.

Very prepared professor, just went to fast during lecture.  She would fill up a whole chalkboard full of notes and then erase them before everyone was done copying them.  Hated the class because I was completely lost and had to drop it.  If your not good at math don't take her!
She tries to rush to much att he end of class and does't explain to well
This class was pretty easy to follow, she does go through things pretty fast, but is always willing to explain more in depth.
She is very detailed and gives great notes. Tests are kinda hard. She is very helpful with any questions. I hate math classes, but I did the best I ever have in her class.
Easy to understand.

I absolutely loved her....she was the most awesome teacher I've had in college so far, and if I could, I would definitely take her again...she was very helpful and willing to teach anyone who was willing to listen to her...HIGHLY RECCOMMENDED!!! If you're having trouble with math I suggest her, she will help out with any thing she possibly can!!!!!
Great!!! If you wanna do well, just come to class and take good notes. You will only use the book for homework exersizes and the tables, but not for learning. Highly recommend!!!
She was a great teacher!  As long as you keep up, you'll do great.  She lets you use a formula sheet on all of the quizzes and tests that you need it for.  If you need to take this class, take her!!

she is a great teacher, if i would have went to every class and took all the notes and did all the homework i would have gotten an A. but i didn't go to every class, missed some notes, didn't do any of the homework except for the few she collected for a quiz grade. homework is not mandatory but i recommend you do it for a better grade. must take he

Great Teacher! I took her for both Stats 212 and 213. As for the people who gave her a "sad face rating", HOW DID YOU EVER PASS ENGLISH 101! If you don't like this professor, you do not belong in college.

Professor Sisson is an awesome stats teacher, and very well respected around campus. I don't struggle in her class, but she has helped me with anything I have needed. She makes it clear she wants the best for her students, and is willing to help in anyway. Sisson makes things clear in class and is easy to understand.

I switched into her class & thank goodness I did. She posted guided notes on BB & I used colorful pens which was helpful. Gives 12 quizzes (some group), 3 exams, & a cumulative final. Very helpful when I would ask questions over email. Definitely have to study to get a good grade. DON'T BUY BOOK JUST ACCESS CODE. Allows cheat sheet for final.

If you need stats, choose Professor Sisson. Math is my worst subject, but she provides everything you need to succeed. Her lectures and guided notes are outstanding. She is quick to provide feedback. This class is a lot of work, but if you watch all the lectures and review all the handouts do all the practice problems, you'll do fine.
Lectures are absolutely wonderful.  I actually enjoyed learning about statistics.  She responds to emails and questions very quickly.

I took the online STA 205 and was so nervous about taking statistics online, but it was much better than expected! The class itself is hard and takes a lot of work, with lectures twice a week, quiz every week and exams every 4 weeks. She is very helpful and offers online chats and discussion for the class to get involved with. Definitly reccommend!

For being in full time school and college the class is challenging to keep up with. I think if I had nothing else to do beside school it would be fine. She does go through lectures very quickly and there is a quiz every week, and exam ever 4 weeks, and a comprehensive final.

She is very good at teaching this course but it was hard!  GO TO CLASS!!!  She gives weekly quizzed that are sometimes take home, group, or like two questions.  If you do well on those you will be fine.  I think she was good at making this an easy experience.

Did not use the book at all, but used Statcrunch a few times. Amazing professor. I am awful at math, but I did extremely well in this course and it is entirely due to Professor Sisson. Great explanations, notes are so clear. MUST attend to do well! I missed a few days and she helped me with the notes. Highly recommend her.

I took this class online and was nervous about it in the beginning. Mrs Sisson is so helpful and explains everything so good! I never used the book, I purchased the "online" version of it. I didnt need it because she explains everything in the powerpoints. If you need Statistics take her!!

Never opened the book. Makes you buy a 90 dollar access code that will only help if you need the help. The only reason I gave her a 4 instead of a 5 on ease is because she grades harshly, without reason. I do not recommend her. Uncompromising grading and teaching style.

GREAT ONLINE PROFESSOR! Each week she posts a video of her filling out a handout for the chapters of the week and then U take a quiz at the end of the week that goes RIGHT ALONG w/ the video handouts. I didn't know what anything MEANT but I knew how to get the correct answer by following the handout so that is all that matters!easier than expected.

Patsy is a wonderful Stats professor.  She made stats as easy to understand as she possibly could.  She posts notes and lectures each week and gives quizzes quite often, but if you watch the lectures and take notes, you can do well.  If you study and do the work, you can get a good grade.
I took her class and had to drop it. She needed to slow downa nd explain things better. Make sure you have a basic understanding of Stats before you that here.
Very clear and provides many in class examples.  If you go to class, pay attention and take notes then it isn't very hard.  She will re-explain things an help you if you need it.  HIGHLY recommended
Patsy Sisson made statistics a valuable learning experience for me.  She is an excellent professor and I highly recommend her to anyone that needs to take Statistics.
He doesn't go over most of the lessons and still tests over them. He barely explains the lessons that he chooses to go over. Avoid this teacher unless you're already an expert in algebra.
By far the best math teacher I have ever encountered. Makes math fun and easy. Goes over all material very well. Test and quizzes are all easy and awesome!!!!! I highly recommend!!!!
Awful, he talks really fast, he has no patients, its really dull you dont learn you dread going dont take this proffesor

Mr. Kramer is an excellent teacher. He does go a little fast, but he is very willing to help you if you need it. He doesnt give quizzes or tests on sections he didnt go over. And he's willing to work with you if you miss a test, just be sure to talk to him BEFORE the next class. If  you need any other help checking the examples in the book helps.

Mr. Kramer is a nice guy but he's not a great teacher. He flies through his lessons and doesn't really stop to break it all down. He also doesn't teach you how to identify things that will allow you to know what procedure to use.If you were good at math you wouldn't be in this class. He needs to slow down and understand who he's teaching.

Great math teacher, very willing to work with you. Took a nine am class and he showed up every day twenty minutes early so if you wanted you could get extra help. Goes pretty fast but always is willing to slow down. Tests and quizzes are clear cut and to the point, always know what to expect. Do homework and ask questions and you will get an A.

Very hard to understand anything he "teaches" in his lectures, he doesn't really teach anything he stands up there and does all the problems on his own and expects you to understand them. I am retaking this class and so are about 5 other people from my class. I do not recommend him for anyone.

Teaches as if he's reviewing material- as if you should know it. Says he will help with questions but can be very condescending when a question is asked- as if you're stupid for not knowing.  Had it not been for the free math tutors at the school I'd have never gotten the material.

Horrible excuse for a teacher.  He does not teach, and refused to go over homework assignments...which in turn prevents you from ever knowing what you've done wrong in time to correct it for a test.  BE WARNED!

did homework, ask question on it and he did not know how to do it himself, was fast with his technique of teaching, did not have patients for questions, you have to know how to do it before you go in there, what a waste...we dropped him in the first week of class, just to let ya know...beware....of ...him....waste money you will fail his class
Mr. Kramer is a great teacher.  Very willing to help and to take additonal time outside of class to help.
A tough course??!!?? It's pre-algebra for God's sake....

he is a terrible teacher, just goes through things like you should know them. says he is willing to help but then when he does he talks down to you. i would definently recommend not taking him as a teacher

Worst teacher I have ever had. Really tries to be prepared but is not at all. He has one way of teaching and if you do not understand it, sorry about your luck. If you ask him for help, he will help you but is really rude about it. Drop class asap. He is awful.
Horrible professor, take someone else if you have to take this class. He teaches the material as if you know it already.

He teaches really quickly and often will only take one or two questions. He always says if you are stuck to go to the tutoring center. So then why have the class? He moves way too quickly for most people. He is a nice guy though.

This class is great for those who are auditory learners. The text book is not used in class and is only used for review so its better to rent than buy. I would also like to add if you get tired easily, or if you have ADHD and crash on you stimulants take this class earlier in the day.
This man is a god.

Knows his subject matter very well.  He doesn't suffer fools lightly, so if you're looking to skate don't expect him to take much interest in educating you.  If you care to learn, he'll bend over backwards to help you out.
Very helpful,skillfull-comes to class ready.  This guy knows everything.  Has interesting programs.
This guy is a genius. Willing to help

Excellent professor, very clear and thorough about every detail discussed. The best part of class was the set of programs coded for homework: they were challenging, interesting, and rewarding to finish. Highly recommended.

Love Prof. Newell - exams are difficult but he gives you everything you need in the notes - he is open for questions and is extremely nice.  He "shows" you without just telling you how to do something.  Great Professor!
He is the best teacher I have ever had.  He cuts to the chase and gives you just the info you need.
the class is pretty boring but if you have to take it his class was pretty easy

He really does a good job explaing the material and showing you hands exactly what he is teaching. Attendance is not mandatory at all, but it is good to go to get all the information. He post notes on blackboard which is a bonus if you skip. Study these notes to do good on test. Sometimes he has a bit of attitude but it can be funny at times.

Extremely hard Theory class, but Newell did a good job teaching the material. Very unorganized, which is his only downfall really. Changes homework/exams after we're given them because he doesn't try them out beforehand! But otherwise good - amusingly bitter and makes class as enjoyable as possible.

Prof Newell took over for another teacher who had to leave in the middle of the semester. The difference in teaching quality was night and day - for the better. Newell takes arcane concepts and makes them understandable. He can TEACH.

AWESOME PROFESSOR!!  This guy really knows how to teach!! He loves what he does, and passes the interest onto his students! He doesn't use a book, and the assignments are very easy! He is very helpful as well!! EASY A!!!!!!

Good professor. He knows what he's teaching and can teach it well.  He does not use pre-made tests (from a textbook) like too many professors at NKU - this is probably one of the biggest reasons I liked him as a professor.

Awesome Professor! Easy class, but if it's not for you, he's there to help. All tests were open book or open note. Labs are amazingly helpful. Lectures are quite boring, but you can skip those if you want, in my opinion. Awesome.

Newell has a brilliant mind and understands the theory behind computation.He also has the ability to teach that theory, albeit, sometimes difficult, the content is excellent.His attitude and language, though some may feel inappropriate, are real, down to Earth, and exemplify a deeper understanding of the word we live in.Take every class he teaches

Great professor. Knows his stuff and will take his time through all topics presented. He is the professor to take for this class and the only one who can speak english with ease (that's just a rumor though). Would take again if I had the opportunity.
awesome class. you have to be a moron not to do well.  straight forward kind of guy

Undoubtedly the best professor in the department. Knows the subject completely before walking into the class room. Lectures are very in depth, but his demeanor can put some people off. Projects are interesting and the tests are just right. Very helpful with questions in and out of class. If you want to learn something, take his class!

He is by far the BEST teacher in the computer science department.  From his teaching to his humor, he makes class an ease.  You work hard, but he will take so much time to help you out.  His teaching style is absolutely wonderful, too.  I would change my whole schedule just to take a class taught by him.  Definitely do so!

Dr. Newell really knows what he's talking about. Doesn't take attendance but you'll be lost if you skip class. He assigns 5-6  programs for homework. If you're stuck, email him and he will help. Practice programs bc you won't learn from just the lectures. Go to class, take notes, do programs when he does them on the board, & study & you'll be fine.
One of the best professors at NKU.  usually, his exams will be a 40% take home part and 60% in-class part. would take him again for any class.

Easily the best professor I've had at NKU. He is very funny, and very good at teaching the material.  Let's you use book, notes, slides on tests (sometimes a compiler too).  His tests aren't obnoxiously difficult like other professors.  Assignments are challenging but he is VERY fair in his grading.  He is also very willing to help you out. GREAT.

Dr. Newell is very knowledgeable about the material and his lectures are captivating. Makes stuff really easy, grades really easy, always willing to help out students who try to do well. He is extremely hilarious with his frequent rants, most of which involve him indirectly cussing out students who didn't show up to class or tried cutting corners.

Hands down the best teacher I've ever had, and probably the best professor at NKU. He is a brilliant individual, who truly understands the subject material. He takes extremely complex concepts  and explains them in a way that makes you wonder why you ever thought it was difficult.

If I could take Dr. Newell for every single class I would. He's probably the smartest professor in the entire university (besides maybe Fox). He loves Theory a lot and it shows. He can turn a tricky concept into basically 5 year old terms, making it easy to understand.
A great professor. He'll make you laugh and his lectures are one of a kind 10/10 would reccomend
Amazing teacher. Really wants all students to pass, I'm not saying he just hands out A's but if you don't know a subject, he will explain it to you and help you out. Very funny guy.

By FAR one of the best professors at NKU. If I can take a class with him versus another professor, I will. Engaging, easy to listen to and funny. Very knowledgeable. I've had him for about 5 classes. For all classes, material may be difficult but he always finds a good way to explain it and will work with you if you do not understand. Awesome!
One of the greatest professors I've ever had

Dr. Newell is pretty average. His lectures sound like a drunkard prepared and delivered them. This is enforced by the gratuitous amounts of swearing and random jokes. Definitely not as concise as other professors in the department, but not the worst either. He knows the material, but the unprofessional language makes it hard to take him seriously.

Dr. Newell is quite a character and has many quirks, but he takes even the most complex topics and makes them easy to understand. If you don't like his style you might not like his lectures, but it is hard to go wrong as he is far better than your average computer science professor. If you have the chance you should take him at least once.

Dr. Newell is my favorite CS professor at NKU by far. His lectures are fun yet effective and he makes sure that you know the content (if you listen). The content is not easy to wrap your head around at first, but he explains it in a way that made perfect sense. Attendance isn't required, but I cannot recommend going to class in person enough!
VERY VERY NICE AND NURDY. he's really good acctually.  but not very recommended. not friendly!

My advice is to show up on time, be respectful, and put in the effort. I immensely enjoyed Dr. Newell's lectures and candor as an older student, and I hope to have him in future classes. I have read the negative remarks referring to his language and delivery and respectfully disagree with those statements. The real world is a lot more rigid.

Newell is one of the best CS professors at NKU. He's a lot more laid back in his lectures than most and can use what I've seen described on here as "unprofessional language" but it's a welcome contrast to some of the other courses. He's very clear in his explanations and drills concepts until you get them which can be repetitive but also helpful.

I took this class half in person and half online and it was great. Everything he talks about is on PowerPoint and if you're confused you can email him and he responds fast. He's a great professor and I can't stress that enough.

Dr. Newell is the definition of what some would say, "Top G". Might as well call him Top G since his first name is Gary... Best CS professor at NKU without a doubt. He might come off as intimidating but the reality is he is a very nice and respectful professor. He makes sure if any student has a question that things are clear. Take Dr. Newell.

Best professor I have ever had. I am honestly really sad that I will not have any classes with him next semester. Hilarious and straight to the point. He sometimes will hold you over class time, but not very long and he makes sure to give it back to you. If another class was preventing me from taking his class, I would drop that class.

He's hilarious to American taste. I'm a foreigner and I find himself uninterested and he's been always randomly throwing out some vulgar words, which Americans like. He warns you beforehand that he would swear a lot so you can drop his class. I want to but I can't. mid-term review sheet is 2-page long but the questions are based on everything.
A very easy A. Do the quizzes and literally put in just above zero effort and it's a breeze. Gives a review sheet and basically every single question on the exams are covered in the review sheet.
Left in the dark quite often. No real organization.

The class was a bit stale, but the professor totally made up for it. Dr. Newell is a great professor and is very informative. His lectures never felt long or drawn out. There is swearing but I think everyone in the class is grown up enough to handle it. Overall a very fun professor.

Dr. Gary Newell is one of the smartest professors I've ever had, full-stop. This class is extremely hard, arguably the hardest class I've ever taken. However, Dr. Newell makes the content fun, interesting, and easy to understand. For more complicated material, he usually posts follow-ups and additional resources that are extremely helpful. 10/10.

Dr. Russell will not make organic easy, like it could be anyways, but he is very clear on his teachings. His tests are directly from his notes and can get a good grade on them if one really understands organic. Would recommend him for anyone taking organic.

Dr. Russell teaches a difficult course, and he certainly doesn't make it easy.  He is, however, one of the best professors I've ever had - he is /always/ available to help you, and goes out of his way to help you understand.  A really nice guy in general, too.

His tests are insanely difficult and he is a very unfair grader who gives almost no partial credit.  He is also very condescending.  On the plus side, he is very enthusiastic when lecturing, but to me, that doesn't make up for the negatives.  I wish I could have taken Kempton for this class instead of him.

His exams are not easy but this class is not easy. It does not matter who the teacher is...this class is hard and will give you problems. He is the BEST person available to teach this course. I recommend him over all the others. He does give quizzes (3 pts) almost daily but it keeps you on top of things which you will be thankful for.

Condescending and seems to think that the fact he is always available for questions makes the unnecessary difficulty of his course justifiable. He doesn't really use the text but unless you can copy down  detailed mechanisms, take notes on what he says and pay attention, you'll need it.

He bases alot of his lab on his lecture, which is really hard to pass unless you are in his lecture.  It is hard to ask him questions becuase he will not answer you directly, he asks you questions.  Do not reccomend taking his lab

I had him for lecture and lab. I hated the fact that when I asked him for help he would ask me a question in return that was completely useless and didn't answer my questions.  All i can say is to try to review eachday and keep up with reading and OWLs and study study study!!!
A very nice professor.  Does not put you to sleep.  His tests are pretty difficult.  Gives plenty of opportunity to bring grade up with OWL homework.

Dr. Russell is by far the best teacher for Organic Chemistry.  It is absolutely a hard class, but I didn't think it was so bad with him.  I also had him for the lab class both semesters, and he was very helpful.  Don't listen to people that say not to take him.  Believe me, take this professor.  The other professors are nice, just more  difficult.
Very heady subject matter, but no one can explain it as well as Dr. Russell. Great teacher, always available for students.
Very hard subject matter but he is a very enthusiatic professor who really seems to love the subject.
Enthusiastic, but almost obnoxoiusly so - thinks everyone should love organic.  Tests are unnecessarily difficult, and he blows through lecture at top speed.

Doesn't understand that not every student wants to be a Nobel Laureate. Thinks everyone should share his passion for mechanisms.  Skips many sections in lecture, but still expects you to know them for exams.  Terrible for lab, never grades/returns things, often just walks out of the room completely and lets you fend for yourself.

Condescending attitude; treats O-Chem as if it's your sole reason for being enrolled at NKU. Thinks you should devote 25 hrs/week to his class, and prepares his test as if you did. Too controlling. Unwilling to listen to other views. Awkward and spiteful. Take anyone else. Transfer to UC if you have to.

Very fun in lab.  He is also very helpful as long as you are willing to try.  After you finish a lab, you have one week to complete the lab report, so take advantage of that time if you need help; he was ALWAYS willing to work through problems with me!

Students need to understand that O. Chem is a difficult class no matter who teaches it, and you WILL have to spend many many hours outside of class on the subject in order to do well.  Dr. R. is one of the bext professors you'll ever have the chance to study under, so take advantage of his knowledge and willingness to help,and his open-door policy!

You will not cover all the material, in class, that will appear on exams.  you're expected to read the whole textbook, do every practice problem, study for exams, and eventually do the homework problems online to do well.  The material isn't difficult to understand through most of the semester, but there is a TON of memorization involved.
Dr. R. is an amazing teacher. Even though his class is extremely hard, he is willing to help anyone and getting an A is not impossible! He is one of the best teachers for organic chemistry.

At the beginning of the semester I was encouraged by his claims of availabiliy & willingness to help.I have found him difficult to"find" or too busy.The course is difficult with him.Every session starts with a 1 question quiz.It's like shootin' ducks in the dark.DISCOURAGING WAY TO START CLASS!Bonus questions on tests?Purposely impossible & unfair.

The last poster is CORRECT. The ridiculous quiz-a-day is difficult.Today 27/30 got it wrong!This SHOULD give KC a clue!!Either give an alternate question or give everyone points.Unfair 2 the average/above average student working hard 2 get a good grade!A BAD TEACHER IS THE COMMON DENOMIATOR IN A CLASS FILLED WITH LOW GRADES. NO compassion from him.

The class is extremely difficult, but Dr. Russell does his best. He is usually more than willing to help with any problems or questions. But beware, his quizzes before every class stink and he will randomly call on you in class with an extremely difficult question.

Although he may sound like he is always available to help, he is very unhelpful and sometimes treats you like your stupid. He does however post practice exams which are usually helpful. His quizzes everyday are ridiculous and very hard to get right even if you read ahead. Overall though he is a pretty good professor who is very excited.
He's pretty hard as a teacher but he's very willing to help and explains a lot.

Prof is very helpful and wants students to succeed.  Explains subject as clearly as possible (given material), and makes organic chemistry much easier to understand.  Makes himself available almost all the time, and will do anything within reason to help a dedicated student.

A lot of people are intimidated by him, but once you get to know him he's very nice!  He really cares about his students success in the course! OChem is a hard course in general, but his extra credit helps.  I would definitely recommend him for lecture, but I heard he's pretty tough for lab!
All of the bad hype about Dr. Russell is wrong. He is an amazing guy and a brilliant man

Dr. Russell is very helpful. This is a very tough class and he expects a lot from his students but he will give you all the tools you need to succeed. He explains the information well and if you attend class and keep up with the work, you can get a good grade in this class. If you are not willing to put effort into this class, you will not do well.

Very good professor. He is always willing to help. His quizzes at the beginning are not that hard and are worth very little of your overall grade. This is a hard class so you have to be prepared for the work to be hard. Expects a lot out of his students.

OChem is not an easy class. Dr R is extremely helpful and always willing to clarify. If you take good notes and listen to what he says, as well as read the book, you'll have no problem with this class. Dr R says things for a reason, so don't be surprised when it shows up on a test! Great teacher, def recommend! Very enthusiastic

This class took so much study time from me. Ochem is hard but Dr. Russell was always thorough in his lectures. He always made himself available outside of class and before exam days. The exams are hard so studying is VERY important. Never wait to ask questions and try to be caught up in the material. He provides tons of practice problems that help.
Horrible professor, nothing he taught in class was on any exams and the advice given when visiting his office hours was to study the material.

Very Hards class. Must study religiously and learn content outside of class READ THE BOOK. And do practice problems everyday if you want a chance of passing. The exams are so hard for no reason. He is no help

Dr. Russell is a great professor: he is passionate and loves to teach, he is willing to help, and although he sometimes seems condescending, he really does not mean to be. In organic lab, he is VERY specific about what he wants. If you follow his directions exactly, you will be fine. Exams are difficult, so study! You MUST attend all lectures.

Dr. Russell seems like a nice guy. He's extremely picky and if it's not done 100% correct he will hate you. He will help you if you ask, but he goes beyond what is necessary for the class. Try to avoid him at all costs because it will make life so much easier. His tests are hard and he's a grader that gives zero sympathy. No partial credit.

Great Teacher if you want to get a good grade just show up and work and you will understand everything.  I got a B without even trying.  He gives you all the time in class to work on the homework so you don?t really have any. Highly recommend
He went very slow and thoroughly explained everything that we covered. Visual Basic is pretty easy, and I found the assignments kind of fun and easy to produce. Take him if you can.
I have no interest in the subject. I hated this class. Not his fault. He went way out of his way to help me!!!

Toru is one of the most helpful professors at NKU. Anytime I needed assistance he was very prompt and friendly. He is very easy to talk to and you feel that there isn't the normal student/professor barrier you experience typically. The subject matter was well covered and we always were able to receive feed-back on assignments to make them better.

Made "advanced" programming easy. He is very knowledgeable and helpful to his students. Gives great study guides and will do anything to help you. The assignments are quite simple too. He won't leave you to die on them either, he is always willing to help. Great professor.

Toru is an amazingly helpful professor. The class I.T. Proj. Management was comprised of group projects, there are examples to go by. No exams!! Weekly Quizes are online and mult. choice & t/f. I will be taking more of his classes. Great guy very slight language barrier, but just ask him to clarify he will rephrase it differently. Highly recommend

Even though he isn't a project manager, he does a great job relating to project management situations. Gives plenty of time to do the weekly assignment in class and will explain any quiz question you get wrong. Would take again.

Dr. Sakaguchi has a friendly teaching style. He does not intimidate students and welcomes questions and comments. He is very willing to spend time with students one-on-one to help them learn. Dr. Sakaguchi values a student’s determination to try to learn what can be difficult subjects. I highly recommend Dr. Sakaguchi.

Very eager to answer students' questions.  I took him for a six-hour Saturday class and he let us leave class for up to four hours, as long as we were back by a certain time to present group projects.  Class was easier than it looked, thanks to him.

Very helpful and friendly professor. I was not a fan of this course at all but that should take nothing away from him, he gave you the tools to succeed. I will say his project outline could be better construed as it became very chaotic later on in the semester
Great teacher, made the material easy to understand!

Class is demanding but one will learn.  Very good professor.  Very interested in helping student's understand.  With the group project, he made sure we were always on track and didn't wait until the last minute.

Very good class and professor. He is very helpful and easy to understand; he takes complicated subject matter and makes it understandable.  There is a large amount of work required for this class.
