doesnt give enough time for other classes makes you buy the book but didnt use it blamed me for not understanding the material and makes you sign a contract that states you must do ungraded and graded h.w to qualify to take the final and made me feel like i was not smart enough to learn the material
This class is so freakin' easy.  Almost too easy though, so easy that you want to skip.  She also bakes and brings food when you get into division.  Yes, I said division.

This professor assigns a deathly load of homework, beyond a point of logic or help. The amount became so severe I was unable to think about my other classes. 90 % of the homework doesn't even count towards your actual grade, yet you cannot take a test without doing her pointless work. Is extremely rude and condescends students who need help.

Don't take this professor. She assigns a deathly load of homework, I literally can't even think about my other classes. She expects you to know how to do all basic algebra, and doesn't offer help on anything that isn't her own work that she assigns. The actual homework doesn't even affect your grade. Expect 100 emails from her a day.
Very understanding but way too much homework assigned and didnt pass most of the students in the class with a B or higher so they couldnt move on.

I am more awful then sin at math, however I took this class and I never imagined id ever see an A on my teat in college again. If you do well with follow along notes, and attend class and space out the home work you will be fine! I never been so succesful at math before and ive never haf a instructor who drilled the knowledge as much as she did!

She runs a  tight ship but will make you understand the math in a way no one else can. DO NOT TAKE A FULL TIME SCHEDULE WHILE TAKING MAT115. No more than 1 other course!! The course content is easy to understand if you participate in class, pay attention and do the piles of homework, easy A! She also favors those who ask questions & visit office.

Do not take this class unless you are able to dedicate about 20 hours a week doing homework that you do not get graded on. It must be turned in and done correctly to "qualify" for the test. Homework sucks but it helps you learn the material. overall I learned more in this class than I ever have from ANY math teacher.

She is a nice woman and is very accessible outside of class. Wouldn't recommend to students who don't do well on tests because it is a test only final grade. The more you get into the semester the tons of more homework you have and it becomes overwhelming. Don't take this "entry level" class unless you were good at geometry
Very good professor and very helpful.  Just pay attention and come to class.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!! She is not the kind of professor that you would like in a 7-week course!! She will have you spend hours till the end doing her homework. She has homeworks and assignments that she won't even grade but won't let you move on until you complete the problem correctly. If you fail behind it will be hard to get back on track.
Very rude and belittles people for wrong answers. Her style of teaching is too fast paced and complicated.
She went to school with Mike Pence and she is a little embarrassed by it. really funny and if you take good notes and pay attention you'll pass.

One of the best math teachers I've ever had! I usually hate math because I never get it but the way she uses real life examples really helps me understand the content. Professor Phillips is funny, friendly, and helpful :)

Comes off as a nice and caring person that wants you to do well, but her notes are very jumbled and confusing at times because everything is handwritten. There is A LOT of hw in this class. I used over an entire notebook's worth of paper just for the homework. If math doesn't come easily for you, you will find this class to be very challenging.

Pretty good professor. Sometimes can be hard to follow but she gives a lot of chances to understand a concept. Really nice and goes the extra mile to care for/bond with her students. It is a lot of work, but for a math class it's pretty easy. Don't be afraid to ask questions.

She makes you do homework that she won't take for a grade, but you still have to complete it to take the test. So if you don't turn it in you will get an automatic 0 on the test. The amount of homework she gives is ridiculous, I wouldn't recommend her to anybody.

IF YOU HAVE A CHOICE DO NOT EVER TAKE THIS CLASS! IT WAS AWFUL. I had to take it for the credit but omg it was ridiculously hard and it takes HOURS to do the homework that, by the way, you get EVERY class. Overall, It sucked!

This teacher is the worst I've ever had. The amount of homework is for this class was 10 hours a week. If you have a part time job or any other responsibility's (LIKE OTHER CLASSES) this is not the class for you. There is no book. Also, I took the "helper" class that was supposed to be a tutoring class. She just lectured LONGER and I got NO HELP.

Professor Phillips is bizarrely aggressive towards her students and snaps when asked questions about content she is covering on the board. She doesn't seem to delegate class time wisely and is constantly stressed as a result, this makes for a tense class environment where students are afraid to ask for clarification. I do not recommend this her.
Caring always helpful

She is the worst professor I have had and she gives absurd amounts of homework that have to be done to take the tests. If you are missing a single homework assignment then you can't take the test. She has jumbled confusing notes and uses strange methods when solving some problems. There is no book, so you have to print out 50+ of notes. Stay away!

Professor Phillips cuts off her personal life to make more time for her students and is dedicated to spending her office hours to help student better understand. She acknowledges different learning styles and pays special attention to students who need extra help. Attend class with full attention, and schedule office hours.
Shes a great pro and youll learn a lot the only thing is youll have a lot of homework and you need to make time for it. Overall shes good.

I've hated math my entire life. Barbara helped me to see that math can make sense sometimes. She's an awesome lady and genuinely caring. she can be a bit harsh at times if you slack off. read every single canvas update and email and DONT LET YOURSELF FALL BEHIND! you will crash and burn if you do. Had her during covid. rough at first but got better

A majority of the work you do in this course while easy, is given in overwhelming quantities, especially with the online learning being implemented. Most work assigned isnt graded, but she will still check for accuracy, make you redo the work, and not allow you to take the test until it is done. Easy A, but lots of late nights.

She's really great.  Has a different teaching style that's not great for everyone. She keeps the class interesting even though the subject material isn't anyone's favorite.  I would definitely recommend taking her classes.

It wasn't an easy class, but Dr. Mackin did a great job teaching and helping students. I went to her office several times as did many other students. She really wanted students to do well and was concerned about their education, not just getting them to pass the class.

Excellent professor. I'd take any class she teaches. She's willing to work with her students and will try her hardest to fully answer and explain any question. She likes to joke a lot and her classes are not boring. It's also awesome that you can call her 'Dr.Mackin', she's super  cute too. :)
Supa fine

Although she's a very nice lady, she flies through material, gives exceptionally hard quizzes, grades just as hard, and offers no room for extra credit.  For me, her in-class explanations are useless enough that by about mid-semester I just started using class time to read my book.  Extremely hard, and not overly clear
Not the best teacher in the Math department. Wouldn't take her again because she flies through the material and can't always understand the way she teaches.
She is extremely willing to help, although her way of explaining the material is hard to understand.

She is very helpful and easy to understand, however she has sloppy handwriting! Dr. Mackin also requires students to complete a pre-requisite assessment at the beginning of the course which is time consuming and pointless. Her tests are not hard as long as you complete the homework problems she suggests. Go to the calc lab if you have any trouble!

It was my second time taking Calculus and my first semester at NKU, she was not a very warm welcome to college. Always gave a huge amount of homework but only graded a small portion of it, went too fast to be a big help. Take Waters' MAT 121/122 classes instead.
She's really funny, you just have to joke with her, so she knows you wanna have fun.
Very helpful and by all means do your HOMEWORK! It helps your grade!!!!!!!
I really enjoyed this class. She was always willing to help her students.  She was a wonderful math teacher.

A very energetic teacher with high expectations.  Weekly Friday morning exams that were very painful.  Helpful if you can make it to her office .... otherwise you will be lost in class.  Not recommended if you aren't a quick and intelligent student.

Wonderful lady, wonderful teacher.  She is great fun, do ur homework, study, ask for help if you need it.  She is willing to help!  Difficult material, but can be done.  I requested her as my advisor after taking her class, she's really great.
Definitely one of my favorite teachers, very helpful, very interesting.

Best teacher ever! She is VERY enthusiastic about math and will do anything she can to help her students. If you are struggling in the class, just go to her and she’ll help you. She likes to joke around with her students and is very funny. If you have to take an early math class, take her. She’ll keep you awake!
A great teacher, when I went I enjoyed myself vastly, and this is calculus class people. If you have to take calc take her you wont regret it.

She was very helpful, and made sure that everyone understood everything that went on.  She does expect a lot out of you with homework and stuff, but that pays off a lot when tests roll around.  Put in the work and you'll get an A!

Very hard to understand. Accused one kid of cheating and he got kicked out of school when he had top grades of the class. Try Chris Christenson instead of her. The easiness of him surpasses her and he is easy to understand and learn from.
Great professor.  Very good at explaining the concepts and always willing to help. Just go to class, do the homework and you won't have a problem.

Not my favorite professor (gives a lot of homework), but I did take this class to re-learn Algebra so that I can teach it (I'm a middle school ed. major with math emphasis), and this class is serving that purpose well.
No Comments

She is a very scatter-brained, unprepared for class.  She has obviously never written a lesson plan a day in her life.  Would try to work problems that she could not finish on several occasions.  Relied on shallow, sarcastic wit to get through any given day.  Appeared to be high at times.
No Comments

Horrible teacher, my friends are in the other teachers for 109 and are passing with B's, and I was better at math in high school than my friends were. Somehow I did all the work in mackin's class and getting ready to fail it. AVOID THIS TEACHER.
great lady.  VERY willing to help.  tests aren't the easiest, but all her classes are passable.

HORRIBLE TEACHER... with out a doubt the worst proffessor that I have had in my college years.  I dont think she is going to teach next year and thats a good thing for anyone that has not taken this class yet..
test are hard but if you pay attention you should get at least a B.
wonderful teacher who cares about her students.  great for calculus.  great for early mornings.  I would take her again in a heartbeat.  i had her for all of cal 2 and differential equations.

Mackin is exceptional at teaching and has years of experience to show you how to really work problems.She expects alot from her students and grades hard and fair(lots of partial credit), but will give you alot to REALLY learn math.Take her class and you'll walk away with a real understanding of the subject.If you want easy ride, take someone else.
Great teacher, very helpful in and outside of class though the presentation of the material at time can be confusing. Highly recommend for calculus A.

If you have the option to take her- DO! She is very good about explaining material and she will sit with you for as long as it takes outside of class. She does have the tendency to start flying through material but just ask her to slow down- she knows she does this and is willing to slow down when you point it out. Do your work- all of it!

Dr. Macking is very nice but sometimes I feel like she goes above our heads.  If you ask a question, she answers it without making you feel stupid.  You get late passes for the homework assignments and she almost always takes a few minutes to go over homework questions.  I recommend Dr. Mackin!

Pros: *Helps anyone who ask *Passes on late Homework *Keeps class interesting *Can clearly explain concepts when not racing *a lot of reference problems ||Cons: *Races through material *No pre-prepared notes/powerpoints *Test questions are usually in different formats that you've been prepared for *spends too much lecture time on practice problems.
She is very helpful if you have trouble go see her. The class is very difficult if you are not a math person.
Easy! Easy! Easy!  Great Professor
She's very nice.  The class is hard but if you go most days and ask for help you'll be fine.
BRUTAL. Simply brutal. Can't teach to save her life.
Best Professor I have ever had
great professor
Great professor.  Unfortunately he is retiring.
He is a great professor and very bearded!

I had him for genchem1, and the P-chem compliment.  He was wonderful in general.  P-chem is hard no matter who is teaching, but he makes it fun.  And even if you wanted to dislike him, you couldn't cause he looks just like Santa (and his wife looks who teaches at thomas moore looks like mrs claus and is a great organic prof)

One of the best classes i have ever taken.  You will learn so much if you go to all classes, all review sessions, read the entire chapter and examples before class, and work out all of the old tests multiple times.  Otherwise you wont do so well.  But if you're willing to put in 10hours a week outside of class, it's a guaranteed A.

He does cool experiments in class. His hand writting is horrible so its hard to read. Goes decently fast. But he is very willing to help outside of class. I missed a test once because of family issues and let me make it up with no problem. VERY NICE and INTERESTING guy. Has a 2 foot long beard.
He is Santa gone mad chemist
He is a great guy.  His classes are as fun and interesting as they possibly can be.  Take this class for a great time in General Chem I.

He is very nice. Will work with you outside of class. Drops lowest test and some quiz grades. Tries to help students do well.  Keeps class environment as exciting as possible with experiments and mole-day. Has a good heart but terrible hand writing!
Great teacher, keeps the class awake with demonstrations and experiments in the front of the classroom... will help outside the classroom and drops the lowest Test and 2 lowest quiz grades...

I took him for P-chem (2004-2005) which was painful due to the very subject material, but I learned alot in his class. I thought he was a great teacher (although his handwriting is questionable). He ALWAYS took time to help me outside of class and gave us plenty of previous tests to work with prior to exams. Likes chicory coffee from New Orleans!!
Very funny, interesting and helpful. Made chemistry fun.

Chemistry is a hard subject! Plan on studing-ALOT! Don't think about friends. Hicks will take the time to help you understand BUT YOU MUST ASK FOR HELP. He works late hours & is very available to students w/ questions. Also offers AM study sessions if u can drag ur butt out of bed early enough.
nice man that tries but his better days are behind him he is very dull take someone else!
Southern gentleman, but his grading is the hardest in the department. It is impossible to make him happy. Absolutely brutal!

Great teacher. If you want to lift your grade from a B to an A, do the assigned "back of the chapter" questions - this is the key to his class. Bloss is probably one of the best professors at NKU.  TAKE HIM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Even if you have no interest in chemistry, you will enjoy Professor Bloss' course. He is very articulate, patient and enthusiastic. He has a genuine passion for the material and will gladly stay after lecture to explain topics or simply discuss ideas with you. He is the best professor you will ever have.

Dr. Bloss is the best professor I have EVER had.  I like chemistry, but thanks to Dr. Bloss I really enjoy learning about it.  He is great, if you can take him, I have never ever heard a bad word about this one!  :)
Very good teacher, I never find his lectures boring.  Very articulate and insightful.  Very helpful, takes the time to explain directly in class any issues.  Really understanding.
Prof. Bloss gives ample extra credit to not only help your grade, but it also serves as an awesome way of studying for the tests.  He is very patient and just has a very pleasant overall attitude.

I really liked Prof. Bloss both as a person and teacher. He was always in a good mood and easily approachable, and he often had after-class "help sessions" where he stayed in the classroom so people who were struggling could talk to him. I had to drop his course because I dropped lab, unfortunately, but he's a great professor.

A very nice man and a professional as a teacher. I made sure to get him for CHE121 regardless of him only teaching at night. DESPERATELY wish he would teach organic next term as he does have a knack for making chem make sense. He's not going to give you an A, but he WILL give you all of the tools you need to get an A. Class act, look no further!!!
Definitely one of the best professors I've ever had!!

Great professor! Will answer any questions multiple times and really wants you to understand. Funny and vey laid back. Only has night class which is unfortunate but I'm definitely going to continue taking his class.

He is a great teacher.  I would recommend anyone to take him.  He will help you with anything and he doesn't believe in memorization.  His practice tests resemble the actual tests.  Very nice.  I am taking him for the next class!

This man ranks as one of the best teachers I've ever had. Somebody else here said he doesn't explain things well, but that's crazy; he does an awesome job of explaining things. I finally understand this stuff! He's also very friendly and helpful. Tip: Download his practice tests and do them!
He give a take home test and goes through everything slowly.  He trys to make it easy for people who haven't had chemistry in a while.
Amazing teacher.  Really has a knack for teaching.  knows how to make a subject most people struggle with easy. Definately the best.
I don't understand the comment that someone made about needing a tutor before this class, because Mr. Bloss was great.  I got a better grade in 121 than I did in 120.  He's a great teacher.

I hated Chemistry until I met Dr. Bloss. He is seriously the best teacher I've ever had. Usually college professors don't care, but he goes out of his way to help. Makes things really easy to understand.

I couldn't imagine Chemistry being any easier than Mr. Bloss makes it.  Don't get me wrong, the material will make your brain hurt, but Mr. Bloss has a way of simplifying it so well that it BECOMES very interesting.  I took chemistry in high school and hated it with passion, but now it's something I look forward to learning more about.

Mr. Bloss is just what I needed to make it through this class. He was recommended to "make it click".He is so helpful and willing to communicate in anyway-email, phone, class, office.  Very dedicated and very humorous too. This class has a LOT  of work( do it all!), but you couldn't have a better professor.
AWESOME is the only word I can think of right now.  He is a wonderful teacher and is willing to help anyone, if they ask.  I highly recommend taking him for chem, you won't be sorry.

This professor was great. If you dont like OWL assignments in your face all the time choose professor Bloss. He uses them as extra credit. Tests are not difficult and he goes over everything as many times as you want. He is part-time and loves teaching general chem to others. Prof. Bloss teaches at night- only(I think). If you just want to understa

Mr Bloss makes chemistry easy to understand. He's very polite and willing to help you. He gives students ample opportunity to earn extra credit points to help them get the grade they want. Take this teacher!

So disappointed I can't take him for organic. This was WOW, the best prof. Not EASY, because you need to work, but for sure, he is your best option among the horrible chem profs. You will pass chem with him for sure. A lot of extra credit which is awesome. I failed the final and my final grade was A- lol

Dr. Bloss is the best professor I have ever had.  He's very clear during lectures.  He gives partial credit on tests and isn't a brutal grader.  A very reasonable person.  Just talk to him.  You have to work at this class, but he makes it very bearable.  There's no instructor barrier to learning the material with him.

Great man. Super nice. He almost makes chemistry interesting. Makes class simple, organized, and stress-free. You don't have to show up, but I would recommend it. It seems that trying to learn the stuff on your own is impossible, but listening to him lecture makes it easy as pie. A few tests, a few quizzes here and there, and that's it. A King!
Awesome professor, but his tests are about as difficult as they get! But he provides a lot of ways to help you succeed, if you use them. He offers A LOT of extra credit.

Nice person. Problems on tests are often only similar and not like class or book examples- Gives a lot of Ex-Cred opps but they are VERY difficult- as in 5-6 hours for 6 points. I won't likely take him for 121 even though I'm getting a B in the class.

My favorite prof. by far! He is very nice & willing to go over things until you understand. Tests are difficult but he offers a lot of extra credit throughout the semester. If you miss class/exam, he is very easy to work with on getting notes/making up the exam. Uses BB a lot! Wants students to pass and has the students' interest at heart! :)
Good teacher but doesn't explain things well.  Get a tutor before taking this course.

Amazing lecturer who does his best to make otherwise difficult material easy to understand. Lecture is essential to attend, but you'll benefit from it either way! Most homework comes straight from the textbook but isn't particularly difficult. If you have any issues, he's great at answering questions and clarifying!

He knows his stuff and wants you to know it.  He is short sometimes when asked a question however and will get incredibly upset if he makes a mistake.  If you participate in class and go to his help sessions you should do fine.  Make sure you know what's going on though and don't miss class and you will get a good grade.  If you don't plan on an F.

He loves chemisty and wants you to learn it. U have to work in his class to do well. doesnt give to much homework but i recommend doing it lots of the questions are usually on his quizs. Go to his study sessions.

Mr. Ledden is not a patient person at all.  Belittles you and insults your intellgence when asking questions.  I have had many upper level Physics and Geology classes and still found this Intro to Chem difficult.  I haven't had a Into to Chem in about 6 years, so I took it as a refresher.  Bad move.  I hope my remaining Chem professors not as bad.

It's a hard class, but it's Chemistry.  I studied a lot and got an A. One thing is for sure, if you take his class you will definitely do well in CHE 115. I'm glad I took him because it's been a breeze in 115.

I think Ledden is a good guy, but has no patience for students with questions.  He gets pissy if you ask a question, and thinks if he says it once you should remember it forever, I do NOT recommend this professor. Hard tests, hard quizzes.  Offers study sessions.  I had to drop the class.

This teacher THINKS he's being helpful because he asks if anyone has questions.  However, he's very short in his replies & basically cuts you off before you've finished asking your question.  He's not patient - even when explaining things.  The class is fast. If you can't keep up, you're left.
Good teacher, but very repetitive.  Complicated Programming for a not so complicated class.
Avoid him at all costs. He works in the day time and comes to teach int the night being very tired. He is not made to be a professor.

I didn't go into the class with a strong coding background, just some Visual Basics, but the class is easy for those you work at it. You really have to give Prof. Cady more credit. Comp. languages are hard to learn-hardier to teach. I would whole heartily recommend him.
Great instructor.  Very helpful with questions and understands working adults busy schedule with HW.  Programming is hard to teach but Tom makes it as easy to understand as possible.

His class was very easy I thought, but I missed the last two weeks and the exam and he failed me even though the exam was only %20 of the grade if I remember correctly and I had an A up until that point so I thought I should have still passed.

His class is difficult, but I think half of that is because I am terrible at computer programming; I just don't get it.  I had an A at midterms, and almost got a C in the class, because it got so hard at the end.  I was emailing him at least once a week, and he was very helpful.

Very Unclear. I mean jeees...he comes tired to the class room from work in cincinnati, and start teaching boring subject as C.  Save yourself. Not very recommended.  He really really needs to improve his teaching skills.   NOTE:THE TEXT BOOK IS SUCKS TOO, YOU CAN NEVER UNDERSTAND IT WATCH MTV BETTER
Okay, well Tom is not a porfessor but he's the only one who teach the "C programming" class.  He's nice, and cool, but the class was really tough...especially at the end of the semester. good luck

Great Class, Awesome Professor!!  Not a class you can just walk through, have to study but the class was wonderful. The field work was awesome!!!  Test were not easy but not hard, just study and you'll be fine.

Dr. Durtcshe was great in the lab section. The exams are difficult but as long as you study well you should know the material. He tended to talk for most of the labs which made things boring at times and you never get out early but he is extremely helpful and very approachable.
Lectures are kind of boring, and he puts way too much information on the slides when he only tests over a few concepts.

Biometry class is completely boring, extension of Stats. Really hard to follow but come to class and study. I got a B and didn't study a lot but when to every class.  Not an interesting subject but he tried to relate the stats to interesting things. Love the professor but hate the class!
Do not take him if you can help it!!

Dr.Durtsche is an excellent teacher...if you actually study and know the material. This class is not supposed to be easy!  He explains the material very well and never goes on without everyone fully understanding.  I've had an A on all my tests thus far...because I study.

Horrible.  Very condescending and rude.  Definitely has favorites and doesn't make an effort to hide it.  Exams are torture, lectures are impossible to follow, notes are unclear, lab is a complete joke, no lab time at all, just an extention of lecture.  Makes the most interesting concepts boring.  No amount of studying will help.  Way too nitpicky.

Avoid at all costs.  I'm a huge science geek and he made me literally hate Biology.  The class was way too difficult, he expected way too much out of students. He expects everyone to be an esteemed scientist.  I almost feel like he takes pleasure in failing people.  I've never failed anything and yet I've never passed a single one of his exams.

Do not take Anatomy with him.  He is very hard to follow.  He only grades on test which were very difficult. Class seems to be taught to those taking it for the second or third time.  Notes are very disorganized. I studied more for his class out of 4 others and still barely passed!

Unfortunately this class is required. Somehow? and he is tenured. Somehow? So your hosed! You will now learn nothing about stats just that everything that you learn in intro to stats doesn't make any sense anymore. Couldn't explain statistics to a statistics major if his life depended on it.
Dr. Durtsche Rocks.  He is the best biio professor ever and teaches the best classes

You would be lucky to have an opportunity to take a class from this guy. Yeah- he's hard because you have to learn and that's why you are here. Dr. Durtsche is a genius and he's hilarious and expects you to work. In turn, you will get first rate knowledge, hands on experience, and the best advice  and feedback if you really are trying.

Durtshe's classes are not easy, they all follow the same format. He gives lectures and provides you with slides. You have a research paper that you work on throughout the semester (gives great feedback on these), and you have a few readings and quizzes. He pushes you to buy a lot of books, I haven't bought one yet, and it has hurt my grades a bit.

Easily the worst professor Ive ever had. He emphasized the easier parts of biometry, and breezed over the tough stuff. PowerPoints were impossible to study from, and he offered little else to study by. He takes three to four weeks to grade anything, so you never have timely feedback. In four years at NKU, he is the only professor to disappoint.

Expect to teach yourself everything in Biometry. Never available during office hours because he's always "busy". Crams powerpoints in every class period. The homework takes hours because you have to teach yourself how to do it. Pick any other professor.

Had a 5-10 point quiz every class period near the end of the semester because he was cramming the material in before the final exam. The final wasn't cumulative. He is a very difficult teacher to follow and doesn't know how to answer questions if you had any. It is very true that you need to teach yourself in this class. Wasted money on the books.

His classes still follow the same format. Still haven't bought any books and done fine, he puts a few questions from them on his exams. His class is still a tough, but it just takes effort. His lectures are heavy and have tons of info, you'll need to know most of it. He makes you memorize scientific names. He grades leniently on the research paper.

Dr. Durtsche is a nice guy but his classes are beyond college expectations.  The excruciating detail he goes into is counterproductive at best.  Almost 90% of the total grade were 2 of the hardest exams I've ever taken.  Unless you're going to graduate school for a specific topic he teaches, I would not recommend.
Very passionate about biology. Is willing to help you if you ask. Quizes are very difficult. Got a C but its my fault.

Easy to follow and it is clear his goal is to make you learn the subject.  Talk kind of a lot sometimes and you will probably be there all three hours.  Only negative is his quizzes  each class are kind of tough.  Very nice and knowledgeable.  I recommend

Had him for Biometry and Herpetology and was his teaching assistant and research assistant.  He is a great professor but demanding.  I worked my butt off for him but learned so much! Highly recommend him but be prepared to put some work into getting a good grade!

Durtsche is clearly passionate about his field but is not fit to teach a 100 level course. He consistently refers to higher level concepts as though students should already be familiar with them. iClicker questions often assume students know more than they do. Content is very specific and more focused on memorization than understanding concepts.

Professor Durtsche is very willing to help and does answer emails. You have to pay attention and ASK QUESTIONS. He wants to help. Please use the SI sessions a lot of the iclicker questions and SI session pre Exam questions are on the EXAMS! Do not be lazy and study. It is not a hard class but you do have to do your part. My major is not bio, fyi.

Professor Durtsche is a great teacher with a great personality, he will just sometimes ramble on in his lectures about certain things we don't necessarily need to know. He always posted recorded lectures. Attendance is technically mandatory, but I missed multiple classes and my grade isn't affected too much.
Awesome teacher!!
He will take his time with you..if you are struggling and you are trying to do your best..he will help you and explain it very well...alg is complicated, but he is hot..and he can teach...
Very good teacher... Explains everything. Very very helpful if your clueless with math. Also has a humourous side.
this teacher is amazing. he is so easy to understand and will help you no matter what. i highly recomend him!

The first time I took 95, I failed w/ different professor. Second time (with him), I got an A! He allows calculators, shows you how to use them, helps you understand before he moves on. Great guy, very funny. Wish I could take him again for my next math :)
He is a little unconventional, but extremely helpful.

Aaron is awesome to the point, I pushed my gradution time line back just because he wasn't teaching 094 in the summer!  I opted to wait for him...he's THAT good :)  Very friendly and will take as much time as you need to catch on.  Recommend to anyone that is intimidated by numbers.

Highly recommended. One of the few Professors who really understands how to REACH students. You will see some complaints about how he talks off the subject etc, but I never felt it was a detriment as he went and above over to service students. Also, the smart student will see that his humorous persona is part of his approach. The guy is a realist.

Aaron is an incredible teacher who makes sure you understand the material. Really funny guy that makes a two hour class go by so quick. I would recommend him to anyone unless you dont like being off subject. To me, I found that enjoyable though because I couldnt stand math for two consecutive hours, but it was easy to be in his class the whole time

I wish I could take him for all my classes! Great teacher that will make sure each and every person understands the material before he moves on and I cant say that about any other professor. He is hilarious and makes a two hour class go by so quick. I would recommend him to anyone!
Great professor!!! Very helpful, and cooperative!!! Would like to take him for all my math classes!

He is awesome, but not hot so dont get excited by the chili pepper, but he doesnt make you feel stupid for not knowing something. Instead he fixes your problem by "dumbing it down" for those of us who are complete idiots in math. Love him, and would highly recommend taking him whenever possible!!!

Asron is amazing!!!  He teaches very well and helps out each student everyday.  Also for the person who said he wasn't hot, your very rude it's an option to rate his hotness, unfortunatly for me, the scale does not go high enough for me to rate him.
great teacher
I got an "A" in his class. That should say it all. He's freakin amazing, no kidding. Those who hate math and are afraid to fail should take this man. He's the God of math.
Very good teacher!
i am looking forward to 099 with him as a professor, the A way is so helpful, he makes learning math an easier task, i am so happy he saved me from math misery!
He is the best Math teacher I have ever had!  He makes it very easy to understand!!  A+++++++++++

Mr. Hirst is a awesome teacher! I came into this class knowing almost nothing about math and now I know everything I need to know. He has a way of breaking things down so that anybody can understand them. I would recommend him to anybody!!!
he was great
Aaron is an AWESOME teacher!!!! TAKE HIM IF YOU SUCK AT MATH

He was okay, but got off subject A LOT.  He would spend almost the enitre class talking about other things and then try to cram the entire lesson into ten minutes; he was okay but I wouldn't take him again.
He is a great teacher
He's an amazing teacher! always willing to help, he's also hilarious! If you study you'll be fine on his exams. TAKE HIM!! you won't regret it!

Aaron is the best teacher that I've taken for math.  He is patient and wants you to succeed.  He goes above and beyond to ensure that you understand.  I struggle with math but he took a lot of my anxiety away.  You have to take good notes, ask questions, go to tutoring and you will be fine.
Such a great teacher!! By far the BEST math teacher I have ever had! I would love to take him for every math class! TAKE HIM!!!
He is the best teacher I have had @ nku ever.  you must study with him ... especially for international student

VERY VERY VERY HELPFUL!!!!!!!!!! He is a very smart man, that not only teaches you about math, but about life. Took the class during the summer, even though the work load was more, he offered to help anyway he could!!!!! I would recommend taking him. You wont regret it!!!!!!

took him this summer and He was a great teacher. He really cares about the students success in the class and is always there for help. I really enjoyed his inspirational messages he brought to class each day, helped me really want to get after it.
Very amazing teacher.
he's freakin awesome. you'd have to be stupid to fail his class. seriously.
Excellent teacher. Knows how to teach his math and you can understand him. He is patient with his students. If you take him you wont regret it and you will get your money worth,.

Aaron rocks. If you have ever had problems with Alg - take HIM!  He makes it fun and clear, and I acutally like Algebra now.  We call it the "A" way!  He's a good guy and great instructor.  I wish I could take him for all my classes.  I 100% recommend him - you'll have a good time while you learn!

Aaron is Great! He is an awesome guy who really cares about his students, Which you cant say for many! He is a great teacher, and I will miss having him, If you need Algebra Take Him!! The "A" Way is the Only way!!!!! We need to have only him teach all math classes!!
No Comments

Prof zwick really cares about her students. She is a very reasonable teacher and there is 1 massive project that you work on all semester. If you do it weekly its not alot. Dont wait to the last day! She gives you a study guide for exams, but still alot to know!

Professor Zwick is passionate about her teaching.  I loved the class and learned so much practical information.  There is LOTS of work but it is not bad if you keep up.....you MUST keep up.  I would recommend anyine to take this class.  I loved the class!

It's not a bad class at all. But! Expect to work your tail off. You have to keep a food journal, and if you get behind, it is near impossible to catch up. She's kind of quirky, but Nancy is very helpful and will do all she can to help bring up your grade if you are in a tight spot. I recommend this class; you learn a lot!

I loved this class.  I was dreading having to take it, but I ended up really enjoying and learning alot from her.  She is very helpful, cares about her students, very nice , patient and funny.  There is work involved, but like any class you get out what you put in.  I would recommend her.

Zwick was AWESOME!! She is by far the best teacher that I have had at NKU. I took the class online. We had weekly assingments out of the book and a project due every week. Nothing that we did was extremely hard If you ever had a question she was always willing to help. Shes very nice. Tests= a little challenging but she gave 2 x-credit assingments.
Very very nice teacher, I loved her! She knows so much about nutrition and is very flexible on assignments. She has one huge project but it can be done.

The final grade was based on weekly postings, 5 assignments, midterm and final. Her midterm/final questions are not written by her and some of the questions are not from the text- still can't figure what saving the environment has to do with nutrition.

Had this class for Nutrition. She is a nice professor, and you do learn a lot in her class, but she is EXTREMELY biased on everything she says. You have many, many projects to do, but only 2 tests; midterm and final. Do NOT take the tests online. Very easy class, nice lady, and learned a lot of info. Recommended!!
she was so nice and very helpful. The tests were hard and i didn't pass most of them but since i did all the other assignments well i still got a B in the class.

She's kinda dorky, but she knows what she is talking about and her class is fairly easy.  She gives a lot of slack, but she gives you a lot of work to do.  You turn in food journals every five weeks or so and I think that's a bad idea-it should be a weekly thing to reflect on.  It's easy to just think you'll get to them later.

She is a very nice woman who really cares about people and what we do to ourselves as far as nutrition.  To me the tests were extremely difficult, even when I did study, More applicable than just knowing notes.  Food journals are a pain but do them weekly and it won't be so tedious.  Offers extra credit so if you do poorly on test you still pass.

I had Professor Zwick for nutrition.  It was very beneficial.  She really cares about people and is very passionate about health.  She is not only a teacher, but also a dietician.  There is definitely a lot of work in the class and the exams are hard, but I still got an A because I did all of the extra credit.

This lady is a real pain, she does not like to be emailed and will not respond, she wants you to call her on the phone. If you do decide to call her and a ask a question be prepared to be talked over the entire time and not even get your question asked. I would never recommend this class to anyone. DO. NOT. TAKE. IT,

I took the night class. The class was extremely easy, just very time consuming. She will give you enough extra credit that you could skip all of the classes and still pass as long as you do the assigned work. The material was semi-interesting. A lot like a health class from high school. Good for your GPA, though.

I took this class online with Professor Zwick and it was the easiest class ever. You have one discussion board each week, and then 4 projects over the span of the whole semester- which aren't hard at all. There is one final and one midterm but if you take it online, you can use your book, and the internet. She also offers plenty of extra credit.

Took her hybrid class, met once a week. She gives grades for attendance, so show up. She has you do four projects in the semester, very manageable, but still try your hardest. One 1,000 word chapter summary a week, one week had two summaries, and she offers 3 or 4 extra credit projects. 2 tests, the midterm and final. Timed, but use any resources.

Nancy is very knowledgeable about human nutrition. If science is not your strong suit and you need a biology credit, THIS CLASS IS FOR YOU! Plenty of extra credit, midterm and final is optional. This is basically an online class, but you still need to attend class!
Not too bad but does come with a lot of work.  would recommend if you do the work.

TERRIBLE. Gives busy work. For a 100 level it is not worth it. I'd rather take a 400 level and do meaningful course work. There was no attempt to even make the course interesting by the professor, which made me not care about the course. I DO NOT RECOMMEND. Does like to talk over the phone if you need her, no emails.

Human nutrition was the easiest class I have ever taken. If you put in any effort you will do fine. Nancy gives the option of doing a route that involves only projects and no homework, or you can still do the homework and projects and get extra credit. She makes the class almost impossible to fail.

She offered a ton of extra credit so it would be hard not to succeed. Her lectures, however, were EXTREMELY boring. Her projects for extra credit were very useful, but I do not think I retained very much of the information.

Professor nancy zwick was really really nice and caring. She had a lot of extra credit opportunities and her exams were online and lasted for 7 days . it would be really helpful for you to go to class.
Took the online class. She is very helpful & easily available for questions. Read the chapters, start your assignments early & you'll learn so much from this class.  Great Professor!
Lots of information to digest.  The exams were really hard because they were timed and you couldn't go back and correct.

This professor weighs every assignment, test, exam, and project, the same. She is there for you whenever you need her. She prefers to be called on the phone when it comes to needing help, than to e-mail her. She is an all-around good professor.

Nancy was one of the easiest professors that I have every had hands down. She gave a few pointless assignments, and one day we even watched a movie in her class, but if you are looking for an easy grade, this is it.

Nancy is very passionate about nutrition. There are weekly papers and additional activities but if you do them its an easy A (it seems a lot at first but are fairly easy). Attendance is part of your grade so show up. if u dont, you can do extra credit projects to replace those attendance points. only downside she rambles but she is energetic!

Nancy is a super kind woman and has made a class that I have heard others complain about super simple and an easy A. Very accessible outside of class and if you are concerned about your own eating habits she will help for free, as she is a registered dietician. I recommend her if you want an easy A.
Professor Zwick is a really cool lady. Her class was pretty easy. We watched a lot of videos and she was always super friendly. She's also super accessible outside of class if you ever need help.
She is a good professor. But she doesnt realize how harmful most of her class is. Often gets off topic. If you struggle with self image or an eating disorder be prepared for the class to be difficult
She's super accessible outside of class and responses quickly. Only projects no exams. Weekly summaries about chapters on the book, super easy!

Nancy is an absolute sweetheart and cares a lot that her students actually learn and try to make changes. Attendance is extremely important for this class, but she provides a ton of extra credit if you're just willing to do a little extra work. Easy to get an A if you just do the work. Paper due weekly on the textbook, but she's an easy grader.

Nancy is the best professor to take for nutrition hands down. She's super carefree, cool, and explains things in a way that just makes sense. She provides tons of extra credit projects, but as long as you do your work/show up this class is an easy A and you shouldn't have to do extra credit. Overall, she's awesome!

I love professor Zwick. shes funny and cares for students. sometimes class is boring because of the lengthy videos we watch but grades mostly come from assignments. they're based on info from the textbook/info you look up. a lot of extra credit is offered. no tests or quizzes. she always urges us to contact her if needed, she responds so fast!
She's cool, but you spend much of class time just watching videos. Weekly homework, but it's not too bad. She offers free nutrition counselling for her students, which is cool.

Take this class. It is so easy. She grades so easy it's insane. She's fun and loves to talk and lets you go early every class. All you do is watch movies and there's like no test. Take this class 100% If you need the credit.

Take this class! The homework is simple and just requires a few hours a week. This class was so beneficial and she truly cares about her students. She is an amazing professor who wants to make a difference in the world. She responds to texts quickly. Offers lots of extra credit as well! Absolutely love her! Highly recommend this course.

Take an extra day to review all of the material a 2nd or 3rd time before exams because you WILL get a lot of specific questions. You'll get a 100 on ur weekly controversies if you just submit something. Take a day to do your classroom activity projects because those always take longer than you think, but you'll do well if you just follow the rubric
If you want to have a fun time, take his class. You do have to prepare for the tests and quizzes, but you'll have a good time doing so. Definitely a great professor.

He does have an accent, and at first I was not sure if I should have stayed in the class regardless of the good ratings on here.  But I stayed with it, and I am very glad I did just that.  Tests were very easy when I studied, powerpoints every class are helpful (If you can stay awake in those comfy seats!) Labs are somewhat irrelevant but not bad

He has a very thick accent, I never quite got used to it but he posts very helpful and clear notes to study from. The labs aren't too bad but can be confusing. Tests and quizzes are challenging. Overall if you do the work and study the class isn't bad. He tries to help the best he can and seems to be a really nice guy.

While he's not a bad teacher, he's not good either. I took AST with him because I was told he was easy and fun but I fail to see any of that. I'm not science minded at all and had to rely on the book in order to get any information. He tends to run in circles and dumps a lot of info on you at once. Don't take if not science-oriented.

This guy is hilarious! I give extra points for yuks and he delivers. AND it's one heck of a course. you gotta put the time in so if you're lazy take something else. BUT if you want to learn about the universe and be entertained in the process--this is your course!
He was hilarious! The class was difficult. Don't miss a lecture. There are only 3 tests and they are worth 70 percent of your grade. You don't need the workbook or textbook at all...
One of the best profs I have ever had. Really cares about his subject and students. Accent not a problem.
This professor may or may not know what he's talking about.  You really can't understand him at all!
Definitely knows his material. Very helpful!

Dr. Ramkumar was my astronomy professor. It takes a little bit of time to start understanding how he talks with his Indian accent and all, but he always makes sure that you understand everything. He's extremely helpful.He uses all powerpoint, and posts on blackboard. I recommend taking Ramkumar for AST110.You will learn a lot of cool stuff.

This was the worst class I have ever taken in my life.  He is very difficult to understand and it mean.  He will call you out if you aren't paying attention and will humiliate you.  I hate him and you will to if you take him. You would think that a professor with an accent would talk slower, but you can't understand anytthing out of his mouth!  BOO

I would take the class again just to listen to him say supposay, he is difficult to understand at times but very helpful anytime you need him, I think he lives on campus he is always there.  the course was difficult for me and he seemed to almost know to much about it but if your into Astronomy go for it

Lab activities did not follow lecture discussions. Tests did not reflect lab or lecture, and only a smidge was covered on the study guides. His accent makes lecture difficult to follow. Nice guy, very helpful, needs to adjust his cirriculum. Should focus more on planetary composition. Tests have too many similar terms for a multiple choice exam.
Chari as a person is cool.  But the material is tough.  Tests were 50 multiple choice questions.  And the final was not cumulative.  I would reccommend him.
Chari is probably the coolest professor I have had.  The material is a little unclear sometimes but he is always willing to help.  If you have a choice to take him, do it.

Yes, he has a thick accent and is hard to understand at first. But you get used to it (mostly). He knows his stuff and is very enthusiastic while teaching it, so the lectures aren't too boring. Quizzes and tests are easy, and the lab is a piece of cake. Just review the PowerPoint notes he gives you and you'll pass his class no problem.
Survey of AST class, just couldn't get interested in the subject matter. Not the professor's fault. He is alright.

Great guy. Do not expect to skate through the course though. You need to study for the exams and do the homework. He uploaded sample questions before every exam. Just show up, pay attention, study, do the homework and you will be fine.

Chari is really funny and tries to keep the class interested on the topic but when it comes to the tests, hours of studying are needed. He uploads review questions before each exam as practice, and 85% of it is not taught or talked about in class. This makes studying even more difficult. I wouldn't recommend taking this class.
His lectures aren't the best. He's a good teacher and likes to joke around with the students.

Dr. Ramkumar is the BEST teacher I've ever had so far. He is so open and so nice with students, he makes the class so much interesting w/ his jokes. You will need to study hard. He will make it a lot more easier with his summaries etc. I would HIGHLY recommend him because he takes out the best of you even though you're not a scientific.

Professor Ramkumar does have a thick accent, but it's nothing terrible and he's easy to understand. He likes to joke around a lot and tries to make the class entertaining. Labs were a little difficult for me, but he would always help me the best he could and I really appreciated it. If you're looking at astronomy, I would highly recommend him.

Passionate Professor! YOU WILL NOT SKATE throught the course, it will involve EFFORT! He gives study guides, practice tests, and has review days. Great class if your not really into science like me. I encourage you take him, because he is always willing to HELP! YOU GOT IT!
An amazing professor. Made me really want to go farther in Astronomy. Labs every week, easy. Exams and tests are simple if you study. Great professor, I will and have recommended him to everyone!
Very kind man, very passionate about Astronomy.  However, the cultural and language barriers were hard for me to overcome.  He also repeatedly kept us longer than the 3.5 hour class.

This professor is amazing! Very kind, helpful and funny. Strict on cell use and will pick on those who use them and sleep in class. Show up and pay attention. Doesn't read off slides, but uses them as a guide. Very good lecturer and makes the content easy to understand. He is my favorite professor thus far!

Excellent, excellent professor!  Made content interesting and was funny as hell.  Excellent class for a PACE student.  Not a ton of homework, mostly in class work.  Attend class and you will get an A.

Professor was ok, interacted with students a lot, making jokes and messing around. Sometimes the material didn't make sense with what was on the exams, but overall it was all fine. He didn't teach the lab though so that made things a little more difficult.

Super fun professor, he teaches with a lot of energy and tells a lot of jokes so it's not boring. He wants people to participate a lot. He has an accent, but it's understandable. Barely any homework, but exams are a little difficult. One of my favorite teachers or professors I've ever had, definitely recommend.

The main issue I had with this class was that the exams were EXTREMELY challenging for this class to be a 100 level course. I would study for more than a reasonable amount of time and still never get above an 80% on his exams. There was also a few issues with getting my assignments graded in a timely manner.
I absolutely loved his lab. He made physics understandable and fun. He's an all-around nice, hilarious guy, and I wish HE could have been my physics professor.
Chari is a great guy, but this class is entirely too hard and demanding to be a gen ed. Get ready to struggle if you have a job, do anything else outside of school, or arent a science major.

Very funny professor. Definitely pay attention and ask questions if you are confused. As long as you care, the exams should be fairly easy from the reviews he does during the week of the exam. Try not to fall asleep in the planetarium if you are in the room because he will call you out in class. The homework is also fairly easy.

He posts review questions before he goes over a chapter. They are possible extended response questions on the test. He uses these as a guide for his lectures. Print those out and answer them as the lecture goes on. Everything you need to know will be in those questions. Wouldn't recommend taking AST in the morning because you might fall asleep..

Dr. Ramkumar is a real character. Astronomy is a difficult course but his lectures make it super easy to understand the topics and he's really funny. He's really caring and is passionate about what he talks about. Also, the planetarium is really cool when he discusses constellations! I would take this class with him again!
Super funny and laid back, but explains things in an easy/understandable way.

Science has never been my cup of tea. But it is needed for GenEds so I took AST110. Dr. Ramkumar is nice, but he is hard to understand at times. He doesn't follow powerpoint lectures and it is easy to lose focus when you're already confused. If you are looking for an easier science course for the credit, I wouldn't recommend this class.

I liked Dr. Ramkumar. Hes a pretty funny guy and really easy to get along with. I ended up not liking the class very much because I lost interest in engineering but overall his class structure was fairly good. If youre interested in engineering though, he gives you plenty of opportunities to figure out what exactly youre looking for.

I have always struggled with science and unfortunately this class didn't make it any easier. Chari is a good guy, but the course is extremely demanding for a 100 level course. He grades pretty rough, and the exams are always extremely particular. I feel like there is too much content trying to be pushed on students. Exams weighted by 60%. :(

I am super into astronomy and thought this would be a fun gen ed course. The first couple weeks went well when we learned about constellations but as soon as we went into the physics stuff it was a lot more difficult. I loved watching movies in the planetarium. The tests are weighted heavily and there are very few of them. He is a super nice guy.

He continuously made fun of me in class. He spoke way too fast in the lecture. The quizzes were extremely difficult considering it was a 100 level class. Homework could take up to 2 hours to complete. Not a fan.
Least favorite professor ever.  Boring.  WILL tempt you to sleep in class, even if you've NEVER done it before.

OMG This was the worst teacher ever! He rambled on and on. Had no idea what he was talking about. Material was covered quickly. He decided to stop teaching half way thru. Didn't even make anymore powerpoints. We just came in and did labs on the computer. Had to drop because I wasn't learning anything! Bad experience and waste of time.
He didn't really give a clear example, but then again the class was supposed to be hard. He tried his best to make sure everybody got everything, and has great office hours.

Professor is super nice and always willing to help but the help doesn't doesn't work sometimes.  I say this because he doesn't seem to know the material well.  He was teaching an algorithms class (using Java) but didn't know Java.  Was very frustrating.

Dr. Ward is a great teacher.  He is very helpful and easy to learn from. He always provides further insight than what is required by assignments.  He is very intelligent and his main concern is that his students understand the material he is presenting.  I highly recommend taking any of Dr. Ward's classes.  You will benefit greatly from it.

He’s new so you have to give him that but he’s always willing to work with you and help you out. His tests and projects aren’t too hard and he’s really good about mapping out stuff and explaining what’s really happening. Kind of boring though.
easy class because he is helpful
he doesn't teach history...  u got the wrong ward, i think u were looking for tom

Prof. Ward is a great teacher.  His approach is to take a problem and dissect it.  He takes you along the thought process from beginning to end so you understand not only what the outcome should be but why and how you got there.  Wish I had taken him for 260.
Nice person.  His lectures can be boring at times and his projects can be very difficult.  But he'll sit with you for hours until you get the program right.  Very, Very helpful professor.
Great professor. As said before, very helpful. He seems to know more Java than what previous posters have said. Also, it seems almost impossible to get him angry. :)

Pretty monotone, it's a good thing you don't have to listen to him to still get an A.  The labs and final exam was easy, the quizzes on extra readings almost killed me.  I would read and understand it, but the questions were on random parts of the reading that didn't really matter.  Buy the main book, but not the others - they are available online.
Extremely helpful.  He doesn't have the easiest class, but he will go way out of way to help you understand the material.  He is always in his office and really wants to help you out.

Jeff's biggest problem is his monotone lectures. They will put you to sleep unless you love computer science. He sometimes made mistakes too. But he still covers the material well and he's willing to help you. The assignments range from easy to very difficult and the tests are hard. Only take his class if you have a genuine interest in CSC.
Lectures are so boring, but you have to go cause its 10% of your grade. Lectures were not that helpful, I learned better googling stuff.

He has never taught the class before or used the programming language due to being a last minute replacement for the professor that was scheduled not being available. He adjusted quickly and was very helpful for us learning the material. The content was easily understood.  Wonderful teacher and I'd take him again but good gods is he boring.
Prepare to really study for exams. Overall he's really helpful, just make sure you stay on top of the homework. Also, pay attention to the lectures because he often goes over homework concepts.

Great professor, super smart, and knows the material well. Gives extra credit for every class you attend (ended up being around 30 points for us, which is huge). Had 6 programming assignment, 2 tests, and the final. Will replace one test grade with final grade if you do better on the final than on one of the tests. Monotone voice in lectures. Zzz.
The class is a lot of work but it is necessary to learn the subject matter. He explains things ok in class, he is better one on one.

Very good professor. His lectures can be very repetitive at times if you already understand the material. Also he give extra credit and replaces your lowest test grade with the final if you do better on it.

I've taken Dr. Ward for the past two semesters and have had some pretty smooth sailing throughout. If you're taking CSC 364, ward would be the way to go. The class itself doesn't cover too much material so it enables Dr. Ward to explain it very thoroughly. Speaks a tad monotone but it doesn't bother most too much. I'd gladly take Ward a third time.

I've heard he is good for higher level classes but he is awful if you are trying to start learning a new programming language. Had to drop the course because he was basically assuming the class already knew java when the pre-req was python.

Great teacher once you get past the monotone voice. It is really difficult not to fall asleep during his lectures, but he is very good at explaining concepts and answering questions. Homework is challenging and he grades more on how you accomplished the task rather than IF you accomplished the task, unlike my INF 120 instructor.
Very smart and helpful

I absolutely loved my semester with Professor Ward. His explanation of CS concepts and the nuances of the Java language are clear, and concise. I never had any issue staying awake in class, honestly.  My favorite part about him as a professor is that he lets you use self-made cheat sheets for exams, and his exams have 10 extra credit points.
Word...

Dr. Ward is fantastic and a genius, though this class in particular was very difficult. His study guides for exams helped us know what topics would be covered, and his examples and our assignments reflected what would be on them. He is incredibly helpful if you attend his office hours as well. Absolutely recommend him.

Dr. Ward is a great professor for this class since he is so knowledgeable. The class itself was very easy as long as you are competent in Computer Science. Attendance was extra credit and there was an extra credit assignment. The final kind of came out of nowhere since it was longer and more intense than either midterm. Still easy enough.
She us very nice and very helpful. The class is pretty easy. Don't miss class because you will have trouble staying on track. I would definitely take her again for other math classes

She is awesome!!!! She is extremely helpful.  She made math so painless for me.  If you need a math gen ed. TAKE HER.  I learned soooo much about math.  The stuff that i learned actually relates to real life.  I would take her again in a heartbeat!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

All I can say is wow!! What an amazing teacher. She has the best way of explaining things and she really makes class fun. Extremely excited about what she is teaching. I would recommend going to class everyday or you will be completely lost. Take her! you will love her no matter what.

She is nice.  She wants you to do well.  Sometimes her lectures are good, and sometimes you get really lost.  She doesn't present many examples, so it's hard to do homework sometimes.  She also likes to teach new material and then throw problems at you right away before you understand it to do in groups.  That was hard and confusing.

Beth is amazing!!! I high recommend her for all math classes possible. Especially if you're going into Education!! You will need your book. it may be expensive, but you should keep it for a great reference book! She is very easy to get a hold of as well. Email, phone, text. you name it. :)

BEST PROFESSOR EVER. She's fun and goofy, but she definitely knows her stuff. She will do anything to help you, even give you her cell number. She is very clear and want's everybody to do good. Tests aren't that bad and you only have a few other assignments. You always work in groups and she's very friendly. Strongly recommend her!
BEST PROF. EVER. She is so nice. Easy to talk to if you have questions. The class is so fun, and its MATH!
Not available for help when needed. Talked allot about personal life instead of going over math problems.

In all my years of learning Math, Beth is the best teacher there is out there. She is one of the only professors that I have seen that actually cares on HOW you learn something and the different ways to learn it, Math isn't just one way and that's it. Beth is great and I highly recommend taking any class with her.

SUPER HELPFUL! and very clear about subject matter. Ever since the first day it was fun to be in and I learned a lot. She answers all questions, very friendly, very smart. great teacher.. she is very helpful and goes over all the material with you before tests or quizzes.. pretty easy to get an A

Excellent teacher! She is very clear in explaining the subject. Funny and helpful. She is a great professor! The content is difficult at times because you  may know how to do it, but probably not why or how to explain it; and that is what this whole class is about. She is awesome. The kind of professor who is interested in your learning. Always answers questions with questions to push you to the answer. Every testassignmentquiz is more about your explanations than your work. The writing never ends.

the worst teacher ive ever had..her fail rate is very high..which means she doesnt care about passing even if you try hard.if you go to her for help..she sets there and stares at you like your dumb..try it ..not helpful..doesnt explain..likes to talk about how she wish she major in biology..regrets being an alg teacher..quiz and test hard every we

the only way she gets students is through student support service, which is a joke, she is hard, doesnt know all the problems to work out, she gets confuse, you have to go to tutoring to get help, she gets irritated if you ask her, she is hard, and not nice, likes to intimidate you, is her goal

hard to understand and boring, i kinda feel sorry for him cuz i know he likes teaching but its oh so boring also he lost my mem stick which wasn't even mine! Really great teacher, a must take!!! Very easy to understand.
This professor is a very nice guy.  Follows the book almost exactly and does a great job explaining the material.
He's overly helpful.  He explains things well.  He's a little to easy on the students.

This man is perfect for those of us that struggle in math! He's really fair and takes notice when you're really trying but just not getting the material. Plus, his name is Jim Justice..and that's just awesome, let's be honest.

Mr. Justice is a awesome!  I've been through my fair share of Calculus professors, he is hands down the best.  If you need Calculus "Jim Justice is the man!"  Very funny and intelligent man.  Exams are fair and straight forward.  No tricks.

No extra credit but he does did change the lowest test grade to be the same as your final grade if you scored higher on the final.  Great Professor!

Homework was not graded but the quizzes cover it so you should do it.  There where 6 quizzes and he dropped the 2 lowest ones. There are only 2 test plus the final.  He don't offer any extra credit but will drop your lowest test grade and replace it with your final test grade if it is higher. Great Professor!
One of the better teachers you will have at NKU.  Super guy and will go over homework problems until you get it.  Go to class, Pay attention, Get an A.

TAKE PROFESSOR JUSTICE!  Entering this class, I was not that interested in math. I was fearful of calculus. Leaving the class, that is now the complete opposite. Professor Justice will not give you an A, you will def. have to work hard for it. He has the ability to explain things so that one can actually understand the topic. Very caring professor
Excellent professor who really cares about his students.  I took him for MAT 112 and MAT 114.  I took the classes at night just so I could get him.  Take him if you can.
Awesome !!  It was my pleasure to take this class with him ! :)

Jim Justice is the best math teacher I have ever had. ever.  If I can take him for other classes I will, no matter how I have to rework my schedule.  He explains the topics so you can understand. The exams are a little tough, you need to make sure you have done your homework and you will be fine.

Wonderful guy.  Very nice guy.   If you don't like surprises, don't take him is my advice.  He does try to trick you on exams, he will tell you he likes to challenge you on the exams.   It also takes him a long time to get things graded.  This is okay when you have large classes, but our class was very small and we were taking our first big exam before we knew what we got on our quizzes so you didn't know where you were for weeks at a time.  I really enjoyed him as a professor overall but you will find yourself frustrated at times because he adds concepts to quizzes and tests that he didn't cover in class all that thoroughly or that the homework didn't cover.  This only bothered me because he claims he follows homework when he makes his exams out but he adds concepts that the homework didn't cover, at all. Or he adds items to exams that he BARELY goes over in class.  If you are someone who needs practice and lots of examples in homework to practice & study, him adding concepts to tests that he barely went over, you will struggle.  My advice is to work problems from each section, even the ones he says you don't need,  because he will add stuff.  For example, when we covered even and odd functions, telling if a function is even or odd, etc, the homework doesn't cover those things but he added it to our 2nd exam.  So when you go over a study guide for the exam, he will add things and your like, "Ummmm our homework didn't cover this," so then you basically have to learn new concepts at all once.  Also, when we covered trig functions, he added coterminals to the quiz and that was no where in the section we were being quizzed on so you basically have no real way of studying for his quizzes or exams when he does tricks like this.  I'm doing very well in the course, but him consistently doing this, it got so tiring and frustrating toward finals time.  I feel exhausted because you never know what to expect from his tests.  I think he assumes we are all math experts and know all of this math so studying can be so exhausting when he throws things in without warning us or preparing us adequately.  I never even heard the term coterminal in his class and yet we were quizzed on it, so be warned.
Too bad...I came to find out information about him, but I'm out of luck.  I'll be taking him in the summer, I'll let you guys know!

horrible. he would teach you how to do a problem a way that didnt make sense.  then you go home try to do the homework, and the the proble. but on test if you do it like the book does and not the way he does its wrong. Horrible teacher. He knows the material, just had no clue how to teach.
very helpful. A friend said not to take him, but I found out she had cheated on an exam and got caught. Not easy, but I've been treated fairly and learned a lot.

McCartney's knowledge pertaining to mathmatics is undeniable. However, you must show up to his lectures with somewhat of an understanding of the topic [read the chapters before they're explained!] NKU is lucky to have such an intelligent professor

If you understand calculus pretty well you should do okay in his class. If you struggle do not take him. He gives you about 12 quizzes and you drop the lowest one. Three tests and final. He does curve the tests though. Very hard class.

The problem with this professor is he teaches how to specifically solve one problem.  He spends too much time on one problem in class and expects you to know to to solve the rest on your own.  He is smart, has a sense of humour, but simply cannot teach.  I was an A student in math, but got a C with him.  That's how bad he is.
ONLY TAKE THIS PROFESSOR IF YOU ARE SPECIFICALLY A MATH MAJOR
his final exam is 1/3 of your grade. very hard teacher

This class was very hard.  All the grades are solely test and quizzes.  He does do a great job to teach it and to make sure the class knows it very well.  The downfall is just the grading system.
very hard. terrible teacher, does not know how to get point across.The book is useless, if you dont get it you cant go to the book for help.

Very smart man, he knows his stuff.. But does not know how to project what he knows in a effective teaching method. He would do any problem you asked on the board.. But does it HIS way, and it seems like he doesnt realize we dont know what he knows...

A great teacher who really cares about his students. I missed a lot due to illness and he approached me to make sure I was keeping up OK and offered help if needed. My first math class in 20yrs and I found it fairly easy. Read the text and try doing a few problems before class and you'll do fine.

If there is another teacher available, take them instead.  Not saying he's a bad guy, just very hard to understand.  Tests are not what you do in class.  Gives simple problems in class and on tests makes them 1000x harder.

not good.doesnt know how to explain things for the students to understand.hes too smart and cant transfer it to the students.quizzes and tests are hard and if you dont do it his way then you get it wrong even if you have the right answer.

I'm an accounting major so I've always been good at math. McCartney is horrible and relating the work to the students and correctly explaining it. The only way I was able to pass the course (barely) was I had to teach myself the information and get tutoring. His tests were really hard and came out of left field.

Terrible teacher. Boring, can't explain things well, I had to teach myself EVERYTHING, teaches everything different than the textbook teaches it and doesn't use blackboard at all. Tests are terrible. He is a nice guy but he can't teach. Do not take.

I do not like his teaching methods. Very hard to understand, he speaks like you should know it already. Tests were ridiculously difficult. Now have to retake the class.

Not a very good teacher. Everyone I talked to said not to take him, but he was the only one offered. I have to retake the class now. Not clear, expects you to just know the material and his tests don't question how well you know it, but how smart you are. Do not take, wait until another teacher is offered.

I started off horrible in this class. He only gives test and quizzes for grades so that is why I did so bad. But McCartney is willing to help. He wants you to succeed and is always in his office for extra help. Overall if I would of understood the concept in the beginning I would have done better. Don't be afraid to ask for help. MAT114=Tough class

Phenomenal Professor.  His intelligence is obvious.  Always willing to help no matter what else he has going on.  Will continue to help until you understand it. NKU is lucky to have such an extremely intelligent professor.

Difficult, but he wants ALL of his students to do well. With that said, he is going to give you the grade you earn. Don't expect an A, if you aren't working for it. Very good teacher, challenging and assigns homework that helps teach you, but doesn't collect.  tests are ok if u understand the subject.  Great proffesor would take again.

Don't take him if you need a grade for this class!  His tests and quizzes are impossibly hard and he grades them harshly.  He rushes through his lectures and assigns homework before you even know what you are doing. Definitely buy the study guide for the class because you'll need it!!

Dr. McCartney is obviously well versed in mathematics. He can explain Complex Analysis with ease, yet the class was challenging enough to keep interested. If I didn't take him my last semester in undergrad, I would have definitely taken another class with him!
i'm sure that he is a nice man outside of class, but he was impossible as a teacher! if you need one class for your math credit, take someone else.
