Worst teacher I've ever had! Avoid taking this class with him at all costs! He doesn't explain things well... He just assigns problems. He isn't willing to help you out much either. Tests and quizzes were extremely difficult.

he was the worst teacher i think i have ever had..all he talks about is stupid stuff that has nothing to do with math. he expects you to learn the material on your own. i even dropped the class since he was so bad. do not take him!!

he is a pretty good teacher. expects you to do homework but does tend to go over the same problems almost everyday. 3 tests and around 12 quizzes but as long as you pay attention it is a easy class. the toughest stuff is the last 2 chapters.
Very good professor, but would never take again. Always tried toe explain things in the hardest ways possible. Even if a student thought heshe found a way around it he would just make it complicated.

I had to work hard, but he always made time to help me even outside of office hours. Scored quizzes and exams super fast. I learned a lot and feel prepared for my business math classes. Sent notes to class by email on material not in textbook and then went over the notes in class.

Avoid him at all costs. He is extremely difficult. His class went from being full to practically empty after the first exam. He makes an already hard class a million times harder than it should be.  Even if you do know the material, there is no way to finish his tests within the time allotted.

Professor starts well, and does well to grade quickly. However fails to give simple forms and answer simple questions. He tries to make ideas, questions and terms harder than they are. I have already taken calc and passed with high marks, how ever I am currently taking the course to gain the college credit and struggling to keep a good grade.

Professor McCartney is incredibly difficult. I have always been able to do very well in math, but I have no clue what I am doing in his class. He spends the entire class going over homework instead of teaching the material. I leave every class with no clue how to do the homework. Do not take him if you want a C or better

This teacher made me hate math. Calculus was and still is one of my favorites but going to his class made me never want to see a derivative again. He also had a very bad habit of telling useless stories the day before the test.

Calc II is a very hard class, and this guy sure didn't make it any easier. You're pretty much entirely on your own as far as learning the content goes, all he does in class is go over the homework assignments (which are not for a grade). In all honesty going to all the classes doesn't leave you any better off at all if you don't constantly study.

Extremely smart man but can not teach at all. You can take all the notes you want and do every homework assignment and if you are still questionable on any topic, you're screwed because he sure can't explain it in English at all. The only grades in this class are the 3 tests and final exam with about 10 quizzes.

He's tough, there is no doubt. Does not check homework but expects students to do it and come in with questions. He isn't always clear in explanation as he tends to explain concepts in a more advanced level of understanding. Do you own supplemental studying or get a tutor. He doesn't use BlackBoard. I understood that it was a 5 credit hour class but he made it impossible to pass. Even the smartest in the class couldn't pass his tests and rarely passed his frequent quizzes. He's bad at explaining how to do problems, mostly tells you to just read the textbook. He also keeps his back to the class and goes through problems barely stopping.

Worst professor I have  ever had.  Calc 2 is an extremely difficult course, and a 5 hour course is a lot of work. This guy makes it nigh impossible to pass.  He doesn't teach.  AT ALL. The NIH stroke scale extra credit was nice & I like the certificate that goes with it.  She was helpful in reviewing what I miss on the exams and has a good sense of humor.

I hated this class. She posted modules with case studies for us to complete and turn in each week. The longest was 37 pages and the shortest was around 12. She hardly lectured. She spent our 3 hour class asking us practice questions. Everything I learned in that class I taught myself.

She's a good teacher- but she does pronounce everything wrong during the lectures. She laughs at her own corny jokes- which then makes you kinda chuckle. She's VERY nice and seems fairly helpful. I would recommend her to others. Tests are right off notes- book is useless.

Have her for 210L and 220. She can be corny to try and help you remember key points.  Very clear on what she wants from you. Lab stays the whole period even if others left early, not a bad thing in nursing. Lectures are kinda boring but she is very helpful!
This women pronounced peritoneal dialysis perioneal dialysis everytime!!!! so we are doing dialysis from that area? no didn't think so. sorry about your totally ineffective teaching style
Great teacher; very knowledgeable
very easy class, and she's super nice...but she pronounced everything wrong and just read from powerpoint

Her lectures are not dynamic but her study guides are brilliant. Know those and you can get 100s on your tests. Believe me, folks really struggle with all the memorization that this class can demand, especially if the instructor is not specific about what to know. Ms Pence is kind and seems very sweet,  and she is INCREDIBLY fair in grading.

Like everyone said, she is very corny and awkward, but nothing you can't get past. She basically has study guides within her notes, and exam questions come straight from that. Very easy if you take the time to actually learn it. She doesnt lecture ALL the time, so teaching yourself is needed, but the content is not that bad, and I liked it.

The only teacher I've ever had who is so bad at communicating that it frustrated me to my soul. In order for your e-mails to be answered, you'll have to send it once every 24 hours for 4+ days. To understand her e-mail/rubric, you'll have to pretend it was written by a third grader and decipher from there. Ask a question and her answer won't help.

I have taken Pence for many classes and I always know I'm going to pass with an A. She tells so many stories in class and gets off topic constantly but she's hilarious. She loves to laugh at her own jokes. Her classes are always easy and she loves to interact with her students. I never stress about the classes that I have her for.

I enjoy class when Professor Pence is teaching. She seems to have a good grasp on what things are really important for us to retain. She provides plenty of info on each section. Sometimes she gets off topic, but she is pretty funny, so I didn't mind. She is always there to help. It really seems that she genuinely wants to see her students succeed.
She was not difficult, just study the powerpoints!
Easy A for research, but you won't learn anything. Although, the other classes said they didn't learn anything in research either. Recommend taking for an easy GPA booster.
No Comments

Make sure that you attend class and try to read all the material.  He requires a lot from you.  Requires interaction from everyone in the class and will call on you if you don't participate.  Watch out on your comments, look at both sides or he will make you feel like a jerk.  This was not an easy course!!
four weeks into a web based class with hughes, and I have yet to get a single grade or a response to the now 8 emails I have sent him.  paid almost $1k for the class and have got nothing from it.

took for a web class. not sure if he understands the technology itself. did finally come through with posting grades. some handouts were from office 2003 although we were using office 2007. wouldn't necessarily recommend for a web class, but a friend had him in classroom and said he was good. he could have been more helpful but disappointed.

I don't doubt he is a good teacher in person, but don't bother if he is your web professor. Emails go unresponded and you'll rarely see a grade. If you have questions about assignments you'll talk to IT more than him.

On the first day of class, he made these outragous threats about how this class was going to be the hardest class in our college career, so 8 or so people ended up dropping after the first class But that wasn't the case of all. I think most of our class ended up with "B's" easiy and I highly doubt anyone got below a "C."

One of 2 classes I've had him teach. Both times, I had to wait until the last week to receive any grades. You have no idea how well/poorly you're doing. He never responds to emails/phone calls. He only responds when turned into the chair of the department. If you're going to teach business courses, you should know how business works. Terrible!

he is a nice person, but class is extremely BORING!!! he will NEVER respond to your emails so do not even bother to email him. His tests are VERY VERY hard. assignments and projects are easy, go to class because he gives extra credit sometimes! hes not an interesting professor AT ALL!

I learned quite a bit of useful information in the class and he seemed to be very helpful during class. However, the lecture part of this class was extremely boring and the tests were really challenging. Most of the stuff I studied didn't even seem to be on the test. Overall not horrible but not great.
Hughes was a good teacher and funny too. Class was tedious because of the nature of computer class. All and all it wasn't to bad. Extra credit is offered.

DIDN'T LEARN ANYTHING! It is easy, but don't look for any real learning to occur.The test are the most random questions that don't prove any understanding of computers.You will get an A if you do the work don't stress when you do poorly on the test. Don't go to lectures its a waste but make sure you go to lab.Horribly usless only take if required

Thought it was an easy class, I got an A in it. He is willing to help if you ask. If you don't do good on the test it really doesn't hurt your grade as long as you do good on the labs and come to class everyday.

This clas was very boring. You have a lecture and a lab per week. For the many times I wanted to skip class I couldn't b/c he would have "pop quizzes" during the lecture classes (which he will hint the answer to you). Overall it was pretty easy, but extremely boring. So it is your call if you want to go to class or not.

Overall very easy class. Boring, but as long as you do the work, you will get an A. Go to lectures because pop quizzes are given. He makes lots of jokes during class that aren't really funny, but at least he tries.
Loved this guy!  Great personality, great sense of humor, all around good guy.
Needs a more rigid curriculum.
No Comments

very straight forward guy. take the notes, read blackboard ( he is one of the few profs i have had that uses that thing religiously) and use the online book flashcards and youll do fine. its not an easy class you have to study. but he makes it so that when you do study and you do well you really feel proud because you know you achieved something.

A committed teacher, with an open mind. Has old school values, but is flexible yet demanding. Tough course, much reading, enjoyable if you are aware that the world extends beyond the shores of the USA.
had for BUS 101 and IFS great teacher tells you what you need to know and puts it on the test, awesome teacher a funny guy.
Prof Hughes is a great professor.  He is really flexible and is willing to help his students if they give a lot of effort.
very easy, tells you what is on the tests, no homework, 2 presentations, 4 tests, and the notes are off the book.

Good guy, he SEEMS to have a lot of background with the business world.  You can learn a good amount in this class if you can pay attention everyday.  Test are not easy but if you read and study you will do fine.  I recommend this class.

Took BUS101 & IFS 105 with him. Very helpful if needed, he genuinely enjoys teaching. I would recommend him to anyone. All you have to do is go to class and read the book for tests. If you like to skip class, it'll hurt you but if you go to class he makes it almost impossible to fail. Good teacher.
If you go to class everyday you pretty much going to get an a.... for test just study vocab and you will do fine.. very helpful lots of extra credit
I've never had him for a class...but he is my advisor.  He really seems to know what he is talking about, and cares about his students.  I would take his class if the oppurtunity presented itself.
Read two books and write 3 or 4 papers. I didn't read either book and got a "C".
Very easy class. If you attend class and pay attention you can't get below a B.

This is a good class if you need to take a nap... Its all you have to do is show up and take the weekly pop quizzes (which he gives the answers to in class DURING the quiz) and go to the lab and do the assignments to get an A. Even if you get C's and D's on the tests (like me) you can still pass with an A+

This class is an easy A if you attend and turn in homework. Do not expect to get any grades besides midterm and final grade. He does not grade anything at all and will not show you your grades. He thinks the class is some kind of game and it gets annoying. If you do not have to take this class then don't. If you do, show up and do your homework.
He's so boring, the work is dull, and he doesn't respond to any emails. Rants about his dogs. Terrible professor, don't take if not necessary for graduation.

I enjoyed his class and you can definitely use what is taught in life.  I use his class everyday.  The homework is easy.  The tests are hard unless you know how to study for them.  He tells you everything on the test, just memorize it all and you will get an A.  He has a lot of interesting life stories.  If you need help, talk to him after class.

Mr. Jim Hughes is a pretty nice guy, he is older and has a dated teaching style. Course material is not difficult, just a ton of memorization. Tests are all essay format and you need to study for them. Gives homework usually once a week. If you go to class everyday, study for tests and pay attention to lecture you will easily pass. Book is used.

I took this class as a part of my integration into a finance major. I took Professor hughes for bus-300. He will not respond to your emails, so do not bother emailing him. I took this class online. The final project required a program called Crystal Reports which I did not have access to. It was not stated in the syllabus that I needed this.

I do not recommend taking this professor for your Inf 101 course.  500 terms per test covered in book and power points with little to no guide as what to focus on.  I received an A but the class average for the first test was in the 60's.  He doesn't teach just repeats terms on the premade power points.

His class was simply put, boring. Everything is on a power point, and it's obvious that he didn't try to update them. The class was easy, but he didn't grade until the last minute. He never responds to emails. He gets annoyed if your point of view differs from his. Don't take his class if you're sensitive. In fact, just don't take it if not needed.
was a great class tested straight out of the book and notes , read the book and pay attention in class get an A
Nice Professor. A bit too much work but you get what you what you work for. would take again easily.

Professor Hughes was okay. Lectures were not interesting, and got boring. Weekly 10 true false quizzes. 7 assignment projects on Excel, Access, and creating on online website. 3 exams including the final, he provides a study guide so the exams and quizzes are easy. There were a few "pop" assignments that came up.

I took Prof. Hughes for BIS 300, His class is one of the worst I've ever taken, not because of the content, but because of his teaching style. He spends little time talking about content, usually talks about his life and how he's been married 4 times. There are a lot of long assignments that you're on your own with. Take any other prof. than him...

Unbelievably easy class! Lots of exams, which helps a lot for your grade.  He practically tells you everything on the tests.  Gives short quizzes, but often just lets you grade them yourselves. Really nice and very willing to work with you. He really knows his stuff.

Too many quizzes! Requires a lot of memorization and to know all the National Parks and locations. The coursework is tricky, and you have to write a report on your favorite park. Skip the background info...he wants the geology. Half my paper discussed the geological formations and it still wasn't enough!

To be honest I did not like Rockaway.  He had too many quizzes and expected you to know this material.  I do not recommend him.  It's not an easy A.  I would never take this class again.  I respect the man, but his class is not good.

Doc Rockaway is an awesome guy and keeps his class interesting, having said that yes GLY 230 is fast paced but he will answer all your questions whenever you ask, especially before test, he calls it last call for free anwswers, which is exactly what it is,great guy,great teacher,but does require some effort, but it's a great class!

Mr Rockaway was definatly a great teacher. He gives quizzes before almost every class. He says to grade them yourself and turn them in. Really he just puts a 10 at the top no matter what you got, and uses them for attendance. His tests arent too bad, even if you get a 60 he curves EVERY TEST between 10 and 20 points. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Course was environmental geoscience. If you read the book, take good notes in lecture AND during his photo slide shows you will get a good grade. If there is a case stude in a chapter make sure you know how the geologic events played out. Also, Rockaway is considered a god in some circles so only bad mouth him in your head.

For an upper level class, it was pretty easy. He gives you the important information without bogging you down with busy work and pointless assignments.  Though it was not a demanding class, I don't feel as though I've been cheated out of learning or like it was a waste of time.  I learned what I needed without all the stress.

Great teacher who wants you to learn the basic geology of national parks. He is the classic teacher of giving homework, giving quizes based on the book, tests and the final worth 200 points with 100 questions. Very easy going, definately worth the class.

An amazing professor! I had him for History of the Earth & Environmental Geoscience. Has a great sense of humor and makes every class enjoyable. As long as you do the work (most of his assignments are pretty fun anyway) and take good notes during his lectures (which are also amusing) you will do fine in his classes.

Great prof- Not a gimme A, but he tests on esactly what he teaches. Read the book-do the homework-pay attention to case studies/slide shows and you'll do well. He pretty much tells you exactly what is on the test- IF HE KICKS THE DESK NOTE THAT WHATEVER HE JUST DISCUSSED WILL BE ON THE TEST. Very accessible- will help as much as needed!
very interesting class, and very  entertaining while making sure you get the right information

great fast pace entertaining class. As long as you dont miss class you'll pass. Very intersting and Dr. Rockaway is very entertaining!
Rockaway is so the man! He rules. He is very entertaining and he cracks me up! He desrves a chili pepper!
Awesome class. He gives out good grades
Dr. Rockaway is the MAN!  Very funny and entertaining professor.  Show up for class and you are guarnateed to pass.  Be careful though, he likes to kick the desk, when he does "PAY ATTENTION"
Rockaway is super cool! If you listen to what he has to say in class you are golden!

Never had a GLY class before, but prof made it easy to understand. Quizzes/exams fairly straightforward with no surprises. Lots of homework. Class well worth it, learned a lot! Would take it again in a heartbeat!

Rockaway is awesome. He has a fast pace teaching style and it is entertaining. But makes it fun to learn his material. I would take another class of his if I could. He literally can answer any question you give him. Very good professor. He goes the extra mile to help his students learn.

This professor is the best professor I have had since I enrolled in 04. He keeps you interested and is always willing to go over any of the material. Very funny and very cool. Know your stuff for the test, he's cool but he wants you to earn the grade. Just listen to him and it will be smooth sailin'.

Dr. Rockaway is super great.  He put up with a lot of crap from me this semester and still managed to keep his cool and be understanding.  He is a hell of a teacher and a great guy to boot.  Take him, you won't regret it!

Very hard class. You need to spend HOURS outside of class studying the material and go to every class. Loved him as a person, but was a difficult professor. I don't recommend taking his classes for but for this one, he is your only option. Horrible experience. Pay attention to his photocopies to study and graphs.

Dr. Rockaway was awesome.  He is super nice and funny, although he is a tough grader.  Having a book is very helpful for exams and quizzes.  If he tells you to read something, make sure you read it.  His exams aren't too bad if you seriously study for them.  He will meet on-on-one and make sure you understand everything.

Dr. Rockaway is the head of the geology department, but also an all-around great lecturer. Not an easy teacher, but one in which your grade is the direct result of your own work -- don't expect an easy pass. Lectures are solid, and all homework comes directly from it (and tests from that!).   And if he kicks a table? It's important. Write it down.

Genuinely funny man. Only professor to make good use of book, read it. He's not always consistent with what he says he wants from you, but he's incredibly laid back and easygoing so he never does anything unfair. He has quite a bit of homework and you never really know if he's actually going to grade it. He does not use blackboard.

Quality guy if you get to know him, he cares about his students if you care about him. Can make your learning experience a whole lot easier. Keeps things interesting with personal stories, and will answer questions before quizzes. Seems to really enjoy his job.

Definitely doesn't give out easy grades. You need to spend time outside of class studying the material and go to every class. He is very fast paced and expects you to carry your load of work. Loved him as a person, but was a difficult professor. I don't recommend taking his classes for gen eds

He is very easy to get along with. Yes you do have test every week. But if he sees you are making and effort he will give you the grade he feels you deserve. He likes to joke and usually his jokes are bonus on exams. He will kick the desk when he goes over something that will be on the test! Flexible when you contact him before you miss the class.
He was an awesome guy, very caring and willing to help. I recommend taking him!
No Comments

She loves her job. That is why she is a hard professor. She expects you to have the same passion as she does. Therefore, if you are looking for an easy A, don't take her, but if you want to learn, take this professor.

The course is extremely hard.  Instead of testing general concepts, tests were over minor details.  First quiz had questions from unassigned chapters.  Assignments were confusing as she had two assignments called assignment one and assignment two and if you are like me it would seem assignment one would be due before assignment two but it isn?t.

Notes are scattered and straight from the book but she doesn't explain it very well.  Tests have random questions that don't relate to actual material.  There was no explanation of lab, and they don't help you learn the material.  DON'T TAKE HER!  Nice person outside of class, but should not be teaching!  Makes you do her research as well
Doesnt email you back. If she does, its a week later. Notes are from the book. She didn't even include all of the notes for the test. Makes getting an a hard because she is unprepared.
Terrible professor.  Didn't explain material and exams were just a guess. Can't prepare for exams because you have no idea what will be on them.  Very fun person, but should not be a professor.
don't take her. Never helps, short on time, busy teacher.

She is really smart, but she expects you to be on the same level as her. She teaches on a level too high for an intro class, and doesn't understand why everyone in the class is having a hard time understanding the material, and especially her tests.

She knows the subject very well and makes the class really interesting. Though the class was challenging, she was really fair and made herself available for those who needed help. Highly recommend the class!
I think she is a wonderful teacher.  At least in comparison to the other lab teachers.  She was very helpful for me and she explained things really well before and after labs.

A good likeable person but not the greatest teacher. Basically, you have to get 90% of the information from the book on your own. She did start posting her complete notes on blackboard but each chapeter consisted of about 20 pages worth of notes. Went through a chapter per class. Class was fun but memorize, memorize, memorize!
Very nice person, and very fun, but the lecture was definitely a mess.  You have to be able to sort thru everything to figure out what you really need to know.  It was frustrating.

Avoid!  Uses textbook notes (too lazy to make her own), always has to give pts because of unfair questions on exams, and lab?  Well, lets just say she does NOTHING to help you.  Ignores student emails, and won't see you during office hours.  Always worried about being the next brain surgeon.  F!

The notes she has is all on powerpoint which makes it easy to follow but she goes through them way too fast, and forget trying to write it all down. You are better off memorizing the entire book. Test were way too difficult, especially for an intro class! Avoid taking her class or else you will be taking this class over again like me!

She loved to talk about Anatomy and you could tell that she was really smart. She was a fun teacher to listen to but her tests were very hard and I feel that she thought of herself a lot higher than her students and she never would help us out by letting us know what would be on her tricky tests.

Great Professor. I would recommend taking him for the CHE 120 lab. Very easy to understand and if your having troubles he is more than willing to help you understand. Laid back and funny but a tough grader.

I would recommend him for lab not lecture. He is a better lab professor than lecture. His exams are pretty straight forward and as long as you understand each lab you will pass them. Some reading is required (techniques used in Organic) which helps in the long run. Just listen to him and you will do fine!
He is great teacher, willing to help anytime and laid back. Is a little picky grading but fair. He tests are pretty straight forward just study. Take him for OChem 310 Lab.

This guy is great, very friendly and helpful. In fact gets frustrated if he can't answer your question.  I mean when have you heard that? He simplifies the material in 101 doesn't always go directly out of the book which throws you off but it's to be expect at this entry level.  Had an easy time.
great professor, fantastic to ask random questions to; however, he fails to stress due dates so just pay attention to when things are due
great professor.....def knows his stuff

Very friendly. Helpful during lab. He genuinely wants every student to do well. However, if you don't put in the work, he WILL grade a bit harder than expected. This is a tough class, but I wouldn't ay it had too much to do with the professor.I suggest not only reading and writing up the labs before class but studying off of the proocols as well.

If you do not like chemistry but need to take it, take Sieve! He focuses on the major aspects of chemistry and doesn't worry about the minor details, making his tests pretty easy as long as you come (and pay attention) to class. It's a very simplified version l of chemistry but it's good for an easy gen ed credit.

Very good professor.  Enthusiastic and makes Chemistry easy to understand for non-majors and leaves out anything too complicated.  If you need to take a Chem lecture, I recommend him.  Gives extra credit, and even if you're not good at tests [I'm not] you can still get an A or B if you show up and do all the work.

Dr. Sieve is the best! He really makes chemistry very simple and gives you a lot of practice problems to help you understand a subject. As long as you show up and actually try, you will easily get an A or B. Definitely take Sieve.

Dr. Sieve is a great teacher. I thought he made the material interesting. I was nervous about Chem because I didn't like it in high school. He does experiments that make class interesting and he gives extra credit and is very willing to help you out with everything. He's extremely nice. You learn a lot. I definitely recommend him.

he's a very nice, helpful prfessor. tests are difficult, but it's chemistry so it's gonna be hard. if you pay attention & go to class you can do really well. he gives extra credit for every test and usually there's a bonus question on them at well. he is very helpful in class and doesnt move on until he thinks the class understands what he's saying

easiest professor ever.  easy a if you attend and take notes.  he gives extra credit if you write papers to earn it.  his tests are easy if you know the material.  hell never ask you something that he didnt cover in lecture.  his "unannounced" quizzes are usually announced a couple days in advance.  take him.
Reads out of book, gives NOOOOO extra credits. His tests very unclear. However, easy to folow during the lesson.
This guy is awesome. He's really funny and he's able to relate well with students.  Tests are straightfoward and he does alot of demos in class which help break up the monotony.

Sieve is just an all around awesome professor. He really cares about his students and will do anything to help them out.  You can tell that he loves Chemistry by the way he presents his lectures, and does demo's throughout the semester.  His test are pretty much straight foward, and for the unannounced quizes-as long as you read what he tells you then you will be just fine :) If you are taking chemistry, I would seriously look into taking it from him
TAKE HIM.  HES VERY GOOD AT TEACHING AND IS FUN.  HIS PERSONALITY IS VERY EASY GOING WHICH MAKES HIM EASY TO TALK TO AND LEARN FROM.
oh my gosh, i just love him, he's very explanitory and easy to follow. as long as you go to class and/or keep up you will be fine. puts everything on blackboard. GREAT TEACHER. take him if you can.
I love this guy. If you suck at CHE like me, take him he's totally helpful and stuff

He is a very helpful professor, but I felt that the clarity was just not there. He made a lot of errors himself that the class had to correct, which was difficult for me to learn when he made mistakes teaching. He would tell us one thing, and then do it a different way. Just very confusing sometimes.  Very nice, but sometimes just very confusing.
REALLY REALLY good!

He is a great professor, really cares about his students and that they understand the material.  WHen I had him, I was in his office everyday asking him questions.  If you have to take a chemistry and you dont like it, take him..he makes class interesting
Great teacher. Tons of extra credit and he is always willing to help you. If you must take CHE take him

I took him for the lab, so there wasn't much teaching or lecture. We were suppose to have a quiz before each lab, but sometimes he wouldn't make us take them. He was pretty cool & a nice guy. Im not big on chemistry, but the lab was kinda interesting. You have to have a natural science w/ a lab for general studies, so I'd recommend this class.
Sieve is really laid back but he is still a pretty tough grader.
my favorite professor! the funniest teacher ever! extremely helpful and approachable.  makes class interesting.

Sieve is laid back and easy to listen to. Overall he teaches material well, but sometimes he gets caught up and has to correct himself, and he has a hard time spelling things. The class was extremely easy for me (easier than my high school Chemistry), but still interesting. He threatens to take attendance but rarely ever does.
All lectures, super funny, really cares about chemistry.

I heard that he's a great teacher in-class, but what ever you do don't take him online. His test are impossible not even close to a 100 level class.... also good luck teaching yourself too, cause the videos he post are no help at all. At least he gives plenty of assignments to bump up your failing test grades.
Okay professor. Not a very difficult class.

Quizzes and homework assignments were relevant to class work however the test and exams were so far from the class work it was almost impossible . The exam was only 45 questions and harder than the test, whatever you do don't take his class online.
Avoid at all costs!! Doesn't understand the material. Awful grading scale. Too picky with postlabs. DO NOT TAKE HIM.

There are four exams and final. He gives extra credit after each exam (up to 10 points). I missed like 6 classes and always came late to others. Have an A. That being said you do have to put in effort. It's chemistry. but whoever failed this class is because of their own work, not him. He loves chemistry. Online chpt homeworks were easy and help.
Brad is my dude. He is very nice but just seems so sad about everything. Do the work, care about the work, and really get to know him. Ask about he and his son's Halloween costumes.
Great lab professor! Although, you NEED to study and put in the work for the 2 lab exams. He is very caring and is extremely knowledgeable. He will always help you if you just ask.

Great lab teacher! Will help and wants you to understand. 1st week of each lab is exploratory,2nd is not. Be prepared for a lot of homework each week with prelab work and then lab reports- couple of hours each week. Reports suck- his grading is never quite clear.  Did bad on them but if you do well on prelab, tests, and lab book then you will do ok

By far the best teacher at NKU! I hate chemistry but I loved that class! I never dreaded his class.. He is very helpful, gives lots of extra credit and easy homeworks.. Tests are not very difficult if you pay attention either( I barely study) and have a 91% Take him, Take him, TAKE HIM! You won't regret it!
An excellent Professor. If you're taking Chemistry and know little about, this is the guy to learn it from. He explains concepts well.
Really chill relaxed guy in lab. terribly harsh grader and doesn't tell you what's going to be on lab exams.. Avoid if possible at least for Organic

Very hands on lab professor. Grading can be a little vague with random red pen marks with no explanation and points missing, but would have to work very hard to fail this class. Provides study guides for both exams. Readily available to answer questions during lab. Never takes all of lab time. Not a chem person, have an A. Take him!!!

One of my most favorite professors at NKU. Dr. Sieve is super easy to understand and if there are any questions, he can dumb it down for you to where it all makes perfect sense. Understanding students is like his superpower. Very non-judgemental and open-minded, so you always have a shot for a good grade (unlike with some other NKU profs).

An alright professor. Graded homework problems and quizzes for all chapters, 3 exams (200 points each), 4 one page papers (40 points each), 1 research paper (200 points), and a final (250 points). So ALOT of points, make sure to study, keep up with lectures and notes. Do all assignments and you will probably do fine. Overall, not hard but keep up.
The tests were somewhat difficult (or at least harder than I thought they would be), but not too bad, and when it became the end of the term, he offered a fair amount of extra credit to help out.

Very easy to follow, engaging, interesting.  Some people in my class didn't like him, just because they didn't like Chemistry.  I thought he was brilliant, gives a lot of extra credit, and his tests aren't all that hard.  He does give unannounced quizzes, so make sure you attend regularly.

Great Teacher!!!  If he taught any other math classes I would take him again.  He goes out of his way to make sure you understand which means you will get a good grade.  You don't have to show up but it is a math class so it is hard to pass if you don't.
Awesome teacher!!!  If math does not come easy to you, he is the man to take because he will help you understand and make sure you pass.  I would take him again.

AWESOME PROFESSOR! I loved Mr. Smith, he is so helpful and his tests are exactly as the quiz from the day before! if you know how to solve the quiz you are going to get an A on the test. I struggled with her exams in class, because she makes them go beyond what you study in class for the semester. Chem is not a super easy subject, but her exams are very tricky. She is very helpful if you need anything.

Professor Curtain is a great teacher.  I took his Math For Liberal Arts class and learned so much.  He's a very interesting professor and is great at teaching.  I recommend him to anyone and I would take him again if I could.  Warning:  It's not an 'Easy A' you do have to study and go to class.

Nice guy, a little in over his head. The class is kinda difficult, due to him and the material. He doesn't explain things well. You aren't required to do the h/w but if you do he doesn't help you go over it. Quizzes are every week and we had 3 exams and the final. The only grades he takes are the quizzes/tests
Dr. Curtain was a great professor, He made intro to Probability easy and interesting.  I highly recommend this professor for any math class.
His class is very interesting and he's animated about what he likes.  He makes sure you are studying things that really apply.
class was liberal math and i thought it was hard. his grading was very unfair.  beware of the tests because his grading is  jacked.
good teacher clear and understanding
Dr. Curtin made the class interesting. I thought his grading was fair, but you will have to do a little work.
I liked how he dropped in the history of particular concept in the middle of a lecture. A very helpful professor.
The best math professor I've ever had in school. Very intelligent, very interesting, highly recommend to anyone. Loved the course
He really loves math, I think sometimes a little too much. He was a reasonable teacher, I'm just not a fan of math.

I know the guy outside of class and he's a great person and he's a pretty good teacher, but the class was just simply...impossible. Don't take the class unless you absolutely have to for your major. Not his fault, but more of the material.

I liked Dr. Curtin, although I thought the first few weeks were totally confusing and pointless. I don't know if I would've done as well as I did if I had not taken Calculus 1 in high school before this class.

Curtin is an okay professor. I've had 3 classes with him, and I've gotten an A or B in each. He makes a lot of mistakes while lecturing which is confusing and what he teaches in class often doesn't really match the hw questions. Be prepared to learn with a friend in class and youtube. He grades hw for correctness (everyone uses Slader)

I don't know how you get to be as old as he does and still have the handwriting of a 1st grader. It's almost always illegible. Don't expect to be able to take notes based of off what he writes on the board.
Genuinely hilarious, and well-spoken in lecture. Tests and quizzes were difficult.

He's very passionate about math and that's great, but he seems to get so excited that he talks too fast for me to follow him sometimes and his hand writing is awful. He doesn't really do any examples or ask for questions during class, but you can go to him during office hours. He won't sit down with you though, just outline the solution for you.

I had Professor Curtin for Calc 1, and the only real complaint I have is how bad his handwriting is. You learn how to read it a few weeks in but it can still be off putting to take notes. I would still recommend.

Good professor, but it was Calculus 3. If you're in that class, you know what you're getting yourself in to. He didn't make it any harder than it needed to be, but he didn't make it any easier either. Really dry sense of humor, but he times it well. Pretty hilarious professor.

For MAT 329, homework, 15% of final grade, was due at the end of the week, every week. He normally had nothing but examples in class and discussion. We had 3 exams worth 20% of the final grade and the final worth 25%. He does not curve though as his goal is to have a fair test. I earned a 46% on the first exam and was still able to pass with a C.

Worst professor I have ever had. He doesn't explain, you can't read his handwriting. I am by no means stupid, I have taken and passed organic chem, but this makes organic look easy. I cant pass with a terrible professor. I withdrew.
Pretty freaking amazing. We'll all miss you, Curtin! One of the best professors I've ever had.
Never a dull moment when Curtin's around!
Nice guy, pretty chill, good prof overall bro
Great Professor, is always telling stories. If you do not show up you will not pass and make sure to do the homework.
Great professor. Clear concise lectures, and keeps it interesting.
I went to this professor for a problem that I had asked many people about, and he helped me to finally understand it.
Awesome.
Always kept class entertaining with his stories and jokes! I have no complaints about him at all! Really great professor and person!
He doesn't explain, only uses examples.

Good teacher overall.  Knows what he's talking about.  Tries to keep it interesting with math history throughout class.  Will go above and beyond to help you if you ask for the help. Gives plenty of examples. Would definitely recommend him.
Very good prof!

He is very kind and willing to help if you have a question. The biggest problem I had was that he does not post grades on blackboard. The class is difficult in general so some exams I didn't do that well on. A couple Cs and an A.
Nice and witty professor! Kept me entertained! Easy class. Just study a little and attend class. I would have done much better if I did the homework and didn't miss a couple quizzes.

Dr. Curtain is by far one of the top professors at NKU. He's great at giving examples. His tests are incredibly hard but he knows this and gives a lot of partial credit for just showing you know somewhat what your doing. Very smart guy and keeps the class interested every day

I wasn't looking forward to this class but this professor made things very clear and was forgiving on homework and tests. But holy hell his handwriting on the board is barely readable, so if you're taking notes, you better remember what he's saying as he writes, because you won't be able to read it!

One of the best professors Ive had at NKU.  Speaks loud and clear, explains everything in great detail.  Doesn't get frustrated at the slower students.  Makes sure everyone is on the same page before moving on. Keeps it entertaining and interactive.  Easy quizzes every week. Lenient grading. Assigns homework but does not have to be turned in.
If you need help ask for it,  he knows the subject well and he's good at teaching it but it will be hard! His tests are always based on the homework so make sure to review it beforehand
His tests were really hard.  He did not explain the material very well and was very boring.

This is class is a little confusing if you're not good at math. Collins is a nice guy, he's just really boring. Doesn't explain stuff all that well. Does this weird humming thing after every sentence he says and it gets annoying.
Very easy to understand and as long as you go to class and do the little bit of homework he assigns, its not hard to get an A or B
Really, really nice guy, but doesn't explain subject well enough.
He is a very nice guy but at times can be confusing/boring. As long as you go to class and attempt to pay attention you will be fine. Oh, and the humming thing is true - he does it all the time!

I was just thinking about this professor. I had him 2 yrs ago for STA 113. I am horrible at math. But he is very helpful!! You can go to him during office hours and he is always willing to help. He is very kind. One of the nicest here at NKU!Whoever said he's boring and can't keep your attention, he's not there to entertain you he's there to teach!

He was so helpful, and you can tell he is there for the students! He is kinda funny! If you pay attention in class and do the homework you would do fine. He is very fair and helps you whenever needed. sometimes unclear in explaining some topics but he tries his best to help you understand it.
Amazing professor. Highly recommended. Doesn't take attendance but it's necessary for a good grade. Laid back, funny and extremely helpful. Doesn't grade harshly at all!
great guy if you go to class you will do fine
He is such a cute old man!! he is an awesome math teacher and is actually pretty easy as long as you try. Take this class!
Very clear on subject, easy quizzes, homework not required to do, reviews alot before tests, answers all questions asked and will stay after class and help you understand.  TAKE HIM!!!

He is excellent.  He explains everything so clearly.  For someone who is Math illiterate like me, you need to take him.  The best Math grade I have ever received.  He has been so helpful and clear.  He is willing to help you out outside of class if extra help is needed!

Ideal professor. He's funny and helpful. You have to work at it, but it's easy to pull an A/B as long as you try. He is hilarious and really makes you want to come to class although it's not mandatory. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
Such an easy class, you get the formula sheet for the tests and quizzes.  Explains everything so well, he really loves math which makes it even better for us who don't.  Take him!
This teacher was not helpful. when asked for help outside of class didn,t go out of his way to help. I recommend taking someone else.

I was scared to take stats, but I am so happy that I chose to take it with this professor. He is amazing and so helpful. I cannot stand math but he made it bearable, and even interesting. NKU is lucky to have this professor; he truly cares about his students and wants them to succeed.
Great professor! He genuinely cares about all of his students. As long as you show up on a regular basis, you will be fine.

He is a nice guy, that is under no dispute. However I did not find him very helpful. i have always been great at math and this class confused me. Days in class consisted of numbers being put up on the board but no explanation. He talks to students as if we know things ahead of time instead of teaching them to us. Do not suggest taking.

He knows what he's talking about, but can sometimes be hard to follow. He can be boring at times, but it's the material. Make sure you listen in class and take some notes. I barely ever did homework and still got a B.

He is a great teacher, even though he doesn't explain the theorems behind the math, he explains how to do problems very well, truely cares about his students and willing to help out a lot. Please take himif you can
very, very boring. and he makes a weird noise in his throat after he stops talking. i did not enjoy this class.
I like this guy. Explains things well. Not too much homework. Very relaxed. Fairly short tests. Structured routine.
If you like professors that are laidback, you should take. Sometimes a little boring, but overall a really good guy
Boring!  I fell asleep through every lesson.  Sometimes he went over lessons repeatedly, and I felt as though I shouldn't have even gone to class.
Good class.  Fairly easy not a lot of homework at all.  Boring but then again it is math.
Prof. Collins is a good guy, Very laidback.  I would recommend taking his classes.  Just study before all of the tests and quizzes.  He doesn't collect homework.
I do not recommend this guy for this class.  It sucked bad, and he was kind of a jerk. His homework and reviews did nothing for the tests.
If your not good at math, i suggest taking him because he would go out of his way to help you.
Good guy who will help you out.  He lets you use note cards on tests.

This class was HORRIBLE but he is a nice guy. Dont know what all these other people are talking about but he always takes up home work and the test are hard and different from the study guides. I took this thinking it would be easy an its the worst class ive ever takin, would have rather took calc an i hate math.

I enjoyed having Collins as a professor!! He was very nice, and lenient.  You could turn in missed homework ANY time and it won't be considered late.  His tests are pretty easy, as long as you do the study guide and study from it.  I would definitely recommend him as a professor.

This class is rather annoying, because there are too many stupid people taking it. He explains everything way too much. By this time most people should know most of the stuff in this course. The good side homework is extremely easy and takes like.. 5 mins maybe.

Doesn't explain how to correctly work the problems...doesn't explain much of anything. The homework is easy because he just checks to see if you did it. He prefers string and chalk to a ruler, and refers to the Greek symbol Phi as "fee". His arm twitches uncontrollably. Three difficult tests, plus a term paper/oral report...yes, for a math class.

A very kind, helpful, easygoing professor that bears a striking resemblence in appearance and speech to Sean Connery. (NO JOKE!!) Accepts homework late and gives full credit. His exams aren't a joke, but they aren't overly difficult. He must put a lot of effort into making exams fair. If you have a question this guy knows his stuff very well.
I personally feel he was very boring, i was unable to make it through his class. If i paid attention i fell asleep so i had a hard time. Nice guy, but just couldnt keep my attention.

He is a total math geek!  Absolutely my favorite prof. this year.  Tests are difficult but partial credit is given.  homework every other class, and will accept for full credit.  I took him in high school and sought him out for this class.  EXCELLENT TEACHER HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Professor is half blind, and is bad at responding to questions. The examples on the board are written in chicken scratch and if you want him to go over a specific part again, he probably won't. Doesn't like to help, and just assumes you know what he's talking about. I found the class extremely hard.

He doesn't collect the homework, but in order to do well in the class it is really essential that you do it. He does care about his students, and is very willing to help during his office hours. He gives a lot of partial credit when grading tests and quizzes.

In his class right now. You have to go to class to understand the material. He's not exactly a bad professor, but he gets distracted very easily, and can't see anybody in the back of the room. Quizzes at least once a week. Pay attention and do your homework and you should be fine.

I honestly don't think the class itself was hard I just think he could've done a better job teaching. You definitely should show up to class. He's a really nice man and he will help you if you ask but the help isn't exactly helpful...

The class itself is not complicated if you have a good professor, but professor Collins is not helpful. His lectures consist of him writing examples on the board, not explaining them, and expecting you to simply understand his process.

Do the homework and you'll do fine in his class. He's always willing to go over the problems from the homework the next day before you turn it in. Ask questions, don't be afraid of being judged by other students. Majority of the time, someone else wanted to ask it but was too insecure. Put forth the effort and you'll get a great return from him.

He is not very helpful when it comes to answering questions. He doesn't even really teach. He just puts examples on the board and expects us to know how he got the answer. He's very rude and isn't consistent with grading. He'll take points off for one person's wrong answer but not another's. It's very annoying.

I'm having him right now for MAT114. I'd say he gets you loss very easy. He just gives examples and ask the class if they have any questions. But how can anyone ask if they are loss in the first place? All homework are online. The practice problems are not graded. There're a lot of content than you think. But he is a nice old man to talk to.

I took this class for maybe two months this semester and had to drop it. His teaching style is very confusing, he often gets lost or makes mistakes while he's trying to explain problems  to the class and if he can't keep up with them I'm not sure how we are supposed to.

I LOVE professor Collins. I think he is such a sweet guy and genuinely cares about his students' success. His lectures can sometimes get confusing, but he is happy to answer questions. Definitely show up to class though bc you'll miss a lot if you miss a class session. This class is especially easy if you've taken algebra before!

Mr. Collins is a fantastic teacher, as a matter of fact I just registered for another one of his classes. If you honestly put forth the effort you will do great in this class. The thing that I love the most about him is that he teaches the material, tells you what homework problems to do, and then at the beginning of every class he goes over it!
Terrible teacher doesnt know what hes talking about teaches things so difficult expects you to know what he does
Really good at explaining things, always willing to go the pace you need to go
He is a nice person but a terrible professor. If you skip class or do not do the homework, you won't pass.

He's an awesome teacher, really straight forward and explains everything well. Quiz every Thursday plus two exams and final. Will go over anything you need, understanding about missing class -if you know you'll miss a quiz day you can schedule it ahead of time. Helpful, clear. Take him!

He is very nice, without a doubt. Had MWF classes, quiz every Friday. 13 quizzes but he only takes the 10 best. ONLY grades are the 10 quizzes, 2 exams and a final. Doing the homework isn't mandatory but it helps. No make up quizzes. He can be hard to follow at times, but he is always willing to explain more; if you ask! Decent teacher.
He is nice. 3 tests and a Final test total. Not too difficeult. And have homework every section which count points.

He is a nice guy. However, he did not explain the material very well. I am great at math but this class really confused me. He just put numbers in the board but without explanations. He talks to us like if we already knew things  if ahead of time instead of teaching them. I do not suggest taking his class if you want to pass and get good grades.

DO NOT TAKE. I loved Math in high school. Have always been good at it. This guy does not teach well. He expects you to know everything already. Not good at explaining. Each homework assignment is only worth 5 points. 3 tests and a comprehensive final.

He is a great professor. He knows what he's talking about. You just have to attend the classes and I'm sure that you'll be in a good shape. He gives a plenty of Extra credit. I even got an A in his class. Must take

Goes over homework and calls that a class, if I wanted to go over homework I would go to the tutor.  Doesn't respond well if questions are asked.  Doesn't care.  The book is authored by him and is terrible, 3 pages of errata.
Very nice guy, but is a terrible teacher. Doesn't explain anything and assumes everyone knows exactly what is going on. I failed this semester and have to retake calc again next year.

Overall, he's not that bad of a teacher. But, if you want to pass, you have to study A LOT! And you have to come to class! Especially on the end of the week for his weekly quizzes. He goes over everything in class if you really do need help, and is really friendly, but you really need to concentrate on the subject and actually study!

Collins is a easy-going guy who knows his Math very well. He'll always go over any problem with you and do his best to explain it. He gives a 10 point quiz EVERY end of the week, so be prepared. Other than that, it's all about how much studying and effort you put into learning the material.

Terrible class. He does not teach well at all.  All he does is go over homework in class and does not spend time teaching at all.  Worst professor I've had so far.  If you're good at teaching yourself the material then this is the class for you.
He class was honestly terrible. I never understood what he was trying to teach and mainly wanted you to learn from the things he posted online.

I attended nearly every single class and went to tutoring twice a week for two months... I still failed his class. I had no clue what he was talking about the entire class. He doesnt respond to emails, and if you ask him a question in class he makes you feel stupid for asking. BC I was using my GI bill, I couldnt drop the class :(
Good Professor. Good at explaining things. If you dont understand something, he will gladly answer in class. Test's are based off of material from the homework.

He is NOT easy. I was so confused half the time. His formula sheet did not make since to me. I attended every class and still struggled greatly. Do not take him if you have the chance to switch, DO IT

This class is NOT easy and he is NOT a easy grader. I attended every class and barely passed.. literally by a couple points. He is a nice man but his teachinhg is not great. I was always confused and his formula sheet did not help one bit. Swich if you can.

Collins is a good teacher! Be sure to pay attention during class and do the homework and you will be good! You go over homework each class and get a quiz every friday! Your homework  has everything the quizzes are over and if you don't understand you can ask during class and he will love to help! Gives 3 extra quizzes to replace lowest quiz grades!

If you're not good at math, I don't recommend him. Assumes you know what he is talking about at all times. All homeworks from the section can be turned in anytime before the test, but don't let yourself fall behind because it's easy to just push all the homeworks aside until the last minute. Does not curve tests or give extra credit whatsoever.

Collins is the worst professor. He writes everything in cursive so if you were born after 1998, dont take him because we were not taught cursive. He also doesnt really teach and expects you to know everything. I still have not received my final test grade and its been almost two semesters. He takes easy content and makes it IMPOSSIBLE to learn.

Mike is an amazing professor who cares about his students, unless they are late. Lectures are long and information filled but he does a good job of segmenting it to keep your attention. Some people don't like the way he goes through problems, but I like watching someone do an example instead of baby-stepping us through the. Highly recommend.
math for liberal arts is a hard class, let alone his teaching. He isn't very helpful and doesn't explain it in terms for non-math smart students. Hated this class avoid if at all possible
Do not take him. He cant teach. He doesnt know how to explain things and if you dont get it your screwed. AVOID TAKING HIM.

He was the worst professor that I have ever had.  I have never failed any class, and I failed his, dispite the fact that I was tutored at NKU and I did all homework and never skipped a class.  He wouldn't help before/during/after class, he seemed to resent teaching a liberal arts math course, he was disrespectful if you asked a "?" DON'T TAKE HIM!

I HATED this class. I am probably not going to pass. He does not explain things well at all. He has all of the homework submitted online so that you can not turn anything in on paper and find out what you are doing wrong. Assigns homework to be due over weekends and holiday breaks. Tests are hard. Avoid taking him if at all possible. Not very good

I absolutely love him. He is very awkward, has a dry sense of humor, only a few people get his jokes. i find him very funny. harsh grader, he doesnt really understand people's questions, n doesnt explain well, but hey i'm a math major, what can i say? if u're too, then u should take his class, it will be a lot of FUN

I would highly suggest avoiding him for calculus. The man is absolutely horrible at teaching, gives tons of easy examples in class then on the exams ask extremely complicated questions. Also, gives way to much online homework so you have to do that all the time. Furthermore, I should of gotten a B in the course and he gave me a C. DONT TAKE HIM!!!

found him a very good teacher who seemed to care if a student passed or not, gave most who were struggling a chance to improve their grade, even offered test rebates for points missed on tests. Enjoyed his class and found him to be a very nice guy who was easy to talk to.

Great teacher. Explains all questions well and will be more than willing to help  u if u have an IQ over 5. He has trouble dumbing down his examples when the student can't figure out the problem 49-x=48. Needless to say he can help you if you aren't an idiot. Besides, with the class being Math for the Liberal Arts, if u cant pass this good luck bud

When I took Krug's class-it made complete sense compared to my last Math professor.  Go over your notes and a few times outside of class a week and you'll be fine.  Tests are short but worth 10 points each.  He keeps your 5 best tests and drop 3 of your worst quizzes.  I recommend him.

His textbook use is very low & sometimes I would have to go to the book to explain what he was saying. I don't recommend taking him unless you have a lot of time to spend intepreting his lectures. He spends too much time on approximations and not enough time on solid calculus concepts. We breezed over continuity & spent days on riemann sums.

He is a very hard teacher. He gives alot of homework on line. I did great with the online homework but did poorly on every test. He did drop the lowest test grade. He let us do math corrections on one test and averaged the two to get a better grade. If you can find a better cal teacher then do it.

Wonderful teacher.  Loves math and loves to explore it with interested learners.  Very logical.  Knows lots of dumb math jokes.  Able to instruct a wide range of intelligences.  Programs his own lesson tools, so he never gets bogged down by tech issues.  Lots of good study tools.  Online homework system is convenient, and has notes built in.

He is a nice enough guy but a little condescending sometimes.  He expected a 100-level class to write a 10-20 page paper about a math subject, despite the fact that such a large paper requires more knowledge than the average student possesses.  The rest of the class isn't hard, but he posts quizzes to blackboard without bothering to tell anyone.

I will admit that he may know a great deal about mathematics but his ability to actually teach is lacking very much. All of his homework is online which is absolutely ridiculous. It makes a 10 minute assignment take hours.

He seems to be a very knowledgeable man but I struggled having him as a professor (it might have been just me). I didn't like the class because I do not like computer programming but if you work hard it won't be the worst thing you've ever had to do. Good luck!

I know that this is the baby math class, but some of the material presented was honestly too difficult for me.  (Seriously, he made us do calculus.) However, he grades super easy, and drops a lot of the lower grades.  I feel like I got a lot out of this class.  Even though I struggled, I got a high A.  If you're bad at math, take his class.

Thankfully I have a natural affinity for using Mathematica, because I sat in class and watched everyone else struggle to keep up. Dr Krug knows what he is doing, but he has a difficult time relaying that knowledge to his students. You'll need to spend a lot of time outside class on this stuff if you don't have a mind for programming.
pretty cool.  easy.  not much effort invovled and will help if you need it.  not afraid of questions.  boring though.
Most boring class of my life and a very dry speaker.
I thought he was a good, fun professor. I didn't have much trouble in his class at all. I just did the homework and passed his class with a B. Didn't have to study much at all.
BORING BORING BORING!!!! If you don't do well with boring professors, avoid this class!! Doesn't try to make things interesting in the least.

He can be a dry speaker, but he has a dry sense of humor, which I found funny.  Class isn't hard at all; only have homework once a week and are allowed a "cheat sheet" during the exams. He can be a boring professor, but compared to theatre professors, most other professors are.
This was the worst class I have ever taken in my life! You basically learn a harder way to prove easy concepts.  Do yourself a favor and avoid Dr. Krug...

A good guy.  I am dreadful at Math.  I worked my ass off in this class, found him very helpful, if a little off the wall.  Very dry sense of humor and a bit of a nerd, but overall a super guy.  I got an A which was down to hard work and paying attention.  I'd recommend him, and just learn to smile at his jokes.
Lackluster speaker who gets very boring.  Material is pretty easy so the course is not too hard.  Requires a project at the end of the class - ick -.  OK teacher, but he could improve.
Great at explaining things.  Some of his test questions come out of left field but mostly clear and easy to follow.
No such think as a "cheat Sheet" for his exams. Doesn't explain things well, when asked to explain a concept over again, he will explain it in a different way... Very confusing class.

A nice guy, homework not graded, math projects, many of the test questions are out of left field.  If you are a Math major he will be a good teacher, but if you are just filling a course requirement "Do Not Take" He explains and tests for Math in an abstract way.  Which is great if you are a Math major and sucks if you're major is anything else.
This class was difficult and I am a math major. He is not a bad professor but I needed more help in this class.
did not enjoy class. I could not understand anything becuase he went way to fast. I had to drop class, Professor talks low, but seems nice... He doesn't curve or extra credit.

He is the worst teacher ive ever had. I have never received anything below and A in and a math class. I almost didnt pass. It is a waste of time. He goes over everything in class but if u ask him questions u are considered a retard

Probably the worst teacher I've ever had.  He doesn't actually teach the class just rambles on at the bored and expects you to know how to do it.  Would definitely recommend not taking him, unless you want to try teaching yourself calculus terms.

he explained concepts and offered help after class. but after class he would not really help, just re-word the question.  if you asked a question in class you would have to ask multiple times until he understood. harsh grader on test but at least you would learn must of the material.
very hard to understand and he now goes by amiee

Prof. Krug goes over a lot of examples and then will you ask you to complete the same exact thing on a quiz. If you pay attention and take notes, the class is pretty easy. SHE DOESN'T ASSIGN HOMEWORK OUT OF THE BOOK OR ONLINE. She is also very helpful and super nice
Should not be teaching a statistics class if you aren't a statistician. Give quizzes on things we barely covered. Not very knowledgeable or clear on examples of problems.

Hardest teacher to understand, very confusing, quizzes are worth 50 points and given every other week if not weekly, does not answer questions, buying the book is a waste of money it does not even go with the material, talks very quite, grades very hard, I do NOT recommend Professor Krug at all.

I love Dr Krug. She is so nice and always willing to help me with anything outside of class, her door is always open. I think her mathematica class is soooooo easy but I do like programming.   She's great! I really feel like she cares and wants to help me learn.

She's very, very quiet and almost impossible to hear at times. It was her first time teaching the class so she really didn't have any idea what she was doing. She's nice though and is only trying to help you pass.
Dr . Krug was, for me, an awful professor. She moved at her own pace and wouldn't explain the material to the extent students needed.

Dr. Krug may not be the most outgoing professor, but she's quite nice and even jokes sometimes. Plus she invited our Calc I class to participate in math events on campus. Instead of the pricey book, she used a free online text. One warning: she usually talks pretty softly, so try not to sit in the back.

Professor Krug is very sweet but i would not have her again if i had a choice. when you ask questions, she is not very good at answering them. she is also a very hard grader. i failed her mid term twice because i solved a problem a different way than she did even though we both got the same answer.  all you do in this class is play games.

Krugs class is very easy as long as you show up to class. You can use your notes on everything you do in class including your midterm and final. I had one homework assignment, midterm, and final and no other tests. Very easy math class if you normally aren't good at math. Easy A.

Professor Krug was not a very great professor. If you aren't very good at math and need thorough explanations, do not take it with her. There is no text book, but there is online homework. There are only two tests during the semester and then there is a final. I would not take a class with her again.
If you participate/ask questions in class and study your notes, you will get a good grade in her class. Always be respectful and she will be extremely nice.
This class is mostly puzzles. There is very little math invloved and it just sucks.
The way she explains the concepts can be confusing at times and it is difficult to do the material on your own so definitely ask for help if you need it. She is better at one-on-one.

With the utmost respect, she should be fired. Has no ability to explain what she is trying to say and tests you on material she has not covered. This class has easy content, but she should not be teaching it.
Horrible professor. Content on test doesnt reflect the lectures and her explanations are incoherent. No textbook menas the lectures mean everything and they are not enough. Don't take her.
Very smart and helpful. Some lectures can get confusing but she we always help you out!

Graded by few things. Doesn't explain things well. The midterm was only two questions, the final was four. She's nice tho. There is a final exam, project, and paper

Dr. Krug was really good at teaching Calculus A. She used a free textbook found on the Internet. Everything for this class was free (besides paper and a calculator). I would recommend getting a lot of paper because you will most likely have nightly homework. Make sure you get a seat in the front of class so you can hear her as she is very quiet.
She's confusing because she doesn't know how to explain things well. Her personality is good but her verbal skill is not.

I don't think I ever had a professor that helped me more than Dr. Krug. Somewhat difficult to talk to, but she greatly helped when it came to doing Calculus. Gave the class plenty of practice. Be prepared to study though, because her tests not easy if you don't understand the material. Also, all materials were free.

With all respect, Ive never had a bad experience at NKU until I took this class. The whole class doesnt pay attention and they talk over her the whole time because she speaks too quietly. Grades harder than any teacher Ive ever had and even gave me points off my tests when I had the exact same right answers as the people next to me.

Sure shes a nice person, but she grades papers how she wants to grade them. Even if you have the correct answer, if you dont show the work the exact way she wants it to be shown it will get counted wrong. I suggest not taking this class.

Im a math major and have never struggled so much with a course and not received adequate help to be successful. I would go to office hours and left still confused. I would work a problem and go into her office multiple times for 1 problem. I would be completely lost and she could clearly see that from my grades but I still wouldnt get much help.

He has a very serious sort of teaching technique. He comes to class prepared, always has everything graded on time, and almost always knows what he is going to say before he gets there. He has tough tests, so be prepared for those. Also, he tends to be a pretty tough grader. I would recommend him to any chemistry student.

Took him for 120 lab. He likes to talk for an hour, which sucks. He helps when you need it, but is a hard grader.  The two exams that there are extremely difficult. Got a C overall. Dry sense of humor, Emails back promptly.
he is helpful if you ask
Extremely rude! Unclear about assignments and disrespectful to everyone.
Went at a good rate didnt go over things well expected too much
Very helpful and always e-mails back promptly, but is a hard grader and exams are difficult.  You will learn a lot from him though.  Nice guy, very polite if he knows you really are trying.

He can be a little dry in lectures, but he is great in lab.  He can be verry funny in a dry, subtle sort of way.  He can be a little on the hard side, but I learned a great deal from him and would definitely take him for another lab.

Better get your no doz in bulk he is so bad he just just so dry and can't explain without leaving steps out of the problem oh he is a sad man very mopey in his body language feel he is very unconfortable being in front of the class and absolutely hates questions

Quizzes and tests are extremely difficult but he will do anything in his power to help you out, including prolonging his office hours.  He really cares about his students.  Great guy, great professor.
one word... HORRIBLE... very boring, hard to follow, not doesn't get in to the lectures at all... when you go to get help he confuses you even more..
Great professor, wonderful sense of humor once you realize that he is being sarcastic! Grades very fairly and gives help if you need it.

he is a great teacher, who takes an interest in his students. he is not an easy A.... but you will learn in his class and he goes way above and beyond to help his students. i would recommend him for anyone in pre-professional fields.

Very good teacher who is willing to do anything to help students pass with good grades, includes extra credit, help sessions, office time...If you are serious about chemistry I highly recommend Dr. Niewahner
I hated him.  Take Bloss he is the best intro chem teacher.  Neiwahner isn't that bad but he is boring as hell. I switched to Bloss's class and I have an A in chemistry this semester.

Good teacher.  He's pretty tough, but its supposed to be that way.  If you do well in his class, you pretty well know you can handle being a chem/bio major.

I had him for lab.  Thought he was great!!!  Heard bad thing about his lecture class but I can't say anything bad about him.  He was very helpful and GREAT sense of humor (if you know where he's coming from)  Show some respect and you will get some in return!!!!!

Organic Chem is always hard. Expect to study a lot. I had him for lab. He's helpful when you need him, otherwise he just lets you work on your own. His humor is dry, but for a Chemistry teacher, I thought he was pretty approachable.

Had him for lecture and lab.  Does not curve tests or final grade.  Organic is really hard, but I think he could have done a better job at explaining it and he is hard to hear sometimes.  Nice guy, just not for me as a professor.

HORRIBLE prof... It is true, he is extremely rude! I saw him 3 times screaming a student. He is very unclear about assignments and disrespectful to everyone...  Very unfair grader. Don't dare to make a mistake while responding his questions during his lectures or you will be humiliated in front of the class. Dr. Ball is the best for che 121L

Good professor.  Extremely nice.  He teaches well but grades very hard. He will take 5 points off for a decimal placement.  Exams are also very hard.  He is very helpful though.  I recommend but make sure assignments are well done and exact

Not very helpful when asked questions, he will make you feel stupid. Very difficult to understand, and does not explain lab procedures very well. Overall horrible communication and teaching skill. Would not recommend.

He's a good teacher. the only problem is he likes to explain too much before labs.But he grades pretty good. Aint that picky with reports. Just as long as you fill out your lab book. Dr. Blewett is the best.  He lets students email him, call him (at his home), or will come in to help students.  His explinations are sometimes a little complicated but like he told me "Its chemistry its not supposed to be easy"  Ive seen him come early and stay late with students and accepts reports way after their due date. Tests are hard.

Nice guy, but I always found him a little awkward. Will help you if you ask for it, and yes he doesn't mind if you call his house. Grades pretty fairly. The lectures at the beggining of his labs are long and very boring.

Really good guy. Lab is easy and he will answer any questions you have. Tests not hard at all.

Do not make a single mistake or you'll get your head ripped off.  Be sure to not ask any "stupid" questions.  He seems to have a short temper and no tolerance for ignorance at all.  He needs to chill, not all of us have had Labs before, not all of us are chem. majors and not all of us are perfect.  He settles for nothing less than perfection.

he grades really hard and doesnt give you a break for anything.  it almost seems like he gets off on embarassing people publicly.   hes extremely rude and plays favorites.  not a good professor if your not a chemistry genius

He assigns no pre-lab, no formal lab reports, and is fair with his grading, though very picky.  He gets frustrated if you ask a question and don't understand him the first time. very easy professor, explains things very well.  extremely picky grader, but he also doesn't expect much work out of you compared to other professors.  can be a smartalleck when you ask "silly" questions or don't understand something.
