Great teacher and person.  Will help you if you put forth the effort to help yourself first.  No surprises on tests, in fact material easier on tests than reviews.  Gives take-home quizzes. Good teacher to have if you struggle in Math!
Jan is a great teacher.  You earn your grade, she is very fair and quite patient. If you are not a great math person I would recommend taking her, you'll get through and you will not feel stupid.

Worst teacher ever! Not kidding-very very negative. Does not care how hard you try, acts like she is the only one that has a life outside of class. Just wrong for a 95 or 99 teacher-made me what to drop out, before I even got started. WORST TEACHER EVER! period.
Really Great Teacher!!!

very helpful. Talks to/ Treats the class as if we aer younger than we are. But I needed that. She stayed on top of everyones grades and let you know frequently what grade you had. Very helpful. gave partial credit everywhere she could. Takes attendance. Lovely woman. I'm taking her again.

the material covered in class was nothing like what was on the test.  She was very rude and only helped you if she liked you.

The best Math teacher I've ever had. Worst Teacher for Math!.. If you are really trying to learn the subject and Not worry about getting a Bad Grade! Absolutly do not take her!! She does have a problem with not making eye contact and when she talks she speaks in a monotone voice. Doesn't care about the well being of her students. She encouraged several students to withdrawl. Do not take her!! You will be miserable!

this is a great teacher.  she is very helpful and available and clear in hre explanations.

Assigns too much homework, a good 60+ questions a night. Talks in monotone, and says Mmm'kay a lot, like Mr. Mackey. Gives tests on Mondays. Test questions aren't clear on which methods you should use. Changes the assignments on the syllabus.
great teacher.  explains throughly.  willing to meet outside of class.  answers questions without you feeling stupid.  if you get the chance take her...

She is GREAT! I had her for Math 095 and went to a differnet teacher the next semester and had to drop it and sign back up with her! Explains thoroughly, and shows different ways of understanding through the book and outside the book. Will help with which ever works best for you! Love her!!!

The best math teacher I have ever had, she was able to explain material to me I never understood, she is always willing to help and always returns emails.  I highly recommend her!

not a bad guy, he gives you plenty of opportunities for points with weekly quizzes or papers. i crammed the night before every test and got A's. attendance isnt mandatory, but often times his notes are confusing so its a good idea to go to class, also he explains the subject fairly well. come to class + study here and there = easy B
He is awesome in lecture.
Great teacher, easy to follow and very personable and helpful

Dr. Thompson is a great teacher! He makes things very clear and is very will to help when you ask him for help. I ended up switching majors because Biology was not for me but this guy is a great teacher!

He posts power points online so attendance isn't mandatory, but it's a good idea to go because he explains the topics in great detail.  Tests are tough, EVERYTHING on the power points is fair game, hard but possible to get an A.
he is funny

I have taken this professor for BIO 150 and 151. He explains things very well. Although he posts his notes online, going to the lecture is a good idea. The material is somwhat hard, but if you go to class and pay attention, he will make it easy to understand. Only problem: he tends not to be in his office during office hours.

Dr. Thompson is an awesome professor.  His style of lecturing provides for a great learning atmosphere, and he makes me want to come to class.  I normally do not enjoy Biology, but I enjoyed this class a lot.  He posts his notes online, but I would recommend coming to class to grasp concepts fully.  Very capable of passing with an A or high B.

Thompson was one heck of a Lab Professor. He's really laid back and funny. Definitely gets along with the class, really tries to connect with everyone. His quizzes are super easy, make sure to flip through the lab book before you take it. It isn't bad though. As for the exams, definitely take good notes because he changes it up on the questions.

Great prof. He really knows his stuff. I took him for BIO 150 and 151 and both classes were awesome. Attendance is not taken but its a good idea to attend class because there is a lot of material on exams. He really enjoys biology and he is funny. He can really relate to his students.

He makes lecture more interesting with videos and stories.  Nice guy, but too scattered for me.  Put material on an exam that wasn't supposed to be there, slow at grading, etc.  His tests are a mix of really easy questions and random ones you would never think to study.  Overall, fine class, but I feel like I learned more from Geismann.
Pretty good in lab, funny too.  Willing to help but sometimes he's hard to find, even during office hours. Doesn't always reply to e-mails.

Great lab professor! He is very clear when teaching the material. He is attractive & funny so class is more interesting. Study over the lab manual b4 lab & the quizes will be easy. Lab exams are a bit harder but easy if you study & know the formulas. I got an A but I also studied for every quiz. The lab write ups are easy, I got a 100% on both.
Great professor, both for lab and lecture.  Funny, connects well with the class.  Really knows his stuff.  Very helpful.

Awesome guy, very funny, very smart. Exams are very hard, but that's to be expected with BIO. I looked forward to every class, makes BIO fun. However, you live and die by the test. Very few assignments, and wont effect your grade very much at all. But with 70-90 students its understood.

Although his class is very interesting and usually not boring; his exams are very hard. If you take him you better read the book because his exams go way more in depth then he does in the notes he gave in class and on his powerpoint.
He's probably one of my favorite professors this semester. He's funny, and i liked when he busted out his guitar and started serenaded us with his songs of DNA...

Great teacher. He was always trying to get us to be interactive, and honestly it made us learn the material better. He posts powerpoints that are very helpful and it always open to help explain something if you don't understand. Take his class!

Absolutely a great teacher. He pretty much gives you all you need to pass in his powerpoints, but he does cover the material well in class so show up and it will reflect on your grade. I made sure to get him for BIO151. Connects well with the class and doesn't require you to learn obscure, meaningless information.
Good teacher, everything you need for the tests is in the powerpoints.  Dont even need to buy the book unless you really want to.
I definitely recommend Dr. Thompson!!! He explains things very clearly and is very helpful. He is also very funny and laid-back. I loved it when he played his guitar and sang Biology parody songs! :D

Great professor! Funny, easy to talk to and ask questions. Access to powerpoints- lectures and tests over powerpoint material. Tests based on what he goes over- have access to study guides and practice tests. Course is test based. Also great for lab! Will definitely be getting him for next semester for both lab and lecture!

Dr. Thompson is sometimes difficult to understand because he may not explain everything thoroughly, but if you ask questions, he will definitely be more than willing to answer to the best of his ability!

Dr. Thompson is an extremely nice and interesting professor.  He usually emphasizes the structures that you need to know and will go through them with you in detail if you ask him.  The course is a lot of brute memorization, but pays off for anyone going into medical related fields.  I recommend the course, just be prepared to study.
He makes lab extremely easy and even fun. His exams are easy as long as you have a general knowledge of what was covered in previous labs. Very easy and very good professor!

Great professor. He creates outlines so you don't have to write so much while you're trying to listen. He explains concepts so you can understand them.He's down to earth and very helpful. He gives you the tools to succeed, but you have to do the work.
He's a good teacher.  He jst gets off subject a lot in class and i had a hard time staying focused b/c of this.  I mean he sang to us during lecture...
Very helpful if you are confused or having trouble in class.  Easy to understand and explains content well.  And not to mention easy on the eyes....which is always a plus
He's nice but when it comes to explainging things and answering questions....well he simply doesn't.  He just avoids the questions

He is a nice guy, but a terrible professor!  I got nothing out of his lectures!  Anytime someone asked a question it was always answered with "I'll get to that a little later" and then never even answered it!  Posts notes on blackboard but are only partial to get you to show up!  Few written essays and test and quizes on blackboard!

Great Professor; actually has a personality.  Always there to answer any questions or concerns about Biology.  Tests are straight from his notes and finals are straight from his tests.  Great class and professor; highly recommend.
Fairly easy just go to class or you will get lost.

Very effective teacher. Lectures from powerpoint yet follows straight from the book. Gives many examples and explains thouroughly. Tests are straight from his notes. If you miss class, you can always read the chapter to get the gist but if you come to class and study a bit you should have no problem getting an A.

He is a decent teacher, pretty good lectures with lots of examples and he has a good personality, but his class is so hard. The only grades you get are your exam scores and they cover huge sections of material at a time. No opportunities to bring up your grade. This class requires a lot of work if you want a halfway decent grade.

Great Lecturer, definately keeps you interested.  But tests cover 7-9 chapters at a time, a lot of material with only 50 questions.  Very difficult to bring up grade if you fall behind, no quizzes..3 tests and an exam. Very helpful though if you ask.
easy I got an a on every exam including a 100 on the first one.

Great professor!  Show up for class!!  He explains very well and will answer ANY questions.  Only problem I had was that one person that took way to much of our class time asking questions and he would answer every one of them, instead of saying see me after class if you don't understand. he would be repeating what he just said...PAY ATTENTION!!
Excellent, took the same biology from high school and taught it so much better.  He's funny makes the material easy to learn, take notes and listen, you'll do fine.
Very helpful and easy to understand.
He is a good teacher. Make sure you go to lecture!

He's a real nice guy. Lectures are very detailed so you really should attend class (I didn't and I kick myself in the butt for it) Read your chapters as the exam covers 6-7 chapters at once with only 50 questions so they are tough. Puts outlines and powerpoints on Blackboard. Couldn't answer questions at times...he beat around the bush.
It was bad experience

Was more helpful than any other professor and a better advisor than the one I was given. anyone who had a bad experience with this professor must have been just difficult themselves. Nobody is more approachable and patient.

Dr. Thompson is the best professor I ever had. He's funny and makes the class more interesting by his jokes. He also does well on explaining the materials. If you go to the lecture regularly and focus on his lecture well, you'll pass.
Pretty clear in explaining confusing biological mechanisms....

If your unsure about a bio major... DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. Its a weed out class for bio majors, it's incredibly difficult and you never are really sure of the content. Thompson does a poor job of explaining clearly what things are or how they work. Only good thing was that he posts his PowerPoints on blackboard, but your on your own for all.

Dr. Thompson was an amazing professor. I realized this after the semester was completed, but I see now that everything he said and did was for the benefit of the students. Dr. Thompson seems to really have a passion for teaching, and not only that, but he loves to see students learn and grow as individuals. I highly recommend taking his classes!!!

He's a great professor who really knows his biology, and he also knows how to teach it. However, this biology course is very in depth, so it will take time out of class to really understand it. This is not a class for people that don't like biology, but if you find it interesting, you'll learn a lot from Thompson, and it will be fun.
Awesome teacher and funny guy.

He is a very great person as well as a great professor. He explains things thoroughly and will answer your questions in depth. He gives in class worksheets that you can work on with classmates, they are very helpful when studying. His exams are multiple choice and there are no surprises. Go to class, do your sapling, and study and you will pass.
Not too easy, but its a hard subject and he teaches it well

Had Thompson for BIO 150, 151, and 151 L. Pretty easy grader, class isn't any harder than it needs to be. He's a really cool guy. Makes jokes in class and I always looked forward to his class! Gives small in class assignments that aren't hard at all. Lab is pretty hard but it's a hard course.

There really isn't a need to go to lecture (unless you want to fulfill participation points).  Keep all of the exams because the final is a copy/paste job - no new questions on it except for the last three weeks of lecture.
Dr.Thompson was a great professor and made the class very easy. All exams were super easy and he gave us very detailed study guides. I would recommend him to anyone and I plan on taking him again!

I took this class as an 8AM summer course, and while that was a drag, Dr. Thompson was always enthusiastic and understanding! He posted all the powerpoints online after class to study by, and everything on the powerpoints were on the tests. I love love love, Dr. Thompson and will recommend him to anyone and everyone!

Dr. Thompson is the best professor I've had at NKU thus far. He is a very enthusiastic instructor and is ALWAYS willing to help/explain a topic that is  being misunderstood, which he did often! (I had a different professor for lecture, who didn't explain anything, leaving the entire class clueless!) Lab with him is easy and fun!
Professor Thompson was a good professor! Sometimes felt like he explained things more difficultly than needed, but if you pay attention and do the work you will be fine.

This professor always showed up to class prepared and did not make the subject harder than it needed to be. He always tried to help studnets out when they had questions and genuinly cared about students. His class in terms of difficulty is standard. Studying outside of class is required to do well in the class, but the tests are easy if you study.

A great professor overall, though he does kind of ramble during lectures. I used to always want to fall asleep in his class; it was so boring. I only showed up to class because the iClicker questions he does in every lecture are worth points. I will say, though, he explains concepts fairly easily, and will help you if you have any questions.

He is a good professor. His lectures contain A LOT of information each day. Attendance is taken through answering questions. You have a canvas assignment every class. You answer questions through the book's website. Exams are hard. You have to study for the exams or you will fail.

I loved Dr. Thompson. He understands if you need to miss class and responds to emails quickly. He helped me numerous times outside of class, and I found his lectures interesting. There's an assignment in-class over the lecture. These are easy points, and he gives great feedback on them. Your lowest exam grade can be dropped in place of the final.

Dr. Thompson Is hand down the best professor that I have ever had. He is my fav!!!!!!!!!!!! you need to take his class. However be ready most of the grade is based on test but I don't think that is his fault  b/c I believe the whole bio 150 classes have similar criculam.
Dr. Thompsons tests are very straightforward multiple choice questions. If you pay attention in class, do the assignments and study the outlines you will easily succeed.

Dr. Thompson is a great biology professor. He has been teaching specifically intro biology for a long time now. He records all of his lectures but requires you to answer clicker questions for attendance every class. Tends to be quite the chatterbox but its not a bad thing. Very accessible outside of class. Definitely recommend taking him
He is okay

His study guides often and incorrect answer keys.. However, he did teach the course and did his job so there is that. He likes to connect different topic together which is nice. He is also kinda funny when he tries. To be honest, I am not sure if it was him or this class in general but I lost interest in the subjects in the class rather quickly.
His lectures are good but with so few assignments its hard to get anything above a B.

Michelle is an awesome teacher, she will explain everything in clear detail, and then if needed explain it again.  Michelle makes you believe that if you come to class you will pass, she believes in her students.

Michelle is a sweet professor, however she is a real scatter brain, going beyond what we need to know which is somewhat confusing. I would not recommend her to anyone. Please take a professor that is full time, and that is there for the students so you are able to pass this lab. Her lab is not easy.

She is very backward at times.  Gets flustered and says things the wrong way.  Unable to keep her class in order.  She is however very easy to pass as long as you study.  Her lab and lecture was much easier than the lecture I am currently in for AP2.  I wish she was the professor for this one as well. She does try to help and is better one on one.

If you're not in love with Michelle Ottersbach by the time you complete her class, there is something wrong with you. She wants nothing more than for every student to get an A in her class. BIO 208 is tough no matter who's teaching, but she makes it as easy as possible. It's definitely worth taking on Saturdays. You won't regret it.

Michelle is the reason that I passed this class! By far the best lab professor I?ve ever had! She is patient and really knows her stuff! She's also pretty quirky but her way of thinking caused me to better understand the material. Thinking of a giraffe and moose may seem odd when comparing vertebrae.....but hey, if it works- why not?!

By far the sweetest teacher I have ever had.  Her lab was even helpful for lecture.  She would give very helpful tips for the lecture and would try her hardest for every student to understand the material fullest. I would highly recommend her!

SO helpful!  You could tell she really wanted students to succeed (at least the ones that put for the effort).  She is soft-spoken and a little awkward at times making some jerks think they can disrespect and walk all over her but if you show you're really trying then she will go out of her way to help you, not just in class but in your career.

When she opens her mouth you can tell that she wants you to understand and succeed. Often her explanations helped with our lecture course. Amazing instructor and I am so thankful I had her for this challenging class. You do have to study hard, but if you put in the effort Michelle is NOT going to disappoint you.
This is the best professor I have ever had!! She was amazing and so helpful. Please do yourself a favor and take her class, you will not regret it. One of NKU's top professors by far.

she is awesome! She will do whatever possible to make sure you pass. She helps you out with knowing what is going to be on her exams, etc. Very understanding and will spend extra time with you individually if needed. Make sure you get her.. you will be happy you did

What a nice, committed, sincere and encouraging instructor. If you need individual help outside of class, she will make every effort to be there for you. She makes sure  that students are aware of what is coming on the tests, and her grading methods are fair.  Students often didn't pay attention in class and talked over her, which pissed me off.

WOW she made lab so easy!! Okay she still gets kind-of nervous but trust me just give her a chance this is the easiest Lab professor ever she will tell you what wont be on the test so you dont have to study everything.. gives bonus!!! lets you argue for extra points in your favor! actualy cares about students passing LOVED HER CLASS!!!!!

Michelle is AMAZING! She is ALWAYS willing to help you outside of class, which many teachers dont. She wants everyone to pass and understands it is a difficult class, so she does everything in her power to help you pass and understand the material. As long as you study, you will do just fine and she is a huge help!

Michelle is the best!Extremely sweet and helpful.  She met us whenever she could-even if we had to meet out in the hall with a bucket of bones!!! She will say "I can't put a sticker on that!" so you know if won't be on the test and can concentrate on what WILL be on the tests. People actually switched into her class even tho it was SatAM-TAKE HER!!
great teacher.  the collest one i have ever had.  she helped so much. if you dont get her for lab your missing out

Michelle is clear in what she expects of you. She gives quizzes every week and gives opportunities to boost grade. She's a little awkward in how she talks but you will get to like her. There's more lecturing over powerpoint notes than their is doing actual lab in this class. Quizzes are easy, exams are hard. Study and you'll do fine.

You want the best lab teacher for bio 208? Take this class!! Goes over everything & truly shows how much she wants you to learn in a fun way. Goes the extra mile to stay late etc for those who want to learn & clarify. You still need to study, it is a lot of material, but she makes a difficult class much more enjoyable.

Michelle is a wonderful lab teacher!  She is very knowledgeable of the material and tries to make it as easy as she can to learn.  Anatomy lab is a lot, and it's hard no matter who you take.  You have to study, but she tries to help you out as much as she can.  She lets you know what to know and study for for each exam.  She is a great teacher!
she is suppose to help us in SI but all she does is belittle us and make us feel stupid for asking questions

She is the intructor for the SI is Che 120 and she is a joke! She is suppose to be showing a people how to work out chemistry problems and all she does is haandout worksheets! She is very short tempered when you do not understand very unwilling to give any help as to the hows and whys of problem solving big thumbs down!
She was helpful and funny!

she is very unhelpful and rude i wish i was a super hero and could sling cold spaghetti on her because nobody likes cold sphagetti and gees can you kindly actually help somebody by showing us how to do the dang problems lord knows Dr padolik wont
No Comments
Very nice- willing to help.  Sometimes doesn't understand that the students do not have a complete understanding of analytical chemistry.  Always willing to meet with you, and isn't a harsh grader.
Dr. Morris is always willing to help with questions, even for 340 lecture, which she did not teach. She actually gave study sessions for lecture material when there was extra time after lab.

She invests heavily in the class, but it's kind of a boring subject so when students don't invest the same she gets upset.  She likes to micromanage and makes you come to class on days where all you do is type on a computer, which could be done much easier at home. She's a very nice person, just not someone I wish I'd taken this class with.

McNeil is a very nice prof. He is very excited about his work and honestly tries to help, but sometimes it just comes up short. The setting of the class and the lecture style made it very difficult to stay awake, and I am not one to fall asleep in class. Definitely not an easy A, but it is still achievable if you work for it.

I am taking a 100 level course but he teaches way beyond the level covering subject material that should be covered in a 300 or 400 level class. It just makes it a little difficult for someone who just wants to know basic astronomy and not the physics of it. I don't need to know how to measure and epicycle, just tell me about some planets and stuff
He is a great guy. Tests off his hand outs. He did hit us hard on the final but was very fare. Pay attention in class and you will do fine
he talks to you like you are a three year old.  takes forever in lab before you can actually start.  Class is the most boring thing i have ever sat through

While i am sure he is a nice man he is a Very Very Very BAD teacher. He does infact talk to you like you are 3. He feels the need to explain EERYTHING, including things explianed on the assignment.  He is a rediculouse grader.  On the bright side, it's easy to sign in and just leave.

So far in my academic career this is the worst professor I have ever had. He explains EVERYTHING including how he has a cold and should face away when he sneezes. 2/3 the year you learn about telescopes. after this class, i could tell you everything about a telescope, and maybe one thing about a star. TERRIBLE.

Very nice man and extremely smart. His class is relatively difficult and very easy to fall asleep in lecture, considering you are in the planetarium with dimmed lights and a comfortable reclined seat. I did well in the course because it's what I am interested in.

Everyone gripes about how hard his class is but its really not. He prints out all his lectures for you and the tests are all multiple choice. His lectures are boring and his explanations are a bit patronizing but it is not really a hard class. Not an easy A mind you but not impossible either.
Hardest class I have had to date, and I am a senior!!

This class wasn't NEARLY as bad as I thought it would be. He gives you a copy of the notes, and several extra credit opportunities. Jotting notes on the slides during lecture helps! He's not always clear, but he's willing to help. If you do the assignments, readings, show up, and study, you'll be fine!

It was very easy to fall asleep during class just because he has one of those monotone voices.  Otherwise, he really cares about the students and how well they are doing.  He will work with you and he makes sure things are understood. If you can make it through the class lectures, you'll be fine.

Professor McNeil was a nice man, but that's where it ends. He tries to help out, but he is so smart I think he finds things hard to explain. Maybe it's just me. I got a C in the class, Science isn't my forte. Overall he was okay, but I wouldn't take him again.
Pretty boring!
HE IS WAY TOOOOO SMART TO BE TEACHING ENTRY LEVEL.  IT WAS HARD FOR HIM TO BREAK DOWN THE MATERIAL FOR THE AVERAGE JOE.

Very nice guy, VERY intelligent, but the class was not at all what I expected. Seemed pretty advance for a 100 level science class. More physics/math related than about the actual planets and stars. Somehow, I did pretty well on the exams. I think if you show up, take notes, and study the writing assignments you can get through it ok.

First off, I am not good w/science. Second off, he is SO smart it is hard for him to convey the ideas. He tries a lot, video clips, and pictures, etc. Labs are not that difficult-just ask questions, he is very helpful. He also offers extra credit---DO IT! If you like astronomy go for it...

I dropped this class because McNeil was way to hard to understand, his test were impossible and I could barely keep focused!! I don't recommned taking him, no offense to him he's a truly smart man but did not know how to convey it to students! So in reality, I'm getting ready to take it again with someone else!
Very boring. Hard to gain interest in the course material with this professor.

Very nice guy and very helpful. Gives copies of notes, thorough writing assignments that are great study guides, additional review papers, and specific sections to read in your textbooks. As long as you read, study, show up, and follow along you will do fine. Ask him for help and he's really cool about it.

INF120 was the class I took. This is a very hard class. Dr. Kirby is very intelligent and I think it is hard for him to teach a intro class.  He probably should not teach intro class, he said on the first day that this class is for people with no programming experience and I had some experience and still struggled...

Some very difficult material to understand without strong math background, but he can tell when students are really trying their hardest.  Very fun projects!  Could be better about explaining certain things when one explanation is hard to grasp.

Went through alot of advanced material with us, and I thought the class (Advanced Computer Graphics) was fun, ending with a group project of making an RPG-ish game. He's a great professor, although his tests and projects were a bit hard sometimes, but you definately learn alot.
Really cool. Teaches well but also he talkes about a lot of cool stuff. Realy cool when it comes video games because his son "owns almost every video games..." so he knows a lot.

Difficult professor. Be ready to work but also be ready to learn a lot. Very knowledgeable about the subject and not to bad at explaining it. He’s helpful when you go to his office, if you can catch him in his office. Beware of his tests.

Good professor that will challenge the students. Test and homework are hard, but well within what was covered in class. Sometimes acts like students are bothering him in his office, but very helpful in class and via e-mail. Covers a lot of material very throughoughly. Take his class if you get the chance.
Amazing Teacher. Tests are a little hard, but if you pay attention to his teaching you will be fine!

I had him for INF 128, but that wasn't an option. He was ok and had a bit of an ego. However, I would take a class with him again if needed. I can't really speak to homework as the INF 128 class is set up differently than most classes.

My review is for a class I took in 1995 - we didn't have this platform then. Dr. Kirby's demanding teaching style had such a positive impact on me, that I have to give him a solid review . I took his C and Systems programming class and the mental toughness it developed in me has served me well in my career for the past 20+ years.

He was by far the hardest professor I have had. He was a really nice guy but he was never clear on instructions or grading criteria. I never really knew what I was doing. He never gave feedback. I think he's better as an advisor than a professor.
good lord, IFS 105 is easy.

He is a great guy.  The class can be dry and boring, but you do learn how to design websites.  He is a good teacher and knows what he is talking about.  He does have many assignments, but if you stay on top on things you can get an 'A'.

I took him for the online section. He had a lot of the information seperated and scattered over blackboard. He required a lot of minor changes in the chapter questions, which became a hassle. Assignments are pretty tough sometimes, but the most confusing part is turning them in. He wants way to many extras.

Nice guy and the class is very easy. Tests are online and he has reviews with the exact questions on his Web site. However his lectures are boring and STRAIGHT from the text book. Also he mumbles at times making him hard to understand.

Seems to be a pretty good professor. The class itself isn't much more challenging than using PowerPoint or Word, but hey what can you ask of a intro class? The only problem is he's teaching FrontPage2003 which will be useless in a couple more months with the intro of Expression Web. He could have just re-worked his lesson plan before the semester.

He tried very hard to make everything clear.  All of his test answers are online.  Manning does a great job, but sometimes stuff just is over most students heads.  The tutor for the class is great, go to her if you need any help, she knows her stuff.
If you're new to programming, his teaching is incomprehensible and boring. He assumes you have previous knowledge, or that you absorb info by osmosis. He's nice, but he's a bit of a creeper.
Can be very helpful but often ideas not thoroughly explained. Oh, and definitely HOT.

Mr. Manning assumes students are business programming. The class is very hard to understand unless you are an Informatics Major. He gives all the test questions (roughly 250) and he only uses 50 of those questions. Homework is nothing like the classwork. It will SAVE your life to visit Kylie the tutor, she is AMAZING!
He is easy, but very boring and very repetitive.  He is willing to help you with anything.
very easy, also very repetitive.  Boring.  simple if you have any prior computer experience, very simple topics.

His class was so boring and he was really mean. When you ask for help he treated you like you were stupid for even asking the question. He should have quit a long time ago. The only good thing was that the assignments were cake.
Very repetitive.  Not real helpful either. If you know your Microsoft office, the class is very boring.  Pretty easy.
Its a pretty easy class and the assignements are simple, he's very informative and a nice guy. Just make sure you go to class, he takes attendance and drops your grade if you miss more than 3...
He explained things well and was very helpful.  He had a good attitude towards students and wanted them to do well in the class.

Manning was a nice guy, but his teaching was ineffective. The class was (more than) often dull and repetitive, although VERY easy if you know anything about MS Office and Access. Everything he goes over in class is also posted on his website, and he practically does the entire assignment in class before it is due.

Very repetive.  Talks way too much.  Bores me to tears.  Very nice and helpful.  Relies on powerpoint notes wayyyy too much...he should not devote nearly the entire 3 hours of class to powerpoint notes...we can read the book.
SO boring!  it almost makes me want to fall asleep

Sad to say, but very repetitive and dry when lecturing. Very helpful when completing inclass assignments though. Approachability is very high and helpful. Gives you hints/tips on how to complete tasks and what to study

REALLY boring. Drags everything out, constanty "reviews" for tests. Tests done on computer, study w/ notes b4 hand. He goes over notes too quickly and if you dont look at him he thinks youre not paying attention. Take someone else if you can.

His lectures are really boring...he has a website with all the notes for the class as well as links to review questions for the tests. If you go through all the review questions and know them, you will get a 100 on the test (same wording & order). He is very helpful with assignments in class. Easy class but boring and repetitive...
he is so easy!! tests are online, all you have to do is the homework which he gives you time in class to do and will help you if needed. He is really boring but it's an easy A, just do your homework.
Very easy.  Tests are online and you can practice taking them ahead of time.  Just do your homework.  He is extremely boring and repeats himself like you would not believe.  Easiest A ever!
very boring
I took this class online and thought it was really easy. Just watch his lecture videos and look over the review for the tests, questions come directly from the review, and you'll get an A

This was the hardest class I have ever taken. The assignments are super challenging and you need to go to class to be able to know what is being asked of you. Professor Manning does give extra credit for coming to class and following along with him in class- this is probably the only reason I passed honestly. Good luck.

He is very nice but classes are boring :( he tries very hard to make connections and metaphors. Gives tons of extra credit! Extra credit with most homework and for coming to class. He is very fair. I had him for BIS101. He is your best bet for this class if you have to take it.

Look, he does what he can. This is hard material to convey through online and I think he does a really good job with that challenge on his end. This class takes hours to do because you need to look at every lecture and really really pay attention. The tests are OK, just make sure you utilize his test practice link, every question is pulled from
Tests are pretty hard, but the homework is fairly easy

The homework is not that hard sometimes hard understand, and the attendance  extra credit is alright. Thats the good part. The test he gives is very unreasonably difficult, and not fully covered in his lecture. You have to work for the A!!

This class was a challenge at first but if you apply yourself & set aside some time to get help with the professor, you will come to understand the material better. The studying for the exams are tedious but if you you really do look over the 250+ questions, you get an A for sure! The homeworks are challenging but the professor will help you a lot
No Comments

I didnt pay too much attention to the slides or lectures since the content is just VBA which is easy. The homeworks were very straightforward and easy to get full points on. On the in chapter homeworks, he will give extra credit point sometimes and you can get upwards of 10 bonus point on the final project. Exams were the hardest part.
Bored me to tears. Terrible speaker. Class was easy though.

INF 110 just isn't worthed the time and effort, I would suggest INF 120. The professor is useless and barely does anything except use the same material from 1995 that most probably his teacher gave. Disgrace of an professor, tbh the professor feels like a dumb 2000's AI like one's in old MS office.
Extremely boring but excellent teacher for those with no proir knowledge.

Frank is a really, really nice guy. He'll answer questions with the answer to the problem not with an explanation so if you really want to learn UNIX, he might be a problem. Rushes through his lectures with minimal explanation.
Great teacher, one of the best in the department in my opinion. Knows what he is teaching and is very helpful.

Awesome professor... His lectures are a little dry sometimes, but he is very enthusiastic about computer security. He gave tons of easy assignments that helped to balance the grades, and his tests are short answer. Everyone did pretty well on the tests. Keep up on the assignments, they are easy and are there to help you out. Definitely recommend!
Good teacher.
Learned a lot from our software engineering project
would never awnser my emails......
Good prof

Very boring; teaches directly from the book.  I took this class with him four years ago, and am now taking it again (surprise) with another professor, and I'm finding it very different.  I realized just how little I learned about Java in Frank's class.
.NET is valuable for my career.  Good examples and labs.
Liked the labs

This class was a cakewalk. Kind of nice considering I was receiving an easy A for a 300 level class, but the class taught PHP which is a very complex language that can be very in-depth and multifunctional. This class just barely skimmed the surface, which kinda aggravated me.
he is a good professor

Took for CIT 271 in-person. On one hand, not bad because the course was basically show up, do the labs, and leave. On the other hand, it covered Windows administration, including server management, and I felt like it was super easy and did not really dive into the topics. No lectures... Kind of a waste of time.

Great Professor.  Eager for students to succeed.  Simple homework assignments.  Test moderately difficult but easy if you study the homework.  Only cracked open the book for an open book test and a couple homeworks.

Dr. Frank is a great professor. I enjoyed the format of the class. You show up, complete labs, and their are two exams, the midterm and the final. The labs are easy, and the page numbers that contain the answer(s) are listed with the question. You do need the book(s). Overall great class, and great professor. Highly recommended.

Took Professor Frank for CIT 271. Easiest class I have ever taken; he doesn't lecture, but instead gives you a lab to complete during class time. Simplest labs I have EVER completed. Easy A. Also very communicative; he can almost always be reached via email, and provides great feedback.
Reads out the book in class instead of teaching anything new.
I took several of Dr. Frank's classes when I attended NKU many years ago. His greatest strength is that seems to care that his students succeed. He is also very good at explaining concepts.

Dr. Frank is a very caring professor. He uses his own website for grading and assignments instead of Canvas. You use the textbook frequently, even on tests. He assigns a lab/assignment each class that is due next class, but they are usually easy. He answers assignment questions after lecture. Doesn't take attendance. He has an unforgettable laugh.

Suuuper nice, old school type guy. This class uses PHP and MySQL to build out several, simple, dynamic websites. You get 2 assignments per week which you can either email to him or show him in class and get a grade on the spot. There are only two exams that are open book and pretty easy as long as youve done the assignments.
great teacher
A good professor one on one, but cloudy when lecturing to a group.

great teacher.if you are the type of person who has to meet with profs and b.s. with them, then dont take this class. however, i love his style of teaching, and if you can shut up and pay attention you will learn a TON. the man is absolutely hilarious and i enjoyed his class. highly recommend the class to people who actually want to learn something

He's a pretty good professor. He's so funny. He knows his stuff and answer almost any question you have. Be warned. If you don't follow directions, he will make you look stupid. I'd recommend him. Test aren't too bad.

Very opinionated. If you use anything besides Mircosoft/windows, you will hate this class. He has a huge bias towards windows. And not very knowledgeable on what he taught in this class. That's all I'll say about that.

He is a pretty nice guy, until you tell him that you did something wrong or you ask a question that isn't a good one (in his opinion). I was very hesitant to ask questions or ask for help because I thought he would jump me for it. As far as his teaching techniques, he is a good teacher.

I loved weiner!  I am def going to take all of the classes that I can by him.  Yes he cusses in class, but I want to go to class just so I can see what he is going to come up with.  You have to do the work, but isnt that what college is?

This friggin' guy is a real piece of work! He drops F bombs like I breathe air, he's got crazy hair, he smokes like a chimney and according to him, "takes his pants off" to play video games. So it would seem odd that he is undoubtedly the BEST professor I've ever had. I learned a TON! This guy knows his stuff. He's HILARIOUS.  Best class ever!

Professor Weiner is a funny guy. He drops the F-Bomb every minute and it is interesting to find out what he is going to say next. Its hard to ask questions because he never answers them nicely I think its because he is from New York its the way they talk. His tests were really hard, he tries to trick you on alot of the questions but good guy

Weiner was an awful professor. He is unclear on his tests because they are very opinionated. His tests are hard and there isn't hardily anything to study off of. Don't ask questions either or he will be rude about it, he expects you to know everything that he teaches.
Kind of funny, love to hear him speak.

Yes he's entertaining to listen to but sadly his entertainment value does not account for the fact that the majority of what he teaches in this class is based on his own personal experience. He claims that he is the authority on certain topics and are proven wrong in more advanced courses. Too bad you havent any alternative for this course.

Tests are hard you really don't have anything to study off of.  He loses his train of thought frequently.  Labs are confusing, he does give instructions to follow but they need to be clarified and step by step instead of somethings implied.  Altogether an alright course.

funny class if you don't mind the language. good beginner computer class but you do need to listen because he will say some thing in it will not be in the notes or the book but it will show up on the test.

He will make you learn - bottom line. I learned more in this class than in the previous two OOP classes combined. Be warned: He admitted to "leaving things out" of homework assignments just to get you to ask him questions. It's a petty, stupid teaching tool, but he uses it. So, don't assume - ask.

Beware! If you miss one day he will subtract 50 points from your test scores.  I was sick and missed 4 of his classes even with a doctors note he took two of my test scores of 100% and turned them into zero's. I would have gotten an A but because of that I got a C. Does this after student evaluations are submitted to avoid flak, Bozo the Clown Hair

Extremely rude and unhelpful. Explanation is good but I do not know what he thinks of himself. He thinks he is the smartest person in the whole world, saying whatever he says is right. I do not recommend him.
Professor is very well organized and gives very good examples.  Forget asking him any questions though as he will talk down to you and make you feel like an idiot for asking a simple question.

Very high expectations!  Constantly bragging about the difficulty level of his 260 class.  Not a people person and sometimes very rude.  Not recommended for people with little or no experience in programming.  Proceed with caution.
Great teacher...he really knows what he is talking about.  Will take more of his courses.

Very clear expectations and very high standards, but pay attention and do what you're supposed to and you will get an A.  I had no prior experience and he helped me learn the basics of computer programming

A little rough around the edges, not for the thin skinned (think Danny DeVeto) but an excellent instructor.   If you want to learn the material this is the prof to go with.  Expect to work for your grade.  I will definately take another course from him.

Weiner knows almost everything there is to know about JAVA. He teaches his class very well. But he is the true meaning of the word GEEK. Dictionary - Geek - N.- Someone who is socially inept.  If you need help with anything DO NOT rely on this guy to help you out.  He is not a people person what-so-ever!

Ok, so I will definitely agree he is rough around the edges, BUT he is still a really good teacher.  In fact, he has a great sense of humor.  I've never had to go to him for too much help, but as long as you ask decent questions and aren't pushy he doesn't get cranky.  I would definitely take another course from him without a second thought.

Teacher was awesome!  He has a great sense of humor, and he really knows his stuff.  If you are an egotist who knows it all, TAKE ANOTHER CLASS!  He is in the classroom to help those who don't now what they're doing, so pay attention, do your assignments on time and you will learn more than you ever counted on.

Awesome teacher, definitely not as bad a guy as people think he is.  He is extremely helpful as long as you ask questions BEFORE the due date.  Only Class in college that I've had where paying attention was easy.  Its really sad to see someone this good at teaching CSC courses retire.
Very good, and willing to help. Teaches real world programming, without the bull.  Do the work, and learn a lot.
Does not help ... is not clear ... very hard tests
Teaches you how to do it the right way.  Put forth the effort and learn alot!
Always willing to help students!
she is willing to help student if you miss a class she is willing to let you make up test and quizzes. lecture can be boring but she is an awesome teacher and I would recommed everyone to take her

Took this class for an easy A instead throughout the semester she would blame students for faults on her part such as not knowing the material covered on the test, when in lecture she would talk about her personal life. Her classes are a complete waste of your time. I think I learned more Geography in  1st grade than in her course. TERRIBLE TEACHER
Very hard class, but what college should be, i learned a ton in this class, you need to go and read or at least skim chapters, very qualified professor, nku is lucky.
Dr M is a very caring person. The class is a lot of busy work. Worksheet and quiz every week. Quizzes are easy, but worksheets can be a little challenging, but she is very willing to help if you ask.

Dr. Medlicott is one of my favorite professors. You can tell that she loves teaching geography. Her backround in geography and travel is outstanding. She is extremely helpful and is very funny. She makes class interesting. She uses powerpoint and posts on blackboard, so there is no note writing. Very good professor. Extremely knowledgable.
Great teacher, says um alot but has alot of interesting things to say.  Very smart, came from Dartmouth (IVY League), Definelty take for Geography, you won't be sorry.
Super nice and all of her lectures are on powerpoint and printable from home. She is an awesome professor with a great personality to boot.

Very interesting class, learned a lot about demographics. Easy to communicate with outside class. 4 quizzes, 4 pop quizzes, always essay but easy to do. Nobody gets below a C. 3 papers (3-5pgs), also easy if you're opinionated. Offers a project to replace the final. Take advantage of it! Don't buy the books. She says "um" often. Highly recommended!

Dr. Medlicott is the best lady ever!! She is so super sweet and has a strong faith in God and that just rocks.   She just knows so much information about a lot of different things its amazing.  Take her whenever you get the chance it will be the best class!
Great professor. Take her for any class she offers.

I got an A in the class and it is not hard to do so, but the only thing I didn't like was she grades your essays like it is an ENG class, and lectures can be boring(as all usually are). I did learn some interesting things though and it wasn't a bad gen. studies class. You also only need a $8 book for her GEO107 class.
Dr. M is seriously the best lady ever. She use to work for the FBI and loves to talk anytime she is available. If you need help or anything she is there.
She is a great teacher, and she makes the class easy.  The tests are easy if you study the notes that you take.
Awesome lady!  Take ANY course she offers.  Extremely helpful and if you pay attention and LISTEN to her lectures you will learn a lot about the course.

She is a great teacher.  I recommend her to anyone. She likes to hear students talk and is very enthusiastic about the material.  As long as you try she will love you and help you with anything.  I recommend taking her class.  Oh yeah, and be prepared to know more about the Shakers than you ever wanted to.

She is very nice and fair. Lectures could be boring as her voice can be monotonous, but the material is interesting. Basically if you come to class and listen you will do well. And don't let the map project intimidate. I got a 99% on mine and had no idea if I had done it right at first. Great gened course!!
Dr. M is great in every way. She loves to teach and help whenever she can. She is just so awesome! Take her for whatever class she offers! She is amazing! <3

Her quizzes were once a week are were not open notes this semester. Idk if she plans on keeping this change or not. She expects you to know a lot of background information even though it is an introductory course. Weekly worksheets, and expects you to read each chapter throughouly. However there is about 50 extra credit points built in.

Dr. Medlicott is very knowledgable in what she teaches. We never had open noteopen book tests so I'm guessing she's done away with that but the content itself is easy to grasp if you take notes from the lecture slides, do the worksheets and pay attention to key terms. Very clear about assignments and deadlines. She's also a very kind woman!
CORRECTION! She teaches Geography NOT Anthropology Great class! Great Professor! NKU is certainly lucky to have her. She cares about the subject material and she cares about her students.
Great class! Great Professor! NKU is certainly lucky to have her. She cares about the subject material and she cares about her students.

Dr. Medlicott once went out of her way to email me a worksheet late one night that was due the next day when I was unable to attend the prevous class. She very much so cares about her students.  Also, she gives A TON of extra credit. Class material is tough for a GenEd, but an "A" is very doable.

I think Dr. Medlicott is an extremely nice person. However, I do not think she is a good professor. I think that she talks about the same topic for about 10-15 minutes and it bores me to tears. She has a very clear syllabus for assignment and test dates which is helpful, but I recommend not taking this class for a Gen. Ed. credit.

Dr. Medlicott is one of my favorite professors. She is very clear about what is expected in class. Her lectures are interesting and she is very knowledgeable. You obviously have to study, this is college, but her lectures are great and she gives lots of materials that aid in learning. I would recommend her class.

She's not the most interesting at lecturing but she does try to explain the information as best as she can. She is very excessable and always responds to my emails the day of. She is super nice and really cares about your experience. She always offers to help

Prof. Medlicott is the sweetest woman. She can be pretty boring in class lectures but she's clear on what is expected from you and is always ready to work with you. You need the books and you have regular assignments/quizzes. Honestly, just do the work and you'll pass. It wasn't the most interesting class to me but I'd definitely take her again.
You will have a quiz every week, but aren't difficult. You are allowed to take the quizzes twice if you didn't like your first grade. She cares about her class and very informative. Take her!

You will need the book.  The homework assignments are grades easy I feel.  The quizzes are online and you get two chances but you only have 25 minutes to complete each one.  The midterm and final are in class and they consist of 100 questions.  You have to know the stuff to pass them.   She is a very kind professor and answers all emails.

A two page worksheet each week. One quiz a week. The quiz gives you two attempts and you have 25 minutes to do it. I wish she gave more time so have your powerpoints and textbook ready! She's very nice, helpful and answers to emails quickly.

i am international student and my english is weak she is the best and she was very understanding the midterm was online and the final was very easy actuality i didnt study a lot for this class and it was so easy for me i didnt study the final and i got high score she give extra credit she is the best
She's awesome! She's so nice and she's brilliant. She worked with the FBI and she's absolutely fascinating. Take her.
She is really awsome prof. For GEO 108 . She really helpfull .
WOOOW she's really an amazing prof. She cares about her students . Easy class if u study and do all the work. I got A . Take her for geo 108
She was very nice, and wanted to help, but was boring. She doesn't seem comfortable talking in front of large groups of people. Overall a good prof.

Dr.M is awesome, very nice and is well versed in the subject material. Lectures are a little boring at times but she really tries to make them interesting. I highly recommend taking her but plan on doing some work. I high recommend NKU's new syllabi web site where you can view past syllabi from any professor for any class, it's another great tool!
she is amazing, helpful , nice prof. at NKU. it was really easy class !!

easy class with a lot of work to do with her. quiz every week, worksheet every week 2 exam. a lot of extra credit in this class. it's kind of boring class but It's easy all the quizzes and exam are multiple choice or T and F. take her and bring your laptop.

She expects you to do college work!  However with this being an upper level class DUH!!!  There are a lot of opportunities for points with weekly quizzes, two exams, and three papers.  I highly recommend her.

Buy the book, she has quizzes almost every week, and they are open book, open notes, and open powerpoint. She gives you the powerpoints, and the assignments are easy, and follow the textbook. The first assignment was tricky. There were only two exams: the final and the mid-term, and she held an optional study session for each.

The work is very easy and her online class is normally a breeze. HOWEVER, on her assignments there is little to no clarity on what she wants done, and if you miss one thing that was not listed your grade drops on that assignment. She does not give many instructions and will mark you off if you don't do it absolutely how she wants.

Dr. Medlicott has high expectations for her students, she expects you to perform as if you are in college. Of all the professors in our wonderful Geography Department she is the one I learn the most from. She is very knowledgeable about her subjects and really tries to engage students in class. Sometimes she can come off a bit put off but I think this is due to her very busy schedule. I highly recommend taking her class if you really want to learn.

Open book quizzes but you should at least skim the material beforehand. Midterm and Final are NOT open book. Offers quite a bit of extra credit I know I received at least 60 EC pts. Will help if you ask goes in to detail in class about subjects if students ask questionsseem interested.

The assignments can be a little tedious, but you have an infinite amount of times to redo them if you aren't happy with the first grade you receive. The quizzes can be a bit tricky because of the short time frame that you have to take them in, but you get two chances. She responds to emails/questions in a timely manner and is very helpful!!

This class has not been hard but it has not been easy. The assignments are tedious and annoying but good practice b/c there are a lot of map activities. You DEFINITELY have to read the book so if you are looking for a easy gen ed this isn't it. READ THE BOOK AND TAKE NOTES she likes to ask A LOT of textbook-based q's.
She is a caring professor. Tough quizzes and tests but she gives you multiple chances.
Exercises need to be done a certain way to receive full credit. Most quiz information comes from lecture, so if you skip you miss out.

The class was somewhat hard. Before taking the class I thought there will be 2 attempts to do the quiz but she changed this option so you have only one attempt for 25 questions in 25 minutes. Sometimes she adds more questions for extra points. The assignments are hard so you need to be expert in maps because you will use them all the time.

Prof. Medlicott homework and quizzes were more complicated than it needed to be. I think it would have been easier to take this class in person. Every assignment was due on Sundays so yo have plenty of time to complete. She was great at grading quickly & responding to you quickly. She also sends out reminders so you never will miss an assignment.

Her online quizzes are ONLY fill in the blank. She mispells answers too, so if you don't spell it her way, you lose full points. The only way for her to manually grade the exercises is to ask her, even then she would be really rude in her emails. She is intelligent and knows what she is teaching, but her classes are NOT made for students.
I love shulthies but please oh my goodness he is just too boring... and just teach if we have a question we would ask.

Dr. Schultheis is great!  He is really straightfoward on his exams, no questions are designed to "trick" you.  He is also really nice and approachable.  I liked him for lab better than lecture though, he was really funny and easygoing.

Very nice person. Stick to the power points when studying, because tends to go on tangents during lectures and gets himself lost. Tests are direct reflection of power points. A little easier to study the material if you don't go to class.
One of the best BIO profs at NKU.  Take him if you get the chance.
Wouldn't recommend taking for BIO 150.  Goes too fast during lecture and is never really quite sure of himself.

He is hilarious and pretty easy in lecture! He sometimes gets confused about the material, but will always clear it up! He is very funny and is great at cracking jokes to liven up the class! His lab exams can be tough, and test 2 in lecture is also tough! STUDY HARD FOR THE FINAL! I would re-take him, he is a great professor!

Even Dr. Schultheis often seems confused about what he is teaching. He is constantly late and underprepared. Exam difficulty and depth of content varies randomly, so don't assume later exams will be anything like the 1st. Most exams have trick questions. Be prepared to teach yourself everything. On the upside, he does his best to help if you ask.
Is VERY boring, but he's a great professor. Tests come straight from his lectures so nothing he hasn't covered. Easy to talk to and will help any time he's in his office. Would definitely take again.

The man is hilarious. Wants you to do well, makes complex material seem so simple via powerpoint you almost don't need to do anything but read them (out of 70 in class, there were days with 14). Would occasionally stop lecturing for a few minutes to talk about something unrelated and incite general laughter in the class, accidentally.

Had him for advanced molecular biology. This class was a lot of fun! Lectures were more structured as in class discussions which make what could be very boring material interesting . He grades very fair and I think he takes into account if you really try hard and show that you put effort into exams, lab reports and paper. I would definitely recommend anyone to take this class as an upper level BIO elective you will not regret it !

Dr. Schultheis is a super chill professor. He makes lab extremely easy and simple. It is impossible not to do well because he essentially tells you the answers. We often finished labs early and we had no exams, only quizzes and assignments, which were also easy. Highly recommend him.

Dr. Schultheis was very easy to reach and always guided us to the correct answer. He always prepared study guides for his exams if his students asked him for one. Homework is easy, exam questions are always found in lecture, and I didn't need the book to pass. His lab is also easy and he provides a study guide for lab quizzes which are very helpful

I just love this guy.  Very to the point and clear with what you need to know and what is just for your knowledge. His BIO-436 course is also great (that wasn't on here but I figure if you're taking genetics with him it should be on your radar anyways.)

I absolutely love Schultheis! MicroBio is tough, but if you study enough and pay attention in lectures you can easily get an A on the exams. The study guides are usually pretty exact to the exam too. He's also just hilarious and genuinely a great guy. Definitely take his class if possible.

She is a nun, seriously. She is not a very good teacher though. She is extremely confusing and does not explain things very well. You have to teach yourself a lot. She does give many second chances and drops a few grades. She just is not a good teacher, I would recommend taking a different professor!!

The subject matter for this class is not very intriguing. However she does a well in teaching it. She shows a lot of examples and goes over every single question on quizzes and tests afterwards to explain how to do it. Drops quiz grades and allows a test to be replaced if you score higher on the final.

She is a very good teacher if you are not good at Math like me! She repeatedly went over our the chapters and she gives a lot of chances for grades on tests and quizzes.  At the end of the semester she takes the last 3 classes to go over the final exam. I would highly recommend her to anyone that needs to take this course

I actually liked this class after I took it with her! I was scared to death of taking a Stats class, but it ended up not being bad at all! She is very helpful and in class she gives you exactly what she expects on the test. Just study for the quizzes/exams and do the homework (she drops a few grades too!) and you will get a good grade, trust me!

She is an outstanding professor! I highly recommend taking her over any other stats teacher at NKU. She is so helpful and truly cares about her students. She does everything she can to make her students succeed and on most of her test the average class score was a B....that says a lot about how good she is.

I dreaded having to take this class, but Marilyn Hoffman made it easy enough...She goes fast so I would recommend not missing class if you want to do well even though it is not mandatory. Everything on the tests comes straight from what we did in class, so study and you'll be fine.

The class is super easy but for some reason i could not do well in it. The topics that we covered are things straight from high school. But i find her hard to pay attention too. The class is dreadfully boring. I cannot concentrate on straight math for the full hour and fifteen minutes of that class. A lot of people in my class do very well.
She is somewhat confusing but a very nice person.

Sister Marilyn is a very kind nun. I'm not brilliant with math, but I found this class fun. There are a lot of real life examples, which makes it more interesting. You get to use a note card on the tests. There are a lot of quizzes, but she drops the lowest quiz grades. Not too much homework--pretty easy. I recommend her!

The class was okay and not that difficult. However, you teach a lot yourself. She's nice but i feel that her grading was unfair. quiz everyday after she barely went over the material and she grades homework really tough. She made many mistakes when doing examples on the board which confused the class a lot. Very boring. I would choose a diff. prof.
She made statistics easy!  Highly recommend her.

She is the best statistics teacher! She is willing to help, and she understands that most people in this class aren't math majors. Study your homework for quizzes. Study all your quizzes for the tests and you will get an A. Great teacher and great class!  Highly recommend her!

Easiest teacher ever and explains things very clearly.  Those who gave her a negative rating obviously didn't care about the class.  The best math teacher you'll ever get....Helpful, gives ample chances and extra credit
This stats class is fairly easy, and only requires basic algebra.  She grades pretty tough, but allows you to use formula sheets on every quiz and test.
I've always hated math...(which is probably why I was in remedial math) But sister Hoffman is such a sweet women and will bend over backwards for you, if she sees you making a little bit of effort!

She is SO quirky, and interesting. I had gotten C's and D's in high school Math classes, but she explains things so thoroughly, and is so helpfully dedicated that is makes it easy! I really reccommend taking this class to anyone who is afraid of taking math!

I totally agree with the last review. I am not a Math person. This is the second time I've taken STA 113, and Hoffman was such a better professor than my last who was Sisson. I would not recommend Sisson. Hoffman explains things so well.
show up and pay attention you'll understand and get an A, that simple.  Great Professor
She's very nice and easy.  Helps you if you need it and explains everything in great detail.
very good teacher always excited about class makes it easier to learn... she is very helpful and wants the students to learn as much as she has time for!!! highly recommend
Quizes almost every day and doesnt help understand homework problems. Very quick course.
does not explain anything, useless, lots of quizzes, boring teacher

This class is hard by nature. The pace of her teaching is FAST. If you miss ONE DAY, you are likely going to have difficulty catching up, unless you are a math whiz. That said, she is a very understanding person, and is willing to help you if you ask for it. Not condescending, she understands that statistics is hard for most people!
She was awesome... I almost droped this class but Hoffman helped me complete this course.. She is the BEST
Tough subject, great professor. Knows his stuff and he's great at teaching it, though class can feel like a race at times. Put a lot of time into this class if you want a decent grade.

Dr. Filaseta is incredibly knowledgeable about every inch of subject matter in the class, and is extremely well prepared for class, having demonstrations and such everyday. You will enjoy the class if you attend and pay attention. If you pay attention to classwork and homework, and you look over the practice test on blackboard- guaranteed A.

Filaseta's a good professor, he's just fast & it can be hard to take notes & think at the same time; I recommend just listening for the most part and only jot down the most important stuff. Put enough work into the class and read the textbook and you should be fine.

He was good at explaining things but I thought he went way too fast and I just felt rushed. It requires a lot of work but if you are willing to do the work you will get an A or B. His tests are hard but he usually puts a 10-15 point curve on which is nice.

This man can easily be mistaken for the inventor of physics, he KNOWS every single detail of everything he is talking about, never stops to think when he is asked questions, he has answers at the tips of his fingers! Very good teacher, moves rather fast and can be stubborn when asked for help.
Great professor for Physics majors and Physics minded people. I knew people who weren't who had a problem with the class. If you like Physics, he's the professor to go.
Filaseta is worth taking physics from. I found him a bit difficult, but it wasn't because he tried to be difficult. He knows what he's talking about and willing to help if you ask.

You are on your own. The best way to pass this class is to form a study group with half your class the first week of the Semester. Extremely Intellegent Man...Not the best prof though. Well, it is better than taking the class at UK with 200 others, while here it is only 25. Good Luck
This guy will challenge you in a challenging subject.
He was very hard and challenging and there was so much work with the class.  He is not very good at explaining things or helping you.
Helps students who help themselves. The first exam was too hard, and he leveled off the second and third exams. Curves exams by giving a percentage of missed points back to you.

He has an open door policy, and you can stop by his office for help anytime, even when he is in the middle of lunch.  On homework questions, he often answers a question by asking a question.  He will give you hints, but not feed you the answers.  It's a tough course, not an easy "A".
He is very good at explaining things and is always helpful.  I am glad I have him again this semester.
the best professor I have ever had in my life I would say. sad to see him retire from NKU. I would recommend this professor with my eyes closed.
Very to the point in lab, and helpful provided you go to his office to ask him questions.  Very enjoyable.

He may seem intimidating at first, but he is an awesome professor. As long as you take the time and put effort into his class, you will easily pass. He likes to have fun by playing music in lab and cracking jokes during his small lecture. I would highly recommend him.
Tough class for a 100 level.  His grading is very picky but he makes class enjoyable.
He is a picky grader but if you ask him questions he will help.  Jokes in class to break up a 3 hour class!  If you do the work you will pass.

Not the most polite man ever.  Spends 1/4 of his class making of students he has had.  "Did you have a moment?" or "Don't be challenged!" are some of his favorite lines. Grades harsh, tests on things that weren't really covered well, etc. Look elsewhere for a chem professor. He is good at getting you out of lab quickly though.

He made lab fun at night.  Course was not too bad.  The labs are the same for all sections.  Played music to break up the time.  Was picky on grading but it is a science class so that si to be somewhat expected.  Would answer questions if you asked or went to his office.  Would answer questions via email as well.  overall the class was fine.
rude, arrogant, very unfair with grades if you are not one of his favorites.

he is so rud

DO NOT take this professor! He does and will not give clear directions. Tells you that you have to "figure it out" when there was no direction given at all. He will not help you, and blows you off if you aren't a chemistry major. Very hard grader, and gives you more work than what the class is for. DO NOT TAKE!!!!!!!!!!!!
As long as you come to class and do the work you will pass.  Expects you to know the material for class.  Will help you if you ask.  Played music in class to keep it light
Standard lab.  Be sure to write down stuff.  He doesn't give handouts or the lecture powerpoint.  Didn't like the group work.

He was a good teacher in some ways, but bad in others. He took the time to go over the lab before actually proceeding, but was VERY vague and rude when answering questions. You essentially had to tell him your question was stupid to get it answered fully.

Very rude and treats you like you are very dumb if you don't understand a question.I would look for a teacher else wear. He is a very smart man, but I think he is too smart to teach.

lot of work for a 1 credit class. Labs were pretty straight forward. DInt like the group work. He would help if you asked him. typically by email was easiest.

Dr. Oehrle isn't as bad as people make him out to be. He is a challenging professor and if you don't understand the subjects then you will struggle.  Make sure you have the GRL textbook. lots of work for a onw credit class.  does give a good prelab that goes over the lab.  pay attention to that.  didnt like group work.  some in the group didnt do much.  played music during lab.  overall was ok.  did grade stuff pretty quickly

He is very rude and disrespectful towards his students. He is very vague on his assignments and is not approachable. Cracks a lot of jokes, sometimes humorous, most of the time, very harsh. Not extremely helpful, and often times gets angry when asked too many questions. Listen very carefully to things when he runs through them the first time, or else you will likely be very lost in lab.
Class was fine. Doesnt give out the prelate. You have to take notes. Class was fine.
Show up and do the labs. Youll pass.
She is an amazing teacher. Easy on grading and on the eyes.
I really enjoyed her class.  It was difficult, but it's worth it in the end.

This class is tough. Professor Johnson must be consience of workload, because she kept giving us assignment after assignment. Forgot the course number but the class was geomorphology. Sarah is very demanding as a teacher and will pile on the assignments. You WILL have multiple assignments due finals week. I did get my money's worth for these 4 credit hours.

She explains everything amazingly. basically prints out the lectures for you.  she love geology and gets into it super hard... but at 8 in the morning her excitement is not well recieved ha.. i thought it was funny because shed ask questions and no one would answer...she pumped if you did well tho.  a nice, fair lady. Easiest of the sciences. First time letting us use notecards on test. Records class. Nice teacher. Boring though.

She is very knowledgeable but fails to convey the material well to her students. Very Good teacher. I have learned a lot and have had fun in the process. Take her!!!

Interesting class, but hard. The content of the class could be overwhelming if you don't know much about Geology. She teaches well, but the tests are hard and her grading is not very merciful. if you want an easy Gen Ed. then take this class. She is a fantastic teacher and I would take again. I am not much of a science person and she somehow made me interested in it. She is super friendly and grades fairly.
She is one of the best professors in the GLY department. 10/10 would always take again.

If you're taking this gen-ed online in hopes it's laid back and simple, think again. There is A LOT of work! A test, quiz, and video lectures every week. You can't skip through the lectures. She is very clear that it is almost never late to turn in assignments & will accept late work for partial credit all the way up to the last day of classes. One large "project final" worth 100pts at end.

I misspoke a few days ago (see below for post listing how many grades where it says there is a final project not final exam). It's cumulative and worth 116pts.

Took this class online. It's all laid out before you start so you know exactly how much work you're going to have. There's a decent amount of assignments each week but none of them are really that hard.

I took her online class as a gen ed. requirement and I'm glad I did! She gives a lot of homework and tests/quizzes but you have a lot of time each week to complete it. I didn't really use the book much, except for tests. Her lectures are enjoyable and interesting! I don't particularly like science but she made it really interesting to learn.
Do the work and apply yourself, and you will be fine.  You deserve the grade you earn.

Attendance is for a grade, and the final exam was a group project, which you'll either love or hate. Textbook is necessary for all assignments, but exams are all online so they're manageable. Very easy!!! I would definetly take her again.  No book required for this online class.  AWESOME!!!!
Challenging. Kasel is excellent returning emails or questions.

very boring teacher. She cant teach and is not very helpful. She does returen emails quick though. She also needs to learn to dress better.

class is for non-majors and is pretty boring. he is pretty quiet, but willing to help if you need it. tests are hard, so study more than the night before. powerpoints are good and he puts everything on blackboard. I would recommend him.

she is a very good teacher and if you dnt get something she will go over it until you do in class she hands out practice test and i do reccomend her to anyone!!!
