he is good teacher but he always tries to cut marks of your work as possible as he can. You barely take full mark in assignment or lab report. I recommend to take your class with Mrs.Fernando rather than taking class with him. Fernando gives you the full mark when you deserve it

He's one of the best! Zacate definitely cares about how his students are doing. If you take the time to get help outside of class when you're confused and ask questions, you'll do well.

Probably the biggest waste of my time. I worked incredibly hard and got mediocre grades. I'm not a bad student either. Avoid this man at all costs.

Zacate is an amazing professor. He makes sure that his students know what to study for on the exams. He is always giving out practice questions and making sure students understand that material. He is always available to ask questions and makes the material fun to learn.
tough grader but really helps you learn your stuff. If you are looking to go higher in physics/engineering, he is a good one to get.

Foletta is an amazing professor. She gives you all the tools you need, and the time to ask for whatever help you need. If you're doing bad, it's your fault. Not hers.

She is a good professor. Stats is not my strong pt so I did go to class almost every day. You miss one class and you actually miss alot. She is very helpful though, used to be a nun. A tip for this class, don't go on the first day. For this course you have to get an 18/20 on a basic skills exam you take on your own time. You only have 3 chances to pass it. total waste of time. rambles on. Has complete conversations with himself while trying to teach class. Glad you made it in life pal but what about the rest of us? I really don't want a degree saying I'm an engineer unless I know what I'm doing. Are you ever going to teach us anything?

He's alright. His lectures are incredible boring and he took the whole class time reading the powerpoint (3 hour class). But other than that, the assignments and tests weren't too bad. Do not take this class if you're going in knowing little or nothing about SQL. Strongly recommend learning SQL on your own before taking this class. Lectures incredibility dull and nauseating. SHE IS TOTALLY AMAZING!!!! She has been by far my favorite professor at NKU!!! i am not a math person, or an A person, and I got an A+ with her.. she explains everything clear and is always willing to help. I would DEF recomend her! GREAT GREAT GREAT

She was amazing! I got A's on all the course exams...Make sure you do the homework, and if you have a question go to her during office hours! Her final was extremely difficult so make sure you work hard on the other tests! She gives you points for homework and coming to class! Highly Recommended!
She is a great teacher. Do the homework and you'll do great.
She taught me a lot that other professors couldn't. I would recommend her.

Very Helpful teacher.  I did well in the class and learned a lot.  Her tests were not to hard if you did the homework.  If you skip the homework then you will have problems in the class. She is a good professor and very willing to help students, but I hated the class. I've never been good at math, and she does not allow calculators. Cain is a great teacher and super helpful. Hard to fail unless you don't seek her help. Most test questions are right out of the homework. She is also very sexy  which  doesn't hurt.
awesome

Very good teacher.  She can really explain math concepts very well.  I never even used the book and received an A based off of her class lectures, homework and the use of Web Assign.  She thoroughly helped me prepare for more advanced math classes.  I recommend highly.
very nice, hard exams, talk to her and you will get help. love her!

I highly recommend her. She does give out homework so make sure to keep up with that and study for tests and you'll do just fine! I love how she always gives a bonus?

Wonderful instructor. This was the second time I had taken the course. My grade went from a D to an A. She is willing to help any student that is willing to put the time and effort into learning. Whether math is your worst or best subject TAKE HER!

I hate math but love mrs.cain. She is clear and easy to understand. She has a way of explaining the process in a way that math dumbies can get. I arranged my schedule around being able to take her for calc next semester.

Very helpful, sweet, and genuinely wants everyone who pays attention to succeed. She grades fairly. I had it in the summer, and she kept it interesting the whole time we were in her class and I hate math. No caculator, but it's easy. I made an A and I suck at math.

Very helpful, sweet, and genuinely wants everyone who pays attention to succeed. She grades fairly. I had it in the summer, and she kept it interesting the whole time we were in her class and I hate math. No caculator, but it's easy. I made an A and I suck at math.
Great professor. Very sweet and is always willing to help you. Take her!
it was hard for me... I had to get alot of tutoring... she goes fast in class...

We had quizzes, and ended up doing them on the blackboard in groups.  Tests aren't the easiest, but if you know the material it's simple.

I dont have much to say about thsi class other than if you dont like or understand math very well do not take her.  She goes really fast and expects you to know alot of material already.  Great person and grewat personality but not the best algebra teacher i have had.  She is hot though i will have to say that
This class was very difficult.. Wasnt clear all the time.. we weren't allowed to use calculators.. expected to know a lot before coming in.. no reviews.. tests were difficult.. Went too fast..
hated this class. she went was to fast and just expected you to know everything.
Great teacher.  Good explanations, and she's by far the hottest teacher I've had during 4 years here.

She's a skilled prof, although her tests will ascertain your skill level in short order (i.e. they're no joke). If you're one of those people who talk incessantly in class prepared to get hammered as she won't stand for it.

If you are not a math whiz going in, this class starts out pretty rough.  However, if you are willing to put in some extra effort and spend time meeting with her outside of class you will learn a lot. Also, she really does care that you are building solid foundations in the class, and will work with you to help you understand if you ask.Very nice!

This class was NOT easy - it was a summer course...but other professors will cut out material. She did not. Also has a tendency to get flustered when class time is running out and she hasn't covered a topic for the next class test.  Will cover it quickly and it will be confusing. You definitely need to do a lot on your own outside of class to pass.
Difficult course.  No teaching really involved, it's more of a pick your answer and prove it by argument class.  Confusing and hard tests.  Homework wasn't graded.
to fast

hard to follow.  the notes are different from the homework, and both are different from the tests. i took AP Statistics and Precalculus in high school, so this class is surprisingly difficult.  she seems like she doesn't really want to be there.
She assigns all odds for the homework so that you can always check your answers.  Plus, she always has opportunities for extra credit on tests or for in class board work.  Great teacher.
Nice teacher and knows what she is talking about. Tough grader and goes against her word consistently. Try for a different teacher.

Professor Cain knows her stuff. She has high expectations of her students, and makes them clear. You *need* to do the homework in order to be successful in her class. She makes herself available during office hours and will help you if you're struggling, but don't expect her to let you slide if you fail and didn't seek help. Would take again.

She's a nice woman, and an easy grader (I received over a 100%). The homework is optional, and I rarely ever did it and still managed to get A+'s on every test. She moves a little fast at times, though. For our unit on probability, she covered a different section every day and it was a LOT to take in.

This class is very difficult. If you take this professor, take full advantage of her office hours. She's very nice and approachable and is always ready to help students. Her tests are hard and she doesn't leave room for a lot of partial credit, so be prepared to spend a lot of time studying for her exams. Her exams are worth most of your grade.

Toughest grader I've ever seen. A small mistake could take you the whole question mark. homework grading takes the entire semester. usually, she lectures at the beginning of each chapter and for the rest of the classes just solve the questions by the end of that chapter. would Never take with her again.

Professor Cain knows what she is talking about. The homework was NOT optional and she did grade it. The homework was overwhelming, though. I'm a PACE student, so with a 50+ hour job, the two classes, the 400+ homework questions was way too much. I spent more on doing the homework for this class than I have for any class in my college career!

I'm taking online classes & have had great experience with the teachers until I took this class. The tests she assigns are absurd. You have to connect a webcam so she can watch you. Then have 1 HOUR to print, take, scan & upload the 7 page test. I tried contact through email & online office hours. No Response.  Promised my test back, never sent it.

She is very hard and confusing. She actually made me hate math more than I already do. She has ENDLESS amounts of homework. I had such a hard time keeping up and her exams are impossible. Get ready to teach yourself. She is very contradictory about using a calculator too. Maybe a nice person, but should not be teaching

Absolutely terrible. She was very bad at getting back to important emails. Brushes over material, as if you already know it. The tests are hard and involve a long process. You must record each exam, take pictures of your work, copy it into a word document and submit it under an hour.  If math is hard, avoid. You will be teaching yourself.

I was nervous to take Professor Cain after reading some of these reviews. Yes, you do have to take tests over webcam and upload it within an hour, and there is quite a bit of homework. The saving grace is that Ms. Cain is absolutely great! If you need help, like I did, she is there for you and will do whatever she can. Definitely would take again!

Professor Cain knows what she is talking about, however if math is a weak subject for you avoid her. She lectures expecting you to have a clear understanding of the basics already and she does NOT ALLOW any calculators on her exams. She is very old school which is not helpful for students with weak math skills.

Ms. Cain is an excellent professor; not only does she have a wonderful grasp on the course material, she knows how to articulate it well. If you like math, if you don't like math, take her regardless; she makes it manageable. Would recommend to anyone!

I had Shelley for an online class and it was absolutely AWFUL. She didn't allow us access to video ourselves, which you have to do for each exam or else you'll receive a 0. She took over a week to email us back with this issue. I personally had issues with compatibility and missing problems on my exam and she never fixed this issue either.
Worst professor I've had. Takes 3 weeks to respond to emails. Too many assignments that you don't know what to do with yourself.

She is horrible at responding to emails. For an online professor, not to respond to students emails for 3/4 weeks is setting the student up for to struggle. She is a very touch grader and give very hard tests. She assigns lots of homework and power points to watch and she flies through them very fast, get the pause button ready.
Very helpful teacher and made the class easy to understand.  Tests weren't bad if you do the homework. She uses the book a lot for homework. Didn't take attendance for me.
She does not allow enough time for explanation before moving onto the next section. She will answer homework questions in email but usually does not respond until the day before the next class.
Learned a lot, but we did not review subjects ever. We just covered one chapter each class and then moved on.

She is exceptionally good at explaining math concepts and connects them to future math classes. Very fair grader. Assigns lots of 'hard' homework so she can have 'easier' tests. Book is necessary- all homework comes from it. If you do your homework tests aren't bad. Splits tests into calculator and non calculator parts-get used to not using it!
Great teacher, very helpful and overall great experience, Plenty of extra credit to help your grade
She is great at explaining the material and is willing to give extra help when needed.

Please avoid her. The material isn't too difficult, the problem is she has a very tough grading rubic, which she mentioned several times in class. While this doesn't hurt those who are good at mat, it penalizes those on the borderline, or not doing well. She also doesn't allow calculators during tests.

Professor Cain is a really nice person and a really good professor. She is always willing to help you and she gives extra credit. She explains things well. HOWEVER, her grading in this class is killer. She has little in the way of points. She states that she will give partial credit, but don't expect it. There really isn't, she is a harsh grader.

She was absolutely amazing. I and math have never had a good relationship so I have a hard time understanding stuff. She was reAlly patient and she helped me a lot. Her explanations of math concepts were great. I would gladly take her for every math class I ever have to take.

She is a great professor and knows and loves her subject. She assigns homework every class, but doesn't collect it. The homework is helpful, but not mandatory. No Comments

Took this as a three hour night class. The only night class that I have taken where I did not get out early a single time. Often past 9PM. The only grades that are taken are 4 tests and participation points. She's very picky in her grading and doesn't give too much sympathy for those students that don't do well on her exams. He is a very laid back and fun teacher to have.  His notes/lectures are a little scattered, but his tests are fairly easy.  I would take him again.
Great teacher. I learned a great deal in this class. Some test material is covered only in lecture, so you have to attend class. The field trip was super fun!
Decent prof, some classes more interesting than others.  Tests kind of hard, but the class really wasnt much work.  I loved the way he said the word "heat".

He's my favorite professor at NKU. Class was really interesting, and he always was keen on keeping our attention, even making the occasional Sarah Palin joke. Took online class. One forum per week with an extra credit assign. to add up to 10% to final grade. Tests were a little difficult but extra credit and easy assignments made up for it!

NEVER responds to emails.  Has a difficult time teaching a class that requires a broad knowledge of biology because he's so pigeonholed and narrow-focused on his area of content.  Grades papers on an English basis using incorrect guidelines.  Should stick to upper division courses within his realm of biology.

Very easy going and laid back.  He doesn't really mind what it is you do so long as you put forth effort and do reasonably well.  He's smart, knows his stuff, and is willing to help you if you're having problems.  He's a cool guy, I'd take him again.

By far my favorite professor in the Biology Department. He's very passionate, caring, laid back, and the most easy going professor there is! I wish I could have taken more of this classes. Highly Recommended over all others.

This prof. is one of the best. Take his class if you want a super easy A, even if the subject is an upper level. Just show up and take notes, you don't need to readbuy the book. shouldnt have been as hard as it was with him. very nice, great guy but not a good teacher. test questions were confusing and poorly written. not many asnmnts so you live and die by the tests. his power points are hard to study from and his study guide is the book. lectures are super boring. 1st words, "Very few get As in my class!" workedmybuttoff

Dr. Acosta teaches ecology in a very effective way by explaining graphs and charts instead of reading a powerpoint. Not boring.  The class is very test heavy but the tests are not hard if you pay attention.  Nice guy, its hard to read him though.

Dr. Acosta has been one of my favorite professors. He teaches ecology good, and makes sure you understand the material. All exams on online, which is a awesome thing. Easy to get along with, would take again.

He is a very easy A. MC quizzes, lot of microscopes on tests, pic picture of each stuff you see on microscopes and memorize this and you will be ok. It is not a hard class, even for foreign with a horrible English as me. Participate!! and you will have "extra consideration."

He was one of the worst professors I've ever had during my time at NKU. He claimed that it was "not his responsibility to teach the class" and refused to give a lecture. Currently taking ecology with Acosta, this man REFUSES to actually teach students while in class. Im begging you not to take this professor. Thats all.

Dr. Acosta is a nice guy but should absolutely not be teaching this course. This class is supposed to be a lecture yet there has not been one lecture the whole semester. You're given about 3 chapters a week and expected to take a quiz on the assigned chapters each week. By taking this course you will practically be your own prof the entire semester

In this class you will basically be your own proffesors becuase you only get one day of lecture and it is him listening to students discussion boards. Awesome professor. Answered any questions I had, and made it clear.

She legit wears a fanny pack everyday. She's one strange woman, but very enthusiastic about what she teaches. HER QUIZZES AND PRACTICALS ARE HARD! She gives study guides and has a review webpage but my biology lecture grade is going from an A to a B just because of her crappy grading.

Where to start, this lady is horrible. She is the worst lecturer, I could barely stay awake. She wears a fanny pack to every class, she probably keeps the souls of students she has failed in there. Don't take this teacher if u want a passing grade.

She is a very tough grader. Her practicals and quizzes are extremely hard. But she  is a great teacher. You can't expect pass and upper level classes without studying.

Dr. Whitson is hard to listen to.  She is knowledgeable but its hard to absorb it from her.  If she doesn't like you, she will grade you unfairly.   If you do all your assignments on plants and do it well then you'll be fine.

Awesome teacher! Hard to listen to because she loves to talk but funny. Very caring, willing to help and likes to keep the class going. Class is not mandatory but there are small quizzes in class. Grades weird but only takes off .1 (and small numbers) for each mistake.
Absolutely horrible

Whitson is a very intelligent women. She is hard to follow at times. I would recommend taking her for Microlab. Very tough material but Maggie goes by the book and notes exactly. She is a really really really bad teacher! I got a bad grade in there because she made her 4 question quizzes in class way more difficult than they should have been! Honestly, Just dont take her. She expects you to do college level work at her professional level and grades super toughly. Also, finds any opportunity to take points off. Avoid taking her class. She is the toughest grader I ever know from my four years of college. You wouldn't what to expect in her exam, she doesn't give you a study guide and her exam is extremely difficult.

Absolutely terrible. I would ask a question in lab and she would say she "doesn't know". I don't know if she was just trying to get me to answer the question on my own or if she honestly didn't know. If youre in BIO120, take her for lab! She is funny and you can clearly see that she cares about her job. Quiz every week over the last lab and two practicals. Good choice for this class.

HORRIBLE!! Never got an A in her class. She expects a lot from you and never explains how to do something. Worst class Ive ever taken! Both of my lab partners dropped out within the first couple weeks!

She is the most amazing prof i have had. I hate chem and still do but she makes sure that you understand what you need to know. Dr. Ball was the only reason that I even took chemistry and had fun. She is sooooo incredibly helpful, and when I had a problem with one of the other students, she listened to me and gave me a pep talk. If you have to wait till another semester to take chem, take Dr. Ball.

PJ is a BOSS! she is so cool and extremely helpful.  i hated chem lec so much, but she made me love chemistry from her lab alone!! i recommend her to everyone!!

Oh she is simply the best teacher. Always happy in class because she makes it easy to understand and she is willing to help. I aced her class easily..I recommend PJ Ball everytime...She is sooooo cooooool.

GREAT TEACHER! She is ALWAYS willing to help and explains things clearly. Her lab is a lot of fun and she makes you feel comfortable. I would DEFINATELY recommend her- its teachers like her who keep students at NKU
THE BEST TEACHER EVER....WOYLD TAKE HER CLASS OVER AND OVER!!!
Extremely helpful. She realizes that most people hate chemistry and really tries to help you understand it. Plus she is HILARIOUS. I would definately recommend her class to anybody.

PJ is an awesome teacher! I wish I could have her as a teacher again!

Pj was amazing! GREATEST. TEACHER. EVER. PERIOD. Labs are normally not my thing but I actually enjoyed comin to class every week. I actually attended every lab, which is unlike me, especially in the morning. I love her!!!!!!!!!!!

PJ is an awesome teacher! She is very friendly and extremely helpful. I would definitely recommend her. She makes powerpoints for class and has them available online. She also gave plenty of time to complete her online quizzes. She is so understanding of her students. I loved her!

THE BEST PROF EVER!!!!!!! Very nice and always very helpful.

BEST PROFESSOR AT NKU. Love PJ! Made chemistry sooo easy for me!
One of the best professors I've had at NKU. The assignments are easy to follow even if you are not the best at chemistry. Easy A if you do the work. The labs are fun as well.
BEST PROFESSOR EVER!! Take her for both lab and lecture and you will do amazing.
Shes just a top tier teacher. No more no less.
The most amazing professor! She makes learning so easy and is always available to help and is extremely kind!

PJ was probably the best professor you will take at NKU. She WANTS you to pass her class and learn. Super kind and willing to help you understand the content. She gives plenty of practice worksheets and if you do them you'll pass her class no problem.

PJ is by far the best professor I've ever had. She teaches the information so clearly and doesn't make you feel stupid for asking questions, but rather encourages them. She truly cares about her students and wants them to succeed above anything. Her lectures are amazing. If you're taking a chem class, trust me - you want PJ. Hands down THE BEST.

One of the nicest professors ever. She takes a lot of time out of her schedule for her students and really does care about their success. super available outside of classes, even just to chat. So funny and sweet, if I could take this course again just to get to see her more I absolutely would!

Dr. Ball is absolutely amazing and wants everyone to succeed in her class. Her class is very lecture heavy but she does her best to keep everyone engaged.  In each module, she posts lecture videos, practice worksheets, and the answers. Her lectures are very open and people are able to ask questions whenever they need to.

PJ is awesome! I took chem online but if had better time management or took it in person I would have probably gotten an A. She's super caring and the way that she teaches makes things so easy to understand. I learned the organic chemistry unit like it was first grade math.
Pamila Ball should be one of the finest human and professor in the university. She is the most humble and understanding professor who cares and guides the student throughout the journey.
Professor Ball is an excellent teacher, and she made a difficult class easy to understand and excel at! She provides plenty of practice problems, and she is very easy to communicate with.

Pj is such an amazing professor. She is willing to help with everything. She is clear about what is on the exams. If you follow the worksheets she has you will do just fine. Highly recommend taking her.

I had PJ for lecture & lab. PJ was always willing to meet before& after class, & during her office hours. Exams & quizzes are majority of your grade, but she does include participation points. The final exam is cumulative. For lab, PJ was always willing to explain topics different ways. She was also willing to check your lab packet for correctness.

She is my favorite professor. If you put in the time, she gives you everything you need to succeed. Even if you do not understand something, she will take as much time as you need to help you figure it out. I loved her!

She is one of the best professors I have ever had. I wish she taught more than Chemistry. She will walk you through everything that she does and she will have a bunch of study sessions. I highly recommend taking her class and lab together if possible. She cares a lot about her students and their success.

PJ Ball is probably the best thing that has ever happened to NKU. She is the kindest soul I have ever met. She is so passionate and helpful and cares deeply for her students. If you are struggling DO NOT HESITATE to email her or go to her office hours. She is there for everyone to succeed!
By far one of the best professors Ive ever had. I was scared going into Chemistry but she made it seem easy with how great she can teach. I wish PJ could teach every single class I have!

Professor Ball is awesome and super sweet. We did half online half in person and it was great. She made lab super fun. She answers all questions and is fast at replying if you are not in person. Would recommend taking her.

he really is a good guy, however not a very good teacher. he is extremely monotone and has a very strong accent. this combo makes it very easy to just tune him out and surf the web. the assignments arent too difficult. make sure you get the textbook and you should be fine. t/f tests are common, and made for an easy B

I took a web course with Raghaven. He has an accent, but you get used to it. His assignments are fairly easy, but I found the questions on his T/F quizzes awfully specific and difficult to answer without using the textbook. Overall he is a decent professor who is able to explain the concepts fairly well.

I took this class online. You have to listen to his recorded classes from like 10 years ago and can not understand a word that he says. I got a A  in his class but I felt like we did nothing that I would need to use, just a whole lot of diagrams not working with db's. The tests are all T/F and really specific so impossible to get a good grade on.
if you need help he is there. t/f are hard but you will get an A in the class regardless.

He is a very nice professor and very helpful and yes his tests are true and false but I don't think they are hard if you pay attention to readings and the lecture you will do good. I took a web class and didn't read the book, nor did I listen to the lectures still I got a B,  I just wish there were more prof like him at NKU

Tough to learn when you can't understand a word he says. Don't bother listening to pre-recorded classes, the mic is 20 ft away and all you can hear is people coughing. Made it through the class, but have no skills. Didn't learn a thing.
He is a very intelligent professor and knows the subject matter thoroughly.  If you can get over is strong accent you can definitely learn some good stuff from him.

Dr. Raghavan is a very knowledgeable professor. You will learn a lot throughout the year as long as you apply yourself in the assignments and pay attention in class. The quizzes are all T/F and can be difficult. Try hard on the in-class labs and assignments and you can definitely learn a lot as well as earn a good grade.
Good class. Difficul, but he is very helpful. There is a lot to learn and difficult subject matter. I would not recommend trying to take the class on-line.
Good class. Difficult, but he is very helpful. There is a lot to learn and difficult subject matter. I would not recommend trying to take the class on-line.

I'm not going to say that Prof. Raghavan does not know the material covered in the course, but he teaches the it like we've been covering the material our whole lives. If we fall behind, he refuses to help and passes the burden of teaching to out-of-class tutors. Prof. Raghavan is by far the least helpful instructor i have ever had.
Took his time explaining how to do the assignments.  I knew the subject matter going in, however he was methodical in his approach and stopped to answer any question.

The SAP topics class for undergrads was very simple and helpful. He did a great job taking his time through the material so it wouldn't overwhelm you. I am sure he is much more difficult in other classes, but he knew the majority of us were graduating that semester, so he made it easy on us. Would take again.

Dr. Raghavan knows his stuff but expects the students to know the material already. Very difficult TF quizzes and tests that are worded different. This class is tough and will take some studying and practice. Dr. Raghavan is not quick to get back to discussion board questions or emails.

Not a good professor at all. If you try to get help he will just be rude and will not help you with your problem. When I asked him for help he made a very rude comment to me and I was not very happy about it. He is unwilling to help and unwilling to teach. His lectures are hard to understand and the tests are difficult.

I took this course online. I would not take him again. The organization of the course was difficult to keep track of: assignments pop up randomly, lectures posted inconsistently, unclear directions and conflicting due dates. He doesn't always respond to questions in a timely manner and when he does, he doesn't always give a clear answer.

Very difficult class and very confusing overall. Instructions for assignments were not clear at all and recorded lectures were hard to follow. It is possible to get through but you will not have a fun time.

Definitely in the top 3 for worst professors I've had in undergrad/grad. He acts as if it's a burden on him for you to contact him for questions, he gives very little feedback on your incorrect answers, even if you ask for add. feedback. I would stay away if at all possible. Plan to teach yourself, which shouldnt be required for a grad level course
Very Knowledgeable. The online class was very organized.  You have to keep up with the work assigned, Is helpful and gives feedback immediately.

He is a great professor. I am surprised to see so many negative reviews here. He is approachable and very helpful. If you really want to learn the subject take his classes. His classes are not for people who wants to get easy grades. Both the classes I took with him are challenging but the class exercises are worth the effort. Best class in my MS
Great Teacher! The material is difficult but he does a great job of explaining it clearly and gives several assignments to learn the material. Would definitely take again.
The class was challenging as we had to learn how to use two different software.

Knows the material but has a very boring voice which makes it difficult to stay awake.  His quizes are ONLY true/false and the questions are worded strange.  The assignment instructions are very unclear and contain many grammatical errors.  I got huge point reductions for not doing the assignment correctly when the instructions were unclear.

I was interested in the topic so I took it when one of my other classes was dropped but I have found difficulties with the professor. His instructions are not clear and he will drop points if you do not do the problem he wants you to approach it. He will not give you a chance to retry work. Very different from my other profs in INF classes.

Lectures have been pre recorded from before the pandemic. There are frequent audio issues and half of the content is skipped over without elaboration because "you can read about this yourself." 
Also, the only way to contact him is to call his cellphone number, no email afaik.
Finally, all tests use lockdown browser and there are no retakes.

He always takes long lectures and repeats the concepts well to make sure all students understand. He grades moderately and expects hard-work from student before approaching him for any help. He is nosy about student's personal life and activities and tries to get all details. Also he expects students to visit him in office once in a while.
There is a lot of group stuff, he offers extra credit in case you do need it. As long as you show up, pay attention and study a little bit, it would be hard to get anything less than an A.

LOVE LOVE LOVE this professor!! He's awesome! I took him for a University101 class my freshman year but had to drop because of work...he still remembered me and said he was actually happy I was taking another one of his classes not mad that I dropped one. Takes the time to know every student! Quizzes and tests are not hard, but you gotta study!

He has lots lots lots of energy when he is teaching. It is hard not to pay attention.  He really cares about what you are getting from his class. He offers extra credit and as much help as you want.  He is super flexible and really laid back although he is very passionate about the topic.

Energetic! He has loads of energy.  His enthusiasm is very contagious.  He is super flexible and offers any and all assistance you could possible need. He makes it difficult not to get caught up in the class and look forward to it even twice a week for 4 hours!
AWESOME professor!!! always excited, great sense of humor, and not too shabby on the eyes either ;) One of the best professor yet!!!

He is a great professor. He makes it fun and exciting. He literally makes up a dance for how plate tectonics slide past each other. Too funny!! I highly recommend him. I learned a lot and had fun while doing it.
Easy class, hilarious professor, attractive.

He is pretty easy going, he allows you to get all work turned in, also he really likes making friends and will buy you breakfast or lunch if you hangout with him, he is just a all around cool guy and incorporates a lot of group stuff into your class work
Professor Varrone is great, best teacher for UNV 101.  Easy assignments, easy grader.  He is very funny and helpful.  Makes the class fun.  Would take again for sure.
Although he's just a UNV101 professor, he's simply amazing. He helped me a lot with my personal life and he really cares about the students. He will always be there if you need a helping hand.

Awesome professor! I had him for a 9 am class and I looked forward to it every time! It was easy to understand and really was into the topics. He made class fun but at the same time taught you a lot! Definitely recommend Varrone!
He is a great professor and Is very helpful. He lets you design your own class which was cool. You have lots of busy work but the class is super easy as long as you go to class and do your work.

tests and quizzes are beyond easy. questions are pulled of his powerpoints word for word. uploads all the powerpoints and assignments. very understanding and helpful. sometimes would bring in food from around the world. awesome guy. not a hard grader.

Proffessor Varrone was a very likeable teacher and person. He made learning the criteria very interesting and fun! He was very easy to talk to. You could tell that he loved geography and that made the material a lot more fun to learn as well. He even offered to help us plan our trips if we needed advice on places to go and amazing places to visit.
Great proffessor definitely take his class!

10 semesters of college and he was easily my favorite professor. He has such fun classes and he genuinely cares for students. I got an A, and this is coming from a slacker. I'm not saying he hands them out, but he really makes you want to learn... Heck, he even made me question my majors! Excellent.

Jeff was an amazing professor! He knows that people have personal problems and is always there to talk to. He gives out many assignments, but they aren't that hard to do. He lets his students design how classes will be taught, and my class had no tests. I highly suggest Jeff as a UNV 101 professor.
Professor Varrone was the best professor I have had. He cared deeply about his students. He was very knowledgable in geography making for a great class. Would absolutely take him again.
He was awesome! Would recommend this class and professor to anyone!

He just loves the world and wants to share his passion for the world and how it works, why it works, and where it is all comes together. He does mostly lectures, but they are interesting because of his passion. He gives a ton of extra credit.

Varrone trascends beyond the "professor platform" and into your life as a friend & role model. He genuinely cares about your success. He will always set aside time to meet with you and give you advice for anything you need. He is funny and makes an effort to make classes engaging. He's the professor you want to catch up with outside of class.
Great man, just let him know if you can not make it to class no big deal.

Great professor!! He is always there to help and he is always in a great mood. Having someone like him in a college setting is something you don't find everyday. I would call him 1 in a million. I would take any of his classes regardless what class it is.
great professor, loves to teach. can make even a boring subject interesting

Professor Varrone was always really into class. He loved teaching and made geography interesting and easy to remember. Tests and quizzes were easy but all fill in the blank. He also provided extra credit. On the first day of class he gave us his phone number in case we ran into any difficulties during the semester.
He is very fun and outgoing and loves to teach. He always made every subject interesting and every project fun. If you love food you'll also love this class.

He is an amazing professor. He is passionate about the subject and gets you excited about it as well. His teaching method is also very clear, you just get it with little effort. If you have the chance to take him DO IT!
Great teacher! He is funny and in a way somewhat attractive. I would HIGHLY recommend him. I love this guy!

His teaching style is amazing, he teaches in a way that you just get it. A lot of busy work but he makes it fun. A lot of extra credit opportunities. Also he is always available via email or phone to answer questions or to give you input. If you have the opportunity to take him, I highly recommend him!

Varrone is an awesome professor! I would gladly take any of his classes. He is fun and entertaining and you really learn the material. I never was much into geography but after this class I love it! You rarely use the book and the assignments given are fun, easy, and relate to your experiences. He does test reviews too! Always went because its fun!
Great professor, saw that I was struggling in the beginning of the semester and helped me the best he could to bring my grade up.

Amazing, inspirational guy. He is always willing to help you out specifically in the entrepreneurship track. He is pretty lecture light and the class feels more like a conversation. Participate not because you have to but because the class is genuinely insightful especially if you want to go into business, have this man on your side!

Jeff is a great professor in and out of class! He cares about his students and their learning and is always willing to help in any way he can. The class contains lots of presentations and group work, but as long as you put in the effort its a really fun time with a great teacher!
Such a great professor and person!! Makes class enjoyable, and actually cares about his students. I wish I could take a class with him every semester.

Professor Varrone, Jeff, whatever you call him will make an amazing impact on your life!
He goes above and beyond, making sure you get the most out of his class and life. No quizzes/tests, lots of assignments that get you out & about. Communicate and he'll help, caring & always available, he truly loves his subject. Everyone should take this class!
Such a great teacher!

Jeff was an absolutely fantastic entrepreneurship professor! He is very knowledgeable about business and very passionate about teaching. His care for his students is evident, giving us snacks and money to start a business. If I could describe Jeff in one word... inspiring. How much more can I convince you?? Take his class!
JEFF IS THE GOAT. BEST TEACHER IVE EVER HAD!!!
Varrone teaches in a different way that really gets to his students. 10/10 would take any of his classes.

Professor Varrone is by far the best teacher Ive had at NKU. So much so that I dropped a class to sign up for another class he was teaching. Highly recommend ENTP201 to ALL students. You will learn how to think creatively while having a good time in class. Extra credit available.
He never had a single test the entire semester, but had plenty of projects and assignments.

Prof. Varrone loves his job, and its obvious. He is really cool in general, he brought snacks to class often, and even said if we needed a few bucks he would be happy to lend if it meant we were experiencing something new. I took ENTP-201, a half sem. course. It was pretty assignment heavy but extremely doable. No problem getting an A.

Her Dinosaurs class is so interesting (if you're into that kind of thing) although you have to study and memorize, she is willing to help. She is EXTREMELY understanding when it comes to tardiness and absenses. One of the best science teachers I've ever had! (English major)

Very scatter brained. She takes a REALLY long time to get papers graded and back to you. On quizzes she would give you rock samples you've never seen before. Not very thorough in her explanations. She is generous with extra credit, however.

Her dinosaur class is more about evolution for the first half of the semester and dinosuars the second half. Her tests are easy just study the answers to the reviews. Use the book somewhat, but not enough to buy.

Professor Bertog takes an unprecedented amount of time to get work graded. This causes things to get backed up and in turn, pushes the courses work load to end of the semester. Stressful. She is open to alternative ideas for her assignements, however. Kills large forests for large amounts of paper to hand out to you.
very disorganized with a cold demeanor

She is very confused about what she needs to do in class as well as very disorganized.  In class her teaching tends to be unclear and strenuous to listen to.  Over all its a simple class if you don't miss a day and partake in all the extra credit.

Very knowledgeable on the subject, but hard for her to get it across to the students. Sometimes you have to pry information from her. Can be very annoying, and very informative.  Very unorganized, but that is part of her charm. And the book is never used.

If you have to take Geology 110, do NOT take her. Too much work for a 100-level class. There is a (simple) assignment each week, in-class assignments, 3 subprojects and 1 overall final project, and 3 exams. Lecture attendance is not mandatory, but lab attendance is. She grades ridiculously hard and doesn't offer much help when needed.

Her class is ridiculously hard. Her presentations are difficult to understand and she is ALWAYS busy. It's hard to get a hold of her when you need her. She acts as if it is a 300-400 level course. Do not take her!

VERY difficult to understand for a 110 class. None of her exams were clear. We had a take home for the final and there were a few questions without the correct answer (she was unaware). She entered a grade that was 20% lower than what I actually received on BB (she was unaware) and none of her PPs were completed prior to class. Always unprepared!

she is the worst professor that I have ever had her exams are a joke way to much information that you aren't even tested on. don't get sucked in thinking she is a good professor because she uses blackboard she took a week off to go on a dig right befor an exam that the average grade was a 72 don't expect much out of her she talks to hear herself ta
Best geology teacher ever.

Dr. Bertog keeps her classes interesting by incorporating hands on experiences such as field trips and in class activities to help further explain the subject matter.  She has exquisite knowledge of the courses she teaches and you can expect to learn a great deal. I would definitely suggest her for any geology class at Northern Kentucky University.
wonderful professor. yes you will do work, but you will learn and she will help you every step of the way. plus with all the field trips and hands on stuff you cant go wrong.
sucks
This class is a challenge. This professor will challenge you. If you don't mind a little hard work you'll get the oppurtunity to sharpen your critical thinking skills and learn a ton of geology.

She would be a good teacher if her test questions weren't so vague.  She would ask, "What is the composition of the volcano," so  you would put the elements/minerals in the magma as the answer, but then she would cross it off and put "explosive."  Explosive is the type, not the composition... That happened so many times.
Dr Bertog is a great teacher, DO NOT Buy the book, we never used it, just print off the powerpoints and you will be fine!  Tests are hard, but at the end she helps you out

If you are a geology major you will take a few classes with her. Not your typical prof, but that is what makes her so great.  Keeps things interesting, and knows her stuff.  I wouldn't recommend for non-geology majors.
She is boring. The lectures are very long and not very interesting. The tests are very hard if you don't study. Attendance is a must to understand

By far one of the absolute worst professors I've had at NKU. Unless you're a geology major, in which case you HAVE to have her, avoid her at all costs.  She reads direct from all handouts and slideshows and contributes nothing extra, is frequently wrong on her own work, and can be difficult to contact. Definitely not someone who should be teaching.

She taught this class as if we were all GLY Grad students. But as long as you come to class & do every assignment & lab she assigns (There is A LOT) there is no way you will fail. She offers 50pts extra credit & if you have an A- you dont have to take the final. I would recommend you make friends & study/do work together to lesson the load.
Very nice! Doesn't lecture a lot and unfortunately expects you to know most of the material before coming in, but when she does lecture its very informational and interesting!!

If not a geology major you dont want Janet. Take Sara Johnson or Rockaway. If you do major in Geo she is the most knowledgeable on staff. If you come to class you will pass. Ive been getting A's since 110 with her. You do have to study. You will get Homework and lots of quizes. She is so weird lol its sooo funny. She is that nerd u grow to love. A+

She is obviously very qualified and knows a lot about the subject, but she should not be teaching students who are not majoring in geology. She often assumed that we knew more about the material than we actually did.

I've just started the semester with her, and I already have a bad feeling. I've heard from others who know her that she's heavily medicated. I'm taking this class at the same time as the prereq due to being written in, and she doesn't seem to want to take that into account much. Rocks might magically be different names on quizzes from what I hear.

Polite and knows her subject well. Her grading scale is built to make your life easier (you get a set amount of free points) Sometimes unprepared, and exams often didn't resemble things we'd gone over. She lectures clearly. My main issue was with the exams, which seemed more involved than the corresponding chapters studied.
She has a lot of E.C. you can do if you don't do well in class. Class and lab is a lot of group work, easy stuff. Friendly teacher.

She is a great person. She is so helpful and caring. I loved her as a person and teacher. Her class in pre-life has a lot going on and test are broad but she has so much extra credit and writing assignments that its easy to get a great grade in her class. I would take her AGAIN!! SHE MAKES IT Impossible TO FAIL!!

By far one of the worst teachers I've had at NKU. Practically threw us into the material we knew nothing about and expected us to complete the work to perfection. She will tell you one thing is correct and then mark it wrong when you receive your grade. In my opinion, she needs to teach her students the material assigned for this class or be fired.

The lectures are fairly boring unless your into that kind of stuff.  I am terrible at anything science (I only took it to fill a gen ed requirement) but I will end up with an A at the end of the semester. If you turn the easy assignments in and at least try on the tests you will learn something and get a good grade.  She does offer extra credit.

LOVE Brooke! She's down to earth and explains the material very clearly. Extremely approachable if you need help! (NICEST professor ever!) No need for the book - she gives all notes and examples in class. Practice problems get posted on blackboard. Show up, take notes, do the practice problems and you'll do fine in the class.
I am terrible at math and have being dropping every math class I took until I got to Brooke. She is understanding, caring, devoted, helpful. This is especially true if you are in need of any help.

She is a great professor. If you go to class no need for the book. Tests are tough, but her practice tests and problems get you ready for the exams and quizzes. She is very approachable and eager to help you understand stats.  I would take a class from her in the future if I could.
Easy professor. She helps you anytime you need it. I frequented her office and she was happy to help me on the assignments.

Math is my BEST subject, and I hated this class.  She puts on an act when she is in front of the students, and does not use blackboard.  If you ask her about your grade she will tell you that you are doing fine, but never gives you an exact answer, and then grade time comes...  People do not finish tests on time, because they are to long to finish
best teacher ever!!! no more to say

she is amazing!! will do anything and everything to help you all you have to do is ask.  She is very clear and makes sure you understand, if you dont speak up and she wont move on until you have it! give practice problems which help big time when it comes to quiz and test time! if you have a chance to take her do not pass it up!!
Brooke is one the best professors I've had.  Everything you write down, she writes on the board so there is no confusion there!  I highly suggest taking her if you are'nt math savvy!
Approachable and helpful. Hard subject but fair grading system and always willing to work with you if you are having trouble.

This teacher is GREAT!! She is sweet funny and explains everything!! You dont need to buy the textbook, you buy this $6 packet and you just fill in the info there! Its a really fun class! I highly recommend this teacher!! Time will fly by!
prof buckley is one of the best in the math/stats department. If you have the opportunity to take a stats class with her, I would high recommend it.

Brooke is by far my favorite professor on campus.  You don't use the textbook, and you do not have any homework assignments.  She is extremely helpful, approachable, and always available for outside help!  Definitely take her for any math and/or statistics course!
She is a very helpful math professor. She will work with you if you are having issues with a certain problem.  She has a very bubbly personality which lights up the classroom!

brooke is one of the best starts teachers out there. she writes all notes in order so there is no confusion.. she cares about that she is doing and her personality makes it easy to stay away in a very boring class. her test are long but if you do homework and the minitab assignments youll finish in time.

She's super nice, way helpful, will explain something to you time and time again until you get it. Attendance isn't required but if you want to have a chance in understanding it it's best you come to class. She makes her own notes so that way you only have to go over what she will actually test you on. I would recommend her for any math/stats class

She was very tough. Do not take her because she will not help you with harder problems that involve calculus. She says you should know that already instead of giving a quick review to jog your memory. She flirts with all the computer geeks and it is very annoying!
She was extremely helpful and gives us examples to work from i would recommend her to anyone.  She explains everything as much as she can.

Brooke is a wonderful professor- very approachable very willing to help- In addition to office hours, she is on campus a majority of the day. She made a 2 hour 8 week class interesting and kept our attention for the entire class. She gives great, relevant, and easy to understand examples. Goes back and forth between examples and notes

She went straight in to everything with calculus without any type of review of it. We had an exam and she didn't give back any of our homework pertaining to that exam until the day of the exam. She said she was applying for tenure so she put that before getting our work and tests graded. Might be a good teacher but she wasn't for this class.

I love Ms. Buckley!!  She really knows what she's talking about and you can tell she really wants everyone to learn it.  Never really much homework, but a lot of in class stuff, and I thought the tests were pretty simple. Overall...great teacher!!

She is the best math teacher I've ever had. She's really sweet and always makes sure everyone knows what she is talking about.  There's homework about every other week, and it's only a few problems. She lets you have a formula sheet that can have anything but examples for exams. Her class is great, definitely take her!
No Comments

She is by far the best math instructor I've ever had. She breaks everything down to a basic format and is always willing to assist those with difficulty in understanding the material. If you have to take a Stat or Math class as a requirement, this is the class to take.
Quite possibly one of the nicest people ever.  Very helpful and let's you use all notes (except examples) on tests.  Really easy, but you take a lot of notes.

Honestly I am sure she is a good professor. She does know her stuff and tries hard. Unfortunately she tries TOO hard. Here's the thing. This is a 200 level course. It *should* not be this hard. It's a sad thing when giving an exam out of 30 people that take then only 3 or 4 actually are able to finish the midterm.
I would not have passed with any other teacher. She was AMAZING!
Great Teacher- She writes everything out so there is no confussion, easy tests and quizzes as long as you take notes, get to drop some bad quizzes, really easy to understand and fun in class.

She is very nice and writes everything on the board and doesn't mind answering questions. Math is my worst subject and all going well with the final I will have a B. Math sucks but with her at least you have a chance of understanding it.

she is so awesome i loved her... dont buy the book!!! save some money... she also gives you study guides which is wat is exactly on the tests and quizzes!!! pay attention take notes and you will love her 2!!!

There are four tests so study or fail. Dont buy the book, its expensive, she doesnt use it, neither will you. Be in class for clicker questions. Overall good class until the cumulative final. Must memorize all equations, maybe 40, and know which equation goes to the problem. Great person and teacher just would never take the class again.
I took stats in high school and ended with a C. I took Buckley my first semester of college and had an A. If you go to class and do your homework it's easy to pass

I don't understand why her reviews are so good. I missed one class and when I returned, I asked if you put the notes on Blackboard and she just laughed at me and said, "umm no." It only got worse when she didn't put the answers to the study guide online. It would be kind of helpful and important to know if we knew we had the right answers. TERRIBLE

Hated her from the beginning. On her textbook requirements there was an expensive book I we had to buy. When I show up on the first day she tells us we don't have to have it and didn't know what I was talking about when I brought it up in front of the class. Very unprofessional and dresses like she rolled out of bed and put flip flops on.
Rough. Do not take.

She will not post notes online which is frustrating and she doesn't post the answers to the study guide online either. I would not recommend this person because she goes fast through packets and does not give you a chance to catch up once you fall behind. Take MAT 115 if you want a better grade and teacher. I am so glad that semester went fast.
If you take this class take her with the lab option. The lab is once a week before class but it saves your grade. She makes it a priority for you to understand the material.

Dr. Buckley presents  statistics in a clear, engaging way. While if you skip class or are just terrible at stats in general, if you do the work and study you should be able to get an A or B. Great professor.

Frankly, Brooke Buckley knows what she is lecturing about! Statistics is like her second language. Stats is not the easiest subject to learn, but if you want a good proffesor to teach you how, and what to learn CHOOSE HER. This is a class that you have to pay attention in! Good luck :)

I would never put any of my friends through what I had to experience. Now that the semester is about over and it is clear I did not do well, I can say she was no help at all. As a professor, she should have seen how bad I was struggling and helped. A good professor that really cares will approach the student to fix the problem instead of ignoring.

she was a horrible teacher and refused to help me during her tutoring hours; on more than one occasion. the first incident she shut the door on me and the second she said life is rough and walked away to help another student that came in after me. I did nothing to this lady. We never even used the textbook. I had to drop her class.
Lab along with the actual lecture was a big help with this stats class

She doesnt give test makeups, even if you have a dr note. When you do labs & you ask for how to do the problems, she wont tell you. Her notes are sometimes diff than they are on the projector. Her videos where she posts questions in them are sometimes unclear. iMath is difficult to use because it doesnt tell you how you messed up.  wont take again.

Did not explain her notes well and had most of the class confused throughout the semester. She will not put notes online or the answers to the study guides making it hard to study or catch up if you are sick. Also, it may actually be helpful to buy the text book because you will be teaching yourself how to do most of the work. Would not take again.

I was nervous going into stats but Prof. Buckley is pretty laid back and all you really have to do is print out the packets she tells you to, follow along in class, and those are your study guides for the exams. As long as you show up in class and try, she's willing to help you whenever you're stuck.

Packets were no help no matter how perfect your attendance was. I printed every packet and always attended class but this professor was always more worried about clicker questions and imath which was a bad website for homework. Overall, run, far, far away if you are trying to get through a stats class with a decent grade.

Brooke is sincerely one of the best stats faculty members. I really don't get it when anyone has anything bad to say about her. She gives great, clear explanations and will go back and reexplain as necessary. I have learned so much in her class and can't wait to take another class with her in the future.

I had to drop because this class was not a math class that I wanted to be a part of any longer. From the first day when she explained the syllabus, I knew this would be a confusing course. The packets on Blackboard had no value and her office hours were pointless because she would only help one student at a time and at one point closed her door.

You'll fail if you don't go to class. She goes off of note packets which are very helpful, but you HAVE to go to class to get the notes. Online homework is not that hard but is due every week. Exams are ok. She tries to relate the material in a way that's easy to understand. For someone that's horrible at math,  I'm passing with her.

Dr. Buckley makes up all her own notes packets and is amazing at explaining things. When I decided to take this class I was extremely nervous about it, but with Dr. Buckley as my professor it turned out to be my favorite class.

I had no problems in this class, maybe the information was just easy for me, but I think DrBuckley gives really good explanations for the material, just go to class, take good notes, and its a breeze, also do the homework.
She's great. She gives you everything you need to pass. If you do the homework and pay attention in class getting an A is easy.

Where do I begin.. She did not do her job, simply made note packets and forced us to follow along. Went to her office hours and she wasn't even there. Came back the next day to find her having a pow wow with other professors, and did not seem like she wanted to stop what she was doing to help me. I just did horrible on the final exam, no help.

I would never recommend this professor to anyone, including my own worst enemy. she has favorites in the class and doesn't seem to care about anyone else. I failed the first test and she didn't take the time to try and help me understand the material better because quite frankly, she couldn't teach it. she didn't use the book either.

Brooke Buckley is the best Stats professor out of all the other Stats professors. Make sure you proint out the note packets, because they help greatly. This is not a hard class if you put in the work. Homework every week. 4 test and 1 final.
can't teach stats. rough semester. do I need to say more? bye bye GPA.

LOL what a class. We had to make a study group to keep up with the class and teach ourselves the entire semester. now that it is over, we all became friends and thank God that this class is over and that we got by with a C.

Dr. Buckley is the best stats professor I have ever had. Anyone who doesn't like her is not putting in the effort to truly learn the material. She's in her office all the time and will willingly help anyone who walks in. She is honestly one of the most positive and helpful people that I know, and this was the most enjoyable class I've ever been in.

Where do I begin with Brooke. She has these packets that you have to print off on your own which is incredibly frustrating and she only works off the packets. She needs to be using a book because students are very confused in her class but she doesn't listen when students tell her that. Overall, run, run far away from this course. not a good choice
Always in her office ready to answer questions. Very prepared and organized lectures. Learned a lot and would take this professor again.

I wouldn't recommend this professor to anyone. She is way to worried about getting all of  the five thousand packets of notes covered within the semester to actually take the time and teach the class. She rants on and on about things that don't make sense to where it doesn't even seem as if she knows what she's actually talking about.

I had to drop after just a few class periods because I could clearly see she wasn't the right professor to teach me stats. I am horrible at math and was told she was one of the best in this subject but she went way too fast for my pace, forcing me to drop and then contact my advisor, questioning why she is being promoted as a good professor.
she is not good at all. i do not recommend her.

Prof. Buckley is great!!! She makes her own notes and explains things so well. Stats can get a little boring, but she makes it fun. She is also willing to help if you are struggling. She grades tests fairly and isnt't nit-picky. If you go to class and pay attention, you should have no problem. I definitely recommend her.
Terrible.. She is very involved in class but does not give homework or book work to help you prepare. Expects you to just learn on your own.

This class was ridiculous. You had class 3 times a week and then a LAB on Wed. before the actual lecture. The lab did not help at all. The homework made no sense and had nothing to do with the class work.
Class is very fast no time to understand. Lab is a waste of time. I was under the impression the lab was to help NOT. Stay away from her....
Boring, in an auditorium, comfy seats, dimmed lights so easy to fall asleep. MUST pay attention to do good, and I hate labs, but she isn't a bad teacher.
She does an excellent job on explaining the topics and examples. Class can get boring at times. But if you need a stat class I would defiantly take Brooke.

Excellent professor! I struggled in the class and the material isnt easy. The class was rough in a lecture hall setting, but she is an excellent individual teacher and was willing to meet for tutoring. She even worked around my busy work schedule to find a time to meet. If she sees the effort on your end, she'll help you out. She rocks!!

I ended up sucking in this class but that was my own fault. I also partially attribute it to the fact that my class was huge (140 people). She is a great teacher though and she ALWAYS took time to answer questions, even considering the overwhelming class size. I highly recommend you take her, especially if you can get in a smaller class of hers.

Very sweet professor. Always helps if you have questions. If don't study, you won't do well. Online homework often, but get as many tries as you need. Very great class, I recommend to anyone with very little knowledge about statistics.
Never responds to e-mails.  if you need help youre better off going to her after class. She has a very whiny voice, and i personally find it VERY annoying. She also giggles a lot...

I have struggled with math my entire life, and she presents things in a way that makes it easy to understand without making you feel like a moron. You do have to work for your grade though. This class is not hard but its not easy either. Stay focused and you will do well. I recommend her over all of the other Stats Professors at NKU.

Professor Buckley is the sweetest woman I have ever met. Her lectures tend to be a bit on the boring side though, seeing as she needs to work through every step of every problem. Would recommend highly for those who struggle with math. If you are good at math you may get a bit annoyed at the thoroughness in which she works some of the problems.
She's a great teacher. She laughs at her own jokes a lot. Gives lots of opportunities to meet with her outside of class for help. She is always willing to explain and repeat if you have questions.

She puts her notes online  and you just fill the blanks in class. She goes at a very slow pace so you  have time to fill everything out. There is a lab once a week but it is not worth a credit hour, which made me mad. In lab you do a worksheet for correctness, but the lab instructor will always help. You have a homework assignment due once a week.

I had Dr. Buckley for STA 394, and it was a great experience. I truly enjoyed the lectures, very cool and applicable class. Dr. Buckley is also very accessible outside of class, she is very nice, and you can tell she cares. With that being said, she expects a lot, and her grading reflects that.

She does give extra credit points on exams. She is really nice and although it was a big classroom size, she still wants to help you. At times the exams got to me because I felt like everything was a bit rushed, but multiple tests are probably better than 2 big tests. Do the HW! Make sure to print out the notes and show up to class!!!

Dr. Buckley is by far one of the best professors I have ever had. If you show up to class, print notes, do the homework, and exam reviews, you will pass. The exam reviews and homework is recycled tests so by doing them, you have a good idea of what to expect on the tests. She also is super helpful outside of class.

Professor Buckley is such a great educator. I had a big classroom size, yet she still made it a priority to take to everyone's needs. The material can be difficult, and studying is highly recommended! However, if you print off her notes, pay attention to lecture, and do the homework, you will be in great shape!

-Absolutely AMAZING!!
-homework is easy 3 tries on every question & doesn't take long 
-gives lots of partial credit on tests if you're wrong
-has review guides for every test and you get extra credit for doing them
-has guided notes print them out and you will learn
-uploads lectures easy to review
-just do reviews you'll do well

I really dislike stats and all mathematics but Dr. Buckley is awesome. She has been super helpful so far in the semester. Put in the work, go to stat lab for tutoring, to her office hours, email her, and print out ALL of the packets you should pass with a C+ or B. She has been a life saver and so patient with me. (I totally bawled in her office) :P

She always responds to all emails within a few hours and they are always helpful. I would use the time after class and in lab to ask her any questions because those are helpful personally. She does go a tad bit fast, but she also does multiple examples of each one so you really just have to pay attention and do the work she gives to pass.

Dr. Buckley is such an amazing professor. Although lots of notes are taken, she sends out guided notes for the class to follow along with and fill in the answers. She is always willing to help, especially during office hours. As long as you take the notes, and do the homework, you are guaranteed at least a B.

what a joke of a class. Horrible professor with little knowledge of what she is doing if you linger away from her note packets. Note packets are just her lazy way of getting out of doing more work. She kicks people out of her office if she is "busy" when she really isnt doing but play on her phone.
If you don't watch the videos and do iMath, you won't pass. Attendance is mandatory but mainly during labs since thats when she gives the exams every two weeks. good luck to say the least.

The class was very easy in my opinion. As long as you do the homework on iMath and do the exam reviews, you should get an easy A. The exam reviews are almost the exact same as the exams she gives which is very helpful. Dr. Buckley is a great professor as long as you respect her and don't be rude (don't leave early, stay off phones, etc.)

I had to spend another semester in college because of her lack of knowledge and willing to help me out outside of class. As someone who is bad at math, I was recommended to take her class as it was easy to follow. When I started to feel confused, I tried repeatedly to talk to her during office hours. She was never willing to help. Thanks a lot.
The exams were too hard

One of the best Math & Stats profs at NKU! She was always willing to help if we had a question and when we changed it to online she put a lot of effort to record a video lesson each day which was very helpful and engaging.

Hazel is awesome.  She explains things AMAZINGLY well.  For upper-level bio majors, please PLEASE ignore the nasty comments below (obviously made by non-majors).  She is great and really knows her stuff.  It's a lot of material to cover so it's a challenging class, but sooo worth it.
She is a great teacher and would advise anyone who needs this class to take her.  She takes a very boring (to me) subject and makes it interesting.
Ignore the mean comments, Hazel is great and really knows her stuff!

Terrible teacher. Her accent was distracting. She's completely obsessed with herself. She often missed class cause she was traveling around the world and her substitute professors had even worse accents than hers! Students are not her #1 priority. She was also very rude when answering questions and always late for Bio 202 lab.

I like Prof Barton-she made the subject interesting and a lot easier to understand. I had her for lab too, and she was always willing to answer questions and help out when needed. Lab was even fun sometimes. Heard she is teaching grad students next semester tho, not 202.

I had her as an advisor and she was awful. Obviously didn't review my information because she talked to me about physical therapy when I was pre physician assistant. Was late to our appointment. I can't imagine having her as a teacher.
Great teacher, she is very dedicated to teaching even though she is very busy with research also.  She knows so much and you will learn a lot!
Awesome teacher, really clear, not that hard if you pay attention and do the reading.
Great Professor

I like this professor. I thought she tried to keep class interesting and it was an interesting subject. She was funny. She also gave extra credit, and fairly easy homework to help bring up grades. She could have made this class way harder than she did. She is also a really interesting person with a lot of good stories.

Absolutely terrible professor. The most self centered teacher I have ever had. I feel sorry for anyone who is forced to take her as a professor. I think that may be why she teaches the classes she does, so no one has a choice.

Great Professor!  Has great knowledge of the microbial world.  Would take again in a heart beat! Home work was minimal with a few papers that made you think.  So if you can't think (like many in the lower classes that gave poor comments) then i wouldn't suggest taking her class. May be a little harder then most but you will learn ten times more!
AWESOME TEACHER. He makes it fun and interesting. Just show up sometimes and pay attention to the power points and the exams will be a breeze. TAKE HIM!
BEST TEACHER EVER, he is the reason I majored in geology and is very helpful with the class and college in general, take him as your professor at least once at NKU

He was an awesome teacher and made integrated science really fun for most of us. I would recomend him to anyone and would love to take him again. I always had a smile and a joke to tell and made class fun!

Pretty easy class if you pay attention. The book is never used, and the notes are always on blackboard. Tests are all multiple choice with 2 short answer. Good to take if you don't like science and just need a credit.

Awesome Teacher!  Take this class if you have to take a science and are not particularly science-minded.  It makes it fun and interesting.  He puts his notes and blackboard and if you study for the test you will be fine.

Thee best science Professor I have had at NKU. The man definitely knows how to keep you interested in the subject matter and his classes are great. The tests are a breeze as long as you study and go through your notes. I would recommend him to anyone taking a science class, get Brackman, he's the best.
Excellent professor. Likes to joke around and have fun unlike other professors. Probably one of the best professors I had in my college career. If you need a science elective take this class.

Brackman is funny and enthusiastic but sometimes hard to really understand since there is a lot of material in his lectures. Some exams are easy and others are ridiculously hard and you can't find the answers in the book or lecture notes. Likes to give quizzes when people don't show up, so go to class. Take him but expect to study a lot to do well.
How can you not like this guy. I've never been good at science and he does great at dumbing it down. Super funny! Our final exam questions were straight from previous test questions. Cake.

He knows how to wake you up at 9am. He's very good at making the class interesting, and also good at using normal terms, so you don't have to be a science nerd to understand what he's teaching. He's probably one of the best teacher's I've had. It's not an easy A, but it's not too hard either.
He is a really nice guy, very laid back. He does very hands on teaching. Does not give a study guide for tests but you do not really need one. If you struggle with science, take him.

This Dangerous Earth...such an intersting class full of very technical and complicated processes; however, Brackman turns all of that into a dumbed down, easy to grasp subject that most students enjoy. Don't expect to get an A, the tests are hard if you don't study. The final is straight from the previous tests. Would take him again.

This class is the basic class of geophysics along with applied geophysics. He puts you into groups and have you work in 'companies' so you understand what the working geophysics word is kind of like. You learn how to write a white paper, learn how to use the instruments, usually undergrads don't get to use these instruments. At NKU you do.

Brackman really wants you to learn the material. As a general class he treats you as if you're not a scientist, but insists on having class discussions and uses visual demonstrations. Great teacher and will help you if you're having trouble. His projects are worth more than his tests so if you're not a good test taker, you'll enjoy the class.

great professor that puts things in simple terms so everybody can understand. makes you think problems out for yourself and challenges you to come to the answer yourself. dont need book!! take him for an easy and FUN gen ed!!

Professor Brackman is a good guy. Nicest, funniest professor I have had. However, the material is a little dry. He will work with you if you have trouble with anything. My final project is bringing in stuffed donuts with GEOLOGY spelled out on them! Do not buy the book unless you have no idea what science is on a general level.

He really is one of the best science professors at NKU! I really enjoyed the class, but it wasn't an easy A! You have to study in great detail for the exams and I would recommend to use the Key Words list that he provides! The final is word for word questions from the old tests! DON'T BUY THE BOOK!! Good and Fun class! I would recommend!!
