Best instrutor at this institution.  Not stuck in the old "we'll do it this way because that's the way it's always been done"--- he's mostly interested in giving you what you need to get a good job in the field.

Take him is you do not like science. He is good at making the subject bearable. Great teacher, and a very fun class. Alot better than expected. BEWARE: by the end of the semester, you WILL know  the theory of plate tectonics.

brackman is cool. class is really chill and he tries to make it as fun as possible. he does a good job explaining the concepts so that everyone can understand. pay attention when you go over the graded quizzes, his tests come directly from them.
No Comments
Extremly nice and helpful.  Be sure to learn the theory of platechtonics
Loved the class.  He made class fun.  He always had a smile and a joke.  He was a good, organized teacher.

I LOVED Master Brackman's class! He is the best professor I have ever had made me decide to major in GLY. Fun class, I learned ALOT. If you show up and put forth an effort you'll make an A. Science haters take this class. He is helpful, clear, he is understanding, and I would recommend him to anyone.
Amazing professor. Very enthusiastic. Fun in class. Recommend highly.
He is one of the best professors ive ever had and keeps you awake and interested throughout the whole class.

he teaches by power points, and uses old test for your study guide, main study guid isnt helpful, he is tricky and tough, approachable and friendly but not the clearest in explaining material, i would have liked to have more prof options.

Dr Scola, I'm sure is a great person, but unless you have already attended medical school, you will not do well in his class.  I think he teaches to a higher class of learning, or maybe I am not very smart.  I heard that once you have taken his class, you learn a lot, I do not feel this way.
He is always willing to help excpesially when your totally science dumb!

This class is like Biology from hell.  I feel like I'm not learning anything.  He just reads off of the powerpoints.  I think that so far during this semester, I stayed awake 5 times.  It's hard to pay attention when you have no idea what he is talking about, or when he tries to reexplain it, he just repeats what he said but reoders the words. DUH!

I had him for lab but not lecture, he was very nice, helpful, and knowledgeable.  Lab practical (midterm & final) isn't too bad.  There's a quiz every day, but its like that for most labs & its cuz u only have it one day out of the week.  Most of the time I would study only 20 mins for class for the quizes & still did alright. I would recommend him

Dr. Scola is a very nice guy.  He is very approachable and willing to help.  You can tell he has a love for education.  The only thing I found was that his lectures were a little dry.  I don?t generally nod off in class but did a few times in his.  I like him but don?t think I would take him again.
A very mediocre teacher. Not much to say about him, very boring and average.

I had Scola this past fall for anatomy 208. VERY GLAD I GOT HIM FOR 209. he gives you a studyguide for every test and as long as you keep up with it after every lesson or at the end of each week, you'll be in good shape. He teaches from powerpt so no book =) he's a real nice guy and good teacher. i would reccommend him to anyone! I got a B in class

Bio 208 and 209 is a very tough class no matter what professor you have. You need to study every day to keep up with the work. Dr. Scola is very nice and helpful and gives study guides. If you take the time to fill out the study guide as the course goes on you will do great! You cannot wait till the last minute to study! I got an A in both courses!

A&P is a difficult course for many students scolas course was clear and concise. if you come to class pay attention take notes and study you will get a good grade. i got an A and didnt open my book once. he will do anything to help you understand IF you ASK him! He uses lots of great analogies to help relate things ALl around great guy and prof!!!!

Prof. Scola is a really nice guy. If you have any questions at all, do not hesitate to ask him. He is very nice and gives good examples to reference the material. He has a good sense of humor too. Great teacher. Use the study guides and his old tests to study and you'll do great.

Scola is extremely helpful and very easy going. He has excellent ways to help students remember the material and he is always willing to answer any questions you may have. I would recommend him to any student taking a BIO 208 course. His class is difficult but if you put in the study time you will be fine.

Great Professor.He is very nice. No matter what Biology is a tough subject and that's not the professors fault. He is very helpful and willing to answer or go over anything with you to help you remember the material. Tests are tough but if you study, you well do good. make sure you keep up with the material.

Scola is a really great professor. He gives students great ways to relate anatomy to things that they are already aware of, thus making the content  easier to remember. He is very approachable and eager to help. I would recommend him to anyone!

Hard subject, you need to read but that's true with any ANP class.  He is happy to answer any questions, during or after class! Material can be hard to follow but he tries to make it interesting by telling his family stories about the subject.

Dr. Scola was great! His lectures sometimes became a little dull, but he really tries to break it down into a simple context. He has a great sense of humor and really knows his stuff. DONT BUY THE TEXTBOOK!!
Very hard but I learned a lot. You had to be able to apply information. He has high expectation but is up front with the demands.

I loved Dr. Scola. I had him for lecture and lab and I aced them both. I did a great deal of studying and attended every mock exam and I found that the material wasn't so bad. You just have to study. He explains everything so well and is super nice! He makes the material interesting. I will be taking him again for BIO 209 lecture and lab.

Scola is hard. it helps to attend lecture. His test questions are trickey. If you stick to the slides, and go to SI you should do well. He is always willing to help but the way he words things on the test are just so difficult. I have learned alot.

When I went for help after class, he acted like I was wasting his time.  In the beginning, I thought he would be great.  Never reviewed for exams, even comprehensive final, which made them extremely difficult.
He's a very nice, soft-spoken guy.  Totally hot.  But his class is really hard.  I don't know why.  The tests are brutal and the lectures are a tad complicated.  He's still hot though!
This guy sucks ass at teaching. he is a doctor and doctors are dumb trust me i am an emt and i have ran into some dumb doctors but he beats them all

Ughh I didn't particularly care for him. It's pointless to go to class because he basically sits and reads the powerpoint slides to you, which you can do on your own and that's it. He wasn't very friendly to me, even when I asked him for help the first week of the semester. This is a difficult class to begin with, and he totally turned me off bio.

Seems like a very nice guy but he is very boring and EXTREMELY hard to follow during class. It seemed like to me that he was just so intelligent that he had a hard time explaining things in a way that the class would understand them. All and all he was very hard to follow and the exams are very hard also!

I really liked Dr. Scola. He is a great guy.  Everytime I needed help he was always willing to talk with me.  If i didn't understand something he would find a way to make it clear outside of class.  His lectures were kind of hard but the key is to study the slides, old test, and make sure to read the sections from the book! I give him a 10.
great professor-and definitely the hottest one at nku! tests are difficult, but fair. just don't get too dreamy in class!

He is very smart and does his best to share his knowledge with you. Taught me to not only so well on tests but help me relate the info to nursing and I will remember what he taught for awhile. Recommended.

One of the smartest men I've met. He's a walking book. He has a "cool dad" vibe to him.. Played Pink Floyd at one point and his phone went off and his ringtone was ACDC. You need to go to class. Every class. No, you can't just learn from the book. Write fast or bring a laptop. LOTS OF INFO. Make a friend and study. Exams are long. Id take him again

3 tests and a final, no homework, occasional 5 question quizzes. The class is mostly all memorization and his tests are on his powerpoints. On his syllabus is assigned reading, its not required. I never read it and I got an A, so don't get the $200 book. It's only for additional help. STUDY! EVERYTHING! I heard Kues lecture is confusing take Scola!

I forgot to mention in my review that he also has Tegrity set up, so his lectures are recorded and you can listen to them from a link on blackboard. I wish all my classes had it! It's really nice if you have to miss class or if you missed something he said, which happens a lot since the class moves so quickly. Also, if you don't study you won't pas

Its anatomy so expect to have to work for a good grade. I really enjoyed taking Scola regardless. He gives off a dad vibe which is hilarious. He has in class and bb quizzes which are only 5 points but anything helped. Go to SI sessions , especially for going over mock exam answers. He has informational PowerPoints and integrity recordings.

This class was extremely hard, as to be expected. I was definitely not prepared to take it as a Freshman. Be prepared to study all the time. He records the lectures which is great. I don't know if I would buy the book if I took it again. Also, don't waste your money on the clicker. Download the app on your phone and buy a subscription. Good luck!

Took this class for my major and was worried going because I was average in highschool in Anatomy but as long as you have a desire to succeed Professor Scola is there to help. He will find a way for you to understand it. Always wants students to ask questions. Wish I could take again.

Dr. Scola is an awesome guy! He's very passionate about medicine and is very good at providing practical uses for the information that you use (in a realistic clinical setting). However, he can be a bit confusing, as he gives you waaaaay more information than you need. Weeding out important topics is very important.

You'll need to put in time & effort in order to get a good grade in his class. He records his lectures. He posts PPT on BB. Has 3 exams & a cumulative final. Occasional quizzes that vary in difficulty. Rent older edition of textbook if possible. He's very passionate about anatomy. Go to office hours or tutoring if you need help! DON'T SKIP CLASS.

His courses are some of the hardest I've ever taken but if you put in the time and effort you'll get a decent grade. He is incredibly knowledgeable when it comes to medicine but has a habit of going off on tangents on something that interests him. Like someone else said DON'T SKIP CLASS!

He is incredibly intelligent and will share the knowledge with you if you ask for it. You most definitely need to be there for every class and study a lot for his exams. This class is not too bad, but one bad test grade can really hurt you in the long run.

There's not a lot of homework but this class requires a LOT of studying. I made the mistake of not making this class my full time job. It's honestly a handful and a half, regardless of who you take. Regardless of who you take, it's going to be hell. Scola is the best of all the options. He's incredibly intelligent. His exams are crazy hard.

Dr. Scola explains the material in a way that the students can understand. Other BIO 208 professors explain things as if it's all review and we should already know it. The class is hard though but that's not because of the professor. It's a lot of material to cover in a couple months. STUDY
He is a pretty good teacher. Great at explaining things. The only thing is that he has this nice soothing voice that makes you fall asleep. I slept half of the semester but still managed a B

He is a great professor and is obviously well educated BUT I did not like his class. He went off topic a lot about things we DID NOT NEED TO KNOW and wasn't very good at explaining. I believe it was the teaching style that I did not mesh with well, but overall a great person!

Dr. Scola was a surgeon. His explanations are beyond a student's comprehension. Very difficult to understand, especially the order of a muscle contraction. If there wasn't SI, I wouldnt be doing well in the class. Bio is hard in general, so not all his fault. Very nice guy and is willing to help if you need it, which is good.

He is definitely hard, but what Anatomy class/professor isn't? Tests are very detailed so make sure you know every little thing about everything. He is definitely caring about his students, though. I liked him, but the class is very challenging. Just study.... Alot

Very difficult class, as to be expected. Strayed off-topic often, explanations were often unclear. Offers help constantly. READ THE BOOK. STUDY YOUR HEAD OFF. I withdrew because I was failing. Tests MC. This is not an easy class. Great professor, but I struggled heavily and may have done better with someone different.

Great teacher, he is a doctor. He explains things very well, has a good personality and is easy to approach and ask questions. You have to study very hard, this is never an easy class, but he is an excellent teacher.
He is an expert in the health profession so he definitely knows what he is talking about. Great teacher!

Scola is a really great professor. I wish I had him for lab as well as lecture. He applies everything to things you should know. Beyond smart. Its a hard class but hey, what anatomy isn't? Highly suggested. He's a cool guy and always there for questions. GO TO THE MOCK EXAMS OK.

Anatomy is a pretty hard class, but Scola is great. He's super knowledgeable and is always willing to help. If you have questions, ASK THEM!! He always encouraged us to ask questions about things that we didn't understand and was super helpful. If you have to take anatomy, make sure that you take it with him!!

You can tell he knows what he's talking about, however, he does not know the best way to present this information. He is not always the best at responding to email, so it is best to ask him questions in person. Just make sure you study a lot and you should pass.
He's an extremely caring professor who loves his job! It's important to study a lot for this class if you want a good grade. He has quizzes almost every week, but it helps you prepare for the exam.

A+P lab is 95% memorization but Dr. Scola provides lots of mnemonics and memorization tricks. He keeps class fun and explains everything well. Weekly quizzes, but they're necessary to actually learn everything. his slides are on canvas so you can go back over everything. quizzes/exams are open response so he's great about giving half credit.

Dr. Scola is an amazing professor. he cares for his students and ensures that your are understanding material. sometimes the lab can be like a lecture, but its helpful. grades are based on quiz and exam scores. so its important to do well on those. there is usually a quiz every week but it is outlined in the syllabus so you know.

This was definitely the most challenging class I've ever taken! Dr. Scola told us that he does not agree that this course should be only 7 weeks since it is so much information, but he tries his best to make sure you understand the information. He seems to truly care about his student's learning and makes himself very available for questions.

Super super nice professor, you're going to need the manual booklet for lab. Come to class so he can show you figures that you need to learn and where everything is. He's very approachable and fun to talk to. Great class. If I would have actually studied frfr easy A yall. I barely studied and got a B. TAKE this professor (^:

I had him as a sub for the spring semester after my original professor became sick. he does not reply to emails, his quizzes are missing way too much info and he doesnt care. i still have not got an email back when i sent it 2 months ago. 10/10 dont recommend.

Its a difficult class regardless of the professor. The exams are hard and all fill in the blank by labeling but if you study a lot for them youll be okay. Hes helpful and wants you to ask questions. The homework is difficult and was the cause of many lost points for me. Hes very nice though and explains well

Dr. Scola is a very caring professor, which is necessary for such a difficult class. He is fairly quick to respond to emails. He explains concepts well and doesn't make you feel stupid when you ask questions. Scola allowed me to make up an assignment for full credit, which most professors won't do. Cares about his students and their success.
If you need help, don't bother emailing him because he won't answer. The tests are HARD and he doesn't really go over what to expect on them, and again, don't ask because he won't reply.

This class is hard, but if you need to take it with anyone, take it with Dr. Scola. He made anatomy a little less scary. Emails back quickly and is willing to help how he can. Gave students good resources, especially after the shift to online happened. Willing to help if you reach out to him. Make sure you study A LOT, tests are fill in the blank.

she is a pretty nice lady. a little indecisive at times as far as due dates, test formats, lab formats, etc. however she is very helpful if you go to meet with her. a lot of programming is necessary, but as long as you put forth an honest effort, and do well on tests (you get to bring a page of notes), you should be ok
Very good teacher, willing to stop class to explain concepts.
Great professor. Extremely helpful and interesting. The programming assignments were a little confusing because of the directions but after you figured them out they weren't hard.
Awesome professor. Very approachable outside of class for help/opinions on assignments. Prepare to learn material and work on hw. I am not a fan of programming at all, but she did make the class fun!
Avoid at all costs.  Incredibly nice, just not made to be a professor. Don't waste your time reading the textbook.  She has her own ideas.
an absolute joy.  she makes you learn.  homework can be challenging but it is reasonable.
Nice professor. She is really here to teach her students what she knows. She always has discussions going, which makes the class fun. I would definitely recommend her.

Worst teacher ever. She never explained anything well, and her help was usually useless or wrong. She expected way to much of her students and she makes class a terrible bore. Nearly the whole class would agree with me. She also told us this class was practically designed to fail us at least once.

Great professor, very approachable outside of class. Always makes sure that everyone is on the same page. Encourages students to work together. Wasn't an easy class/subject for me but I ended up doing well!
She is a real good teacher and when you need help she is there to help you!
Spent more time figuring out her mistakes on assignments that figuring out the assignments.  Otherwise a great person, always willing to help.
Great Professor. She knows what she is doing. Will definitely take  her for any other course.

Dr. Doyle really wants to help you and will give her all but the reason she has to do this is because she is so unclear with many things. She will skip back and forth on subjects so it is hard to know what she really wants. I like her personally, but I will avoid taking classes from her in the future.

If Dr. Doyle taught a class in a time slot that I couldn't take, I would quit the other thing. She truly cares about her students and gives fantastic feedback and is overall very personable, she truly made me feel like I could go to her to talk about anything, and she really helped learn how to program with real, logical explanations. Office Hrs >

I took this class online during Covid, and Dr. Doyle made it very enjoyable! All of her activities were easy to understand, and as long as you read the material, the assignments were easy to complete. She is very easy to get in contact with and gives wonderful feedback. Very caring and a great reference to have!

This class was the TA program that Dr. Doyle taught. She taught things that are useful such as learning how we learn, growth mindset, etc. but a bit late into the semester. She wants to make the program better and appreciates feedback so she is very caring on striving for the best. TAing was very rewarding as well.
No Comments

I really liked him, He goes slow and is very easy to understand, shows you how to do the assignments, and can be funny at times! This class was a blessing compared to my 310 class. I didn't really study for the exams, listened in class somewhat, got at least a 97 on the assignments and got a B. take him if he's an option!
BORING!!! this class is really boring but super easy, just skim through the chapters and you'll be fine. very few assignments.

One of my favorite professors. His lectures are a bit tedious but he lets you out early often times and genuinly cares about his students. Attendance isn't enforced, assignments aren't too difficult and tests are pretty basic as long as you look over notes before. I wish he had more classes in my major I could take! He's the best!

Professor Gonella was a really good teacher however lectures were not very lively. This class had a lot of nit=picky test questions so study, study, study for the 2 exams and 1 final. Come to class and pay attention if you want to do well.

Mr. Gonnella is one of the kindest professors you will take. The class (Quantitative Analysis W/ Excel) is a very boring subject in itself, but Gonnella is very helpful if you need it. Do the assignments on time and attempt all extra credit. Study for the tests because they can be tricky. Try hard and come to class it will pay off.

This class was pretty boring, most people in the class already knew how to do everything (basic word,pp,excel things) so I never paid attention to his lectures. Its an easy A if you pay attention, B if you show up

This is an advanced excell class.  Not an easy class to take (if you don't use it everyday) or teach.  Classes are boring but he tries to liven it up a bit.  Seems to really care for the students.  Do the homework and study for exams.  The time to complete the homework was greater than the amount needed to pass exams.

He is very passionate about this class. He will go out of his way to explain topics and give examples on how to use the material covered. Some lectures are a little boring and pointless, but due to the lack of material in the class, they are needed. Would take again.

Attendance isn't mandatory but you should still go. You use the book a lot for in class assignments. The work isn't hard and you usually don't have homework if you finish it in class. Pay attention to the lectures because I didn't and the tests were hard for me. But I still received an A-.
Jerry is probably the best and most accessible teacher at NKU. If you enrolled in one of classes you will not be disappointed
The class itself is extremely boring, but Gonnella just added to the boredom.  I don't think you have to explain to college students what a computer is for a whole week.
Very Good professor, taking him again next semester.
very nice class 3 exam and 10 or so quizzes both of then online, 4 assignment to do, do not miss the class more than 4, I recommend him for BIS 300 and BIS 380 and INF 101 good prof.

Lab instructor on Fridays. Easy class: go online and start the lab or homework assignment and leave when class is over. If you're stuck or confused, he will help. Takes them a while to upload all the grades on Blackboard so overall grade isn't known until the end of semester.
Great guy, would definitely take again for a third time. Just show up to class and ask questions and you will do fine. The tests can be rather hard, but you can tell they are straight from the book
Interesting stuff, but the lectures were long... Sometimes he seemed unsure on what he was doing.

I am a CS major. INF 282 is a req. I think he knows what he's talking about, but he's a awful teacher. He spent most of the time talking about nothing, and irrelevant stories, and let us out after 20 mins. almost every class, And expected us to learn. My bro with a MS summed up 6 wks in 10 mins. If you need this for your GPA, AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!
easy class there are 15 pop quizzes all of them easy also 3 exam. the class is kind of boring but it's easy A. take him

This class probably would have been boring anyway, but Gonella made it SO much more boring. He talks to his students like 5 year olds and takes forever to do anything, especially when helping you with something.

Only take INF 101 if you need to for your major. Extremely boring class due to the content, Gonnella generally makes it even more boring. 15 quizzes throughout semester, all easy - he'll give you the answers to most of the questions during the quiz anyway. 3 exams, not difficult if you pay slight attention during lecture. You need the book for lab.

Super easy class. 15 quizzes that he basically gives you the answers for. Come on Fridays for lab. There will be one quiz Monday andor Wednesday but besides that coming to class does nothing. Tests and Homework are easy. He is a great teacher
He means well. I found it difficult to pay attention to his lectures, but to be fair the content isn't exactly that exciting. He gives lots of extra credit. Tests are SUPER hard.

Take!I took this course online via Blackboard.The test were multiple choice & essay.If you stuck read the chapters & watch the required videos the tests were ok. Michael was understanding when there were issues w/Blackboard & took that into consideration when it was time for the test.I liked this format b/c it worked well w/my personal schedule.

This class is the best class I ever took! So enlightening, fun and interesting... I wish I could take more of his courses. Those who say is hard are just slackers; if you don't care about learning, then don't take him...
awesome teacher, i really learned alot, although tests are kind of hard so study!! take his class if you get the chance!
Easily one of the best professors at NKU.  You might leave his class depressed about the world, but at least you leave with some truth.
He is a wonderful professor and an even more interesting person.    This class requires a lot of thinking, which is how all classes should be, so be prepared to use your noodle!
He keeps his students involved and he teaches in a  very laid back and engaging style. His tests and quizzes are difficult, but he is a great professor.
Lots of enthusiasm, but teaches economics based on his point of view. Not very open to contrasting opinions about relations between countries. Left-wing thought process.
Best prof. at NKU!  Tells the truth about the current situations going on with the world.  Laid back teaching style, trys his best to keep the class engaged.

AMAZING semester. Best one I've had since taking Dr. Hewan's class. Marchman tells the truth and he's not sorry if you don't agree. I'm really glad I took the class. Take this if you want a fun and interesting class, it's worth it.

Easiest class I've ever had.  Just spews leftist rhetoric,  all though there is ome truth to some of what he says. Just spew it right back on the test and you'll ace the class.  Don't buy the book, you won't need it.
I think I'm in love with him. I'll admit this class requires a lot of studying, but it's definitely worth it. Especially around Halloween. Definitely take this class.
it was a very boring teaching style

Very Interesting Professor, he keeps the classroom atmosphere very relaxed and you may get carried away and think you are in someone's living room having a casual conversation because of how interactive the class is.

Very nice guy, interactive class style, lots of readings and discussions.  Interesting & applicable material.  Non-cumulative final.  You have to think about the material and do the readings to get a good grade but it is NOT a hard class.  He'll do a lot to help you (study guides,  reading guides, etc).  Plenty of extra credit opportunities. Take!
Awesome teacher, mixed teaching style with lectures, class discussions, group discussions, and videos.

looovvveeeddd this class! In the beginning i was very unhappy i felt he was too difficult for a 100 level. But as the class went on i realized it was my favorite class i've ever taken too bad he was my last class before  graduating. Great guy great professor tests can be alittle hard but if you take good notes you'll ace it please take this class

Fantastic professor! His classes are extremely enlightening. He's super laid back and interesting to boot! The type of prof you wouldn't mind running into at a bar. Beware: if you are still stuck in high school mode, don't take his class. He doesn't put up with immature nonsense like ' I need extra credit'. Kinda cute too.

This class was my favorite class I have EVER taken. Marchman is a hottie and made concentration difficult at times but well worth it. What he had to say was mind blowing and I think that was what really made him so attractive. He knows his stuff and really knows how to make it interesting. No text book which was WONDERFUL! TAKE HIM FOR ANYTHING!
He's an amazing teacher! I hate all social studies, but he made geography more than just maps and memorizing - it was really interesting. I definitely would recommend him to anyone.

His tests aren't too bad. He offers a lot of extra credit. He never lets you out of class early. He talks way too much--and sort of hard to follow unless you are really interested in what he is saying. Shows a lot of movies. He's pretty excellent.
I recommend taking one of his classes. His class changed my major into Geography.
Mr. Marchman is AWESOME. one of my fav. proffs @ NKU. he made the class SO interesting and so current. he is hilarious & tests arent too bad at all. def recommend him!
The Zinn book is really irrelevant to the class. Other wise a very good teacher.

Probably my favorite professor at NKU. Determined to deliver facts and truths without bias, material made current and interesting and applicable. Very friendly and helpful, he's leaving Northern and I'm sad to see him go
He is leaving end of this semester. I have never seen professor like Marchman. He is amazing and he knows his subject well.

Made this class very relevant with facts and truths without any bias to it. Tied current events to the each unit of the class. I can't believe NKU is letting go because he is probably one of the best teachers I have ever had.  NKU will definitely regret letting him go.  Professor Marchman is one of the best ever.

Michael is a good teacher who has a really informal class.  You will watch a lot of films in his classes and only have a few homework assignments.  I would recommend his classes to anyone.  Easy classes, easy professor.  Tests can be hard if you don't study but you will be fine on them if you do study.
This class was absolutely horrible. im sorry but he did a poor job of teaching i had no idea what he was talking about the entire time.  His tests were way too difficult for a intro 100 class.

So this is an introductory class, well, it's supposed to be, and he made it EXTREMELY difficult. His tests were way too hard, even if you did study. He wasn't interesting to listen to. He even tested us on things we didn't even go over in class! It was like you were in a 500 level class. I DO NOT RECOMMEND HIM TO ANYONE!! Get out while you still ca

Don't listen to these other people! They don't know him. First of all, he goes by Mikey. His classes are so informal that sometimes he brings a little hot plate to class and fries up some chitlins while talkin' 'bout the Man. Probably Business students bithcin...
DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS EVER!!!! all we did was watch movies and then we had to read all of the chapters in the book for the exams it was an absolutly terrible class!

I don't know why so many students are saying his class is too difficult. I studied very hard for my first exam and got an A. On my second, I only studied for a total of 3 hours and got a B. He is a fun teacher (if you don't mind discussions, lectures, and watching lots of videos) I learned so many intersesting things, I would highly recommend him!
Great class. Fascinating and helpful.
Don't get me wrong he is a great guy, very funny, and interesting to talk to before class, but this class was very difficult for just an intro class.

I took GEO 101 with Michael and loved the way he taught that I took GEO 302 the following semester. Michael is liberal and in Cultural Georgraphy he teaches controversial things, but he never forces his ideas on anyone and always listens to what students have to say. Amazing teacher and very personable guy.
This class was difficult because of the book we used. Michael tried to make the class better but the book was dry. He isn't going to use the book again.
test are tough but manageable interesting topics. if you want to know what is going on in the world take this class and your eyes will open wide.

This class opened alot of people's eyes 2 the real world around them. much more than places, focused more on people & culture & how events currently going on came to b. sad part-tests R extremely difficult. I think he tries to b a little tough because hes new. Not good idea cuz 1/2 dropped after 1st test. openminded great guy very enlightening

One of my favorite professors! He made me actually want to attend class because his lectures were so intriguing. His class isn't about physical geography at all really, but more about current events and controversial topics that span across countries. He opened my eyes! Be warned, though: the tests are difficult.
A great professor and a great class I was actually looking forward to attend to. You learn  a lot and open your eyes and mind during his class! Easy tests if you study, not for slackers!

Don't sign up for the class expecting a general education geography course, because you won't get it.  Teaches more along the economics line than the geography line.  Only 4 tests, with the last one optional, so involves a lot of studying the night before.

Michael is a nice guy but he seemed to expect his students to already be familiar with what he was talking about. Most of the time i was lost! I absolutely dreaded going to class. It was so boring and everything was pro-liberal.

This professor is awesome. I learned some interesting things though don't take him at 8am,he wants you to participate in debates and i couldn't get too into it because i was half asleep. TAKE HIM HES AWESOME!!

Michael Marchmann was an amazing professor, and one that I personally will never forget. He has a beautiful mind and thinks independently. He also teaches independent of text books and routine class constraints. If he ever comes back to teaching youd be remiss not to do everything in your power to be in his class.
Love this professor! He's the best!

DR. HENRY WAS AWESOME! IT WAS SUCH AN EASY CLASS! ALL NOTES ARE ON BLACKBOARD.  ATTENDANCE ISNT MANDATORY BUT IF U DONT MISS MORE THAN 3 U GET TO SKIP A LAB.  LABS ARE SUPER EASY(YOU DO THEM IN GROUPS) BUT THEY ARE NOT EXPLAINED WELL(JUST ASK QUESTIONS).  DONT BOTHER BUYING ANY BOOKS IT WAS A WASTE OY MONEY I DIDNT USE THE LAB BOOK OR THE TEXT BOOK

He's a great teacher. He knows the material really well, and although it does get kind of tough as you go on, getting an A in the course is easy. He curves everything, so by the end of the year a 72 will equal a B. Labs are easy, nonstressful, and somewhat fun. And they usually only take 30-45 minutes at most.

Great professor! He knows his subject extremely well and wants his students to do good. The labs aren't dreadful and he gives generous curves. I was terrified of Physics before I took this class, but he made is quite interesting.

Dr. Henry was the best professor I ever had!!  Physics was a very dificult class for me and he understood that some people just hava a hard time with it.  He really wants his students to do well and he is very enthusiastic about teaching.  Super nice person.  I wish they were all like him.
Does not require you to do your homework. Gives quizes and a midterm and finial. Best part is he grades on a curve. Labs are easy. Easy to get a B.
Extremely nice and helpful guy.  Curves quizzes and really wants all his students to do well.  Hard to fail this class if you show up for class and attempt to do well.

Very helpful! He is always willing to answer questions after class. Basically, as long as you study the chapter and answer the questions you will do fine. I studied his slide notes too because it shows you how he will make the quiz/test. Most importantly, ask questions if you have them.

great teacher!  he is the lab teacher as well so thats always a plus!  homework does NOT need to be handed in :)  !!!  he just goes over it in class and doesnt even check to make sure you did it!!  labs are great and as long as you show up and finish the lab, you can leave early and you get 100% on it!  great teacher, highly recommended

The class was easy becuase all quizzes are online so you can use your notes if you want, but it is soooo boring!!! I fell asleep so much.  He's nice but I couldn't take it again becuase of his monotonous voice.

Professor Henry is a great professor. He will do anything to help you and your grade. Curves every quiz and test nicely. You get a 100% for lab reports by just showing up. Does a great job explaining the conceptes also. Would take again if I were to pursue Physics.

He is terrible.  His power pts are from when he first got hired and they never change.  So boring he cant explain physics to anyone. His class is straight lecture and all you do is regurgitate facts and hope for the best on quizzes. If you want to learn physics or get a decent grade don't go to him.

This class was awkward. Hard to stay awake during leture. I took notes everyday but yet the the timed online quizzes had tons of questions that we never covered. Also he expected you to know things that you may not know such as conversions.  I'm 29 and have been out of school for 10 years. Very hard class!

Helpful Professor.  Makes physics not extremely hard if you keep up with the information.  He will "update" all your quiz grades if you make a better grade on the mid-term or final.  Personal guy who would go over chapters before the quiz.  Great teacher.

Easy class, not a very clear way of teaching. Attendance not mandatory but if you do go to class all the time you can have a free lab. AWESOME grading scale, curves everything. Doesnt explain labs real well just expects you to know what you're doing right away. If you don't really need physics for your major TAKE this class.
Doesn't have the best attitude regarding grades/questions, and has some difficulties in explaining things to students.  Very unorganized in lab, but online quizzes were nice.

Dr. Henry is a challenging professor. If you're willing to regularly attend class, and invest time, you'll most likely succeed. The book is only needed for the first few weeks, and you don't need the online code. Prepare yourself for long lectures and cheesy jokes.

Over half your grade is based on the midterm and the final. You have quizzes after every chapter. If you apply yourself these tests are cake! The lab  is 10% of your grade, if you show up, you are pretty much assured full credit! I would definitely take suggest  taking him!

AVOID... SO boring to listen to. He wld freq. tell us that most would not pass this class.  He wld curve all the quiz grades so that no one would "fail" but then when it comes to the midterm & final...no curving! End result is that he does this so it doesn't reflect back on him as a poor professor. I would avoid this professor at all costs.
Nice guy but he just blows through the material so you don't get to really get to focus on anything. Loves to talk andhis powerpoints

If you are a student who comes to class and sits in the back on Facebook, you will not do well. However, if you pay attention and try you can do great in this class. He's an older man, so he makes jokes that are corny sometimes but he's very interesting to listen to as he knows his shtick. If I could take the class again I would.
That is an awful experiment when he just ignored my question and told me to find tutor for help everytime.

Professor Henry was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. He makes a lot of dad jokes and his lectures are a bit dry but he knows the subject well. Homework is frequent and the tests are challenging, but he is more than willing to take time and explain concepts to you if you do not understand.

He is hands down the worst professor I have ever had. I took him for PHY 110 and now have had him for 2 more classes. When his classes are online he does not teach anything, he gives you a 300 slide powerpoint that does not help you figure out any math or the concept. Then immediately gives you hard homework that you can't answer. DO NOT TAKE
Wow does she know her stuff!! Never met anyone as knowledgable as her!!  You will learn a lot...but need to pay attention!

One word...GOD!!  She is the ultimate for anything nursing!  I don't know how her head doesn't blow off with all the knowledge she has in her head..I  can only aspire to be like her..and know that I will probably fall short.  Caron Rocks!~!
Caron is a GREAT teacher.  She tells you exactly what you need to know.  She is very direct and has a strong and commanding presence in the classroom.  I wish she taught all my courses.
brilliant with pharmacology
Very Very helpful! Will help you anytime you need. Explains subjects very well and will go into more detail if you ask. Authoritative presence but nice. Extremely smart with any subject
One of the best in the nursing program, right next to Sandy Turkelson!

Amazing teacher. By far the best so far in NKU's program.  She is extremely helpful. Not easy, you need to work hard but as long as you do she will do anything to help you learn the material. Great!!!!!!!!!!!!
Best instructor I've had so far at NKU.
Very smart. Assumes everyone else is that smart. Made the class a lot harder than it had to be. Not a very nice person. I passed the class so this isn't coming from a failed student.

Caron is awesome! She is so knowledgable and extremely helpful. She commands your attention, so you better listen in her class. I wish there were more professors like her on campus. She is very dedicated and wants her students to be successful and she teaches her own SI! Caron Rocks!

Caron was my favorite instructor for pharm, and one of my favorites for any nursing class. She knows her stuff, and wants her students to know it too. She did SI, and clarified anything not understood in class, even if it was taught by a different instructor. Pay attention in class, go to her SI, and you will do well.  Love her!

Professor Martin is very smart, and knows exactly what she wants you to understand. If you're having trouble or need help she always replies to e-mails very fast. If you show up to class and listen to what she hints at, and STUDY more than 2 days before the test, you will do fine. She makes a hard subject not so bad.

Very intelligent woman, but doesn't make you feel stupid. If you pay attention to the lectures, take good notes, and do the practice tests and worksheets before the exams, you will get an A. Don't get me wrong, it's a lot of work and a lot of memorization, but it's doable. There's no "surprise" material on tests. Cares and wants you to succeed.

Very fair. Works hard to help those that want it. Does an amazing job teaching Patho/Pharm. If you have a choice you want her for your instructor.  Despite the difficulty of the course work,  many students passed this course, the other classes that did not have her struggled much more.

Professor Martin is an incredibly smart woman, and she gives great feedback in her classes. If you don't come up with the right answer, she will try to see where you were coming from or help you get on the right track. As long as you participate, you will thrive in NRS 339L. I wish she taught more classes!

I loved professor Martin, I had her for pathopharmacology and a HESI remediation course. She is extremely intelligent, always knows what she is taking about, and explains things in unique, understandable ways. She is also dedicated to her students' success and wellbeing. She sees us a people, not numbers. Great person and educator.
I have had her every semester during my time at NKU.  Thank goodness she team teaches with other professors or I more than likely would have dropped the nursing program all together.

Very boring. Used "you know" a ton and I'm like not I don't that's why I'm here... Notes were bad and then she took everything out of the book. Expected you to know random stuff that you might not have learned prior

This teacher is horrible! Her powerpoints are useless and her test questions are ridiculous. She can't give rationale for the test questions and it seems as if she doesn't know the answers. You must read the book to pass the tests. The homework assignments were all graded for accuracy and were useless when preparing for the tests.

Avoid as much as you can. Her lectures are a waste of time. A ton of us would miss the same test questions, then find the answer in the book to back ourselves up when saying she had the wrong answer. The other team teacher would even tell her she was wrong and she still wouldn't give us credit for the "missed" question. Ridiculous.

AWFUL!  She never emails you back, she ignores you when you go to her office and her exams are pathetic.  She does not get questions out of the book and if you miss a question and show her your proof she still doesn't accept credit.  She is not willing to help you at all and has no advice when it comes to studying. AVOID HER!

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!! She is the worst professor I have ever had my entire life!  Her notes are awful.  The exams have NOTHING to do with what is taught in class.  You will not learn anything in this class!!!  Hopefully she is fired before you get her!

She barely skims over material during lecture and will not answer questions. She gives dumb assignments randomly in class for credit to prevent people from skipping. Her test questions are from outer space, so be prepared to spend ALOT of time reading the book or pray they fire her before you're forced to take her.

Billie was hilarious to sit through class and listen too...however as far as helpfullness and clarity I as well as most others in the class complained about her and even to her quite often. I personally think they tested from another text. Overall, I was really surprised a lot of us including myself came out of that class any smarter b/c of her.

She is the most boring teacher @ nku. She nearly falls asleep herself during the lecture so you can imagine what the class is doing. At the halfway mark in the class about 40-60 out of 100 pppl would just leave b/c they werent learning a thing. Shes very rude and when she doesnt feel like answering a question shell say look it up in the book.

Billie Jean is not clear on her subjects.  She has poorly laid out objectives for Pharmacology.  If she told us that she would give us study guides on blackboard, she would end up not doing it.  Her teaching partner is Caron Martin, and Caron explains her objectives and what's important to know.  Kosak did not do that, even though she told us that

she explains things very poorly. her objectives are very poorly defined, unlike martin's. her power point notes were missing from blackboard. class average was a 73 when she taught the material, and was 89 when she didn't. That should tell the nursing department something. she also gave us completely wrong information twice that ended up being on a
This professor was horrible. She is the worst teacher I have ever had. She read very simple slides and told you to read the book for more information. It was useless coming to class.
He is a really good teacher. If you have to take stats, jus take him.

I had him for two stats classes because he's one of the best stats teachers ever.  I would rank him in top 3 favorite professors at NKU.  He's funny, very nice, very helpful, and knows how to lay out only the important stuff during lessons.  Last, his grading system, test, quizes, and homework are all fair and makes the class not as stressful.

I never had him for STAT 205 but I know for 314 I haven't liked his class at all, I have been to his office twice and when I ask questions he makes me feel like an idiot for asking and then asks me if I have been to class, I haven't missed one class. His class is more like a lecture than actually working out problems.

If you can stand listening to choppy English and this dude saying "Am i right??" after EVERYTHING than this class is for you. But if not, then do not take 213 with this dude. He only explains things one way and is not very good at answering questions. I have never gotten below a B in any math and I currently have a D.
Great professor!  If you have any problems, just ask him and he will help. I struggled through sta 212 but had no problems w/ DK's class.
He loves his Grandma!!
Very good stats teacher really loves to teach it and will go out of his way to help. Some times a little tough to understand but you get used to his accent really fast. Great teacher.

He was a great teacher!  I've already recommended him to a few friends!  I usually have a hard time with any type of math class, but had no problems in his class.   He can be hard to understand, but laughs at his mistakes when he has a difficult time with his English.
Sometimes hard to understand. his class isnt the easiest, but not the hardest ever.
Great professor, DO THE HOMEWORK and you will do great in this class!
Grandma would be proud of you DK!
He is very easy if you do the work and pay attention. Attendance is key, but not mandatory. He is available for help very often. I would recommend this class.

Highly entertaining & energetic.  He cares and is always willing to help.  DO THE HOMEWORK!!!!  Exams and quizzes are based solely on the homework.  Attend class everyday, not only to keep from missing covered material, but he figures attendence in as part of your grade.  I will definately take him again if I can!!

Dr.DK is awesome!!! he is very helpful!!! and as long as you do your homework and go and see him, you WILL PASS! the key objective is YOU MUST DO YOUR PART!!! if you dont do what you need to do as a student, then dont complain about your grade! the help is out there! GET IT!! LOVE YOU Dr. DK!!!

Took STA-213 as a summer class, and DK was awesome! As long as you *DO THE HW*, take *GOOD NOTES* in class, and show up for the exam reviews, you'll be golden. He's not boring at all, and let's you leave early when he can. It's not a back-burner class, so keep up with the work.(I highly suggest you take STA-212/205 IMMEDIATELY before this class)
Wheres the same shirt and shoes everyday.  Class is mandatory or you will fall behind.  Talks about his grandma A LOT. He can be funny at times.

He doesnt collect any homework, but make sure you do it or you probably wont pass, he wont tend to help you on hw if there are no GOOD NOTES or HW. He talks about his grandma alot, he can be funny with his , makes the class fun and not boring. The class might seem hard at first but once you get into the later chapters its not bad. Id recommend him.

Hard to understand, but for this difficult class he was a very big help always lightened the mood. What you get out of the class is what you put in it attend everyday and do the homework its an easy class

DK is an amazing teacher! It is Stats, so you know if you are a numbers person or not going into the class. He is as helpful as it gets for a Math course. Class is a must so that you can keep up with examples and HW. There are no tricks, good notes=good quizzes=good exams.

DK is great, he really tries to help. It is statistics so it is very boring but you have to attend to get both attendance points and good notes. Taking notes really helps, he puts on the board everything you need to pass the quizzes and tests.

He is sooo funny and makes the class very fun.  He explains things very well and always allows time for questions.  He is available before and after class and almost whenever you need help.  His accent may worry you at first, but you get used to it quickly and he is easy to understand.  I absolutely LOVED his class and would highly recommend him.

DK is a really good professor. He does have a heavy accent but makes certain you understand clearly each lesson.He available every morning before class and encourages questions.  If you are nervous about Statistics, take it with Professor DK.  He will get you through it.  As a side note, he is also really cute.

After taking Erdman and getting a D i had to take the class again leaving me with D.K. His accent sent my eyes rolling but really, with time, it's not bad at all. He's great! Definitely take him! Great personality and very fair in grading! Take D.K!!! He's funny and you'll be glad you did!

His accent may push kids away from the class, but i promise as long as you do your homework and ask questions when confused, this class is super easy and the guy is really nice.  Homework isn't required to turn in, test and quizes aren't too bad as long as you genuinely keep up with homework.  I would recommend him

He is awesome. Do the homework and you will do great in the class. He is always willing to help when you need it, just call him. He talks about your grandma a lot, but it makes the information easier to understand.

DK was a good teacher, he was very understanding and helped you when you needed it.  Do the homework and you won't have any problems.  His tests are easy for the most part as long as you do your homework and sometimes homework questions are the quizes.  Tests are usually only 4-5 questions long and quizes are only one.  Final 10 questions.
One of the worst ever.  He doesn't care about the subject, he's more concerned with getting paid.

Highly recommend taking DK as your STA 205 professor! He is always willing to meet with you during his office hours to clarify anything you are not understanding and is willing to redo problems with you until you understand it. There are only 2 exams, and a quiz almost every class period. BUY THE ACCESS CODE ONLY!! DO NOT BUY THE BOOK!
I personally did not think Stats was hard.  So this class was fairly easy for me.  DK is a great prof. and i would recommed him to anyone!!

Tests were extremely hard. He expects you to write word for word what was discussed in class. While he is helpful, if you do poorly on the tests you are doomed. You have 10+ quizzes and several mini-tab assignments, but no homework and no real buffer to help improve your grade.
He does not speak English very well so you need to be able to understand his accent. also his tests are extremely hard but he does give points for each step so that nice.

Makes the class ridiculously harder than it has to be. Makes you write out long, involved answers to problems that you would use software for in real life. Also, going to his office for help doesn't get you much help. Hated every second of it.

Flies through lectures extremely fast, acts like statistics is common sense. Offers one-on-one help, but is very condescending while giving you help, makes you feel dumb for not knowing something. Quizzes almost every day. Very unapproachable and offers nothing for people who struggle with math. Funny at times, but makes me too angry to laugh.
His accent is hard to understand at times, especially when he starts talking fairly fast.
He's not bad. Hard to understand. Not sure if he knows what he is doing or he assumes we know what we are doing? Show up to class.

Extremely helpful professor.  He really wants his students to do well. He will tell you to come to his office if you need ANY help. Cannot make up quizzes and he pretty much never tells you when they are. It's pretty easy if you actually do the work though, and GO TO CLASS. It's not common sense stuff, so you actually do have to pay attention.
DK is awesome. Show up to class and do the work and you'll definitely get an A. DK is very very helpful. If you don't do well in his class, its because you don't show up

He assumes everyone is familiar with this subject. He so busy joking around and having fun pep confusing the quality of the class. Anyone should be able to grasp an intro level course but if u rush thru it and obsess over teaching everything in the book cover to cover the students will pay the price...kinda unfair. Adult learners beware!!!!!!!
not good at all.
Worst teacher at NKU. He gave quizzes basically every class! You have to do the homework to understand what is going on. His notes were horrible and allover the place!! Do NOT take stats with him!!
DK is a cool as a person, but a terrible instructor for those who struggle immensely with math classes.

I think he is a great professor and super smart but you have to keep up. Attendance is mandatory (he starts docking points after 3 missed class) and pop quizzes ALL THE TIME! His tests are pretty easy though. Just review the quizzes and homework (which he doesn't collect) and you're golden. He's humor is a bonus.

Absolutely the worst profs at math/ stat depmnt. He does not follow the syllabus, no clear communication with the class. literally deducts points from those he does not like and gives points to those he likes for the exact same answer. Avoid him at all cost!

This class was tough. I ended up barely getting a B & I really had to work for it. I partially blame myself for lack of effort but I do believe you need to take more than STA 250/205 before attempting the class. The jump in difficulty from the intro level courses to this course is ridiculous. I could hardly finish the tests even as a fast worker.

The reason I did well in this class was because the content was easy to find online to teach myself. The lectures were decent but he tends to only cover the basics, while the homework is in way more detail. He did not read over problems he put on our exams which led to him giving us credit back for problems that were impossible to solve.

Never received what I got on my final test. Now starting to believe the rumors that he never grades the final and hands out grades randomly. Why does NKU keep him? says a lot about the department and the university.

Dr. DK is humorous and light-hearted when teaching! The class isnt necessarily easy, but if you show up and pay attention its definitely doable. There are weekly quizzes, but they help you understand the content and they arent hard. I definitely would recommend him over other stats professors as long as youre willing to try!

Should I celebrate because I will never have to take a class with this man again? The class is ridiculously hard and his tests and quizzes are literally pasted and copied from online which he never taught. Avoid him at all cost!!
He can be kind but it is very hard to understand his lecture. He is a very tough grader. I would not take his class if you are a non-stats major.

This is the second time Ive had him and both times he made the final ridiculously hard so if you were hoping to use the final to boost your grade youre out of luck. He didnt grade the final either time Ive taken him. During lecture he would do examples and most of the time he got the wrong answer and asked us how to do it. Worst prof ever

I would not recommend missing class because that's when he goes over all of the content. There are weekly quizzes, but he goes over the format so as long as you pay attention in class and take notes you'll be fine. He has a good sense of humor and class gets out early sometimes.
He has a lot of quizzes and pop quizzes too so be prepared.

Prof DK is not great. If you dont show up to EVERY class, you will not do good. Grades on few quizzes and then the tests. He does not explain anything in order for it to make sense. He also moves very very quickly so dont get confused. i took sta205 with him 2 times and did poorly and took it with David Evans and passed with an A+
dont take it with him take it with David or some other person you will fail if you take it with him
By far one of the worst profs at NKU. It is not surprising more than half of the students dropped out of the class and I wish I will never have to take a class with him again!

Every test we had he would show how many students got each grade level on the most recent test, and if you are unfortunate enough to get him DONT FALL BEHIND. It is apparent that DK understands, but he gives little time for notes as he races back and forth across the whiteboard erasing your only access to class materials. He is tenured, be prepared

Don't take his class. His accent makes statistics even more confusing than it actually is. When I asked for help he was smug and rude.  Class is almost entirely graded by quizzes and tests, everyone continuously failed but we were somehow the problem. f that guy

First quiz of the class most students failed it. I could swear he is actually getting problems wrong when he works through them with the class. No access to any materials for you to confirm whether you're on the right track or not. If he erases it before you get it down you're screwed. Jokes too much and doesn't seem to take his job seriously.
He's horrible. I skipped other classes to go to his office hours, and he acted as though I was a moron. I ended up withdrawing

Professor DK has been one of my favorite professors this semester! I was HORRIBLE at math in high school, and ive gotten no lower than a 9/10 on his quizzes and no lower than a B on his exams. If you expect to skip class, you wont pass. He makes sure the class understands what he is teaching but if you choose to not do the work-youre outta luck!

Dr. DK was mediocre at best. He definitely knows what he's talking about but it doesn't translate well to what he says. He also has no problem calling people out for not doing well. He's nice and can be helpful, for a 200 level class, there is far too much effort that is required for people who are not stats majors.
One of the worst professors yet. Why does NKU keep him. Says a lot about the university.
Dr. DK was very helpful outside of class and explained everything in a way that I could understand.

Dr. DK is hands down the best professor Ive had so far at NKU. He does a have a slight accent but you get used to it quick. He is a super nice like able guy. His quizzes are the test questions so if you study those youll do great. He lays out the exact format he wants the answers in and provides study guides for tests. Awesome stats teacher
This class was awful and I did not learn a single thing all semester. You teach yourself and he wasn't helpful when I emailed him for help.

The subject matter and test combined make this class tough.  Every detail counts, study study study!  She is a nice person and helpful for students that ask for help.  However, I think its rediculous that u HAVE 2 attend class to get the notes or else good luck gettin em from someone else!  U really got 2 b dedicated 2 studyin if you want 2 pass

This class is by no means at all any easy class, but if you need to take it, make sure she is your lecture teacher. She is very well understood and relates just about everything to real life. Definatly Would recommend her!
wonderful teacher! Very helpfeul and has a passion for her job

I got an A and hardly studied but i'm also really good in bio. I really can't say how hard it is for someone who isn't. However, she doesn't like to be challenged. A friend of mine corrected some of the material she was teaching and Mrs. K stopped corresponding with her the rest of the semester. Not the makings of a good teacher if you ask me.
She is very helpful when you need help.
Worse lab professor! We basically sat at in our seats for two hours and stared at the person sitting across from us. No direction at all. Avoid!!!
She is a great lab professor, she is very helpful but you have to want the help! Her tests are somewhat hard!! Attendence is a must because one thing just builds onto something else!! Study Study

Professor Kappesser is awesome.  the tests are a bit tough, so study.   but she's a really sweet lady and she reminds me a little of my HS bio teacher, the way she relates all of the subject matter to the students with stories and examples.   loves her job.  even though ive never been great at bio, she makes it interesting.
She is so nice and super helpful. The class only meets once a week so make sure you show up. If you don't, you won't pass. Super easy assignments

Mrs. k is the best professor ever. She thoroughly explains what to do in labs and even demonstrates most of them. She answers any questions you have. Her tests are very simple if you read back through the labs and answer the discussion questions (not taken for grade). No lab reports. Was late to exam because of traffic and she gave me extra time.

If you need to take this class, take Professor Kappesser. She is very reasonable and you can tell she cares about her students/ wants them to pass. Doesn't ask for too much. Only thing is it felt like she never even looked at any of our work until the final project.

I am taking her now and I actually like the class. Everything was group effort and I had a great group. There are a few things you do on your own but its not bad at all. She does give a quiz but doesn't really like too. You can always ask for help and make up assignments. The only annoying thing is Peer Evaluations.

I took her lab for both semesters last year, and she was probably my favorite teacher. She is very engaged and seems that she really cares for her students. There are barely any tests but I would say attendance is crucial. If I wasnt switching majors I wouldve definitely taken another one of her classes.

If you don't know which professor to choose for BIO150L/151L, take Dr. K!! She's a great professor and explains concepts, experiments, and assignments very clearly. She gives good feedback and truly cares about her students. She's really understanding of personal situations and is honestly my favorite professor at NKU!

A great professor overall. Very caring and nice, and will answer any questions you have. She doesn't really reply to emails much, though, and if you miss one lab it is worth a lot of points you cannot make up for. I missed like 3 labs and now I probably have a C in this class.

This professor genuinely cares about her students and does not make things any harder than they need to be. As a lab professor, class was very stress free and fun to attend. This is a great professor and one who you should take.

She is pretty good. She talks a lot before labs begin. She wants to see all of her students succeed. She will help and answer any questions you have during lab to ensure you are doing the lab correctly.
super nice and caring of students. you will probably have to spend time out of class doing work. work in groups for whole year.

Professor Kappesser is one of the most reasonable professors I have had so far. She understands the work load required of other classes, and is more than willing to change deadlines which is extremely helpful. She is very easy to get in contact with outside of class, and is very helpful with any questions. I highly recommend this professor.
made lab very fun and interesting
nice laid back guy. knows what he's talking about. had him for lab. Definetly take his lab.

This was a very great professor, he was willing to work with you.  If he sees that you are trying your best, and are studying, and doing the homework and extra credit, he will really work with you if you have questions or accomadations.

I had him for lab and I didn't really care for this him. Granted lab is a very self taught class I just didnt feel like he cared at all about being there. He sat in his chair the whole time and didn't even bother to come help when it was obvious someone was having trouble. Didnt seem to like to help people when they did ask.

If you aren't a biology major, don't take him. He talks to the class like biology is our lives. He stands and lectures while he draws on the board. His drawings are terrible and don't compare the what they are supposed to look like at all. Worst class I've ever taken.

I took him for an intro level class of biology.  I found it really hard to pay attention during lecture.  Typically the lights are dim, he has a powerpoint on, and just talks.  Typically he goes really into detail and answers his own questions.  He only has three tests, typically 75 q's and a paper on genetic diseases he picks for you.

he is super chill and nice. he is helpful but you have to ask! he cannot read minds as far as i know so if you are struggling speak up he is willing to help! i did extremely well in his lab and i really enjoyed his class.

He is a good professor, though if you don't understand the subjuct I don't recommend him for this class unless you want to use the book. I was able to get by without, but then I enjoy Biology and understand it pretty well. It does get a little boring in this class. You need to be able to pay attention for long periods of time in this class.

very very nice! I only had him for lab class but he was very intersted in what he was teaching. quiz every friday but thats in any lab, and you have to study for the test. two test if you study and pay attention in class you will do fine. also give some extra credit.

Had him for lecture.He is very knowledge about the subject, maybe too much. He forgets he's teaching a intro bio class for non majors. There were many times I would go to my lab prof to ask questions about the subject matter and my lab prof would say wow i'm surprised you have to know that. 4 tests, 3 quizzes, 1 paper. good for majors, not non.

Professor Millward's class was not necessarily interesting, but if you did the readings and the worksheets that correspond to the readings, there is no way you can't pass. He takes questions off the worksheets and puts them on the tests and quizzes. Overall I really liked the class and wouldn't mind taking it over again!

You have to buy the lab book required for this course. You need to go to class because he gives you additional notes to add to you lab book that will help you stay for the test. Some times he will let you use your notes for quizzes, theres a quiz at every lab meeting. The tests arent that difficult if you study and most of the time hes lenient.

He is amazing. An easy grader. I will recommend that you come to class regularly so as to get clues to what will be on the tests and exams and when he emphasizes on a particular subject, note it down.

Only reads off of slides and extremely boring. Mumbles. Each chapter gives an online quiz you get two chances to take, which was nice. Occasionally gives case studies as group work in class. Nice guy, but not such a great professor. Tests cover a lot of info, so you really need to study and supplement lectures with reading or youtube videos.
very easy grader, but basically self taught. drops lowest 3 quizzes

This class is super hard no matter what anyone says. I wouldn't say he is the worst professor or the best teaching this topic. In lecture he mumbles quite a bit and there's a lot of people in class. It's hard to pay attention and you will need to study A LOT outside of the class to pass.

Entry level bio. Only took it because of my major. He is very monotone and likes to dim the lights so it's easy to fall asleep. He doesn't care if you show up to the lecture or not. Alot of outside studying. Never used the book in class. It's an easy class if you pay attention. I had him for lecture and lab.

Had him for Bio. Gave everything on Power Points that were on black board. Gave 3 points quizes online that were extremely easy. His study guides were very long but I studied them all and got A's on all his tests. I do not like Bio but got in A in here
Not very helpful, still a fairly simple class
He lets you out whenever you are finished with your work and is very willing to help if you ask.

VERY easy class.  very easy to get points.  In class participation grades, although attendance is not mandatory. Very laid back, you can have laptops and cell phones out. Weekly chapter quizzes.  If you read aka skim you will do great. Very quick on responding to questions. such a sweetheart
Easy class. Everything is on power points. Study guides have a lot of information on them. Not very precise on what is going to be on the exam.

I have him for the lecture and lab of Bio 120. He is a good teacher and is very thorough in his explanations. Also he does not mind if you have smartphones/laptops and in fact he encourages that you bring them and use them. His class also isn't too hard as long as you show up and pay attention and do the minimal homework you do get.

Overall a top tier professor.  Dr. Robertson presented Evolution in a manner that was enlightening and within grasp.  Tests were challenging and fair.  Always has time for students inside and outside of class and has a contagious love for biology.
I had her for lab she was teamed with bowling. Greatest combo professors to take! They work hand in hand with class and lecture

Good professor, very friendly and helpful, but expects a lot of detail in her exam answers, and with the online exams it's hard to type all that you need to type within the time limit.  Grades pretty hard too.

She is awesome! Had her for coral reef ecology and geology. Class was very challenging. Definitely have to study everything, but she provides a study guide before every exam, you just have to fill it out thoroughly. Does a lot of online readings and discussions. Only complaint was the paper that was due after the trip at end of semester.

Good lecturer, and a nice person.  Let us turn in notecards to use on the exam, but the exams are DIFFICULT to make up for it.  Hardly anyone ever finished one completely within the time limit. Doesn't give you study guidelines...responsible for everything in chapters even if not covered in lecture.
She's VERY nice and VERY helpful. It's a hard class, no doubt, especially for a 100-level. But she breaks things down so they're easier to understand. Also, we got out early almost every Friday.

I can't stand this woman, I got a c in this class and I get mostly a's and b's. Her class was so difficult and she did not explain things well at all.  Her  notes do not match up with half the study guide and her study guides do not match up with the tests AT ALL. There really is not point to doin the study guides . It is a waste of time.

THANK YOU for being the saving grace in this class!!  EXTREMELY helpful to students who seek her assistance.ALWAYS responds to emails promptly.  Makes the class interesting and fun, easy to understand and follow. Uses the book as a reference rather than a tool to be memorized.  This is my 2nd class with her and I'd take anything she taught.

She was helpful throughout the semester, constantly coming by groups to see if they needed help. When we needed help she was pretty clear and straightforward. Her exams weren't too bad. There was a question on one exam about her research, most people had no idea, including myself, I still got partial credit for it though, so she's pretty lenient.

Super easy content, but she makes it difficult. Assigns online homework without mentioning it in class. Doesn't accept late work. Her lectures don't cover half of the material that is on her exams.  Steer clear of her. If you must take her, make sure you know what and when everything is due and be ready to learn most of the material on your own.

Doesn't tell you about online homework until you haven't done it, then blames "blackboard" for not giving you a grade. Somehow she made 5th grade level work the hardest it could be. I have taken this class, I have studied, I still know nothing.

Took her for general bio 2. Gen bio 1 was set up pretty much the same way with a different professor and I easily got an A. With Robertson, I am struggling to get a B+. It's extra frustrating because I know the content is easy but she makes it so difficult. Reads right off power points in lecture, super unclear about what is going to be on exams

I've never been so uninterested in biology. She makes everything so difficult to understand, her lectures barely cover any content, she tells you to read the book if you ask for help. Worst bio professor I've had.

I normally never rate anybody, but I will make exception for this one cause I feel like I will be saving some one out there. She is by far my least favorite lecturer at NKU, I am normally an A and B student, however I found the class I had with her to be horrible. I felt like everything was harder than it should have to be. Stear clear of her!
Fun class. Quizzes were online, very easy. Exams, really hard. No study guide was given. Wasn't that bad of a class!

I had Dr. R for both lecture and lab, and NKU decided to have the ecology students teach themselves which is a horrible idea.  We had groups and challenge questions.  The tests were very hard and there were no study guides.  I also had her for lab, which I think she did pretty well with.  Unfortunately, I think she's the only Eco professor at NKU.

I couldn't get past her bad attitude. Every time you ask a question you feel stupid, and good luck trying to schedule an appointment to meet in her office. This lab was much harder than it should have been because she didn't explain much and didn't update the material. She should have quit years ago so someone who likes teaching can take over.

She is a horrible teacher she is very mean spirited and just nasty and rude if you come to here for help she is useless!Ithink the only thing worse than her teaching is her personality she never checks emails very harsh grader also during a test several people get extra help but the rest of us do not SHE IS NOT WORTH TAKING SHE BLOWS!

Very good at explaining math to people who aren't good at it (ie- me)!!  I definitely recommend taking her.  The only reason I got a B in her class instead of an A was because I forgot to study for the final.  Definitely an easy A if you do your homework and study for the quizzes.  She is AWESOME!
No Comments

Christy has a good upbeat personality. Very easy to talk with. Always willing to help before or after class. She gave me a C and I am retaking the class. My fault not hers. Grades come from quizes rather than homework. Do your homework and Ace the quizes :)Good Job Christy and thanks for the letter of recommendation.
Had a great time in this class. She did a great job explaining things in the most direct way possible.

I finally understood this class with Christy.  I had Gail Mackin and struggled but Christy was able to explain it much better.  She is fair, full of enthusiasm and more than willing to help.
