She teaches high school during the day, so trying to explain this to college students is easy for her.  She makes the class make sense.
This guy rocks! He teaches well, he is very helpful and even cracks a joke in a dry class. Keep up on the homework if you fall behind you will have a hard time catching up.

He was awesome! VERY VERY CLEAR, Explained it perfectly!  Willing to help students, and isn't strict.  You do have homework every night, but its always the odd problems which the answers r in the back of book to help make sure u get the right answer.  His test are lil tough but i think they are department test not made by him which explains why.
Great prof. He almost made calculus fun.

I know i made a C in the class but that was totally my fault--i slacked...but he is a great teacher. He wants to make sure you understand everything and doesn't make you feel dumb if you don't. Hes also pretty funny and makes the class fun. The work and tests are fair. I would take him for another class, no doubt!

Very helpful teacher. Calculus is a difficult subject, he teaches it very clear but even so things can be confusing. I've stopped in his office several times over the semester and he has been more than helpful, very patient. I would recommend Dr Newman for anyone having to take a math class. Like others have said he is also funny.

Dr. Newman is a pretty cool professor.  His class is immensely boring though, but he tries to compensate for that through random jokes and silly comments.  If you've never taken Calculus, I wouldn't recommend that you start off with him, but if you have, his class is very fair and is very capable of being passed with an A if you do your homework.

Dr. Newman is a good teacher. He explains things very well, his tests can be tough because he likes to grade tough. He is a nice guy and can be entertaining while teaching. He does say "OKAY ALRIGHT" almost every ten seconds it can drive you nuts but overall he was a good teacher

I thought this guy was ridiculous.He skips steps on certain problems and expects you to know how to do it. He mumbles, stutters, goes back and erases then corrects problems, thus causing confusion. Hes a good guy, but not a good teacher

Dr. Newman is the best math teacher I've ever had.  He does an excellent job relating to students-- he can predict questions and areas of difficulty.  He's eager to help.  Don't miss class-- it's too hard to learn without being there.  I rearranged my work and school schedule so that I could be in his calculus class.

He was one of the best math teachers I have ever had. He is very excited to teach and very willing to help you if you have any troubles. He predicts where some students might have issues and is always open to questions. I would go out of my way to ensure that I have Prof. Newman again as a math teacher. Overall rating EPIC!

i love dr newman. he's a nice old man who loves calculus. ive had calc before in high school but had to take calc one over and i think he makes some things harder to understand, another girl in my class was totally lost untill i explained it my way. he can just be a little confusing.

Im takin him right now for Calc 3. This is the goofiest old man Ive even met I feel like I'm sitting through a G rated comedy every class. He does explain things well and you will do well if you try hard... duh its calc. The coolest thing is theres really no due date for HW you just have to get it in b4 the exam that covers the material.

I really really love this prof! He's really funny and has such bizarre words and phrases like "beasties from the easties" and "the straight skinny." But he's super helpful too. Homework isn't due until the test, so you have time to actually complete it correctly.

Newman is a great Calc professor. He gives plenty of help in class, teaches clearly, and will help you understand your problems very well outside of class. He collects homework at any point up until the next exam so you have plenty of time to work it out properly. The things he say in class are really funny. Very enjoyable and helpful class.

There is no textbook.  Dr. Newman just gives you a 3 page packet of what he thinks you need.  Then every week the class will do proofs on the board and Dr. Newman will correct the proofs to his liking if he sees fit.  Overall he is a good professor, he is a little bit of s stickler when it comes to grading tests though.

He is a tough grader on tests, but as long as you give him what he wants you will get a good grade. He teaches from his own notes and does a decent job explaining concepts. Be prepared to do some heavy logical thinking in 302, but if you need help Dr Newman is is willing to sit down outside class and help you catch up.

21 homework assignments in a 16 week semester.   The use of Blackboard is non existent so you have no way of calculating your overall grade.  Final exam is worth 32% of your grade and is too long for the time given to complete, half of the class had to turn in incomplete finals due to not enough time.  Would not recommend.

Professor Newman is a very nice man, however, his teaching makes you forget that. His teaching styles are quite outdated and he struggles to keep the class engaged. If you are good at teaching yourself math then this class is for you. If you struggle with math then I would stay away.

Teaching method is outdated. If you aren't good at math don't take him. Even I am good at math and I've had to get a tutor twice. You have to show up to class to know what the homework is or when quizzes are due. Does not provide syllabus. Very bad at answering questions. Wouldn't take him again.

Attendance isn't mandatory BUT he doesnt tell you when there will be a quiz and you cant make it up. He doesn't tell you when the homework is due so just have it for the next class. Super easy class if you are decent at math.

Take this professor if you already know calculus. If you don't know calculus you won't learn it from him. all he does it show examples, but never actually goes through the steps of how to do the problem. He also gives a lot of homework.

Best math teacher I've ever had, counting high school or college. Gives methods from the book as well as his shortcut methods which 9/10 are much easier. Great at explaining, attempts humor which is more comical because how bad it is but still made me laugh. Great guy, no due date on homework.

He is a tough grader; if that deters you, don't take him. However, he's very helpful and understanding of life issues. He will help you catch up if you meet him halfway. The best thing to do is show up to class and pay attention. His teaching ability and examples are very adequate.

Prof. Newman is a really nice and friendly man. He definitely knows his subject. That said, his teaching method is essentially to work the problem himself on the board and pretty much expect you to follow along. If you're good at math, you will probably do fine. If you're like me and you need step-by-step explanations, try someone else.

Dr. Newman is one of my favorite professors, and has nurtured a love for Linear Algebra within me. There's going to be work--lots of work--but if you can stick out the first few weeks, it'll become routine. You'll get the most from Dr. Newman if you are eager to learn. Ask questions, seek answers by yourself, and stay on top of the homework.

Dr. Newman is great and explained all the topics in the class very well. If you have questions, he would address them the best he could in class or meet with you after class if needed. The exams were challenging, but fair and the homework was very good practice for the exams. This is a class where you need to pay attention or fail. I recommend him!

Prof. Newman is great. His lectures reflect what you'll be tested on, so no surprises. The homework is good exercise, though it could be a little overwhelming. Tests were not very difficult, but you must study. Attend class, take notes, complete the homework, and study for the exams, and you'll do well. He's not engaging, just a good professor.

Class is not mandatory, but this professor does not make online announcements, and you would only know when things are due/tests are if you attend class. Old school teaching style and literally uses the only chalkboard left on campus. Tends to call on people even if they don't know the answer. If in 7-week course, be prepared to go to tutoring.

Newman is a gem. He is able to clearly explain difficult concepts and best of all he goes over examples step-by-step that appear on the homework. Lots of homework, but that's really the only way to learn this kinda stuff. Tests aren't too hard, he provides a sheet of paper beforehand that outlines the problems he'll give. I recommend taking him!
He explains clearly and very caring.

Dr. Newman is undoubtedly the kindest teacher I've ever met. He does teach in a manner that expects you to be familiar with the prerequisite materials. As long as you follow along with both lecture and homework (the homework load is considerable, but graded lightly), you're in for a fun semester.
Good teacher, nice guy, get there on time, very particular about the material but you have to be.

Gary's class is very easy and simple.  Just follow along with the book he goes slower than most people need but makes the class easier.  He is very thorough.  Will take off points if you are late and miss certain amount of classes.  Very Fun and EAsy

This class is easy, but mind numbingly boring.  Professor Scott is extremely helpful and his class isn't very hard, but horribly boring.  Make sure to go to class at least once a week, and you'll be fine.

Class was pretty easy, just keep up with work.  He takes off a lot of points for a little mistake, but its an easy A or B if you try.  He is very nice and helpful, Access is really hard though, so pay attention when you get to that.

Gary was a good teacher. This class is very easy but for alot of people that do not know much about microsoft office especially the new 07 version its helpful to take because you can learn how to use it espeically if you are used to the older ones. Gary is very helpful if you have any questions and he lets you do what you want on lecture days.

Very nice professor. Classes are really boring though but it's not his fault. Attendance is not mandatory and the powerpoint notes are on blackboard. tests are really easy. the class might be a little better online.

this is generally an easy class. he takes attendance everyday but you only need to go if there is an in class assignment or test. grade consists of 7 in class assignments and three tests. for each test we get a study guide that usually has the exact questions. everything that is due you must do in class the day that it is due or he will not accept
He's a good professor.  He knows what he is doing.  Follow directions very carefully on the assignments, or you will get marked off significantly on your grade.

Considering I knew all about the Microsoft programs when I walked into class, the class was a breeze. He so boring and monotone, but he knows the material and will not leave anyone behind. Easy A whether you know the material already or not.

He so boring and monotone, but he knows the material and will not leave anyone behind. Easy A whether you know the material already or not. He curved every test and takes lots of homework grades. Also, come to class everyday because he takes attendence.

Gary Scott is a great teacher, he grades like this is a 300 level course but always gives an A if you do the work which is not hard at all, his exams are difficult because the exams are not written clearly, but you can make up for that with the homework. You will get a B if not higher in this class. Overall, take him!
must go to class he takes attendance everyday but the material is super easy. an easy A.

This class is the definition of boring.  He is very monotone and its hard to concentrate. He is a super nice guy but gets frustrated easily. DO NOT surf the net while he is teaching its RUDE and distracting to others who are sitting around you. HW is assigned once a week you get three days to do it. The tests always have a curve..

He is really nice but the voice is monotoned. His test questions tend to not be anything you've talked about throughout class. You will get a weekly homework assignment. I think he grades every little detail and that brings down your grade but he is worth taking.

Mr. Scott at first didn't seem too bad, but because I didn't triple check the syllabus- my 97 dropped down to an 81 because he had the final test due on a Saturday night when everything else was due on Sunday nights. There are only 3 tests and literally every question was taken from quizlets. The work was really easy, but he is kind of picky on it.

He does not "teach" anything.  You pay $150.00 for an online book with access to a website.  His lessons are read this and this and complete this assignment. He has put zero effort into this class. Do not take this class if you are not already a moderate user of Microsoft Office.

The class material is very dull and boring to read, that being said Professor Scott does have a very well organized syllabus which he follows perfectly, so there are no surprises.  I took the accelerated online class, which made the reading ovewhelming (105 pg/wk) on top of assignments ands and 3 tests. Wouldn't recommend taking online.
Alright teacher, for an online class follows the rubric and the work is easy.  If you don't do everything they way he wants it done even if you do it right he counts it wrong and takes points off.

This class was easy. Not going to lie, but the professor himself is a joke. Grades are sent via email, most unorganized class ever, dude said he accidental missed the deadline to give final grades... they are still not entered. Such a joke. Also be prepared to buy expensive textbooks and buy Microsoft 2013.
No Comments
Very boring class. I skipped a lot, tests are pretty hard and you have to read the book.  Very boring lectures, we got let out early almost every day.
Learned a lot.  Willing to help.  Easy assignments.

Well, at first the class is very easy.  Learning Word and PowerPoint is extremely easy.  Excel is semi-tricky, but really interesting.  Access, he spent one day on it and confused the whole class.  It was easy for me, however it's part of my major.  Exams are very tough.  READ THE CHAPTERS IN THE BOOK, 80% of the questions come from there.

Taught the topics class that involved real world projects with a local company, NACPA. Kept everything organized and on track. He went out of his way to allow the students to have this opportunity. Hopefully this can happen again and he is the one directing the class.
Awesome teacher! Funny and interactive!
She was so amazing! the B-E-S-T! Traci made the class seem more interesting and I learned so much. I wouldn't change a thing.
She is great! She has a ton of energy and is lots of fun. Knows material and demonstrates very well. Take her!

There are not enough kind words to describe Traci. She is the best professor I've ever had. She is so willing to help and talk you through stress or exam material. I would highly recommend taking her!!! She's awesome!

I loved having class with Traci! She is so friendly and easy to talk to, she's also goofy and funny which make her classes fun to sit through. If given the opportunity, I highly recommend taking her class! One of the best at NKU :)

Traci is an awesome teacher! I loved going to lab with her. She made lab fun with her tremendous amount of energy and outgoing personality. The class is easy and one of the more exciting classes since it is hands on. She is very helpful when ever needed. If you have Traci, be prepared for her to be your favorie teacher.
his classes are strictly lecture, he talks over and over again about absolutely nothing! pretty boring, his labs are cool.
Teaches from powerpoint. Will slow down if he thinks you are not getting it. Very concerned for his students. Uses great analogies. Can be funny at times.
Nice guy, but 70% of final grade was based on 3 exams which were way too difficult

Bresser is sort of boring, but the class itself was really interesting. Gave easy tests and small number of assignments.  Had to do a project or two, but overall no big deal. It was a nice lecture class about the universe.

His tests for astronomy were very very hard but if you show up to ALL classes and prove you are trying he gives you a break. If and when he offers extra credit...DO IT! It will end up saving your grade. His powerpoints are all about one hundred slides long and the subject is pretty boring unless its about constellations or black holes.
His tests are hard. He doesn't really clarify on the information that will be on the tests. Labs are easy.

Read the book, it helps.  Participate in class, respond to his questions, it helps.  His powerpoint presentations are long but he usually covers them in a couple classes. Do the Extra Credit.  I enjoyed the class.

Had him for Univeristy Physics 1 and 2. I like the guy you can learn alot if you want to and hes always willing to help you in or outside of class. I got an A in both classes I had with him and had never taken a physics class before.
Great professor! If you do not understand something, ask and he'll clarify. There are a lot of points for grade so if you do everything, you can get an A

very hard class, avoid at all cost. lecture is very boring and all he does is read from the powerpoint that he puts online. test are very hard and there is way to much information to learn. does not have his stuff together. do not take. not interesting at all.
He knows his stuff, but his lectures can get a little boring. But he's a really nice guy and will answer any of your questions.

This class is really hard. All he does is lecture and uses powerpoints he puts on blackboard. So there is no real point to coming to class because he is confusing and very repeative. Most of the information learned in this class was complicated and way over my head. I thought this class was going to be interesting but it wasn't. Don't take it!
He is aweful. Boring, makes weird noises and sweats a lot. He is vey confusing and his tests are impossible. Take someone else. TRUST ME
Terrible professor, doe not make sense and his tests are impossible
He has potential but very boring. His tests are impossible so take another professor

Dr. Bresser is very smart, and he knows his stuff. But he is very disorganized and just copies down the points in the book without really adding much. We missed time for weather, and Dr. Bresser did not attempt to speed ahead, instead he cut out crucial chapters. Don't expect your assignments to be returned in a timely fashion.

Dr. Bresser is able to explain somewhat abstract concepts quite clearly. His test consists of two parts- conceptual and mathematical. In each part of the test you get to pick and choose which questions you get to do, so even if you don't know everything on a given test, you should still be good. He is very accommodating. To his students' schedule.
Dr. Bresser is a wonderful physics teacher.  Electricity and magnetism is a very hard class, and he explained everything perfectly.

Dr Bresser knows his stuff. He is very good about explaining and helping anyone who needs it.He gives lots of extra credit and labs are easy, just show up and do your work. Ask questions if you have them. Lots of people who didn't come to class were failing but I thought it was an Easy A.
Really nice guy and very knowledgeable about Astronomy. You can tell he is passionate about the subject. Very approachable and will explain things if you ask. Has a goofy sense of humor.

He's a super nice guy but his teaching needs some work. You can tell he knows what he's talking about but he rambles a lot so you have to be careful what you choose to take notes on. His tests are horrible too.

He knows what he's doing but he seems to forget  that the students don't, make sure to find lectures online to supplement and create your own notes form the book, nice guy but I just dislike his teaching style

Honestly, I thought that I would love this class but it was terrible. The tests did not reflect anything that was in the 2 1/2 hour pre-recorded lectures and my grade suffered because of this. The lectures were hard to follow and not very interesting. Also, if you are terrible at physics, don't even think about taking this course.

I can tell that Dr. Bresser knows what he's talking about, but I had a hard time understanding. I think my lack of a background in physics led to this. I strongly recommend taking math and physics before this class, although I think that this is a lot for a 100 level course.

Its not a bad class because these professors (yes theres 4) accepted any lab up until the due date. But I dont recommend taking it online because its kind of confusing and the books were pretty expensive. It definitely helps if you know someone in this class as you can split up the work. But overall Dr. Bresser was pretty nice.

Class was too in depth & difficult for being a 100 level class. Given test reviews that did not reflect what was on the test, despite being given them to prepare for the test. Dont take this class unless you absolutely have to. He was vry nice & funny, but should either do better in helping us understand or accurately tell us what is on the test.
It seems he doesn't care and wants to leave constantly.
Do not take this class unless you already have knowledge about astronomy. The tests are extremely difficult and lectures are hard to follow.

I took this class because I thought it would be easier than some of the other science classes, but I was wrong. Class consists of extremely long and boring lectures that are impossible to follow. Dr. Bresser knows what he's talking about, but doesn't do a good job at explaining it.
Professor did a terrible job at lectures. The labs were an absolute joke and taught nothing. He just mumbles on all class about very in-depth stuff, when in reality no one knows that much already.

Youd be hard pressed to find a class more boring than this one. Super lecture heavy, covers the same topic multiple times over. Made me lose interest in physics. If you do great on the homework you can bomb the exams because thats how the class is weighted, so thats my best tip. Id look elsewhere for a University Physics professor.
This class was pointless. I didn't learn anything that I didn't already know. He has attendance quizzes which are impossible. The lecture part was VERY hard to sit through.

He doesn't talk about whats in the book, just about the same things every class. He has show and tell every class and brings the same things in everytime. He says, "mmk" a lot, so much it gets stuck in your head the whole night. Very boring class, never close windows, because he'll just ask you to bring it back up again. Bad class, Don't go!

He struggled to teach this course and was not able to explain concepts from the text. Wound up teaching much of the content to myself and went to LAC for tutoring weekly. This was a once a week 3 hour class. He seemed to be willing to help but was only available after class. I dropped the class after 2 weeks of staying after class until 11

Lots of extra credit. I always looked forward to going to INF 101 because of him. Very friendly and fair with grading. Lots of quizzes, nearly every day or every other day, but they are fairly easy. Tests could be tough, but with all of the extra credit it was not a problem.

It's is one of the easiest classes I have taken, but he is very condescending to student that answer questions just sit in the back and be quiet and you will pass. Not a good speaker says okay after everything sentence sometimes more than that and holds his knowledge over students and always assumes he is right.

While he does grade tough, he and his graduate assistants provide decent feedback and allow multiple attempts on any assignment. There is at least one quiz every week, but you never know which day. You could pass if you skipped the lectures, but definitely not if you skip the labs on Fridays.

The class material itself is by no means hard, and his general structure on how to teach is thought out, but his personality as a teacher is distracting and somewhat abrasive. He repeats personal stories constantly in class, and will be one of the stranger gentlemen in the program. Not very easy to approach and has a near permanent scowl.

Gives a ton of extra credit,  however, he does not cover the content on the quizzes, will take off points for small things,  and will always find something wrong with your work and deduct points for it.

This class is literally the easiest class you will ever take. He gives extra credit almost every day. After half of the semester, I had a 90/70. Do the assignments early so if you get a bad grade you can fix it and turn it in again. Do all of the extra credit and assignments and its a very easy A.

Professor Burk is an all around good guy. He gives a lot of extra credit, so there is no reason you should fail the class. He gives enough time for assignments to be completed. If you put in the effort, you'll at least get a B. He's a very nice, and easy to talk to man.

Good luck. Tests do not relate to the material lectured at all and he is very condescending and loud. Was lucky enough to take him when tests are open note but he has said he is not doing that anymore

He is very hilarious first. I had an easy A because I did all of the extra credit (he gives A LOT) and the tests were open notes. However he told us in class that he won't allow his next students to use their notes or book for the tests (I was lucky yes). The lectures don't cover all the things in the tests and unfortunately those are really though

Easy class, but really boring. I fell asleep in the class all the time. I felt that it was really repetitive and I might as well just have been an online class. The textbook cost so much and many other professors don't require attendance but he does!
Takes his class very seriously, but expects his students to as well, which unfortunately is very difficult to do because of how easy and simple it is.
Easy a just go to class do the work he accepts late work

Look. I never got this many extra credit in my life. Didnt have to take the final and still had an A. If you fail, you did it to yourself. Most exams are online and open book so its extremely easy to get an A. Make sure to do all the excel/access work online on MYITlab. You can resumbit until you get a 100%, takes time but its a very doable A.

I didn't show up to many of his classes, at the beginning of the semester he said that attendance is a grade. I'm pretty sure he only said that so people would show up. all of his test are online and the answers are within Quizlet. He will also let you retake a test or assignment if you have an excuse what so ever.

Burk is a good guy. He's quirky, which is great for keeping students focused on the material. My only issue with him is how often he says "okay." In the first two classes alone, Burk said "okay" a total of 1,407 times. "Okay? okay. Okay SO, ok today class..." If you're not easily bothered like me, youll be ok.

Was very easy to take and seemed a little unclear to some people, but not me. Maybe it was because I knew alot going into it as it was.. But be careful, he likes to go off into tangents (telling the same stories even twice sometimes...) He does not like people messing around, and will reward those who put forth effort and show up to class

Professor Burk takes some getting used to, but once you do he is a very helpful teacher. Very clear about assignments and due dates. If you do the assignments and DO THE READINGS you will have no problem. The only reason I don't have a hundred in this class is because I don't do the readings. Nice guy, very helpful.

If you are familiar with word, excel, powerpoint, and access you will do fine.  It is not that hard (and I had no idea what access was until this class).  I will say that you will have to teach yourself most of the time, because his examples in class don't help you to remember the material.  There is A LOT of extra credit offered.

He is very nice and tries to make class fun. Furthermore, he is extremely fair with grading. If another section got some kind of bonus, he makes sure the other class gets their fair share. The only bad thing is that the in-class lectures don't help you on the quizzes. You need to read the very dry textbook. He just helps with SQL and examples.

Tony was so chill. He allows us to finish the class at our own pace, so I was able to finish over a month early. If you need help, you can contact him and he will respond with useful tips really fast. Overall my favorite class this semester and professor as well.
Professor Burk was my least favorite professor I had this year. Definitely would recommend taking a different professor for this course.

Lectures were pointless because he didnt teach anything. Easy to get an A, its all online and if you wanted you could get all the assignments done in the first couple weeks. I wouldnt take again, just because it was boring, but it was also the easiest class Ive ever taken so I liked that. Hes nice, just repeats everything he says.

All assignments are online. Attending class is not worth it since he only talks about how to do the homework which is easy. I stopped attending class after the first few weeks and still got an easy A. Just a lot of busy work.
He can be relatable, he is hilarious, and willing to help you if you have a question. If you can, take his class.

Great and funny professor, Fridays are lab optional days where he helps people with questions. You have to pay for simnet and connect and all the assignments are on their, you can work ahead and attending class is optional. Their is a good amount of assignments every week but if don't wait till Sunday to do them then they aren't too bad.

Class is not mandatory and you don't learn anything from the lectures. Overall, he's a good person and the class is easy, it consists of online assignments. You don't learn anything from this course if you already know how to use Office2019.
Very easy class. Class is optional as he just goes over how to do the homework you're assigned
He's a nice professor but you will need to complete the assignments on time, it takes hours to do but once you figure things out you get "A" and don't have to give the finals.

Professor Burk is great. He posts all of his MANY fairly easy assignments so you can get ahead, and, if you have a grade high enough, you can be excused from the final. I finished the course two weeks ahead. However, his lectures are redundant and he can be a little abrasive when giving help. Take the course with him because you'll pass 100%.

There are a lot of homework assignments but they are easy and have detailed instructions. You also get multiple chances to do most assignments for full credit. Attendance is mandatory but he offers lab days every week that are optional to attend. Lectures can be boring but overall his class is easy if you do the homework.

If you put in the effort you will have no problem getting an A. Professor Burk gives many extra credit opportunities and allows corrections on almost every assignment. The actual class seems repetitive, especially since he goes over the assignments after they are due. Overall I would recommend Professor Burk to anyone taking BIS 101.

Professor Burk is an interesting guy. Be prepared to hear the word Okay more often than not. Other than that I could tell he is passionate about teaching the material and cares about the success of his students. Theres a lot of assignments, just dont get behind and youll do fine. Take advantage of extra credit opportunities to avoid the final.

Tony is a hilarious professor. There was a never a sad day in his classroom. There is a lot of extra credit in this class, which isn't needed because the class is extremely easy if you've ever used a computer before. There is a good bit of homework that takes a while to complete because the software is very sensitive, but it's not awful.

Professor Burk was okay not the best not the worst but def will make sure Im not gonna have him again. He talks so much and jumps all over the place not only topic wise but homework wise. He gives so much homework its like he thinks the only things in our lives to do is homework.

One of the easiest and most boring class I've had. Just do your work and show up and you'll get an A. The whole class is learning how to use Powerpoint, Word, etc. Stuff that students already know how to do. You can do assignments over again to get a higher grade. Lots of extra credit. Super boring lectures. He says okay like 50 times a class.
Easy class, but this guy is confusing. I stopped listening to him and skimmed through the book, and I did fine. He's funny, in a weird way.

frank is a good, fair teacher the tests, quizzes, and homework are straight forward. He has compassion and will work hard to help you get through. He likes students to bring in articles for x-tra credit. take him for class
Great teacher! He was very flexible and the class was pretty easy....funny guy, take him!

funny guy.
Not always so clear when making a point, but he eventually gets there. Nice guy. Do your study guides and you'll get an easy A everytime. Take good notes.
Awesome and easy! Tests are easy! Requires some reading if you want to get an A on tests. It's definitely an easy B class if you show up.
Awesome guy!! Made the class a lot of fun!! Easy for the most part! Definitely take his classes!!

He is kind of hard to follow sometimes but this was such an easy class. He is very flexible, gives study guides, and is very leniant when grading tests. For an upper level class, I expected more substance. It's very easy and we normally don't stay in class the full length of time, which is nice if you don't care about your education. Takes a more practical approach to hydro, which is great, however.

Frank is very laid back. Gives good reviews before test day. Tests aren't too difficult if you study a little bit. You should come to class because you do a lab just about every time (labs are pretty easy). Good way to tackle your science w/ lab gen ed. Would recommend!

While he may talk incredibly fast this class was a pretty easy. He is very laid back and as long as you go to class it is an easy A. Having the book is helpful but you can get by without it if you are stretched for cash.
frank was the best. his class was so much fun and he is just so personable with his students, its amazing. i will def take him for my other science class.

Talks really fast, but laid back teacher.  Normally wouldn't stay in class the whole time and time would always go fast.  I bought an earlier edition of the textbook we needed for $6; don't buy the new version.  Show up, complete the labs, and study for tests and you'll be okay. EASY

Does talk pretty fast but really cool guy. Gave us all 10 bonus points for coming on the last day of class. I'm taking him for SCI110L because i know it will be easy and fun. Plus he's pretty easy on the eyes ;)

he is so funny! makes the class fun and enjoyable. he talks really fast but always repeats what he says.  really helps you understand what he's talking about. you will definitely enjoy this professor!

He was great in previous classes, but he seems to have lost his mind- totally insecure about other professors.  His tests are not consistent with material covered and he even puts questions on his tests where you're obliged to write about how he is your favorite instructor at the school
Great professor. Explains material very well. Really funny, and fun in the classroom.

He's a good teacher and explains a lot! He draws pictures too. Tests are easy,but you have to study what he says to study and you'll do fine. He's also very understanding about needing to take a test another day etc.

Awesome teacher, gives you all info for test, then reviews everything day before. Really makes you understand material. Fun class, movies and no class discussions. He teaches and your likely to get out at least a few minutes early. Good teacher! Would take him all classes tought.
Great professor. Laid back class environment. Easy class. Lots of videos. Watch out for required saturday field trip!!!
Great Guy
hilarious even though no one laughs but i was. in my head.

Dr. Christensen is amazing at explaining. He goes really slowly, but somehow always finishes on time. Teaches entirely by doing problems out of the textbook. great professor, teaches by working problems. teaches very slowly but makes sure that all questions are answered. Gives study guide, know what to do the problems and test will be a piece of cake

GREAT MATH TEACHER PLEASE DONT PASS UP THE OPPORTUNITY TO TAKE HIM BECAUSE HE'S VERY CLEAR.  Also, he gives u a study guide thats similar format to tests, to help prepare you.  THIS IS TEACHING AT ITS BEST.  Do your work and keep up, and you'll understand the material & still pass

Professor chris is a really nice guy. he makes finite seem really simple, he is laid back, gives excellent reviews for exams, responds to email in a timely fashion, and offers help whenever, i highly recommend this professor for finite!!!

This is an overall straight forward class. Attendance is not mandatory but he collects hw everyday and goes over all problems that you don't understand. The test are pretty easy, most of the time easier than the in class examples
FANTASTIC professor, I would take him again in a heartbeat!  He made Calculus amazingly easy to understand - he is one of the best professors I have ever had!
Very slow and meticulous.  If math is difficult for you take him.

Christensen is one of the coolest dudes hes the most chill teacher you're gonna find lets you turn stuff in late if you dont get it or jus dont get it done definitely recommend him everytime

Dr.Chris Christensen is the sweetest math prof, ever! I loved being in his class. He's really chill and seems to always have an inside joke going on. Great teacher...take calc with him!! He's wonderful!

Fantastic professor. Is cordial and makes calculus fun and easy to understand. Lectures are succinct and geared toward helping students complete the homework. Tests are reasonably difficult, and reviews are given prior to each test so students are adequately prepared. Definitely recommended!

He is AMAZING! He is VERY thourough in explaining the content. He doesn't give TOO much homework but there is an assignment every class. Dr. Christensen is the bomb.com. He is a brilliant math professor, but explains things on a very basic level.
This man is a fantastic professor. He will do any problem you ask him to and explain it so a dog could understand calculus. Never had a better calc prof!!!!!
If you  want a good grade without being stressed out! TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! he is amazing absolutly love him!

One of the best math professors I've ever had, easily.
Great professor.

The best math instructor I have ever had.  If you anticipate having difficulty in Calculus, then Dr. Christensen is the professor you want to take.  Your understanding of the subject will benefit greatly.
I REALLY likes this class. It was very fun, interesting, and VERY laid back. Just do the work and turn it in on time and you will actually have a FUN time learning. Very interesting topic to discuss.

Awesome teacher!!!!!! Knows his stuff and is very laid back. He gives practice tests to help review for tests. L8 homework accepted.
Excellent Prof.  Very clear.

Great teacher. A lot of homework, but you actually learn from it.  Reviews for tests are great, he just gives you a copy of the previous semester's exam!

Very nice guy, very thorough. Gives study guides, grades hmwk which helps grade. Works hmwk problems in class. Doesn't collect hmwk right away so you have a chance to review and fix errors. Very nice guy who is willing to help you. Highly recommended.

awesome professor. very helpful. great clarity.

This prof knows how to teach. The class is not a cakewalk, so be ready to actually work.

Professor Christensen is my favorite professor and I took this class specifically so I could have him again. He's very monotone but is a great lecturer. This class in particular is not that hard and is a unique and interesting concept, especially if you're interested in security and ciphers.
He is a perfect math prof!! He tests just like he teaches, and his study guides are JUST like his tests! Textbook is mandatory and is always used.

Amazing professor he is patient, nice, and understanding. He explains calculus so good and I wish I had him for my Calculus II class. Brilliant professor! Christensen has received awards for ability to teach calculus. Excellent teaching method and will work with you to help make sure you understand the material. You couldn't be in better hands.
Great calc teacher! He is a lenient grader in that he will accept an answer if you chose a different solution, but took all the steps correctly.
great teacher!

I've taken him 3 times and I love him! He gives a LOT of homework assignments, but technically none of them are due until the following test. Dr. Christensen is the best professor in the math department. He explains everything clearly and concisely. His homework was balanced and fairly easy if you read the material. The exams were take home so they were very easy. Overall a fun class by a great professor.

Best professor I have ever had. Goes slow during lectures so his students understand. Great instructor. He explains things clearly and he is very patient. Light homework/

Professor Christensen was an outstanding professor. Attendance was not mandatory but the material is better understood with consistent attendance. This was hands down the best professor I have ever had. The explanations are start simple and build up. Dr. Christensen is a really nice guy and a fantastic math professor, one of the best Ive had. He's very good at explaining Calculus concepts in a digestible manner. The best math teacher I have ever had. Explains concepts very clearly and takes time to answer every question a student has.
