BOOOOOOOOO

Knows what he is talking about. Genuinely cares about you, Sense of humor. Since this is mostly a course people take for a major, the material covered is standardized, and it is a fast-paced course. Prior knowledge is an advantage, but not needed. Kues tries very hard to make hard material easy. This is a pure lecture class.

The class is hard in itself so be prepared to work for a good grade. Kues helped make the difficult subjects easier. He emails back at a decent rate and will answer any question to the best of his abilities.

Kues is one of the best professors I've ever had. his tests are hard, but he gives you every reason to succeed. Make sure to watch tegrity when studying. He's always there to help,and he is a very good and clear explainer. I definitely recommend him. also, I wouldn't buy the book. I did and didn't use it once.

His lab was super hard. The way he explained things and the way the class was structured didn't work for me. STUDY A LOT!!! The first test will put things into perspective for you. You must get a 60% to even be considered to pass the lab. I will be retaking the class as I failed this semester. Do not underestimate it.

Kues is the best. I had him for Lab and loved it. He tells you exactly what you need to know for the exams and makes the class fun. Has a sense of humor. Explains material in ways that help the student remember it clearer.

Prof. Kues is really a great person and has a sense of humor and obviously very intelligent. His teaching style was not for me so I felt like I was drowning the entire semester. I fell too behind, and will be changing my major. Go in with an open mind, but beware. His tests are very tough and he struggles at teaching to a level you understand.

Good luck. Strongly advise AGAINST taking this class. If at all possible DROP IT. Makes absolutely no sense in lecture and when you ask questions he makes you feel stupid. Expects you to know everything in depth before he even teaches it. Thinks his measly 5 points of extra credit the entire semester is God's gift to green Earth.

His class was as tough as I expected.  If you want a good grade, you have to go to class and put in the work.  Lectures can sometimes be a bit fast and confusing, but he's always willing to meet with you and go over things.  I also had issues at the beginning of the semester with online tutorial access and he was beyond helpful with that!

I had Kues for anatomy and this is a very difficult course to pass no matter who you have but Kues is very helpful and does anything he can to help. He gives many assignments and quizzes that you were able to take up to 3 times to help your grade. He even gave everyone the chance to earn extra credit which helped my grade out a lot!

Taken two labs with him. Dr. Kues is a great lab professor. He expects you to do your part though, so slacking is not really an option. He relates well to students, is good at lectures and question answering. All around great professor, especially when it comes to the difficulties of anatomy.
Very accessible professor. Always willing to sit down with you and explain things. You must put in work to succeed in this class.

No matter what professor you get you have to put in the work yourself. He is always willing to help out or re explain things if needed. On the other hand, you could memorize everything on the powerpoint and still not pass with a good grade. He doesn't do a very good job of telling you how to apply things, which makes it more difficult.

Mr. Kues is a consummate professional, and NKU is very lucky to have him. He is a good role model. He has a good combination of traits that are part high school teacher, part college professor, which is good for incoming freshmen. He is not creepy and his TAs seem comfortable around him. His tests are hard but not impossible. He likes his job.

If you aren't good at learning things on your own, he's not the teacher for you. I never really had a problem with him, but had to go to tutoring in order to understand a lo of things. Part of it is some of the content is just hard.

Mr. Kues is one of the best professors I have had at NKU. He is extremely knowledgeable, and will do his best to answer any question you have. Very accessible and helpful outside of class, you just have to put in the effort. Most students don't like him because he teaches a hard class, but overall an amazing instructor that tries to make it fun!
Amazing teacher, but get ready to study a lot!!I would take him again!!

Kues was awesome! Explains things well, goes over concepts until everyone understands (tell him if you don't), and responds to emails fast. Good sense of humor, very knowledgeable, and he did everything he could to help my grade. He posts his lectures on BB along with lots of other study aids, so didn't use the book. Taking him again next semester!

Kues was probably the hardest science teacher I have ever had. He taught this introduction like we were graduating from grade school and going to harvard. His jokes are stupid too. He lit an almond on fire? Like what the heck does that have to do with Biology? Gives no extra credit. wanted to gouge my eyes out by the end of the course.

I had Professor Kues for Bio 150 and here's what you should know if you plan to take this class: he is a wonderful lecturer; however, his exams are pretty difficult. Learn how to apply the concepts rather than just know the concepts. Read. the. textbook.  He also gives online quizzes that are video/audio monitored.

Take Kues! While you have to do the work for your grade, he is super easy to work with and gives you all the help he can. I went to his office all the time for help, and he was always willing to explain things till I understood. He will tell you exactly what to study for the test if you ask. Online quizzes every chapter and 5 exams. Best prof ever!

Let me just say, I was a straight A student before Kues. I got a B in his class but it was intensely stressful to get that B. Not to mention, this was an intro bio class! I already had taken anatomy and microbiology, but I had to go back and take BIO II because prereqs are different here than my last school. His tests are impossible, good luck.

Kues is a very straightforward professor with clear grading criteria. He does expect a lot from you and be prepared to study a lot. However, what he expects is very well know from the first day of class. Very cool guy and very helpful when you need it. Highly recommend taking him!

Anatomy is a difficult subject and you have to study in Kues class. Theres online quizzes for every chapter and 3 exams and a final. Hes a good lecturer, but you really have to put in the effort outside class if you want to have a decent grade!
I believe that if you apply yourself in his class that you will get the grade you deserve to get and that he will be willing to work with you if you are willing to ask for help.

Anatomy is a tough class. YOU HAVE TO PUT IN EFFORT. I received an A in this class only because I reviewed every day outside of class. He goes fast in lecture so you need to read outside of class constantly. He makes you work for the grade but he is an excellent professor and is very knowledgeable. I highly suggest also buying the A&P online study.
you have to learn a lot of new info every week and maintain the info in order to pass lab practicals. go to open labs and mock exams, they help a lot.

I'm currently a senior in high school taking all my classes at NKU and Kues will make sure you understand whats going on as long as you ask! he will reteach material in different ways until it makes sense. He's awesome but you better make sure you study. I would recommend getting a group of people in your class to study before exams.
Super great teacher

This class is super difficult, but I feel like he tries to make it as painless as possible. He has a lot of office hours, there are SI sessions, and he records all of his lectures. Very helpful, nice, and funny.

He is really good at teaching and he clearly knows what he is talking about. His tests are hard, but it is still worth it to take his class because he makes sure you know the information. Also, DEFINITELY visit his office. He is very sweet and always willing to give as much help as he can. You can tell that he wants you to help you succeed.

Really great professor! Teaches well and if you go to him he will help you understand it. His tests are very difficult even if you study a lot do be prepared cause they are tricky. Overall he is a good professor though!
If you take 209 at NKU, there is no acceptable reason to pick another professor about Kues.
He explains things really well, puts the notes on Blackboard. Finds ways to make the material applicable. The tests aren't easy, but if you study and really keep up with the material, it's doable.

LAB WAS SUPER EASY. LECTURE WAS TERRIBLE. THE MATERIAL ON THE EXAMS WERE MORE DETAILED THEN THE NOTES GIVEN. ALSO, NONE OF THE STUDYING MATERIAL ON BLACKBOARD HELPED. TAKE WITH ANOTHER TEACHER, I DO NOT RECOMMEND UNLESS YOU ONLY HAVE HIM FOR LAB. YOU'LL REGRET IT.

Professor Kues is a marvelous instructor! Gives his students special attention and explains the material at a medium pace. Exams are tough but he always emphasizes what to expect. No Homework required, no quizzes, just clicker participation.

If you care about your grade, the only way to excel in this class is to spend time with the material every single day. If you procrastinate, then you are asking for trouble. In my estimation, Kues is a particularly difficult instructor who makes you work hard for a good grade. Study hard, chances are you'll do well. Slack off, you'll regret it.
Kues is the BEST! Interesting lectures, fair on grades, and truly wants to see his students succeed.

Kues is the best biology professor on campus. He is super knowledgeable and is excited to share what he knows with the class. He uses visual aides, handouts, hands on examples, PowerPoints, group work and online resources to help you learn. If you have questions he answers them and has a lot of office hours for extra help. Wish he taught everything

Professor Kues is definitely your best option when it comes to anatomy and physiology. The lecture material is sometimes really difficult to understand, but he cares about your success and encourages you to ask for help as much as possible. The only issue I have is sometimes he goes really fast and it is easy to miss out on some of the topics.

Mr. Kues is awesome! I had him for 208L, and I'm making sure I get him for 209L, also. I am a student athlete, so I had a lot of complications with missing class, but he was very understanding about it. He gave me many options on when I could retake quizzes and tests, and he was super helpful when I had questions.
Kues is a king. His classes are challenging, but so involved. Requires commitment.

Mr. Kues is one of the best teachers I have ever had. Not only is he a good lecturer, he truly cares about the success of his students. I have never hesitated about reaching out and he answers emails very quickly. Although the material he teaches is extremely difficult, he still finds a way to teach it well and make you work for the grade.
Really knows what he is talking about.

Mr. Kues is the most respectable professor I've ever had! He is VERY knowledgeable & intelligent, which at times makes the class harder because he sometimes goes quickly over things that may be confusing the first time you hear, but he's very friendly and doesn't care to answer a question if you have it! He truly cares about his students' success

Professor Kues is truly an awesome teacher. He is very passionate about anatomy, so he is very knowledgeable and detailed. He lets you know what you need to know in order to do well on the exam. He is a little tough, but he definitely cares about his students and wants them to do well. I had a really good experience with him and I learned a lot.

If you have to take A+P, Prof Kues is the best. He's knowledgeable, easy-going, kind, and truly wants to see you succeed. He gives you all the tools you need to pass the class, but it's up to you to put the time and effort in. He makes you work for your grade, but you end up learning a lot in the process. Highly recommend him for BIO 208 and 208L.

Professor Kues is the best professor I have ever had, if you make an effort in his class he will be there to help. He truly cares about his students succeeding. He is forsure the best professor at nku to take for BIO 208.
Great Prof! Makes a tough class bearable. Willing to help you in any way he can! Funny and personable as well! Great all-around guy.

Ive had him for many different classes and he is by far the best professor Ive had. He honestly cares about his students and puts your grade in your own hands. His exams are tough so be willing to study for them. All in all, really great.

He genuinely cares about your grade if you take the time to seek help outside of class. Enjoys getting to know his students and help them succeed but ultimately leaves it up to you. DEFINITELY suggest taking him for lecture and lab if possible. Tests are tough but if you do well on the tests you will do great in the class. iClicker can hurt you.

The lab aspect is all about MyLab, quizzes, and practicals. If you skip, you will fall behind. He takes the time to go over anything in class with you and will sit with you at the models and cadaver if you need the extra help. Ultimately take him for lab and lecture because he makes connections to the labs in lecture and vice versa.

Mr. Kues is a fantastic A&P lab and lecture professor. He is extremely patient and is excellent at explaining concepts. You can schedule 30 min. appts. with him to go over what you did not understand in lecture and lab. He is quite knowledgeable in A&P, makes the lectures fun, and welcomes in-class participation. I honestly had a great experience!

horrible teacher! i took this class for a gen ed. i know nothing about science and this teacher is very unclear and study guides are not the same as tests. if you have to take a science, do not take her

Took this class as an option for a Gen. Ed. requirement. Little did I know this would be so much tougher than the 110 level would make you think. She often second guesses herself and sometimes wasn't even prepared (generally for labs). Labs were long and rarely did groups get done in the alotted time. Don't take her if you don't have to.
She was a great teacher, but unfortunately her topic was very boring. It was evident she tried her best to make it worthwhile, and that made her stand out as an educator.

Dr. Reizner is a great professor, and I'm not sure where some of the negativity is coming from. Some of the lecture material can be a bit boring, but she tries to make if fun, and some of  it is very interesting. As long as you come to class and pay attention, you should do well in this class.

For a general course, she made this so difficult, often assigning multiple worksheets and papers right before tests. At one point she assigned 11 total worksheets, a paper, and an exam all due the next week on the same day (week to complete). Often taught new material right before it was tested on (2 days). Never e-mailed me back one single time.

Awful teacher. Would not recommend taking this class with this instructor. Never responds to emails. When asking for help, she will shoot you back with another question and say "then that should help"... instead of walking me through it. Assigns multiple worksheets day before the test. My worst class to date because of the instructor.

Easy to learn, half of the class you should already know and shows a lot of videos. Make sure you do the homework and study guides they are most of the class and can just copy off her posted lectures online
She's pretty witty and super laid back. There's only two homework assignments in the semester. You don't use the book at all.

Easiest class I have ever taken.  You don't have to show up to class because she doesn't take attendance and all the material are on her powerpoints which are on blackboard.  The only day you have to come is group assignment days and test days. If you study for the tests and do the in-class assignment you will get an A. DON'T BUY THE BOOK.

GLY 120 was the easiest class I've ever taken. Mostly in part to this professor. Her lectures are easy to understand, all the material she goes over in class is online. As long as you do the homework and show up for the group assignments, its an easy A. Her review questions are almost identical to what she used on the exam.

Julie was a great professor, I was sad when the semester was over. She was clear in what you needed to know and provided all of her powerpoint online for use in studying or even to bring to class. I went to class even though attendance was not mandatory. Some people only showed up on test day. Take away from that what you will.

Very clear about what she wants from you and any assignments she assigns. Explains the material better than other professors, only real snag is that she tends to drift into random tangents that have nothing to do with the subject.

This was such a fun class to learn about. The professor was amazing and made this lecture fun. Sadly I wasn't able to be there a lot due to personal issues, but the professor had notes online to where they were easily accessible. Julie really inspired me to switch my Media Informatics degree to a geology degree and I give her so much respect to her

Stupendously boring. Any passion she has for the subject is lost in translation. Assignment instructions are vague, but she wants very specific answers. Tests on things not discussed in class. Make sure you attend class and listen very carefully or you will fail the exams.

This professor is very chatty. She has a difficult time finishing a sentence without seeming very unsure of herself. Class is not incredibly difficult. It is unfortunate to have high expectations for a class and find out it's not all that it's cracked up to be.

This class was incredibly boring. She didn't have an interest in what she was teaching whatsoever. The class is easy though. You DO NOT need the textbook and don't even need to attend class. She doesn't take attendance and she has PP on BB (which is the only thing you need for the tests) She doesn't have a final either. She also is a hard grader.

She is a very sweet professor.  I never used the textbook, so don't worry about buying it.  If you pay attention in class, take notes, and review the power points, you will be fine.  I liked this class and thought it was interesting.

The class was good. It is a little boring but as long as you take notes and go over power points and actual study for the tests it's not hard. She's a good teacher, offers help outside and if you ask her questions shell answer to the best of her ability. I would take her again.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!worst class ever!extremely boring Exams are not like the material she does for the review or the learning curve questions she makes you take online she doesn't respond to emails hard to ask questions to and spends most of class making rude comments about students not listening all class was her reading power points that's it!

I had Julie for a class called This Dangerous Earth.  She's very laid-back and friendly she wants us to call her Julie and she makes sure that everyone is going to, or should, pass the test before she administers it.  If you show an interest in class, she'll show an interest in you and your passing.

I took this class because I really enjoy the topic of Geology. But this class wasn't anything like I expected. She relates a lot of her material (especially volcanoes) to food and it doesn't help. Reads straight off the powerpoints. Rambles and gets sidetracked a lot. Only good thing about the class is that she doesn't take attendance.

This was a class I chose last minute, however it ended up being my favorite class. Professor Reizner sparked my interest in Geology and was more than happy to help explain if you didn't completely understand.  Easy test, easy class. I would highly recommend this course even as a Gen Ed.
Shes a literal angel, and her lectures are always entertaining. I took the online course so there was a lot of reading, but overall the class and professor were both wonderful and very informative.
Lots of videos, but always well picked and informed. Love her class and she recognizes when life happens so long as you do well.
Professor Reizners class is all electronic. Homework once every week, Quizzes on canvas, PowerPoint lectures. Buy the e-book and work on homework with a partner and you are guaranteed to get an A.
Very good professor overall! Make sure to read the textbook to do well on the quizzes.

I took her dinosaurs and disasters class online. It actually was so interesting. You can get by looking up most (NOT ALL) of the answers, but she actually made an online class exciting which is quite a feat. As long as you watch the lectures easy A for sure. Absolutely would recommend.

Professor Reizner knew a lot about what she was talking about. There is a test due on Sunday night each week with a few homework assignments every few weeks and that is about it. This class is an easy science credit with not a lot of stress.

The only time attendance matters is during days of group assignments/book discussions. Most test answers can be found online except for those that come from the books. I would suggest getting the books (probably online versions to save money), but dont thoroughly read them. Even though this subject isnt my favorite, I thought the course was easy.

has done a ton of actual work in paleontology so she knows a ton about what she's talking about. lots of personal anecdotes about dinosaur digs and stuff. don't buy the book until you check if its free from Steely, even most of her higher level courses use books available online.

Julie did a great job. The lectures were very informative and easy to follow. The labs helped you apply what she talked about in her lectures and weren't super hard. During the labs, I liked that you worked with classmates and didn't do it by yourself. The tests were online which I liked and as long as you study before hand you should be fine.

I'm personally not a science person, but Professor Reizner is passionate about what she talks about in her lectures and it really makes coming to class more enjoyable. You can tell she knows her stuff and cares too. She is kind and encouraging especially if you're unsure of something and need to ask questions.

She stopped emailing back. She sent out a rude email about how we should treat class like our jobs&she has had deaths in her life too but still showed up. Then she "accidentally" deleted all our midterms online so we had to retake them. We also had to watch a video&answer the questions. She gave half credit because I did not use my "own words".

Mrs. bowling is prob one of the best teachers i have had as far a bio lab. she is just starting out so she is young and has a great sence of humor and is very prepared. she is super fun and pretty darn hot
One word: AWESOME!  She is always willing to give help and she really does care for her students.  Has a positive attitude and wants everyone to succeed.  I would definitely take her again!
I really liked Dr. Bowling, she was a great teacher, but very hard! I got a B, but it was very hard and my lab grade added in helped it out! I would take her again if I had to take any other  Bio.

Very friendly person, but not a great teacher.  Test/quiz questions are often wordy and confusing, it seems like she tries to trick you.  She is approachable if you have questions, but she is not able to always answer them becuase she is still a new teacher.  If possible, try to take Thompson for lab.

I am taking her for GMC 1 (shes one of three professors). I loved her style of teaching. She is very easy to understand. Her exams are tough and some questions are a little confusing but just ask her what she means and she will tell you. I would take her again. She is new at teaching and will only get better!
I have not taken her yet, but she is my advisor for BIO. She is very helpful and willing to do what she can do to help. She is also very enthusiastic about her job which always helps
Bowling is very nice..I had her last year and she still says hi to me in the halls.  Just watch out for her tests, there is no mercy.

I came into this class this semester expecting a lot worse than what I am experiencing now.  Like all other professors, she gives quizzes every week, which are quite easy, however her lab practicals are pretty intense.  Most of the question consist of microscope slides, so you have to know what EVERYTHING looks like.  But helpful and approachable.

She is just OK.  I had Curran for 150 lab and compared to her, Bowling is much harder.  Her tests SUCK. I guess she's nice and tries to help in lab, but her tests are too hard compared to how unenthusiastically she teaches the lab.

Dr. Bowling intimidated me at first, she's very attractive and intelligent and has reached a high level of success at a relatively young age. I asked good questions and tried really hard, and I felt as though I earned the rapport we've developed today.

DO NOT TAKE HER!!! She is insulting to any upperclassmen and I personally caught her saying degrading things about the upperclassmen to the freshmen that sit in the front. She is HORRIBLE at explaining things and answers "Uh I don't know" to 90% of the answers we ask. Her tests are IMPOSSIBLE compared to the material she goes over in class.
I LOVE HER.

Very very very attractive! but teaching methods are not so good. She doesn't explain things well and really seems like she doesn't know what she's talking about. If your looking to take BIO 150, i recommend to take it with Dr. Thompson...

She is a very nice person, but her tests are ridiculous. Most of the tests are nothing that we have reviewed in class and all out of the book. I feel that because she is young and has her doctorate degree, she feels the need to prove herself by making her class impossible to get an A in.

Her test are not impossible to the amount of material she teachers. Biology is a complex subject with a lot of details. It's hard to absorb all of these details from 1 lecture. Study and you will do fine. She gives you an entire outline of what will be on the test, and a practice test. I recommend using that text book to study, helped me alot.
Very nice (sometimes) but cannot relay information, that students can understand one bit. You're on your own with studying for exams, no study guides ever given! And classes are dreadfully boring.

Very hard professor. Do not bother going to class and taking notes because they will NOT help. 90% of exams are things never discussed in lecture but left to teach yourself from the book. Wonders why her test averages are so low. Has slide presentations but they are only pictures with NO captions so when you go back to study, they are no help!

Here's the thing. She's really sweet, funny, gorgeous, and intelligent. I loved her as a person, but I HATED her class. Bio is usually my strong point, but her class was just so hard. Her tests were SO difficult and were hard to study for if you just study your notes. She's always willing to help, but her tests/quizzes are just so HARD! So yeah. :(
Awesome Professor. Make sure to take notes in class. She is organized and if you go to class, take notes, and stay awake, you will not see anything that will surprise you on her test.

This teacher is not at all a good teacher to take. She expects you to know a lot of stuff you may have never heard of before, she compares  biology to the stupidest things in life so you have no idea what she is talking about, after every test she is always wondering why the test averages are so low, is it because she is not a very good teacher?
Bio can be hard. Her notes were ppt so take notes on top of those too, pay attention in class and don't fall asleep and you'll do fine.

Dr Bowling is an awesome person who cares about reaching her students and who is willing to help you succeed.  She's very organized, with an outline for herself for EVERY class.  She only has pictures on the slides because she wants you to LISTEN and ABSORB what she's saying instead of ditching class and relying on her powerpoints come exam time.

She was a great professor and really loves what she does and it shows! She is more than willing to help anyone either during class or after and has great office hours. downside is her presentation and class participation by clicker response you really have to pay attention she can be tricky with her wording. But overall a great professor!

Enthusiastic teacher, genuinely wants to see her students succeed. Does a good job of using classroom conversation to encourage learning. Expects students to read material before lecture. Very approachable and willing to help if asked.
Even due to treacherous snow weather, she basically says even if it is snowing and you may die, be in class.  Very rude to you when you ask a question and thinks you should just understand.

The tests are based off of notes and the textbook. Although you shouldn't ever expect to get through all the notes because student, usually those involved in related research, tend to hijack the class-time for their own needs.  Prof Bowling is very caring and will help anyone who takes the time to speak with her. Appearance (RawR)!

Though she may be a very nice, approachable teacher, tests are IMPOSSIBLE!! They are multiple choice and answers are misleading. NO ONE no matter how many tutors you had, got above a 70 on a test. Do not recommend her AT ALL!
Dr. Bowling is pretty easy. She lays things out and tells you what she expects for you to get an A. Has a couple "pop" quizzes but they aren't hard if you go to lab. SMOKING HOT!
Great teacher, clear and helpful even outside of office hours. She will help you succeed and if you are willing to work to learn.

Dr. Bowling's lectures are pretty clear. But her tests are  difficult, even though they are multiple choice. Some of the answer choices are WAY too similar (trick questions)! Also, all of my other professors replaced the lowest exam with a higher final exam, but she didn't. If she had done that, I would have gotten an A in the class, not a B! :(

Dr. Bowling is a great professor. She teaches Intro to Bio very well. Some people complain about her tests being hard, but Ive never recieved lower than a 92 on them. Biology is one of my favorite ares of science, but I still thought the exams were fair. I would take her again but she doesnt teach BIO 151 :(
Terrible. Tests are ridiculous. Doesn't teach. Reads straight off of power point. Studied over 20 hours a week and only had a C in course. There's a reason she doesn't teach 151.

I think Dr. Bowling does a very good job teaching this class. She is clear and always available to help. Her tests are a little tricky but not too bad. Sometimes the homework is repetitive and boring, but overall I really enjoyed the class.

Dr.Bowling was a wonderful teacher who helped you through every step of the way!She made the lab fun and was laid back. Would definately take again for future bio classes. Expect pop quizes but if you read and keep up they are nothing to stress over. Offers lots of help! If you fail its because you are lazy. Easy chance to acheive an A or B!
Asks ridiculously in depth questions considering she only spends 1 day a week lecturing. you pretty much have to teach yourself everything.
Two words: Flipped class. So, unless you enjoy teaching yourself and have a ton of extra time, wait until another professor teaches genetics the next semester...

Dr. Bowling was great. Many reviewers have complained that the powerpoints are just pictures and that you have to use the book, but as science majors, that is typical. She isn't an easy grader, and she makes you work for an A, but it's not impossible, and you learn the material better. Some of her questions were confusing, but she'll clarify.

Until I had this Genetics with Dr. Bowling, I was terrified of taking it.  I never did well on this subject in gen Bio, so I figured this class was going to be awful.  Without Dr. Bowling I would have hated it - she's awesome! I got an A in the course.  Don't get me wrong, you need to study, but Dr. Bowling is super helpful and nice.

She is very hard, but makes you work for an A. I spent 15+ hours studying and doing homework for her class. IF you want a challenge she will give it to you. She will help as long as you put the effort into learning. Expect homework, and lots of studying. The exams are very challenging.

Dr. Bowling i thought was a very good professor. She sometimes did not explain things clearly. The class is pretty easy, my lowest grade was like an 84. You will need to study! Study! I can not stress that enough, you will need to study for her class. Her tests are not very easy, but i promise if you study and pay attention in class you'll pass!
Good professor, but class is almost unbearable if you are not in love with Biology

Bowling cares a lot about her students. If you are a huge participator, if you show up everyday, if you work hard.. she will take care of you. she is the professor who will help you if you seek her, but she will sometimes look out for you too unlike other professors. The science classes are hard so of course it takes effort. But Bowling is great.

This professor is extremely difficult to follow. She teaches the chapters out of order and expects you to come to class basically already knowing everything she plans to teach. She talks down to her students when they ask questions. Her tests never have anything to do with class discussion and lecture. I dread attending her class every week.

Please do not take her if you are worried about your gpa. She just went over powerpoints but expected you to know the book. I retook the class at a different university and put in the same amount of work and got an A. Worst teacher at nku.

Dr. Bowling is great! It is very evident that she genuinely cares about her students' success. Her exams are challenging, but if you go to class, it helps a lot! I do suggest that you take her. She knows the content well.

i have to repeat this class partially my fault but ive never had to before. she is confusing and rushes and is kind of mean at some points if she thinks you're just stupid. no amount of studying could save me from this class. i would not recommend taking her unless you are strong in science and or are not moving on to higher bio.
Very helpful.

This professor is a really nice person, but she isn't a great professor to take.  while she is enthusiastic about the topic she expects her students to have the same enthusiasm and makes her test very difficult.  She quizzed us 3 times over material we didn't go over in class because we were supposed to read it and understand it.
Dr. Bowling is very nice, but she is probably better suited to teach Introduction to Biology. If you don't give her a textbook definiton on a test, she probably won't understand it.

This class was impossible!! The tests are super hard and you basically have to teach all the material to yourself. She gives you long study quides to fill out by using the textbook, and those barely even help when studying for the exams. I would not recommend taking her!

WARNING!! Do not take this class no matter how much you study the tests are impossible!! She is really nice but I studied, went to the stem sessions, and got help from her and it was hard to receive a C on the test.

She's really tough and her tests are impossible. She's not approachable; she tends to talk down to you when answering your questions. On her tests she gives you a specific question but her multiple choice are general answers. This  became extremely frustrating. I will not be taking her again.
She is the most passionate professor Ive ever had! She makes other professors look terrible. She is an absolute genius and can dumb down anything you are struggling with for you to understand.

Cool, funny, approachable, easy going and will go out of his way to help you outside of class.  Zips through lecture but will stop for ?'s and notes are on BB. I recommend this prof. and would take him again. Not easy, but an A is possible if you REALLY work at it. Labs HW quizzes weekly. Tests once a month.  Not too bad if you really study.
Excellent professor. Will help those that really show an interest in learning the subject.  Quizzes and exams are tough if you don't study and read the book.

I took this class because I needed it for the RAD TECH program; Physics REALLY isn't my thing, but trust me, if I can pass, anyone can. I got a B in the class, but REEEAAALLLY had to work at it. I learned a lot and the guy is pretty entertaining during lecture; he'll stop to answer questions and is helpful during lab. Good with Blackboard too.

Friendly guy.You can get a good grade but you REALLY have to work at it.Grades on a histogram, where you are judged compared to how well or poorly your classmates perform, which is VERY stressful.Good teacher, but I would avoid taking him again due to the HORRID Histogram grading system, which I believe to be unfair (and curves your grade DOWN).

Great teacher, he makes Physics fun and interesting. You do have to study for the quizzes, but the questions on the exams usually follow the quizzes. Do your self a favor and study the quizzes for the exams and everything for the final. I could not believe how many of the questions were the exact same.

Had him for both sections. I really like him. He's hard to approach at first, but easy going once you get to know him. He is by far one of the easiest Physics teachers at NKU. Don't let the other ratings fool you. But... don't take him if you rely on a professor to teach you everything. You must work from the book, and read each chapter on your own

Online class was pretty easy if you studied regularly. The final exam was basically your final grade so make sure you know your stuff. The final had 300 questions - very long. But I got an A & I learned alot. She was also very much available if you needed outside help.

Amazing teacher! So friendly and helpful.  I really enjoyed her lectures. Tests are difficult because some questions are worded almost identically...but if you study the powerpoints you will be perfectly fine. Would definately take her again!
Very nice, and always willing to help. Really knows her stuff, and is enthusiastic about it. I love the encouraging emails she sends.
This class could have ruined my scholarship. Don't take her unless you are forced. Nice and encouraging lady...but if you fail one test, you basically have no chance. Good luck!

Web course very easy! No book required and all test information is in red. Copy everything in red and study it you'll get an A. Test were very reasonable with ample time. I HIGHLY reccomend everyone take this class!!!

Very nice lady. Class content is interesting for a biology class, but the test are absolutely impossible, and if you do do bad, there is no way to recover from them. If you are a study freak go ahead, but this is no easy ''A''.
Super nice person.  Very encouraging and always willing to help or answer questions. She gives great notes on pp.
very helpful

She's easy in the sense that if you DO study and give it 100%, the exams will appear very easy. They're worded exactly like the powerpoints. But if youre not a fan of studying, there's no way you could pass this class. I think 33% of the class got A's, while the other 40-50% failed. So it's easy if you study; impossible if you don't.

The internet class does not have a textbook.  Basically, you have to study a powerpoint which is lecture notes.  Her test are timed and given from 5:00 am to 11:00 am.  I would not recommend this class to anyone.  When I asked her about changing the time of the test because I work full-time five to six days a week she told me to drop the class.

I loved Mrs. Dempsey! She teaches a very hard class but does a very good job at teaching the material and trying to help you get a good grade. If you stay focused you will do ok. Make sure to study alot though.
Had her online but she was always prompt with assignments, notes, grading. Always there for help when needed. Great professor!!

This class is medical terminology and is an online course. I didnt not enjoy this class at all. The powerpoints were done by some other company and make no sense at all. The class is extremely boring and the final is 60% of your grade. I wouldnt recommend this class however it is the only class offered as of yet.

The online 209 class is great!!! I would definitely recommend the class to anyone. Questions come directly from the powerpoints she posts. Notes are really easy to follow and she is an incredibly helpful professor!
It is advertised as an online class, but really is not.  The Final exam is at NKU. If you need a science credit don't take this class.

So when I was deciding whether to take the online version of this class or the on-campus version I was surprised to find out no one compared them. My opinion is pretty simple though, you should deff take Dempsey online for this class! Hard class but MUCH easier than what my friends are having to do on campus. Don't be scared just because its online
This has been by far the best online course I have ever taken.  Sometimes it can be hard to get ahold of the instructor but she always responded back right away and very eager to help with anything.

I heard she is a great teacher in the classroom. But I had her online. She is very responsive and caring. 50 min for each exam online. In answering each question you cant go back to check your answers. There are No lectures, and concepts are often hard to understand. Make friends with the tutors. If you want good understanding, DONT TAKE ON LINE.
She is awesome, just go to class and study your notes and an "A" is totally possible.
Pretty much the greatest teacher Ive ever had...ever.

Yea... lemme guess you are thinking to your self.. wow this class is so freaking easy.. and then you get your first test back... haha not what you thought huh! Well she is a great teacher and she will do what she has to in order to get you throught it. She
Pretty much my favorite professor ever. Hard class, but shes always willing to help out, and really makes class interesting. <3 Deb.
She is very helpful. In class, she'll break everything down to the basics. But her tests are hard.
I had her like 3 years ago so I don't know if things have changed, but the class was fun and interesting.  1st test was the hardest but she gives you plenty of extra credit opportunities.
Debby is awesome! She is very clear on what she expects of you. She has no attendance policy! And even if you dont like science she keeps you interested!
SHE WAS THE GREATEST EVER! SO TAKE HER IF U CAN!
More than a teacher.  She really does care!
It is true if you have to take Bio take her. You will regret it if you don't I know I took it once before with someone else and she is way better.

She is so perfect for 8 a.m. She was not too peppy but just enthusiastic enough to keep me awake.  She is very sweet and cares about her students alot. I liked the class and material, and made it to class pretty often but there is alot of material to only be covered on 50 question tests. Study, study, study!!
good teacher
Really sweet woman, explains things really well and her lectures are the easiest ever. If you have to take this class, take it with Debby. But make sure you really study hard for her tests!

Dempsey is amazing- she is passionate about teaching and loves her students. She even called every student in the class before the test to make sure they didnt have any questions. Her tests are a challenge but she is the kind of teacher that makes you want to do well.

How could you not like Debby, she knows her stuff.  Always helps you get your answers and makes sure you  understand.  She basicly wrote the course so if she says it then it is true.  Great instructor
Dempsey is the best teacher! She's very nice, caring, very approachable, and will do her best to try and help you out!

She is an excellent professor.  The only difficult part is that there is so much information to know, but she does a wonderful job at explaining the subject. She will do anything she can to help you if you ask for it. Very nice lady!!!
she is absolutely the best instructor I've ever had. She calls each student before tests to see if they have any questions.  She will go out of her way to help a student!

I never liked science until her class. She was very helpful and I spent three hours studying before her test and aced all of them easily. If your stupid avoid her classes - if your average to smart you'll be just fine, as long as your willing to study. She's straightforward, no tricks.

i want to tell you never take a summer class with her unless you're a total bookworm who can study without the a teacher.  very very hard during the interession, too much information crammed in, but if you can memorize and are able to study several hours per day on powerpoint notes, then i recommend, but otherwise you may not like it very much
Very good teacher

I am a complete ditz when it comes to science, and she was the perfect professor to take such a broad survey class with. Her lectures run smoothly and seem to fly by. Her tests are really really difficult, though. I would study for days and still only get a low C. She's willing to help you if you need it, though. Her door is always open.

I took the web- based winter intersession Biological Perspective of Wellness, and it went pretty well. It's a whole lot of information crammed into a short period of time, but that's true for any intersession class. She TRULY cares about her students and is ALWAYS willing to go above and beyond.

I took her internet class.  I'm telling you she is the nicest professor I've ever had.  She is someone who truly cares about her students.  There wasn't a text book and she used power point slides.  I've been putting off science til my senior year, and i'm so glad I lucked into her class.  Anyone who is needing a science without lab, take her. Grea
Her test are straight forward, but good luck on the choose the correct answer, those wewre difficult as H#$%* she is very nice though.
What a teacher! Dempsey was so into helping the student out. She will do what ever she can to help you succeed. Test are kind of difficult so study and you will be fine.
She is an awesome teacher. Very energetic. Very helpful
helpless

I do not know why this professor gets such high ratings. She is a good lecturer, but she does everything she can to trick you on her tests.Although she sends you emails everyday telling you how great you are and how much she's thinking of you, don't be fooled. Just go ask her a question and she'll act like she's been put out.

very nice, very encouraging, and very helpful. She answered any and every email I sent to her, and would stay after class to answer questions. Her tests are extremely difficult, so you have to study hard and know those power points backwards and forwards. She will change one word on the test, so read every word of every question and answer!

I was worried about taking an online course, especially something as challenging as BIO 209. But I found it to actually be so much easier! Her tegrity lectures are clear and helpful. Can earn extra credit by going to SI, which I strongly encourage! Great professor!

This is by far the worst online class that I have ever taken. I am so frustrated it's absurd. We have to be video recorded while taking tests, we cannot go back and check answers, and we cannot use any cheat sheet. The tests are over 7+ chapters at a time. The lab and lecture do not match up. You literally have to memorize everything! DO NOT TAKE!

Never have I taken a bio class that didn't allow any sort of index card w notes,  you are covering 36 different  different powerpoint "lectures" in 8 weeks that is insane. Studying nightly & wkends doesn't seem to help. Its all memorization and she clearly tricks u on the tests, which the computer grades you on. what exactly does she do to teach?
Awful teacher. She resends the same e-mails to every class about how they're wonderful and how she is thinking of you, but its just something she typed up 10 years ago.
Fabulous, smart, friendly, and approachable.  Her class is not easy but she will do anything that she can to help you get through it.

She only gives 4 grades. 3 exams over chapters + the final exam. Everything is taught and reviewed by powerpoints. She does not help at all. The exams are usually over 8+ chapters. You are on a webcam recording during all exams, which is quite annoying. Failed the class, really disappointing. Unless your majoring in science, this class is DIFFICULT

This class was required for my major and online was the hardest thing I have ever had to do. It's so hard to understand the lectures and the tests go much more in depth than the notes. DO NOT RECOMMEND ONLINE. If at all possible take lecture in class, it will save you.

She really cares about you and will help you to pass. This online lab was tremendously easier than my peers who took the lab on campus. There is a simple 5 question quiz. There is one mid term, one final. Nothing else. All homework is optional and is extra credit. I will say if you bomb the test it is hard to recover due to lack of assignments.
Hardest class I've taken. She is a sweet lady and cares but her work load is overwhelming and she uses the Respondus Browser to record you taking all tests and quizzes.

Anatomy is difficult to begin with and even more difficult when the lecture is taken completely online.  She has plenty of videos and worksheets to help you understand.  Still have issues understanding the material?  Shoot her a quick email and she is always more than willing to meet with you to answer any questions.
She is awsome! She is amazing and I love this professor! I've only heard good things about her, the class is hard but she makes it easier to learn!

-Lockdown browser for all quizzes and tests, even practice quizzes -Make sure you look at the study guide -You learn everything from a powerpoint, it is like teaching yourself -Tests cover a ton of material -If you are looking for an easy Gen Ed, this is not the class to take.

Wonderful professor very caring, and very accessible if you need help she is always wiling to help. You really have to study a lot if you want a good grade. This is an online class based off of 4 test (100 pts. each), 6 quizzes (20 pts. each, lowest one is dropped), and 1 final (200 pts. cumulative) You are recorded the taking tests and quizzes.

This class is all about how much effort you are willing to put in. I suggest watching the lectures, taking notes over EVERYTHING, and studying early for the exams. If you do poorly on one test, bringing that grade up will be a struggle. Don't fall behind!!! As tempting as it may be to just take a week off.. DON'T!!! WATCH THE LECTURES!!!!!!!

Amazing professor and very caring. Just memorize slides when she assigns them and you'll have no probs with tests. Seriously, tests are straight from slides. Don't have to read. Sends motivational and caring emails each week. Offers help in her office whenever. You always know what to expect with Debbie. She's a top professor at NKU.

This class is horrendous. The material isn't spread out evenly, she sprinkles religion into her lectures (which are nearly always read word for word from a PowerPoint), she covers way to much material, especially since the test questions are very specific and closed note. DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS. Really, don't. It's abysmal.

Her class is hard but she is the best person in the world to teach it because she knows exactly how to structure things to help you learn and succeed.  She's one of the best professors I've had so far.

I took this course online and my peers took it in the classroom with Prof. Scola. Trust me, take this class online. Its difficult material and the 3 test online are super detailed and very challenging. Scoring %80 on these online test is considered good. You must study week or two in advance and be very organized with the note printouts she gives.

Took online. Tegrity lectures are great. Very clear. Good teacher. Make sure you attend SI. Hard class, must study. Exams are rediculously hard. She expects you to know every detail to get one question right. Automatically assumes everyone cheats bc exams are online so she makes exams extra hard.

I took this class online. The material is easy to understand, but the exams are EXTREMELY detailed and hard. Memorizing notecards for all the material was the only way I could do even alright on them. Study every day, even if its just a little bit, and DONT leave it till a week before the exam to start. Debby is super helpful if you ask, too.

Don't take it online. I didn't learn anything from her online class. The test are ridiculous. I feel like she is a lazy teacher, most of us were asking what does she do? I do not recommend, she also rounds down, not up.  Take it in class if you have the choice.
Do not take this class online, if you aren't good at teaching yourself. Anatomy is hard enough as it is. Her test are ridiculous, and this class wasn't helpful to me.
Great professor.

An easy class if you actually keep up on the weekly chapters and stay ahead, like you're SUPPOSED to. Exams were crazy hard though. BEWARE. THE. FINAL. It's beyond ridiculous. Ready to study 26 Chapters of Anatomy? Overall, a super nice (yet super difficult) professor that will help you anyway you can; very motivational and encouraging.

Great Professor! If one does not learn, or do well, it is because they have not put in the effort. Study everyday, learn and memorize the material, and you will do well in class. Stop blaming the teacher, and put some effort into your own education. You have Professor Dempsey, your slides, your book, and youtube....There is no excuse:)
She was great! Very helpful, the SI leader is awesome, so make sure to attend SI!
Absolutely Amazing!! She made this class so fun!  She was so helpful and she tried to do all she could to help us!

This class was very interesting. You have to be very self organized and study. This isn't the online class you can just take the tests without studying. It's tough but she keeps it very interesting and fun.

You better make sure you memorize every single word on her power points otherwise you won't do well. She tries to trick you a lot. Much harder now that you have to have your webcam turned on while taking an exam. Must study everyday

This class if tough!! It is only 4 exams that make up your grade. If you aren't a science major, you're going to struggle with the terms and it makes it that much more frustrating. I learned a lot in this class but i wish there was more meat to make up the grade if you don't test well...

Its an online class without a text book.  You are expected to devien what is on the test from her power points that are mixed with youtube videos about dogs surfing.  The class blackboard looks like a 12 year olds myspace.  If all I need to do is memorize, then give me a list.  Take this class if you want to have a bad time. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

I took this class online and it was super hard. It was a lot of my own fault because I neglected this class since it was online. I learn much better in a classroom setting. However, her Powerpoints were just awful and had a bunch of terrible graphics and weird, unnecessary stuff. I wouldn't recommend this class unless you're super dedicated.

This class requires a lot of self discipline and study. As long as you study everything she covers and keep up with the assignments, youll do fine...bio major or not. Debby was very helpful and even met with me a few times to go over some tough material. Shes willing to make time for her students and if you put forth the effort, youll get the grade
awesome professor!  very willing to help
if you hate science, she breaks it down as best she can for you. The department makes her teach most of the topics in that class. So its not her, her test are decent. Just study.
nice but tests are difficult

There's more material in this class than you can shake a stick at, but the instructor does a really fabulous job in structure and format. The notes are clear and concise, and you know from the start what's expected of you. You really have to work hard for a good grade, and you have to spend many hours with the material. Do this, you'll succeed.

She is a great professor. Tells you what you need to know and is straight forward with the content, however you still need to work hard in this class. The grade is all quizzes and exams, and you get up to 5 extra credit points by going to SI. Always responds fast to emails and is very willing to help you!
This is not an easy gen ed. Lock down browser for EVERYTHING. The tests cover a TON of material. It is a lot of information to cram.
Class is taught through an online program with self tests which she literally pulls word for word questions from. If you remotely do the self tests and memorize the answer choice, you'll do fine!
No Comments
She was a great teacher, I was glad to have her for biology since it's not one of my best subjects.
One of my best professors. Very helpful with a difficult subject.
No Comments
She was great. Explains things in a way that make sense to anyone. Always willing to help, even outside office hours. Has typed up notes for class. I'd take her class again!
She is Great, Dont Listen to Negative Feedback on Her, She is The Best!!!!!

This class was the worst. I attended class everyday but her accent makes it hard to understand her. She isn't very helpful at all. Even if you spend a week studying for her test I think it will still be hard to get a good grade.

HORRIBLE!! I wouldn't even call her a professor/dr. A 54% class average on exams is not at all normal, this shows lack ofteaching skills. She is not approachable at all and is very rude if you try to ask for help. She does tell you to get common sense even if you get 8 out of 9 pts. I got common sense and withdrew.
Prof. Lagadic is a horrible professor who at times is snooty and hardly helpful. She also wastes an enormous amount of paper.

She is the worst prof. I've ever had at NKU. You can read the book & go to class, but I doubt it will help. Her accent was cute 4 a while but that didnt last long! She doesnt help, doesnt explain, and is just terrible! And I usually love all my classes and professors, but she has seriously made me question my major and reason 4 going 2 NKU.

Worst professor I've had. Assigns too much homework, practice tests are nothing like the actual exams, not helpful to students, and she doesn't explain anything well. If you ask her for help she tells u to suck it up and use ur common sense. She is not approachable and should be fired. I signed up for BIO NOT CHEM!! I changed my major.

I hated this class. You can't understand her and when she talks it really doesn't make sense what she's saying. She's not very helpful because when you ask her a question, you can't understand her, nor does she make sense. She comes off really rude and snotty. I do not recommend her!
If you are a lazy student, obviously most who have rated this professor are, do not take this class.  Exams are hard, but formal lab reports make up for the bad grades.

to the one who commented below..having a 4.0 does not consider me being lazy. The professor is by far the worst ever. Even if you are smart, and try really hard, I guarantee it will still be the toughest class if you take it with Lagadic. Good Luck.

i got nowhere with this woman. she is really hard to understand and does NOT want to help at all.  although she knows so so so much about what she's teaching, she doesn't take the time needed to teach her students the material.  she kind of ruined my entire outlook on chemistry and shes kind of a b*tch

Professor Lagadic is a very unaproachable prof.  When I asked for help for something I was not understanding, I was told, "I do not have time for this.  I taught you this in class. Figure it out."  Her tests were impossible & went with practically nothing she taught in class

This professor is a genius. She has more knowledge for what she teaches than any other professor I have seen. She sometimes struggles to get all of the points for her lecture in and taught comprehensively within the 50 minutes allotted, but she is more than willing to meet with you outside of class to clear things up. Very fair teacher. A+ prof

This professor was very fair. She gives you chances to make up points on exams and to retake quizzes. If you are willing to put in 10 minutes of studying and work to help improve your grade, you will easily pass. I wish I would have taken complete advantage of the help she gives, and I would have dont even better. Take her, she is great.

Dr. Lagadic's lab section is a little more intense and time-consuming than other chemistry professors'.  She does require that every report due is typed, including every calculation and data sheet.  However, it is very rewarding because she provides immense feedback on them.  She explains the lab beforehand and does a great job explaining concepts.

Dr. Lagadic is a great professor.  Although she may have a french accent, she is very comprehensible and easily understood.  People who have rated her negatively are probably those who don't like/understand chemistry.  Her tests are very capable; many people just decide not to study for them.  She is a great professor and deserves more credit.

She is a great instructor, students who complain about accents are too busy listening to accents rather than what the instructors are saying, she is a little unapproachable but i was persistent and made her approachable, sometimes you have to do that. Got an A in her class, make use of OWL, never get any of them wrong, there is no reason to!
Dr. Lagadic did a great job. She was extremely helpful and answered all questoins as long as you asked. She had great oractice tests and great study guides. Do attend class. It helps a lot.
Dr. Lagadic is great.  She was always willing to help me out in 120 and 121.  Her lecture notes are great as well.  I never found any of her test all that difficult and learned alot from her.
She is fair and expects the work to be done.

I am currently taking Dr. Lagadic's chemistry course and I love it.   She's really really helpful and explains the concepts well.  I wasn't planning on attending NKU next year but have so much enjoyed her class that I am now considering it.  I completely recommend her. The work is challenging but she is fair and gives good opportunities to do well.

Although i was at first thrown off by her accent i eventually got use to it. Dr. Lagadic is probablly the most helpful teacher at NKU. Her exams arent all too hard and she gives you a study guide and practice exam. I would advise going over the practice exam multiple times because that is the same format as the test. If i can i will take her again.
i suppose she's a good teacher. but she's very picky. and i feel like she's somewhat hard to understand.

I had one year of high school chemistry before this class. If you've only had the same, you may end up lost. She was frustrated easily. I asked about a chart that was set up oddly in the protocol and she said she wasn't sure what language besides English I needed directions in. I dropped the course. I definitely don't recommend it for freshmen.

Prof. Lagadic is def not mean or snooty for all those people who said she was, she is very nice but she goes over the course material WAY too fast. Most of the people who found her class helpful probably have some chemistry background but trust me, DO NOT take her if you haven't taken chem before, you will be lost, take chem 102 first.

Dr. Lagadic is nice and allows you to gain extra points back on test which was really helpful. Sometimes it is hard to understand whats she's talking about, but most of the time I understood what was going on.

She assigns way too many formal lab reports that are at least 100 points each and her grading is so meticulous it's hard to get a good grade in her class even if you know the material. Exams are super hard and she makes you feel like an idiot if you ask her questions. She's foreign and hard to understand. I do not recommend her at all.

omg she is so hard to understand and when you go see her at her office she confuses the heck out of you avoid at all cost pre meds she hates the book find someone who can one teach and 2 you can undertsand

She is very nice, and she friendly, but my god... the tests are insane. She gives some partial which is the only thing that saved me. Be prepared to work your ass off, because the tests are over about a quarter of the book each time, and the final is comprehensive, no punches pulled. Math intensive.

Dr. Lagadic is probably one of the hardest professors I have ever had. Her exams are based off the book problems and NOT the OWL problems. Once you figure that out it makes the exams way easier. She allows you to get points back and if she likes you is very personable to you. She knows a lot about the subject matter too but can make you feel stupid
She has very difficult tests, but will help you if you ask questions and go to the review sessions. She is hard to understand and will make you feel very dumb. Extra credit points will be worked for.
I'm pretty sure she thinks this is a 300 level class i would go elsewhere but if you can't. Be ready to study a ton. The school suggest sitting in on other teachers if that gives you an idea.

So many people dropped this class, and for good reason. Not only is she super hard to understand, but she FLIES through the material. I was completely lost the entire time, and this is supposed to be a gen ed? The tests are crazy hard also, unless you've have a really good chemistry backround prior to taking her. Otherwise, avoid taking thsi class!

Lagadic is a great professor. She is very approachable, but her explanations will sometimes go over your head if you don't understand Chemistry. She is a very picky grader, so pay attention to significant figures and makes sure you label things well. Tests are not difficult if you are prepared and study your lab notes and the feedback she provides.
HIGH Expectations, expected you to be a chemist
I had a tutor and went to study sessions and was on borderline d-f
Dr. Lagadic is a very helpful chemistry teacher. She explains information very well and she is absolutely the best chemistry teacher I've had.

I advise anyone not to take this class unless you are in a higher level chemistry.  She is very hard to understand, an extremely hard grader, and her tests are huge!  Most students don't finish her tests in the time given.  Also, her online quizzes are on chapters ahead of what you review in class.  She is by far the worst teacher I have ever had!

Although Dr. Lagadic is a very kind individual, she is one of the worst professors I've had. She is very unclear, and her tests are incredibly difficult. If you are stuck with this professor, I HIGHLY advise you attend any and all study sessions- YOU WILL NEED THEM. I do not recommend this instructor, good luck if you have her.

Weekly quizzes over material learned that week, weekly (sometimes every two weeks) there's a homework packet with 15-20 problems over the chapters covered in lecture. Tests are decent length and sometimes require fast computation to get done in time. She genuinely wants her students to learn and gives many examples in class.

Every so often she gives a packet of up to 15 problems, graded partially on completeness, partially on correctness.  She takes time out every week to have a set study session outside of class that you get extra credit for attending.  Study hard, she wants you to do your best.  I wish I could have her for every chemistry class I take.

Prof. Lagadic is the worst professor I have ever had. I do well in Chemistry but she managed to confuse all knowledge I had. Homework and quizzes are given but not returned (not helpful), exams are extremely challenging and too long for the time period, she is mean and unclear. Would not recommend this professor to anyone. If you have her, DROP!!!

Dr. Lagadic is one of my favorite professors at NKU. She really cares about her students, if they are trying. She is a tough grader, but she is very clear about her expectations, and if you follow them, you shouldn't have a problem.

Dr. Lagadic cares more about the student's development academically and professionally than most of the professors at NKU. As long as you read her syllabus, take it seriously, and are considerate in your emails, she will help you out as much as you need. Dr. L goes above and beyond for the students who are respectful and genuinely try. Take her!

She is a hard grader. A question for a lab would be an opinion question, and she'd mark it wrong. She expected answers for post/pre-lab questions that weren't even in the question, so you lose points for that. Expects you to study for exams off of your previous labs when she still has some of your labs. DO NOT TAKE PROFESSOR LAGADIC.

Dr. Lagadic is known as a tough professor, but I found her to be fair and understanding. Some of the post-labs were a bit specific, but she is always open to questions so long as you are respectful when you reach out to her. I would definitely take her again!
This professor is the absolute hardest out of all the other professors. This class was absolutely rediculous. I will probably end up retakeing with a different professor

She is very kind and willing to help. That said, she is also hard to understand, and she turns the lights off during class so that can be a problem if you get sleepy. Her tests tend to be very long for the time period, and they are harder than the ones in the practice exam. Finally, we did not cover everything that is in the final.

She gives homework every week on all the content learned that week. All the notes you need are uploaded on blackboard to print. However, she does not provide detailed explanations on how she gets the answers. Moves very fast through the notes.

Professor Lagadic should be teaching an upper level course and NOT an introductory one. She was very slow to grade work, did not give clear feedback on exams, and exams were astronomically harder than any of the practice ones. She tells you not to buy the textbook but I wish I had bought it anyways because I had to teach myself most of the content.

While there is truth in the statements that there is a lot of homework, you get the entire week, if not more, to complete it. She has to go through notes quickly to cover the material, but she provides the notes to print out/follow on bb. Her tests are straightforward, and if you study and pay attention you will do well. No textbook required.

Teaches way too fast, but if you ask her, she's willing to ask you. Dr. Lagadic is not very clear sometimes and makes things look harder than what they actually are. Overall, she's not the worst professor, but I really would recommend a different teacher for 102 and maybe her for a higher class. Don't buy the book either, just buy the OWL code.

Where to start... well first off she is french and it very hard to understand what she is saying, so that makes the class a little more difficult, also i missed one day of her class and she told me that i was not able to make up anything that i missed becuase it was against her policy. so i missed about 150 points just for that day.

also one day in her class i didnt get something that she said so i asked her about it, and when i did she told me that she couldn't help me becuase it wasn't the fact that i didn't understand she said it was becuase i didn't listen and dont care. over all she is a horrible teacher and i think all other comments will confirm my comment.
DO NOT take a gen ed with this professor! She does not care about her students and seems to go out of her way to be cold and cruel.
She is the best chemistry professor ever. She gives ten points extra credit on each exam!!!!! enough said
Horrible professor took forever to give anything back. Test were extremely hard. She is an extremely hard grader!!! By far worst chemistry I have had!

She never let international student to use the dictionary!!! That makes she bacome the worse professor in the whole Science Center!!! Also!!! We cannot understand what she said at all!!! never give us a chance to explain what we did in the lab. THE WORSE!!!

Horrible teacher, goes too fast then doesn't explain anything (and if she tries she makes it worse!), gives an insane amount of OWL, doesn't even attempt to work with you on anything, concerning emails were responded to by sarcastically rude patronizing  comments.
offers ten points extra credit for each test. writes very detailed notes. never had to open the book.
Dr. Lagadic is awesome. Tons of extra credit opportunities and very concise lectures.

Can't understand what she's saying. Expects everything to be memorized the day she teaches it. I was learning more from using Google to understand her power points. She really shouldn't be teaching an intro class.

idc what y'all say she is a good professor for CHE 120L. By FAR the worst professor that you will ever have the misfortune of taking if you step into her "classroom" she has no care in the world for students if they make any mistake and will kick some students out of class for being unprepared. terrible. cares more about how you fill things out than if you have the correct answer or not. homework are long and significantly easier than the exams, and she only grades two problems off the homework. so if you miss those two, tough luck. The tests were extremely difficult and the final exam included sections that were never discussed in lecture. Avoid this professor

Professor Lagadic is a very rude and difficult person to have as a professor. I am warning you do not take her lab because she is very rude to you. She always screams at you and tells you what can you not understand. Very difficult

Dr. Lagadic should not be teaching an entry-level course. She tried to explain things, but it didn't really help and she was hard to understand. She explains things thoroughly and completely before beginning a lab, and is willing to answer questions throughout the lab period. She's a tough grader, but I found her feedback to be helpful.

If you are a serious student, you can succeed in this class. I like Dr. Lagadic's teaching style; she is very clear in her lectures and posts note sheets that you can print and bring to class. She didn't teach two chapters that were on the ACS final (electrochemistry and nuclear chemistry); We had to teach ourselves. We got blindsided at the end.
Respondus lockdown browser is used. Hard to understand material & the homework is excessive. Tests are extremely hard for no reason

Her accent is at first difficult to understand.  Once you get a grasp of what words she is actually speaking, it is then difficult to follow. Has a pretty rough accent, but it gets easier to understand throughout the semester. But it makes it hard to understand what she is trying to ask sometimes. Great Professor! She know the subject and is really quite easy. She gives everyone a chance for an A.
Her accent is awful. Had to drop the class.
I could not understand her and she was very rude to our class and did not understand our questions.
She is very nice and very helpful when you ask for help.  I found her lectures hard to understand, mainly because of the accent.

Yes, she has an accent. But it isn't nearly as bad as other professors I've had. I got used to it quickly. She understands the material perfectly and explains it well. Alina is one of the best professors in the computer science dept. She never cancels class. She is always willing to help every student until he or she understands the material. One of the best Computer Science teachers I have had.  I love her!!!! Whenever I had a problem I would just go to her office and she would sit down and explain things to me. Very nice! Cool teacher, easy class.

She knows what she teaches. she works hard for the class materials. I liked her class :)

She is doesn't care for students if someone do hard work  also and request her fro increasing grade. The test were hard and were difficult. I would not take class again with her and not recommend for newly students who are new to this class.

she is very tough grader. she doesn't allow any make- ups. sometimes the test contains material even from outside which is way too hard.

her exams are not a 100 level kind, she thinks everyone knows programming and forgets that she is teaching a 100 level class! terrible, would not advise anyone to take her

Dr. Campan is one of the best computer science professors at NKU.  She is from Romania so she does have an accent, but she is not hard to understand.  She is always prepared for class and explains everything in great detail and will not move on until everyone understands the material.

I LOVE HER <3. she gives 7 assignments and 6 quizzes and 2 midterm exams and of course final exam. quizzes and midterms are easy but the assignments are very challenging. you need to study and practice to pass this course. Very nice, sometimes her accent makes her hard to understand, but she makes up for it by helping and being kind. However I do feel she can get frustrated with some students that take forever, which I don't blame her.

Very good professor. Very understanding. Quizzes can be a pain in the butt with multiple right answers. Seems like she can get frustrated with the slower students, but this stuff isn't rocket science, so I can understand where she's coming from.

Very intelligent instructor.  She is very helpful and not afraid to help with advanced topics that are outside of this class.  I loved her as an instructor and hope to have her in a future class.

I really liked her. She's a little hard to understand sometimes because of her accent but other than that she is a really good teacher. Explains content well.
Great teacher, uses blackboard well and the class was engaging.

he is a VERY nice guy who helped out our micro class as much as he could. you have to take a quiz each week online. he let us have 2 attempts which was awesome. he provides powerpoints for each concept and a week b4 the test, he goes thru them and filters out what we need to kno 4 the test. make flash cards of the slides and ur set! very good prof.

Dr. Mester, really knows his microbiology.  He has always been willing to help us understand the subject.  He is very encouraging.  It is not a class you can float through.  You will need to study.  If you work hard you should do well.
Dr. Mester is great, he makes funny nerdy jokes about micro to keep you entertained. He is a little over your head, but if you ask questions and read the book you should be fine!

He's a fantastic teacher. He doesn't just read straight off the powerpoints and relates the material to real-life situations in which help you remember the material. He's very understanding and flexible.
