On the plus side, he's an awesome guy to shoot the breeze with and talk science with.. off the record.   He's cool but I don't know that I'd take another of his classes.  He expects way too much but is very accomodating.

He smiles A LOT, willing to help always, sometimes plays the Ramone's, but biology can be tough.  There is a lab practical and exam after every 4 labs, and homework about every 2 weeks. Fairly easy professor, just not very clear, homework was sometimes returned months later, he is nice, just doesnt take time to explain himself, expects you to just automatically know everything...

His only downside is his EngRish is rusty.  I'd take him again if I had the chance.  I even stop to talk to him in the hallway every once in a while.

He's a great teacher, I just HATE programming.  He grades pretty easy on assignments and lets you re-submit for better grade.  Midterm and especially final are hard, but he gives you pre-test practice questions. No book needed! Super nice guy and wants everyone to succeed.  Would recommend for any class.

Dr. Hao has exceeded my expectations. He is very intelligent, funny, & always in an excellent mood. He will ask a lot of obvious questions (which extends lectures) but he does this to engage active listening. He does more than enough to prepare you to be successful. Don't be lazy & take notes in the well prepared PowerPoints he provides.

Dr. Wei Hao is the worst professor at NKU. I would never take his class again. He has no sense of empathy and he doesn't respect his students. He insults and compares students if they are from non cs background. I would never suggest him to any student. He is biased and partial towards students. He makes students feel low. He is not humble at all.
Wei Hao is a good professor but this class is extremely challenging. You must prepare a week in advance for the midterm and final projects as they are complex and grading is strict.

One of the worst professors I've had, tests are very hard and project instructions are unclear and usually not on things covered in class. He's rarely available outside of class,office hours are only 2 days a week for an hour each, and even if you do go to him for help, he gives hardly any information.
He was not really helpful. His explanation is just too boring.His exams are really tough and his correction is just too strict.

I think that Prof. Hao is the worst professor I have had. He is very unclear yet expects everyone to understand. If you ask a question, he gives you a poor response then moves on. He will not give detailed help when needed. Projects are not related to course material so you have not covered what you are trying to do. Test are memorization only. BAD

-the midterm had content that was not taught. I spent 10 real hours working on the midterm throughout several days and asking the professor for guidance on the part we did not learn, and he ignored me. He doesn't check emails during midterm week. I had to accuse him of ignoring me to get an answer and all he said 'was I am not ignoring you'POS

This was for Cloud Computing. He gives slides and there are labs to work on, you don't need the textbook. He wrote the textbook, so that's why he wants you to buy it. I'm not sure it's even used anywhere else. Use the labs and the slides and you'll be fine. I didn't even open the book. Final is open note. Overall very easy.

Seriously the BEST math teacher I have ever had. she really cares about students and is always available to help you. She is very clear with explanations and goes over tons of example problems. Also she gives you a week to turn in homework assignments so you have a chance to ask questions if you get stuck before you turn it in. AWESOME PROFESSOR!
Excellent professor. She cares about her students and wants you to do good. One of the best teachers I've had at NKU!

She is probably the best teacher I have taken. She doesn't require attendance and her tests answers are posted online after tests and have study guides online that are exactly like tests. She is pretty good looking as well. Buy the book if you wish to learn anything. If you attend class you should be fine but if not you need the book for homework.
Very helpful and clear. Great at explaining things so that students can understand them. We didn't have to turn in homework but if you want to do good on tests you should do the assignments.

She treats her students like they're in the fifth grade. And she's really uptight about everything. But it's not too hard of a class and the homework isn't mandatory. There are 12 quizzes and 3 tests. If you're good at math expect an easy A but if you have trouble with math then don't expect to learn much.

Shes a great teacher! She will explain everything. Will ask if you have hw questions, and will go through as many as the class needs. Usually a quiz a week, but only have 2 questions on them. She doesn't mark off the whole problem if you get 1 part wrong either. Go to class, take notes, ask questions & you will pass - garunteed.

i liked her a lot.  i thought the class was easy but i could see why if you did not get math easily that it could be very hard.  do not have to turn homework in and is very helpful with explaining the problems though!!!
Very helpful, just talk to her and she will work to get you the best grade possible.

I'm horrible in Math, but got an 87 on my first test. She doesn't collect homework which is a plus & answers any questions you have before starting new material! Pretty easy class if you come to class, take notes, and listen!

I hated this class so much. She is nice one on one but in a class setting not so much. She makes you feel dumb and isn't nice about makeup work. If you can don't take her class. It isn't anything you want. I used to like math now I hate it because of her.

She is the greatest. she can explain anything and is very easy to understand. she is willing to help ANYONE and you do not have to do any homework. possibly the greatest teacher ever for the fact that she has 3 classes each with 75 students and she remembers the majority of their names. TAKE HER. she's hot too
i highly recommend her. very organized and understandable. probably the best math class i've ever taken. if you go to class and pay attention, you'll do great.

She is so nice! She doesn't require that you turn in homework, but beware... If you don't do it, you will be behind on the exams. She is very helpful, and is willing to drop anything she is doing in her office to help you with homework. Take her!

Absolutely the best math teacher I've ever had.  I tried to take pre-cal 3 times and compared to her, everybody else was speaking a different language.  HIGHLY recommended.  She's just a sweetheart, she's extremely organized and makes math seem easy.  Just make sure you go to class and do the homework.
had her for finite math. Math was never a stroung subject but laura is excellent at teaching and doing it in a way that the material makes sense. she is one of the best math teachers at NKU

This is the best math teacher ive ever hadin my life and also helped me get my first A in math ever. She teaches really well and makes sure you understand. Highly recommend to anyone nervous about math!

She is an excellent and very smart teacher.  She runs a tight ship which I appreciate.  It makes you take her seriously and pushes you to learn the material.  She is super organized, knows math inside and out, and doesn't waste a minute of class time.  I learned more in her class than in any other.  She's very fair and helpful.
Very good professor, I would say that she is the best math teacher I've ever had.  Did a great job of making the subject easy to understand, would highly recommend her as a professor.

I had Mrs. Urbanski my freshman year. Going into the class I loathed math but she is extremely clear and makes sure that everyone understands. I averaged a C in high school but I got an A in her class. Would recommend one of her classes if you have to take a math.

You will take 6 pages of notes per day. She writes at lightening speed so while you are trying to catch up she is explaining so you miss alot. You have homework every single night as well as an online quiz once per week. I did all of my homework, had an A in the class, but was completetly unprepared for the test so I dropped.

She is a really great teacher! She spends time going over homework questions from the class before first part of class then she gets into the lecture, it's a lot of notes but by the end of every class you'll understand the material. Plus she really gets into reviews right before your exams which helps. Take Urbanski for 109 or 114!!!

She is awesome! Gives 10 online homework assignments that you can re-do until you have them right. 3 tests. If you come to class, take the notes, and study you will do just fine. She makes it all seem really easy, and takes the time to explain everything clearly

I've always been terrible at math and she explains everything so well that it was like a light switching on in my head. When you miss class she will help you catch up if you visit her office, and will even lend you her own lecture notes! One of the best teachers I have ever had, highly recommend her.

She is extremely helpful and friendly. All problems are clearly laid out and she takes them all step by step, also goes over a variety of types for each problem. Would highly recommend, she makes class more bearable and always has a cheery disposition each day.

Mrs. Urbanski is a wonderful teacher. She gives clear instruction on what she wants on her test, and is always willing to help you. responds to emails quickly. Her test are pretty easy if you show up and do the in class review.

Out of all the Finite math classes at NKU her tests are by far the easiest.  She gives you a problem and will say give me the variables and thats it. Or she will give you the equation and say do the next step very easy! Online hw you can take as many times as you want. attendance is not a grade.

Mrs. Urbanski is very nice and she is willing to help you. Her tests and quizzes are tough. MAT 140 is a tough class period! Make sure you show up to all classes. She did drop the lowest quiz grade, but she grades tough. Also, she does not allow makeups for quizzes even if you miss it due to technical difficulties. She expects you to participate.

She was a pretty nice lady, but the class was a bit tough at times. It was her first year teaching this particular class, and the technology involved she was not familiar with. That made it pretty difficult. She was very strict as well and wasn't good at being clear with the material she was presenting.
She is by far the best teacher for math at NKU!  She is extremely helpful and tests are not bad at all.  Take her!

One of the best math teachers ever.  The way she explains it is very helpful.  She wants everyone to do well and do anything she can for that to happen.  Definitely need to go to class or you will miss a section.  The book homework she assigns doesn't have to be turned in so I didn't do it.  Four tests and a final that is cumulative.

Best math teacher EVER. I've never been good at math and the way she teaches really helps understand the material. I wish I could take her for every math class I ever have to take! Just don't miss class, and you'll be fine!

Professor Urbanski is literally the best math teacher I have ever had. She explains everything SO well! And she's VERY willing to help. Do the book homework even though she doesn't collect it, it will help you. If she teaches any of the classes I need to take in the future, I'm taking her class.

Mrs. Urbanski is a good prof and class is pretty easy compared to other math classes.  Class is basically doing example problems, it's boring but it helps you understand.  There is online homework and optional book homework basically everyday, but overall the class was pretty easy.
Best math teacher there is and shes more than willing to help you no matter the circumstances

She really cares about you passing the class if you show the effort. She gives an attendance sheet out every class but I don't think attendance is part of the grade? Every class is full of note taking. It's easy to not want to pay attention because it's math and lectures are somewhat boring but STAY AWAKE and PAY ATTENTION! All homework is online.

Professor Urbanksi is probably the best math teacher I've ever had. Go to every class, and it'll be impossible to fail. Miss one class, and you miss a lot. I highly recommend her to anyone wanting to take a math course.

Mrs. Urbanski is the best math teacher I've ever had. NKU is fortunate to have her.  She is a consummate professional who cares about doing her job well, and cares about her students. She doesn't talk down to people. She is a positive person and her positive energy radiates to the class - she's a nice lady and a wonderful teacher.
great teacher!

She is a wonderful person and great teacher! She explains things very thoroughly and gives plenty of time for the class to write notes and ask questions. She assigns a lot of homework, which is sometimes a bit tedious, but it's good practice. The homework makes exam problems much easier. It's math, so you have to show up or you will be very behind.

Mrs. Urbanski is the best math teacher I've ever had. She's professional, friendly, inspiring and good at teaching. She explains everything she's doing so if you pay attention, you can do well. I'm not a math person, but I've learned math like I never know I could, with her help. I feel lucky to have had the privilege to be in her class!
She is a fantastic professor. She is really nice and the class is easy if you come and pay attention. She takes attendance, but it isn't mandatory.

Best Teacher ever. She is welling to help at her office hours anyone anytime. She is always smiling, in class she really works hard to make you understand the subject. RECOMMEND her for sure. but you need to keep in touch with her plus work hard. :)

Oh my Gosh, she is so amazing! One of the best teacher's ever. She is so sweet and super helpful. She is always willing to answer questions through email, in class, and even in her office. Her class is not so hard. All you have to do is come to EVERY class and try to do most of the homework. If you do the homework, you will understand the material!

I have not taken a math class in over 20 year, and managed to get a B+. Yes I worked hard, but the credit goes to her being a very efficient& great professor. If math scares you, definitely take her because she really breaks it down for you to understand. Her teaching style should be in every school in America. Oh, she writes very fast, so keep up!
She is an amazing professor. So nice, friendly, and approachable she actually makes everything understandable for everyone. I would highly recommend taking all math classes needed through her!

Mrs. Urbanski is an amazing professor! She is willing to help you, whether that is inside or outside of the classroom. She has most assignments on Imath. You DO NOT need the textbook for 109, for 114 on the other hand you WILL need the textbook. She submits grades fast and also grades tests fast  and hands them back the next class.
Really nice teacher!  Will do whatever possible to help her students succeed.  If you attend class and do the homework you will pass.  Hope I can have her for all of my classes!

Professor Urbanski is overall a great professor. Teaches the material very well and makes sure everyone understands it prior to moving on. If you do the HW, Study, and go to class you will pass this class. Multiple online HW which are easy and can re-do until you get them right. 4 tests and 1 accumulative final. Great teacher. Def. take her again.

I enjoy this class because I like math but she goes EXTREMELY fast, you need to be at class every single day and be prepared to take lots of notes.  I do not like the program she uses to do homework but I'm sure she can't help that.  Everything on the test we covered in class.  Though I found it difficult at first to keep up, I would take her again
She is a very nice woman, very helpful if you ask. SHe gives amazing notes, but if you do not show up for class you will struggle. not much homework, test are decently hard. she funny too.

Mrs. Urbanski is one of et math teachers I've ever had. Though her class can be boring at times and there is a lot of notetaking involved, it is very helpful. Also, I never do the book homework and I'm passing with an A.

I always did bad in/ thought I sucked at Math until I took Professor Urbanski's class. I've had her for two math classes now and she is a gem. Can sometimes seem harsh but not terribly. Sometimes felt like she went too fast towards the middle/end of the class, but that could be because it was a 7 week course. Overall, take her!!!

Good professor, does a good job of thoroughly explaining the material. Don't take her online class, she is extremely strict about certain things and will have no problem giving you 0s on quizzes and tests for even the most minor problems with your testing environment.

DONT TAKE ONLINE COURSE WITH HER. Homework is nothing like her lectures. She will give you a 0 if your environment video on lockdown isn't good enough. Terrible at teaching the subjects online. 0/10. Would never take her again. Avoid her

I took this class online because it was the only thing offered to me. Mind you it is also a 8 week course so it was very time consuming. When I started to struggle in certain areas Professor Urbanski took time to help me outside of class which made me successful in the end. If you are struggling in her class, let her know & she will help you.

I took this class online, and didn't always understand the way that she would explain in her videos, so I would learn through the homework system, and her quizzes and tests don't look like the homework. I know someone who took her class a couple semesters ago though, and they swear by her as the best, so it just depends on your learning style.
Very rude professor. She is very picky when it comes to respondus browser. She does not make exceptions even when the issue is out of your control. Stay away.
The lectures are very straightforward with great notes. Always willing to help you understand the material. Great at responding back to emails.

I would never take another class with this professor. She is very strict with standards regarding Lockdown Browser. She did not respond to messages quickly and acted like I was bothering her when I asked questions. Definitely one of the worst classes I've taken

Very accessible outside of class, genuinely cares about her students and their success, and exams are just like problems from the homework.However, 90% of the grade in this class comes from exams, but as long as you complete the hw (which is optional) you will be fine. Overall, this professor was great at explaining content and you should take her.

I had to contact her a few times for issues with Lockdown Browser, and she always responded quickly, which was nice. However, I really take issue with the final exam being 50% of the course grade. That's completely unreasonable given that this was a 100 level math course. If you struggle with test-taking, I wouldn't recommend taking her courses.
I had a terrible experience with Laura. She was one of the most unapproachable professors I have ever had. Every time I asked her a question she acted like it was an inconvenience.

Mrs. Urbanski was my favorite math professor that I've had so far. She teaches the concepts extremely simply and really wants you to understand, not just how to do it but why. There is a lot of homework. The online textbook isn't necessary but you do have to buy the online code. If you have a chance take. her. class.

Laura was the absolute worst teacher Ive ever had. Any time I asked for help she would make me look stupid in front of everyone. Ive always been an a-b student, not there! She wasnt private about your own test grades, or letting you know if she wanted to see you after class. If you can take any other teacher do it. 10/10 do not recommend her!!!

WOW, I loved Laura as a professor. I have always struggled with math and she does an AMAZING job really explaining problems and making sure everyone understands. This is not an easy class but she makes it bareable and gives everyone a good chance of passing. 100% going to miss her :(

In the midst of COVID-19, she took the time to prepare lecture videos just as she was teaching in class. She expected you to watch those on your own time and then left class time for optional zoom calls for help on the homework. She is always available to answer your questions. She wants to help you succeed.

Dr. Wang is always willing to help. Some of her assignments are very easy, while some can take a while. Quizzes are rather easy. Go to class, complete in class assignments as well as out of class assignments/projects and you should be ok. Final/Mid-term worth quite a bit.

Easy if you have prior experience.  She covers material quickly and sometimes is not clear.  She is hard to understand because of her accent, but will help you if you need it.  She is willing to stay after class and help you finish homework and projects.

Online -- Very great schedule and super prompt with email responses. Her English isn't perfect, but it isn't that hard to understand her. It's easy to know what she wants and it wasn't hard to get an A.

I took this class online and it was a joy.  Professor Wang had everything assigned in blackboard on Monday's and you had a week to do it.  Test after every chapter.  Final project was fun but it is a group project and being an online class, the communication gap was a slight problem at times. Great Professor!

One of the most genuinely nice and caring professors. Incredibly laid back and willing to work with the student. She is always willing to help. She even rescheduled  around Halloween because it was a night class. Lectures are really dull, but you can mostly just go over them yourself. Easy grader, I don't know how I did so well on the exams.

Her accent is very thick which is to be expected.  Her lectures are also VERY boring and dry, but it's HTML so what can you expect?  There are 3 tests including the final, and you're allowed to have a cheatsheet on all of them.  She's a SUPER easy grader, too.

Great instructor, I took this class during the summer so it was a little more difficult to keep up with the work.  Some of the assignments were easier that others and some of them can take a while to finish. I think I should have taken this class during a full term so that I could of had more time to absorb the material better.

I had this class in spring, and Dr. Wang was really nice. But one problem was that her accent was heavy and sometimes our class couldn't understand her. Although we couldn't understand her she was quick to respond to emails. She was open to any feedback on her teaching style and overall I would recommend this professor.

Very thick accent that is difficult to get used to. She is very nice though and loves it when you participate! Quizzes are online and at home, so super easy. Exams were a bit more challenging though. HTML is an easy language to learn.

Great instructor, was my first time taking any web development and by the end of the class I was very confident in my abilities. She is not a native English speaker but I was able to understand her just fine. One assignment and one online quiz each week and two exams and one project.

The accent is hard to understand at first but you get used to it. She is a super nice professor. HTML and CSS are a cake walk then you get to JS and it gets somewhat difficult. There is a big group project at the end of the semester. Week in and week out quizzes, in class assignments, and labs. Go to class or you'll miss out on 100 pts every day.

Dr. Wang is a very sweet woman. Her accent is heavy but is easy to get used to. There are weekly assignments, quizzes, and in-class activities. There is also a group project that starts shortly into the semester. I would recommend starting the assignments early as they can be time-consuming. Also, she responds quicker on teams as opposed to email.

Professor Hongmei was one of the more tougher professors, but she was ALWAYS willing and ready to help explain material. She was hands down one of my favorite professors here at NKU. She covers material quickly, but will always explain it nonetheless.
No Comments

He was not very helpful. Way he explains things isn't relevant to computers and (while its amusing) it didn't teach much n made it frustrating bc it took so long to lecture something that should b simple. Doesn't give clear directions on how to correct hmwk (u can keep correcting n turning in til you get an A) u basically teach yourself.
He was a good teacher and was pretty funny. He gives you many opportunities to get an A. Take him for this class.

This guy is awesome! Class is boring, but very easy. He's very clear and willing to help you with anything. Gives a lot of extra credit. Great guy and good professor i would take him again. You want this guy. Never used the book you just need the MyITLab code.

The class itself is not hard, but lectures are almost impossible to get through. Attendance is taken everyday, so there is no way getting around it. He is a very tough grader, and everything must be exactly how he wants it.

This class was almost too easy. You can learn everything on your own and was mainly focused on Entity Relationship Modeling with the most basic covering of SQL. You won't learn much but you can easily get an a if you actually do the work. The only bad thing is that his quizzes are ALL true and false.

Professor is willing to help in any way needed.  If you don't understand a topic or need help with an assignment he'll work with you so you can understand it.  The class was pretty hard but if you read the chapters and pay attention in class you'll be fine

Burke makes it nearly impossible to do bad the class. Constant extra credit and if you ask him for help, he will take you through step by step. If you need to take INF101, take it with him. Takes attendance but not mandatory. Weekly assignments but plenty of class time to get them done. Says "OK, cool!" constantly. Awesome dude.
Make sure you at least have the INF 101 Lab with Burke, he is able to help you if you can't figure something out and is overall a nice guy. You need the book only for access to myitlab.

It is a lot of busywork that takes a while to complete but is not hard. The lectures are boring, but as long as you complete the simnet assignments you will be fine. He was helpful if you had a question and gives extra credit.

Dr. Murphy is newer to campus.  She is nice, fair, and understanding.  She will do anything that she can to help you!  You will definitely use the book.  She keeps you up to date with what is going on and keeps office hours for students to come in.
Dr. Murphy is an amazing professor. Math is difficult for me however, she is extremely helpful. I received my first B in a math class ever! I wish she were teaching 141. I highly recommend her!!!!
Dr. Murphy is a great professor! This class was extremely easy because she is (almost too) fair! She is very helpful> If you must take Mat 140, take her 100%!
Dr. Murphy is absolutely amazing!! She is sooo positive and soo helpful! She is definately the best professor I've ever had in my three years at NKU! Take her!

Dr. TJ is great! She's the easiest teacher I've ever had. She knows her material and explains it so that any idiot can understand. I'm not good at math and her class is a piece of cake. Her only downfall would be her occasional absence when she has a sub teach our class that doesn't teach as well. If you want an easy A take her!!!

I had a love/hate relationship with TJ. I loved her in the fact that she is extremely nice and helpful I hated her in the fact that she is unorganized. However, I would definately take her again. She makes you explain everything you do so be prepared to write too!

Favorite. Professor. EVER. I've never been good at math but this has been one of my favorite classes. She's amazing & even types of the notes for the whole semester and puts them on blackboard for you to print out. I wish she also taught MAT 141!!!

She is probably the most caring teacher I've ever had.  She's very kind to all her students and will bend over backwards to help you.  She's a very laid back teacher and I would take her again in a heart beat.
I liked this class, she doesn't assign homework, she only assigns 'practice problems' that she doesn't check. Honestly, it was a really laid back class.

Math is NOT my best subject. I've always stuggled with it. TJ is great. I just got my final grade for the semester.. and I got my first 'A' in a math class. And they 'A' is not because the class is easy. It's because she actually teaches you. I understand math SO MUCH BETTER NOW. TAKE HER CLASS.
SHE IS THE BEST TEACHER EVER. Cares so much about her students, and doesnt go on until everyone understands, super nice, pretty easy grade if you work for it, she'll help you!

She's easily the most helpful and caring professor I had this semester. She's very sweet, and often reviews test materials and concepts the class struggles with to make sure everyone understands. Attendance was not mandatory but if you still regularly attend class, you'll have no problem passing.

I loved TJ! She's so sweet and very good at explaining the content in class. I am not a math person but I almost didn't struggle at all in this class because she was such a big help. If math is your weak point as well, you'll be comfortable with her.
Super nice lady. Genuinely cares about her students. 10/10 would recommend, especially if you don't like the subject.

Dr. Murphy rocks! She made math make so much sense to me and made me feel like I was actually good at math! She gives 2 tests and a final, 3 simple assignments, and a poster project. No homework! Attendance is not mandatory but I recommend going to class! She gives great examples and explains everything very clearly. She is so sweet too! Take her!
Dr. Murphy is a great instructor and is mostly very nice and helpful. I would recommend her to anyone, particularly those who don't like math.

Doc. M is the best professor I've had! She is very helpful and wants to make sure you understand before moving on. I would say I'm pretty decent at math and this class was a breeze for me, so at times the slowness can be annoying sometimes. Overall GREAT CLASS.

Professor Davis is very helpful and approachable.  She has plenty of office hours and gives positive recommendations regarding writing assignments.  A reflective paper is due each week total of 10 for the whole semester.  For the 2 major papers a re-writes is available to improve your grades. One group presentation which is 30% of your grade.

Professor Davis was extremely strict on her attendance policies and the ability to turn in work if you miss a class even with valid excuses. This class could have been really interesting but she kept lectures straight from the book. She was also hard to understand at times.

This professor loves her job and is very passionate. BUT..... she has a very hard time describing the assignments, which make little to no sense. She is a very hard grader. It seems like you cannot please her with whatever you write!! She cannot keep the attention of her class!!! No one pays attention

Pam is very clear on what she expects out of her assignments. She gives constructive criticism and is willing to help make your papers better. Do all of the assignments and you will get an A! She is very willing to help and is very interested in community health.

Lectures are not terrible but she grades way to hard on assignments that are due everything week. Attendance is mandatory. I would take a different teacher if possible; the ones who did will get a A, where I got a B and put a lot of effort in.

Pam is always clear on what she expects of you. Also the exams are online. I thought the class was very easy; the lectures are very dull and boring though. You need the Community textbook to write reflective papers and to take the open-book exams. Overall I really liked Pam, she is very kind and helpful.
Great guy. He's very patient and willing to help. I would definitely take him again.

This guy is awesome. And compared to what I've heard about the other teachers in the physics dept., you will hate your life if you take anyone else.  He is very patient and wants to understand what is going on. Easy labs and good times to be had.
Great teacher, very personable, very patient.  Fair grader.  Fun class.
He is very helpful and I have learned a lot. It was hard and PHY isn't something I enjoy but he makes it bare able.

Awesome professor!  Very, very helpful, and a fair grader as well.  I felt like he really wanted me to succeed in his class.  He also has a great sense of humor and makes funny comments during class to keep things fun!  If I ever had to take another PHY class again, I would ONLY consider taking Dr. DeSilva.  He made this class bearable!!

This man actually made me enjoy a 7AM summer physics class!  He explained everything so well, and had no problem spending lots of time on one concept if the class didn't understand.  He graded very easily as well.  My only qualm is that his accent makes him a little difficult to understand.
I liked him a lot.I'm not a math person but somehow he made me understand it.If you really come to class and try, you to can get a good grade in this class.I did!

Mostly easy course.  Attendance is mandatory and the course is designed so that you must show up on more than just exam dates to pass.  If you have troubles, meet up with him in his office and he will take the time to help you.

He is a great teacher. More than willing to help out students. Class is easy as long as you pay attention in class and do the homework. If you do not understand the material he is willing to go over it again with you. Quizzes are every Thursday so it forces you to go to every class.

Great teacher! Attendance is expected but it's worth it. He explains everything step-by-step & is happy to help of you don't understand something. Quizzes aren't hard & he gives plenty of review for exams.
He does a great job of explaining things.  HIs style is much like a high-school teaching style.
I hate Math, but Jim Clark actually taught me how to do a few things and I even got an A in the class! Whatever you do, show up and you can't fail.

Many people didn't do well in this course for some reason... He assigns homework every class but never grades it. I did the homework regardless, which may be extra work, but it made the course a breeze. I highly recommend doing the homework. Excluding the non-mandatory homework, I suppose the text book is unneeded.

Took the class in the summer and loved it. Go to class and you will be fine. He is always willing to help if you have questions. Homework isn't a must, but if you don't understand the material it will help you.
He explains the material very well and is pretty fun, definitely would take him again
Great math techer ever! Easy class, please take his class.

I highly recommend this professor.  Every class he goes over homework problems that people may have trouble with and will ask for any questions on the material.  He is really easy and he doesn't give that much homework.

Loved taking Math with Mr. Clark! He's a great guy, super nice and is willing to help you with anything. You MUST attend class otherwise you will be confused and fall behind. 3 tests, one of those 3 being the final (Non-comprehensive) DO THE HOMEWORK. Scores you extra points.
Took over the summer. Do the homework and show up and you'll do fine
He's a great teacher. I would highly recommend him to anyone who has trouble with Mathematic courses.
Took it over the summer, it was easy if you kept up with the homework and attended class.

He has a great personality and sense of humor. Huge thing I did not like was that he always messed up while teaching. When a student asked for help he sometimes acted like he had no time to do so. Most importantly, when I took tests/quizzes I always had to re check his grading and multiple times was given the wrong grade it was a big issue.

I took this class with Mr. Clark over the Summer and absolutely loved. If you show up to class and do your homework you will do just fine. He was always willing to help me when I needed and even would show up to class early in case you had questions. I look forward to take MAT 114 with him again next semester. Totally recommend.
not understanding or helpful
Hes very nice and does a good job explaining concepts

James Clark seems like a nice guy, but he wasnt made to be a professor. His class is really boring, and he is disconnected. He acts very strange, as his class is taught exactly like in high school. I never had any time to do ALL the homework he assigned, and its a must for passing the class.

I pushed off this class cause I am not great with math. But, I really enjoyed his class. He was able to explain the material really well. Attending class is optional but I recommend going to lecture as much as possible. I enjoyed his occasional "dad" jokes. His prepares you for every exam. I was really satisfied with this class.

Clark is a good guy but he messes up so much. He will explain one thing in class and then when he uploads a practice test it is completely different or not correct at all. He constantly messes up in class. I understand missing a negative sign or something like that but he misses entire sections or has numbers that make no sense.
One of my favorite professors; he always made sure everyone was on the same page and gave us plenty of study materials to prepare us for tests and quizzes.

If you are a person who barely passed algebra in highschool and aren't good at it. This isn't the class to take. Rather take it with a different professor. Makes a lot of mistakes in his work and I genuinely feel like a failure being the last still with a quiz. 


5/5 he's a good, down to earth person.

2/5 I don't like his teaching.
Easy Class. I like his humor. Always ready to help his students.

Awsome teacher, as well as an awsome guy. Very willing to help you out when needed. Have a quiz everyweek, but if you read its cakewalk. Test are difficult but its worth the rough road. I would 100% take him agian. (Go on the extra credit field trip!)

Awesome teacher! Awesome field trips. Labs are hands on. Weekly quiz but allows 1 page of notes over the reading section. Have to study for the tests. Straight Forward. Offers extra credit if you go to the Red River Gorge with the class on a saturday. 40 points. Need the book. Lab is easy. Take good notes and pay attention.

Great Professor.  I had no interest in GLY prior to class, but he made it interesting. Take good notes. You will need them to study for the tests.  He gives Extra Credit opportunities. Labs are not bad at all. Overall, the class was good.  I would take him again for sure.  Very nice guy.
nice guy but bit of an ego. will threaten the class with a quiz when we get started late, like we are highschool students. kinda forgets we pay his salary. but knows his stuff anyway.

Has a bit of an ego. however he knows his stuff. very unorthodox quizes in labs. labs are not hands on, they are book work btw. delivers a clear lecture, please be aware though, work level is a bit much for an intro level course. will help you if you need it and does offer extra credit. count on a quiz every day of the semester.

Let's face it - any science class is work; you have to read the book, attend class, and STUDY.  Professor Bullard was excellent in his use of PowerPoint slides which he used to SUPPORT his easy to follow lecture with a lot of diagrams and pictures.  He was friendly and helpful and cares about student success.  His passion for subject is a positive.
Okay class, gives extra credit all the time. Read and take notes and pay attention in class and you will do great!
Very intelligent and enthusiastic about geology. A walking billboard for the geology department. Always encouraging students to switch majors. Good professor overall.

You have weekly quizzes, but they are extremely easy! You can use your notes on the quizzes and test! You have read for this class but it's not a lot. 1 group project and one project by yourself. He offers a ton of extra credit! Weekly lab experiments that are fun and easy points! I'm horrible at science and ended up with an B+.

This professor is truly great person and teacher. He lets out pretty early! It really helps to do the readings he assigns and to pay attention when doing group experiments during class. He is a nice professor.  Sometimes lectures can be hard to focus on but just put in normal effort and you will do good!
I suck at science and I got an A in the class. He's great and gives a ton of extra credit. Such a nice guy! I would definitely recommend!

Very nice guy.  Really knows his stuff. He's helpful, gives good extra credit, but be sure to go to class, you never know which day he will have a quiz (always one a week).  Take good notes and you'll do good on the tests.

Just showing up and completing assigned work will almost give you an A. Lets you use notes for quizzes, lots of extra credit. Do it all in case you miss something later. He will explain anything you don't understand. No reason not to pass this class with an A.

Material was very in depth, but he explains it well. I received an A, but worked hard for it.  There is an abundant amount of extra credit you can do, and it is well worth it.  Had an A+ going in to final, he let myself and the others with high A's be exempt from the final. I would take him again if my major required.  Loved him and his enthusiasm

Very conceited and would make rude comments about how he disapproves of people working in cubicles when they should go out and dig for rocks instead. He forgets that without his students, he wouldn't have a job.  He does offer many ex. credit assignments. As long as you study, attend class and do assignments, then you should have at least a B.
he was the worst. he is super mono toned. super boring. and not helpful. if you have questions hes not willing to help. if you want to be bored to tears every class hes the professor for you.
He gives pop quizzes over reading assignments. I never read but always passed the quizzes with extra credit. As long as you pay attention in class you will be fine.
Great Professor! Class was very easy to pass and do well if you took notes and came to class.

You need the textbook and the course pack but nothing else. The exams were very difficult and you have to take A LOT of notes outside of class for the in-class quizzes. It's easy to fall behind and towards the end of the semester, this 2 hour and 20 minute class seems to get longer and longer. He's a cool guy but good luck.

Though this course was very hard for me at most times, Professor Bullard was more than accommodating and made an effort to help me with material. He is also very funny and engaging. I definitely recommend taking his class is you are required to take a science course.
No Comments

Very intelligent teacher. Explains very well, she keeps classes interesting with her funny personality. You dont use the book. Her tests are average has m/c fill in blank and essay. If you study youll be fine. Shes from canada and is kinda hot! I recommend her if your not good in science!!!!

She is an interesting person, but not a good teacher.  The multiple choice part of per tests are confusing and difficult.  Power point lectures.  She doesn't tell you what to study so it's hard to do well on the tests.

Brenda's awesome! I think she explains things very well- and for someone like me to get an A on a couple of the tests, she must be doing something right! She has a very charming personality and sense of humor, and she's definately a hottie!
I love her prehistoric life class! She is clear, thorough, and really good at answering crazy hard questions. As long as you review her pwr points you'll be fine. kudos on the pretty comments.
pretty easy class. sometimes test questions can be difficult or confusing, but she will clarify if you ask. A major plus is she's pretty cute. going to class was a breeze.
She's cool. Geology is NOT my thing AT ALL so I didn't do so well. She doesn't use the book at all. But she is helpful.

She really knows her stuff, and inspired in me a love of geology.  She was always helpful when a question was asked and a very entertaining professor.  I took this as a night class and even after hours of being on campus she found a way to make my last class fun and interesting.
No Comments

umm, well i thought she was okay.  she didnt really make things clear after she taught it to u.  I would always have to go and get help from someone who had taken a different professor.  test were easy tho if u knew that u were doing

I had her for both math 095 and 099.  She is a great teacher, but she is also extremely dry humored and montonous.  It was really hard for me to concentrate in class because she would ramble and repeat things that I already knew because of prior experience and goes over and over and will answer any questions you have.
She was ok, but her clarity not da best
She was so boring and had a monotone voice like the guy in the Clear Eyes commercial. I wouldn't recommend her for a person who falls asleep in class easily.

Overall, a nice teacher. She does speak very monotone and slow. Everytime I asked for help, she kinda talked about the overall paper/test,  and not what I was specifically inquiring about. It was frustrating, but not a hard class.
Extremely, extremely monotonous. Tends to repeat useless information. Attendance is mandatory, which sucks. She's really rude in email communication. I don't recommend this class.
She really needs to find a new approach to teaching.  The class is so boring, and she is so monotone.  Its so hard to even sit through class.  She just needs to keep things to the point.
there is no method to her madness!

Don't take her class. Find someone else. Yes she is that bad. She does not answer questions or help she looks at you like you are stupid and moves on. although i have an A in this class i would not recomend her for anyone who seriously struggles with math
HORRIBLE dont take her!!!! no more explanation needed!
awful. she isnt helpful at all. she never works with students!

Remedial class for me, but I knew everything except application problems. This was a problem seeing as how she rarely explained things clearly. If she was slightly more fun it would be fine. I'd recommend taking someone else. She's very nice though.

This instructor is a hard one to rate.  She was very willing to meet with you and set up times before tests to be available for questions.  That said, she wasn't always clear in how she taught.  She was nice but not very personable..if that makes sense.   Would I take her again?....probably.
Not sure why so many didn't l her. She gives so many opportunities to help you pass, and I have neverunderstood algebra unjtil now. she is a littlmonotone, but I wan't there to be entertained.
Best professor I ever had

Mrs. K makes it very easy for you to pass her class. Not real upbeat morning person :). I did not like that she would stop class for her students who came in 10, 20, and 40 minutes late but she's nice. Go to class, get 100% on ALL the homework, and do ALL the extra credit. If you fail, it's because you didn't do the work outside the classroom.
Very monotone teacher. Two hour classes were unbearable. Not a hard teacher or class.
Why anyone would rate her low is a mystery.  Gives so much extra credit, lets you correct tests, and will meet with you anytime she can.

She was a very helpful teach, lots of extra credit and I actually learned ALOT from her. she breaks it down with explanations so it makes sense. Remedial class for me and glad I had her. Highly recommend her for anyone struggling in math.
ew
He wants you to know your stuff.  A lot of memorizing and harder than what I expected.  Grades fair.

The tests are a little difficult but, if you go by the study guide you'll do fine. The notes you take in class are very important. He is always willing to take questions so don't hesitate. He is strict about the attendance only because the notes are important.
Very easy to understand and get an A.  As long as you attend class and take notes you can't fail.  Only thing you need to do is take notes.

GO TO CLASS. He gives about 2 pages of notes a day, front and back of notebook paper. He relies on pictures to explain things, which are helpful sometimes, but I'm not a visual learner... He's a good teacher. You have to know your stuff to do well, though. STUDY.

You have to go to class to get his notes, they are very important, barely used book at all.  Assignments are easy and nothing but busy work, and I'm pretty sure he didn't really grade our last one.  He takes FOREVER to grade things, over a month.  He is helpful though, if you do not understand things.
Had him for GLY 110. He knows what he is talking about. You cannot skip or you will get behind. Expect long lectures and tough test but he is pretty cool.

Wasn't interested in this class at all. Mr. Webber is very helpful but the subject matter is hard to understand. Tests are really tough. Reading quizzes and labs every week. Labs are annoying and take a long time but you're aloud to work with people on them. Reading quizzes are easy because you can use google.

Horrible.  If you want to minor in Geology do not take his class.  He designs the class for a science gen ed, which is great if you are taking it just for the credit.    His labs are unorganized and a lap-top is a MUST since she does not publish a lab notebook.  Sucks with 4 people around you with laptops trying to do a lab. VERY UNORGANIZED.

Lab is a joke.I figured out the reason he doe's not publish a lab notebook like other professors.  It;s so he doesn't have to read them.   Grading is 4-5 weeks behind, Lab organization is a complete joke.  I have had to go on amazon to buy kits so I can do identifications in order to pass.   DO NOT TAKE HIM.

He's a good guy and is able to explain complex ideas in simple terms.   And he is actually pretty funny. If you are just wanting a gened science credit, take his class.  However, if you want to actually minor in geology, avoid avoid avoid.  labs-    Total disaster.  Like I said, if you just want the science credit, he's your man.

He is very boring to listen to and the lectures are long. There are weekly online book tests and random in class assignments for "free" points. Tests are not bad but some questions you will never hear in lecture. Over all the class is easy as long as you do the online assignments and show up. Is not helpful when you need a boost to your grade.

He lectures a lot and it can be boring, but overall the class is easy. He gives a lot of participation points so you should go to class. He does group work too, but never really checks it. His study guides are very similar to the tests.

He definitely explains things better in the classroom than through reading the textbook. There are a few days where you have participation points. He is very in line with his schedule and will constantly remind you of assignments. No pop quizzes.
The class is a lecture class. He gives a quiz and learnsmart assignment every week expect on test weeks. Gives up to 30 extra credit points at the end of the semester.

he's hott in a nerdy way :) class is pretty boring. Constant notes and lectures. Just study for the tests and you'll do well. It's a pretty straight-forward class and he'll help if you just ask. He's really nice. Definitely recommend if you need a science credit.
Weekly quizzes over the reading, nice guy, but does take a long time to grade things. I learned a lot.

He talks to the end of every class. When you finish a section and only have 5 minutes left, he WILL start the next one. Tests and reading quizzes are too hard for a 100 level class. He shows more pictures than talks about the actual information. I studied constantly and still have no clue what he's talking about.

He can be a funny guy. His class is boring. You do not use the book except for reading quizzes, which are much harder than they need to be. Class is challenging for a gen-ed, unnecessarily hard. He takes forever to grade things. Wouldn't recommend taking him if you.
Easy class. Must attend classes to get notes. Very very boring. Dont need book except for reading quizzes online (which you can google just as easily). Always talks until the end of class

class is extremely boring! he talks until the very last minute. must attend class to get the notes. exams are hard. labs are easy and he did not make us take any lab exams this semester, which was awesome! the only reason for the book is for the reading quizzes each week, but you can google the answers! do not buy the book.
If you don't attend every single class and make sure you pay attention 100% of the time and take notes this class is very difficult.

his sense of humor is very sarcastic and it can come off a little mean. sometimes he is funny but most of the time he is of no help to me. oh and dont bother to send him an email he will basically tell you your stupid, but then again that could be his sense of humor reading poorly...
Awesome guy. Pretty funny too. Labs are fun. Tests aren't impossible but aren't a cakewalk either. Very possible to get an A. Very helpful and always around school.

Very smart, has a good sense of humor. Yes, he grades hard for gen chem, but he IS quite helpful if you ask for help outside of class. Must do all homework and labs, etc. or else you will be lost. Perhaps he could be a little more detailed, or maybe repeat the lab directions more slowly. But this IS college, he shouldn't have to hold your hand.

Very tough class. However, one must stay on top of notes, readings, and homework. Be prepared to spend hours on homework. This class is not impossible but work must be put into this class. Dr. Hare has a corny way of trying to make the class fun...this class is not fun at all. It is quite challenging.
The material is really tough but he will help you 100% through it. Then again, for p chem, you pretty much have to take him. But he is really good at what he does.

I had him for the lab and the lecture and he is not a bad teacher. He is used to teaching P-chem so if you don't have any prior knowledge be ready to do a lot of outside work. He will help you with anything just ask. His test are pretty hard but wake this is college. It's not supposed to be easy.
Awesome class, awesome professor, made P. Chem enjoyable! If you do the homework in its fullness, you will pass the tests!

I had Dr. Hare for both lecture and lab, and I thought he was a great professor. I thought his way of explaining problems were sometimes more confusing than necessary, but that's because I had taken a chemistry class before and already knew a simpler way to do things. He will help you outside of class if you need it. DO NOT NEED TEXTBOOK AT ALL.

Was a great intro professor. Tries to make the class more interesting than it is and is very organized. Goes at a normal pace like all other classes. Will help you if you need it during his office hours. He's usually at outside-of-class functions. Gives some extra credit.

I can honestly say that I don't know anything about P Chem other than its the least enjoyable class I've ever had. Great guy, very dry sense of humor, and he does a good job of teaching it, but if you aren't great at higher calc (3+) and the physics of that, expect to struggle.

My hardest class this semester. He's a super strict grader. Nothing can be perfect, he takes at least a few points off of everything, even if it's perfect to you. Then, he gives little feedback on how to fix it next time. He really makes you work for it, as if we're all chemists. Be prepared to get a C if you take his class. But still, he's nice.
He is a super tough grader and will take points off for about anything. There are no extra credit opportunities, and the experiments arent super clear. Hes a nice guy though.

He is a really great teacher, but beware of everything. If its not perfect then you will have points taken off. No joke. Petty points are the real deal in this class. Otherwise hes really chill and cares a lot about students. Great taste in music too

Great and interesting teacher. Very intelligent and willing to answer any questions during lecture or at the end if you feel more comfortable. Tests have 0* multiple choice questions and for some reason talk about bear grylls' prodigy son Cubby. However they are relevant to the material you learned with a twist that can benefit or hurt you.
Quiz and test have a lot of trick questions, and his questions sometimes don't make sense.

In a unique series of events I had Prof. Hare teaching the material for Prof Padolik's class. As far as lectures go, he is hysterical and works very hard to make sure the students understand what he is trying to teach. Works a lot on the board and will occasionally do very odd things, but it's okay, because he is fantastic.

I went into chem thinking I had no chance, but with him and PJ i cannot imagine not understanding chemistry. I asked him questions i kid you not every 5 seconds and he would just laugh and answer them. But he was really good at not directly giving me the answer but leading me to answer it myself. Love his teaching style. TAKE HIM!! best lab prof.
Lab can be tough but he always explains how to do various lab techniques, if you don't prepare then prepare to fail. During lab if you need help ask him, easy to talk to during class

His lectures are amazingly clear and his tests only concepts not random chem trivia, he knows what he's doing and very approachable. Just make sure to study and do the review because ultimately he doesn't want students to fail

You can tell that Professor Hare cares about his students. He was always willing to help and even required that if you fail a quiz that you have to zoom with him so he can explain the material to you (I know that sounds terrible but its for your own good). Only problem is that he used ALEKS for homework/studying but the tests did not reflect ALEKS.

Super easy to get a hold of outside of class. He responds to emails very promptly and works well around schedules if you need to visit him during office hours. Lots of homework as he mainly uses the ALEKS system, which can be tedious, but ultimately really helpful as it ensures you know the content. Really nice guy and super great professor!

Biggest complaint is ALEKS, however this is going to be removed as of 2023. Standard assessments instead of quizzes, these are awesome, you have to do them outside of class but they're open web and open note, you need to understand the material though or you will fail them. Very approachable, if you have questions email him. Never used the textbook

(fall semester) Really good teacher. He always held group discussions at the end of class to explain labs which were very helpful (especially for the final). He also held a study session for the final. The labs were always clearly explained and he explained every question you asked if needed. I felt like I learned a lot from the lab.
never thought i'd get an A, but did. study a lot because her exams are a little off the wall regarding material. Plenty of extra credit given. fairly easy if you study.

Professor Curran knows her subject matter but moves very quickly.  She expects you to ask if you don't understand and if you don't stop her, she moves on.  Even after asking, it is sometimes difficult to understand but she is willing, at all costs, to help you succeed.  She really cares but is tough.

Professor Curran was great. Not only she was she an excellent professor, but she's really REALLY funny. If you have her for the Spring semester, you'll have the pleasure to hear her rant on about Earth Day and it's great. Definitely study hard though, her exams can be a bit tough. Overall though, she rocked.

She's kind of goofy and cheesy, but that made lab fun.  Compared to Bowling her lab tests were easy!  She doesn't really care what you do in lab, I goofed off a lot and got a B (but I also didn't turn in a whole lab report, so that was my bad)

First time teaching bio writing and did horrible. We wrote 2 papers and had many little 20point assignments.  It took her weeks to grade the assignments and a month to grade 1 of our 100 point papers. didn't have exams but she is extremely harsh grader. Take Dr. Acosta if possible.  Won't take her again EVER!!!!

Mrs. Curran's class is like taking a 10,000 piece puzzle and putting it together on your own.  Her teaching style is to relay details without the depth of understanding, but tests your depth of understanding. It very difficult to see the big picture in her class. You will need to study hard. I found studying in groups to be helpful.

I don't recommend taking Dr. Curran. She is very confusing when teaching and always jumps around. When you ask a question, most of the time she doesn't answer it. Participation points were a nightmare. I could never get full credit because I could never fully understand the material. I went to her office many times, but it didn't help. Don't take!

I enjoyed her class, her test are hard but if you go to class she really is a good teacher! I went to her a lot during the semester, I bet if you ask her who was the student with the most questions she might say my name! But I would recommend her she is a very nice lady.

Class is meant for both psych and biology majors; seems a little difficult for the psych students and a little easy for the bio students.  Lots of academic paper based learning, knows a lot, and my personal favorite? Tests are very conception based- she'll give you an image and you need to take the information and explain/elaborate/apply it.

I will never take her again. She gives lots of 20pt assignments that are due one after the other and then she takes forever to grade them. Sorry if you have a question, she won't completely answer it and will also make you feel dumb in some way. Very tough grader, she never gives out full credit. Seriously, choose someone else if you can!

She is amazing. I've had her for two classes. Both times she didn't require a textbook. She provides all information in her lectures. She explains things - multiple times if you need it. Very approachable and understanding. If you need help she will make time to help you. Her classes tend to be half individual work and half group work. Love her.

She is a little corky but very passionate about what she teaches.  The material is a little tricky but she does her best to make it as simple as possible.  The final project is a group project which is worth a test grade and it made me want to pull my hair out but other than that, this class was great and so was she.

Dr. Curran is a hard professor, but she is one of the best. She does give out a lot of assignments, but that is to help you understand the material. She gives good feedback that is useful and should be used. She does make you work for your grade, and you did get 2 extra credit opportunities. Do not be afraid to ask her questions, she is helpful.

Horrible professor! Has a 20 point quiz every week and it an extremely hard grader. Purposely tries to trick you up on tests. Good luck every asking her a question cause she typically never completely answers it or rambles about a completely different topic. Also, be prepared to bring earplugs her laugh is horrid.

Hard subject. Great teacher once you learn her testing style. Does her best to make class interesting. Relates examples to everyday life to try and help you remember/understand concepts. Would def take her again. Just wish more extra credit was offered or hw to earn points besides just exams

worst prof Ive ever had by far. doesnt give full credit for anything, even little give me worksheet assignments. often gives unrealted busy work assignments that are due the same or the next day wit little to no time to work on it. doesnt compltely listen to questions when they are asked so never answers what you are asking and makes you feel dumb.

If you show up to class and go to the review sessions and complete the worksheet every week. You are pretty much guaranteed a good grade. Exams are pretty straight forward and are based off the power points and review sheets. Overall a pretty easy class.
Really high expectations with unclear lectures. Cannot explain concepts clearly and very rude. Close to retirement. Take another professor if you can!

Emotional grader. The course work was easy enough to understand. Unclear lectures and feedback. Close to retirement and dosn't care about her students at all. Not a good listener and will often give feedback that isn't relevant to the question you have asked. Avoid if possible.

Dr. Curran has a horrible attitude. Her class has interesting content, but going to her class put me in a bad mood because she was condescending and short-tempered. All her exams are many pages of short answer questions and she grades harshly. Her feedback is not very helpful. Overall, it was not a super hard class, but avoid her if you can!

Lots of ups and downs. Content is easy enough but this course would be better if another professor was assigned. This should be an enjoyable course with a positive professor that respects communication. Do not take this course.

Dr. Curran was not only entertaining but also passionate about what she teaches. In my class, she went out of her way to make sure we had the resources we needed to do well in her class. All of the exams were almost the same as the mock exams and iClicker/online hw. If you are willing to use the resources in your lap, I recommend Dr. Curran.
Choose a different professor if possible! Purposefully tricks you on test questions. Unclear feedback. Don't get on her bad side and make sure to laugh at her 'jokes'.
great person, but can't convey anything properly.

I'm strong in English, and I found this class to be tough. That said, Dr. Curran is qualified to teach it and she does a great job. You might be frustrated after she reviews your draft, but you will learn from it, which is the point. She's a positive person and I admire and respect her. I've learned a lot from her and I'm so glad I took this class!

Dr. Curran should not be teaching BIO 291W. Her expectations are way too high for sophomore students and she often grades with emotion. This impacts final grades heavily and she is not open to any other methods for class work. Do not take her if possible because she will likely cause similar frustrations.
Tests were completely short answer. The final was all short answer, 8 pages front and back. She doesnt have lots of class work but the exams and wack and lectures are so boring.

Dr. Curran is one of my all time favorite professors. While it was a neuroscience class, she didn't just cater to neuroscience or other hard science majors. She made class interesting with many different guest lectures that went perfectly along with class topics. We had 3 exams. a major group project (Mayerson), and a handful of small assignments.

Dr. Curran is the most intense professor I have ever had. Her expectations are too high. She will edit your paper and when the edits are completed she will say they are wrong. She can not be pleased. Her directions are unclear and she can be rude when you do not understand a concept. Also, she takes forever to grade assignments. AVOID HER!!!

This has to have been the best professor I have had at Northern By far!  She is AWAZING at what she does and she makes it to where you understand the content!  Her test questions come directly from her notes!

OMG....Fabulous!!  She's a total riot!  I couldn't believe how fast 2 hours went by 3 times a week, but when Sandy is teaching it's just fun!  She is totally personable too!  You can ask her anything and know that she will be able to answer it.  She is a lot like Caron Martin who is like the GOD of nursing information.
I love this professor.  She absolutely excels in her field.  I wish she and Caron could teach all my courses.
Outstanding. great for isual learners and very positive vibe!!!
She is an awesome teacher! And she is my advisor, and she is the best! So helpful!
Great professor. Very funny and easy to talk with.
Great professor. Easy to talk with and very funny.

Love her as a teacher!  I had her for Med-Surg and she is very energetic and enthusiastic in the classroom. You learn a lot with her. If she doesn't know something, she has no problem admitting it, and researching it to find out. Highly advise anyone who gets a chance, to take her class.

Sandy is such a delight! She can easily brighten your day. Even on days she comes in and says "I'm a grouch today, be careful", youll still catch her smiling and being helpful. Love her and can't wait to have her for Med Surg!
I have had Sandy for three classes now, she is by far THE BEST nursing professor at NKU. She is the sweetest lady and does everything she can to make sure you succeed. Take her whenever you can!
I loved Sandy!

Sandy is by far the best professor I've had so far in this program. She makes learning so fun. She is always so happy in class, and stops what she's doing in the halls to talk and say hi. She does anything she can to help her students.

I don't know about all the other ratings, but she is so boring and reads from her ppts.  She doesn't even know our names in class.  She is very smart, but I don't know why she got all these teaching awards, there are definitely better teachers out there.

She is delightful! She can seem a little corny but I love her. We're under a lot of stress as nursing students and she helps brighten your day. She is a good teacher and knows the material. We did several in-class activities so it's not just her lecturing all the time. I hope to have her again in future nursing classes.

I absolutely love Sandy! She is my favorite professor by far in the nursing program. I loved having her for skills. She helps you remain calm during your skills and gives you great feedback. Take her if you can!

Sandy is the best professor I have had so far in the nursing program. I had her for 210L and now for 339L. She truly cares about all her students and wants to see them do well and succeed. I even switched my track so I could have her again. Can't recommend taking her enough!
Extremely nice professor and cares about her students. Easy work, but kind of a lot. Map quizzes and assignments usually every week. if your willing to do the work then take this class. Easy A

Very hard.  I would not take this class.  There is too much material for a 100 level class.  She seemed real nice and knew what she was talking about, but I didn't really learn anything about Geography.

I managed an A but don't know how. I didn't study cuz I didn't know what I needed to study. This was the first time she's taught Geo 100 but she's very scatter brained in any case. Easy teacher though. She may be better at it next semester when she knows what to do and what not to do. We were the guinea pigs I guess...
She is an extremely nice and caring professor. She can be scattered brain but it's entertaining. She tries to make the class fun and interesting. Would take another class from her.

This teacher is ridiculous.  She does NOT teach well but expects a ton from the students. She needs to kick up her teaching if she is going to expect so much. I am also beginning to suspect she almost enjoys watching everyone struggle. STAY AWAY.

The guy below me is an extreme under achiever if he believes that she's too hard. While she is scattered brained, she is a VERY GOOD professor. Very approachable. Will help anyone in need. Map quizzes and assignments every other week. Take study guides for exams as a grain of salt though. Focus on notes. Gives a lot of extra credit opportunities.

The class is kind of boring, but she tries to make it fun and enjoyable. The assignments and quizzes are easy enough, but you do have to work in this class. She will help you in any way possible and really does want you to succeed. Her class is such a relaxed, low stress environment.

I love Dr. Bruins! I have had her a few times now and I enjoy her classes because its like a "free" period in college. She is lenient on attendance, her assignments are easy but fun and her exams are take home. Most of the time you have a big paper to write, but they're not bad at all. She grades easy. A nice change from other teachers here.Low key

She is a fun teacher and one of the easiest classes I have ever taken. As long as you read your books for exams you will be fine because her lectures aren't very useful. 3 tests and 8 hw assignments, super easy class.

Super easy class! Love Ms. Bruins, she took our whole class out to eat and paid. I've had her for three semesters and plan to take her again. Great class to just hang out in and attendance isn't a big a priority just don't take advantage and not show up all the time.
Love her!! She is so nice. Her lectures aren't interesting. They are very boring. But she's awesome. Take this class!

She is an awesome lady and is very nice and helpful. The class in general isn't too exciting but she can make it interesting. Everything is easy just make sure you study your book really hard for the tests. I would recommend her, you wouldn't regret it.
I think she is a very nice lady, but can be very confusing, Doesn't post grades in a timely manner on Blackboard, lets students run all over her, and doesn't really seem to care for her job.

Connie is great! This was my second class with her. She is very easy and really cares about her students. If you turn something in late, she does not take off points. If you have a problem with an assignment, she will work with you to create a solution. Attendance was not mandatory, but was taken into account for a small participation grade.

Connie is a nice lady and I like her as a person. But as a teacher, absolutley horrible. I have no idea whats going on in the class and I havent missed one day. She tells stories the whole class and gets off topic and then apparently we have these hard tests?? Its like I dont know where she gets this information from. If you can take someone else, do it. Nice lady, but teaching style is just completely off and confusing.

Connie seems to be a little confused. This is a geography class not story time. We maybe had 4-5 lectures all semester that was on topic, besides that we listened to her stories or talked in groups off topic. She is very friendly and willing to help but I learned nothing. Being that she doesn't teach, he tests are very difficulty. Do well on HW!

She is a GREAT lady.  I love her just for that.  She loves her students and is there to help. She does tell alot of stories but most of the time they connect with what she is talking about or she has a reason to be telling them..

I agree the test are somewhat hard but if you know anything about geography you should be fine for this class. I love her stories and it is always something different each class. Overall I enjoy the class.

While I enjoyed Connie more as a person than a professor, her class wasn't too difficult.  The only challenge was her two midterms.  She gave ridiculous study guides a week in advance, but really just going to class and having some prior knowledge of the subjects discussed are what helped me get an A.
Connie is a great professor! If you need Geography, definitely take it with Dr. Bruins!
She is so easy to talk to and if you need help with anything inside or out of her class she's always willing to help you. Only complaint is that her lectures are a little confusing.
She cares about every student passing and is willing to give alternative assignments if something isnt working out for you.

she is a great professor if you take her night class it will be cake but its mostly basic knowledge and if you pay attention to what she says you will be fine doesn't grade very hard as long as you put something down and attempt it you will get most if not all points but you must be outgoing to make the class easy, ask questions and seem intereste
If you need to take geo 100, TAKE HER. She's friendly, and will help you. If you have projects/papers, she tells you what she wants in them, and as long as you follow what she asks for, easy A.

Dreaded this class, but Professor Bruins made it tolerable. GREAT professor, projects/papers are not difficult. Buy the book, you need it. Very willing to accommodate extenuating circumstances and highly understanding. TAKE GEO 100 WITH HER!!

Professor Bruins is so nice. As long as you have all the assignments in by the end of the semester she does not take points off. Her test are a little lengthy though, with at least 1 essay, but most have 2.
No Comments

Pam is very intelligent, and has a lot of teaching and experience to offer to her students.  I think she wants everyone to learn, but sometimes thinks we should  know more than we do.  I have enjoyed her as a teacher so far.

Pam is extremely knowledgeable and a real asset to the NKU nursing staff.  The only thing I think she has trouble with is narrowing down where students should focus.  It is nice to know what information is most important rather than trying to cram every little detail into your head only to lose it by the next test.
Class was hard! I felt like Phares had extremely high expectations. Glad to never have to take a class like that again!

I had no interest in Ped's at all, but Pam made it interesting! Yeah, it's a little tough, but anyone can do it, if they just read and do the work! I know that scares some people, but its nursing people!!!!
Pam is awesome, as long as you read, ask questions, pay attention, and actually do you work, you will be fine! She is very helpful in answering any questions you might have.
Phares directs you to your group to find answers. If you go to her she will help but has high expectations and forgets students dont really care about her class. Hard to follow

Pam made everything more difficult than it needed to be as well as never explaining anything! Most of us had never written an anotated bibliography in our lives and she did one 5 minute speil on it an thought that would be enough! Most of the class is just busy work instead of teaching you how to do the assignments & she rewrites everything you do.
No Comments

I hate science and I didn't mind this class much. I only skipped twice, which btw she keeps attendance everyday so if you skip you wont get as much credit. The class was easy, if you missed a test she would let you make it up. The tests were combined chapters that's the only reason they were difficult. She's a very nice lady though!
She's such a nice lady! Super easy class, probably one of the easiest A's I've ever gotten. Always willing to answer questions and help-if you need a random science class i TOTALLY recommend her!

sarah is a good teacher, power points become very repetitive. and at times she moves fast. alot of info is covered in this class. she gives points on alot of in class assignments and is really caring about her students. she is very understanding and is easy going
