Very nice teacher and helpful. Tests are easy. Go to class and you will do just fine.
awesome prof. teaches like its a high school class. easy A.
Her class can be kind of boring sometimes but it's super easy. She is an extremely nice lady who is always willing to help. I definitely recommend her!
She is a sweetheart and really cares about her students. Science is not my strong subject, but she is always willing to help me understand the material. I recommend her!
One of the greatest Pro in my college.. Easy course and interesting one. Take here and you will not regret it
she is nice and helpful.take her

This was a great course.  I learned something and it wasn't too difficult.  Sarah is super nice, but you better come to class because she does a lot of activies for points.  Tests are straight from the quizes and study guide.  Take her!!

Sarah is an amazing teacher who cares about her students, loves teaching and LOVES Geology. She knows her stuff and teaches it very well and in a very clear way. Loved this class, loved the teacher. If you need a science or just want a class to take just because, take Sarah for any Geology class that she teaches!

Absolute wonderful teacher and person. She explains things that is very easy to understand. She is very enthusiastic and really cares about her students. I was not happy i had to take a science class but having her as my teacher rocked. You learn a lot and if you show up you will get an A

Sarah is GREAT! She makes geology interesting and easy to understand for people who are not into science.  Quizzes are open note and she uses all the quiz questions on the exams.  Book isn't needed at all.  Very easy grader, just show up and try.

Sarah was an amazing professor. Her class was fairly easy and she definitely kept it interesting. She was very helpful and really cared about her students. Was very open to helping in anyway she could. I would recommend any one of her classes.
Rude and condescending.
No Comments
Knows the material but doesn't know how to teach it. Would not recommend this prof

I actually kind of feel bad for him, but he knows the material he teaches, but Nobody understands it.  If you take this class you will get many moments where everybody is looking at each other going...What is going on here?  about 9-10 online quizzes, 3 exams and a final.  The exams are easy if you study wisely.  I wouldn't recommend.

Dont recommend this professor. He knows what he's doing but he CANNOT teach it. Makes you feel stupid if you give a wrong answer and you will more than likely be wrong. Very hard to please when he grades. Take another professor if you can.

Seems fairly nice, but kind of condescending and VERY hard to please.  I'm Pre-Med, and this was my hardest class because he is fairly incomprehensible.  Gives you some opportunities to make up your grade at the end, but not worth it.  Take someone else.
Its like no matter how much you study, you never know what the test will be like.  Every test is kind of a gamble, and I didnt feel prepared for a single one.

Although the class is difficult.... it is supposed to be.  He gives so many extra tools that help you study, which is great!  Didn't have to buy the textbook, which was a big plus... and the notes he puts online are so helpful that you hardly have to take notes during class!  The moral of the story is... if you put in the work, you can do well.
Don't know who wrote some of the comments about this guy, but he's much better than several have claimed - always very helpful and concerned about his students.

Make sure you attend class and do the homework and you'll be fine. His exams are tough but if you turn in HW he considers that in your exam (which helps) He has a lot of online quizez that are helpful and he posts solutions and answers. He loves using blackboard a lot, which is welcomed. He cares about his students and will give feedback surveys.
He's a good teacher. He's pretty laid-back and can be funny sometimes. The class is a bit difficult, but that's just how the subject is. He's available to help too!
Dr. Nolan is an okay teacher. His lessons are based more on showing examples on just solving the problems rather than actually showing how. He is always available for help if needed.

This was the worst math teacher I have ever had my entire college career. He is very condescending and makes you feel quite stupid if you give a wrong answer in class. His tests are always totally different from the reviews. The tests are horrible. Even people with straight A's struggled.

Although at first he seemed difficult, he's actually a pretty good professor.  He's always availiable to help during office hours and via email.  He takes note of how much effort you put into learning the material when determining your final grade.
Just imagine the worst professor you ever had.  Then act like you are death row everytime you go to class.  This is how you will feel. Highly recomend if you have an academic death wish.
worse professor ever. Does not care about his students. Horrible grader. Does no examples completly so you never know what he wants for your homework and test answers. Horrible, horrible, horrible.
He makes the subject interesting. It's stats so it can't be that fun. Just pay attention and do the homework and you will do great. I would recommend him.
Hated him class boring.

Dr. Nolan is genuinely nice, and is always around to help. HOWEVER, it was difficult to understand what was expected from you & he doesn't seem to know how to make lectures easy to understand. Group projects were somewhat enjoyable but Quizzes/tests were a nightmare. Never missed a day, did all the reading, took extensive notes and still got C/D's

I thought he was a wonderful teahcer. I went into the class hating math! I never understand any math. He was very helpful in and out of class and made sure to work his hardest to get everyone to understand. His tests were good also.

Very nice person who really wants his students to succeed. He is always there to help you and will answer emails quickly. However you never know exactly what he wants nor does he finish examples fully. He speeds through the difficult stuff and slows down for the easy stuff. I do not recommend taking a class with him.

Being a PhD, he teaches as though he has a class full of brainiacs.  He is somewhat helpful, but if you have a hard time with math or stats I recommend taking this course with another professor.  Quizzes & tests were difficult (I even did all the homework) & the reviews don't really help much.
He is a good professor. The material is difficult. He could explain things a little better. Show up and you'll do fine.

he is a good teacher, but i do found the materials he covered in class has nothing to do with the exam. even you think yourself knows everything the test still difficult to do. i think that's because he raise the level of questions in exam.
He is too smart to teach. Lucky I'm good at math so I could teach myself how to do it. Take somebody else if you don't want to teach yourself.

Literally the worst teacher I have ever had. Our assignments were to watch lecture videos made by random people to learn and then we would go to class to work in groups and figure the material out ourselves. I can't believe I passed this class because I literally never knew what the material was. There is no book and he is a horrible professor.

He is always willing to help, but he is not very helpful in his feedback. I spend approximately 40 hours on this class along with another 40 hours on my other two graduate level classes and I am barely making an A in his class. He grades very strictly and makes it nearly impossible to understand the work or to do well in his class.
Tests are extremely tough. Don't expect much productive feedback or any kind of clarifications whatsoever.

Graduate Stats for Healthcare Research  online class. Workload is overwhelming, strenuously fast paced. Expect to spend 20-25 hours/week on the lengthy list of assignments. Exams are the most challenging I've ever encountered and I'm in a Doctorate Nursing Program with 4.0 average undergrad. Take this class elsewhere, he's the only one teaching it!
Didn't clarify,  wrote his own text book, was not allowed to ask him questions,  was not clear on homework assignments,  too much comparing a text from his text.

He isn't the easiest professor, but I did feel as if I learned the material well. He is a busy man, but I was still able to get help from him many times in his office. His first few hw assignments were vague and frustrating but after that you knew what to expect. I think he is fine for applied courses, but I would stay away from theoretical ones

STAT 614 is a very challenging class.  Professor Nolan did not oversimplify the material and therefore the concepts are hard to grasp but a true sense of statistics is conveyed which is valuable for graduate studies.  It takes a lot of work to do well in this class but he is always willing to help and seems to want everyone to succeed.

Weekly course notes are entirely too wordy and confusing. Wrote his own textbook and has no idea how to simplify the material to those of us who do not have a phd in statistics. You often have to teach yourself the material. Very challenging and I am not really learning much of anything except I am perfecting the art of praying I will pass.

Okay, the bottom line is that Dr. Nolan's 614 class requires a LOT of hours each week. The first two weeks were the most challenging as you get use to his teaching style and all the reading. You will not pass if you don't read his own text. So, read his text, his weekly notes, watch his videos THEN do his assignments. ASK QUESTIONS!

He is very enthusiastic about teaching and he smiles a lot. He is very helpful when you need help. Seeing him in his office or emailing him about projects helped me a lot. I learned a lot from doing this. I learned a ton in his class! He makes the course challenging, but if you succeed in the course it is well deserved.

Dr. Nolan has the tendency to teach his lower level classes at what seems like one of his graduate level classes. It's by no means an easy class but on the other hand he will literally do anything he can to make you understand what he's teaching. Plenty of office hours available for one-on-one time and he will also get back to your emails faster than any other professor I've had. Lastly, Dr. Nolan is very enthusiastic every class. You can tell he enjoys teaching the subject.

Quiz every Friday, multiple homework assignments a week. Obviously awful at explaining things when you ask for help. Teaches Stats for elementary ed majors but has never stepped foot in a elementary school classroom. 0/10

An in person class, that should be online. Class time is used to do activities that no one understands. Don't bother asking questions, he doesn't answer them and just looks at you like you're dumb. I would not recommend him to anyone.

The whole class was just activities. No lectures. Never taught us anything. I spent the whole class guessing what I was doing even after reading the text book. Tests every Friday with mastery objectives and not percentages. He asked us for feedback and we told him how to make it better and he said he was just going to do it the same next semester

This class was part of my elementary education major. This professor never stepped foot inside of elementary classroom and it was not very helpful when we were suppose to learn how to teach this material to elementary students. He also did not teach this class for almost ten years. It was always group activities and he never taught us anything.

Mastery point grading allows for retries. I was studying for reattempts instead of the current weeks material. Need time outside of class to meet with him to "earn" your third attempt. Group activities instead of lectures. Required portfolio for final of all activities/tests. doesn't know anything about elementary education.
Dr. Joe Nolan is the best professer at nku because he is cool. B)
Dr. Joe Nolan is Mr. Beast!!!!!!   B)
HES MY FAVORITE TECHER EVER

You MUST read the text or you'll be lost. Time management is a skill you'll need in this class as there are assignments (sometimes multiple) due everyday Tuesday - Saturday. ASK QUESTIONS. He's very good at responding quickly and truly cares that you do well in his class. It is very difficult, but if you work hard, you can succeed.

LOTS OF WORK. Assignments due Tuesday-Saturday. Multiple assignments due each day. NEED to read the textbook. It is his textbook that he wrote. Gives lots of feedback on every assignment and quiz which is very helpful. Advise to print off feedback. Responds to emails very fast. Would ask questions as much as possible.

This class was very challenging especially if you 1) haven't taken statistics in a few or several years, 2) work full-time and/or on weekends. There is ALOT of reading between the textbook (that he wrote) and journal articles for DBs and the exams. However, Dr. Nolan is SO helpful and responds quickly to any and all questions you may have!

Worst professor i ever had in my life. Not fair doesnt care about students. Always in a bad mood and annoying.Never take him ever for analytical lab. He also have problems as well.I totally recommend that he find another profession other than teaching.

Horrible professor. He was a sub for my actual lab prof and I couldn't stand him. He treated us all like 4 year olds and whenever you asked a question he would give you a look as if to say "you are completely stupid". Don't ever take him if you have a choice. I only had him for 3 weeks, can't imagine a whole semester.

rude, mean, and inconsiderate. this man needs to be fired. he deliberately lashes out at students and refuses to help. if you ask him a question he says that he already told you that or to figure it out. DO NOT TAKE HIM

When he explains something, he acts VERY CONDESCENDING.  If you ask a question, he treats you like a child.  He is an EXTREMELY HARSH grader. If you leave out a tiny part - you lose 10 points instantly.  I've always been an A/B student, and I will barely pass this class with a C... AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Everybody has bad things to say here, I thought he was actually a great teacher.  He does come off a little rough at first, but just talk to him.  He's a nice guy and really knows his stuff.  He's got a very dry sense of humor that I don't think most students appreciate, but I've learned a lot from him.  I would definitely take another class of his

because of Dr Bullen was out, so he substituted my labs and lecture. He is a very nice but funny guy that always mean to people. But he explained thing very clear in easy words. He is a very picky teacher, and pick on something that I don't think is important. once you get his style of grading,follow it you never get a bad grade! take his CHE340L

Let's see, you can spend twice the amount of time on a lab report as someone in Dr. Bullen's Lab and get a 60 or go with Dr Bullen and get a 90.  If you're in his section and there are seats open in the other one then you're an idiot, and your F is your own damn fault. I got ABOVE the mean grade for the class and got a D+.  I can't imagine...

Dr. Edwards is very helpful and is one of my favorite professors at NKU. He does have a sarcastic sense of humor but,if you actually do what you are supposed to do and put some effort into the class, he will go out of his way to help you. The only people he treats like kids are  people that act like kids.

hes awesome!!!!!!!! people complain about him but he's a really smart dude and really wants to help if you just ask him. Personable and i wish he taught 121L!!! makes sense of everything I didn't catch in lecture. Grades hard but he wants what he wants you to understand what you're doing so just listen to him and everythings cool :)
Super hard grader.. I failed by 1% .. I always tried by best and it still wasn't enough
WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE.  HARDEST CLASS EVER.

There are many students that will say that Dr. Edwards is not a good professor. Those students, either do not care enough to put in the effort or are just lazy. Dr. Edwards is by far the best teacher I have had at NKU. He is sarcastic and funny and makes class enjoyable. I took him for Che 120L and passed easily. I am taking him again now.

Took him for 340L and I will say, I definitely had to work for the grade I got. Very tough grader when it comes to lab notebooks, expects a lot from the student for each notebook. But, he is a great professor and does care about the students. Expect very high expectations from Day 1.

Dr. Edwards is a highly inconsistent and unclear professor. Oftentimes students in the class didn't understand what was desired of them and, if asked, Dr. Edwards would only repeat his confusing directions. I feel he would be better suited to teaching a higher level course and not a course designed as an introduction into college chemistry.
Terrible. Never actually teaches and when he attempts to explain something he makes it far more difficult and complicated. Also rude and condescending.

Dr. Kirby is really nice and tries to be helpful but answers e-mails way too late. I'm not sure if she makes the powerpoints so she has a hard time explaining them. I agree with the person below me about the text book. I think the class was more difficult than it should be.

(took Korean 195) She is the best professor ever, shes so nice and helpful and a wonderful person if you ever have a chance take her. This is a Korean class so it will be difficult you have to study a lot and do a lot of work but its way worth it and she loves what shes doing so you will love the class!

This is not a 101 class.  This is an entire year of academic work condensed into one class.  It appears to be an attempt to make up for the fact there are no other KOR level classes.  By pass this class, I could easily have taken two other languages, or a Chem/Bio for far less the headache and beyond a 101 level.

always makes time to help you after-class.Shes very funny and has a great lab teaching method.She gives you enough hints so you can figure it out and that way you can remember it.She does not reference online text ever.Had to look up something for program in text once.Responds to emails always.Lectures are boring and not necessary except for quizze

This class is super hard (unless you have programming experience). However, Kirby is the best professor for the class you'll find. She's very sweet and really enthusiastic about the subject, and she really wants to see her students do well. She does what she can to help you and although the subject is still hard, she makes it possible. Take Kirby!

My favorite professor at NKU by far. She is very helpful Korean and even though the class is hard and moves very fast, she still can really help you understand very well. But yes it feels like a years class in one semseter, but if like Korean enough then its not to hard you just have to put in the effort. I can speak it pretty decently now myself.
This class is pretty challenging, especially if you have no interest or prior experience with programming language. HOWEVER, she is extremely kind, and really wants her students to do well.

This is a pretty challenging class, especially if you have little interested or no prior experience with programming language. HOWEVER, she is a very, very, kind professor and truly wants her students to do well.

INF 120 would be much easier if I could understand her during the lectures. They are also very boring, so thats also part of it. I mostly (99%) taught myself this class. If you have little-no prog. experience, choose a different professor, as it will be much easier for you. I had previous prog. experience and I had some difficulty with this class.

Two semesters of work in one. Nice professor, but reads slides at you in class, so it's boring.  For each class there are 5-15 pages of homework (it was overwhelming, and many people didn't bother). Sometimes homework wouldn't be posted until the morning it was due, making it impossible to finish. No late work. Nice person, but I dreaded class.

Nice lady, easy class, but not super clear on a lot. You have to pry to get an answer to your question. She also never updates blackboard, so midterm and finals are the only times to get your grades. Would recommend for the easiness.
Provides great knowledge of subject with very informative lectures, but grades very hard and is very nitpicky.

Her homework assignments are more difficult than those of the other professors who teach INF 120.   The tests are pretty difficult, but it's possible to get an  on them. You'll have a tough time getting an A with her unless you have prior experience, or study hard. My friend took INF 120 with a different prof. and had a much better experience.

For this class, it's best if you have the interest to learn Korean. otherwise you'll probably struggle through. She is willing to help if you ask. Very kind and respectful. even has a nice funny side.

Real nice and sweet. A good chance to learn about Korean culture. if you just show up and think you'll pass without participating and doing the work, you're wasting your time. She has a tendency to rush but if you talk to her she'll give you extra help.

Very fun and willing to help! I love the class and her so much. If you struggle she is willing to help you. She also gives you an opportunity to talk with some foreign exchange students from South Korea. She also encourages you to attend Korean club. it's a fun course!

Kim is a genuine person. She is open to help you with the Korean language. Others in the class claim she goes too fast. To some degree it is true. However she does tell you to let her know if she is going to fast. To help if your behind is to read a little in advance and copy down her notes. That way you have the notes to review words and phrases.

Bo Kirby tries her best to help students, and will allow extra credit for those who are struggling. She shows a extensive knowledge of the subject matter of the class, and is happy to help students inside and outside of class. All of the necessary information is given in the class lectures, so attend class and pay attention to pass.

Great teacher. There to help, she told a couple times she stayed up all night before an assignment due helping students through emails. I just wish NKU will make this class easier like the assignment were tough!

Kirby was a good professor but I had a hard time completing Labs and take-home assignments. She wouldn't offer to help, but offered hints that didn't help at all in programming. I commute, but she assumes EVERYONE lives on campus and can get help in the Open-Lab. Not very happy with her performance.

One of the best and friendliest professors at NKU. This class is very hard, but Kirby WILL help you as much as she can. She will even stay after class or meet up with you and go over anything you need help with, including pronunciation.  If you want to actually learn a language, by all means take this course. You will learn Korean.

She is an amazing professor! She is very helpful and really wants everyone to learn. The class isn't easy but she helps you through it. If you want to take a language, definitely take Korean! She's my favorite professor!

The class itself isn't hard, its how she teaches.  She doesn't give a direct answer and ends up making everything you learned ambiguous, she doesn't use the book at all, her wording on some things aren't great either, and she tends to stumbled over her own sentences sometimes.  I think she is a better Korean teacher than a programming teacher...

If you aren't one of those kids that can't handle accents, you will be fine. Very kind, and very helpful. Be respectful, prepare to work and learn. Currently we have 18 pages in the workbook and 15 pages of reading. This is the normal level of work. Be interested. Lots of out of class activities together and meetings with Korean students.
Very nice. Assignments are a bit difficult and lectures are kind of dull, but overall she has a nice personality and makes the subject matter fun.

Mrs. Kirby is a very nice woman but I cannot say the same about her as a teacher. She gives TONS of homework and we had 30 word vocab quizzes every week. This class is A LOT of work and she does very little teaching and no interactive assignments. Honestly I would have been better off just learning the language by myself. What a waste of time.

You need the textbook (for an online code), but she will provide it- don't buy from the bookstore. Class was very difficult, but very fun. She is sweet, caring, respectful, and incredibly helpful. She replies fast to email, and is happy to help outside of class. She is understanding and is willing to give extensions. Amazing prof.

Prof. Kirby runs a great class. Her lectures were helpful and she did exercises in class to aid your learning. She was also quick to help if you couldn't solve homework. The exams were fairly easy and you could get 100%. However, attendance was mandatory. If you did the activity for the day and didn't attend, still a 0%. She's a great choice!

Professor Kirby's class will make you understand the basics of python. There are a lot of points available every day which makes the tests less stressful. Attendance is mandatory to get these daily points however. She is very caring and if you are dedicated, you will do well.
Great teacher

Professor Kirby is awesome. She is willing to help students who struggle with Korean. While it may seem she goes too fast, if you speak up she will slow down. I ended up taking Korean because it was the only class to fit my schedule. I was not disappointed and glad I took Korean.

I wouldn't take a Bo-Kyung class again, even though she is one of the nicest people I've met. She assigns a LOT of homework and takes an attendance grade. She gives a lot of quizzes and lots of weekly vocab words. She covers many grammer rules a day. I was honestly failing the class, but she began tutoring a few of us after. She's so sweet, though!

She's a nice person, and helpful when you reach out to her outside of class, however, she's not great as a teach in class, she essentially just reads off confusing slides (I'm someone with a background in coding so I knew what she was trying to say) and gives a lot of gotcha questions and responses to questions that made me not want to speak up.

She does not help you when you ask instead she just points out what you need to look at and waits for you or someone else in the class will answer. Does not go easy on new students even if it is introductory to python class. She also stops and wastes a ton of time for responses even when no one knows how to answer the question.

AWESOME teacher! There are quizes almost every class but they are easy if you come to class. Sometimes he lets you use your notes or a partner and overall the quizes helped my grade! Tests are pretty easy because he gives you a review before the tests and tells you what sections it is over.  His teaching method is great and easy to understand!

Excellent teacher!!! My favorite so far.  He really tries to help you succeed as much as he can without giving you the answers.  He makes himself available to help as much as he can and emails you about anything that may change or you need to know.  I would definately recommend taking him for any math classes you can, he's a great professor!!
If you need statistics, take it with Dr. Hodgson.  He has the BEST attitude toward students I have ever seen.  Awesome teacher, wish NKU had more like him.

Stats and math suck, in general.  Those are just the facts.  However, this class is required for a lot of majors, so if you have to take it, then take him!  Super nice, knows his stuff, and he is very helpful! No attendance policy, but you better show up or you won't do well.  He actually made stats bearable.  Take him!

Awesome!!!!! I heard so many bad things about this class before taking it, but Dr. Hodgson made it so easy to understand. If you have to take this class, make sure to take him. He is very approachable and want his students to do well. I usually hate math but after this class I don't mind it at all!

Great Professor! Very well educated! Makes the class interesting and is very willing to help. If you don't go to class you won't do well in the course even though attendance isn't mandatory in his class. Buy the textbook only if you are willing to do the homework, otherwise you don't really need it.

I loved this guy. He was a great teacher and he convinced me that I should take up a double major in Stats (which I have). I HIGHLY recommend his class to anyone. He's easy to understand and goes above and beyond for this class.

I loved his class. He is so helpful and really cares about his students. As long as you come to class and ask questions if you have them then this class will be a piece of cake. Homework and attendance aren't mandatory but believe me they're important. Overall this class was great.

This class was fantastic, the professor was one of the nicest I've had and was more than willing to go the extra mile to help.  You can tell that he truly loves teaching and made this class easy and fun.
Dr. Hodgson is a wonderful teacher and all around good person.  He is very patient, caring, and commited to his students.  It's obvious that he genuinely loves math and teaching it.

He is one of the best professors . I really loved the class though not a big fan of stat. He makes it interesting and he s very caring and patient. He s extremely supportive. I wanted to drop the course and he encouraged me to the maximum. He s very nice person & I have the highest regard & respect for. He genuinely cares for his students -Bestprof

challenging class. You world need to work for it. He simplifies it to the maximum. He pretty much comes in early for each class and spends extra time with you. Always willing to help. He uses real life examples to make it easy and for better understanding. I struggled as I am not a big fan of stat but helped  me a lot and he he s the best of best!

Professor Hodgson was by far the best teacher I have had at Nku, for math. He explained the topics in a very clear and easy way. There were many assignments to make your grade up if you faltered. He genuinely cared for the success of his students, and was willing to help at any point, even to stay after class to help you with anything.
very caring, wants everyone to pass. clearly outlines what he wants to  get an A. gives practice problems to do that are very similar to test questions, just different numbers

He is a great professor and overall a great guy in general. He really wants all of his students to pass and become the best person that they can. He is very knowledgeable about math and gives great advice on how to make math fun in the classroom. I am so happy that I get to take him again next semester.
He is truly a caring teacher who wants to see you succeed!  I'm glad that I had him and would take another course he taught if I needed one.
Very personal, able to connect to real life scenarios. Available almost 24/7.

I was really nervous about taking stats for the first time and he made it very accessible and easy to understand.  He really does want all of his students to succeed in his class.  He also has great flexible office hours for those who need additional aid.  Great professor.

He is an amazing professor! I would take him for every math class if I could. We do move a bit fast in class but as long as you utilize the tools he has on blackboard you will be fine! Good lectures. He has a bunch of worked practice problems online which are great for studying. As long as you pay attention and study for a test you will do fine

VERY helpful when it comes to anyone having a problem in class. Encourages student interaction and lets them work together on take-home quizzes. Genuinely cares about the students and their well-being. I am holding out to take 213 until HE is the professor... I love math and statistics, and he helps me understand why.
Great Professor!!! Very helpful, definitely knows his stuff!!! Was very willing to help and kept class interesting and kind of fun!

Professor Hodgson was extremely helpful and willing to put in extra time to make sure students understood the material. He provided many examples for students to understand and be familiar with on the test. Definitely recommend him!
By far the best teacher I have had at NKU.  He is very patient and goes above and beyond to make sure that you learn.
Attendance is not mandatory but highly recommended by me. I worked my butt off to get an A- and I don't think I could've gotten by if I had missed a class.
PACE student-by far the best teacher I have ever had-ever. Interesting, was open to answer questions at any time, even offered Skype assistance on his days off.  Amazing teacher.
The best teacher that I have had at NKU! Willing to help in any way possible.  Provides you will all the tools to get a good grade.

Dr. Hodgson is one of the BEST teachers at NKU. He is very caring, approachable, and really knows his stuff. Hodgson is more than willing to help his students and will work individually with you to make sure you understand the material. For sure, TAKE HIM. He makes math seem so easy!

I usually do well in math courses but I struggled in his class. The homework took me forever because of how detailed he wanted us to show our work. Quizzes were quick and easy but test took me hours to write out all my work. He doesnt seem personable and wasnt much help when I emailed with questions. I spend way too much time on this course.

Easily one of the nicest professors I've had. He really cares about your education and encourages everyone to work together. Always makes sure you're prepared for the exam. Very easy homework that was not graded for accuracy. I am not good at math but he really helped everyone succeed.

Cool and collective guy, one of the few professors who genuinely cares about how his students are. Group project are super easy, I would take it again but stats was hard for me. Lots to learn always new content, so keep up good luck

This class was extremely difficult for me and I am not sure why. I was good at geometry but coming into this class everything changed. I understand the stuff in class but on tests and homework it doesn't make sense. He tries to make small talk with us however, I don't feel like he actually cares how we are as learners. You can tell he loves math.
Kind guy. Tough graded assignments. frustrating "challenge" problems. Lots of manipulatives/resources to help visualize.
Excellent explanation of mathematical procedures and relevance to practical applications. Highly motivating and kind-hearted. Easy to get good grades with little effort.
Very interested in the material and that shines through with his teaching style. Very clearly communicates concepts and is genuinely helpful.

If I have to be honest, he's a mediocre old typical professor but you also do want a good grade. He's just a really strict grader and his classes were as dull as it can be. Basically only him speaking and his lame jokes. I just don't recommend him to anyone, his reviews were horrible beginning of spring 2023. Yet somehow I took it and now I regret!

Wonderful guy, math was never hard for me but even if you ask a silly question in class he will answer it without hesitation. class and material is not hard everything is laid out for you so you truly can grasp the work. dont buy the textbook even though its cheap and just review practice problems before a test. Great man and teacher, loves math!!!
Dr. Hodgson is an awesome professor. He makes it nearly impossible to fail. Provides plenty of feedback and documents for you to succeed.
There were unclear parts of assignments that made it more difficult to learn the material.

What a great professor! I am terrible at math and passed with a C he seemed to always be in his office whenever you needed him. This was a class I had to MAKE FRIENDS and had to be determined. But he knows each student by name and is SO nice. He has some funny dad jokes and is all around a cool dude. Makes you feel like theres no way to fail.

He is a super nice guy that really tries to get you to understand the material. The majority of his questions on hw/tests he made himself so you won't be able to google it. I've always struggled with math. He will give you a lot of feedback if you ask. Follow all of his instructions because he takes off points for the smallest things.

Amazing professor and he truly is passionate about statistics and pretty funny. We did 2 zoom classes a week and he makes them fun. He is always available if you need help and really cares about his students. As long as you show up and participate/ make sure you understand, you will most likely pass.

Horrible. Makes it clear to students that he is way superior to them. Very smart, but if u have a question he explains things so you're more confused after asking then u were originally. Insists that on tests short answers are all that's necessary then grades down for incompleteness. Go to his office for help and he's a jerk-makes you feel stupid.
Drop Immediately.

he's really nice in lab, he helps in that class. kind of talks to himself in the lecture, no one listens and i think he knows that. it was the MOST boring class ever. stopped going at the end of the year and didn't miss anything. study vocab and you'll be fine.

He makes it seem like it will be impossible to pass his tests, but it's not.  In fact, it's the total opposite.  Don't get me wrong, you have to study still.  His tests come straight off of his study guides.  His lectures were super boring though and he made no sense 80% of the time.  Had him for lab too, and he rambles about pointless information.
Dr. Linn is always willing to answer questions and when you ask him something he never turns you down. He teaches a difficult topic but explains it well and makes it as clear as possible
Dr. Linn is always willing to answer questions and when you ask him something he never turns you down. He teaches a difficult topic but explains it well and makes it as clear as possible
Class was interesting. He can talk way to much and you didnt get much time to do lab work. Quizes can be hard too. super nice guy though.

This class is ridiculously hard. I'm not stupid or lazy, I got As and Bs in every pre nursing class. But the class average for his tests were 38 and the median is 40. I know people who worked really hard, studied for weeks and got C- on the test. His study guides are misleading, you have to study way more in depth than he tells you. Avoid if possib

Dr. Linn needs respect for his students. His lectures are informative and he answers questions. However, this is a very difficult class and he doesn't go the extra mile to help. I did poor on one exam and he made me feel bad, instead of trying to give assistance for the future. I did well with little thanks to him, the book is your best friend.

I loved Dr. Linn's class. He was very nice, funny and helpful. He does not hesitate to answer any questions you have. You turn in a few lab worksheets and two lab reports. He doesn't grade too hard, however, you should attend ALL labs. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!
Very difficult subject matter (nursing research).  She really knows her stuff!  Proposal was practically finished and ready for IRB when class was over.
No Comments

She was awful! All her notes were straight from the book, did not clarify anything.  Half the students failed the first exam and BAD! She doesn't care about her students in class and her notes would be like 180 slides for just one chapter, not to mention 4 chapters would be on a test!

This was a hard class. Prof McCoy grades at a doctoral level so if you aren't an excellent writer you may not get an A. Very strict class attendance and NO CELL PHONE USAGE IN CLASS! Don't be scared away if you have to take her but take this class seriously.

If you want to enjoy a lecture do not take this class. She seems to hate her job and her students as well. She has inferred that our entire class was grossly incompetent. HER NURSING THEORIES CLASS IS HARDER THAN ALL THE OTHER SECTIONS OFFERED FOR ABSOLUTELY NO REASON. Also make sure you show no ounce of happiness during this class, she hates it!!

Do everything in your power not to take a class with McCoy. She teaches many classes in the program including Nursing Theories. She is a hard grader and loves to nitpick. If you like answering irrelevant discussion questions, drawing pictures, and being talked to like you are stupid; this is the class for you!

She teaches at her level and has a hard time connecting with students.  I did learn in her classes and did not mind her as a person.  Her tests are way too hard, but all the busy work keeps it from tanking your grade.

Boring. No redeeming qualities relative to this professor's ability to teach. No ounce of caring for students. In fact, often gave off vibes of contempt and loathing for students. If you want to learns something, and enjoy learning about it, DO NOT take this professor

This class was taken online. I really did not mind Professor McCoy as I didn't have to take her in person. McCoy is a very tough grader. There was so much busy work in this class that totally felt like a giant waste of time. It's doable to get an A if you put in the work and do as the rubrics say.

I lose respect for the faculty of NKU when every semester, I return to find McCoy still teaching. She is easily THE WORST professor I have ever had. I created this account just to warn nursing students to avoid her at all costs. She dishes out 4-5 times as much busy work and papers as the other professor teaching this very unnecessary course.

First of all, she's had all semester and still pronounces no ones names right (even after multiple corrections). She treats you like you're stupid. Gave up on doing lectures more than halfway through the semester. Calls on people randomly. Nitpicks papers. Take these classes with another professor.

He is very soft spoken, but I do not find his accent that hard to understand.  He uses a lot of examples in class, and tries to get the students involved.  His labs and hw help you to understand the material, but aren't too challenging.  I would take from him again.  He is very kind, very fair, and very willing to help.
Accent could be difficult to understand, but not bad. Very clear with assignments and fair grading. Great with feedback. Very friendly and even funny. Great professor!

Nice guy, but you better sit close to him or at the very least face him. It is way easier to get what he is saying by watching his lips. Very helpful. Quizes, exams were all short answer ex: what is the def. of a shell? Fair grader. besides covering a few chapters out of order, follows book word for word at snails pace.

Dr Hu is one of the best profs at NKU in my opinion.  He genuinely cares about the student and about the material.  If you don't understand something he will work with you till you do.  He does have an accent but once you get used to it he is very easy to understand. I've had him for one other class and am taking him again this fall.

Very few exams and quizzes. The exams are open book and open note, and you can even use your laptop! He also drops the lowest exam grade, including the final. Stay on top of the labs because they can pile up very quickly.

This is my third time taking Hu, and this class was by far the hardest. You cover so much material and the midterm and final are worth 30% of you total grade EACH (so 60% all together). You cover tons of stuff and dont really get a study guide, sort of just a 'know everything in these chapters'. Labs are fun if you're into infosec.

Yi is one of the best teacher I have taken courses with at NKU. He has an accent that is not to bad but takes getting used to. All his courses are generally easy to pass as long as you complete the assignment and the labs. When I took his class he let us use notes and a book on the exams but not on the quizes. I got an A in his class.

(+) Takes the time to help students with questions. (+) explains topics and homework satisfactorily. (+) Lets students know in advance what we will be doing ahead of time. Gives ample time. (-) accent is hard to understand sometimes. Material covered can be boring. Lectures from slides. (+) No tricks or excessive material on homework or exams.
Absolutely the best teacher, and he has led a cyber defense team, and participated in nationals.  I love how he helps everybody until they understand. The quizzes are always fair game.

I took CIT 380 online as a 7-week sprint course. Yi Hu explained the topics clearly, made the labs interesting, and was helpful. I recommend this professor and I'd suggest taking 380 for a full semester.

There is over 20 labs, meaning you average at LEAST 1 lab per week. The material is not hard in my opinion but you have to put a lot of time into the class. With that being said, he is an amazing professor. He's simply a genius. I learned so much and he was never hesitant to help during or outside of class. Extremely nice professor.
Adele is a hoot. The class is easy. Exams are straight from the notes. A few other assignments, but they aren't difficult. She grades fairly.
Adele is miserable. She is self absorbed and unwilling to help her students. She is also very rude.

She thinks that she is correct about every question even when you can prove she is wrong. However, she will proofread a paper if you give it to her early. She is biased in grading and will be rude to you if she doesn't like you.

Honestly dreaded walking into this class on days she taught, if she doesn't like you she will let the whole class know.  She has a hard time keeping her biases out of the classroom, but will be sure to let you know yours are out of line.

Be ready to teach yourself! I struggled in this class although I read the textbook, studied Hesi and Nclex books, memorized notes, and studied in groups. Adele doesn't know the answer to many questions asked in class, and she'll tell you research it online or in textbooks. She sends rude emails, argues, and doesn't explain things well. It's awful!

Be ready to teach yourself! I struggled in this class although I read the textbook, studied Hesi and Nclex books, memorized notes, and studied in groups. Adele doesn't know the answer to many questions asked in class, and she'll tell you research it online or in textbooks. She sends rude emails, argues, and doesn't explain things well. Awful!

Had her for Calc 1B. Sucked. "Any questions? Comments?" No, just move on already! She makes sure to do the longest method possible on every example, so you just end up teaching yourself while she rambles. Takes off points for stupid things. I hope she is better at teaching physics like she is supposed to.

Very difficult to understand.  You just have to end up teaching yourself because her examples don't make much sense.  Mandatory hw that is rediculously long.  Tests are taken straight from the book though.
Dr. Fernado is the best.  She is so nice and very willing to help you with any problems or issues.  I wouldn't take physics with anyone except for her!
One of the best teachers I've had. She makes things crystal clear and is very willing to help you if you don't understand something. There is a lot of HW but having her is worth it.

Class is easy if you pay attention.  All of the concepts are basic and she makes it almost impossible to fail.  Her accent and use of grammar is sometimes difficult to understand but she makes up for it by teaching in a way that everyone can understand if they pay attention
the best ever
Dr. Fernando is the best, hands down.  Her exams are nearly the exact same as the study guide, and she will make sure everyone in the class completely understands a topic before moving on.
Very helpful, and explained concepts clearly.  Gave equation sheets, which helped a lot.

Dr. Fernando was absolutely the best physics professor that I have had. I am a student at UK, and came home for the summer just to take physics at NKU. Dr. Fernando was encouraging, willing to answer questions, and completed a lot of hands on examples in class that really help you grasp the concepts. Do all of the practice problems she gives!!!
She is very Amazing professor I have ever seen; I could say she knows how to make it easy for you to learn.

I had a web class with him and found the class to be difficult but not impossible. I had very little interaction with Dr Elkin but from what I did have he was quick to respond but some times short. I would take a class with him again but I think for him he does not like to repeat him self  so you better pay attention.

I'm a smart person and I found his web course more demanding and confusing than my 300 to 400 level courses.  He is rude and expects way too much.  Labs make little sense when you haven't had any exposure to rocks.  Quiz each week on one chapter, labs due nearly every week, 2 field trips and a paper.  I spent over $150 on this 100 level class.

I took this as an online class and yes it does take a lot of time.  Weekly chapter quizzes, labs, and field trips are required.  I did not find him overly demanding and when emailed questions he responded quickly and was helpful.

Prof Elkin is 100% dedicated.  Yes, the class requires time & staying organized with notes. Read each chapter with his notes.   If you take the time necessary to keep up,you will do fine.  He grades quickly and answer's emails.  He's extremely organized - I would definitely take another class with him. Hint: This class requires TIME and EFFORT!

Professor Elkin was fine. I took his online geology course. I hate rocks, so this class was super boring to me...  But I needed the science with a lab credit. This class was time consuming,  but not impossible. He gives very timely feedback (almost same day) and is EXTREMELY fair in his grading. It's not a walk in the park, but very doable.

The most confusing course i have ever taken in NKU. when you email the Prof. for help, he just doesn't like to help. everything is confusing including his syllabus. do not take this class. you best will never be enough

Professor Elkin expects a lot, but he is fair, hardworking, thorough and prompt himself which I appreciate. The labs can be a little confusing, especially since you do them solo (versus having a lab partner), but they are doable if you use the resources he provides. I got a lot out of the class, something I didn't necessarily expect from a GenEd.

Took geology online. Required lockdown browser in beginning but when it expired, the class got much easier! Do the study guide and you will get good grades. Don't need book. 3 journals and discussions, 8-10 question timed quizzes each week. 80 min. mid-term and final. NO long papers. No group work. Easy science credit.

The online class was managable. Lots of reading and seemingly pointless self-guided field trips. The syllabus and assignments are confusing. Elkin is prompt with responses, but has a very condescending attitude. Be prepared to be treated and talked to as a child. Choose another professor if given the option.

There was something about this guy I did not like. His posts and emails were condescending, and at one point he accused our class of cheating and told us he could see exactly what we were doing when we were on Blackboard. The rock and mineral labs are hard regardless if you watch the videos he provides and read the lab book. I had to teach myself.

Professor Elkin is very rude when responding to students with feedback on grades and emails. The class is harder than most 110 level classes. Perhaps if the teacher was approachable the class would be less confusing. I would not take this class if you like having a good teacher and actually learning.

Great class and great professor. The class does have a lot of work and involves time but it is managable. Don't let the other posts or syllabus fool you, this class is much better than it sounds. I would take a class again with this professor in a heartbeat.

I took GLY 110 online with this guy. Even though there's a quiz every week, labs every other, and some field trips and tests. it's really not that much spread out over the whole semester. The class itself was easy, but the prof is a jerk. He's very short with students and doesn't offer much help. But he is fair in his grading.

I took this professor's class with my brother since we were both in college at the same time. He wanted us to buy seperate course material and not share a book/ ebook. This resulted in him accusing us of cheating for every single little thing in his class. He specifically called us out in the lecture to try to embarass us.

This professor talks down to you. Response to questions are to the entire class "I shouldn't have to explain what to do on the labs. Directions are clearly stated in the modules." Does he care if we learn? His announcements are demeaning and doesn't trust anyone, as he continuously reminds the class in a negative way about school honesty code.

Professor Elkin makes his students feel terrible for doing something incorrectly. He was constantly rude and his daily announcements were unpleasant. Not the typical professor you would like to take, he's tough. I suggest not taking him, he's organized and keeps up with grades but shows no interest in his students.

Professor Elkin is entirely too rude. He talks down to his students and doesn't seem to care if you are struggling in the class or not. He his very quick with responding to emails, I'll give him that, but when he does respond it is very short and the email comes off in a rude manner. I would advise you to take another Geology class.

Professor Elkin sent out a mass email to my class accusing students of cheating. He talked about how he can and does check when we open his lectures and things like that, which is really stressful because I eventually turned to the book because it was more helpful. Very condescending and hateful to any questioning. He also never leaves feedback.

I took his GEO-110 online Fall 2018. He was everything that the other posts states: Rude, Condescending, also accused class of cheating. At times he was almost hateful. I would not take this class. I took the class to fill my general education science requirement and I felt that it was a 300 level class with his abundance of work & labs.

Hardest class I have ever taken. The labs were still tough despite doing your reading/homework. Nothing really made sense, even google wasn't much help. The quizzes were pretty easy. He graded my labs fairly and maybe a little lenient, but overall it does not seem like an intro course. He never seemed disrespectful, contrary to many reviews.

Accused my class of cheating/plagiarism called out 3 students in an email. Was very rude and condescending in emails. When I would ask for help on an assignment, he would not help me, just said that the course was self explanatory and that the online lecture would help.
A lot of work with little understanding of what a 100 level gen ed course is. Totally useless course with an absolute overload of work.

She's a nice lady, but doesn't explain the material well. She's willing to help you. If you are really good in math, take her, but if math is a shaky subject, you might want to take a different professor. Her lectures are very boring, she very monotone.

she hasn't taught at the college level before. if you have knowledge of stattistics go ahead and take her, but she tends to confuse herself when she is trying to explain something. She seems like she really wants you to succeed, and is always offering to help if  you contact her.

Horrible!  I went to her office twice for help and she was never there. The one time i did ask her she told me to ask it in class.  The average on the exams were low D's and the average on the final was a 54%.  2 0r 3 of the students had to correct her several times.  DON'T TAKE HER!

Crystal is a great teacher, is very clear on everything and helps you out whenever you need it.I hate math and she made it easier for me to get through a subject that is my weakest. Take her if you can:)

she is helpful if you have any questions.  she will do any problem you ask-she gets her test problems from the book, so look those problems over.  as long as you ask, she will answer anything.  take her!!!!

I think she is a really nice person. I think she is just really young to teaching and it's hard for her to explains things in perfect clarity. If you like math you should be okay, just make sure that you go to every class. Everything you learn is built off the last class and if you miss one day you will be confused.

She is a nice enough person, but not the best teacher in the least. She very often confuses herself when trying to explain things and is never in her office when she's supposed to be. Gives a quiz every week, if you have no prior knowledge of stats do not take her!
Just an average teacher. Has trouble getting information across. And talk about a bore, I fought to stay awake every class. Very easy though, take home quizzes and tests. Exams aren't impossible.

Though she doesn't require you to be there, attendance is highly recommended.  Jumps around on topics all the time.  Is willing to help, but doesn't really know what to do unless you tell her what you need. Just an OK professor.

Very competent.  Very flexible and understanding.  The only thing I would suggest is to ask her for specific homework problems that will help you on the test.  She doesn't require homework, but I strongly suggest you do it.
She is incredibly nice and helpful.  I enjoyed the class a great deal.  If you do the problems in the book you will pass this class.
Easy teacher. Very willing to help, but you need to somewhat understand what you need help with. I never got the book though it probably would have helped. Highly recommend.
Great Teacher! Highly Recommend

She is a great teacher for those who have issues relating things/needs things explained or reminded to them! Awesome teacher, very helpful & nice. She does expect attendance & she expects you to work. Take her & you will not fail!

I was kind of scared to attend this class just from the rumor of it being hard, but professor Culbertson was very clear in everything she taught. She was helpful in any way she could be. She doesn't make you come to class but you better if you plan on passing. If your taking this course i highly reccomend this professor.

Professor Culbertson was awesome. One of the best professors I have ever had at NKU.  She was able to create interest in a subject I was very scared of.  I wish more professors were like her.  DON'T BUY THE TEXTBOOK. She puts notes and practice problems on blackboard.  Everything you will need will be on bb.  Highly advise on taking her.
She was such a good teacher. She tried and tried to get everyone to understand. The tests were just like the problems in class. Final was hard, DO NOT BUY TEXTBOOK
I am not a math person AT ALL but this class was relatively easy.  Just do the take home quizzes & projects and keep up with the material and you'll be fine (duh).

I have never been a "math person" but I have always passed every math class with a  high grade. This class is incredibly difficult. The notes given are very unclear and hard to follow. Lectures are long are repetitive and often place emphasis on topics that are not covered in the quizzes exams. I would not recommend taking this class.
She was a really hard professor to follow. She gets side tracked too easy

Prof. Culbertson is awesome. She takes the class moderately slow, so following along with the lessons shouldn't be hard if you take good notes. She does have a tendency to over-teach the easy stuff and under-teach the harder stuff, so the tests are a bit difficult. She gives help when asked and will do her best to get everybody a good grade.

I am not a terrible person when it comes to doing math, and actually somewhat enjoy math. However, she made the material very hard to understand. When she explains the material to the class, she explains it as if we already know the material. So if you don't understand anything, please ask.   DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK!

If you're looking to take a math class for a gen ed credit, you cant' go wrong with Chrystal.  There are a few tests and take home quizzes with no homework.  She also has you give a group presentation at the end of the semester but it's fairly easy and she isn't too tough of a grader.  You use the text book, but not too much so don't buy it.

She is a very sweet person. However, she is very hard to follow and her exams are difficult so that doesn't make things any better. If you are bad at math DO NOT take this professor! She is very unclear when teaching.
Great professor. Explains everything well would take her again.
Easy class, but hard to follow... Tests make no sense and seem like you never learned the material.

She's really nice and gives you plenty of opportunities to earn extra credit (or fix test grades). Tests are almost identical to review and take home quizzes. She doesn't take attendance, but it's not smart to skip regularly. She's really hard to follow along with during lectures though. I taught myself most of the content throughout the class.
She is super nice and really cares about you. Class is moderately difficult if you arent good at math but she is very reasonable and understanding.

Great teacher! I can't say enough how willing she is to help people understand math. She doesn't talk down to students even though it's relatively easy material. Referenced book periodically but not necessary since she makes her own homework sheets.  Homework assigned usually once a week never more. Test questions similar to homework- Do it!!!

Very eager for students to understand material.  Knowledgeable about the material.  Did not talk down to us despite the elementary nature of the material.  Take-home quizzes were fairly easy, tests a little harder but still reasonable.

I took liberal arts math and its basically logic and plurality. If your not good at word problems don't take this class, you have to use critical thinking a lot. relatively hard, I wouldn't recommend it at all.

She is a great teacher and is willing to help anyone who needs help (out of class or in). She does teach math so do not be confused when people say the class sucks; math is rough. She does not require a text book but does follow text book examples loosely. Mrs Culbertson is also a practicing Christian which is a plus in my book.
I did not do well in her class, she never explained things well, the final was SOO hard. Tests werent impossible.

Really like this professor. I felt like she made Stats fairly easy, and I am no math person. I recommend to take her. DON'T BUY THE TEXTBOOK. Waste of money, she always puts practice problems on blackboard. Very helpful and gives tons of examples in class.

Makes the material unnecessarily hard for no reason at all. Does not care if you pass or fail. Our entire class failed one test and she refused to curve it. Probably the worst professor I've had. Also has a very monotone and quiet voice when she talks and makes it hard not to fall asleep. Definitely would not recommend to anyone

I think she was a pretty good teacher.  She is very eager to help if you need help.  Do not buy the book.  She is good at responding to emails if you need help on a quiz.  Her tests are hard at some points but she  curved our final by ten points.  She also puts out study guides for the tests and goes over them in class.
Was not a fan of this professor at all. I felt like she didn't care about the success of her students. If you are bad at math then I would NOT take her. Don't buy the textbook.
I liked her. The book is not required, and she explained things well. I recommend her to people who don't like buying expensive textbooks.

Her lectures are notes that look like they were made in 30 minutes the night before. Only grades are quizzes and exams that make you feel like you're going crazy. I have written every single note she has given word for word and the quizzes still seem impossible. I ended up dropping this class because it destroyed my GPA.

Moves very fast. Makes a lot of mistakes herself with the actual math and makes it confusing. Very, very dry. Barely any homework so theres very little to grade. Will assign specific problems and tell you the same exact ones will be on the test but once you get the test, all of the problems are ones never covered in notes/homework.

She is a nice professor and I have no problems with her. If you show up and take notes, you will pass. MAT 114 is by far my least favorite math I have ever taken but Culbertson is a good teacher. She isn't intimidating and is always willing to help. If you want to pass, you really should ask any question you might have.

I liked Dr. Culbertson. She was pretty personable and and taught the subject matter well. She moves pretty quickly but if you have good attendance and pay attention, you'll do well. Don't get the textbook, you don't use it.
She makes this class so easier. She really cares about her students. She also gives make-up exams when the class average is low. She gives many opportunities for students to pass the class.
I had her for two classes and she is a really nice person. I enjoy that she has several times for office hours and I highly recommend using them if you take this course.
Professor Culbertson is very genuine and friendly. She does a good job at explaining the material and doesn't make you buy the textbook.
No Comments
Dr. Haik was super cool. She always has a story to tell and made everything around the students schedules. Haik was fun and there was never a dull moment.
Extremely helpful, and very fun person.
She is very nice and helpful. Always had alot of energy and liked to get out of class early. Her quizes are very hard and her exams are just the same. Be forewarned.

Dr. Haik is great! She is very lively and excited about the subject as well as interacting with the class. She is always open to answering questions and helping you out. Great class. The quizzes and exams are hard though. You WILL need to study.
She is great! I am secretely in love with her

Surprised to read so many bad comments about her. My experience was really good, maybe because my class was just an orientation. You will work a lot, but it was a very easy A. She really cares for her students. You can find the book online, don't need to buy it at all.
Disorganized.

This was hands down the hardest class I've ever had. I struggled with the lab but Haik helped me throughout the whole semester. her tests are hard but if she feels like she gave questions that were too tricky she will give you points back! I absolutely love her
Questionable.
Professor did not address my concerns. Disappointed.

I learned a lot more in his math class than I have in any other.  He requires that you constantly practice what you've learned and that you slow down and think before immediately solving a problem. It was a challenging course, but I learned better study skills.  The final makes up 40% of your grade.  The other 60% comes from tests.  No pressure!
He is nice, will help if you have questions... but his class is NO JOKE. I've only missed 2 classes, done all the homework, take notes and review material, but still failed the first test...

Honest to God he is the best math teacher/professor I have ever had in my entire life. He explains things so well, which is very important in math. He always encourages the class to ask questions, and he had never ONCE gotten impatient with us when we had questions. He truly does CARE about students & wants them to succeed. I recommend him!

He was pretty nice and always willing to help you out with any questions!  but... his test are SUPER hard and your grade consist of only 3 test and a final, so you HAVE to study and make sure you know what you?re doing, or you will fail, like me

He was a great professor! He helped me so much. I have had many MAT professors before and he is by far my fav. He is always willing to help you in any way he can. His tests aren't that easy but if you study and practice you should be ok.

If you don't understand math very well, this is the guy to take. He is very good at explaining things in multiple ways. Homework and class isn't mandatory but I would HIGHLY reccomend it. He goes over the homework very in depth, it's actually kinda how he teaches material. He is very patient when you ask lots of questions. TAKE HIM!

Excellent teacher! Class is not mandatory, but you will miss a lot of info if you do. Be sure to ask questions! He gives the opportunity to do so at the beginning of each period.  His tests are difficult and he's not an easy grader, but as long as you attend class and study, you'll be fine.

I would not take him if you have a hard time in math class. He isn't very helpful. His tests are extremely hard. He doesn't care. I hate math and struggle through it, do not take him if you are like me. it's a terrible class. his tests are hard and he grades weird.

He is very smart and loves math. simply stating that his test a crazy hard and no matter if you do all the homework and extra just to study and go to tutoring you will never fully understand what to expect or know how to do anything on the test. Only 2-3 problems are normal application of what he taught out of the 20 on an exam.
Great Professor. Knows his stuff.  Very helpful.
Relies too heavily on textbooks, doesn't answer questions clearly. Doesn't go over quizzes, so you never know what you missed.

Exams are ridiculous hard. He grades them even worse! You could repeat every word he says and still get the answer wrong. Exams are all definitions or explain and then essays. Must attend, otherwise it counts against you. He is confusing! Doesn't seem very helpful.
Students were always correcting his subnetting, lab reports are due every week and they don't help you learn the material. Mid term was fairly easy but it was 12 pages long. Final was VERY hard.

If you want pass this class don't take this guy.  Gives too many assignments, tests are really difficult and he grades very hard too.  My advice look for another option avoid him, he does not know the subject.

He is a hard professor, but he was ultra on top of things.  He graded things asap, went over any Ruby program the students asked for, and was always asking if students needed help. I would recommend him for Ruby.  Part of the issue is that most CIT students can't program.  Not his fault that they didn't learn enough from 120/260.

Decent professor, even good compared to others in the informatics department. Not the most knowledgeable on the subject, but will go out of his way to help you if you ask for it. Read the book, follow his lab report example exactly, and get the study guide information out of the book/powerpoints and you should get an A. Class requires ~6 hours/week
students corrected his subnet work on the board and do not let him know that you are explain how to do it to other students in the class
Beginning of the semester was ok but with the last 3 weeks left he played catch up and a lot of the class suffered

Let me just explain to you how CIT works. CIT is tough. Professor Cunningham is a great professor teaching TOUGH material to kids who believe they are going to become the next big white party hackers. Well, you're not. This class requires dedication. I only missed roughly 10 points out of the ENTIRE class, including a difficult midterm and final.

Class was pretty good. Quiz every week but it only counts for 10% of your grade. The midterm was okay, the final was brutal. He's a good professor that knows what he is talking about. Don't take him if you aren't willing to work for it. It's no cake walk for sure.

If you want to be successful in networking (i.e. want to be say a network engineer or tech) you MUST take this guy. He is hands down the best networking professor you can get and if you work hard you will easily pass your CCENTCCNA and be very well prepared going into your CCNP. Yes he is tough, but work hard now for a better future.

Scot is the best informatics professor I've had yet. His enthusiasm and field experience are inspiring. He has high expectations, but he makes everything clear and will answer any questions in class or by email. Very helpful if you are pulling your weight, but don't slack off and expect sympathy. I would definitely take any class Scot was teaching.

Does not post lecture notes/powerpoint slides up , have to continue to pause the web lecture to type notes. Demands too much work from doing discussions, weekly quiz, lab assignments, readings, 6 mini-lectures that easily take up more time than going to class in-person, lab questions. Does not give correct answers after getting your grade back.

Scot is an incredible professor. If you follow his game plan, you will learn the material and retain the knowledge. He expects you to put in work and is preparing you for the CCENT/CCNA. Don't expect to float through this class. Come prepared and you will be successful.

Scot is a great teacher he just teaches a class which is meant to weed out student who aren't ready for the rest of the major. 247 is one of those bottleneck classes where you  cant advance until it is done. Its not an easy class and it is not meant to be. Scot is the best teacher you can get for this class.
Very good teacher but teaches a hard class with a lot of material to learn.

Scot may be an experienced business professional, but that doesn't equate to being a good teacher.  Had to do more work than a research course. Questions can be ambiguous, to which if you get it wrong, he'll say "something" was implied. Believes his own methodologies to teaching even though it can be lacking. If you like being frustrated, take him.

Scot is absolutely amazing! He knows exactly what he is doing. This is a upper level (and one of the hardest) CIT classes so obviously it'll be challenging. As long as you complete the labs and show up to class you should be fine. Beware of quizzes!

If you are ready to put the work into the class, you will get a lot out of it. He has a lot of lecture videos and reading to look at, but the videos are a good mix of PowerPoint slides and command line examples that I easily followed (with little prior experience). The labs are straightforward, and he gives good feedback on discussion board posts.

CIT371 online with Cunningham was far from easy. The timed quizzes and tests were tough. Make sure to get the book. I suggest the digital version. Scot is a good respectable professor, but if you are looking for an easy A, take somebody else. Hint for 371 online students: he reuses quiz, lab, and previous exam questions on the final.

Scot is a professor whom you may become frustrated with during the class, but after the class you'll be very grateful. He really makes you put in the work, and if you do, you will get a lot out of his class. He talks fast and his lectures move quickly. Quizzes frequently. Utilize the book! Overall a great guy who REALLY wants his students to learn.

Professor Cunningham is a pretty good professor. He grades and gives feedback the next day. There is a LOT of material so it's a pretty hard class and he doesn't accept late assignments so it can be a bit stressful. There are weekly quizzes on the material.

This professor is very intelligent. He seems to know anything and everything computer science related. He was able to answer all my questions. It was a tough class. There was a lot of reading, and you are quized on that reading (1 to 2 chapters) every other week. The quizzes are not easy but are definitely impossible without doing the reading.

I have had Scot for 4 classes as a CIT major. I'm not going to lie... he is difficult. But, if you want to learn and retain material, he is a good choice. He is a fair, slightly tough grader, and does not accept ANY late assignments at all. Stay on your game, keep up or ahead with the work, don't skip class, and you will do well.

Difficult class, especially if you're not too familiar with networking. YOU NEED TO READ AND UNDERSTAND THE CHAPTERS! Weekly quizzes of every chapter prior to the lecture on that chapter. You need to show up for class. He explains things well and he enjoys explaining things. Be ready for binary and subnetting quickly. Enthusiastic and witty guy!

Horrible. He animatedly spouts information from slides and textbook. He is very confusing and often doesn't know answers to questions. It is not unheard of for dedicated students to fail his classes. He gives no extra credit whatsoever. He refuses to allow students to see the weekly quiz results to understand what they got wrong or right and why.
Instructor doesn't know how to grade. Doesn't teach material nor reviews assignments. Expects you to know material before-hand. Poor teaching skills overall. Avoid him at all costs.
Instructor doesn't know how to teach. Not flexible at all. Doesn't grade fairly. Class too challenging. No extra credit offered.

Just a bad teacher. Expects you to know the material before it is taught, refuses to show what you got wrong on quizzes. Class is made way to difficult for a 200 level. Lectures are boring and confusing, and not helpful in actually teaching the class anything.

Dr. Cunningham is not a terrible professor. I did feel that I learned from the book more than him; however, I found his labs extremely beneficial to help undertand and retain the material. He's not the most helpful, and not the most clear, but I do feel that he is a firm but fair professor overall.

This is was the worst class I have ever taken. I was very excited to get into this class and ended up being very disappointed. He is the worst prof I have ever had. He was unorganized, disrespectful and   dislikes foreigners students.I would strongly advise against taking any class with him.

Fairly intelligent guy, but NOT a good teacher. Talks way too fast and every lecture feels rushed. Quizzes every week on material BEFORE his lecture on it, and  he refuses to let you see what you missed. Not much to learn from the labs, and most are in groups. He relies to heavily on the textbook. No extra credit. Expect to teach yourself. Avoid!

I am surprised. I used to be afraid to take any classes with him but I learned A LOT in this class. I am a foreign student and he treated everyone equally. I just registered CIT 484 for the spring with him and I am so excited to learn more

Does not teach, you have to learn everything on your own, you ask questions you get super vague answers. Doesn't provide anything besides book material, stolen slides, and stolen labs that you find all online.

Scott is interesting, I've had him for numerous different classes and he is always super knowledgeable but never delivers the knowledge to the students well. His course content is dense and dry, and most times when working independently it's difficult to even get through. Partner that with his no late work and you're bound to barely pass.

This lecturer is horrible. You have to teach yourself everything since his classes are at oddball times where you are half asleep the whole time. His presentations are horrible and give no more insight than reading the book. I am glad this was his last semester with the university and I will never have to take him again.
