This is now my third class I've taken with Professor Cunningham, and I must say, he's one of the best that the College of Informatics has to offer, full-stop. Knowledgeable in his field beyond belief, succinct and exact in his explanations. Definitely not an easy grader, definitely not an easy class, but so rewarding. 10/10 recommend.

The way he teaches LInux, its as if you never will be good at it. He's a gatekeeper of the worst caliber. You won't get proper help from him, or feed back. He expects you to know everything from the text book as if you've been doing it for years. The CIT371 course is 100 level materials that are being taught as if its 300. Completely out of place.

He is very knowledgeable about the material, but not a very effective teacher. Many of his test questions are ambiguous and vague. He is a strict grader and often grades subjectively on style and form vs. function. He does not allow the correct test answers to be shown, so you can't know what you got wrong. He should be teaching graduate only.

Definitely a fantastic teacher. He was very knowledgeable when it came to the course material and provided great explanations. He also graded assignments very quickly. If you're going to take this course, start on assignments as early as possible. It's easy to get behind, and hard to catch up.

Prof. provided poor feedback, even when asked directly for additional feedback. Outright rude with some of his replies. Had to fight for points on some quizzes due to auto grading and poor lecture skills. I hate that I had him for this class. I feel that had I been taught by a better prof I would have really enjoyed the material.

Assignments are okay if youre working in a team that understands something when you dont. Thinks that you actually were taught by your previous professors so you should know what to do, this is an faulty assumption. BUT when your lost he will explain,  but be ready for a jab like you should already know that good luck!

He is one of the greatest instructors here at NKU. Some of us students like an easy life and to be spoon-fed. I don't mean life should be difficult and complicated but when you sign up for college, you have to pay the price. He is someone who not only teaches but prepares you for the future. I will encourage you to choose the class.

Good professor. She loves her job, outgoing, and open to help anyone.  The class wasn't hard.  She makes you give an intro speech about your self, two informative speeches, a persuasive speech, and a group persuasive speech selling an imaginary product.  You will use the book a lot. There's quizzes, a mid term, and a final on book material.

Class speeches and test/quizes are easy. She is very helpful but I felt like she would say things to the class that should had been private like what a student did wrong on their speeches or discussing an older students' age. I would never take her again just cus she dnt no her place.

Prof Blalock has much knowledge and enthusiasm for public speaking.  I think she's a great teacher.  I am that older student, and she never said anything out of line.  She helped me learn a necessary skill that I didn't want to learn.

Great teacher and class. 5 speeches throughout the class and one of them is a group speech. She grades very fairly and is very helpful. 4 or 5 online quizzes (easy) and 2 exams (mid-term and final). She gives you study guides and helps with any questions. Really helps students grow as a public speaker! I really enjoyed this class and teacher!

Blalock was one of my absolute WORST teachers I have ever had. I took her CMST 110 class, and it was absolutely awful. She relied too heavily on the book and rarely taught us anything. She is also a very hard grader who plays favorites, so watch out. I will NEVER take a class from her ever again and I recommend the same to you.

Really nice person. Really good teacher.. However, she is very very liberal.. I have nothing wrong with that, but as a conservative it kind of made me mad when she tried to shove her political views down my throat on occasion. Even one of the homework assignments had a slam directed towards conservatives.. and that irritated me a bit.
Never take her, she is all over the place, fills the class time with personal details and does very little actual teaching. I was  very disappointed in this course.
Excellent teacher! He is very helpful, and gives a lot of extra credit opportunities.

He is an extremely nice guy and will give out a lot of extra credit to the class but it is a department ran class and it is a lot harder than I would have expected a 100 level class to be. However he does make sure you have the information needed to do well on the final ( the final developed by the department and is over all course material)

Very funny guy.  I would totally suggest taking him if you're not that into biology.  If you are, though, take someone else.  He's fun, but he caters to those who are simply there because they have.  This class was a pretty easy A, but if you remember anything from your high school science classes you'll probably be bored to tears.

He is very funny and keeps class enjoyable.  He is very througouh with notes and uses powerpoint's to use as a study guide.  Lecture is not mandatory but Lab is and is probably the most difficult part of the whole class.
If you struggle with Biology, this is the professor to have.  He truly cares if his students pass his class.  He gives ample opportunities for extra credit.  He is a wonderful teacher!!!

He is hilarious. He really cares about students being interested in the material and he will make you laugh to keep your attention. He's also very helpful if you struggle with the  work, though you probably won't. It's an easy class and if you're struggling he's willing to help. Lecture attendance was not mandatory but I'd still recommend it.

Dr. Thacker was awesome. He would say and do the strangest things if it meant the students would enjoy class and understand the material more. The tests are also extremely easy as long as you follow his notes. He puts them on Blackboard after lectures so you can get whatever you miss, too. I'm going to miss him, a lot.
THE BEST BIOLOGY PROFESSOR. I highly recommend taking him your first year in biology. Notes on blackboard, uses fill in notes, and he's so funny. TAKE HIM!

Dr. Thacker is great. He does everything in his power to make you succeed.  No mind games.  He drops your lowest exam grade, gives you fill in the blank note pages for every chapter, has a review before every exam, offers lots of extra credit and he's hilarious.  He is more than a fair professor.  Take him for both lecture and lab!

I wish he would teach more classes, he's hilarious and has a great way of explaining things. He's always more than willing to help. Subject matter seems a bit overwhelming at first but he has a review before each test that really helps. He also drops the worst exam grade and offers extra credit. As long as you study it would be hard to fail.
She was extremely rude and not helpful at all. I was in her remidial math class and she flew through it without explaining any thing.  SWITCH OUT if you get her

She is a very rude and mean teacher.  She does not help you out at all, and the material that is presented to you in class she goes over very quickly and gets mad at you for asking the question over and over again just because you don't understand it.  When your taking tests you only get an hour to take the test and if you don't finish the test in
Great teacher can be rude at times but if you speak up and ask questions and do what you are suppose to do like homework and what not she is very helpful.
subject was hard but she helped her students who needed help. It was nice to have a teacher who cared about her students.
Hard teacher, but only has a short time to teach the material. She is very helpful if you come to her. I think she cares about her students to learn, if you go to her for help.
She's a fantastic teacher! A lot of homework but seriously, try finding a math class without. She's awesome!
Very rude and mean teacher. Also left class 2 weeks until the final and never responded to emails after she left. Does not care about her students.

Took her in her first year as a college professor. Seemed devoted and encouraging. Good notes. Class isn't mandatory but I'd suggest going. Cons: Doesn't post notes on Blackboard, didn't curve grades even when they were really bad, grades homework fairly harsh, and takes TOO LONG to return assignments. Pros: Extra credit, DETAILED Study Guides.
She seems disorganized. Goes through notes a little too fast sometimes. Gives 3 HW assigments- 2 requ and 1 xtra cred. Very anal. Not a difficult class but I don't highly recommend her.

She's disorganized, sometimes makes mistakes in her powerpoints and doesn't realize it until she is lecturing class. I'd recommend taking a laptop to type your notes b/c she goes through them fast. She'll call you out if you try to leave class early, she's very anal. The only good thing is she gives you detailed study guides.
Very unorganized teacher. She can't keep her information straight. I don't recommend her at all.

She is good at explaining complicated biological things. Test are not too difficult if you study. She is pretty uptight about being quiet and leaving early or late entrances but other than that she's pretty helpful. I'd recommend her.

No computers or hands-on learning for this class. He read powerpoint presentations for 3.5 hours with a thick accent. Talks way over your head and doesn't notice. Quizzes and exams are straight from the book but he tries to trick you by changing one word in the sentence. That's not learning. Can have cheatsheets for exams - but that's not learning!

This professor at first was a bit hard to understand but after a week or two with him everything is perfectly clear. This teacher always has a good attitude toward his students and will help you out with things if you need him to. He has good power points and as long as your read the chapters and go to class you will get an A or B easily.

He's ok, but its hard to understand him sometimes. He gave us tons of take home labs to do. There are no labs in the class its all lecture based which is kind of weird seeing that its a networks class. He expects us to learn everything from power points slides and pictures. The quizs(which are every week via blackboard) are all based on the book.

Every week we typically do 1 lab-takes about 30 min to 1 hour, we read 1 chapter, and take 1 10 min quiz(on blackboard) its open note open book easy points. The labs are easy and our learn allot from them. In class its just power points and discussion. He is a good professor the material is a little boring but required. But its a pretty easy class.

Worst teacher I have ever taken in my life. Cant understand anything he teaches. Class averages for tests around 60. Does give extra credit, but you must teach yourself to pass. Questions are incredibly hard. DO NOT take him.He acts like hes never taught in his life!

OMG. This is the most useless teacher I've ever had at any level. He was NOT prepared for class, ever. He always seemed lost and confused, and he interrupted tests every single time we had one because He messed something up on them. It was a nightmare. I saw on the schedule he's teaching again this semester. I don't see how. He's really awful.

Was wrong about the subject matter on several occasions. When presented with evidence that he was wrong, He continued to deny it.I strongly believe, he himself is writing up his rating here.To be in safe hands.

He is an absolutely TERRIBLE professor. He actually isn't teaching at NKU anymore due to all the problems I had with him. He is unfair, unprepared, AT LEAST 10 minutes late to every class, skips sections that don't interest him (he told us this) and isn't afraid to insult your opinions.
I like Mr. Bean jokes. He is funny and enjoyable. Sometimes, networking is boring, but he tries his best to make it interesting. Good teacher.
He is the best professor I ever had. This class has lots of great labs that help you to grasp the materials. He is very helpful and has great attitude towards students.

Extremely hard class. Labs and homework every weekend. Gave 1 extra credit. 1st test no study guide. 2nd test study guide and test are somewhat similar. Final exam study guide only contain about 30% of the whole exam.

He is incapable of teaching. Can't answer easy questions. His lectures are reading out slides. On his exams he picks a sentence from the book, may negate it and ask you if it's true or false. WORST PROFESSOR at northern, learned nothing from him.
It was terrible! We had to learn 2 whole books almost by heart! Difficult midterm and  final with 100+ questions, horrible memories!
Great Professor, great leaning experience with various methods (videos, Labsim, Labs, etc.)

I have to agree with most of the other people. Jasani really is an awful teacher. He does not seem knowledgeable at all.  Put it this way...there is a wireless course I want to take but I am passing it up because he is teaching it.  Would not take him again.
This class is very demanding as there is large amount of work required. Great online professor. You will learn a lot if you work hard.
The worst teacher I've ever had. She talks too fast and doesn't care that the majority of the class is failing. If you want to pass chemistry do not take her.

She is literally the worst teacher or professor I have ever had. She speeds through everything (including complex concepts) without explaining them very much at all. Good explanations and foundations are important in understanding chemistry, and she makes learning the subject very difficult. I do NOT recommend her as a chemistry professor.

Nice Lady and very knowledgeable about her subject however not a very good teacher. She doesnt know how to relate material to students most fail and if you fall behind it is basically impossible to catch up. Class seems easy then tests are difficult and not only is your answers graded but the work that led to the answers

Not a good teacher... she is very knowledgeable about what she is teaching but she flies through everything. If you fall behind even a little its almost impossible to catch back up. The examples she does in class are usually totally different than ones on tests and quizes...I would NOT recommend this teacher.
Challenging but learned a lot. Her lectures are dependent on students keeping up with reading and assignments. She will help with questions if you ask. Critical thinking is necessary for exams.

WOW...she's the worst professor ever! She tests on concepts that have only been taught a few days before, even very complex material! The material takes awhile to understand; it cannot be learned in a matter of days! Most of the students agree that her class is WAY too hard; it's not fair for the whole class to suffer because of her bad teaching!

Monteyne teaches as if she has never been in the real world,as flies through the material at an incomprehensible rate. Concepts that take weeks to master are taught in one class session and expected to have it masterede by the following test. She expects to already know what she is teaching and therefore spends no time on any particular section.

She really isn't that bad. She does move fast, and the material is hard, so I wouldn't take it as a Gen Ed.  Her tests are really hard though, but she does study sessions before. The textbook is hardly used, but I bought it and use it when I need to review myself.

She is a difficult teacher especially for lab. If you are a quick learner or are willing to put in a lot of time into studying, this is the class for you but this is not an easy class or teacher to take especially for a gen Ed. Some things are taught too quickly or not thoroughly enough for comprehension, this is when you must teach yourself.

I had her for Che 120 and Che 120L. She is a really good teacher, she does a lot of worksheets and problems for participation points to help you learn concepts. You do a lot fo examples, which help. Although her tests are hard, she holds study sessions before the tests that really help.

She is a hard teacher and she does give a lot of homework, but she is a great professor.   You will pass the class if you do the homework.  You only need a 64% to get a C in her class.  You can get that by failing every test.  Test are hard but the class is easy!

She was a really nice person and better understood if she teaches you one on one if you have the time for that. She moved really fast and taught us a lot in one class period and it was hard to comprehend it. You barley use your book she teaches off notes and gives you owl work. The lab she at first just throws you into it, it seemed.

Although there was a TON of material covered- I found this class to be interesting, challenging, and fun.  Dr. Monteyne is an outstanding professor and will go out of her way to help. Read the book, do the reviews, and study with flashcards.  There's no reason why anyone shouldn't pass this class.

I love, love, love Dr. Monteyne!  I haven't met a professor at NKU that doesn't meet Dr. Monteyne's caliber.  She will go out of her way to help students that are slacking.  (And those students who are slacking are the one's that never go to lecture or lab).  It's easy material, you just need to go to class and do your homework!

The class is in a planetarium with the seats permanently reclined. He has a monotone voice and doesn't explain anything in a way that someone who isn't a Physics major can understand. DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS.

Horrible, horrible, horrible, there are no other words to describe how horrible this professor was. The lecture was very boring, he can't teach at all! He just reads his power points which are useless and impossible to read! I would never recommend him or this class to anyone! I would take a GLY class with Brackman! DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS!!

For an astronomy class I found it extremely easy. The quizzes were hard (60-70 questions) and took forever to complete, but the tests were the exact same questions so it was no problem getting an A. Boring lectures, but overall it was as easy class.
It is really hard to stay awake, so it is hard to pick up the information, so unless you like studying outside of class, i would avoid this class/teacher.

oh boy where to start. well he doesn't tell you want you need to study for on test. let's see in my class right now he is trying to shove 3 chapters in when there is only 2 weeks left of the semester and it takes him 2 weeks to go over 1. he is also shoving three quizzes in as well and doesn't understand why we do so bad on his exams.

Unless you're really into astronomy, this class will bore you to death. He passes around a sign in sheet, so attendance is mandatory unless you have someone to sign you in. PPTs are all online. He is very respectful and always there to answer questions. Quizzes and questions take time but are easy if you try. Study and the tests are easy too!
Very monotone, don't even need the book for the class. Puts all power points online. Hard to stay awake. Lots of quizzes and he likes to cram multiple chapters in a week.

Terrible. Notes are power points full of eqn'ts and pics from text- goes through them quickly so it's hard to take notes yourself. Some of his explanations are good and clear... most aren't. Most of the time you're looking around wondering what he wants. When questioned he is a bit impatient and you're still left not knowing what you need to do.

She is such a great teacher and very approachable! She wants you to try hard, but she will help you. The more you try the better off you are, but she is a teacher that cares and will remember you after the class. She enjoys teaching. You do need to study  so don't think she is the easy way out. I would take her for every class if I could!!
Very helpful, easy to talk with. Tough but fair.

I love Angie. She's so funny, which is helpful because she does read from her powerpoints. Always expect a quiz. I don't think Angie herself is hard, it's just pathopharm as a subject. Must keep up with material because she will fly through 125 slides per class and won't stop. I really suggest her though. She's one of my favorite professors.

Angie's awesome. She gives you 2 points for coming to every class and 2 points if you get an A collaboratively after taking the test (so you could get 4 points back on each test). The material for pathopharm was very hard. However, angie made her tests pretty easy. Most people did very well on them. The book is not needed. She reads from the Ppts.

Angie Riley is easily the best professor Ive had here at NKU. She really cares about her students and goes the extra mile to help explain he material. Shes so funny and sweet. If I could take her for every nursing course I would.

I had Angie for Pathopharm. She was great. Thought she was not easy and challenged you it really forced you to know the material well which is important, especially for this subject. She is easygoing and will help you if you need anything. Highly recommend her!

I had Angie for Pathopharm. Her lectures are long and boring she just reads the powerpoint. It is important to always go to class though because she gives a lot of little quizes, which is good because it forces you to keep up with the material. Flashcards are a must! I made flashcards for every single slide and I got an A on every exam.

It's a very difficult class and she's a nice but hard professor. There is a lot of content to know so be prepared to spend every minute studying. All that I have left to say is try and know the main things about the drugs.
She is the absolute worst professor I have had. All of her homework assignments take hours and they end up hurting your grade. Try anyone else.

She's okay.... slightly eccentric, but very straightforward. Tests are pretty easy if you read the book and her notes are straight from the textbook. Tries to throw in fun activities, has good stories, and knows how to laugh- although she comes across mean at first. MUCH better than Kosack from the horror stories I have heard from other students

I liked her a lot.  The class is not easy but she was very willing to help me when I wasn't doing so hot.  She helped me pull through it.  She is a good person and tries to make the class as interesting as possible.  Advice...go to class, read for class, and study throughout the semester not just a day or two before each test.

Lots of good examples, great guest speakers, really opened my eyes to the diversity of nursing. More of independent format with homework but it gave you a chance to look at things that were of interest to you.

Kim was an alright professor. She is very knowledgeable and is always willing to help you with your papers. However, she tends to talk a lot, and I often found myself completely lost during her lectures.  If you ask her to review your papers before you turn them in, you should be able to pull off an A.
Overall very good professor.  Organized, very knowledgeable and helpful.  Will review your papers and projects to help you do better and think about the issue.  This professor will challenge you.

This class is very very very tough. I struggled through the entire semester. Sarah isn't very helpful when it comes to answering questions, however I will say that she helped bump my grades up so I could pass. She is very nice, but I wouldn't recommend this class to anybody.

I did receive an A in her online bis 101 or inf 101 class but it was hard. I sometimes worked 7 hours straight on the projects and Sarah does not respond to emails or answer questions. It took her the entire class to finally have her grade the few (3) projects that were not computer graded. Absolutely no instruction. AWFUL!!!

Course content isn't very complicated, but it seems as though Professor Mann was not as knowledgeable as a teacher on the content should be. She wasn't willing to help Mac OS users whenever they experienced issues, and often times was open about her lack of understanding. It's an easy A, but it could definitely be easier if not for the professor.

Sarah Mann is the WORST professor I have EVER had. I can't stand her. Her "lectures" are her reading powerpoints that were premade by the book company. She knows the bare minimum about the class. Being a millennial and growing up with a computer I felt as if I knew more about the topics than she did. She can't keep track of the grade book.

There's a ton to do for the online course, but it's very straightforward. The work is easy and you have multiple chances to redo work to get a higher grade. The only thing you don't get second and third chances on are the quizzes which are timed, but very easy. She is accessible. Generally if I emailed her she would reply in less than 45 minutes.
Easy! there is a module every week with about 5-6 things to complete but it is easy! Any problems you have she is happy to help with

Computer Literacy and Informatics with Sarah Mann is easier than a 3rd grade art class. Attendence is recorded for a total of 50 points in the semester. Literally everything is online, there's modules and quizzes due every MWF. But she "reviews" the lesson AFTER the quiz from a powerpoint. No point in going to class. She gives so much extra credit.
Professor Mann is a great professor. Shes very helpful outside of class, and offers endless amounts of extra credit for those who show up to class

WORST CLASS I HAVE TAKEN!!! I have friends that have taken her in class and said it was a breeze, I took her as an online 8 week class and it was the worst decision I've made. BIS 101 is a pre-req i need for next semester so I couldnt drop. I would spend HOURS on the projects. It was unrealistic to get done the amount assigned and actually learn.
Terrible teacher. Don't take any classes with her.

This online class was structured very well. Each week you had a clear understanding on what had to be done. She emailed us in the first few weeks saying This is a 100 level course. Dont over think it. I spent maybe two hours a week on this class and passed no problem. Quite a few projects but they are very simple and she is easy on grading.

Professor Mann is very hands-off, which can be a good thing, but can also be very frustrating. Most of the homework is super long and took hours. This course wasn't very fun. At least there was a clear schedule throughout the semester.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. I don't think she even looked over the coursework before she uploaded it to canvas because there were so many mistakes on her part during the semester and the instructions were completely outdated. The work is pretty easy but it will take you hours. And good luck trying to get an email response from her.

This professor is a very hands-off teacher if you do your work on time. She is incredibly nice and doesn't assign an absolutely overwhelming amount of work. I would take her class again just to feel her positive presence. Very kind professor, choose her!
It is very hard to follow his lectures. His notes are unorganized and difficult to read. A lot of homework. Nice guy though. I wouldn't recommend him to someone who hates math like me.

I found it kind of useless to go to lecture..I pretty much taught myself. He talks to the class like we're children...continuously asks us to ask questions, yet only goes over one problem during class. I hate to say it, but I hated his class.

He was a really nice teacher, took time to talk to students and would answer questions in class. He moved a bit slow sometimes and didn't give much heads up about work. The only lectures he gave was going over homework or taking notes you could get off Blackboard.

This guy knows his stuff and helped me actually like this stuff a little. He goes slow so i could understand first time. Tests were easy since they were formatted just like the homework and lecture. i hope he teaches the next level.

Pointless to go to class unless there is a test or homework turn in. Taught myself what I needed to know and also help from class mates. Loved math before this class, now not so much. Don't recommend him at all.

Seriously, don't take him. He literally spends all class on one problem and barely even explains it, he just writes stuff all over the board to the point you don't even know what to look at. All tests are on StatCrunch. He also makes you do a video project at the end of the semester and he demands your face is in it. Which really weirded me out.

Jack Dagg is the worst professor I have had throughout my college career. He claims to be all for his students, and willing to help you if you work hard. He says that if you do all the homework and attend all the classes then he will raise your grade at the end of the semester. He only does this for select students, so don't count on it.

differential equations is hard but dagg makes you feel like you can do it evenif you arent math whiz.I busted my tail to get through this class. he gave me a higher grade higher cause i participated in class and since i tried to answer questions in class. if you take him show you are really trying to learn it. not an easy A but my friend made an A.
he only offered 2 test and final  and a project. i ended up failing every test and i received a B in the class. if annoy him and cry for a better grade, you can get the good grade! it worked for me!
He scribbled on the board and nothing made any sense.

Dagg is the kind of professor that will help you when you put in the effort. You have to do the homework. The homework is the best thing to help you learn. Tests are like homework. Understand homework, will do really well on the tests. The project is super easy.  Partake in class discussions and get rewarded.  Slack off and will fail. Simple.

I failed my first statistics class and then I re-took statistics with Jack Dagg in the summer. I found his class so much easier. If you don't understand what is going on in lecture he stops and makes sure everyone is up to pace and knows what to do. He really wants everyone to pass! Tests are easy if you take time to do the homework! Great teacher.

professor dagg helped me every time I asked. his answers to questions in class are complete and thorough. this teacher made me feel like I could succeed which is rare at my college. I will definitely take him for my other statistics class. if you want to learn and have someone help you a lot take this guy.
This teacher was very helpful.
I learned a lot about statistics from this class.

Professor Dagg was very helpful and gave immediate feedback. All of the tests and homework are online through myLab. I appreciated the use of technology as opposed to pencil and paper. I also appreciated the video tutorial assignment which helped me improve my grade. I REALLY struggle with Math and I would happily take another course with him.
Very helpful and encouraging

Professor Dagg changed my thinkng about math. I continued as a math major and graduated because of him. He was tough and makes you work for it; but you will learn how math really works from the abstract. He's a little picky about cell phones in the classroom.

He takes 20% grade on attendance and only 10% on homework. He will never tell format of the exam or even what to study(notes,hw). There were only two exams. Midterm grades were so bad he lowered the weight from 25%-5% but did nothing to help fix this for the final.
I do not recommend this teacher. He never gives a clear answer and likes to play guessing games. Only 2 tests the entire year (midterm and final). Attendance is mandatory as a part of your grade.

This class was extremely hard!  He is very unclear in class.  Attendance is mandatory which is 20% of the grade.  He knows what he's talking about, it's just very hard to follow.  All tests are multiple choice with maybe two short answers. DO NOT RECCOMEND!

He was the worst professor I've ever had. His lectures are incredibly boring. He takes too much time to explain a concept we already know. He has only two exams, so if you mess up on one, you're screwed. I definitely DO NOT recommend him.

Awful, lame, boring class and guy. Doesn't explain anything, says you need to learn it on your own. Find the equations yourself. Hw is all online. You have to teach yourself how to solve them. Once he took the entire 50 minutes of class to explain how to solve one problem. Not cool. Not fun. Boring. Don't take this class with him as your professor.

A really nice guy and a good teacher. He wants everyone to succeed and do well in his class. He explains all the notes and problems thoroughly. If you do your homework, come to class and study for the tests and use the Math Center for help then you will do fine. I recommend this professor.
Helps well with analyzing. I am not english speaker and he helps very much.Vry good man and easy to talk. Knows calculus well and make student understand easy.

explainations are terrible and not clear. expects you to learn on your on by using my stat lab . hes boring . do not take if i wouldve known this i would not have taken. his inability to explain possibly has costed me a passing grade
A good teacher.

GREAT TEACHER - stayed late to help clarify any and all qstns/had tutors to come to class to personally sign up/was always available and never moved on until everyone in the class was on the same page/Not the easiest subjct but the ones that strggld the most also admitted to not studying/ THIS IS COLLEGE not all classes are easy 100 level classes

As a person he is cool. He tries to relate to students a lot. As a teacher he is he's alright. He will take all class to go over one or two problems. Attendance is mandatory, and keeps you to the last second. Can have notecards on tests which is nice. Expect to actually learn the material from online homework.
I enjoyed this class.

You will have to teach yourself everything you need to know for this class, which is difficult in a math class. The exams are worth 60% of your grade and he always picked the trickiest questions to ask. I dreaded going to this class and even though I received an A, it was the worst class I had ever taken. He is very impatient and does not explain.

You have to teach yourself everything!  He bases the class around this, he answers your questions with questions and never directly answers them!  He's not a teacher because he doesn't teach you anything he just over sees what your doing and wastes class time doing one problem that only takes 5 minutes to do. Take with another teacher!
Take with another Professor! Terrible Teacher! You have to teach yourself everything!

He was a funny guy. But a terrible professor. I taught myself EVERYTHING in the class. The only grades are 3 exams and one project. It might sounds nice that there is no busy work, but you have to do good on the exams to pass. There is no study guide, you just have to teach yourself everything he is suppose to teach you. Do not take him.
I felt I learned a lot from this class. I thought this teacher was good.

He made this class way harder than it needed to be, I didn't learn anything the whole semester. Also there were only 2 test with 8 questions each, a project and a final. There aren't many chances to get your grade up.
A good teacher. I enjoyed this class.
Homework and tests are done on StatCrunch. Does problem on board and doesn't explain any steps.

Dr. Ma was a great professor. Organic is incredibly hard but she definitely kept it as simple as possible and her tests really weren't very hard. She gives problem sets for each chapter if you do those correctly you will ace the tests! She takes questions directly from notes and problem sets!

Great instructor. she encourages but not much to think. If you do not like using your brain and being challenged mentally you will like her class. She is a very special individual that truly cares her classes.

Dr. Ma was very helpful if you had questions related to the lab reports. She grades the lab reports easy, but lab exams hard! Her lab exams are very challenging and include things we had never seen such as solvent structures. She can sometimes be hard to understand and doesn't post pp. Overall, she is very good and I would take her for lab again.

Had Dr. Ma for both semesters of organic. Tries really hard to make a difficult class as interesting as possible. She offers plenty of extra credit, partial credit on tests, and will provide you with lots of resources to succeed.
By far the worst professor I have encountered. Not recommended.

Dr. Ma is very knowledgeable but her accent gets in the way.  If you have a hard time getting past accents then don't take her.  Otherwise she is great.  She has always been happy to help and is very friendly.  She gave us 7 extra credit opportunities which helped.

The nature of Organic is just hard. But I think she tries really hard to fill that gap and make it understandable. She's a little hard to understand at some times but she's funny. She gives extra credit points and curves the test!
She is very helpful but sometimes hard to understand. Her exams are not that bad and her practice exams are really helpful.I will highly recommend you to take her

Best advice- Sit in front rows! She's hard to hear,talks fast and has a heavy accent. If you sit further away than 3 rows you will most likely miss stuff. This is a hard class no matter who teaches it. Makes notes outlines avail. on BB- print them! You will not get everything if you take notes by hand. B/c of this you really NEED to go over them.

Dr. Ma is very easygoing. If you know you're material in lecture then lab should be easy. Her exams are made up of every lab report and lectures, so if you study them it isn't hard. She always answers any questions and allows for mistakes in the lab. Her lab reports aren't long or hard. Her accent can sometimes get in the way, but nothing too bad.
Her accent is difficult sometimes, but she makes a really strong effort to make sure you understand. Her PowerPoints are thorough. She is always accessible, and is generally very sweet!

Dr. Ma is the best, she is accessible outside of class and is always willing to help no matter what, she is a fair grader. her tests are not the hardest if you study and if you go to the mock exams. she gives up to 12 points extra credit which literally helped me go a whole letter grade up. couldn't have asked for a better ochem teacher.
I loved SANDY! She practically saved my life! She was more than willing to help you and although some say she is hard, I think she explains things perfectly! Love her!

She emphasized that reading the book would be vital to passing the class, but then when it came to tests and the lecture she would tell us the opposite. You never knew if she was testing on the answers in the book or on her notes and many times students failed tests because of her contradictions! I would not recommend her to anyone.

DO NOT TAKE! This professor has a nasty attitude and is so unhelpful. Ask a question to clarify something and she'll tell you to read the rubric as if you haven't already. Took her 2 weeks to answer an email and was no where to be found during office hours and kept cancelling class right before paper was due so I got no help. She is the worst!

I had Grinnell for theories and I thought she was great. The only two things that our grade was based off was really just a group project and a paper. There are no notes, studying, or exams in this class. You just show up and play games, color, or watch a movie. I still feel like I learned a lot though. She is helpful with answering questions.
This professor is so unhelpful and just plain nasty. Argues with the class instead of helping.

Take her for Nursing Theory! She is AWESOME. You have no homework and no tests, only 2 projects (which are ridiculously easy), and a few responses (also easy). She makes everything easy and we watch movies and have lots of fun. TAKE HER!!
Not an interesting topic but she tries to make class fun.  Not hard just have to complete the work, and it's only 2 projects and a couple responses.

Easily the worst professor I have ever taken. She is extremely horrible at responding to emails or any questions you may have. She is downright rude to her students. Clearly does not care about your education. 0/10 would NOT recommend.

RUN AWAY!!!! the 1st day of class i set my stuff down on the table, pulled my chair out and he got behind me and i thought he was going to be nice and push my chair in for me, and he pulled it AWAY!!! which pissed me off and he was just rude. DO NOT TAKE.

The only thing good about taking this class is no final. Way too formal and serious for an introductory course. He NEVER responded to my emails. Very boring class, didn't learn anything from his lectures.

He gives frequent quizes so you don't have to take any comprehensive tests. He has powerpoint notes to study. For the tests, make sure to look over the notes and read through the bolded words in the book. I thought he had a good setup.

Had him for IT Project Management and dredded going to class each day. After the whole class bombed the first test (because he didn't use anything from his slides), I lost all respect for his lectures. TONS of work, and he doesn't really grade the assignments. He grades the group on the final presentation instead. I don't recommend.

I had an online intersession 8 week class, in the beginning he would give us a chapter with a quiz at the end.  then towards the end of the semester, lets say 2 weeks before finals, he started throwing all these assignments at us, the assignments were very diffult.  i would give hime credit bc he held on campus session and seemed very nice very har

The team project takes up tons of time in this course, lasts the whole semester w/weekly assignments, and only counts for a little more than a test grade. You have a group of 3-4, and there's a lot of work (that's all I'll say). At the end, you present it to reps from PMI. The first test was hard, but he granted us a reprieve w/online tests later.

Knows the material very well and does a good job explaning when asked questions.  Quizes are a bit to hard, pick random little parts from the book to ask about.  Gives little to NO guidence on main projects.  Very very DRY guy, I can't imagine him laughing.  As already mentioned, does NOT answer email, I'm not even sure if he knows how to use it.
Only used book for online quiz
Terrible

He does take some getting use too, but is a great Professor.  Seems dry at first, but you just have to keep going to him and get use to his style.  He knows his stuff and is willing to put forth as much effort as you do.

Difficult teacher.  Quizzes are timed and over information that is not helpful to the learning process.  Nobody has a clue what he wants for the projects.  He is not clear at all.  His lack of clarity comes from not telling direct answers to questions.  There is no language barrier.

Frank is un-organized and has difficulty communicating.  Projects are confusing and there is no direction. Class time is spent on things that you will never be tested on.  All questions come from the book.  He selects random information from the book to test you on quizzes.  Quizzes are very hard, but from the book. Avoid if you can!

This prof is very confused.  He does not know how to teach.  He is unprepared for class.  Quizes are memorization and regurgitation method.  He does not set up the class so you can learn.  I am glad I did not work for him in the real world!
This guy is terrible. 100 uestions on the quizzes, almost no help on assignments, way too many slides. He knows a lot, but a bad teacher. I will recommend to stay away of him if possible.

Stay as far away from this professor as possible.  Horrible teacher, unrealistic expectations of students, gigantic quizzes,  doesn't return emails, and utilizes very little class involvement.  Be prepared to be bored!!!!
His test were impossible and he his project was incredibly too much to handle.
Good prof.  Very dry wit.  Will help outside of class if you pay attention in class.
No Comments

HE IS A HORRIBLE PROFESSOR. Never responds to emails, gives stupid quizzes that do not make ANY sense. Braun cannot explain properly if you ask him a question. Classes are very boring and very annoying.He gives ENORMOUS and unreasonable loads of work, and grades it ONLY at the end of semester. Some teachers must not teach, and he is one of them.

Nice enough guy BUT refuses to respond to e-mails, despite posting his e-mail address on syllabus;multiple choice quizzes are so granular they include footnotes from the book (rendering learning the big picture items worthless).Had difficulty answering specific questions,doesn't stray from power points,workload is very high versus knowledge gained.

Doesn't post assignments until towards end of semester so then everything feels very rushed. Doesn't post grades in a timely manner. End of semester I had no idea what my grade was. Grading criteria for project was very unclear. Very dry, lectures are boring and a struggle to sit through. Nice guy, just not the best professor.
Bad exams, otherwise teach well

You can tell he is very smart.  But he does not have the ability to convey his knowledge to students.  He is unresponsive to e-mail. The quizzes are silly, the questions are meant to trick you rather than to see if you have learned relevant information. He does not ever clearly define what the projects/reports in the class are to be.

This was my first graduate class at nku. The prof. made me feel bad about my interest in MBI. However, PLEASE I BEG YOU DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASS THIS PROF IS TEACHING.  Everybody in the class complain about his quiz … 35 questions for 35 minutes.
Great teacher.  Very good at explaining everything.  Tests a little difficult but doable.
Great professor! Prepared, able to clearly explain difficult concepts.

She's generally a good teacher.  She doesn't really seem to handle questions well and you have to coax a "yes or no" out of her.  She's very, very willing to give extra credit though so if you need E.C. then you're in luck.  She's fair as well and quite nice. If you're nice to her, she'll be nice to you.

This professor does not move slowly enough for anyone in this course. This course is made for people who are not strong at math at all,  and she treats it like this class is our major. It is very hard to stay for the full time because she drags on and will hop from material to material, without giving anytime for it to soak in.

Math is not my strong suit so I do have to work harder to understand the material. With her it is nearly impossible. She talks & goes through the material way too fast. If you politely ask her to wait she gets irritated. I have A's & B's in other classes and I'm a double major so it's not that I'm incapable of comprehending. It's her teaching style

This professor was usually 10 to 20 minutes late to class. She would hand out roughly 5 to 10 handouts per class and graded you on keeping track of them. She is disrespectful to students when they ask questions and moves too fast without actually teaching. I should have taken an online course. MyMathLab is where I had to teach myself.

Dislike this teacher very much. Almost every student in the class I was in dropped it. Does not go through material at all. Rushes through things and will not explain well. When asked how to do things she has replied "maybe you should come to class" when only a day has been missed. Worst math teacher to have. Do not take her class.

She moves from subject to subject quickly which doesn't help when you already don't understand the subject. She also doesnt use Blackboard. She also has these lame and corny jokes she puts on papers. She doesn't have any style and her hair is a hot mess also. She is basically lame!!
Don't take this class just because they suggest it for people not strong in math. It's 98% riddles and I still don't know where the math comes in
I have trouble with math already, and she is not helpful. She goes through the material way too fast and barely explains anything.

During a class she told me to shut up because I was the only student answering and she got "annoyed" when I answered. I am not terrible at math and I knew how to do everything but she actually confused me. She has no organization and she moves way to fast even though we tell her. She will work with you and is very nice just not a good professor.

He is a great and helpful. He always try to give more chances to get more grades by assignments. He really cares to make all students understand not to teach and leave. When you do mistakes, he gives another chance to correct to give you grades but you have to understand how you corrected it.
TALKS TO FAST AND MAKES MISTAKES ON TEST AND REVIEW SHEETS.
he is helpful
very good
He is amazing! Super hard on his students BUT I learned sooooo much.  He likes to yell but don't let that scare you the first class. It will benefit you.
Great teacher !! just take his class
Worst teacher ever, always do mistakes on test and review sheets.
Very difficult class and lots of homework but he is good professor.
In nearly 200 credit hours, Dr. Moses-Wasburn is easily the worst professor I have had. I am one of 3 students that I know of repeating the MAT 141 course I took. Do not take him.

Very unhappy with my results from this class. I had to teach myself everything out of the book. I am a good student and enjoy going to class however I found that class time was not used very well, I left feeling like nothing was accomplished. I also felt that I could not ask for help because he was not very personable. Waste of my tuition money.

He has little to no social skills. He does not make sure that the entire class is comfortable with his method of teaching. There is always homework, and the homework rarely has anything to do with what was taught in class.

Spent hours doing homework on Mymathlab, to have it not even worth any points. Homework has nothing to do with what he states he is trying to teach. Do NOT take any class taught by this socially awkward man who does NOT know how to teach anything.
WOW. Terrible person and even worse professor.
This teacher was awful. No one should ever take him. He has no idea how to teach and you will end up learning nothing.

This class was extremely difficult. I spent double the amount of time outside of class studying and doing homework, than any other class. Does not teach very well so I basically had to teach myself. If you have to take a Stats class, I would recommend not taking his class.
This class is terrible. He has no idea how to teach at all. Loves giving out homework that has no reference to the classwork. So basically you never learn anything because he's all over the place.

I spent countless hours outside of class working on homework only for it to be a tiny part of my overall grade. The homework doesn't relate to the classwork/quizzes/tests. He will show you the "shortcuts" for the homework, & then you won't know how to really do the work in class on tests/quizzes. He also doesn't know how to teach in different ways.

Its a pass/fail course for the ALEKS exam. So basically thats all you do is work on modules in class, I never went to class and did everything on my own. He does work in the tutoring center so thats pretty nice when you need help.

Professor Wasburn-Moses genuinely cares about helping his students and is very generous with his accessibility and time outside of class. Throughout my time in the course he walks you through many examples that were related to test and homework questions. He is truly here to help you. Bet

I took this class as a requirement for my degree and it was the worse class I took. The homework is hard. His lectures make no sense at all. His tests are 7-9 questions long and nothing like the test reviews. He makes you do group work for a zoom class at 9am.
Rough class and wasn't really prepared going in.
I have to study to do well.

She was a really easy grader, but she didn't really teach the material. The one way to learn anything was to read the text booklet online. She also could be a little rude sometime if you didn't understand something.

Listening to this professor was a narrow winner over committing ritualistic suicide. She's nice, but utterly inept as a teacher. Read the book, because what she says might be negative learning for you. I would sooner graduate a year late than take her again. Luckily, the class is easy.

Sometimes she is hard to understand. She switches topics very quick. She has only three test so if you fail one your done. The hw counts as 1 point. If you ask for help alot time she doesnt understand your question so it might take 30mins before she understand question.

She is hard to understand and the things you actually program only count as 1% of your grade.  She was late for class a lot and always wanted to hold class later.  She doesn't understand your questions and makes the class harder than it needs to be.

She is a good teacher if you know how to ask the question right, most of the time its easier to show her the code in order to get a good answer. If you get on her good side though you will do fine and she will go out of her way to help you

By far the greatest professor I have ever had. She teaches in a way that is very easey to understand, is very available to her students and willing to help however she can. She was extremely encouraging; which is rare in the program. I was not looking forward to another Med-Surg class but Lynn made it much more interesting and easy to comprehend.

Class with Lynn was pretty relaxed, except when she would have the class do some sort of participation activity, which occurred about once a week. She did expect us to read, but let us know to pay special attention to the tables, etc. in the book. I think some things she says can rub people the wrong way, but only if you are looking for a problem.

Lynn was not at all what I expected. I had heard so many people say she was an excellent professor in the nursing program but I was SO disappointed. Her attitude was very rude and negative over the semester. She is very self righteous and will get very upset if you think she is wrong about something. I had to teach myself all the content....
The hardest professor I have taken by far.

The prior reviews must be speaking of some other lynn smith. She is in no way helpful or easy. The absolute worst professor I have ever had in the nursing program. I do not recommend her for any student. Our class average on the first test was 68 and she would not curve. She is degrading through email and makes a point to make you feel stupid.

This teacher is self-righteous & has an inflated sense of self. She makes it a point to put a negative ripple in the lives of students. She has an inability to consider anyone else's point of view but her own-even when the textbook has evidence to dispute test questions. If you're forced to be in her course, be invisible- it's in your best interest

Lynn was great. Don't expect to learn anything in this class, because frankly the material is bland and uninteresting. However, Lynn makes you think and consider some of the principles of nursing and is great about engaging in conversation. If you do the work to the rubric, you should be able to manage an A.

Lynn helped us to understand the material.  Classes were more like discussion groups, which helps you to learn the big concepts of the material.  I don't see why people say she's a bad professor, because she is one of the best professors I've had so far in the nursing program.

This woman....her tests are not terribly difficult but her attitude is HORRIBLE. She's very rude and disrespectful. If you give a wrong answer she makes you feel like an idiot but if you don't answer at all she gets angry. She is short tempered and  not at all helpful with questions. I would never take a class from her again.

Many people do not like Professor Smith. I did not have an issue with her. She highly values participation, so be sure to participate in class. You must attend this class as it is simulation and you cannot get points for not attending. Lynn is very passionate about this class, so I did enjoy taking it with her. She does respond quickly to emails!

this class is a lot of work. however, professor smith is great about responding to emails. she is very helpful if you need help with any of the projects (and there are a lot.) my one complaint is that the rubric doesn't always align with what she wants. i think another professor created the rubric. ask her questions so you can get an A

Mispronounces names even after correction. Gives 4 or 5 page homework packets when she decides to cancel class. Grades tough and doesn't use the rubric. Gives conflicting info about assignments. Lectures are on topics we never use in assignments.

I take this class online, Smith is the worse professor I've ever had!!  She is a tough grader and is unfair.   Avoid this professor! If I have to take another class of hers, I will drop it and take it elsewhere.

Great Professor! She does expect you to work and to follow the grading rubric. She is very intelligent and gives good honest feedback in my opinion. Maybe that comes across wrong to some people but I would rather have constructive criticism than no engagement. I would take her again for future classes.

Dr. Smith is very knowledgeable about world religions and cultures, but the class is sometimes boring. Dr. Smith loves participation, so speak up in class but do it respectfully. The class isn't difficult if you pay attention at least half of the time in class. Attendance isn't mandatory, just don't skip on quiz days.

You will learn a great deal in her class about nursing theory. Her class and methods prepared me how to locate peer reviewed research in addition to writing papers in APA format. She interacts with students discussions regularly which I really enjoyed. I would highly recommend.

Although Prof. Smith is knowledgeable about different worldly cultures, this open-mindedness does not translate in the classroom. As others said, it is very difficult to advocate for yourself and be prepared to answer questions quickly or face a lecture about her disappointment in you. Male students will also be made an example. Avoid this prof.
This teacher is not helpful at all. He doesn't explain the matirial very well. His exams are very diffcule even if the book was opened
He is good professor and really smart. Just take any mechanical class with him. He is funny professor and Don't worry about your grad. You will pass and get what you to do.

Dr. Sadat is very caring and teaches the manufacturing and design subjects very well.  He is an excellent advisor. He is always positive and answers my questions as much as possible.  He is definitely the best in the Engineering Technology department, and most knowledgeable.
He is very good teacher but some times he is busy because he is the director of engineering department I recommend him
THE BSET ONE, IF YOU NEED HELP JUST ASK HIM.... ON THE OTHER HAND, HIS EXAMS LOCKDOWN BROWSER

Dr. Sadat is one of the most passionate professors I've ever had. He is head of the department and also teaches multiple classes and regardless of how busy he is he will always make time to help you. He also is always looking for student input about how we think the program is being run. With that said his classes can be a little improvised sometimes. He would come in and seem like he didn't plan the day out. But we still learned what we needed to.

One word to said about Dr. Sadat that is he is very greatest Prof at NKU. He has lots of experiences from manufacturing environment and share what real manufacturer would do beside the book and lecture.

Open book tests using lockdown browser while he observes all the students in class so you wont be able to take it at home. His teaching style is read power point slides and keep calling out students who are not paying attention. I dont recommend him to anybody. Find someone else to get good grades and actually learn something might as well.
She is awesome. She makes sure that you understand every bit of what is going on in the lecture. If you are taking MAT 119, I recommend her without any hesitation.

Assumes you know what she is talking about immediately and skips sooo many steps on her explanations so you lose her fast. Would not take again if my life depended on it. Also prepare for her to fuss about technology for half the class. Also her notes are the biggest jumble that has ever existed.

Failed this class the semester before then took Marie, she is an amazing teacher. Everything is clear cut. Homework doesn't take long. Not a very tough class. She is an awesome teacher for people who cannot math

Mostly Algebra II stuff learned in HS. Hw given after every lecture however she does not grade for correctness just for completion. Only 2 exams each worth 100 points. She gave us a list of the type of questions there were going to be ahead of time.

Had Ms. Jump after being out of college for almost 10 years, my first time taking PreCalculus I barely passed. Ask questions and she will try to make sure you understand (may have to speak loudly for her to hear u) She gives an outline of each test and what to expect. Really helped for studying for a Math test. She's a little quirky in her habits,

Her knowledge of the subject is vast but I don't think she knows how to get the information across to her students.  She gets frustrated when you don't understand what she is trying to explain.  Lectures are erratic and jump all over the place.

She is awful! If you are not a math person DO NOT TAKE HER! She is smart but she picks a problem and tries to solve it herself without explaining things and also skipping steps. If you want to get a good grade in this class take a different professor!

I was a School Based Scholar in HS, and had Ms. Jump for Mat 119 AND 129. Yes, she know what she is talking about, but if you ask her a question or tell her you don't understand she will go back and try to explain it. You cannot expect her to know that you don't understand. I LOVED her and her class. If I could I would take it again.

She may be educated, but she certainly can't portray her knowledge to others. There was an elderly man in my class and she treated him like he was stupid because he didn't understand. Also, don't smile in that class because she'll yell at you. Don't say FOIL, because THAT'S completely wrong. She makes you say First Outer Inner Last.

I took this class as a seven week summer course, coming straight out of Cincinnati State. If you have never taken an online course at NKU don't take her class online. She doesn't know how to post assignments to BB, the assignments were in places you would never think they would be. She also needs to take a class in email etiquette. Buy the book!
Easy class

Horrible teacher.  Expect to learn nothing. Expect to not get a proper response most of the time for your hard work. Forget about extra credit. It is honestly more difficult than any of the other work in the class and only worth a couple points.  i should have a b+ in the class without even trying.  Also, almost nothing to do with the subject.

2 group projects where a group of 7 had to write a paper and presentation- for online. Frustrating and difficult. No reasoning for grading. Weekly discussion boards, don't get the book, midterm and final found on quizlet. Material not presented well.
glad its over
A lot of work but still got a good grade
n/a

I took this as a 7 week summer course. I highly recommend taking it in the summer! There was an assignment each week which was so so easy and then you would have to respond 100words to 2 classmates. There was a midterm and final exam  (not timed) and one 5 page research paper that has easy guidelines. Professor Summers is great! take her!!!
Very easy class! Just keep up with the weekly assignments. Research paper and midterm/final exam were fairly easy. I recommend her

I took BIS101 with professor summers online during the summer. Super easy class and plenty of opportunities for points. She is always available to help via email or zoom, and she is very nice. You have to buy the online textbooks to do your assignments, the websites are easy to use and make the content easy to learn. 100% recommend her!

The easiest class you will take. She is such a nice women, she is very caring. There are a TON of assignments but there easy, just take a while. You really dont even need to go to class so you can use that time to do your homework. Definitely would recommend this prof and class. very useful class too

Tried taking STA 212 my first semester with a different professor, ended up withdrawing bc I had a terrible grade. Expected to go into this class and not do well. I was wrong. Mr. Peterson is the best math professor I have had. He explains the material in a way it's easier to understand. Had a total of 8 quizzes (mostly take home) and 3 tests!
This was the third time I've taken Stats and the ONLY time it made sense! If you go to class, fill out the notes and study for an hour a week you can pass with an A!

Very good math professor. Explains thoroughly and clearly. He is a nice guy and really cares. He told us at the beginning of the semester that he doesn't allow make up work but then he did for some people so just talk to him and make sure he knows what is going on. I didn't know that and I would have gotten a better grade if I did.

Professor Peterson does a great job at explaining the material and giving several examples which is why his lectures are typically the full amount of time. He is always willing to help you - you just have to ask for it. I would take him again if I had to take the next class up.

By far one of the best professor's at NKU. I have always struggled with STAT and after taking him, I finally get it! Assignments weekly to take home (DO THEM). As long as you do your hmw, go to class (important), and study weekly you should be fine. He is clear, and I love the notes he provides to the class, really helpful. Recommend him for sure.

If stats is mandatory for your major (like it was for mine) then you need to take him. He explains everything so well and in-depth. He makes guided notes available to student so they can follow along. I personally really enjoyed this class and I am by no means a good math student!

Mel is awesome! I really struggle with math and had to take this class for my major, he was so helpful and made things easier to understand. He makes study guide notes that are used in class so the book is really only needed for homework questions, I just purchased an access code and no book. He helped me via email and in person before most classes

He's very genuine, the material is tough but it's stats so that is expected. I failed the first time I took the class with a different professor and I'm doing better the second time around with him. He's a good dude.

His class has guided notes, which makes it a lot easier to study for exams -which reflect what the notes are, so it's super easy if you just look over it a couple of times. Do the suggested homework that he gives because it better prepares you for the test.
He is always there when you need help. Sometimes he contradicts himself, so sometimes you don't know which version of the story you should go with.

The class is hard in general... but it helps that he is very passionate about statistics! There are A LOT of quizzes! They are worth 20 points and usually about 6 questions on them so they are easy to fail! Just study and you will do fine. He is ALWAYS willing to help! Attendance isn't graded but you want to go. Learn a lot of new things each class

If there is a word to describe Mel Peterson, it's competent and I mean this in the best way possible. This is a professor who is always prepared for lecture and puts the time into making sure his course work is polished and fits the content from lecture. As a student, you will still need to try in order to get the grade you want.

First advice, follow his guided notes because they really do help. I had a C+ for my midterm; but after using his notes for the rest of semester I ended up with a B even though I got an A at the final test. GO TO CLASS because if you miss 1 is a lot to catch up. It is not easy at all but he is  very helpful in and outside class. He has a cute smile
Great professor! He really takes the time to make sure the entire class understands before moving on.
Wonderful professor. Never left class unclear of what was expected. Homework was sometimes challenging but never over the top. Easily can get a good grade as long as you attend class and do homework!

First term of his working at NKU, Fall 2011, was really a hard grader and all the homework problems were manadotry. He was clear, and most of his quizzes and tests were curved up by him due to students' low grade. In his classes, he does ask for a project or a report. Upon all of that, he was an awesome guy, indeed.
Excellent teacher, if not one of the best Statistics teacher. As long as you attend class and pay attention you shouldn't have too much difficulty with the class

Great stats professor! I am terrible at math and stats and got an A in his class. If you attend class, take notes, do the homework assignments and go to his office for help, you will definitely understand the material and get a good grade.

Mr. Peterson is very helpful and can meet with you if you have any issues.  You can tell he really enjoys the subject he teaches which is a good quality in a professor.  Go to class - that's important with this class, and make sure you do the homework and understand everything because the material is cumulative.

One of the best profs. ever. Pretty easy class if you attend each class. He uses study guides with blanks to fill which makes this class very easy. I hate STA, but this prof. made it VERY easy. You won't use the book. You will use a lot STATCRUNCH. Start fast with your project and you will get extra points. I love this professor.

Mr. Peterson is a great teacher!! He's also a really nice guy and knows how to teach the material so his students understand it. I haven't opened my textbook once this semester because he teaches the material so well in class. He also provides guided notes which really helps you understand the material.

Best math teacher I ever had! He actually made math make sense to me which is something that hasn't really happened before. He used guided notes which were extremely helpful. He always answered all questions. I was able to get by without the book but if you like extra practice get the book.

Dr. Peterson was the best teacher I have had thus far at NKU.  He is just a great teacher, he understands the real world and doesn't ask you to memorize countless equations. His basic teachings are to make sure you understand. If you can, take his class over other NKU teachers.
Great prof, extremely clear and a good guy

2nd time taking STA 205. Went in thinking I would fail, again. Surprisingly Prof Peterson helped me understand stats, which is incredible because I literally didn't know what a p-value was in my last class! If you have the chance, TAKE HIM! he is so into his lectures you can't help but listen and understand!

Professor Peterson was a good professor, but I was never able to wrap my head around his style of teaching. He was always willing to answer questions outside of class and made sure we had the resources to pass if we wanted to use them.

Grades only come from quizzes and exams, however they are easy to pass if you follow his guided notes and do the practice problems. The practice problems are totally optional, but I wouldn't have passed without them. He is amazingly nice and is always willing to answer questions. I was terrified to take a math class, but he made it worthwhile.

I'm alright at math for the most part, but I HATED Mel's class. For the most part he was super friendly and everything, but not the best professor. Classes seemed to drag on, and it was super hard to keep interest.

Fantastic professor. Has a clear and organized course curriculum. Attendance is not mandatory but you may be confused if you miss class; shoot him an email if you need notes you missed. Practice problems are not graded (take advantage of them if you need help tho) but he does assign short take home quizzes that are simple and can boost your grade.

Dr Peterson has tons of experience working with stats. Hes passionate for both statistics and teaching. Hes a nice guy, but tends to talk pretty fast. If you get lost you may have trouble keeping up. Honestly if youre not gifted in math, I wouldnt recommend him only because he expects students to know quite a bit even if they never learned it
My favorite professor so far! Very willing to help if you don't understand something and just overall a great person!

He only gives paper tests and gives no extra credit. I wish I sat in a better seat because his lectures are all important. He helps during office hours so don't stress too much. Math can get difficult but he has guided notes and everything he says will be filled there.
He was a great professor but couldn't make the class any easier.

He's amazing! Very professional and easy to understand, homework isn't mandatory and he is very willing to help if you are confused. He always lets you use a formula sheet on quizzes and tests which makes the class 100 times easier.

If you have the chance to take Mel for stats then absolutely do it! He is a great professor. There are a lot of quizzes, but that's because he teaches materiel and then tests you on it instead of jamming it all into one large test. Definitely helps with midterm and finals. He has guided notes which are necessary to pass imo.

I never rate my professors on here but so many people complain about stats. I feel like I need to explain how great of a professor he is. The guided notes help soooooo much and his lectures are long but interesting because he worked for P&G and brings in real world perspectives on why were learning that particular content. By far the best prof

He is very accessible outside of class and gives options for you if for some reason he isnt available. I somehow passed and am terrible at all math. He doesent offer extra credit and gives take home quizzes each week. Great professor but I suggest finding a study buddy and dont go at this class alone.
Loves stats and makes it very easy to learn! great professor take him if you get the chance.

I would take him again. Stats is just hard altogether and it is hard to teach. Print his guided notes. If you miss class a lot, it will be hard to teach yourself the content. He was a nice guy. A lot of in-class assignments which are easy 100's. A lot of in-class quizzes and take-home quizzes.

I am glad he was my professor for STA 212. He was willing to help and his examples in lectures were very helpful for tests. The tests and final were quite hard, and he can be a tough grader, but overall not too bad. I would definitely not skip class if you want a good grade.

I don't like the way he explains things, and our first exam (midterm) was a lot harder than the practice problems we were given for it. Also there was not enough time to complete all of the problems, although he did give a small curve to try to compensate for it.

I am a lost cause at Math and he was always willing to help me. LOVED the content, got kind of wrapped up in it during his lectures. Difficult tests. But again, always willing to help if you show your effort in attendance and assignment completion.

If you have never taken a statistics course before,  I would not recommend taking him for Stats 205. He moves very fast and gets too in depth with the work. His tests are difficult compared to the other assignments and he's a tough grader. None of the tests are open book/notes. He made this course the hardest class I have ever taken.

A lot of people thought he was impossible but the class really isn't that bad. His lectures are full of examples. The homework is just like the examples and the tests have problems like the examples!! Just do your work and study your notes and you will do good in his class!!

1. This class is difficult, especially after the first few chapters 2. Go to class and pay attention. His class is just lectures and examples on the board 3. He isn't very approachable but NKU tutoring helps 4.  16.7% of your final grade is just homework the rest is based off his Exams so do well on them 5. Don't take this class
Hard to follow. Would not take any of his classes again.

Dr. Agard is sweet and cares about his students. The largest problem is he hold your hand for too long so that when the test or quiz comes, you're lost. The tests were very difficult and required hours of studying.

Mostly lectures, homework is typically take-home assignments, but no MH HW or anything too tedious. Uses Canvas. Tests are just like the study guides, but they are long tests, so you must study. Takes forever to get back to you on emails, or just simply wont get back to you at all. Receive extra credit for coming to class, so thats a + to take him
Ive never really been good at math but Dr. Agard was a good professor and he made everything really clear. Attendance isnt mandatory but unless youre really good at math I dont suggest skipping.
very quiz and test heavy. isnt great with canvas. only lectures

He is the best professor I have ever had. While his accent is a little thick, you will more than likely be able to overcome it. He is always willing to give extra help during office hours or even during class to help you understand.

He is the best prof. I've ever had. He's not easy but he will help you with anything you need. He's hilarious too, always talking about grandma and how much he loves candy. You'll get past his accent after the 2nd week.. if not, then you should probably drop. 10/10 def recommend him.
If you already struggle with math, do not take this class because he will make you that much more confused.

If you have trouble comprehending math, do NOT even attempt a class with DK. He may think he is helping you, but he will actually make things 100% harder on you. You will have a quiz every class, with 2-5 minutes to do it, and when working on problems in class, if you do not know the answer when called on he will degrade you. DON'T TAKE HIM.

although Dr. DK does have a thicker accent, you'll be able to understand him well within the first couple of weeks. there are quizzes randomly throughout the week, and attendance is taken everyday. he is super funny and one of my favorite instructors i've had this semester. he loves candy and just has such a huge smile on his face everyday.

DK was great! If you pay attention in class it's very easy. I didn't study much at all and got A's on every test. His tests just repeat his quizzes, so study/understand those and you'll be fine. My only problem is that he didn't post grades on BB so you never knew what your class grade was. He'd tell you if you emailed him, but didn't respond fast.

This was my first class with DK, and he is hilarious. I found this class to be pretty easy, although I know some people really struggled. We had group projects/assignments every week or two and he grades them critically. He put up note packets for every topic which we used in class, which was extremely helpful.
