This is a very interactive class!

GREAT Professor. I would definitely take him again. Although he doesn't collect homework, if you don't solve the practice questions, you probably won't pass. Always asks students to come work through their difficult problems during office hours, he gives out candy too!

If you are not good at math and still can't understand him after the first week or two, just drop the class. He is a great person just not a good professor. He did not hand out any worksheets other than the formula and table sheets. All the other notes you got came from his in-class notes. His exams are very hard! He gives no extra credit

Dr DK was so confusing at first,his accent was kind of a barrier but i got used to it. after the first exam, i started liking his classes , they became very easy and he was always there to help you out. i was always looking forward to his classes. always show interest in class and outside class, that way he would be willing to help.
He can be kind but then he can be very hard to understand. He is a very tough grader. I would not take his class

He is very hard to understand and he expects everyone in the class to understand the very first time he teaches it.  If you don't understand a problem, raise your hand and tell him so, or else he won't go over it again and it will be on the exams

He is the worst professor. His accent makes him so hard to understand. He vaguely explains everything, and just expects you to know it already. I also tried to contact him NUMEROUS times to receive extra help and he never contacted me back. I would definitely try to switch  professors if you could.

Okay first off DK is very hard to understand. Yes, he does have a very strong accent which makes it difficult. One thing students on here ned to know is that he is by far the best professor I've had at NKU. Even though it is difficult to understand him, If I needed any type of help he was there. He would make sure I understood every aspect of it.
Hard to understand because of accent Moves way too fast- doesn't explain things slow enough Quizzes 1-2 times a week

Moves super fast, no real time to get good feedback from him. Often marks off things on tests & quizzes with little more than a squiggle of red pen for "feedback" (if it can be called that). Will give out bonuses for things like bringing in Halloween candy or getting a higher score on Test 2 than you did on Test 1 (shows improvement I assume).

This professor for me was horrible. He is hard to understand, pretends to available outside of class when, his only hours are from 6am-8am, (which is almost impossible to make if you have a job, and even if you do go to them he will find any excuse to send you away, you dont get something, do this this go away, I would avoid this class

take this class if you want an F he is the worst professor in  my life very cant understand his English he is very impatient and he is a tough grader when he teaches you and you ask a question then he will tell you to stop wasting his time, I dont like him
Absolutely horrible! Makes the class way more difficult than it is. Would not take a class with him again.
Very clear lectures and teaches everything from very basic.
Only one piece of advice, DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASSES at all costs if you want to pass! There are way better professors in NKU.
horrible

Great professor who knows what he's doing and wants you to succeed. He's clear about what he wants and doesn't give confusing questions on quizzes or tests. Don't skip class, pay attention, and you'll pass easily.

He has an accent but once I really focused on what he was saying, it was easy to understand him. This was a very difficult class for me because I am not a traditional student. He was very interested in helping us understand and get a good grade. He was always available to help before class. He is a great professor! He always has chocolate too :)

I would not take a course with him. He teaches STA314 as if everyone is a stats major, but the class is for many different people. He is a super tough grader that takes off points for seemingly random things. He is never clear with what he wants in projects and never gives a rubric.
Mr. Huber is awesome! Teaching Skill = A+ explains everything in an understandable manner. Challenging class but he is MORE than helpful!

Probably the biggest waste of my time. I worked incredibly hard and got mediocre grades. I'm an "A" student, and this professor destroyed my GPA. Avoid this man at all costs. Very tricky test and very wordy. Try Dr. Fernando, she is the best. Here you need a good phy background or being one of his favorite students. Horrible experience.

Amazing class. He makes physics very down to earth with tons of real world examples and really knows his stuff. Tests are a little on the hard side but his quizzes are curved and are just like the actual test. Plus, he gives a bunch of handouts and examples to get you more than ready. Always more than willing to help anyone with anything. Take him.

Huber is an amazing teacher.  His class is perfectly constructed, every single quiz, lecture, or homework assignment directly correlating and preparing you for the test.  I'm terrible at math, but Huber makes it a breeze.  Honestly, this is probably one of the best professors you can take, I highly recommend him.

Prof Huber is one of the BEST professors ever...seriously!!! He makes things easy to understand. He is so incredibly helpful and his self-deprecating humor makes class fun and enjoyable! I would recommend him to anyone!!!

Professor Huber is the real deal. I have NEVER had a professor that is more passionate about the material he is teaching, and it carries through to the students. I was also blown away by his eagerness to help students. I would wholeheartedly encourage anyone to take him, for any class.
amazing. he was very willing to help. he actually helped teach me calculus as well. GREAT PROF. his tests were hard but fair. highly recommend his class.

One of THEE best professors I've had. He does everything he can to ensure his students do as well as they can. He will go out of his way to make sure that he is readily available whenever needed. Very responsive to emails and his door is always open. Take this professor if the opportunity is there... even if you have to drop another class.

If you care about your GPA then, DO NOT TAKE ANY PHY COURSE WITH HIM. Basically, he thinks we only have his class, nothing else. Tests are bloody hard you got to study the book along with the notes, labs, and the homework. If you have any other option, then you better run.

Professor Huber is by far the most helpful professor I have ever had. If something doesn't make sense, he will do whatever he can to help you. He responds to emails more quickly than any professor I have ever had. His tests can be difficult, but he's always willing to help. I would absolutely recommend him.
Great Professor--Highly recommend him!

Prof Huber really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. If something isn't clear to you he will try to explain right away and if you still don't get it he has great office hours. Great teacher

He is understanding. He worked with me greatly during office hours to review for exams, only wish I would've done it for the first exam. His system for clickers shows an understanding of college student budgets (Extra credit for having it the last class) We didn't use the lab workbook much for the price. Quizzes and tests are the worst parts.

Wonderful professor, if you have to take any biology labs, definitely attempt to take her! She's an amazing help and make all her labs fun and interesting. I'll look forward to taking a class with her again. (:
Her lab is hard, but it is totally doable. You just have to work at it, but you will learn a lot
Expect tests where the material wasn't covered in lab. She's a very nice person, just wouldn't take her as a professor again.
Very nit-picky grader. If your answer is not what she wants, it's wrong. Great person outside of class. Not my first choice for a professor.

She was helpful throughout the semester. She will constantly come by your group to make sure you don't need any help, if you ever do, she is clear and helpful. You will cover a lot of material and she puts a lot of short answer questions on her exams with particularly wordy answers. She expects your answers to be thorough, but is pretty lenient.

Great teacher and is very friendly. Only had her for lab but she was fantastic as a lab teacher. Test were difficult but she made it clear what was going to be on them. I look forward to taking her again.

For Lab she is fantastic, however I can tell when she reviews over slides in lab that she rushes and I could only imagine the her lecture class would be the same way. Lab though was great, she is very friendly and ready to answer questions. Would definitely take a LAB again. She is very intelligent and volunteers for cancer societies.
By far my favorite lab professor she is really helpful and has a great sense of humor to get you through the semester without dreading going to a boring lab.

Dr. Strome has a nice attitude and is very friendly.  However, she is very unclear as to what she is looking for in assignments and when you think you have done something completely you'll often receive half points off. She is a ridiculously hard grader. Not necessary to ask questions as she is very unhelpful in answering any of them.
When in doubt, write more than you think you should.  She's fun, but tough.

Strome is super funny! She is very helpful and I enjoyed going to lab! Although Strome is amazing the class is difficult. There is a lot of work that you have to put in. The notebooks are time consuming. Strome is a hard grader, she is picky, just learn what she wants from you and you will do just fine.
Absolutely horrible. Worst professor ive ever had.

Dr. Strome is the best teacher at NKU. Her course structure makes learning the material easy and fun. You work through material following lectures by answering questions in groups and Dr. Strome assists when you need it. The content is very detailed but she explains things in clear ways and is available for extra assistance. Great class!!!

She lectures all of class with close to no class participation. She attempts to apply the material to real life, but she jumps around so much in the process that she loses everyone. She could be more concise and clear when teaching a step-by-step process instead of spewing out her thoughts as they come along.

This is the worst professor I have ever had. Jumps around on material, not clear at all. When you need help she acts like you are stupid, unless you are a female then she will go out of her way to help you. Not much homework and 2 tests and a final. Tests are rough what she says are on them are not.

She was very helpful and put many examples on the board. If you show up and take the notes and study the notes, you will be fine. She gives you her office hours and she will always email you back if you have a question. I loved this course!!

She has a very heavy lecture and skips around a lot which can become confusing. If you need help, she doesn't respond to emails in a timely manner so good luck on that and try not to miss class because if you do, you will be very behind.

Online AND written homework. Tests are difficult and attendance is necessary in order to get credit for turning in homework. Lectures are long and dull. For the awful math department Xavier University has, she is fine. Do not expect much from the course.
Not too bad, but we seemed to skip around a lot in the book.
She was a good professor to have. She really enjoys the material. I actually made it out of calculus alive. It is a miracle.
Pretty good teacher. I'm not the best at math, so I worried going into this class. She will take time to help anyone and stops if anyone has any questions. Extremely nice and helpful!

I adore professor Snodgrass. She is very good at teaching and cares about her students. She is very welcoming for asking any types of questions. She is very helpful with assignments and homework. She applies the material to real world situations which makes it very understandable. I was worried to take this class at first but I enjoyed her class.

For her calculus class, there are three tests including the final (which is cumulative). She creat the tests last minute, so there is no study guide. Half the material she told us to cover on the final was not on it and it was much longer than she said it was going to be. Fails to respond to emails and post grades promptly. Sad excuse for a teacher

Good professor, very helpful when you go to office hours. She doesnt take attendance but I dont recommend missing a class unless you can understand from the reading. Many homeworks, three test, no quizzes.

Overall she is a very nice professor. She does grade homework, but she will go over any problems the following class. Tests are tough, make sure you take plenty of notes. DO NOT miss class or you will miss a lot, she expects you to know what she goes over in class on the test. She will offer extra credit but it will only be 5 to 10 points.

Really tries to connect on a personal level when teaching. Wants to relate topics to real-world scenarios so that the material is better understood. Caring and wants you to succeed. Doesnt like you to miss class but theres no professor who does. Great person and helpful.
She is really passionate. I took her at 8 am and she really connected with the class. You could easily tell that her top priority is making sure her students understand and learn.

Dr. Snodgrass was an awesome professor. She was always open to questions in class, even the most mundane and obvious ones. The homeworks can be long, but most of the questions are fairly short and straight forward. She is also extremely accessible outside of class. Nothing in this class was too hard as long as you paid some attention. Recommended.

She told us all (multiple times) she would drop 3 of the lowest graded hwk that did not include StatCrunch, and never did. She never even put my Final test grade in before they were due so I have no idea what I got on my final. After the second test her lectures got more scatter brained and hard to understand, she jumps around too much. dont skip.
Hands down one of the best math teachers I have ever had. She is truly passionate about what she is teaching & cares about her students. I would definitely take her again given the chance.

The lectures were good and easy enough to understand. The homework was always just like the lectures as well. However the exams were extremely difficult. I did well on them but they were often only 5-7 questions and the questions were very involved and nothing like the homework problems. She was very passionate but I would not take again for stats.
She tries to be difficult for no reason! Lectures didn't quite match up with test questions! Worst professor I've had since I've been here! Don't take her!

I love Dr H! She's a bubbly, awesome professor. There was a time or two where she gave us the wrong formulae in class, however for the most part she was totally on top of her game and very knowledgeable. General Ecology is a tougher class than I thought it would be, but I didn't have to work terribly hard for my A- and Dr H was always down to help.
Not the nicest professor.
Great professor! She is very passionate about the environment and her teaching reflects it. She is always bubbly and fun and makes her lectures very interesting. I really enjoyed her and her class.

I decided to take Dr. Hopfensperger's class to fulfill one of my general eds and was not disappointed. Both the lecture and the lab contained interesting activities. Be aware that there's group work, so sit with people who are will to do work. There's lots of papers, but there are clear directions on what to write. Overall, super fun and engaging.

DOESNT GIVE TESTS. She gives simple notes and the assignments are semi-difficult but nothing more than a few pages of writing. The Lab also doens't have assignments but you HAVE to be there on the field trips. A great teacher and class to really enjoy. She makes all the trips fun and engaging.

Dr. H was awesome in protecting water resources lecture and lab. I did this to fulfill my gen ed but now I'm minoring in env. studies because of her class. She doesn't give tests, which is great. However, she assigns several different assignments, but they're all relevant and relatively easy. Just make sure to thoroughly explain your thoughts.

Doesn't offer multiple choice on tests. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it helps to understand what her powerpoints mean. Her study guides aren't the most helpful because she will leave off information on them that you need to know for the test. Only a few homework assignments and she grades them easily.

Dr. H is really nice and really knows the information she teaches. If you e-mail a question to her, she gets back to you really fast. She is extremely willing to help if you ask. Her tests aren't too bad if you actually pay attention in class. Don't skip class bc the pps aren't helpful without your own notes. I definitely recommend her!

She's a nice person but her tests are ridiculously hard for a Gen Ed. Average was 67-75 per test and she never curves/gives extra credit. Very complicated/unclear in her instructions for tests and her teaching style. Definitely try to take a different course for a science Gen Ed.

Dr. H is the best prof I've had so far at Northern! She's very sweet and has adjusted well to an online format. If you watch all the lectures and take notes, then you'll do just fine in the class whether or not you're good at science. She treats her students with respect and understanding and never overwhelms us or holds us to impossible standards.

Dr. Walters is by far one of the top 3 professors I have had in my undergraduate studies.  She is very nice, teaches thoroughly, will help if you need it, and makes her lectures interesting/exciting.  I highly recommend her. also attend class and understand the graphs/major concepts.

She is an amazing professor! Follows syllabus to the tee. Very friendly, knowledgeable, and fun. Grades fairly. This class was pretty easy if you go to class and take notes. I highly recommend taking Dr. Walters!

Dr. Walters is my favorite professor that I've had at NKU in all 4 years I've been here.  She is extremely knowledgeable and friendly.  Her classes are very straightforward - no tricks or lack of communication. Lenient grader. Seems to just really want her students to learn and enjoy class. Take ANY class you can with her, you won't regret it!

Dr. Walters is an incredible person. She loves what she teaches and her job, and this is clearly evident in her teaching style. She lectures a lot, but her lectures were easy to follow and she will answer any questions and is happy to meet with you after class if you need a concept clarified. I recommend taking any class you can with Dr. Walters.

Dr. Walters is a great professor. She likes her job and takes it seriously, while being kind and helpful. If you take the 151 course, do get the Rust book, as it will help you a lot. She took time to give us all helpful feedback on our lab reports. She also taught us on ANOVA and T-tests in a way that was more clear than by other professors.
Excellent class with great lectures. Would definitely take again.

Dr. Walters is my favorite professor at NKU. She loves birds and is an excellent teacher. The classes I've taken with her have always been challenging but fun and interesting. She paces the work so you can learn it better. If you want to learn to be a better birder, take BIO407! It will probably be my favorite class taken at NKU.

Dr. Walters is very nice and keeps lectures interesting.  She uses powerpoints and clickers to help clarify her points.  Her con is that, if you don't read the chapter, you're screwed.  Some of her exam questions are difficult to understand, but it could just be me.  I would definitely recommend her.

If u are a foreign, ur dead here. DON'T choose her. You need a STRONG background in Bio to survive her and a perfect English, she speaks very fast. Test are too tricky, MC, you don't use the book. She is nice and helpful but she looks to trick you in her tests. PP slides are very helpful, but they won't be enough. Look for a tutor after each class.
She is nice, and will slow down if you ask, will meet with you anytime, just ask! feedback is immediate! SHE IS A GOOD PROFESSOR. I don't like evolution tho!

I absolutely loved Dr. Walters. Her online lectures with built-in questions were very helpful for lecture review. She explains the material very well and I would 100% take her class again. She will also answer any questions you ask with patience, and she offers a lot of resources.

I really loved Dr. Walters, I had her for both BIO 150 and BIO 150 Lab. She is super passionate about what she does, and works hard to make sure you understand the material. The course is hard, but she is super accessible for questions and extra help outside of class. Take her if you can, you won't regret it.

You have to show up for class but her classes aren't super boring or lecture-based and actually help you better understand the subject. She cares about what her students want to learn about or discuss and I took a lot away from this class that I can actually use in the real world.

Dr. Walters is an amazing professor. She does a great job explaining concepts and answering any questions. The lectures are sometimes long, but that is because there is lots of content to cover in Biology. Overall, I would recommend this professor she does her best to help you succeed.

I wouldn't have gotten through Biology... actually school without her. If you fail it's your fault, she is super approachable and helpful. She is very clear when it comes to what she wants from you and when she is teaching her strong subjects (Animal Behavior, Ornithology) she really shines.

Dr. Walters was my favorite professor this semester. She really made the effort to make sure her students were understanding the content. While she was strict, she was caring and understanding. She possesses all the qualities I could ever want in a professor

Dr. Walters is an amazing professor. She truly cares about every one of her students. I'm so grateful for her taking the time to explain everything and making sure to answer student's questions as best as she can. Just make sure you don't skip class or you will fall behind quickly.

Dr. Walters is one of the best bio professors you can have. She wants you to do well and is always willing to help in any way she can. Don't be afraid to ask questions, and make sure you show up to class. Bio 150 is not an easy class but I am thankful I had a professor who could explain things well.
Lab was definitely better than lecture. Sometime the group you were assigned wasnt great, but she was nice enough

Dr. Walters is amazing! She made a 5 pm lab worth going to. She is passionate about her studies and wants success for her students. She grades quickly and gives feedback. I highly recommend taking her!
Dr. Walters is one of the nicest professors at NKU. She really cares about her students. She is also very organized.

She is a sweetheart. She uses Sapling for homework which was not too bad. The biggest thing I would say is study for your exams and make sure the assignments she gives you are correct. For lab she was very nice and energetic making it fun.

I don't care if other students take him or not but just be warned that you will most likely NEVER use the books he assigned you at the beginning of the semester. very opinionated. our class was very close due to disliking him in unison

This class was very easy, and very discussion oriented. There were no tests, just 4 assignments and a project. He assigns reading, but I never did it. He's very nice, though, and as long as you show up to class and do the assignments it's very easy to get an A.

Dr. Oswald is a great professor who cares about his students; he does not baby them. With the caveat that his classes are honors classes (therefore not geared toward a specific major), they are extremely interesting for strengthening one's general knowledge. Definitely recommended if you're interested in discussion about science.
He was a great professor! Easy grade, discussion class, and lots of fun. Definitely will be taking him again.

Dr. Oz is a good prof! He's also an all around good guy. He's in the honors program so his classes are very discussion based, not difficult. When it comes to assignments he lets you know exactly what he wants and grades fairly. Do the work, try and be involved and you'll do well. Currently in his 301 and 394 classes. I'll be taking him spring too!
In this class we took trips to the zoo for a big research project.  There were a few homework assignments that were in essay form.  Dr. Oswald was very helpful and I enjoyed his class.

There was no textbook and no tests- just mini projects that you worked on with a partner or two. The workload was very manageable and Dr. Oswald was always willing to help. He made a seemingly boring class interesting and I enjoyed it a lot. :)

Wants you to know syntax for coding and write a web page on paper for tests.  It doesn't make sense to me; when will you be writing html on paper and w/o internet access to find out the exact syntax?  Also he doesn't have office hours, so if you have questions you have to ask before/after class.  That's hard to do for projects.

probably one of the best programming professors you will find, able to explain programming concepts in plain english, very up to date on technology (unlike many professors), awesome class glad i took it with him teaching

Very difficult class, but Alex makes it fun and he is always helpful. He emails back fairly quick. He is such a sweet heart and is very understanding. He definitely knows what he is talking about, as he programming background is boss. Overall, his class is the one to take if you want to learn.
Great guy.  Snarky sense of humor.  Fun labs.
Knowledgable and friendly.  Very patient.  You can tell he loves to teach and interact with students.  Great instructor.

He is a great teacher and a total sweetheart. He is extremely helpful. Since I did NOT know anything about programming, the projects and exams were very hard for me. I believed if I had an other professor I would had failed. I would definitely recommend him to anyone and everyone!!!
I had absolutely zero programming experience coming into this class, but I did very well. He might not seem super friendly and approachable at first, but he's actually really nice.
Instructor is very confusing. Does not provide examples. Does not know how to teach. Assignments are too challenging. Avoid if you can.

Absolutely horrible.  Difficult to understand, has little concern for student education/potential, and focuses on aspects of the material that are common knowledge.  Lacks preparation and gives very little guidance to expectations on assignments.

Tests are ridiculous.  She does not test on what you know.  She tries to trick you.  When the student approaches her with a descrepancy, she will not give even when proven wrong. She is very defensive.

Extremly difficult personality. When showning her in the book where the informaiton is she still would never consider her information being wrong. The examens are very difficult to understand and reason the right answer. Would not recommend her as a professor.

Has no order to her slides what-so-ever which makes following along in class very difficult. Test reviews are not very helpful and trying to get an appointment with her to go over your tests is nearly inpossible.

RUN AWAY FAST. She is the worst teacher I've ever had in my entire life. She constantly contradicts herself and makes no sense. Her test questions come from nowhere. She is defensive and rude and hates when people ask questions. She is a psych nurse and doesn't even know her own subject. I could go on and on. SERIOUSLY DON'T TAKE HER.

This class is probably super easy in the fall or spring. I took the summer class, so it was a little more challenging since we only had 3 weeks. The assignments are very interesting and fun though, and Dr. Cecil is nice and has a good sense of humor. Don't buy the book, you don't ever use it. Even Dr. Cecil will tell you not to buy it.
This was a pretty easy class, only one exam the entire semester. Although you do have projects you have to do, most are group projects. Overall she is a fun, easy, and helpful professor.

Luci makes sure you know she doesn't want to be in class so it is a major drag.  She can be somewhat funny but is VERY dry.  She never tells you exactly what she wants so try to talk to people who have taken the class before.  The final exam is cake.  Lots of assignment - all are very easy if you know what she expects from you.
Truly love her! Very nice person. She is always helpful and the class is interesting!

She's a nice professor and the assignments are easy, but there is one exam and it is not easy, I studied the material for 4 hours straight and failed.  The questions have more to do with silly statistics that you don't even think to look at, so be sure to study that as well as the material she gives you.

I've had every comp. science teacher for at least one class, and he is the best of them all BY FAR. He has a way of teaching that is different...you WILL learn, and you'll wonder why you thought programming was so hard before. He has a great attitude, is always willing to help, and if you do your part and try to learn, you will pass easily.

Ryan was a really great professor. Whenever the content got more challenging, he was always willing to help myself and other students with whatever questions they had. Communicates great over email, and provides plenty of opportunities to get an A. He even offers online lectures if you don't want to physically attend class. Great teacher and person

He is one of the best professors I have had in my college career. He brings his real world experience to his lectures and teaching style, instead of just presenting the material. He makes all of his own assignments, so he can effectively help you understand. He is usually the last one to leave after he makes sure everyone who needs help gets it.

Wonderful professor. He is a great teacher, incredibly caring, and has very interesting lectures and assignments. He truly wants to see his students do well in the class. I learned a ton in this class and it was very easy because of Professor Lehan. Best one I've had at NKU. If you get the chance, take him for sure.

Great professor, highly recommend, 1 coding assignment a week about, you will actually learn the material.  Test aren't really difficult, just make sure u understand the code and how it works and know things he goes over in class.  I wish he taught more classes.

Best adjunct professor I have ever had and one of the best professors overall. Very clear, very easy to understand. Makes learning easy even though it is not always easy material. Great assignments that build on previous assignments. He expects good work for a good grade, but it you put the work in, it is not hard. Highly recommend.
Great teacher. He'll give you a letter of recommendation at the end of the term if you ask. He is very lenient and I think he really likes teaching.
Good teacher nice guy but is stuck teaching a useless class

David rushes through lectures even though he uses the entire allotted time. Seems to have some time management issues. Takes way long to grade projects and doesn't review his tests or quizzes before he gives them (straight from the book). The class itself is interesting, I just wish there was someone passionate teaching it.

Not organized, not helpful, and if you were confused he told you to go to the tutoring center. We took quizzes on chapters before the lecture. Quizzes were the only reason to attend class. His lectures are painfully boring, never engaged the class, and rushed through the slides. Went off on tangents too often and never really clarified his points.

A good professor will meet students halfway with the learning process.  They assume some of the responsibility for the students learning the material.  This professor is the exact OPPOSITE.  He makes you read a chapter, we take a quiz on that chapter at the beginning of class, and he then gives the lecture on that chapter. COMPLETELY BACKWARDS!

I took this class as an online class and it was fairly easy. I've taken tons of security courses so most of this class was a refresher. David posts online lectures that are easy to follow as well as most assignments. TestOut modules are straightforward.

Dr. Renaker has lots of industry experience and uses it to tell great stories during his lectures. Unfortunately the lectures do not always reflect what is on tests, but hearing about all the wild things he's dealt with during his career makes the classes worth it. Just make sure to review the textbook and slide decks before tests.

Unclear grading criteria, you will find out when finals come around. He also uses lockdown browser so thats quirky. His lectures are long rambling over PowerPoints and he randomly assigns in class assignments worth like 10 points. Please take this course online if you can. His lectures are a drag.
There isn't enough space
She is great!!! So helpful and made the class much more enjoyable.

Great Professor! She really pushes you that extra bit to perform the skill with precision. She can be a tough grader but it will pay off in the end. Also had her for 215- very easy exams and great enthusiasm in the classroom. Definitely recommend! (PS: DONT BUY THE 210 SKILLS BOOK!)
Had her for 215 and 220L.  Very helpful and easy to talk to.  Wants you to do well so she is a hard grader but still puts things very straightforward.

Julie is a really fun professor! Very to the point and direct in her teaching. I do agree with others when they say she's a hard grader, because she is. But, if you study and know the content, then everything will be okay! Overall really great!
hard class for me, but she made it better. she is very accessible outside of class and wants you to do well

She is great for 210L (skills lab), 215 (fundamentals) and 339L (clinical reasoning I). She is super sweet and really explains everything so you actually know the rationale behind things, not just memorization of information. I highly recommend her for any nursing class.
Julie is very helpful! She makes this class fun but you do need to be there everyday. Would recommend taking her!!

She is very willing to help and her classes are so much fun. Very polite and respectful even out of class. However we spent a lot of time before class prepping for quizzes. Class would have been perfect without those quizzes

Her lectures were quite lengthy and she would often talk around the subject. When she was talking on subject, I found it helpful to take notes over everything she said. For exams, make sure to study the objectives and go through the PowerPoints. It's not a hard class, but don't slack off or it'll be hard to catch back up.
Very boring lectures and attendance is taken daily! But easy A, her "practice" questions are basically the test questions plus maybe 2 or 3.

It's a boring lecture class but not that hard. She puts up practice questions for exams and about more than half the practice questions are on the exam but you should still study because there are only exams, no quizzes, or homework, and some extra credit opportunities. I also didn't use my textbook at all. I do recommend her to anyone.

This class was the best! I really liked the way prof. Blocksom taught, She had highlighted questions in her slide shows that more than likely will appear on on the test, her first two tests are difficult, the last 3 are pretty easy, I got a B- in the class! She was very helpful when needed.

I liked her as a person, but I did not do well in her class. She does give some of the questions for the test in her powerpoints, which is helpful. However, I feel that it's hard to know what to study. I'm a straight A student & I could only manage a 78. This type of class was not fit to my learning style, but maybe different for others.
Make sure you have an ipod or smartphone to play on, because this class is boring. The content is interesting, but she is the kind of teacher that puts you to sleep.

This class is based on exams ONLY so make sure you study! Her class is very boring as a whole; you do the same thing EVERYDAY! The info that could be learned in this class is very interesting if you can see past the boringness of the class. I am typically an A student but I struggled to keep a B. PS there is NO point in getting the required book
Tests all online but pretty specific questions. Have to listen in class because the online notes are pretty useless

Get prepared to have word for word read to you all class long from a slide show...every single class. Oh, and if you ask a question, she will reply with, "Well the book says this, but really I think it should be this, because..." It's an easy grade though- the exams are online and can be taken with your book.
Easy, online test are easy, one assignment all year, its easy. Yeah, shes boring as hell though!

All four exams were online. Assignment guidelines were clear. Extremely boring lectures. I skipped class all semester and passed with a 96. My roommate took it this semester though, and now she only lets you miss 12 classes. Doesn't care if you use laptops or phones during class. Overall, very easy class.

Marla is amazing. She lectures very well, gives at least two examples for each different problem, goes over the past lecture at the beginning of class, hands out worksheets for practice, and sometimes gives us take-home quizzes where we can use our own notes. Stats is a tough subject, and she does an excellent job teaching it.

She is a very sweet lady but a horrible teacher. She constantly had spelling mistakes on the notes, stops reminding you about the homeworkquizes after the first week, and is an extremely harsh grader. I failed the class with a 69.4. If you are looking for a good teacher to help you out along the way, look somewhere else.

I had a perfect attendance rate, but still that didn't help. Lectures made zero sense and when I told her several times that I needed help, our schedules conflicted. She refused to go out of her way to help me, even though if it wasn't for her students, she wouldn't have this job. She  laughed at me when I showed frustration. Wouldn't recommend!
The math itself was far too easy, but she explains multiple ways which can be confusing to non math people.
Super nice, and very helpful. When I had her, she gave us study guides for the exams and they were pretty indicative of what to expect from the exams.

She is a very kind educator and has a true passion for math. The material can be confusing if you do not have a strong background in mathematics, but she is willing to help. She gives study guides that really prepare you for the exams and the homework is typically harder than the material on the exams, which can be helpful.

She is honestly one of the most confusing professors I've ever had. She gives too many ways to do a problem so you just end up getting more confused. Not very helpful on homework assignments. I should have dropped the class when I had the chance.

The class material is not very complicated, but out of class practice is essential. She can get wrapped up in lecture and confuse some students, but usually attempts to rectify the concerns. There is a group assignment almost every week, so attendance is mandatory(they are not announced). Points on these cannot be made up. DO EXTRA practice problems
She is very unclear with explaniations. Very unapprochable. Borning. Class is not fun at all. You wont laugh once unless it is at her. You would be better off with a diffrent professor.

Her tests never applied to  what was on the study guide.  She can be rather confusing when speaking and not very good at wording her problems.  She is a very nice person and made her self available outside of class.

Marla is a great professor. She does move pretty fast, but I think the people that complain about her & say she's a bad professor are the ones who are too lazy to put the work in. It's a lot and she has a lot of deadlines but she's just preparing you for your life after college. She really knows what she's talking about & helps outside of class.

I had never taken a statistics class before college and ended up doing very well in this class. Marla is a very good professor who will help you if you need it and is also very good at explaining the material. If you put in the effort you will do fine in her class.

This class was mostly lecture based, and required teaching yourself material - there were approximately 150 people in the class, and the class consisted of filling in blanks on a "note packet" we had to print out. There was a lot of homework, usually videos/quizes/problems. As long as you show up to class and do the work, you should be fine.

Be prepared for homework that will possibly take you a while to do. She is a very kind professor, responds very quickly, and is very intelligent. She will help you at any hour of the day as long as you reach out to her. She makes a pretty difficult class somewhat easier.
Extremely helpful, she makes sure you understand everything

Marla is amazing and I couldn't imagine there being a better stats teacher. She makes everything she teaches so clear and easy to understand. As long as you listen, take notes, and study your notes before tests it will be very hard not to receive an A.
Wonderful teacher, very helpful and thorough, subject is pretty easy, and she is always there when you need it.

Marla is great. She's very clear and uses a free online textbook. I'm still not entirely sure if attendance is mandatory but I recommend going if you want to understand everything. Very easy content and she teaches it very well. Goes quickly over the last lesson before moving on to that day's content.
Easy class but I'd avoid taking this professor if I had the chance to do it again.

Brags about income. She can't spell-- incorrect word usage (constantly). The class "hurts her feelings" when they put their books away 1 minute before class ends (literally- 1 minute). Spends 5 minutes ranting about how hurt she is. Grades poorly-- she has low comprehension if you don't write everything using her EXACT words on tests and quizzes.
Marla is very nice. She is 100% willing to answer all questions and even retach some material.

She's really nice and sweet but her teaching is confusing. She'll teach kind of easy examples in class and then on tests and quizzes the questions will be way harder and confusing. Also teaches different ways of solving which is also very confusing. HW is online which sucks and attendance isn't mandatory but if you skip you will miss a ton.

Marla is always willing to help students. Statistics was a struggle. My only complaint is how she refused to offer extra credit. I felt like I wasn't accomplishing anything. She received notifications from the tutor that I was going 2-3 times EVERY week. She didn't take it into consideration when it came to grades.
Most difficult class I have taken throughout my entire university career. I strongly do not recommend this professor.

She was a very hard grader. My math papers would "bleed." Does not take attendance, which can be a good or bad thing. Does not offer extra credit. I only recommend if student does well in Math. If student usually does poorly in Math, then I would avoid her class.

Marla is awesome! She is very nice and helpful. The tests were fairly simple if you paid attention in class and took notes. She puts guided notes on blackboard which are helpful. I thought the class was fun and educational. Attendance is mandatory but not boring.
She took pride on having high standards. Would not recommend her.

Marla seems like a great person, but when it comes to teaching statistics she is definitely not a professor I would take again. There is NO extra credit, the hw is online, making it more difficult to complete, and what she teaches in class is never the same way she puts it on the test.

I think Marla is an excellent professor. The only problem I had (other than the fact that statistics in general was difficult for me) was the fact that some of the symbols and the way she set up problems look different from the setup in the homework and the textbook, sometimes making it difficult to understand andor compare to your notes.

I failed this class from a different professor the previous semester and Prof Lemmon was amazing in comparison. As long as you take notes and attend the lectures the class is very easy to be successful in. I got a 93 with Lemmon and a 43 last semester just to be clear how much better she is. She is a much easier to understand!!

She has read books on how to best educate students. The class isn't a breeze, you do have to work at it. There were a few times after a lecture that I didn't feel like I understood the material, but always after the group assignment and homework, it came together. The one time it didn't, she had extra work available which did it for me. Recommend.

Took her class online Fall 21 and she is a great teacher in terms of lectures, hw, understanding, only down side is if you dont like group work online. There is a weekly online group assignment that you have to attend via webcam to get credit for and everyone has to agree on the answers. If you pay attention you will do great!

Had to withdrawal class due to lack of help/guidance. If you are not good at taking tests you will not pass this class. Notes for weekly lectures do not correlate to homework/test. Must use lockdown browser before tests and recorded your whole room, papers you use and a picture of your ID in order to begin tests.

Everything you do is recorded and proctored, and you have to show your instructor around the entire room with a webcam. Lectures are poorly done and do not line up with the exam material. Mandatory group meetings on Friday and Saturday mornings. 350 characters isn't enough to describe all the reasons you should avoid this instructor at all costs.
Very difficult professor, very strict on lockdown browser. Will give you a zero if you even look away from the camera.

This professor is EXTREMELY unprofessional. The worst experience I've ever had in all of my years of attending college has been with ol' Lemmon here. I DO NOT RECOMMEND. Take any of your MAT courses with anyone except this person. Anyone at all.

This is the most unprofessional, most appalling, and absolute worst professor I have ever experienced. She thinks she's teaching at Harvard. It's NKU honey. She has single handedly ruined the academic experience at this school for myself and several of my friends here. DO NOT TAKE THIS INSTRUCTOR! JUST DONT!

Marla was a great professor. I took this class online which made it very difficult. She always replied to emails and was very helpful. There were 4 Tests and two homework assignments and a quiz every week.

I have ALWAYS been bad at math my entire life and this is the first time a math teacher has really taught me the material and I actually UNDERSTAND the material. HIGHLY recommend Marla. Love this woman!

Best teacher I have ever had. I have always struggled with math and was nervous about taking stats my first semester but with her help I actually understood all of the material in this course and she was very helpful. I would go to her office 1 to 2 times a week and she would sit down with me and walk me through the material. Great teacher.

Professor Lemmon was very accessible both via email and in her office. She provided lots of examples and helped when she was asked. There are groups in the class but she will move people around if necessary.
super easy as long as you pay attention during lectures

Everything in the class is webcam-ed so it makes it very difficult to feel comfortable. It is very difficult to use the information from homework and notes to the quizzes. If you are not a good test taker this class will be extremely difficult. For what the class is, she made everything harder than it should be.

He is nice but the language barrier makes it difficult to ask questions about content and receive a clear answer. Has trouble with students that have accommodations due to not understanding test set up online. Does not provide enough material to do proposals!! relies upon online to teach you about labs to do proposals and reports. Take someone else

Is very poor with technology, despite trying to use Tophat. If anything that he does not expect happens, he fails to notice fairly obvious buttons that are visibly labeled. Is very poor at understanding and answering questions asked by the students

The worst prof ever! His disorganization is hurting the most vulnerable students. His problems are written with errors, which will make you loose time at an exam. I don't mind the accent but he just reads off his slides and doesn't explain well. If you ask for help he quickly gets annoyed and assumes you're stupid and lazy.

This professor was disorganized, inconsistent with how he graded, and class was stressful. While in lab, it was hard to understand what was being asked of us and what to do, with most of the class being confused and disorganized. While this professor really does care about his students and wants you to succeed, it's hard to in this class.

Dr. Gemene was overall a good professor. While he was difficult to understand at times, he was always willing to help my lab partner and I whenever needed. If you show him respect, he will reciprocate it right back, but he does not put up with people being disrespectful during his discussions/explanations of the labs.
He is a great professor, however, only learning the lecture notes is not enough for the exam, you need to read the textbook and do homework (not mandatory).

hes hard to understand, instructions unclear.most of the time the class is confused.come to class prepared or you will get a zero. tests are difficult you HAVE to study. tests include doing experiments and calculations,no formulas are given and not open note. he's a slow grader,strict about grading. he genuinely likes chemistry tho.

Nearly impossible to understand him. You will NOT know you actual grade throughout the entirety of the course, as he chooses to grade things very late. Gets agitated easily with confused students. Lacks constructive feedback on reports. Exams are HEAVY. Avoid this professor at all costs.
He is unprepared himself. He gets confused at his own lectures. He is very heavy on grading and takes points off extremely easy. Be prepared.

Steer clear of this professor... He doesn't give enough information in the readings to do your proposals, but if you don't come prepared, you may as well just not show up. He's a tough grader who explains nothing and gets annoyed if you're completely lost. Just take a different class.

Hardly explains what we need to do for our experiment and proposal, and will proceed to give us a low grade for not understanding something he didn't clarify. He also grades extremely late, so you'll sit there and wonder what your grade is for most of the semester. Pleaseee avoid.

Has a very thick accent and sometimes has trouble figuring out how to explain things, which isn't a problem in and of itself. However, his lectures are just reading word for word off power-point slides, and the content of those slides is just copied and pasted from the book. Have to show up for pop quizzes though, so you have to go anyways.

I can tell Dr. Gemene cares about his students, but he is a horrible teacher! He spends days on easy concepts and flies through the harder content. He says he is willing to answer questions, but if you don't understand his explanation, he is easily frustrated.

Dr. Gemene is great! He is one of the most genuine ad caring professors I have had at NKU. He is very passionate about chemistry. He expects you to try in the class, despite it being 0 credits. He does have a thick accent, but if you attentively listen and are prepared for each lab, you will do great!
She is an awesome professor! She goes out of her way to help students and she's a genius! Take her if you get the chance!
I learned a lot... very patient
Great teacher!!

While she goes very fast she posts all the powerpoints. You will have to wrk hard for an a but get a lot out of class. She will work with you to make sure you pass her class if you put in the effort. Fantastic and enthusiastic prof!

sHE IS THE BEST LECTURER YOU WLL EVER GET. vERY HELPFUL AND ALWAYS WANT HER STUDENTS TO PASS. YOU WILL HAVE A LOT OF WORK TO DO IN CLASS BUT YOU WILL GET THE BETTER UNDERSTANDING IN MICRO. SHE IS THE REASON WHY I AM A MICROBIOLOGIST AT ATL.

She is a great teacher. I had her for Micro and she is by far one of my favorite professors at NKU. She is always willing to help and she is so excited about what she teaches, that it makes the class more interesting.
I enjoyed her micro class - i learned a lot even though it was very involved, somewhat difficult. Lecture was harder than lab.

great lecture professor.  Goes really fast in class but provides you with study outlines.  Exams are harder than they should be make sure you know your genus for every organism you study in class and what diseases they cause.
She is nice but is from Equador and hard to understand

Dr Allameh, is an awesome professor. He make the class really easy and if you study he material and do the homework you can easily get an A. He is knowledgeable in his field and he really knows his material. He is there every day to answer your question or help you if you need help. A+ Professor
Great teacher, know what he's taking about.you can get a good grade if you keep up :)

I've had this professor teaching me several courses. He's great in teaching his courses and interested in explaining them for several years. Truth to be said about him, his punctuality, clarity and overall fairness that he provides. Also, his type of assessments that he gives to his class is unique and beneficial in which it lets the student study.

Dr. Allameh is such a great Professor that plays an important role within the NKU campus. I have learned so many things from him. :) :)
Dr. Allameh is such a great Professor,he know the material very well, he like the student to understand and ask him if u don't understand any topic his one of the best pro in the University

Dr.Allameh knows his material very well, his class challenges you, the exams are hard but he is willing to help, he pushes you to learn by weekly HW and team work. He is great professor, and very capable in the thermodynamic , he teaches us two ways or more to solve the equations, and shows us where the trick is, the exam is hard

He tries to make unbelievably tough exams like he wants every one to get low grades. He likes to see every one begging him for understandable questions. I got to take this class with him because he is the only teacher available.
helpful and supportive.
was not that easy but the guidelines were clear. the syllabus was really organized.
Easy class. You have to learn how to do the homwork and you will get A
Easy class and helpful

Dr.Allameh has a great personality, friendly with students and very helpful in/out of class. There are 2 tests, and a final (comprehensive) all fair, but throws impossible questions! Not a big deal because he will grade you based on your rank between others or grades curving. There is in class assignment as teamwork, and a smaller homework.

Dr. Allameh is one of the best staff at NKU. His exams a little bet hard but, if u understand the TW and HW u will did well. Also, he will make a curve after each exam and, extra credit to rise your grade I took about 5  courses with him most my final grades A & B. I recommend this professor to anyone who want to learn & understand the engineering.
keeps the class engaging. He has a fair grading curve that puts you to an instant B if you show a lot of effort such as showing up for lecture or section. Highly recommended professor!
A great professor
he is good teacher

his theory exam is not easy part and you do not have enough time to solve the exam,he give some of the questions directly from the HW and the rest from the note. like the practical part since it is open book, open note and allowed you to use the Xl.
he is great professor and he gave us great advices in our senior project.

She's perfect. Make sure you go to class, because she will purposely put questions on the test because she knows others will get it wrong. I really enjoyed this class, mainly because her energy and excitement about ENV is very high. She's great and resourceful!

I'm an env science major, and this was my first environmental course; so I was nervous. She makes lectures fun by pairing off into groups to discuss, and making up ideas. You watch some really great documentaries. When you learn about soil you make edible dirt pudding! You do have 4 photo essays, but they are easy. So are tests if you study.

This is a once a week class for 3 hours. You go on a field trip almost every week to really cool jobs where you could possibly get a job with an environmental science degree. You listen to workers, ask questions, and take notes. Possibly take a hike. After each class you have to write not even a page journal on your experience. If you do that, A+!

Took many classes with her because I think she is one of the best professor at NKU. very patient and trully care for her students. It is not an easy A, because she is very picky, but it is, for sure, your best options. She has many ENV clases, try all of them with her, and your GPA will be ok.

Amazing teacher and person. She made learning about the environment super easy, you didn't have to go to class but she does take attendance. She interesting so she made it fun to sit in class, she made learning about the environment personable. She definitely has a passion for environment and that's what made this class enjoyable. super nice lady.

Pretty easy class, very simple test, just read the manual and the PP slides, TAKE note of each result of your experiments and the meaning of each thing because she will use that in her tests. Quizzes are very simple just study the main title of each topic. This was one of the most helpful and nicest professor. She is the easier one of the Bio Profs

One of the best professors I've had so far- funny, intelligent, and informational. Wonderful TEACHER. Go to every class, ask questions, and STUDY HARD. Gives you all the resources necessary to get an A.
Nice

Mrs. Wainscott is awesome!! She is super fun in class, and loves to have fun and get to know the students.  She is a little bit more personal with the students, which is awesome. I'm pretty sure she only teaches during the summer.  she holds review classes and pretty much reads straight off of the test! :) takes attendance, but isn't mandatory.

She is a "weeder teacher!"  Goes thru material for 1st exam so fast with little explination & little review.  Study every day, esp for first test!! She does goat a better pace for tests 2,3. Tests are hard, mult choice, but a fair teacher overall.

She's funny and fast-paced.  She has to go through many, many slides each class...it's a TON of material to memorize.  If you are struggling don't be afraid to ask for help, she is very helpful.  But if you don't keep up and study a lot (3-6 hrs. a week minimum), you will fall behind!  But I really liked her...she made A&P entertaining!

She does move very fast, but she knows what she is talking about! She is very interesting and keeps you laughing even in A&P! Don't be afraid to ask her questions, she is very helpful. Test come right from powerpoints, not textbook.

Probably the best professor I've ever had. She is always willing to help and definately knows what she is talking about! An A in the class is directly correlated to the amount of effort you put in. She will never be the reason for a bad grade. Lots of studying, but if you manage your time well you should get an A! Wainscott is awesome !

Absolutely love her!  She is passionate about teaching Anatomy.  Yes it's hard, it's anatomy!  She makes it very interesting and relates it to real life experiences and keeps us laughing ( she is hilarious ).  I have worked hard, studied hard, have not missed a class and I have an A.  You must put in the time to do well, regardless of the teacher.

This is Anatomy The class is hard no matter who your professor is but she is very helpful She does have a lot of students in her classes but if you have any questions you can go up to her She knows my name out of all the students and does care if you pass the class or not I have barely even opened the book because her powerpoint have all you need

Shes not a very good teacher, and coming from a freshman... DONT TAKE HER! She may know what shes talking about, but theres about 150 people in her class and she doesn't make sure you know it before she goes on.Her motto is "you get it,you get it, you don't, you don't". I don't recommend her to ANYONE ,if you want to pass BIO 208 take someone else.

She is an awesome professor! She goes though everything fast but it's not to fast to where you don't understand. USE THE NOTECARDS! These are a guide to whats is on the test. I got a 76 on the first test (didn't use them) when I took the other tests I used them and got 90's on all of them including the final. I would definitely take her if you can!

DO NOT TAKE! I took her for lab she is extremely unhelpful and when asked a direct question she contractidicts her answers. Your pretty much on your on to learn the lab. Also will take of points for the most random reasons impossible to receive 100%.
She is literally the most unhelpful professor I have ever taken. She does not answer questions or clarify questions when you ask her. I DO NOT recommend this professor.

Absolutely terrible. She doesn't teach AT all, nor does she explain the lab you're about to do.  A lot of out of class work is expected, and this is only for the lab! But don't expect her to keep track of it either. So unhelpful and unorganized. She creates the most complex, ridiculous examples for your very simple questions. Do not take her.
Dr. Simunic doesn't teach, she gives speeches using powerpoint and from there you are on your own. Frustration and misery await the next batch of her students.

Although i took her during her first semester teaching, i STRONGLY suggest not taking her. Work is abundant and help is practically absent.Expects the class to know what to do despite her not even remotely attempting to teach the subject. Grading is inconsistent.

I absolutely dread coming to this class. She barely teaches, had to have OPEN NOTE TESTS because she knew we wouldn't pass the tests and I STILL GOT Ds. This class was one of the worst experiences of college yet. I wish I dropped this class when I could.

HORRIBLE experience with her. Do not take her you will regret it. She doesn't know what she is talking about, expects a lot of work, isn't able to answer questions clearly, very unorganized, loses papers ALL the time and takes weeks to respond to e mails if you're LUCKY. Most of the time she never responds. I repeat do not take her.

First of all, she does NOT tolerate slackers in her class.  Unlike a lot of professors I had at my university, she tells the hard truths of what the real world is like.  Encourages participation out of all of her pupils and encourages you to think for yourself.  The group assignments were challenging,  but it is what it is. Very good instructor!
This was an easy online class.  No tests, only journals, discussion boards, a group project, and 1 short paper.  She is fair in grading, has a manageable workload, and is very helpful.
She  lays everything out pretty clear for you. Don't let the work build up or you'll be in a world of trouble.

This is an on-line course. First of all, if you send an email asking any questions, it takes the teacher three days to respond back. When she does respond she doesn't even answer the question that you asked. She does not teach. All she does is set up the homework assignments, which takes about twelve hours a week to complete.
excellent professor!

I had some trouble with my class submissions, and she was EXTREMELY helpful in helping me get all the assignments turned in, and she was in constant communication with me to make sure that I got everything taken care of.  She was such a huge help and a blessing!

It was a pleasure to have Professor Fry. His lectures made the concepts very clear, and he was very responsive to the needs of the class. He used the PowerPoints from the book's publisher, so I didn't end up needing to read the book. (I don't know if he'll do this in the future, so don't rely on it!) I definitely enjoyed this class.

Justin is actually an amazing professor. He's super blunt and does get annoyed easily if the class doesn't know something we went over, but he WILL go over any concept someone doesn't get because he truly cares that you learn. I didn't find him too difficult really, but that may differ by person.

Justin knows his stuff, like most people who teach these courses. However, he is probably one of the most arrogant and easily annoyed people I have met. He is quick to anger, will get upset, even slams his hand on the wall sometimes when the class doesn't understand content right away and he takes too long to grade. I would avoid him if you can.

I've had Fry before, but this semester he seemed a bit unprepared. The class doesn't have a lot in it to begin with so it wasn't very interesting to him, and that showed. He's been very slow about grading as well. I recommend taking him, but maybe not necessarily for 364.

Great professor, kind of awkward at first, but very assistive. Quick responses for any questions via email. Extremely helpful. Highly recommend this professor. Quizzes every thursday. He says it's not mandatory to come to class, but I wouldn't have been able to do it without attending his lectures.

He was a great professor. he gave labs every Wednesday and if you didn't get it he would show you and basically give you the answers. He also gave tons of extra credit which helped a lot! I would take him!

This is one of the few perfect Professors still existing on earth. I mean a Professor who takes proud on himself when everybody does well on exams, quizzes, homeworks. He will go to great extincts to make sure that you pass his class, giving you second chances, or even third chances with extra credit assignments to help you improve your grades.

DON'T TAKE ANY CLASSES WITH HIM AND DON'T TRUST HIM AT ALL. TOO MUCH  WORK , HE TOOK LONG TIME TO CORRECTION THE ASSIGNMENT AND HOMEWORK , LAB. EVERY CLASS HAS  QUIZ AND LAB, ASSIGNMENT. SOMETIMES WE HAD  2 ASSIGNMENT AND 2 LABS

If you want to learn and discuss with your professor, I would not recommend to take him. Our class is a night class which is from 6:15 to 8:45, but usually is finished at 7:45, sometimes even 7:15. He just reads the slides. And will ask you questions outside of what he teaches in the tests. Also, don't expect your assignments be graded on time
He didn't really show much interest in teaching. He pretty much just read over power point slides and expected students to know everything. He's a nice guy though.

You probably won't do well in one of his classes if you aren't prepared for class. By that I mean actually reading the book and being prepared to ask questions over things you don't understand. He does just read over the slides a lot as others have said, but if you actually ask a question over the material, he will break it down for the class.

The final exam is basically just the two tests we took throughout the semester merged in one, and if you do better on the final exam than one of those tests, you also get that grade. Since the exam was just a rip off the two tests it was easy, and boosted my grade a good amount. I ended up with a grade slightly above 100.

Probably the best option for an organic teacher at NKU, but still extremely difficult. Doesn't give feedback on the things marked wrong. You have to go out of your way to see her during her office hours to get answers.

Organic is extremely difficult but she will help you as much as she can as long as you ask for the help. She'll let you sit in her office for hours working on organic. She is super funny and nice too. I would definitely take her again.

Dr. Onorato was amazing! I took a different professor for 310 and decided to switch to her for 311 and I dont regret it at all. 311 is supposed to be harder, but I got a whole letter grade higher. She makes sure to be as clear as possible in lectures and will go back if someone doesn't understand. And her office is always open for question!

Take Dr. O! She's amazing at teaching organic and is always, always, always willing to help her students. She genuinely cares and makes sure you understand the material. (Oh, and don't let people scare you about organic. It is no where near as scary as they say.)
Dr. O is the best. If you want to do well in organic, you take her.

She is the best professor I have ever had. Organic Chemistry is the hardest class I have ever taken, but having her as a professor makes it do-able. Ask questions when you need help. She responds very quickly to emails. Her explanations are in-depth and always helpful. She is nice and pretty funny too. Definitely take her if you have the chance!!

She is quick to write people off. If youre below average, best of luck trying to get a good standing with her. After the stress of the daily quiz on things which include stuff she doesnt talk about in the lectures, she goes on to give rushed and incomplete breakdowns of the new material. If you arent too confident in your CHE, dont take her.

O-chem is a hard class, but Dr. O does not make it harder than it needs to be. Great lectures, explains content well, and is very happy to help with any probelm. Daily quizzes occur every day of lecture, but by the end of the semester you will be happy for this as they keep you ready for exams. Lots of studying will be required though for exams.

Easily the best prof Ive ever had at NKU. Ochem is notoriously a difficult class and as a graduating senior and someone who struggled very much in gen chem 1 & 2, Dr. O was such a relief. She has this way of making you not feel insanely stupid for asking questions or not understanding material immediately like other profs do. Absolutely love her!!!

Dr. O was my favorite professor sophomore year! She is so funny and really tries to make organic as simple as possible although it is an extremely tough course. I am taking her again for 311 and totally recommend her.

Dr. O is my favorite professor since I started college. She tries her best to simplify things so that it makes the most sense. Daily quizzes that keep you on track! I am taking her again next semester.
Amazing
Explains stuff well, but if you don't memorize your mechanisms RIP

Dr. Onorato is definitely one of the best professors that I've ever had. She explains things very well and is pretty funny. She really cares about her students and wants everyone to do well. Very accessible outside of class--she will let you sit in her office for however long you need to. Just be prepared to study a lot!
This was the worst class I've ever taken. F you aren't a genius in this field or if this is a pre-req for something else you DONT TAKE HIM.

Easily my favorite professor so far in the MBI program. He is very hands on and expects a lot of you, both from a participation standpoint and a higher level of thinking standpoint. He is very helpful and typically gets backs to emails quickly. Great class!

I took this class as an 8 week course. As a result, the class was fast paced. None the less, he was able to make sure everyone was doing well in the class. In class, he made a friendly atmosphere as well. He made lectures more enjoyable.
Great professor. Read the chapters and he will lecture over the content until you understand it perfectly. Never felt rushed, even in an 8 week class. I'd love to take him for all my classes.
Very hard class, easy grader because it is so hard. Worst class I have ever taken. Doesn't have grades when he says he will.

I absolutely loved having Professor Goh. He was very up-front with his expectations for us as students. I also found his lectures to be quite engaging; he actively looked for participation, and he frequently asked if everything made sense to us  "Yes, no, maybe?" Overall, taking his class was a very rewarding experience, and I hope to have him as a professor again.

This class is hard and fast paced, and you cannot miss any classes and expect to know whats going on. You have a quiz and usually two assignments every week that are posted with only a few days to complete. I think Professor Goh knows the content for the class extremely well, but could give better feedback and explain things more clearly.

I took the 8 week course, and as expected, it moved VERY fast. There is a lot of reading involved. Dr. Goh is a really good professor and really does love the subject, but he kinda slacked on grading homework in a timely manner. His lectures are hasty and unclear but if I had trouble with a concept and asked him, he could explain it very well.

Great teacher, he challenges you to learn the material and think about more than just what is stated in the book. He knows the material forward and back and is able to relate that knowledge to you.  Hands on technology exercises help drive home the point.
He is the best professor I had. He is very smart. He knows his subject and knows how to transfer it to students .

Very laid back, but not in a good way. He is very inconsistant and forgetful. He just reads off the PowerPoint slides and gives rushed exams that cover very little of the material learned. You'll be teaching yourself for the most part. Overall, not a good professor.

Barely teaches the class. He just posts PowerPoint slides and hopes you learn. Creates a zoom meeting before the exam to review and ask questions and he doesn't even show up. terrible teacher do not take!!!!!

This guy doesn't know what he's doing. A friend wrote down random answers and the teacher gave him 100 on the homework assignments, showing that he didn't care. The exams were not related to what we were learning and it was not a good class.. Drop the class asap or get another teacher

Professor kesh is truly one of the best professors I have ever had.He has an impressive amount of knowledge. Professor kesh is an incredibly caring and supportive teacher. He truly want his students to succeed . He is always available for questions, Overall, I would rate Professor kesh as an excellent professor.
This man is very lovely. You can ask him every thing. You can bring new one into class. You can ask ask ask ask, he doesn't tired.

I took Mark at the University of Cincinnati, but there was no listing so I'm submitting here. He does read directly from powerpoints and does not really seem to care about the material and he is bad at explaining things. The class as a whole had no clear expectations and was unorganized, but that was the departments fault. He is the EASIEST grader.

He is a wonderful lab teacher, you know what he expects from you.  He is always there when you need him and will joke with you during the right time.  I really enjoyed this class and wish I could take it again(For fun).  This was a very interesting class.  The only issue with the class not him is the material needed is a little bit of every where.

Professor Carmen was by far my favorite professor this semester! He really cares bout his students and is very willing to help, you just have to ask for it. He makes sure that everyone understands the point of the lab and really relates it back to lecture to help make even more sense of the material. I highly recommend taking his class!

Dr. Carmen is great. He is 100% willing to talk to you outside of class. He even helped me study for my bio lecture exam even though he was my lab professor. BUT be aware that if you don't care at all, neither does he. He will give you the grade you deserve;  if you are doing the bare minimum, expect an average grade. Must study before every class.

Carmen is very knowledgeable but is very bad at sharing that knowledge. His powerpoints make it very unclear what the main concepts are. His feedback is terrible. He answers your questions with questions, leaving you more confused than before. Tests cover everything under the sun. He uses group teaching style which often inhibits learning.

He is a nice guy. This is his first year teaching, and I wish it wasn't. There is no real direction in the class as to what things are important to learn. You are expected to answer test questions about anything in the chapter. SO there isn't much time to spend on grasping the important concepts. Not a good way to learn this stuff...

Carmen seems like a great guy but he does not make it clear to his students what they should be focusing on exactly. He jumps from one topic to another. He is very smart but isn't great at dumbing it down for his students to understand. I wish he was more specific on what to focus on.

Carmen is a very nice guy! If you have any questions he does not hesitate to help you, he will even go out of his way for you to make sure you understand the material. This is not an easy class but can be do-able. He gives online quizzes once a week, they aren't too hard, read the chapters. Test aren't easy, study vigorously and you'll be fine.
Dr. Carmen is awesome for lab! He is clear about what he expects and is always willing to help out students whenever possible.

The first time I took this class I struggled. It was his first year teaching this class so he skipped around so I dropped. This time I passed with a B. You MUST study for this class. He post his notes on blackboard. Use the book LESS and his notes MORE. Very nice guy. He emailed me congratulating me on my very first exam with a score of 90. Study!!

Dr. Carmen is probably one of the most informative and passionate professors I've ever met. You can tell he really wants his students to do more than get A's- but to actually understand material above and beyond what is expected.
if you looking to get a good grade (A,B) do not take any course with  Dr.Matthew Stephen Block

GPA Buster! Confusing, arrogant- Asks for questions but never gives anything but vague answers. No empathy- acts like his class is the only one anyone has- Test scores across two classes indicate he's not doing a good job, yet he thinks the tests are "fair" Unless you are a physics whiz or don't care about your GPA, I'd stay away from this guy.

One of the best professors I've ever had. If you are genuinely interested in physics I suggest taking Dr. Block. It's not an easy A, but that's because it's a college physics course. If you do the homework, come to class and actually pay attention, you will do fine in his class.

Worst professor I have ever had. He asks for suggestions for improvement, yet doesn't change once given.
