He writes very small on board and gives a ton of homework, but never goes over the questions when asked to. Only on campus twice a week so he does not have open availability to meet with struggling students.

Should be teaching a 300 or 400 level course. Too academic about things for an intro level class. Very knowledgeable, but has issues simplifying. Very strict grader. You are not allowed to keep tests. Whole class struggled with electricity part of course, which is his field. He's a theoretical physicist, and it shows.

No easy A!He explains in class very well, but too fast.Very elitist attitude, which makes him seem unapproachable. When you ask a question he can't "dumb-it-down" for you, but if you ask it again, he'll answer it in a different way. He is a strict grader and does not compromise, but he puts the material into notes very well. Homework is crazy long.

This guy is terrible. Average grade in the class was around 70 out of 100.  I got a B+ in 211 and am up for a C here. Everything about this class is unnecessarily difficult- LONG homework- LONG labs- LONG in class assignments. Teaches this intro class like an 300-400 level class.  If you're not way into physics and math, avoid this guy.
Keep away from this teacher If you want a good grade. Long Homework, Long lab, Long in class assignments.

To be honest this teacher made me cry in this course. He makes you work so hard and his labs are not fun. He grades hard and takes off points for unecessary things like units. I had a good grade but i had to work hard for it . If you love physics take him but if you dont find another teacher. He lectures really good too.

Dr. Block is an excellent professor who challenges students to learn the material rather than spew out facts and do simple algebra. Some students do not like this, but it will serve you well if you plan to take any kind of standardized exam (such as the MCAT).

Great guy! However his grading is a little weird. All test are open book but timed so unless you know  exactly where it is at in the material you'll do bad. However with grading he will give you the upper hand and give you the most points for your program. I do however advise to stay away from this class unless it goes with your major.

the class is not easy for students who don't have any experience with programming. and the  projects is harder and far away what you have learn from the labs or the class. however his labs is very easy but is not going to help you to achieve or do the programs. find  this class  harder  due to  little material provided

great guy! His lecture and all the materials he provided didn't help at all when I was doing homework. The materials are way too easy, but the tests and homework are hard. Some of his instructions in the homework make no sense, sometimes I couldn't even figure out what exactly he wanted me to do! His grading makes no sense either. DON'T RECOMMEND!

Professor McCord would often belittle students when they did not understand a portion of the lab or program. I ended up refraining from asking him questions due to him being condescending. The programs did not accurately follow the course curriculum and I would be lost quite regularly.  I would not recommend taking Professor McCord.

Wells is a very nice professor who wants to see you do well and really enjoys when students take initiative and show passion for computer science.   She was always super helpful and willing to meet to discuss assignments.

This class is not easy for entry level programmers. Previous programming knowledge is almost a must. Lectures can sometimes run a little dry, but is expected of a programming course. Lots of labs that help knowing the concepts.

McCord is a good guy, not sure about some of the comments people have left in here. This class was tough because i felt the assignment did not reflect what we had gone over in class yet. He jumps around in the book chapters so some part may go over a previous chapter you have not covered yet. That was the worst part. Some 10 + page labs + projects.

Incredibly boring lectures and really slow on getting feedback back to us. To be fair the class itself is literally just learning C++ and nothing exciting, but he teaches it basically by comparing to Java and just goes over slides, which is an awful way to learn. Assignments are a bit iffy to understand at first because of his subpar explanation.

Dr. McCord is an excellent professor. He is very understanding about life, and always willing to help. He is excellent at explaining the material, class assignments are entertaining and fun to complete. I am hoping to take Dr. McCord again. Highly recommended.

Great professor! Very kind, clear, helpful, and knowledgeable. I'm already taking him again for Web Development. I recommend him 100%!For this class there is a textbooklet made specifically for this class and given free on Blackboard. You will need to use it and the slides. Don't miss in class assignments. They are in class for a reason.

Dr. McCord is a very great professor. This is my second class with him. Course assignments are interesting to complete and very helpful in learning the code. Dr. McCord will also do everything in his power to help you succeed. Highly Recommended for programming courses.

He gives very good lectures that could let you never open the textbook. The Bb materials are useful if you don't want to search through his Tegrity lecture, though. He's always there to help if you don't ask at the last minute. I've had a fun semester, and I know the outcome of my grade is entirely on my shoulders since he's not vague or unhelpful.

Online class. There were zero lectures. He does not teach. He uses an online interactive textbook (zybooks) which would be a great supplement to instruction if there were any. The textbook is the only thing teaching us. He avoids in person meetings, preferring to meet online with a voice chat. Does not clarify or help if you are not understanding.

Professor Rubleske, was an average professor. Nothing special. He made the course  much more difficult then it should have been. He expects reading, calls on people so be prepared. Attending class is mandatory. He is a very tough grader on the few projects and lecture is very dry.

I've been taking Joe's class for 8 weeks and I'll take him any time I can in the future. He's a hard teacher, uses a ton of terminology (which isn't bad if you read), & the content is dry, but he REALLY cares about his students, especially if you participate. Joe went above and beyond when I needed a recommendation for a job. Great for networking

Rubleske is awesome.  He takes what can sometimes be a complicated concept and teach it clearly;  all you have to do is show up and and pay attention. There are a roughly 4-5 exams and 4-5 assignments, so make sure you study and do well. You don't need the textbook, all studying comes from his lecture slides, so study those and you'll pass!
the worst teacher I have ever seen in my life. I will never take any class with him.

This guy teaches a horrible online class, his lectures are hard to bare . He clicks his lips or mouth at the end and beginning of every sentence. He doesn't give grades back timely and leaves poor evaluation if any. He is off topic and will skip all around his powerpoints. His tests as far as online are lightning fast so study like crazy.

This was the most challenging class I've taken(maybe tied with Calc II). I'm so glad I had him as an instructor though, he made the class bearable! He has a great personality and keeps things fun, even though it is a rigorous course. He really does his best considering how challenging the material is and how much people tend to struggle with it.

It's a good idea to read the chapters before class, he will call on random people to answer questions about the content. Gives extra credit for having good attendance. Allows you to use your textbook and notes on exams! Really nice and helpful! I asked him to extend a deadline and he did it with no questions! Has the class play a game before tests.

Professor Rubleske is a great guy. However he treats every lecture as if he is talking to a group who have taken INF 282 before and this is just a review. The lectures and material become an exponential increase in difficulty. If you like to work hands on in class with the professor then this Professor is not for you. Side note His lectures are dry

In the first ten weeks of class we had 2 assignments and an exam. Got an A on the first assignment, a B on the exam, and an F on the second assignment. He'll leave you in the dust and takes no prisoners. Only take this guy as a last resort.

My favorite professor at NKU by far. Lectures are very informative and homeworks' correlate well with the lectures too. Tests are fair and you have plenty of time with questions asked. Personally really liked databases, but I credit that to him because of how he taught it. Would definitely take again if I could!

Knows what he's talking about but moves too fast to really follow it. He acts like he's talking to a group of industry professionals who just need a quick recap. He's interesting to talk to as a person but as a professor I did not really like his teaching style. He's alright if there's no other option but his courses could be better.

For the love of God please don't cheat, I'll admit I was an idiot and cheated and he found out very quickly. He is very straightforward about this and please listen to him. First offense only results in a 0 on your assignment, but be smart and don't do it twice
DO. YOUR. WORK. Prof. Rubleske is a great person, with a good sense of humor, and he obviously knows what he is talking about, but if you don't do your work in his class, you will not pass.

I took BIS 310

He informed us that it is his first time teaching the class  and he was doing a pretty good job explaining the content and elaborating for us to understand the materiales

40% of your grade is Assignments the other 60% of your grade is tests. The first exam and assignment you will get a A+. Joe will then change the testing format from open note canvas to closed note paper tests and you will fail MEAN GRADE ON TEST 2 WAS 74.5/140. I would also recommend to be proficient in SQL before taking this class he expects it.

let me start off by saying joe is my favorite professor I have had at nku so far. He's a good teacher, has a good sense of humor, and uses his time efficiently (had his 6-9 class and usually got out an hour early). His test are open note and he only has 6 assignments that took no longer 6 hours to complete. Attendance isn't mandatory but suggested.

Dr. Rubleske knew what he was talking about in class. He was open to any questions you may haw had in or out of class. This class was extremely easy. The hardest part is probably the data modeling section (still not bad). He doesnt require attendance and if you have done this before, he releases notes on canvas so its easy to make stuff up.

Teresa is one of the best professors I've had at NKU. She's very clear, and is always willing to help. The course itself was challenging, but she was always willing to help when you needed it. Don't buy the book, you won't use it! I wish she tought more classes at NKU, but doubt that that is going to happen. She is now an adjunct professor. A+++

This class is extremely difficult. Teacher does her best to explain the content, but most of the explained comes out confusing. She is always willing to help those in need. Extensive study and reading material outside class is crucial if you want to pass.

Teresa tries her best and wants you to learn. She is extremely confusing most of the time though. This class is based a lot on Group Projects and labs; projects are somewhat difficult and the labs aren't explained clearly. Take this class if it is an ABSOLUTE MUST.

Most likely the worst teacher I've ever had.  Her method of teaching is to talk about powerpoint slides that she's been using for a long time, not giving time for labs, and having tests that do not match the content that you've gone over.  She's also rude, condescending, and inflexible.

VERY helpful teacher. The subject itself was pretty tough (Ruby is my worst programming language) but she made the class manageable. I had to email her multiple times for each assignment but she was always willing to help. Highly recommend her, DON'T cheat in her class, she had to turn multiple students into the dean for sharing code.
she was the lab teacher, she was really helpful and cares about students.

many people found her class helpful, however I did not and I thought her class was very tough. She does not tell you when you have online assignments and will gladly give you a zero. Her tests are not easy and there are not many of them.  However, she does give out note sheets and sometimes lets  class out early. She doesn't use the textbook.

I am horrendous at math, and have always failed in the past.  This was the first time that I have understood math so well, and actually enjoyed it. She is silly and that makes up for the long classes.  She is fair, willing to help, emails timely etc.  Great professor!  Wish she taught 114-115 (which ever class I have next). No textbook required.

Mrs. Ferguson was one of the best teachers here at Northern. Even after I took her class I still go back to her and she helps me with other math classes. She makes you work hard for your grades but not terrible if you do the homework and study.

Mrs. Martha is truly amazing! She is one of the reasons that I decided to continue with a science degree. She filled in so many gaps that I had within my math background. Sh's very understanding and very willing to help you understand the material. If you are afraid or skeptical of taking a math class, I highly encourage you to take her!

IF YOU USE MY MATH LAB, (which you will in this class) DONT BUY THE TEXTBOOK, ITS ONLINE WITH MY MATH LAB. that being said her class was fun. she made it easy and fun. she will also give you the extra help if you need it

Professor Ferguson is a rock star of a math teacher. She has some awkward humor moments at times, but she teaches the material well and if you engage with her you'll learn a lot easier. Would definitely take again.
If you've never taken stats before and this is your first semester in college. Do not take her. Period.

She's a little quirky and super nice. I had some difficulties in her class but only because I'm not good at math. She explains stuff pretty well. However, I personally thought the tests were more difficult than the assignments. Make sure to ask for help if you need it. Don't buy the book! Just buy the access code.
Shes very caring and understanding but the class is very fast paced.
She was the best! She was super caring and helpful. We reviewed notes in class & used Alexs to practice/learn the material for a grade. A lot of homework

Great teacher but here's the bottom line: Go to class. If you go to class, take notes, do the homework, take the practice tests, do your notecard based off you practice test you are going to do very well. ;) I've never been a good math student and I got an A+ in her class.
More likely to help. Expline everything

very nice teacher, very wonderful person, but isn't the best of teacher, but i cant blame her, anyone who actually understands circuits is going to have a hard time explaining it simply.  Some students didn't like her, but she really does care, she just sometimes doesn't know how to show it i guess!

I enjoy her lectures. When you visit her office she is more than happy to explain things and give feedback. You do however have to study, her tests are tough. I  admire her because she is the only woman electrical engineer that teaches at NKU.  She deals with colleagues and students who come from countries that don't respect women.

If you want to learn you will learn. In general the students like her but her job seems challenging being in a male dominated field. She is one of the most helpful and caring professors that I have had at NKU.
Shes tough to understand so if at all possible, sit in the front of the class. You will have a much easier time understanding her.
DONT TAKE A COURSE WITH HER! EVER
She is tough, but I would take her again. I learned about circuits, and I am sure I will learn a lot from taking her classes.

Good instructor but you have to read in order to follow her lectures. But then again how can you possibly graduate in engineering without reading and studying? She was  very dedicated and always there to help, very accessible.
She doesn't collect homework but if you don't do it, you will not do well on her quizzes and exams. If you don't score well she will curve for the class average, so that helps.
I learned more from her than any other professor at NKU and I enjoyed her class.
A lot of understanding but she is not a push-over. She knows her stuff inside and out.
I like the teacher. I learned from her lectures. I did not like the labs. NKU has to spend more money on getting new equipment.

She is very hard to understand because of her accent. Her lectures are really boring and unorganized and she only reads from the slides. Also if you email her she might not reply. The main group project can be done in any programming language and she does not even look at the code,  some groups did it with auto generated php.

During my time there she was terribly disorganized. She expected people to assume what she wanted, and constantly changed her rules, expectations, and teaching methods. She was kind, but her schedule was constantly filled with errors such as overlapping due dates and being blocked from important links unintentionally.

HERE'S WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW. 60% of your grades based on Labs, assignments, and quizzes(20 on each). They are all easy along with the tests, which btw you will have 3 including the final 10% for the first two and 20% for final. Very EASY CLASS but you gotta put some effort if you wanna learn. She's Way way better than other profs(TRUST ME ON THAT)

It's no fault of her own that people can't understand her, but it's worth noting that her English isn't very good. If you take her, it's crucial to pay attention to the little details of the lectures, as programming questions tend to be less than half of the exams. I did find however, that the exams tend to have questions taken from review quizzes.

Absolutely a nightmare of a professor. Nearly impossible to understand because of her thick accent and her lectures are bone-dry. I didn't understand 85% of what she said, causing me to have to read the book. Tests didn't really cover anything relevant, just small useless details that are easily overlooked. Stay away from her if you can.

I found her to be a very pleasant teacher to have for the course and the requirements she set forth were extremely reasonable in both time and difficulty. I also would recommend making sure to attend all lectures as her subject matter of a specific week related heavily to the homework and tests in that general time frame.

While English isn't her first language, she does an okay job conveying her lectures. Just be sure to pay attention. She has an assignment every 1-2 weeks and 3 exams. Optional review questions, but no quizzes.  She isn't picky when it comes to your code. If it does what it's supposed to, you're fine. Comments are not needed on your code.
Toughest class I have ever taken. and I couldn't understand a thing. very confusing assignments and homework

She's a great professor.  It's clear that she knows what she's talking about, though her Chinese accent sometimes makes it a little difficult to understand.  She's flexible with deadlines if the class is having difficulty on a particular homework.  There are occasional "attendance quizzes" that as long as you're there to take them you'll pass them.

Her exams are nearly impossible to receive an A or B on. She makes you handwrite HTML CODE. Rather than using a coding program to ensure accuracy, the students must handwrite all their html code and have nearly everything correct to receive credit. Several homework assignments each week. Also note that she does not follow the syllabus whatsoever.
You will do great if you put real effort in the learning. If you want an easy A then this class is not for you.

No reviews expects you to know this stuff. She goes through the material too quick and expects you to know this stuff like the way she does. Worst professor only way to pass is know the material very well and practice on homeworks only no reviews and no test sheets.
A good professor, but more traditional? She is sometimes hard to understand, but will help you if YOU put in effort.
She is here to help you understand the material and easy to work with.
Respect her and expect a good grade and a fun class. She's great to work with. Makes fun out of a usually boring class.
Very helpful, very enjoyable. Great classroom atmosphere.

Brandi is a bold and excellent professor. She is passionate about teaching and her students. This tactic makes for a wonderful learning environment which I loved. Brandi made little to no mistakes. The students however, sometimes took her kindness for weakness, but this did not bode well for them. Put the time in and respect Brandi & you will pass.

She's funny and really laid back. This could have been simply because it was a 100 level class. You are able to choose your group, which you work with often. There is a quiz on blackboard nearly every week. Five points. If your whole group gets 100% you are excused from the next class. ATTENDANCE IS A GRADE! Can only 3, after is a letter drop.
I love her so much, she's always ready to help you. I would love to take any class with her again.
showed us codeacademy
We did everything in groups.  Really easy even for a 101 class.  Brandi was funny and chill and the class itself was fun.
She is super nice and the class itself is laid-back so she makes sure that you are taken care of in class and in general she is understanding of college drama! Best coolest teacher ever!

Brandi is great with her students and genuinely cares about them. She is very good about working through assignments and making sure the class understands the content. She gives good reviews before tests and quizzes, making them very easy. I had an easy, excellent experience in her class.

i had class with her over a year ago and she still goes above and beyond to help me in other classes. i have gone to her for help when other professors wouldn't help with their own assignments. not only does she help but she makes me feel like i can do this.

Professor Neal is very likable, supportive, open, friendly, caring, knowledgeable, helpful, and kind. She is one of the best professors that I have ever had. I've taken two different classes with her, and had a lot of fun both times. I would highly recommend taking your classes with her if at all possible.

Took the online section to her class and it was a complete joke. The online quizzes and tests are copy and paste from quizlet. Weekly tutorials have clear instructions but the weekly project often has many more requirements that have no instruction and you're expected to just figure it out. Good for GPA boost, otherwise total waste of time & money

She is an amazing teacher. If you need to take BIS 300, take her, all the the other professors are honestly not as helpful as she is. If you want an A, she will help you get it, class is interesting, a few workshops that are optional to attend and just an overall great experience. LOVE HER

Brandi is an absolutely famous teacher, from Day 1 as a new professor at Miami University she brought life to an otherwise boring subject. Her lectures usually turn into discussions but know what you put into the class is what you get out. During the Corona Crisis, she seamlessly shifted her class online while maintaining flexibility for all.

I took Prof. Bragg's online INF 286 class. I found her to be very helpful and available. She almost always responds to emails the same day, and gave good feedback on projects when I needed help. She does not mind answering questions. She records lectures every week. Read the chapter, do the assignments and you'll be fine. Would take again.

Professor Bragg is great at introducing students to coding in her INF 120 class. The material can be a little confusing, but she does a great job covering it. Make sure to take notes and do the readings because you will have labs. Homework can be a little difficult, but nothing too bad. If you're worried about having no experience, don't. Take her!

One assignment builds on itself every chapter so you have to do it even if t isn't assigned. Sometimes assigns more things that are one offs. Midterms roll around and you get up to 2 different assignments and a project all due at the start of mid term week with more due the following week. Also takes 3 weeks to grade anything you turn in.

Group project including a presentation (For an elective CS class?)  Assigned lots of side assignments along with, made it difficult to have time to work.  Didn't know the Android environment well, needed guidance to show her how to read my Android Studio Project for grading.  Nice and there to help, Android just isn't her strong topic.

The class started off well enough, the projects were relatively easy and the material covered wasn't too difficult. But after the first programming assignment, the professor took 3 weeks to grade it because of techincal issues. She then tacked 2 programming assignments and a group project with four weeks left. May be the worst CS class I've taken.

Horrible.  People left questions on discussion board (as she said to do) but she never answered them.  Weeks later and no grades posted.  Lectures are just her reading the slides and are essentially useless.  Buy the textbook b/c you'll need it.  Weekly quiz (2 attempts, easy) and assignment (ranges easy to somewhat murky), five tests, one project.

Not bad but labs, tests, and quizzes are often confusing. If you ask her for help she will help you out. She does grade fairly and overall her class isn't too tough. But if you don't do the work you will fall behind, so don't just look for an easy A. You can get a good grade in her class just put in the effort.
This professor knows a lot about what she is teaching and is always willing to help.

I had her for CIT130 as well. She mainly comes across as very unknowledgeable. In CIT130 I sometimes helped students when she couldn't. Her lectures are mediocre slide reading. Quizzes are easy, except when the wording of the question begins to make you wonder what it really means.   She opens direct mail, but a few people never got answers on BB

This class is very difficult, and she doesn't make it any easier.  Basically taught myself. Quizzes and labs every week.  You have next to no time to do the quizzes.  The labs become very difficult, and her instructions are sometimes impossible to follow (I know I wasn't the only one, the message boards were full of questions every week). AVOID.

Taking her INF 284 right now. She gives out a study guide before every exam but the study guide is deceiving and you might as well just throw it away and read and memorize the book work for word. She teaches the class as if it is a computer science class rather than a general IT class. Class average on exams so far is a 68. Wish us luck.
Do yourself a favor and avoid her like the plague. I do not understand how she has a job as a teacher.

Although I rated a 2 I have a few things to say. She will work with you if you are having trouble in her class. She does care and as a person she is awesome. She was teaching a tough class so I'll cut her some slack. Be ready to study, though. I studied for this class more than any of my other classes combined and still only barely made a B.

On Tuesdays, we have lecture, and on Thursdays we have lab. The lectures aren't the best, and at times I think she's throwing around words that I'm not sure she understands. Labs are very basic, just follow the instructions from Blackboard (though sometimes the instructions are wrong). Class usually gets out early, though, which is nice.

She didn't seem to understand the material she was teaching. Students with prior knowledge of the content often helped to explain it to the class when she could not. Lectures were very boring and not very helpful, but she takes attendance. Labs were simple and we got out of class early often. I feel like I didn't learn much from her class. Avoid.

I personally took her class online and in person. Her powerpoint slides were vague and she is very unforgiving in her classes. Her office hours are tiny one-hour windows M and W and if you try to reach her via email, do not expect a response until sunday when your homework assignment is due. I don't usually like being mean, but here its justified.

The thing about Dr. Thomas is that she teaches difficult classes. She, herself, is actually very nice. She teaches many online sections, but she does have an office in GH(I highly recommend utilizing her office hours). 130 covers way too much material in my opinion, and 247 is designed to eliminate students who shouldn't be in this Major.

Hardly responds to emails. My class had 3Cs 8Ds and a few Fs on our first exam- not a single A or B, and yet she didn't think to curve the exam grades. Doesn't seem particularly knowledgeable of the many topics covered in the introduction course CIT130. Through my first two semesters at NKU I've had many amazing professors, she's not one of them.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Lectures were horribly boring and she just read from the slides. "You can look that up on your own time" when she wouldn't admit that she didn't know. Tests were online and open note, but were so poorly phrased that you never knew what the question was exactly asking. If you have to take her, good luck.

Professor Thomas put no effort into this class. Exam questions were word for word from the textbook and the lectures and labs are created by another company. On the bright side this made the class extremely easy. Also, the couple times I ever did have questions, she either didn't respond to my email at all or responded too late for it to matter.
Shes helpful facetoface during the labs. But her class is mega lab heavy, and she grades pretty hard.
Did not enjoy. Doesn't seem like she truly cares. Uses materials from other professors. No OC.

The best way to describe Cynthia is as a "proctor". All of her classes use materials from other professors, which is usually outdated. She always answers questions and emails too vaguely. Unfortunately, she teaches many crucial CIT courses, so its hard to avoid her. Her classes are passable, but you won't learn much unless you teach yourself well.

What can I say? This professor lacks vision and generally does not seem to care. Taking her class, there were hundreds of typos in the lecture materials, quizzes, labs, and exams. The questions that she asks on the exams are vague and often are opinionated and do not follow the labs or the lectures. Don't take this professor unless no other choice.
Doesnt answer emails, exams are pretty hard, lectures are unclear. Good luck with this one
Terrible at teaching. I would not recommend him. Great guy as a person but you won't learn anything from him.
Show up to class do the work, and you'll be fine.

Mark is an incredible professor from the standpoint of someone with limited knowledge of programming.  Pretty much all of the homework is straight from the lecture of that week.  It helps more that the class is at a slower pace so the students can have time to learn the more basic functions before moving on to more advanced ones.

Great teacher. He in class exams are fairly easy, and his take away exams/labs come straight from the lectures. My only suggestions are to go to class, and takes notes on each step he does in StatCrunch. Also, if you miss class, go see him in his office, he tends to take a while to email people back, and put grades up for the take away exams.

He's slow to get grades back to you for quizzes and exams, but he takes the time to explain things and doesn't try to jam too much into one class period. He doesn't make you do pencil and paper solutions for problems that you would use software for.

I particularly loved him as a Professor. He somewhat resembles Santa Claus. However, be prepared to study the material after the 1st test because then it becomes difficult. Attendance is not mandatory but it's helpful if you'd like to know what is going on. He's quite an easy going guy and will answer questions and do problems if you are confused.

His lectures are really long and kind of make me want to sleep, but he obviously enjoys sharing his knowledge. If you do the homework when it is assigned you will be able to keep up with quizzes and tests. Even though he is confusing, if you ask him to clarify something he will work with the class until you understand it. It was his first year so..
Good teacher if you pay attention. You do not need to come to class all the time but missing tons could hurt in the end. Does a good job teaching; if you have a question:  ask.
Very understanding professor! Lots of homework.

Professor was a very nice and funny guy. His lectures were very boring, and somewhat hard to follow. There was a lot of homework and the tests were difficult. However, he is very lenient on due dates, and if you do the study guides before the tests they are pretty much the same as the test. If you are good at teaching yourself, he is awesome!

Definitely not the greatest teacher I've ever had. Makes multiple errors on in-class examples and doesn't always explain things in the easiest way. I found youtube math videos to be more helpful. Homework covered maybe 25% of in-class material and was much harder than anything we were learning. Would not recommend (unless you're taking McCartney..)

Heard before that she was a great teacher, but she isn't. Tutored twice a week and still had trouble understanding the material. She gets off topic way too much in her lectures. Be prepared to take a lot of notes and at least 2 homework assignments a week plus a quizzes on them. Also don't waste the 200$ on book unless you'll think you need help.

This was my 2nd course with this faculty member. I took Calculus II with her over a summer and she was absolutely hilarious throughout the entire class and made a 5-day-a-week calculus class enjoyable. She also did a good job of getting across the material and making it seem approachableeven stating whether she struggled with material herself. A+
Attend class and pay attention, do the homework, and you shouldn't have much trouble.  Practice exams before every exam that were similar to the exam.  Would definitely recommend!

Mary Glore is a robot. If you have a calculator built into your brain this should be an easy class for you, but others beware. The class consist of the students sitting and watching the professor write down problems, and solve them herself yet not explaining anything and if she would mess up while solving the problem she'd simply continue on. RUN.

I love this woman. very accessible. if you go to class and see her in her office when confused this will be one of the bests class you ever take. I suck at math and i would not have passed without her as my teacher. very intimidating at first, but easy obstacle to get through if you just tough it out.
She doesn't explain things well and is often hard to follow her examples and lectures

She is all over the place. She is not well organized at all. The most frustrating thing is she will make homework due over subject matter we haven't covered and its worth a grade! I have taken stats and prob. before I changed my majors, if I wouldn't have known what I was doing I probably would have failed.

Dr. Glore is a great professor. While she is difficult to follow at times, if you go to class and do your assignments, you'll be fine. She explains statistics really well and gives lots of partial credit.
Really funny professor. Will stay around and help you understand material if you're struggling. Uses a lot of online material, quizzes, assignments. Overall a fun class.

Her lectures are incredibly boring. If it were not for the attendance policy I would never go to class. No one pays attention to her lectures. Everyone had to figure things out on their own and hope for the best.

The class is difficult if you haven't done math in a long time, but if you focus up you can get it done. Mrs. Glore is nice and understanding, but some of her explanations of concepts were odd/didn't make sense to me, so I'd end up redefining topics myself. Threw me a lifeline once in a while though.

Stats is a very tough subject, but Dr. Glore is very good about explaining everything and making it understandable. I was scared to take stats but Dr. Glore kept it very clear and I rarely actually got confused. Some concepts can be hard to understand, but if you actually pay attention and do the work, it's an easy A.

I was terrified for stats because I've always been awful at math, but Glore is awesome! She's really sweet and cares about students. The homework is easy and I only spent 1-2 hours per week doing it. Attendance is 10% of your grade so it's important to show up. People say she's boring but any math class is. She tries to make it entertaining!

Glore is an okay professor. Lectures are very dry and can be confusing. I asked her a simple question one time, and she answered it like I was stupid. Gets the material across, but I definitely would not take again.
She's not terrible, but stats is dry, and she doesn't do anything to help that. Weekly homework and weekly quiz. Everything is online.
If you have a chance to take stats 205 with another professor do it!
Isn't great at explaining the work and messes up problems without realizing it. Speeds through the notes and doesn't give good feedback. Take this class with another professor, at all costs.

Dr. Glore is the BEST possible stats professor I could have had. She was accessible to me for just about any question, whether it be through email at night or on campus during the day. She was always ready to help me and she went beyond just teaching me, she made sure I understood and helped me until I did. If you have to take STA205, take her.

I hate math and was terrified of statistics, but professor Glore honestly made it tolerable. The only thing annoying about the class was the attendance grade, missing one class brought me down to a B. But other than that, she is insanely thorough, funny, and loves answering your questions and helping out in general. I would 100% take her again.

I was terrified to take stats as I am horrible at math. Glore was not the greatest instructor but she is extremely kind and caring. She is always willing to help. I went to tutoring for the class 1-2 times a week all semester and passed easily. She drops low quiz grades, homework grades, and your lowest test grade. Class is pretty easy with effort.
Test are very difficult. Chances of knowing what your grade is  before the end of the semester are not likely. I was very excited to take this course only to be very let down.

By far the worst Professor I have had in college. "Objectives" that are used to study and prep for exams are basically know the entire chapter front and back, not realistic. This is a first year nursing class not a graduate class which is the way she treats it.

She is NO nonsense. When she says read the book, READ IT!! She is not kidding! If you have a problem, she'll help you, but you need to let her know. Offers lots of extra credits! Give yourself a favor! DO IT!!!

Louise cared about the students, but she couldn't effectively get the point across. Questions could come from anywhere, told some students to read the book and some to study their notes. Would use "objectives" to study, I asked her for help during office hours and she said I should already know how. FYI I  got all A's this semester except her C.

She seems to really care about the students but she is not clear on expectations for students when it comes to exams. When I asked for help she told me to read the book, after I had read the chapter twice! I'm not really sure why she is teaching this course here because she is not helping anyone learn anything. She's a dream crusher!
Avoid if you can. Not clear on what she wants and is no help. Doesn't care if you pass or not

Niemer is definitely one of the tougher professors you'll come across in the  program. She is no-nonsense when it comes to knowing your stuff. Read the book, study the slides, and don't cram and you will do fine. Im not sure why people think her class is so tough- objectives tell you what to know & study. But dont expect to be handed a grade.

One of the worse professors I've ever had in my college career.  Not only didn't know what to study, but her lectures were quite dreadful.  She goes off of what's on her mind.  She would also start a sentence then say, "ohh, come on Louise". She couldn't finish her thoughts. I never knew what to study. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.
Amazing person, with a caring heart. Very smart and wants the best for her students.

I was scared to be in her class based off these comments but she's such a great person. So funny and relatable. She remembers what it was like being a nursing student and tries to work with us and accommodate to our schedule as much as possible. Go to class, study and do the SLO's she provides. That's how I got an A. She's the best!!!

You have to read the book and nee present for class in order to pass. She is a tough professor but she is also so pro-student. I am almost finished with the program and she is the only professor that I have had that I needed to buy the book. You have to earn your grade it is not handed to you. There is a lot of chance for extra credit, so do it!

Not the right person to teach a first semester nursing course. Test are difficult to study for, be ready to read the book and re read every note you take, even then you may not know the material to her standards. If you are taking a class with her one word of advice, RUN!

If you want to understand chem take Bloss! He is such an amazing professor and Is so sweet. I am horrible at chem and managed to do well. He does not use ALEKS to teach as other NKU chem professors do. He gives little homework through them but doesn't really on it. He also has many opportunities for extra credit. My fave professor at NKU
Makes lectures very easy to understand. Works out variety of problems with the students.
Great Dude. Super helpful!
great teacher easy to work with

Bloss is your guy. He is kind, caring and patient. He clearly wants everyone to succeed. As long as you attend lecture and take notes with the powerpoints, you can get get away from reading some chapters (which I had to do). Do weekly assignments.Bloss is an easy grader and will give partial credit for attempting the question even if it is wrong.

I had Professor Bloss for Gen Chem II, and he was great! I took Gen Chem I in the spring of 2017, so I actually had some time off of chemistry before entering this class. I was a bit nervous going into the class, but Bloss made it a breeze. He is very knowledgeable, he cares a lot, and he gives great lectures. I highly recommend this guy.

Dr. Bloss made chemistry fairly enjoyable. I had not taken chemistry in 4 years when I started, and I understood all of his lectures. He is a part time professor, so his classes usually fall in the evening, but I like that type of schedule, personally. Hes a very caring teacher, and Ive already signed up to take his class again next semester!
Very organized which really helps. Willing to help. Entertaining to watch.

She is a very great teacher. She will print out the notes for you to print out and fill in, which requires you to listen and pay attention. Attendance isn't mandatory, which is great, but i recommend you do go to class because you miss alot when your gone. She is very sweet and soft spoken; i recommend her to anyone having trouble in stats

I loved her as a teacher. SHE IS VERY HELPFUL and her teaching style isn't boring so it keep you interested. I have her 8am. Class and almost everyone always comes. She doesnt make you get the book instead she post the notes. I loved her and her class

She is an amazing teacher! All you have to do is pay attention, fill in the notes you print out and this class should be very easy! She is very calm and she doesnt get frustrated with you if you don't understand. She walks through the steps numerous times if you don't get it! I HIGHLY recommend her!

Awesome teacher!  Ive taken it 3 times with other teachers and had to either drop out or fail out and I currently have a high B !!! She really cares about her students and wants them to understand the material!!  I would DEFINITELY recommend her!!!
She is amazing.  I was dreading stats and I have 100% right now.  SUPER easy to follow, very, very helpful.  I've already recommended her to all my friends.  Take her for sure!!

Jackie is such a great professor! She types out the notes but that doesn't necessarily make the class easy. You must attend, but you will understand stats completely after taking her class. She is great! Take her!
I loved Jackie. She was willing to help you anytime during her hours and she tried to incorporate humor. She was fun to have.

I took this class thinking "easy A" considering I took Calculus in HS. I didn't get an A but I still reccomend Wroughton. She was very organized and seemed to care about the overall grades of her class. I found her lectures to be a bit boring. We took notes, did a few examples and left. Good teacher but she could have made it engaging.

Had her for STA 212 and took her for 213. Tries to engage students but most are too shy to talk in class. Always willing to help and answer questions. Has review days prior to tests with problems in the exact format of the tests. If she taught other courses I would definitely take her again. NO BOOK REQUIRED. Notes are printed and handed out.
Great Teacher!! She made everything make so much sense!! Wish I could take her for 213( it doesnt fit with my schedule) She posts the notes, so NO BOOK. I recommend her 100%!!
Huge help!! Lets you meet her outside of class whever you need help and a great teacher!Highly suggest!!!

She is an awesome teacher! I am taking her for 212 now but also for 213 next semester! She makes everything easy to understand and is very willing to help if you don't understand something! She makes all the notes to print off and study and you don't need the book! She is by far the best math teacher I've had! Take her for sure if you can!
Dreading Stats? Take Jackie! You'll love her! She takes time for her students she explains things in a way to where it clicks. Quizzes are weekly. But the material is tough but she makes it easier.
She is amazing. I wish I could take more stats classes with her. I highly recommend her.

She was INCREDIBLE! Best math teacher I've ever had. Didn't think i would like stats but she changed my mind about that! She doesn't use the text. She makes her own notes and test is dead on the notes. Very very helpful and clear on everything. I plan on taking her for as many classes as i can!!! :)
Go to class and do all the assignments!! Try and you will succeed which is not always the case in stats!! Gret professor with a great personality !! FUN!!

TAKE HER FOR STATS! I love this woman. She is such an amazing professor! She gives you notes to print & use for class, so it's much easier to follow along & you dont even need the book! She is excellent at explaining the material, she is always willing to help you & really CARES for her students! I got an A in her class! Seriously, she is the best!
Take her! very nice, post notes online prior to class. Best math teacher I have had at NKU
I love her. Great notes. Very friendly and reliable. She is very interesting and her stories are exciting.

She is very helpful during her office hours.  I understand that Dr. W does a good job with notes and yes we don't use the book. I find that challenging I'm a book person and struggle understanding her notes. Most others do not.  She is very nice!and Im told by the tutors that they prefer her methods of teaching.  TOUGH CLASS THOUGH!

She assigns a lot of assignments but it is for your own good! It really helps you become confident with the material so you feel less intimidates come test time. She is an excellent teacher and explains concepts very clearly. Hard to get caught back up if you miss a class but she is more than willing to help you after class.

Dr. Wroughton is the best professor I've had at NKU! Very easy to understand the content. Don't buy the textbook, you don't use it.  Print her notes and follow along in class. Don't skip class or you won't pass. There are 4 assignments and 4 tests. She makes sure you have all the information you need to pass her tests! I highly recommend taking her

No book, types notes for us to print & bring to class. no homework, just 4 extended assignments & 4 exams. practice hw & solutions on BB for practice (recommend doing) She tells students to come to her first for help bc she does everything in her way & simpler. Just show up & pay attention, easiest Stats class you'll ever take.

Let's me honest - stats online is tough.  I was at least happy that the lectures (via YouTube videos that she made) are a lot like being in class and that the notes are very clear.  She gives you a lot of practice with answer keys that helps a lot.  You just need to know what you are signing up for and know that you need to put in the work!!

Dr. Wroughton is an amazing professor. She always gives note-handouts for you to follow along with which helps SO much! She is always around and willing to help you and clarify anything. The tests were really hard, people cried.  It was a really tough class, but i'm SO glad I got to take it with her! Take any class you can with her!

She seems pretty amazing.  She is very smart and fun and easy on the eyes!  Wow.  There are only 4 big homework assignments and 4 tests but she prepares you well for them and has great notes that she gives handouts for.  If we had to miss a class she created a video to make us watch instead (boo!) so you don't get out of a class ;)  pretty helpful2

Very organized Professor! Would definitely recommend her and take again. Little slow on responses for online courses so make take twice but she gives great feedback and will work through areas you don't understand. Not lenient however with timelines so stay organized. She makes it possible to pass for someone who isn't math savvy.

Dr. Wroughton was the absolute best professor that I have ever had!!! She is soo willing to help, and wants to make sure that you succeed. If you don't plan on going to class then don't take this courses with her, she explains everything in class, so if you don't go to class you will be lost.

Best professor I've ever had. Failed stats my first semester and passed with flying colors because of Professor W. Always willing to work with you to help you succeed. Gives you plenty of help and extra credit through the semester. Gives you notes to print out and follows them word for word in class.
I very much enjoyed being in this class and I learned a lot! She gets assignments graded quickly, provides good comments, and is always more than willing to help. Great professor!
Dr. Wroughton is a great professor. She explains things very clearly and her expectations are clear from the start. Definitely take one of her classes if you get the chance.
Pretty good overall. Class is easy to follow. Quizzes and HW are easy.  The tests however can be difficult.  Extremely nice.  Take her for stats

Dr. Wroughton is very nice. She certainly knows how to break things down into steps. She is willing to listen to her students and help them when they need it. She tries very hard to get the class to participate, but not very many do. Take her for stats and engage in her Q and A. Listen in and show up to class...u will do fine.
Great Stats teacher! She explains it so well, unlike most teachers who think you understand it just because they do! She's quite funny too.

Now keep in mind I had her for STA 341.  In all honesty, Jackie is a good professor.  She knows the material very well. But I had a difficult time understanding what she was saying half the time because she talks crazy fast.  And her take home tests were close to impossible!

She is very enthusiastic about stats. You have online homework every week and a quiz every other week. If you study they are not too hard. Her tests however can be tricky. She is a good professor but talks fast and can be hard to keep up with.
hardly uses the textbook and gives very few problems or examples for you to understand the material

She is the best teacher I have had so far in 2+ yrs of college. She actually enjoys teaching statistics. She is extremely helpful. If you need extra practice and don't want to ask she has "homework" assignments up and the solutions to show you how you would work it. She gives you opporunity for extra credit. Highly reccommended!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

She's clear in here presentation of the material and her office is always open if you're having troubles. Major flaw with the class was Exams on Monday. Would have switched sections if I had known in advance, seeing as working weekends is the only viable option for most students. It's the worst indicator of how well a student grasp the material.

She is not "easy" and is not going to hand you a grade, but she's a good teacher and she works with her students to try and help you learn and progress. I haven't been in stats in a while so I struggle but she is pretty thorough so I am able to progress in her class.

Jackie herself takes joy in teaching. You don't use the book,when I didn't Understand the material, I had to turn to Youtube!She also types out notes, so you just fill in the blank! But if something from your notes don't make since you don't have the book to fall back on. Overall a great teacher but her class is tough!

After my first stats class I was dreading taking another one.  Luckily I signed up with Wroughton.  I have learned more so far this semester than I learned my entire 1st semester of stats.  This class is definitely not easy, but you  learn a lot, and how it can be used in the real-world.  Put the in the same effort she does and you will be fine.

I really liked her. She really makes stats more easy to understand. She doesn't require you to buy a textbook, which is always a plus. She was very helpful whenever I asked her questions. You have to spend a lot of time outside of class on work, however.

This was a difficult class for me. Thankfully, I got the best teacher there is. Dr. Herman is excellent at what she does, online classes are very well prepared & she will always help you anytime you ask. I would certainly take her again. I highly recommend her!
THEORY! TOUGH GRADER, If you don't write the same thing as her (word for word) you won't get credit.

It's been 2 weeks and I can definitely tell you, most of these ratings are questionable? just go to the statistics section in the ratemyprofs and you will find how low ratings she got and I can tell you those are more realistic than what is written here.

She thinks she is teaching at Harvard. I have never seen a prof with this kind of attitude. You go to her office time and she makes you feel to never go back. I would avoid her AT ALL COST! She is way too picky and if you don't write what she wants word for word forget about getting a good grade.

This class was mandatory for my degree . Exam windows are only available on days I work. The class is online and I asked her to open exam early due to my schedule and she refused. I was not asking for an extension . I asked for it to be open early. Taking class at another university now to transfer credits in.

I loved Dr. Herman, and she is one of my favorite professors I've ever had. She made stats so easy to understand it was crazy, she is a great teacher. Attendance was not mandatory, but going to class will help a lot with understanding the material. The textbook was optional, so I didn't get it and I did fine. Take her if you can.
It was alright but she graded wayyy too strictly! I think that I did better on most tests than what she put in the gradebook even with her comments. She was a good person but a strict teacher.

This was the first time that I had videos to watch outside of class. To be honest, I was less than enthused about this at first. But as the semester went, the videos were actually very helpful and weren't too long. We had quizzes (dropped a couple), 4 big assignments, and 4 tests. If you came to class and actually paid attention, you'll be fine

Her test material is nothing like what she shows in class. Exams are very hard and continually ran over. Instead of removing questions she kept the length of the exam throughout the semester. Homework is occasionally from a book that she uses twice and never references again and look nothing like the exam.

Content is super easy, but she is not clear on what she anticipates. She wants all responses to be verbatim, but is not happy when you write exactly what she writes which makes no sense. I would not recommend. Take a different professor.
Had a project every week, but would occasionally change the due date, so keeping up was difficult. Exams were about 20 pts each, but could take hours to finish.

She markets the class as very software intensive and that we would really learn the program R. All I learned was taking her notes and putting them into R. I learned nothing about the application of the software.

For maki this class, she has no idea how to teach it. Entirely subjective grading and very unclear explanations. She will test you on material you have not covered and will take off when you dont know what it means. I would not take her.
How clear and concise she was. I took stats in high school and didnt pass the AP test and didnt understand anything we learned, but when I took it with Wroughton it all made sense to me.

The vídeos for home work are easy, you just watch and write down what she writes in the video, rarely longer than 20 minutes. You do them for every class, but thats all the homework you have. Quizzes are easy bc you can use your notes, and the only actual work you do outside of class is a study guide before each exam, only 4, and she always helps.

I am a senior here, and this was by far the worst class I have ever taken. I have never had this much trouble with any class. Get ready to do proofs DURING tests and have no leeway to provide better or alternative solutions, and don't even think about using outside knowledge or better solutions. If I could, I would have rated this professor a 0

Yes this is a tough class but it is about statistical theory. Dr. Herman does a good job of teaching you and then pushing you another step on homework and take home exams. She is always available to help her students and has a fun personality. I wish I could have taken her for my math classes too.

I think she is the worst professor out there. Makes Sta 205 very difficult by making students participate in so many weekly quiz and test every two weeks. I ended up withdrawal from her class and as of now, find another professor if you want to get good grades

I took a 14 week online course this summer after having failed the class in the spring so I was, but Dr. Herman is amazing! The class is laid out really well and she creates videos for you to watch, which are the only way I could understand anything. imath could be a pain with rounding, but the practice helped me make sure I knew what I was doing

Statistics online is not what I would have preferred but all I could do. Was happy that there are videos that she does that do a good job of explaining things. There are a lot of assignments but I dont think Id be prepared for the exams without them. She also set up a zoom meeting to talk with me when I had questions. Just put in the work!!!

One of the worst instructors I've ever had at NKU. This class doesn't even pertain to my degree, yet it is mandatory to take. It wouldn't be bad if she actually taught the material consisently (i.e. teaching a section and then ask questions that was never mentioned from the lesson). Rude, allows babies in class, wants work to be exactly like hers.

Re-taker here -- I was terrified after failing the first time, but a professor can really make a difference! She cares a lot and was always willing to meet with me in person or in Zoom as the semester changed on us. If you put the effort in to the class you should be fine. Probability is tough but it was much better this time around!

I hate math. I had to take this class for my major and I was very worried about it. The exams will make or break your grade - there are very specific things that Dr. Herman is looking for which can be frustrating but if she notices something consistently or if you come to her with concerns she seems always willing to do a zoom meeting or help!

This has been the worse experience with a professor I have ever had.  He weighs his exams at 70% of the grade, so really don't bother doing all of the random homework he gives you it doesn't really have any impact on your final grade.  I would never take this professor again.  He explains stuff when you ask him, but reads completely off power point

Hands down the worst professor I've ever had for any class in my undergraduate career. I've never seen a professor be more disengaging to his students during lecture. He does no examples with equations in class, doesn't stop and ask if we understand or seem to care if we pay attention or not. All he does is read straight from powerpoints. AVOID!!!!

After seeing the previous reviews on this guy i was worried about taking him. But he has been nothing but great. He answers your questions, if you ASK the questions. He curves tests and his homework/labs are basically completion. Hes a really nice guy, but does have a somewhat monotone voice. Oh and attendance isn't mandatory.

avoid at all costs. classes are death by boredom not very clear but if you ask him to clarify something he will. tests are super long and super hard. sometimes we would be in the test 2 hours past the class end time. tests are nothing like quizzes or homework. if you work your butt off you can get a b/a- but if you can take another prof avoid this1

Dr. Cain is a nice man, but his lecturing style could use considerable improvement. He relied heavily on his own slides but sometimes got confused about them, and questions often resulted in his reiterating previous points without answering the question. His tests were primarily multiple choice & excessively long, and he gave very little feedback.

I must say, this man is extremely talented because I don't think any other human on the planet could make triangles confusing. He could teach the class in Chinese and I'd understand the exact same amount. He knows what he's talking about, but nobody else does! Don't bother coming to class. Let the textbook teach you and you'll be fine.
Dr. Cain is a great professor. He really cares about his students. If you are struggling with class ask for help, he is willing to help you!!!

Okay, Dr. Cain may seem a little strange, but once you get to know him, he's actually really nice and funny. He's the type of professor that reminds you of your grandpa. He's really sweet and is excited to help you if you need it, you just have to ASK. He's a little disorganized and lecture is confusing, but outside of class he is a blessing.
Dr. Cain is a nice man, but he made this course unnecessarily difficult, especially in a course that's for non-physics majors. I would NOT recommend taking his course.

Worst professor at NKU in the graduate program.  I dared to question something the second week of class, and from then on I was marked.  I showed her comments on my papers to a couple other professors who were amazed she was so rude.  Avoid her if you can.

So confusing. She gives you assignments with a generic grading rubric and penalizes you when your submission does not meet her preconceived notion of what the assignment should look like. She is so ridiculous. And I am upset that I have to deal with her ineptitude for another semester.

Worst teacher in the graduate program.  I haven't dealt with anyone so arrogant and lazy at NKU.  She never teaches just opens up the same things from the previous semester and gets upset if you don't understand it.  She has ruined an otherwise good experience for me at NKU.  If you are looking at NKU-look somewhere else as she is it for peds
Learned a lot

Dr. Sauntry is the worst professor I have ever taken. She is arrogant and if you dare disagree with her she will put a mark on your back for the rest of the semester. She does not encourage student growth and learning instead seeking to limit students to her lectures and textbook (even if you can prove she is wrong). An embarrassment to teaching.

Gives a lot of bonus points, so there's no reason to not pass. Lectures tend to be short so most of the time is spent on the lab portion of the class. She always has a great attitude and as long as you do the readings and complete the labs you'll be fine. She'll let you use a sheet of a notes on your quizzes and exams.
It's basically a middle school science class. Show up and do the experiments and you will be fine, they are worth most of the credit.

Seriously the easiest science class at NKU. All we do is the lab exercises out of the coursepack and leave. She maybe had four lectures the whole semester and they were super short. She never wants to stay the whole time we we'd get out like an hour early. She also lets you have a cheat sheet for every quiz and test. She's also super approachable.

Professor Bielewicz is super nice and she understands students at this age level. She is very laid back, but is also very knowledgeable in the field of science. This class is by far the best class to take if you need a science with a lab. If you passed high school science, then you'll pass this class easy. You only need the coursepack, not the book

SUPER easy class. Show up and make a cheat sheet from the test and you'll get an A. SCI 110 was easiest gen-ed ever. Don't buy the textbook and work fast on the experiments and she'll let you leave early.

BEST SCIENCE TEACHER EVER! I have struggled with Science until I found Krissy! She explains everything in a fun, clear way. She goes out of the way to help students. She's amazing. One of the best professors I've ever had!

It was a little difficult to navigate her canvas page because she lists everything under files rather than modules, but I would just look for directions in the assignment tab. She made very clear and well put together lecture videos and assignments were easy to understand. Assignments and quizzes were not difficult to complete.

Her class is easy but i dislike her personality. She is very blunt and came off rude. Curses in class, pushes her political views, and can't stay off her phone. I feel like I wasted my time going to class because she loves to talk and get off topic, and we ended up finishing work at home because we never completed labs in class. Dont buy the book.

If I could give a higher rating for Krissy I definitely would! She is absolutely amazing! Very caring, funny & fun, tells you straight forward what will be expected on tests & quizzes & gives extra credit at times to help. As long as you show up to class, participate, & pay attention (which you should do anyway) then you will do great!

She gets off topic so easily. 10 slides will take the entire class time with her. She rambles on and on about stuff we dont care about. Other than that, shes cool and makes the material easy to understand. Really straightforward class.

It's not easy being her favorite class, but someone's gotta do it. She was really relaxed and didn't put too much pressure on the class. She's extremely approachable if you don't understand something or miss something. She does a great job of preparing the class for a test. Favorite class I've had in 2 years, she made everything fun and relevant.
Don't buy the book. Class is easy. Krissy is kind and caring. I don't pay attention in class and can still easily pass quiz's and tests.

Professor Krissy is fun and always brings excitement to each class. She allows notes on quizzes and test. There is little to no homework. She presents topics that get the entire class talking and makes the class fly by. I learned a lot about things that are present in my life currently. She is personable and always willing to help you understand.

AYO, 

this professor *chef kiss* was the best science professor I ever had. Very caring, respected. Just don't be a douchebag, please.

She is a very intelligent and caring teacher. She loves to joke around with her students which makes the class so much more fun. Even if you don't like science the class is still enjoyable. Krissy is able to break down the hard concepts to something you can understand. Do yourself a favor and take her class. :)

Seriously if you need a science class TAKE HER! She is the best professor I have had at NKU. She made late night classes bearable. She is personable and so helpful! Gives you cheat sheets during tests, there are easy points to earn every week. If you do what you're supposed to do as a college student this is the class to take.

Krissy is great! (that's what she told us to call her) The only way you don't get an A or even a high B in the class is for not doing the work. As long as you can justify an answer, she'll give it to you. A lot of quizzes but you can have a half sheet cheat sheet and for tests, you get a full page cheat sheet. She makes science not so boring!
Not incredibly clear, relies on OWLs to teach you how to do example calculations. This class is crazy hard and he doesn't make it any easier.

In all honesty I'm not good at math, so this class was very challenging. He would lecture about random things, and his voice is slightly monotone. I asked him for help several times and he didn't know how to "simplify it anymore." I would not recommend this professor to anyone that struggles with the math portion of chemistry.

He's a very good person, but some of his lectures are very surface level. There are a few topics that he doesn't quite explain clearly. He doesn't have any multiple choice on exams, so they take longer to finish, but they aren't too hard.

Dr. Farrar is a nice man and he wants his students to succeed. Tough class to learn and to teach - tons of homework - but working problems is how you learn chemistry. I felt very listened to - if you ask him for help he will help you. Get the optional Kotz textbook if you can. If you ask questions and keep up with homework, an A is possible.

Dr. Farrar is super bland and it makes lectures unbearable. He only skims the surface of everything and never gives any examples. His exams are extremely difficult and he will take off for just about anything. He is a nice person but I do not like his teaching style. The class average on one of our exams was a 59% if that tells you anything!
Very helpful with material will always take time out of his day to critique work. Always has a positive mood in class an shows genuine interest the material being covered.

I had Farrar in fall 2019 and I did not have a good time. Homework is on ALEKS. His lectures are not good. He grades stuff VERY late. He did not even begin to start grading lab report until the very end of the semester. He provided very little feedback and was often vague about lab techniques. You have to mostly figure stuff out on your own.

Does not respond to emails, is a very strict grader, and offers little to no feedback on assignements. If you plan to take him for lab, I would switch out. Makes lab exams worth half your grade and is very picky when grading. If you want your grades, you will have to wait until the end of the semseter to receive them.
Much more helpful than my CHE 120L professor. Labs weren't as stressful and I felt I actually understood the content.

Some don't like his class style (no exams, just EOs). You have to get a certain # of Q's of each topic right to pass the EOs (pass/fail). You can retake EOs and he's great with explaining why you got stuff wrong. It can be scary that you have to pass all the EOs to pass, but it means you'll get an A. This style ensures you understand all topics.

Having to pass all EOs to pass the class is scary, but it ensures you understand all topics rather than doing bad on a certain topic on an exam. This also means you'll get an A in the class. Lots of office hours and is always willing to help with homework and questions about EOs.

Professor Farrar's approach to teaching organic chemistry left much to be desired. Their uninspiring lectures and poor communication made the course an excruciating ordeal rather than a valuable learning experience. I earnestly hope that the department takes this feedback and takes steps to improve the educational quality of this crucial subject.

Professor Farrar is a pretty nice guy but I will tell you right now! Listen up! Never take his lecture class because he gives ALEKS. He thinks its a gem but in reality it only makes students hate their lives. These next 7 weeks will be hell for me and if you can take anyone else. The homework is so unbearable it is ridiculous. Also nevergivesgrades

I only had Professor Farrar for the lab so I cannot speak for his chemistry lectures but he rarely put in grades and when we asked him about it he said "he was very far behind" which I understand but we got little to no feedback on previous labs so I did not know if I needed to improve any lab skills throughout the semester.
Aleks based..... You can spend hours on homework and barley make any progress. Aleks explanations often times left me more confused then before. Would not recommend. Terrible way to learn.

He takes several weeks to grade anything turned in. Aleks is a core component of the class and he did not fully understand how the knowledge checks and quizzes within aleks worked until 4 weeks of class left, so if you were at about 70% completion and then took a knowledge check you could be dropped down to 35%. Overall the structure is terrible.

Dr. Farrar was always approachable and available during office hours to answer any questions. If you ask questions and come prepared, it is possible to succeed in this lab. He answered all of my questions in class and through email. The class was set up for us to succeed with effort. I found him to be professional and helpful.

Dr. Farrar does some things really well, and some things really poorly. He is an amazing professor when it comes to explaining topics in detail in lecture. His main flaw is communication. He almost NEVER responds to emails, and your grades will be put in very late. He makes up for these things by giving thorough feedback in his office hours.

The class is definitely a grind, be ready to do lots of homework. With that said, if you stay on top of the homework, such as doing a few problems per night, it's not too much to worry about. His lectures are pretty detailed, but you have to pay attention to. The assessments and grading scale takes getting used to. Farrar is very helping though.

I failed his class and had to repeat in the summer because of his horrendous grading scale. He makes his class basically a pass or fail and thats definitely a no go with chemistry. I barely even passed it in the summer because of how horrible his assessments are and the amount of homework he gives. if your thinking about taking him RUN!!!!!!!!!!!
He keeps his class mostly online and never explains anything well even if you ask.

This class is hard if you're not willing to do work for it. With that being said, his class is pass-fail and the assessments you have to take are confusing because some of the topics are based on his powerpoints but he HEAVILY relies on ALEKS. Get ready to tutor yourself and go to tutoring. Also, he grades everything at the last minute.

I think John is a great person but I would never take his lecture class again. The way his class is structured is he does not have exams he has EOS. They are pass/fail and you can come in at whatever time he sets outside of class to do it. That is the hardest thing. Having to do them outside of class. You need to work so hard to get at least a C.

I had to drop this class because of the difficulty on top of how much time it took. Lectures are NOT helpful at all, and he basically has you teach yourself through ALEKS, which is useless. He doesn't do tests, but does EOs every week instead, which are pass/fail and ONLY outside of class time. Get ready to teach yourself an entire class!

Horrible. Worst class Ive ever taken. Worst college professor Ive ever seen. 0 lectures. Thousands of questions on ALEKS to answer and then assessments that HE makes over completely different things than what was on ALEKS.

This was my first chemistry class since high school. In the beginning, Professor Farrar prefaced the class with "I know this is too much work," and he wasn't kidding. I didn't like the assessment based pass/fail approach that he uses in CHE120/CHE121. The mandatory homework on ALEKS is very helpful, but so time consuming. Be prepared to put in work

Grades are solely based on the exams, which are murder. Expect to have memorized her study guides/followed along and still get a barely passing or even failing grade. Test answers are incredibly specific. You won't do well if you're relying on the class to prepare you for the test.  Lockdown browser and webcam for tests, which feels invasive.

This class was definitely challenging, but I really appreciated it. She really knows her stuff. The grade is made up of 3 exams and a cumulative final, and she uses lockdown browser for all of them. I learned a ton! Take notes off of every powerpoint and study those.. her study guides are very helpful as well!

This class was hard but I really liked the material, it was very interesting. Don't procrastinate all the assignments though because it will get overwhelming very quickly. Her study guides were extremely helpful for the tests but make sure you know everything on them thoroughly.
She's pretty clear with her expectations. She's super open to meeting and talking to students as long as you reach out.

I enjoyed her online class and the material was provided very well that prepared you for the labs and exams. I would take her again. As an employee at a local hospital she apparently a well known and respected nurse.

Debbie cares about her students, replies to emails quickly and is willing to meet with you if you aren't grasping the material. That being said, this class is hard. You have to be diligent about listening to her online lectures and willing to read the PPTs until you get it. The exams are tough, recorded and you cannot go back on the questions.

I've taken this class the previous semester with a different prof. and got a D. Took it again to replace that grade, nope. Might as well kiss your social life goodbye because if you don't spend 24/7 learning the material, you'll do poorly. I've spent more time studying this semester than anything and still fail the tests. Would NOT take w/ her.
