Grades based solely on tests and exams. She holds impossible expectations. Does not attempt to assist you in succeeding/ passing the course. She isnt helpful and is rude and nasty when you reach out for assistance.

She will help with anything you need. I needed to take a few quizzes early due to vacation and she made it so I could do that. She is a very sweet and caring person. She really wants you to succeed and get better.

Professor Dempsey is always available through email, & during her office hours. I recommend definitely studying her powerpoint presentations because that's where all her test & quiz questions come from. I used flashcards to study the material, but it's a great idea to meet with her during office hours & have her quiz you!
not a huge fan of her for an online class, though she may be better in a classroom setting

Hardest class I have ever taken and absolutely ruined my spring semester. Deborah seems like a good teacher, but dear god this course is dense. She will meet with you during office hours and give you plenty of direction, but you still have to memorize 50+ slides to pass tests. Don't take this class unless you want your life to revolve around it.

I had her for CHE 120L, I haven't taken chemistry in a long time (3+ years), and she was always willing to answer my questions during lab. Her exams for lab were very straight forward if you review and knew all the topics on the study guide you were fine. Always responded to my emails if I had any questions, sometimes may have taken a day or two.

I had Dr. Lady Russell in spring 2020 and she is very sweet. Her lectures are mostly clear and she does lots of examples. The exams are fairly challenging and you can have up to two hours to take them, but if you practice the example problems over and over, you should have no trouble. Lots of ALEKS homework, which can be annoying to finish.

Lady Russell is my favorite professor at NKU. Her teaching style worked well for me, and if you actually take the time to study, her tests are very easy. Go to SI and this class becomes a lot easier. She is so nice, and she explains things well in lab, as well. She is easy to talk to if you need help.

I have taken her for CHE120 and 121 lecture/lab and have struggled to learn anything. In this class, you definitely need to learn the material on your own if you want a good grade on the exams. Labs are a nightmare especially if you don't have a good group to work with. If you have the option take a different professor.

Take a different proffesor. Exams are hard to pass. Talks super fast during lectures. Handwriting is a bit complicated to read during lectures. You will have to teach yourself the material in order to pass the exam.

This class is test heavy and not multiple choice. If you do not know the content like the back of your hand for the exam, you will not do well on exams. She is an average lecture professor, but is a tough grader on exams. She has 2-3 homework assignments that are pointless that no one in class takes seriously, with most of the answers online.

Lady Russell assigns homework materials prior to lecture so students can get an idea of what the next lecture will be about.That way, students are more prepared and are learning information for a second time during class. She holds weekly review sessions and offers extra credit on her tests.

Dr. Russell had very tough tests but you could pass as long as you studied & asked questions. I went to her office hours which were very helpful, and I tried to not skip a lecture. While there were participation points for going to lecture it would be best to not miss any of them anyway because if you fall behind it will be difficult to catch up.

This is a very hard class. She clarifies things if you ask questions, but there are hardly any chances to redeem yourself if you do bad on a quiz or exam, considering there aren't alot of grades. I would take her again, but if you cant keep up with her lectures, good luck.

She is really nice and will help you if you have any questions. Tough grader for sure but she gives a chance for extra credit. Her exams practice is nothing to the actual exam so don't focus on them a lot. ALEX homework is really easy but the way it makes you redo things is stupid. Lost a lot of credits because of that. She can be mean LOL

Dr. Russell is very knowledgeable when it comes to the world of chemistry. The problem with that is, it seemed like it was hard for her to "dumb it down" for someone else. She rushes through her lectures. If you do bad on one test you are screwed. She is really nice though. Just wish she would've broken down the material more. Thank god for youtube

The professor knows the material. She just teaches it too fast. If you ask her a question, she becomes frustrated. Her mock exams are different from her actually exams. You might as well learn from You-Tube. If you fail an exam, you might as well drop. It is very hard to get your grae back up. She doesn't "dumb it down" which would've helped.

Gives you questions that she gets confused on how to do. Then turns around and gives you very tricky questions on the tests. She pays no attention to the homeworks so youll have modules due on material that you wont even talk about in class for another week or two. She sometimes teaches you wrong material then tests you on the right.

This has been my worst college experience. She grades so hard; It is ridiculous. She takes points off for the smallest things. She does not respond to emails no matter how many you send her so you never know what you're doing wrong. Thanks to her I no longer have a 4.0. Please pick ANY OTHER professor. You will regret this.

3 exams and a final, no homework, and 3 quizzes on blackboard. He's hilarious and the most unhealthy nutrition professor. He has guided notes which is awesome and tells you everything that is on the exam. The only reason you need the book is for the online quizzes, so just borrow one from someone else. It's all memorization, so study!
Hate this class, he doesn't review and yeah he's funny, but he is also a complete hypocrite when it comes to teaching nutrition. Wish I didn't take this class at all
Science can be a dry class, but this was enjoyable.
He is a very good instructor.  He gives the students a lot of resources to use to study outside of class.  His Purpose Games help a lot.
Shearer is hilarious! There is a lot of content on his exams, but he's really good about telling you what you need to know and what you don't.

One of the best professors. But if you don't study or show up you won't pass. He goes over exactly what he wants you to know for the test and his lectures are always interesting. He's a really funny guy and cares a lot about students. He even puts aside extra hours to help you and will help with BIO 208/209 if you ask. Tests are difficult but fair

King Joe is a great professor that really wants students to succeed. He puts in way more hours than he has to to help students and answer any questions they may have. He is one of the best professors I've ever had and it's a shame he's considering switching careers because he is very good at what he does. Take him while you can.
He's hilarious! Decent lectures, tough tests.

Professor Shearer is great! One of the only professor that I've had where you can genuinely tell that he cares about his students. Loved his lectures, nutrition wasn't something that I really had an interest in but he made it fun. The day before the test he spends reviewing. If you study what he tells you, you should have no problem getting an A.
I should have taken the placement test to get out of this one.

It's an easy A for me, but keep in mind I'm a CS major. She is older but well-informed.  I don't really like the class  b/c her teaching style,  She'll ask you to code something for an example, then take the problem down immediately after, expecting you to have it memorized, then doesn't give you enough time to try it before showing the answer

I thoroughly enjoyed Dr. Wells' class. I had 2 years of programming prior to the class, but did not find the material to be too harsh for students new to programming. Dr. Wells is very kind to her students and is willing to go the extra mile to make sure they succeed and understand.

Dr. wells is a well informed and caring professor. Even though I was new to this whole area of programming, I attended every class in the semester and was able to get through it. But you should try to understand every piece of codes and commands  cause there are some sophisticated programs you will have to do. Overall she is an amazing person.

Took her for INF 120, horrible lectures were you are given a program code but no chance to actually take it down.  quizzes consist of multiple choice and writing a program within 20 minutes.  tests consist of multiple choice and 3-4 programs written.  Horrible professor, does not show knowledge of material.

Like many others have said, she takes down problems before you get a chance to comprehend it or even take a pic of it. The zyBook cost $90 but she uses her own problems within it that there is no help on the internet for. And if the zyBook grades you wrong even though you're right, you won't know it and you won't get any points. Bad class, good TA.

The professor was very unprofessional. If you asked her a question then she would treat you like you were an idiot and give you an attitude. I knew more than the professor did the whole time. She would lock the assignments if you didn't show to class but would then say showing wasn't mandatory. She was very rude to the students who didnt understand

Did not have a good experience. Often would lecture for 30 minutes and then give 10 or 15 minutes to finish coding. If you didn't understand, you will get a zero, tough luck. Assignments were often locked with passwords and had unclear due dates. If you didn't understand, she would not like the fact that you looked for help from other students.

I can tell that Kenneth Roth is very passionate and knowledgeable about programming. Unfortunately, it can be hard to follow his lectures. At times, it can just seem like too much information at once. With that being said, I still recommend his class. He will always take time to help with assignments and to help with your success in the course.

The exams were stupid. They were originally created by a professor about 6 years ago and they current teachers of the class still use them. They are ridiculously hard. They were so hard that the whole class had a 12 point curve.

Dr. Roth is extremely knowledgeable in the IT field. He has years of field-work experience. This course was appropriately difficult for a 4-hundred level course. His tests are difficult. Be ready to study. The labs can be somewhat difficult if you fall behind. I recommend going to class, but many of my classmates didn't. I would recommend him.

Roth will ALWAYS help you if you need it. The lectures aren't too bad. If you want to skip, MAKE SURE you know that there isn't a quiz that day and you should be OK. I would highly recommend going to class on lab days. He gives lots of help on projects that could potentially be confusing. 8.5/10, All around a pretty good class.

Absolutely wonderful professor. Mr. Roth is a great guy and a genius. If you want to work in the IT field one day, this is the best person you could talk to. Not only does Mr. Roth teach you the fundamentals of CIT but he also provides amazing insider tips and advice for those entering the workforce in the future. I have learned SO much.

Excellent class and professor. As long as you get work done you will pass. The material is easy and the labs are very descriptive in what you are supposed to do. The deadlines are clear. If you attend the lectures you will find it easier to do the work, as they have relevant information. Professor Roth is also very helpful if you ask questions.

Great professor, attendance was not mandatory but strongly encouraged. One lab per week and one lecture; these never seemed to disappoint. He always responds to questions immediately and is very caring about his students' education.

Ken was a new professor when I had him and he knew what he was talking about when it came to programming. He makes learning programming incredibly easy. His attendance policy was "if you know what you're doing, don't show up," so I almost never had to go to class, but when I did go, he was willing to help me understand. Projects are very fun also.

Professor Roth is an inspirational, caring, and genuine professor who is my favorite professor of all time at NKU. He always takes time to answer questions thoroughly and isn't afraid to stop his lectures until you get it. Labs are very important, and Roth has a general "you are an adult" attitude about attendance, which is not mandatory, but good.

Ken is an awesome professor, Id highly recommend taking his Internet of things class. His labs were actually enjoyable and I learned a lot. Hes always willing to explain when you dont understand something and will help you through your code. His lectures can be a drag but theyre not that long. Trust me, this professor has your back.

While I think the course could be restructured a bit I really have no qualms with Roth. He's an understanding, caring and all around great professor. He consistently went out of his way to make sure I understood the material. Roth is extraordinarily fair however 447 is a tricky class. If you're having an issue be sure to email him.

Prof. Dilts is awesome. I hate math but she's very good at making the class enjoyable. She's very personable and a sweetheart. You need the book for homework. She gives frequent tests, quizzes and homework, but PLENTY of extra credit opportunities. She drops your lowest quiz grades at the end. As long as you try, you'll pass her class.
She is a great professor who is new to the university. She is always there for her students, and if you need help she is always available on text or email!
I took Ms. Dilts' class my first semester at NKU. Although I am terrible at the subject, she teaches it well, and she makes the classes fun. I look forward to taking her class again this semester!

Great teacher. She will give you her phone number and email if you have questions outside of class. Always looking to help the student. The reviews are basically the test. She helped me like math again.

She is the best ever! She makes math so fun and easy because she is so laid back and funny (like hilarious) She gives extra credit all the time, study guides (that are like the test) she is very helpful and she cares for her students. Lots of homework and quizzes every class but that helps and they're easy. Show up, she'll notice if you don't :)

I have always struggled with Algebra. This being my 3rd time taking the class and finally passed with an A. She is an amazing teacher and truly cares about her students. Im an adult and she helped to make sure I was catching on. She reviews before and after quizzes and test. She funny and witty. Take her, you will be happy you did!!

Math has never clicked with me, but I passed this class with a B+. Mrs. Dilts cares for her students and wants to see them succeed. She gives plenty of extra credit and her study guides are the tests exactly. Homework every night and small quizzes the next day. Easiest class if you keep up with it and always ask questions! Pick her!! You will pass!

Incredibly unclear on all requirements. Lectures move a mile a minute, constantly derailing into off-topic rants. An overwhelming amount of homework, often unrelated to the actual course content. The professor was completely unprepared to teach the course, and got angry and frustrated at students on multiple occasions. Avoid if at all possible.

He cares about students and wants to see them succeed but is new to teaching. There were problems with clarity in assignments and the lecture wasn't formatted very well. At the end of the semester he worked with students to find out what did and what didn't work so that he could improve the class next semester. If you do your work, you'll be fine.
Easy lab, explains things well if you talk to him

Professor Cho is a lot of what I hate about school, constant stress of daily quizzes, projects that have no real discussion/relation to the class. If I were to take this class again, prepare for the mid term and final by using the slides, those tests aren't very coding based, rather questions about coding and defining terms.

In class, Dr. Cho doesn't teach. He reads out his slides and adds very little information. He will call out "this makes sense? ok!" without waiting for a response several times and hits the board really loud with his marker. He refuses to help at all with the homework even though every assignment says "always ask for help with the homework". Awful.

Lectures were pointless and was just him saying the same thing everyday. The midterm and final were half the grade. Feedback was typically minimal if any was given. Class is easy enough to pass since everything is online. Final project was stupid since he makes you use Python for a website.
I loved Dr. Cho he was one of my favorite teachers of sophomore year. His lectures are not the best but he is a super nice guy and willing to help. Very memorable professor.

Has good knowledge but does not know how to teach. If u ask him something, he is going to confuse u even more. The assignments are like fill in the blanks but during exam it is completely different with webcam and having to code from scratch.
He makes everything look hard. Even a slightest of topic seems like a big problem because of heavy explanation. I would never take his class again.

He could improve his teaching style (even though the content's dry as it is), but he does explain concepts in memorable ways that enhance understanding of the content. He also clearly cares about student success! Be prepared to work hard for your grade, but also note that if you give useful feedback, you'll get EXTRA CREDIT.

Dr. Cho is one of the most unorganized professors I have ever seen, though he talks about being proactive and teaches ideas like conceptual integrity, but doesn't implement them himself. His expectations are unclear. Course work is not well integrated to assignments. Most learning is done outside of class, tons of reading and videos. Hypocritical.
This guy goes on off topic rants, his work load is insane and his exams are awful.

Dr. Cho cares about the success of his students and he shows it, but hasn't made much improvement on it. The entire class is very disorganized and does not have much direction, jumping from topic to topic, each of which feels useless but shows up on exams. There are a ton of extra credit opportunities, however, so that is nice.

Dr. Cho has much knowledge to share, wants to see students succeed and for them to become passionate about his subjects. He is still learning how to pass on his knowledge and requests critical feedback to do so. You do have to work for your grade in this class, but college shouldn't be "easy". Very approachable outside of class.
DO NOT TAKE HIS COURSE! DAILY QUIZZES. WE DON'T DO PROGRAMMING. BORING.

This teacher is terrible i wouldn't recommend taking him for this course. he cannot explain things well to you if you are having problems. this course is supposed to teach you java and he doesn't do that he just runs through code with you and makes you do assignments he doesn't go through syntax or anything.

Professor Cho, while sometimes very repetitive and boring, is a good teacher. He explains concepts thoroughly and uses plenty of examples. There are quizzes every class period but only a few from the whole semester are graded, and he tells you when they are. Exams were quite tough, but were reflective of the class.
He goes fast, but if you need help just go and talk to him  he will more than glad to help.

This man is so very boring and confusing. He loves the subject but teaches way over the level of a beginner. He ruined my appreciation of this subject and I can truly say I changed majors because of this man. I feel bad saying all this because he is so nice but he just sucks! Test = Impossible!!!!

He's a difficult teacher but if you really pay attention and keep up with the reading (powerpoints and book), you'll understand everything. Tests aren't that bad if you know the material. He's very detailed about the questions.

Fantastic professor! His little lecture tangents actually help you understand the study of Biology, rather than just the material needed to pass the course.  He posted his leture notes online & gave a sample test & answer key before each exam - what other aids do you need? Those who say he is too difficult need to re-evaluate their Bio major.
Very nice however,Very difficult to follow in his lecture.

I find him difficult at times, but if you are going to the lecture, it shouldn't be that bad. He teaches little things outside of the material that makes it easier to understand.  He ALWAYS makes sure that you understand it, IF you ask. If there's a problem, he is understanding. On quizzes, he gives clues to the questions. I enjoy having lab with h
Very nice guy, but very difficult to follow in lecture. He rambles alot and jumps subjects often. Would not recommend.
He teaches things and then says, "oh, by the way, you don't need to know that."

He is a interesting professor, to say the least.  He tends to ramble through the lecture slides before performing the lab, and his ramble is incredibly boring.  He does joke quite a bit, and most of them are pretty funny.  He is a pretty tough grader on his quizzes.  I don't think I would recommend taking his class if you can get passed it.

Dr. G is an excellent profesor he taught the entire class with enthusiasm other raters mention his "tangents" well these made the class even more interesting Whoever says that this class is hard really should choose a new major if you try come to class and study the powerpoints you will get atleast a B, studying=A dont buy the book you dont need it

Best bio professor I've ever had. He curved his exams. All you have to do is go to class and take a few notes. He gives you the power points online. Study the slides and do good in lab and BAM I got an A in his class. He is a delightful professor it's too bad he retired.

He was very funny.  He made a 7:50AM lab interesting.  He is probably one of the harder profs to take, but you will learn more with him than with most of the other professors.  His level of structure suited me perfectly.
Nit-picky... way too anal about what you right.  Married to SPSS

Very good teacher who brings some humor to class...it is a lot easier to stay awake in his class than other professors who teach the same class.  Test are difficult, but if you study they aren't too bad.

He made this class way harder than it needed to be.  He's a brilliant man and his lectures are incredible, but he does not give structured notes, only posts powerpoints...which are just pictures from the book with no text.  His tests are brutally hard, even if you study.  I study for a week before his exams and still never got an A

He is pretty nice and really into Biology overall, but he tends to talk too smart.  He can't bring down what he is saying to our level so it's hard to understand.  He also wastes lab time talking a LOT.
He was funny, but I fell asleep a lot in the class.  Nice, but didn't really prepare you for the tests.

Absolutly loved this class.  Had a blast and enjoyed having him as a professor.  Quizes and Tests are hard but if you study you will be fine.  Know details of labs and do labwork completely will help a lot.  ASK QUESTIONS!!  He will take time to answer. Very Helpful.

A very nice professor. His lectures can be a little over your head but if you ask for help he is more than willing to give it! Tests are somewhat difficult but with studying you should do fine! Keeps class interesting. His love of Biology is contagious! Overall I would say he is great!

very tough teacher and extremely hard to understand. very monotone but tries to goof off. results in you getting more confused actually. Thompson is a hundred times better. do your best to find another professor. anyone is better than him.

He'll go for about 20 minutes on a topic while you're taking copius notes and then all of sudden say "oh by the way, you don't need to know any of that." He does it so often it's hard to follow his lectures. I personally found him to be a HORRIBLE teacher.
No Comments
I had no clue what was going on class.  After awhile it was kind of pointless to even go!  I suggest taking Dr. Lye!  Dr. Geisman is nice though.
I love him for lab.  He was extremley helpful in class. He would spend one on one time with you if you asked.  Tests actually werent too bad. I would definately take him for 209L
Very enthusiastic about the material.  Overall, he's a nice guy and is always willing to give help whenever possible! Definitley recommend.

Definitely recommend. His lab exams aren't difficult because he gives you handouts on what to study. There's no need to study everything - just what he wants you to learn. I can see how people would think he's unapproachable, but once you get to know him, he eases up a bit. Class average on lab exams was a 78%, which is good for BIO 209.

He is a very excitable person.  He obviously loves biology and makes it easy to understand.  He gives you study guide/reviews material to prepare you for exams.   He is a very approachable and an extremely pleasant person.  He relates to research he has done to help explain relevant materials.

Dr. Hastings is very excited by biology. He was very nice, and was willing to help clarify things most of the time. He gave us study guides and practice quizzes for all of our lab tests. When he assigned homework, if you sent him your answers 24hr ahead of lab, he would look them over. He also looked over the lab report for the semester.
Lab- Hard subject, but Hastings is good at telling you what you need to know. Be prepared to stay the whole time slot, he goes over it until you get it!
he's really good, but sometimes a bit confusing.
Does not like to help students, very unreasonable, he is all-knowing, apparently.
he makes class fun and clearly knows what hes talking about.
its a fun class, and ive learned a lot.

Don't let the previous ratings fool you... Dr. Hastings is an excellent professor!  I was nervous about this class before taking it, but shouldn't have been, I enjoyed coming to his class more than the other 4 that I was taking!  Tests are challenging, but if you thoroughly study your worksheets, there won't be any surprizes.  Demand Tim and Moby:)
Great Lab instructor! If you need a teacher for Bio 209L then take him! He tells you exactly what's going to be on the tests.

He's not very approachable and when you ask a question, he gets kind of short with you. He also plays favorites...so elementary. However, he is a very easy teacher and tells you exactly what is on the test.

He is an awesome teacher! He made things easy to understand and very very helpful.  He also catered to our class's needs instead of sticking straight to the syllabus.  I would totally take another one of his classes!

I had him for Integrated Honors Science a few years ago, he was awesome! He didn't get along well with the god-loving sorority girls, but had more of an open mind than they did! It was fun and one of my favorite college classes so far. Plus, he's kind of attractive, in a mad-scientist-hippie kind of way ;D

Awesome professor but he is not working at NKU anymore. He really loves biology. If you show up to class and take notes you will be ok, his tests come right from the lectures no surprises but they are hard!

Hastings is an amazing professor.  There's no chance of not understanding the material if you go to class.  He makes it extremely easy to pass the class with flying colors as long as you put in a little time and effort.  Hastings gives very detailed feedback on assignments you turn in early.  Easy A while learning a lot. Wish he wasn't retiring :(
Very passionate, puts powerpoints on BB. Would reccomend

Awesome professor.  Very interesting lectures.  He basically tells you what will be on the exam by giving you the exam from last year.  Some questions are word for word the same.  He just rearranges how he asks on the other questions. Easy homework and posts all powerpoints. Loved the class

I recommend him for lab. He gives out work sheets that are very helpful when studying. I enjoyed his lab class. He also loves what he does, and wants you to understand the subject. Very good teacher for a hard class.

This class was very hard but Dr. Hastings is very nice and is willing to ask during class several times, "Are you okay with this?"  My friend thinks he's the coolest.  Some of the reviews say he uses the same tests... He doesn't.
Great professor! He really loves biology. If you show up to class and take notes you should be able to do great on his tests, his tests come right from the lectures no surprises!
That class is so easy for anybody with a halfway-decent background in science.  Kudos to him for driving a motorcycle.
DON'T TAKE HIM.

All his "text books" he claims you can get offline for free this is not true. You never use these books so not a big deal. Professor is hard to understand and is not good with personal boundaries. Take notes in his class and review them religiously before a test or exam. Dont slackoff in the labs and homework from every class and you should pass.

Dr. Sun was very clear about the subject matter, maybe not so much with the exam questions, but as far as actually teaching the material, he made sure everyone understood it. He always asked to make sure we were not confused. I think he's the best E.E.T. professor in the department.

Lots of examples were provided and discussed in the class. He was very thorough in his explanations and would give us hands-on assistance if we needed it.  If we had questions, he would help us arrive at the answer, maybe not by directly telling us how to do the assignment, but he would get us there by making us think. Great Professor!

Dr. Sun has a great teaching style and personality.  He is always well prepared for class, explain the material really well, and really care about the students. A great class, we've learned a lot. I am happy in general!

We did a lot of labs! And since I am a hands on learner, This is the course that I have learned the most, Thank you Dr. Sun. I really got my money's worth out of the lab fee. I learned a lot of great programing logic!
Don't take him.  He makes the tests more difficult than they need to be, so that you won't get a 100.  Boring lectures.
He made every concept very clear and easy for the students to understand. He is always very helpful in the lab.
Doctor sun is very nice and good and you should take his class. This is in no way a way to get him to not care about this site's grade.
Dr. Sun is an exemplary professor that truly wants his students to learn the information he is teaching. Furthermore, Dr. Sun is very thorough in the way that he presents the information.

Dr. Sun is a great Professor. All of his material will come custom-arranged from him and is given only in class. There is no reliance on textbooks because Dr. Sun really knows his stuff. A great result of this is that everything that will be on the tests, you will have extensively covered and practiced during labs, there will be very few surprises.

This is the first full class I have had with Dr. Sun. I am not a traditional student and didn't review material outside of class other than the homework. I still felt like I understood the material well from lectures alone. The complaints are usually from lazy students who want to be given a passing grade without doing any work.

Professor Hunter was an awesome professor! Took time to answer questions and explain everything multiple times until you understood. Even in lab he would spend the extra time with you , would hint at the answers but not hand them out. Very professional, very dedicated to his job.
Was very helpful throughout the semester. Was very forgiving when i mixed up a test day and when i was out for a few weeks with knee surgery! 10/10

Honestly, a great guy. Hilarious lecturer and honestly one of the best at actually having students learn what they're given. Most of the time lab work has to be done outside of lab, but that time is made up from the lack of studying you have to do. His exams aren't meant to be easy or difficult, just to test your knowledge. He does jeopardy reviews

Daniel was a great teacher. I took Geology for a gen-ed credit, and science is not my strong suit. I've been doing great in the class. If you ever don't understand something, just ask him. Most class days, you take notes. He's great!

He's extremely funny and makes lectures entertaining. His lecture slides have lots of sound/animations/memes. He really makes it a fun class for college students to learn. Homework was easy and never required a lot of time to complete. Long due dates and plenty of time to complete homework. Loved him
Easiest Stats teacher at NKU, use to teach high school, very easy!
She isn't the best at answering questions, but at least she's nice. Show up to every class or you're going to get lost fast!

She is nice, but she doesn't always do a very good job at explaining things. I would suggest not missing any classes because she moves fairly quickly. I'm terrible at math and I intend to walk out of her class with at least a B. Overall, she is a decent teacher.

Good teacher. Seems scattered sometimes but she's very nice and tries to make sure everyone understands. Very easy and generous with grades, gives you warnings for quizzes and tells you what to study for tests. Not on campus very much but willing to work with you. I would take her again.

I never understanded stats, and i still dont after this class. She is a very nice person but can not explain the information clearly. Also, do not miss a class or you will be lost for the rest of the year. I left with a B and i think she was VERY generous when giving my grade, but that isn't a complaint.
Works well with students

Feels like a high school class. She lets the students run the class, not fun for someone who understands the material. Moves VERY slow. Did lots of take home tests/quizzes. Given plenty of opportunity to get a good grade. She has a great personality, funny, but not the best teacher.

Easy Class. Math is def not my subject, but with her she goes pretty slow and makes sure everyone has a pretty good grasp on the material. Some take home quizzes and tests which is nice. I would take her again.

Better than all of my other math prof. that I have had at NKU. For below average or average math students like myself, I would highly recommend. As for some of the comments that other here have posted, I think their simply repeating what she says when she makes fun of herself.
No Comments

was frequently unprepared, did not demonstrate sufficient knowledge of the subject, and made the class harder than it should have been, not because she challenged us to learn more, but because she was not a good teacher.

She IS VERY VERY NICE...I have alot of trouble with math and she takes alot of time to MAKE SURE EVERYBODY IS UNDERSTANDING THE WORK AND PASSING.i loved that about her she was a real person not another proffer that want to show everyone that they were smarter and knew more math and failed everyone i got a B and should of got a F- .

This is one of those professors who don't really know too much about the subject they are teaching so in the end just passes everyone so that no one writes bad evaluations about her.  Never really seemed to be prepared or to really know what is going on.  Take her if MAT 109 is the only Math you need because you can get a good grade but won't learn

Easy teacher but we didn't learn anything. It was especially bad because she taught only the first of the 2-parter of Stats. I wasn't prepared well for MAT212. She didn't seem to knwo the material that well either.

Took this class because I had to for my major, and if you ask her anything outside of her notes she CANNOT answer your question. She acts like she doesn't want to be here at all, and rolls her eyes whenever someone asks her a question. Also be prepared to never hear from her outside of class, because she NEVER responds to her emails.

Math is a very hard process for me. Kristin was very explicit when teaching. She was always assessable and returned emails and texts. If you did not understand the material, she would want you to contact her and would talk you through the problems that you were having. She always made sure that everyone understood the material before she moved on

She was the best professor I have ever taken in my entire college degree and I have been in college since I graduated high school in 2010 and have taken over 160 credits between my associates and now. She knows her stuff and relates it to the real world and can explain things multiple ways. She's available through, text, email and in person.

I personally do not like Dr. Zarnowski's teaching style much. He runs through examples on the board non-stop, then leans heavily on online homework problems to get you practice. If you don't get the big picture of the subject, you'll really struggle. His lectures are not super engaging and it is easy to fall behind if you're not a math pro.

One of the worst math professors I have ever had. Doesn't explain problems well even when you ask questions. The only way you can learn in this class is if you copy down the examples that he flies through during lecture and then go to peer tutoring afterward. Don't take.

You will have no issue doing well if you can keep up with his teaching style. Had to retake due to obtaining a D and he was gracious enough to let me into his full course. If you think you're prepared, you're not, so make sure you prioritize this class. Mandatory $120 textbook is almost useless. Don't get placed in without MAT 102 or 103.

He is a really sweet guy, but I cant even explain his teaching style. All he does to teach is write problems on the board and solve them and expects you to know how he got the answer. Webassign homework due at least twice a week, with a lot of problems and the homework doesnt help you learn at all! I would not recommend him to take.

His teaching style is to work out examples on the board, so that might not be for everyone, but he was always willing to answer questions or review something. We pretty much had a quiz and a few webassigns every week along with 5 exams throughout the semester. Exams make up most of your grade (about 80%), so make sure to prepare for them.

Lets just say I was in a tough situation and was struggling with the course due to outside issues. This professor was willing to understand and work with me to pass the course. His lectures where easy to understand and the homework was not overbearing.

He was very good at explaining calc 2 content and there were typically three webassigns a week. I didnt use the textbook much at all and the exams were just like homework assignments so they were fairly easy! I would take him again.

He is a really sweet and understanding guy and always willing to help. Homework is usually assigned twice a week and exams are fairly easy because they are almost identical to the hw problems. Ive had him for two classes and he keeps everything organized and simple. Lectures are the most important part of the class.

I took this course over and eight week period, and while it was difficult, Prof Metzger was always very responsive if I had any questions. It'll be beneficial to you if you watch his tegrity recordings before each class so you know what going on. He knows the subject very well and walks through examples thoroughly to help you with the homework.

I took his online class, and he assigns so much work that I barely have any time for my other courses. His textbook lectures alone take 5-6 hours to get through as he does cover-to-cover chapter assignments. Expect about 12-15 assignments per week, Monday/Wednesday/Friday/Saturday/Sunday, and god forbid you fall behind in the class. Never again.

Naturally, this course is going to be difficult and homework heavy. I took the full length course in person, which I recommend after reading the other ratings. I had maybe 3-4 homework assignments a week and attendance wasn't mandatory. He is quick to respond to emails and will offer help with your assignments if you do attend class.
I took his online course. It was extremely hard and he is a very hard grader. I suggest taking it in person with a different professor.
hard class

This course was very important in the computer science curriculum and Dr. Khan just did a bad job. Lectures are monotonous, boring, and confusing. Homework is sparse and convoluted. Tests are a painful, poorly written nightmare. Good luck getting help outside of class. His courses are low quality and it made me hate computer science.

Dr. Khan seems to have a bad rep, but I had him for CSC 360 and 364 and loved him! I thought his lectures were very clear, and he always told exactly what to study for exams. The classes are somewhat difficult, but I didn't think Khan was bad at all.

Dr. Khan is a nice guy but more importantly he cares that his students are learning and understanding the concepts he covers. The assignments were quite lengthy but if you go to class, ask questions, and work hard you'll be just fine. All of the tests cover the material covered in class.
Assignment heavy but if you do the assignments then you don't really need to study for the exams. I took multiple classes with Rasib and he is great!

He might come off as arrogant but he is one of the nicest professors I've had. Just talk to him. A couple of the assignments and tests are generally tough but if you study and put the time and effort into the class, getting the grade you want won't be too hard. You will LEARN in Dr. K's class most importantly. I'd take him again if I could.

Dr. Khan was a really nice guy. He was very helpful in and out of class. He was always willing to provide assistance. He was very knowledgeable. This class only consisted of 7 assignments, 3 exams, and about 5 quizzes. He made the class fairly easy.

Dr. Khan is nice enough, but his lectures are very dry, but thats partially just the nature of the content. This course was very challenging. We had 2 exams, for which the class average was 68%. There were 5 pop quizzes worth 15% of your grade, so missing class isnt wise. Prepare to actively study. Simply doing the assignments wont cut it.

Lectures were dry and uninteresting day after day. Felt like he was reading directly from the powerpoints and spent too long looking over coding examples without much, if any sort of, elaboration. Had this arrogant attitude that made me not want to ask questions because it felt like he would belittle me for not understanding.
professor rasib has a lot of attitude and he gets really mad if you ask him anything. not helpful at all. I would not recommend taking his class.

This was Dr. Hall's first year here at NKU. She is full of knowledge about Chemistry, and loves it. She is hard at times to get along with, but willing to help out if you just email her. This was an online class, so you really have to be willing to teach yourself some things.
Only nice to you if she likes you. Had a hard time getting help. Don't take online. Doesn't give partial credit, no matter how hard you try.

Dr. Hall can come across as rude in her emails. Her lectures are boring, but she does weekly web conferences, posts practice problem videos, and provides practice tests. The class is HEAVILY based of test scores and the final is cumulative. Weekly assignments and quizzes not worth much.

Only 6 weeks into the semester and I'm doubting if I am going to be able to get a C or not. The WORST professor I have ever taken in my 3 years of college so far. She is extremely nit picky and will count off if you do not follow the directions exactly as they are written. Do yourself a favor and find someone you can actually learn from....

Dr. Hall is very rude and an extremely hard grader. She doesn't give points back when you're correct. Whether you speak to her in person or over email, she can be pretty mean. 90% of her pts in lecture come from tests. In Lab, she grades just as hard, and almost refuses to give 100% on worksheets because "you can't have a perfect paper."

WORST PROFESSOR EVER. I'm all for constructive criticism when I don't understand the material, but she gives the rudest feedback. Instead of explaining why you were wrong and how to fix it, she basically says "sorry you're struggling, get a tutor." She has the worst point system; assignments+quizzes are worth little points and tests are 200 each:)

If you have the opportunity to take this class under another professor, do it. Dr. Hall is the worst professor I've ever had. Assignments and quizzes are worth 1-6 points each, and tests are 200 each so if you do badly on one test, you have nothing to save your grade. The tests are so difficult and the examples she gives don't prepare you well.

DO NOT take Dr. Hall's class. She is the worst professor I have EVER had. I've had to rely on outside sources for MOST of my learning, but it wasn't good enough for her tests. She makes assignments and quizzes worth 1-6 points each but tests are 200 points!? Her feedback is useless. The assignments don't help you prepare for what's on the test.

Dr. Hall is one of the hardest teachers I've ever had and is very unclear about what kind of answer she is looking for. Even my chem lab teachers answers for her aren't correct. The class isn't weighted and most assignments and quizzes are worth 1-4 points with the tests being like 200. Don't pass the tests  don't pass the class. TURN BACK NOW!!!
The other ratings speak for themselves. My dog could teach chemistry better.
Dr. Hall online chemistry is one of the hardest class Ive taken, I felt like I was set up to fail with the exams being worth 200 points and assignments worth 1-4 points.

Dr. Hall's class is SO hard, DO NOT TAKE if you have a choice, I highly recommend taking chem in person. she makes assignments and quizzes worth max 5 points while tests are worth 200, and there are only a few extra credit point opportunities. her lectures are heavy, and she is a strict grader.

Dr. Hall has gotten lots of bad reviews on this site but I totally disagree. I was really worried about taking her class because of these reviews but I did not have choice. As long as you put in the work like you do for your other classes, you will be fine! She is very understanding and explains things well.

I would ask her for help, she would just reiterate the information given and then tell me to solve it from there. She doesn't have office hours and claims that she would give conferences if we really need help, but she won't actually do it. She will give them for tests, but she would tend to do the conferences during other courses times.

I was scared to take the class based on the reviews but now I have real insight. The class is test heavy, but there is many extra credit opportunities. Dr. Hall is always there to answer questions and help. She provides great feedback and multiple chances on homework and quizzes. Just do what's expected of the class, YOU GOT IT.

He is way too smart to teach lower level chem classes. He makes no sense and if you ask a question he rambles and doesn't even answer it. He has no clear grading criteria and will take points off of your labs but won't take points off of other peoples who put the same answers. Would not recommend.

This was Chad's first semester here at NKU, so he was just getting adjusted the things.  He would really make you think if you asked him a question. Sort of left me more confused after I asked for help. I think he may get better as he gets more adapted to the way NKU is in comparison to the other places he's taught.
Chad is the man

I absolutely hated this dude. He spent 90% of chem lab bragging about how much he accomplished by the time he was 19 and all the papers he published and whatever else. He never answered 1 question I had he only replied with other questions or some sort of rhetoric. Extremely cocky and unprofessional.

Chad is alright for the most part, but sometimes when you ask him a question he can be condescending or answer in an off-putting way. He's very enthusiastic about chemistry and can sometimes be overly chatty when you're trying to get a lab done. His pre-lab lectures aren't all that interesting, but he tries. Overall, not too bad.

No matter what Chemistry 115 is a challenging class. I found Chad extremely enthusiastic and passionate about chemistry. He would always answer my questions before class or outside of class. If you really put in effort you will do good in this class. There are several practice problems and he gives extra credit on quizzes and tests.

Chad is a professor who truly loves to teach and cares about how well his students understand the material. He is really really good at making a difficult topic really interesting and easy to understand. I would recommend him to anybody, especially early in your chemistry career.

Chad is always willing to answer questions and make sure you understand the topic, and gives his best effort into making all lectures apply to you in some way. Overall super smart guy who's been where you are.

Be prepared to study. His exams are harder than a 100 level chemistry. If you don't study for the exams and quizzes you are screwed! Be very prepared to put a ton of effort and studying time in for this class.

Bergren has trouble making material clear from her lectures. However, she is more than happy to meet with you during office hours or any time you need help. The class is what you make of it; if you know the material, you'll do well. If not, you'll struggle. Lots of quizzes and lots of exams, but she gives a review sheet the week before the exam

She did not do a very good job of explaining the material that we were covering. She is a HARSH grader, and you must show EVERY step you do or you will not get credit at all. Just be warned, and if you can avoid taking her, I would avoid it at all costs.

I would do my absolute hardest to avoid her. You will save yourself so much stress and time. It's hard to stay afloat when grading is based on extreme technicalities - points are deducted for punctuation and everything must be written in complete sentences to receive credit. Never seen a force working against students when they're trying so hard.

Never take her unless ABSOLUTELY necessary.  She'll take off points if you don't write in complete sentences, put a period at the end of sentences, etc. and you rarely understand what you're going to lose points for until you actually start taking the assessments. Impossible to get an A with her, expect B+ at absolute best.
Try to avoid.

Tony is a nice guy who is willing to help. Ask questions when you are confused! The class was pretty easy except for bash scripting and regular expressions; you HAVE to dedicate time to understand these concepts. I hear he is teaching CIT 383(Scripting) next semester. That class may be difficult, especially if it's bash scripting(Good luck!).

Professor Tony cares about his students, but that doesn't mean he will just hand you a passing grade. If you reach out to him for help, even if you missed an exam, he can be willing to offer a hand. You just have to be upfront about what you don't understand and he will make sure you get it. I really think he is a great professor, just not easy.

I think he knows the material just can't teach it very well. If you have previous experience you might be fine, but his labs are almost impossible because you are expected to be able to figure out what hes wanting. Tests and quizzes are lockdown browser with webcam and many questions are not covered in class. I would not take this professor again.

Means well and wants students to succeed but is awful at teaching. Lectures were unorganized and threw way too much information all at once. If you come into this class with a lack of programming experience, YOU WILL STRUGGLE. Rely on TA and try to get outside help from a tutor. (There is a true lack of support for this course and it's sad)

Dr. Tsetse could use some improvement with course planning and responding to students. On one particular lab, I couldnt acces a specific resource and he didn't respond to any of my emails asking for help and I had to ask another professor jsut to get a B on it. As for the course, we have a 10 page group research paper, a presentation, and a final.

Great professor, makes sure to meet you where you are. Available through email and office hours. Nice, polite and friendly. Can skip class if you can still get the work done. All in all, a good professor who won't make the class any more difficult than it has to be, and is more than willing to help.

On our final group presentations, he was rude and appeared bored. Many times interrupting demanding to answer questions that students had not gotten to yet in their slides, talking over them when they tried to explain. Very disrespectful especially to the students who struggle with public speaking.

Tony is very smart but doesn't know how to teach an intro class. I often leave class more confused than before. We have to write a single spaced, 10 pg, research paper that we have to present at the end of the semester on top of a lab formatted final exam. I could write a 10 pg paper about all the ways tony fails at explaining his confusing lecture
Appreciated.
He is the best professor ever.

This class was super hard because I came in without a lot of programming experience, and there wasnt any sort of accommodation for my lack of previous experience. Would warn against jumpin into this class without experience with RUBY Programming. Good luck

Going in to this class, I knew I would have my work cut out for me and was fully prepared for that. From the very first class, we all knew this professor was no where near qualified to be teaching this course. She was very unorganized with labs, paperwork, and lectures. She didn't know how to teach the subject. Avoid this professor at all costs!!

Awful professor! She never came prepared for class, never did what she said she would and she made everything so much more confusing than it had to be! I could look up an equation online and just use it to solve a problem. She tries to make you ge through 20 steps for one easy problem! Will not take her again if I can help it.
Christa was very eager to help students understand physics. I don't know why these other people gave her such a bad rating, I thought she was great
Nice professor. She's always willing to answer questions and help you when needed. Seems eager to teach and explains thoroughly. Decently lenient and understanding.

This class was HARD. It was especially hard to complete online with a lab. There was a point where I was accused of just plugging numbers into the blanks. That was my snapping point. She finally understood that I really needed help and worked hard to help me. She went above and beyond and met with me on Saturdays, one on one to help me.

I took her online class and in class lab. This class was the biggest joke. Her lectures made absolutely no sense. We would get tested over material and then learn it the next week. Half her assignments don't work. My best advice, unless you're going into astronomy, do not take this professor and do not take astronomy at all.

Do not take this professor. She does not know how to teach. I took her for online and everything was disorganized and hectic. It takes weeks for grades to get put in and she does a bunch of grade changes during finals week when you cant do anything to fix it. Unless you are majoring in astronomy avoid her & this class. crazy hard for entry level.

This was an online course. Was not organized at all. Quizzes had didn't match her lectures at all. tests were hard and no study guides were ever given. went over 5 chapters in three weeks. completely disorganized. nothing we learned in the online lectures correlated with the labs that we had once a week. online course was super disorganized

I took her online class with the weekly lab. The online class was very disorganized and the quizzes did not match up with the confusing lectures. Tests often covered four or five chapters at once with no study guide. Test questions did not correspond to the lectures. Online lectures did not match the lab. It was way too hard for a gen-ed class.

Please, do not take AST115 for your gen ed. This class takes so much time each week, pointless assignments take hours, doesn't help that she loves to hand out 0.9 out of 1 point on many assignments, that is just petty. Very unorganized online class, easy to miss things.

If you want to pass physics don't take him. He is unorganized and doesn't do his job. He picks favorites and if you aren't one of them, then you are screwed. If you need help, he makes you feel like you are the dumbest person alive.

Really disorganized. He consistently would spend all 2 hours of class on only 1-2 physics problems so it was hard to ask questions. He didn't go over material well at all so we had to rely exclusively on the book, which he hadn't even read so he told us things out of the book were wrong. Overall not great at all.

Can't teach you physics because he does not know physics. When you would ask questions about material he would either dodge the question or yell at you. Likes to count questions wrong if you get them right because if you do them a way he does not understand, then to him they are wrong. Worst professor I've ever had. Embarrassing NKU employs him

Professor Neal can be a little disorganized at times but he cares about his students. He will engage you so be prepared to talk. Test questions are straight from the homework or class examples. He drops your lowest grade in each category including tests. Not a hard class to pass if you read the book before lecture and put in the effort on homework.

Neal's class was the hardest class I've taken. The majority of your final percentage in the class comes from the 4 exams you take throughout the semester(he drops the lowest grade). He seems to be a genuinely nice person who cares about his students and although he gets very scatterbrained while lecturing, he is always willing to help if needed.

The subject (Physical chemistry) is one of the hardest classes taught in the field. She is a super nice person, and knows the material, but is a little all over the place, which is not fun in such a hard class.

Professor Daniels is a straightforward professor, which is exactly what I needed in chem. She gives a list of steps, the equation and an example if needed. She had a laidback manner in class and was very approachable when I had questions. She also cares about her students, she emailed me the one day I missed and checked to make sure I was okay.
Very tough grader but has a lot of energy and is very kind and approachable

Everyday I didnt wear my seatbelt to class because it stressed me out so bad. She does not grade on time. She didnt grade all grades for midterm and assignments form sep 10 till last week of classes. She doesnt answers emails fully and avoids important questions. she is a very nice person tho. Relies on lab flow to teach you. Take someone else!
SO FUN!!! But shes tough

He doesnt teach anything; all he does is read from slides on the screen. He told us on the first day of class that he is not a C++ programmer and students have had horrible experiences during the last two times he attempted to teach this class; I wish I had taken him serious and withdrawn because this has turned out to be horrible many of us.
Not hard, uses slides a lot, but helpful when I emailed.

Hands down: WORST professor I've ever had.  He spends the whole class reading directly from slides. Gave answers that contradicted the textbook.  Asked for feedback on why I got a certain grade and he couldn't even tell me.  No clear guidelines on anything and little/no help.  AVOID if possible; otherwise read the book because you're on your own.
I wouldn't take him again for Android. He took way too long to get any grades back to us. Reads way too much from the slides. Overall nice guy but not the best professor.

Had him for Android. Not a bad professor, too longer to grade than I would have liked, but overall he is a super nice guy and was helpful inside and outside of class time. The book he used sucked, but I felt he tried to make up for that. His group project helped me the most (we had a good team).

Clark didnt give any feedback on any assignments until finals week when it was far too late to gain anything from it. His lectures were just him reading off publicly available slides from Google. He would say he is going to assign homework and never do it. He would also start off most classes by talking about his personal/family issues. Avoid him!

Clark is a great guy, but not a great professor. He is really nice and always willing to help out, but his lectures are based on slides you can find for free at home, and he gave little to no feedback throughout the semester. I understand he has a full time job outside of teaching, but it seems he put very little effort into planning the class.

Professor Clark was overall okay. The group project was fun and there was great content in the class, but he was clearly not too interested in it. By the beginning of December I still only had 1 assignment graded (not even the midterm), so expect to never know how you're doing in the class.

Was the least helpful, least clear, and least qualified person for this class. We asked questions he would answer with "It's not important" or "Because of mathematics". Went during office hours to get help time and he didn't do anything to help. Taught myself everything. Finished class a month early and went through review questions rest of time.
Rushes threw material. poor teacher

Absolutely the WORST professor I've EVER had!!! If you asked him questions he would respond by saying that "we should just know" or it "wasn't important". Often he would call our class stupid for not understanding something and say that if we couldn't figure it out we were "doing math wrong" and should change how we learn or study better. He SUCKS!

Horrible professor. If we asked questions, he would respond with "because of mathematics". Additionally, he rushed through the material no matter how much we asked him to slow down to a point where we ended class almost a month early. He called our class stupid several different times and told us that we should change majors and not be teachers.

Took his class this semester and though it was difficult I would take it again. Im terrible at math so I hired a tutor and passed with an A-. His curves saved my test scores and he also dropped lowest homework and quiz grades.

Mr. Collins is a really nice and caring professor. He is a quick responder when you message him and always is willing to help you understand material if you are confused. His test are hard and there is sometimes information on there that you didn't learn in class. His lectures are often really heavy but he does provide extra credit opportunities.

One of the best professors at the college. Is willing to help you with anything and is very accessible outside of class. His tests are easy as long as you come to class, and offers extra credit throughout the semester. Is very easy to talk to and a class I enjoy going to everyday.
Overall Mr. Collins was a great teacher. I took a 100 level course so it was a pretty introductory class. He is funny and very intelligent. His lectures are interesting. Good guy and a good teacher.
Favorite professor!! Learned good information and it was an easy A
had fun, amazing teacher, learned a lot and is willing to meet with you. very accessible
One of the best professors at NKU. Hes very student centered and understanding. Definitely my favorite professor at NKU by far.

My FAVORITE person and professor. I loved coming to his classes and I looked forward to them. Hes amazing, 10/10 recommend. Really makes you understand the material. Teaches you and tells you exactly what you need to know and what is important. Willing to answer any question you have and is easily accessible via email or in-person if need be.
Nicest guy you will ever meet! Very understandable and willing to help in any way he can.

This professor was not that great, but he's the only one who teaches the section. He is a nitpick grader and will not give you an A unless your Lab reports are a replica of his graduate published work. He is also a slow grader and pushes a huge political agenda in class.

Was actually a very good professor. Yes, he was slow at grading but he improved that over the semester. He is working really hard to enhance the class and spend more time in the field than writing lab reports. He cares about the success of his students, and it shows.
He explains things very clearly and is always willing to help.  He's also very funny and always available for questions outside class.

He can be rather unclear about some things, but for the most part, he is very understandable. He explains the steps to labs before starting and even makes comical noises with the actions. During the lab, he walks around to make sure everyone gets it and makes jokes throughout to ease the stress. BIO 150/L is not for those that aren't interested.

One of the best professors I've had at NKU! He was very helpful in and outside of class and explained concepts in terms that were easy to understand. He likes to get to know his students on a personal level and enjoys seeing you succeed. Complete all your work on time and you should easily pass this course and make a lifelong peer!

Out of my four semesters, Professor Castellano is by far my favorite professor at NKU. He is very friendly and relaxed with students. His grading requirements are very clear and you know what to expect with each assignment. I'm excited to take him in my future courses.

This class was super easy, partially because it was fun, and partially because the content was easy. The textbook wasn't necessary, all of the material was in the slides. There were not a ton of grades, but Steve wasn't a tough grader so it didn't really matter. This class was super chill and fun and I would 100% recommend!

Not too bad of a class or instructor. He can sometimes be confusing but is willing to clarify things for you. Lots of assignments in the beginning of semester but they aren't too hard. Lectures are relaxed and attendance isn't mandatory. There are a few presentations and one big end of the semester paper you have to do so have fun with that.

you have to work but everything is graded fairly and quickly. he is so fun and interesting. i also enjoy that he doesn't answer questions directly, he helps you get there on your own. he gets to know everyone by name and developed a relationship with all the students. i really grew in this class bc of the independence he gave us. he's the best!!!
There really isn't anything bad to say about Steve. He's just a good guy and watches over the lab groups as we work. I like Steve.

There was almost no homework outside of class. He is passionate about the topics he teaches. His lectures are easy to follow and take notes on. All quizzes and tests are taken online through canvas in class. He has "active listening quizzes" during lecture in which he answers all the questions on the quiz during the class. Easy A.

Super chill teacher and easy to talk to/ask questions. Gives clear instructions for assignments. Even if he takes off some random points, youll still get a good grade if you follow rubrics. Labs are done in assigned groups, but he pays attention to your group dynamic and will make adjustments throughout the semester. Great guy, would take again.

Steve is a great guy. His class was a challenge, but he gives good feedback so you can improve on the next assignment. Willing to help when he is needed, and will email back quickly. He keeps a consistent schedule all semester, so you know what and when to expect things. You learn a lot of useful skills in this class!
Completely self-taught, and loaded with meaningless busy-work.
One of the worst professors I had. Did not teach at all, completely self-taught myself. The amount of busy-work was crazy.

Don't know why people would complain. Homework is easily found in the book. Quizzes each week and exams cover the quizzes that we already had. Had to read a lot but learned. Professor was available when I asked questions.  I'd take him again.

The worst professor I've had during my college career. I emailed him numerous times with no response. Exams were not over the chapter we were on. Marked my answers wrong even though they were right. I sent him screenshots of proof and still didn't change my grade. Always late on opening assignments due to crazy excuses. Won't take him again.
Quizzes over every chapter. Tests come straight from the quizzes. Had to read but not hard.

He is nice, but his accent can make him hard to understand. Does not go over what is needed in notebook so be sure to find out ahead of class. Be prepared for the actual experiment because he does not help.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS IF IT IS ONLINE!!! He read off another professor's PowerPoint for class. It took him more than half the semester to realize that we were all struggling, despite the numerous emails from multiple students. Owl did not always line up with what we learned in class and was SO HARD!

Dr. Eilers is a man of respect. He taught me if an experiment fails you did not fail you just may discovered something new. Failures are a part of life and you should be happy because I always thought I failed but I learn by asking him questions on what I did wrong and he saw a major improvement in me. I was in his lecture class and he is the best!

Not a good professor to have for a hard class like organic chemistry lab... Hard a hard time understanding him as English is not his first language (he's German). Never really felt like I understood what was going on in lab and it seemed like something went wrong with the experiments every week. Wish there was a different professor teaching lab.

Dr. Eilers is difficult to understand (thick German accent). In lab, he is very helpful if you are polite and pay attention to him during his pre-lab lecture. However, when we went online due to COVID, he was impossible to access outside of class and graded extremely harshly. He is a kind man, but not a great professor to have.

Dr. Cooper is very passionate about Biology and provides very detailed explanations to any questions you have. You need to read and do the reading guides in order to be successful. He is very energetic about Biology and is very easy to talk to.

Dr. Cooper is a really funny professor and explains concepts pretty well. His exams are pretty challenging, however, and you need to make sure you study well for them and attend lecture since exams make up most of your grade. He encourages class discussion and is always open to answering questions that students have.

He is very nice outside of class and can be helpful. His lab is very difficult and very exam-heavy. Does not give study guides and tests are far too difficult for this course level. I did well on the exams but it still was extremely challenging. Dips into study time with over 1hr lectures outside of 50min meetings 2x a week. Could be taught better!
Exams were super difficult and no study guides were given. Lectures were not easy to understand and lots of homework. Definelty wont recomend to take.

Dr Cooper is funny and does make class time rather fun, but that's about it. He is well educated on his material and knows to answer all your questions clearly about in class material, but he doesnt care how you are doing in class. His exams are tricky and if you come to him with issues, he will simply tell you to deal with it. No study guides.

if you can take anyone else for this class, do it! This class was literally just the prof reading from a PowerPoint and exams and some homework. You basically have to teach yourself the material if you want to pass the class.
You must come to lab every day or else you will get behind, you also must understand and memorize how to do the labs step by step.

I loved Dr. Cooper, yes the class is hard but if you keep up with it then its not too bad. There is not outlines of what to study however going through his powerpoints and focusing on what he highlights is key. Overall he is very funny and will help if you reach out to him.

Dr. Cooper is a newer professor, but you almost can't tell because he's pretty good at it. He has his flaws like everyone else, but you know that he is good and passionate about what he does. He does have chapter quizzes BEFORE starting the next unit which is different than other classes, but they're usually pretty straightforward.

I love Dr. Cooper! His class is really challenging and fast paced but if you apply yourself and STUDY will do fine. Attendance is not mandatory but you might miss in class assignments and theres always clicker questions in class for participation (even though you can access them at home lol).
One of the best

Dr. Cooper is amazing. He responds to emails very quickly and will answer any questions you may have. He makes sure to chat with everyone and help them understand what's going on. There is homework outside of class, but as long as you show up and do what you're supposed to, this class should be an easy A.

Dr. Cooper is amazing. Best professor at NKU in the biology department. I've had him for multiple classes and he's so good at teaching and helping you understand. He is very caring about his students and wants nothing more than success for them. I highly recommend taking him if you have the chance.

I joined this class 5 days into the semester. After I joined I immediately started with a 50% (F) because the professor decided to submit a 0 on a quiz that I had no option or ability to take because it was due before I had joined the class. Instead of reopening the quiz or voiding the grade the professor told me to just drop the class.

Not a class you should take if you also work, Based off of the second week of class and a miss understanding on why assignments are assigned on Wednesday and due Thursday night while being an online class. As well as not stating that the assignments will have locked periods and Friday, Saturday, Sunday are unused Very Disrespectful.

I think the bad reviews are based off the weird assignment times (which they kind of are), but this class was so easy and required little time to complete each of the weekly assignments. There is a weekly quiz that opens on a Tuesday and is due on Thursday but they take a max of 15 minutes. Exams aren't even worth that much either and she gives EC.
Great professor. Helps with assignments.
With help from the professor, I learned a lot.

She doesn't give clear instruction on assignments. She provides almost no guidance on the research paper, which is worth 30% of your grade. There aren't many other assignments to boost your grade, just weekly assignments not worth much, which she grades hard. Would not recommend.
Such a rude and horrible person who is not professional and not great at responding properly

I took this as an online health informatics course. You would have a weekly assignment, with little to no explanations. Her assignment due dates, were always inconsistent and at random times. She grades extremely hard, but doesn't give you proper insturctions of what she's looking for. AVOID taking her if you can.

She knows what shes talking about. Passionate about what shes teaching. I really have enjoyed her class and everything you learn about relates and its really interesting. Theres lectures on lectures so you have to pay attention and theres a decent amount of homework/classwork but shes not a harsh grader.

Definitely pay attention in lecture because there's a ton of information to learn, but she's very passionate and informed on the content. Also if you have questions, she is happy to answer them. I loved this class and learned a ton!

Dr. Sanctuary is a great professor. The quizzes pretty much follow the lessons and aren't too difficult. There's lots of assignments, which can become overwhelming on top of other classes, but they should be an easy grade since they're mostly participation/effort. She also provided lots of feedback on assignments AND LOTS of extra credit.

DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE! Professor Sanctuary was very knowledgeable but made this course ENTIRELY too difficult for an entry level course. Her discussion boards were 500 words each, there were exams, projects, and a group paper? Her lectures are so long and she talks very fast, & u have to watch them. Definitely take this course with someone else.

Two 1 hour+ lectures weekly with a quiz and a discussion post (at least 500 words) every week Quizzes follow that weeks lecture OR the week prior. She expects you to apply what you learn to concepts outside of the class which can be difficult Group paper and a nutritional assignment you work on all semester This class is WORKK, no time to learn

The professor makes this class way more difficult than it needs to be. Group paper, quizzes weekly, 2 lectures per week, homework with 500+ required working or homework that has multiple answers to it, and she's a very picky grader. It was almost impossible to make her happy this semester. I would not attend another class she teaches.

This is NOT an introductory course, extremely advanced material is covered in this class. 500+ word discussion posts, large projects, 2 one hour lectures each week. I truly believe Professor Sanctuary made it her goal to make this class entirely too difficult. While she is easy to reach out to via email, she often lacks empathy when problems arise.
This class felt like being lectured by my keto obsessed aunt for a semester about why keto is life changing. Didnt gain anything valuable from the class.

This class featured a quiz and assignment every week. The quiz however isn't in lockdown browser and can be found on quizlet. The professor offers lots of extra credit as well. On the exams if you print out her powerpoint you'll also be fine since they are open note. Overall if you work for it. You'll be ok. Just be prepared to work.

This class was extremely difficult, especially for someone with an eating disorder. It is very focused on your personal health, which I don't think should be included in a college course. Dr. Sanctuary herself was very kind, but inconsiderate of her words and how they made others feel.

Professor Sanctuary makes it her job to have her students hating their life. She is an extremely tough grader with multiple assignments due each week. If there is a discussion post due be ready to write over 500 words to not even receive full credit. With her heavy lectures and lack of empathy I would not recommend this professor to anyone.

Professor sanctuary is ridiculous! It is her personal mission to make you hate your life. There is 2 1 hour lectures a week with a quiz and a homework assignment/discussion post.
