Discussions must be AT LEAST 500 words in length. The lectures a way too long and too packed with information for any normal human with a life to maintain.

10/10 Professor in my opinion. I learned so much from this course. Can be a heavy work load (sometimes) but you literally just have to watch the lectures and pay attention to do well in this class. I don't understand why she has such poor reviews. She was amazing and super super sweet. You can tell she's truly passionate about her class!
assigned way too many assignments and lectures.

This course is very focuses on what YOU eat. You also have 2-3 one hour lectures a week, with 4 assignments due in one week at times. She is not the one to grade your work, it is her TAs. Her way for you to study is 12 page study guides, and only one page of it is on the exam.. Don't take her if you can help it.

I would not take this teacher ever again. She gives you so much work during the week and on exam weeks she still gives you a quiz. But she does give you a lot of assignments so it helps raise your grade but she makes me still want to not be alive.
There's lots of note taking for exam but get to use it. Required lock down browser and web cam. Extra credit availability.

Dr. Sanctuary's class is very informative, if you are looking to get a very good view of nutrition this is the class for you. There are lots of long lectures that become boring after a while. She responds quickly to emails and questions. She is good at setting clear grading standards. Lots of assignments that take a lot of time.

Professor Sancturary was a great teacher overall. The class was definitely a lot of work, but there were plenty of particiption grades available. Exams are opne book, and she responds quickly to emails.

This class is more in depth than I thought, but it was great and I learned a ton. No book required, and as long as you do what she asks you will be great. Listen to the lectures, do the assignments (graded on completion) and use the study guide. Time consuming, but worth it.

She is a very hard grader, she doesn't explain things well, she has noises going on in the background of her lectures so it's hard to concentrate, exams and quizzes are very difficult and more than one answer could be correct a lot of the time, inconsistent with grading.

Required students to pay for a new, incomplete online program that is very weirdly formatted and annoying to use for many different reasons. Many of her lectures have weird noises in the background that make it hard to pay attention to. Didn't initially put a lot of due dates on Canvas, just on the weird website so missed a few assignments
Worst class I've ever taken. Extremely hard have to have a C to pass so have to take it again...

she makes this class more difficult then it needs to be. she gives you 4 lectures to watch and then about 6 assignments that have nothing to do with her lectures or notes. Tests are impossible because they have nothing to do with the material. Nearly impossible to reach or get a concise answer from.

I took this course online. She makes this class a lot harder than it needs to be. It is only a 100 level course. No textbook, but you have to buy a subscription to a website that is annoying to use for a few reasons. They don't relate to the lectures sometimes and due dates don't line up with canvas. Grades pretty rough on discussions as well.

This class was more difficult than 300 level courses I have taken. The information is way too in-depth for a 100 level course. Since this class had no relevance to my major, it is already a nuisance course, however this professor's material was way more complicated than it needed to be. Professor Sanctuary personally was very knowledgeable.

This was an intro class to human nutrition and it was taught very advanced. I learned a lot but there was A LOT of work. There werent exams, they were replaced by projects. I ended with an A in the class but it took a lot of work

At times, I felt like she purposely tried making class harder on us. Expect at least three assignments a week (if its a discussion post, it is LENGTHY). Theres major projects due multiple times throughout the semester, which are difficult. You really have to read the powerpoints closely to pass the quizzes each week.

I don't really have a whole lot to say besides the fact she is obviously one of the best in the entire department. You can tell from the first day of class how good of a professor she is. With that being said, CIT171 is not a tough class in general though.

If I could take every CYS/CIT class with Professor Taylor, without a doubt, I would. Professor Taylor makes the labs and lectures entertaining. Not only did I learn, but I enjoyed the class a lot. If you work hard in her class, she will reward you. If you get the opportunity to take Professor Taylor's classes, you cannot miss them.

I took CIT-130  as well as CIT-171 with professor Emily. She is incredible when it comes to helping students and her lectures are amazing. She puts a lot of efforts to put best practices to make us understand a concept. I would highly recommend you all to take her classes.

She is honestly been one of my favorite professors thus far in my college career. She is always so kind, she cares, honest, not afraid to open class up to discussion because she genuinely cares and wants to know how her students stand on a topic we are covering in class. Feedback given on every assignment even if it was a "Great Job! Keep it up!"

This class is Lab oriented. You didn't need to come to class unless you needed extra help. You can do labs at home. All required texts are provided as well. Taylor is one of my favorite professors of all time. She is incredibly kind, always caring and wanting to connect to students. Great feedback, you can tell she wants her students to succeed.
Great teacher weather at lower level courses or upper level
I owe everything I have achieved in my college career so far. She is by far the best professor at NKU for me. I would take her for my entire 120-hour required credits.

Darci is a wonderful instructor. She really goes above and beyond to make sure her students understand the material; and is more than willing to meet with students outside of class time for extra help. She applies real world experience to her lectures, which keeps you engaged and entertained the whole time. I would highly recommend taking her.
Professor is not recommended in any capacity because labs are outdated and overly difficult, professor lacks caring and is overly intimidating.

This instructor shouldn't have a job. She should've been a prison warden, she would fit right in with the hostility she cultivates. If you voice any concerns she has zero qualms with putting private emails on blast and raising what she sees as a slight against her with administration. Grade A narcissist. Its not her problem, its everyone else's.

Gonna be honest I did not expect to pay $1200 to be treated like I'm working for a wage.

I've worked in the IT industry for 10 years and people like her are universally despised at firms everywhere. Avoid if you can. God help you if this class is required for your degree.
Uses content that is over half a decade old and is stubborned to acknowledge the fact that the class needs to be updated. Gives very cryptic responses if you get one at all.

Darci often states clearly wrong things during lectures. Like saying a SSD is heavier than a HDD. on top of that she often gives mediocre excuses on why her class is outdated. As of 2022 she is still using labs dated in 2011 with seemingly just a "revised" tag on the end of the document. This class is horribly outdated and I hope to god I pass.
Terrible, needs to be fired now. Stuck in the past and a general bad time

Not a great teacher. Had trouble performing the labs and fixing them when students did something wrong. Has the same amount of computer knowledge as a potato. She may have experience but she doesn't show it.

If you have to take her for CIT470, good luck. The labs are severely outdated, she is not willing to help, and her lectures are lackluster. The course is not easy and needs to be redesigned. Many of my classmates have went to the CIT department head and complained about her methods. Do whatever you can to avoid this class and this professor.

Darci is a great teacher if you are willing to learn. So many people dislike her and and ridicule her, but if you actually want to learn she will be there. I did very well in her classes so far just by paying attention and reading, hard concept I know. Read the material, listen to her lectures, and dont be afraid to ask questions. She will be there

Darci is not a good professor. If you have questions, you either don't get an email back or you receive a vague, often condescending email that does not relate to your initial question. Midterm was graded after final exam was taken. Group projects build off eachother but were not graded to know if you even missed anything. She provides no feedback.

Avoid at all costs! Far from engaged. IF she replies to a question her reply is often vague or useless. She is slow to grade the typo-ridden and often out of date labs that she assigns. Google is often more helpful when it comes to learning the material of the class than she is. Her lectures are often all over the place and hard to follow.

Extremely tough course to have her with. Good luck with everything, as her labs do not help you move forward with the assignment. Provides false solutions to help when asking questions. We do not even have our degrees and she is having the whole class fix our virtual machines which is stopping us from completing work.
Difficult class

I was very nervous for this class going in, but Dr. Klein was an amazing professor! He was super lenient on grading and was very clear about what you needed to know for quizzes and exams. One drawback is that he doesn't give formulas for tests but if you study your notes beforehand you will be fine. He is very clear when explaining things.
Missed a test and failed the class. Took it the next semester with Marla Lemmons and learned so much more. Pretty much on your own for learning the material.

This was probably the easiest math class I've ever taken and the professor really explains everything well. However, if you miss a class the next day you'll probably be really lost. The grading is based off of 10 homework assignments and 4 tests but they aren't hard at all as long as you study. Definitely recommend!

This class is great for those who are auditory learners. The text book is not used in class and is only used for review so its better to rent than buy. I would also like to add if you get tired easily, or if you take medicine that will make you tired take this class at 9-12 instead. Professor Klein is hit or miss for some people.

He gives 10 homework assignments and 4 exams. Math has never been easy for me, but he goes (painfully) slow and thoroughly explains everything. The homework is a really good buffer that lets me get feedback on how to do the problems before the test. Klein is a really sweet person and I would reccommend him!

The grading criteria is very clear. Weekly voice chats (like discussion boards), two papers, three exams. Not terribly difficult but you do have to participate to receive points and a decent grade. Exams are essay questions (3-4 sentences, 10-15 questions). Grades fairly easy.

Weekly voice chats (like discussion board), research project, group project, and 2 exams. Exams are a combination of multiple choice and essay questions. Provides clear and thorough feedback, responds quickly to email. You must participate in discussions to receive points.

The lectures are many short videos. Many simple in class assignments that are decent portion of your grade. GO TO CLASS AND YOU WILL PASS. He had a few projects that were easy and step by step, but take over two hours to complete. Exams are hard, but if you complete all assignments & projects you will for sure pass. Always replied immediately.

BIS300 is way below this guy's pay grade. He flies through the material while doing an exceptional job of explaining everything. The homework can be time consuming but his instructions are so well-written that a monkey could get an A. I wish I could've taken higher-level classes from this guy because he is really good.

Anderson is a great professor. Really knows his things and the lectures have a great mixture of short videos throughout. There are A LOT of in-class assignments (EASY POINTS) that aren't noted so show up to class. A lot of work.. many assignments that take hours to complete and a quiz over every chapter (simple). Exams ARE TOUGH! Show up and pass.

I loved having professor Dahlem! I've never been good at science, but he made it super easy to understand. You get 2-4 assignments a week (quizzes included) but they are very simple as long as you use the book. He grades fairly and makes sure you understand everything you need to know. He dropped our lowest quiz and assignment grade.

This was the hardest class I've ever taken in my life and I am a straight A student. You will have a quiz or test every class, the amount of material you will have to study for them is insane. Definitely recommend going to the classes and doing all the worksheets!

I hated this class, nothing made any sense and it was just a bunch of rambling. There was nothing interesting about the class and it was very hard to want to go or stay the whole time. It was so boring and he's so monotone. I hated every minute of being there and I wanted to drop out everyday I was there.
It is awful

Although I liked this class, I will say there is a ton of work required for it. Do the worksheets (not for a grade but they help). Extra credit is available. Do the work on time and you should be fine.
A tough class with lots of homework especially if you carry a full load. Does give extra credit just be ready for lots of work

I used to hate science but Dahlem really opened up my eyes with this class! He really cares about what he teaches which makes it feel like there's meaning behind the class. While there is a lot of work, most of it is sooo easy. If you go to class & pay attention, you'll pass without a doubt

His lecture confused us more than if we hadn't come to class. The first week, he tried to teach us binary -- backwards. He doesn't know how to solve his own in-class examples, and doesn't know how to space or spell correctly so his code gets errors constantly. Assignments are all on ZyBooks, so take the course online and save yourself some time.

He doesnt understand what he is doing. This class is for people who have not coded at all but he teaches as if all people understand coding. The lectures are pointless and he calls people out for not doing well but he does not teach the content. He makes a lot of errors in his programs.

Constantly makes errors in his code that the class has to correct all the time. His tests are completely nonsensical. Python is not a difficult language, yet skilled students end up with 70s on his tests because they use concepts that we never went over in the textbook or in class. I find it offensive to NKU as an institution that he teaches here.
If you don't know programing and hoping you will learn programming here you're wrong.

If its your first time programming, stay away from him. You won't learn ANYTHING from attending classes, so if you are unlucky enough to have him as your professor, get ready to do some serious self learning. He knows stuff but can't explain, grading is unclear and he relies excessively on the $71 online zybook subscription. Avoid him anyhow.

This was a very difficult class and I feel like it would be difficult with whichever professor you have. The lectures are very long and take up a great amount of time. If you don't quiz yourself often, you won't do well. Lots of quizzes

I took Avenido for bio 208 and despite this being a hard semester with covid he really cared about how his students were doing. If you ask him for help when you need it and attend class regularly, you will do fine. Great professor!

Always available outside of class and he is very clear about what you need to know for exams, especially the final. He also offers extra credit. Study what he tells you to and go to SI and you will do fine. I liked his class so much I'm going to take him for 209 too.

I took Anatomy of course, but this was the thing that STRESSED me out 24/7. The content was hard anyways, but Anviedo was hard to get interested in, and stay focused. He gave all of our tests online, on lockdown browser, and made them very difficult. If you do not put all you've got into this class, you won't make it.
Take Dr. Aveindo for BIO 209 lab and lecture. Great professor and answers emails quick!

if you could take BIO 209 in person with a different professor, I definetely would. For his online course he gives PowerPoints and lecture videos that are by someone else. The PowerPoints mostly have pictures on them but you aren't labeling so I do not know why there isn't more helpful information. Exams were extremely hard and lockdown browser.

This class is obviously extremely hard, the professor doesn't matter too much. The online class was terrible. Lectures were not even done by him, he hardly had anything to do with the lecture portion. He is a good lab professor, just be prepared to teach yourself a lot.  He is very helpful outside of class, though.
best professor!

This is a hard course in general but having Dr. Jay as a lab professor was really helpful! He always applauded me for doing well and made sure that he would help people who were struggling. He even reconsidered questions when we talked to him about why we put something on a quiz or test. I would recommend having him as a lab professor!!
Dr. Avenido is amazing! He made Bio 209 enjoyable and I definitely recommend people to take his class!

This was the worst class I have ever taken. The professor did not "teach", he did some power points which were just "OK". When I asked the instructor how to better understand or improve my grade I was told to talk to other students who were doing good . Online courses are for adults who work full-time jobs and can't spend 40 hrs/wk in studyin
Dr. Avenido is a good lecturer, however it is difficult to reach him outside of class. He hardly ever answers emails.

Hes very caring and will do what he can to help you pass the class. The content of this class is difficult regardless of the professor you have. The exams are very hard and you have to study the material almost every day to stay refreshed on what youre learning. If you email him hell most likely help you with whatever you need.

Not sure who let this guy teach, but i dont think he knew what was going. His content was a mess, grading was extremely inconsistent, and overall was horrible. Half of his class is him rambling about anecdotes that are completely pointless or irrelevant. Avoid this professor for all classes if possible (especially DSC classes).

Contrary to many of the posts here, Dr. Adjei was a wonderful professor for me. He was very friendly and approachable, and you can see that he truly believes in his students' success. He can be a good reference to have in the future.

Dr. Adjei is a wealth of knowledge. Sometimes he won't realize the students are not following the advanced topics he's talking about, but if you stop him to ask for help he will make every effort to clear things up. I did not like his tests or some of his presentation styles, but just being in his class is worth it since he radiates so much info.
If possible please don't take his class. I had to choose his class because there was only one class. The way he presented was really really boring and the grading was so tough.

You are no longer on President's List because of this class. I got A- for one-credit class. Guess what? There is no extra credit. He does not follow the syllabus for course grading, there is few assignment so you do not have any chance to increase your grade.
I don't know why he had to make things so complicated. If you can avoid him, do it, DO NOT take his class. I'm so desperate.

This teacher has 0 communication & very disorganized.  Instructions are very confusing for assignments.  Syllabus is not even attached to canvas.  DO NOT TAKE CLASS IF YOU HAVE A MACBOOK !!! Makes you purchase 2 textbooks & only uses 1.  Good luck my friends

Seth Adjei was a very friendly Professor, was very easy to connect with not only on a Student to Professor level but personally as well. I will say this, if you do not put the work in that is necessary to understand the material then you will struggle. Seth is always willing to help and is very knowledgeable.
This professor has no idea what he's teaching! I just don't know who allowed him to teach!
i DONT KNOW WHO LET THIS GUY TEACH
I would not take his class if I had an option, if there was a different professor teaching I would definatly take it instead. I really hate data science now since this guy is teaching this guy

Good professor have a feeling I was in one of the first classes he has taught as a professer has deep understanding of topic and break down topics for students

Mr Adjei however new to NKU and to teaching, does a really good job he knew the topic well and could break it down easily for students new to programming. Wish I could take him for the rest of my programming classes

Dr. Adjei was great. His class was pretty easy even if you have no prior experience in web development. The quizzes, for online sections at least, were long but very easy. I never had to meet up with him outside of class but just from messaging him about certain problems with an assignment or Canvas, he gives thorough answers to any questions.

Do not take Seth's CIT 383 - Scripting. For one, he chose to teach the course using Ruby... one of the least valuable programming languages on the planet. One of the hardest teachers at NKU Nice, approachable, & lenient on deadlines He expects more from you than any other teacher in the college 1st time teaching these classes As a student, did not know most of the languages required & no prior classes are taught to gain these skills - struggled a lot and had to self teach since he did not teach them

Youd be better off teaching yourself. He will make up imaginary meetings to avoid office hours so when you need help he is hard to find. If you already know programming/scripting then this class will be a breeze but without decent knowledge of the material in advance youll feel lost and forever behind with the non stop lab and project assignments

Great Professor. Will help you with as many things on an assignment as you need. Gives students ample time to work on in class quizzes and tasks and walks around to make sure everyone understands. Will be taking him again for INF-284

Professor Noor, is really nice and happy to help if you're struggling. The lectures were fine and followed along with the book which I'd recommend reading. The in-class quizzes could be challenging at times but the class would collaborate along with Professor Noor. He wasn't a tough grader and responded in teams quickly.

I haven't had the chance to have him for an in-person class but online he is horrible. All of the videos he posts are just him reading the slides that are already available to us. There is a major gap in what he teaches and what's in the textbook compared to what you need to do for the assignments. Was lost on many assignments he uses 0 examples.

He makes no sense. He cannot write coherent English and his assignments make no sense. His Powerpoints don't help with a lot of the homework and if you don't have a Networking foundation, you will struggle. He gives feedback, but it doesn't make sense. I asked many I.T. professionals in the field to help me with assignments, but they could not.

Professor Noor never responded to a single email I sent him throughout this class. I had to rely on his TA's to help me. His "lectures" are just him reading slides I could read on my own and many labs were confusing or had wrong instructions.
Very nice guy, he really tried. Hard to understand at times, very soft spoken. Lectures consisted of reading off slides.

Do not take his class. Every homework assignment has at least one or two incorrect steps which leads you to be unable to complete the lab. They are incredibly vague and his spelling and grammar are very hard to understand. He never answers emails. His lectures are just him reading from the PowerPoints word for word and not adding anything to them.

Prof. Noor is cares how his student preform, and during labs he walks around checking if anyone is confused by anything or if they need help. Attendance is technically not required but there is sometimes a class task which requires an access code from him. If technical issues or there mistakes in labs or quizzes, he is understanding helps fix it.
His assignments don't make sense. I literally cannot decipher what he is trying to ask.
Prof Noor is the worst professor I've ever had. He is incredibly disrespectful to students and cannot teach for his life. I have learned absolutely nothing
I loved my honors course with her! The seminar was so much fun. She answers emails and questions outside of class. Take her for honors!!!
It's best to participate in class to get a good grade, whole class was a group project, lectures helpful to assignments, and good feedback on assignments.

Not easy content but very fascinating to learn about if you enjoy neuroimmunology. Heavy emphasis on critical reading and analyzing empirical papers that are accompanied by detail-oriented questions.
Wouldn't have wanted to take this course with any other professor, the best.
The best

I would take more bio classes if I could just have Dr. Williamson. Lectures were amazing and she could make boring things seem interesting. Has a lot of passion about the subject, and cares about student success. She responds quickly to emails and is always nice. Posts fill-in-the-blank PowerPoints to make note taking easier. Take her for BIO150!

This was by far the worst professor I have ever had. Class made no sense and he did not cover materiel he would later quiz on. Every student failed the quizzes and he never acknowledged the continuously bad grades. He made a challenging semester even worse. I am typically a great student and was beyond stressed and frustrated with this professor.

Professor Brandt really made this class possible for me, I didn't feel prepared at all for this class but Brandt really made me feel comfortable about the course and really helped walk me through it. The final being so big is stressful, however if you do the homework and quizzes and study those for the final, you'll do good. I def recommend!

Cool guy, hated his class. I had him for liberal arts math and it was completely useless. The homework would be over in class concepts but sometimes made no sense at all. Very here is this, go further for your homework on your own. The only thing I liked was the end of semester project.

If you can't learn from a textbook then it will be the worst class you ever take. He has you do readings and homework over topics that you have not yet gone over in class and expects you to teach yourself. After that he only does a few examples in class. The only good thing about his class is that he lets you do reassessments on quizzes.

Really nice person, but I would not take him again for any math class. A lot of reading but nothing in the reading is addressed in lecture. Homework is 10 times harder than the examples he uses in class. The daily quizzes are also a lot harder than his examples. Reassessments are nice, but not beneficial when you don’t know what you’re doing.
He was super chill and I absolutely loved his course structure(standard based) I am not a great with big exams and so his structure was a big relief!

Dr Brandt is a fantastic teacher. He is very kind and looks out for the well-being of his students. Everything he does is with the intention of helping the people in his class. Theres a lot of minor projects/assignments but he does that to ensure on grade doesnt severely hurt your overall score for the class.

Dr. Brandt is amazing. He breaks the math down and focuses more on the conceptual side of math, rather than the math itself. He is very funny, and lets you work in groups to discuss problems. There is a weekly quiz, but the only exam is the final. Hes homework heavy so make sure to do it lol

I had the basic calculus knowledge prior to his class so did well in the beginning but still wasn't able to get over 90 on the weekly quizzes. I had a 86-87 in the class but our first test was the final and didn't tell us how it would be or anything other than similar to the quizzes. It was not similar and everyone failed and my grade dropped to C+

Dr Brandt, will not teach you any content. His focus is that you read the book and teach yourself and he will upload his lectures after class but his writing is on a tablet and is not legible. If you want to pass this class you need to already know the subject matter or know someone who knows it. Extremely hard to get help from when needed.
I'll keep it short 1.) Weekly Quizzes 2.) Only test is your FINAL and he won't give you any material for it (not similar to the quizzes) 3.) Went from a B+ to a C+ because of the final
Good experience

He's an alright guy. He just explains some things on a powerpoint, you can take notes on it if you want to. Then every Thursday a lab file is due and you turn it in on the website. Labs are super easy, tests are also online so you can research things you don't understand. Overall easy class, alright teacher.

He just spends the class lecturing, and basically lecturing to himself. He uses powerpoints, but half the time the pics are blurry. He is a nice guy, and the class is an easy A. But I wouldn't take him again if I wanted to seriously learn something.

Everyone saying good things about Professor Bahha has reviewed his CIT 130 class. For CIT 247, Bahha is terrible. Since I only have 350 chars, the most shocking thing was that when I spoke with him after a test, he said that "it was not his job to make sure students understand the content" and "he doesn't care" that only 3 people finished in time.

Dr. Bahha is really helpful! He goes over reviews in class, and every assignment is self-explanatory, though he will help you with anything! He is very lenient and really wants you to learn the material. He keeps it real and his class was interesting and fun to attend.
I took Dr. Bahha's online class. I loved the class because there were no surprises, he posted a weekly calendar that allows you to stay on top of your workload. I loved his class!

This is not an easy class CSC402/502-Advanced Programming Methods  professor is very knowledgeable and willing to go the extra mile to help students. I was dreading this class and actually enjoyed it! He was a big help, will answer all your questions. Great teacher, full of patience for those who needed it.

Bahha is a caring teacher but thats really all he's got going for him. His lectures are mind-numbing and not all that useful, he skips over diagrams and important stuff rather than explaining it. Hands out good grades, but homework and project requirements make next to no sense. Easy class but you will learn nothing.

CSC439 Dr. Bahha was a great teacher that I have ever met he is the very nice only thing you need to do is to complete assignments on the time I wish to get his other classes again! 100 % recommended taking his classes A+. Also, he's my favorite teacher so far. He's really passionate about what he teaches, I've never learned so much in one class.
I take this class CSC539 Software Testing and Maintenance. Best lecturer and projects! I've had in college.

Dr. Bahha is an amazing professor. Not only does he provide good, clear feedback, but he also tries very hard to get to know his students and help each and every one succeed and grow as an individual programmer

Dr. Bahha is such a wonderful professor and person! He makes class very interesting and he truly cares for each and every one of his students. The classes are sometimes difficult to participate in if you don't prepare by the doing the hw beforehand. He does assign 3+ hours of hw for each class, but he's also an easy grader as long as you try.

Dr. Bahha is very knowledgeable and caring. His lectures CSC-539 are very clear and engaging. Take him for a hybrid class! Clear criteria of what is expected from you, and manageable A if you just follow instructions.
I learned a lot in his class take his CSC694 class.

As a person, I really liked him. He was understanding if you had to miss class and was willing to work with you if you couldn't complete an assignment on time. You could tell he isn't used to teaching an introductory course. A lot of the info went way above my head. He did acknowledge this at the end of the course tho, just a little too late.

Graded extremely hard even when you correctly answered questions but they weren't just how he wanted. You can tell he isn't used to teaching introductory courses. Has a thick accent so it is hard to understand when he talks. Expects you to just understand without going into detail or talking about material.

Dr. Nilesh Dixit is one of the best teachers he is very helpful and hes way to teach is very understandable and easy. You always enjoy hes class. Aslo he is always happy to answer any questions any time. He is really very helpful with students.
I really enjoy this class and I learned a lot. Dr. Nilesh make this class essay to understand and makes you enjoy. And he help you with anything you need.

Dr. Dixit really seems to love what he teaches. If you love to get excited and geeky about sweet stuff, this is your man. You will get as much out of working with Dr. Dixit as you put in; getting involved is the way to go!

Honest review here. He's hard, and he isn't going to baby you. This class will at some point confuse you A LOT. WHEN that happens go TALK TO HIM. He will walk you through an exam and hw assignment. He is very accessible and really wants you to do well. Also, if you want to actually get skills to GET A JOB work with him on research and stuff in clas

His class is a little boring, but it's pretty easy. There's 4 "exams" and 2 papers, which are 2-3 pages. No homework. As long as you study what's on the study guide you'll do great on the tests. The maps are especially easy. He likes to show pictures and talk about all the places he's been. He's pretty decent.
No Comments

Easy class. I can't believe some people actually do poorly in this class!  It's like he goes out of his way to give you cake exams.  Sometimes he takes attendance, other times he doesn't.  Seems to get angry about other regions' problems, which can be either entertaining or super boring.  Nice guy in general.

Dr. Mitchell is funny & easy to talk to.  He tells you what's in the test and the map test was easy as well.  I suggest you read prior to class & listen to his lecture. He gives u clue about the test.  His got good stories about his world adventures & fun to listen to if you like traveling. Nice guy, easy to get along with & will recommend him.
Funny, class can be a little slow, but I recommend purely for his eccentricities..."Hit the Bricks!"

Ugh, I would not recommend it to anyone who falls a sleep when bored! He is not very clear in his lectures.  You have a mid-term and final, he grades those hard.  You also have two 12 page papers due.  He is extremely nice and is willing to help, but the class is dreadful.
Class is boring if your not into geography. Hard to pay attention. Tests/Map quizzes arent to bad. Study the material and youll do ok. Teacher is really cool and nice.

He's a nice guy and he's funny. Class gets boring and if you can't stay awake, don't take this class because he'll embarrass you. Easy as can be. I hardly had time to study for his tests and still got B's on them and the 3 page papers are easy! I recommend him.

His teaching style must have changed, because his tests are HARD. He lectures about nothing and when it's time for tests, it's a guessing game. The map quizzes are easy, but the multiple choice questions are NOT. He's very boring and don't fall asleep in class. Aviod him at ALL COST.

He's a nice enough guy, but even as a serious student he's very difficult to follow.  The amount of material he covers each week is insane and you are expected to retain it all, never know what part of it he'll test on.
I enjoyed the class and his stories. Took lots of notes, do well on map quizes and you should be good

I know that a lot of people did not like him but do not let that scare you from his class. He is somewhat hard to follow but the class its self is not very hard. As long as you pay attention you will be fine. He is a really nice guy and loves to talk. I would take him again!
Very easy going and funny.

He seems to like picking on certain students.  He definitely has favorites.  Don't use your cell phone or he will make you leave the class. Do not eat anything in there either. The class isn't too easy and the lectures aren't very exciting.

DO NOT USE YOUR CELL PHONE IN CLASS! He's not very good at explaining things. He talks mostly about things that aren't on the tests. He just shows pictures most of the class. this man is crazy. both the good kind and bad. he loves what he talks about... you can tell that. but he is also crazy about cell phones/talking/sleeping/eating. he will talk for an hour and 15 min about the same things over and over and just give a couple ex. after the first time i understand what he was talking about i stopped listening. HARD tes
This class is hard for 100 level geography and he is not clear about the subject but he has a good personalty and will help you if you come to the office hours
He really is a bad teacher. He is all over the place, talks really highly of himself, and acts like he knows what he is talking about. I don't remember one thing that I learned in that class.

Funny, insightful, helpful, quirky, and truly well-informed. Apply yourself in his classes and read the text on your own time, even if he doesn't reference it in lectures outright. Fred is the man! He's not always clear on the material but he is very enthusiastic. If you can stay awake...go for it.

Drastically oversimplifies the world we live in.   Not very sympathetic towards other people/cultures.  I didn't find him terrilby helpful either.  I did well in his class though.  He rambles a lot and just sits up there and tells stories about how his son

This guy is very monotone. It's really hard to stay awake. When he lectures he is all over the place, I didnt even know what to write down or what was important. The first test was easy but they gradually got harder.

You gotta keep up with studying the maps (you'll have to memorize A LOT of places) and your notes, because thats all the tests are based off of. The material is interesting to me, but a lot of people seem to fall asleep in the classes....also, watch out for pop quizzes.
he was so damn boring, i just couldn't handle it, he rambled and rambled w/ no real reason behind it, fell asleep everyday, but still got a b
Realizes it's just a general studies course Dr. Mitchell makes it pretty easy.  It's an easy class but you do learn some - if you have to take GEO take him!
Brilliant man, has great mannerisms and is really funny if you get his sense of humor.  Really down to earth and kind also. Doesnt take attendance but gives pop quizes without warning.
Not very easy for a 100 level class.  Most boring professor I've ever had.  Extemely hard to pay attention to for more than 1 minute straight, if you are trying your hardest.
I dropped the class due to sheer boredom.  Take someone else who focuses more on the subject at hand than personal vacation stories.
Great guy! Always welcomes you to stop by. He is the best!

His stories are interesting if you like historical stuff and I think I made a b on every test but made an a in the class. Showed up late everyday. Takes attendance.  not strict. can be boring and pointless at times. no papers though!!
pretty easy.. just listen to him..  he makes you want to travel outside out lil country..

Not easy but not hard. He does do pop quizzes. His test aren't that bad. I was usually done in 20-25 min. Lectures were a little hard to stay awake in though. As long as you read the book and catch some of whats coming out of his mouth in lecture you should do okay.

Tough class. His lectures are all over the place, he never finishes his thoughts. If he writes something on the bored, its probably the most important part of the lecture. You will be better off if you rd the sect. & look at the maps before lectures. The map quizzes are a gr8 way 2 rack up pts. He likes to show slides of vacations. Good guy tho.
Fred is a good guy.  He loves geography and if you pay attention in class he gives you everything you need for your test.

Yes geography is hard, but Fred is so helpful, all you have to do is ask h for help and he will gladly. If you study the study guides the you will pass the class with flying colors. Forwarned though, don't use your phone or sleep in class!
Good professor.  Doesn't let you get away with being lazy though.  As long as you do your research and don't bs your papers, you will be fine.  Also, very eccentric and entertaining.

Cool guy with lots of stories and experiences. I had high expectations going into the class and was somewhat disappointed. Lectures can be boring, but lets out early half the time. Put a lot of effort into your papers, he expects a lot on them (even if he seems lax!). Study guides usually have test questions on them.
The class is extremely boring. Extremely. He is super nice and always willing to help. His papers and exams are very hard and require a lot of work and knowledge.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! He is the most unorganized boring professor I've ever had! There were days I would stay up late studying for his quizzes and we would get to class and he would tell us he forgot about it! Not to mention his lectures are so boring it's hard to stay awake, no cell phones or you get kicked out, AND HE NEVERRRR POSTS GRADES!!!!

If you are a foreign with a weak English in this course, you are dead. Very difficult to understand. His jokes are worried. Almost all the lecture is stories about his son. MC test, very hard. Pay attention to the study guide but look for extra info in quizlet or bluestudy, read the book, and each graph. Look for videos on you tube for your written
This was the most lame class i have ever taken.

Most boring class I have ever had the displeasure of sitting through. I have never fallen asleep in class, and I seriously struggled in this one. Class is only out of 240 points. Very strict on eating/texting/attendance. I would definitely pick a different professor.

Fred has done a pretty good job at keeping this class interesting for the most part. Yes, it is kinda slow, it's GEO 100! But he uses a fair amount of voice inflection, funny jokes, and tries to tell funny and relevant stories. If you stay awake and actually listen in class, you could probably get by without the textbook (attempt at your own risk).

This was quite literally the most boring class I have ever experienced in my lifetime. Not only was he extremely boring, but he didn't have any powerpoints, no notes, nothing. So I never knew what to study for the quizzes and tests because all he did was ramble. All the tests had nothing to do with what he rambled about in class either.
If you want a good-ol guy teacher/prof, he's the one.  I recommend him even if you don't like geography.

Basically what everyone else said.  If you want to do good on her test, READ THE BOOK, and not just the day before the test.  Also, write down everything she says in lecture, no matter how minor it seems, there is a good possibility it will be on the test.
OUTSTANDING professor, had her for Nutrition class in 1997.  I recall her being one of the best lecturers I had at NKU, even tho I was a Communication major.
Good at teaching, but exams are very hard. Have to read her notes and text very carefully.

Dr. Pearce is easily one of the best lecturers on campus. She is impossibly knowledgeable within her subject matter and presents material in a clear and concise manner. Attendance is effectively required, and the tests are...intense. Dr. Pearce grades without mercy. Study the notes, the lecture, the book, and you'll do well. Just...don't slack off.
Great teacher. tough material and tough tests. Much study required.
Take good notes and study them hard.  Dr. Pearce is very knowledgable.  Allows 5 points extra credit assignment.
hard test but keeps you interested and very helpful
No Comments

She's a very funny and nice lady, you learn a lot of INTERESTING material in nutrition.  There is a downside, her tests are VERY VERY hard - but it's just a lot of memorization, that's all.  But she's a great professor!
hard
She was the worst professor to have

She is a horrible teacher! Her expectations for learning the material are impossible. I have a 3.8 gpa and I work in nutrition at a hospital and I still dropped it like it was hot. Don't take her- she is unreasonable.

Good news: she provided a packet of notes in the bookstore along with the textbook.  Bad news: it's 52 pages and she expects you to know all of it, plus what she throws in during class.  Knows the stuff well, has lots of experience in her field and I learned a great deal from her, but I still got a C in her class--the only C I've ever received.

I can't believe the negative comments about Dr. Pearce. Her nutrition class was hard but she was very clear in her explanations. I struggled in the class but learned more because of those struggles. It was a tough class but she was great! If you actually want to think and learn, not just pad your GPA, then take one of her classes.

Forgets that she has been repeating the same material for years and students haven't seen it yet! Expects you to be so well versed in the general concepts that you can spend all of your time memorizing the itsy details. Not an understanding prof at all!Her class is the only one that should exist in your world!

A good lecturer, but does not follow the book at all-will give tons of details in lecture and expects you to know every little thing. Tests are tough-not really a check of what you know, more of tricky, check the wording questions. Gets offended if students don't do well on tests. Very tough, but a good lecturer. Memorize every little sentence!

seems to be a really nice lady, very good teacher uses good examples and is good at explaining the material, but ridiculous when it comes to testing/grading/etc. Makes things seem easy in class then tests over stuff that wasn't even covered. Test almost impossible to prepare for-Class average 54%! Brought my A down to a C! :( avoid her if possible
LOL the amount of material that you need to know is ridiculous. Quizzes that are true or false- are you trying to make me cry???

Avoid this class. Her tests and quizzes are very difficult and very detailed oriented. The study guides and outlines are no help at all. I would recommend having taken similar classes or take another professor if you value your GPA.

Yes this class is hard, don't take it if you want an easy A. There are 5 quizzes 3 exams and a cumulative final. Again, its HARD. But I actually really liked her. She's fun and explains things well. I've learned so much from taking this class and use the knowledge in my everyday life. If you are good at memorizing, this class isn't that difficult.
No Comments
she was rude, hard to hear, she played favorites, and she went way too fast

Dr. Pearce is not a bad professor by any means, but her class is definitely not easy. Her tests and quizzes are very detail oriented, and a lot of times they include things that are not on her outlines but over things that she mentions in class. If you skip class a lot you definitely will not pass.

This class is very informative. You learn interesting things and you can apply it to your daily life. You have to study to earn your grade. It is a pretty fair class. DON'T buy the book!!!! All you the things you need to know are in her outline. Even if she does not take attendance you should come to class.
Some of her methods are a bit ridiculous, but overall she is a good professor. I think she could use a little more compassion in some areas, but again overall she is a good professor.

Really learned a lot of information in this class, although it was a tough A to acquire. If you dont attend class you will fail, very lecture heavy. if you have the opportunity to take nutrition online take NUTRITION ONLINE, VERY EASY 'A'

cool teacher. Lecture based. very knowledgeable, was intimidated by reviews on here, but if you pay attention, study and come to class you will do fine. She is excellent at reading e-mails and extra credit when she feels that it is needed.

She is a really great teacher. She tries to make learning fun. She will also help you with any questions you have. As long as you show up and take notes, then you will study. She gives outlines for the chapters so you  just have to fill them in. Great teacher!

Great professor - very smart and helpful. Genuinely fun person.  The material is difficult and confusing, but if you come to class *regularly* it is no problem.  She gives extra credit sometimes too, but not much.  I have learned so much about health and nutrition from this class - and it is applicable to daily life! You will learn so much :D

After reading the reviews on here I was scared to take this class.  I have to say that it wasn't as bad as everyone made it sound.  Just make sure you print the outlines off blackboard and study those.  She is very knowledgeable and helpful.  I also recorded the lectures which really, REALLY helps.  I liked her!
Horrible professor. Notes are terrible. Are to study for test.
Alright teacher. Hard tests, gives you useless study guides.

Avoid. Her quizzes each class period are over the lab that you are about to do, not the previous one. Impossible! The homework assignment we had, she never clarified that it was supposed to be typed, so did not receive full credit for that. Does not give you anything to study off of. Doesn't give you any kind of credit for actually doing the lab.

She's okay, but I would recommend taking this class with a different professor. I've heard others are MUCH easier. You MUST study, A LOT. She tests you on very small details, and she sometimes tries to trick you. All the quizzes are true/false, which is sometimes hard. All the tests are multiple choice. She's not awful, but not easy.
Great teacher but a lot of memorization. Her lectures are never boring.
She knows everything there is to know about nutrition. And she wants to make sure you know it by the time the semester is over. LOL

Sad to see bad reviews on her. I loved Hopper. Very caring/understanding and always willing to answer questions out of class. I asked her at least one question for every experiment and she was always happy to help. Would take her again in a heartbeat.

Dr. Hopper is amazing! She always makes sure you understand what's going on in lab and gives plenty of resources to help set you up and prepare for the lab. Everything was understandable and I 100% recommend Dr. Hopper as a professor!
Dr. Hopper is incredible. Shes very good at explaining things and she strives to make sure everyone is doing well in her class. Cant wait to take her for Analytical chemistry

I like Dr. hopper, she gives regular lectures using pp. her tests are a mix of ALEKS and written parts which I appreciate because all of our homework is ALEKS based making it easier for us to recognize the problems. study/ do your work and you will get an A.

Although I passed with a B, if there are other professors to take, take them instead. Her ppts are so wordy, none of it makes sense. Tests on ALEKS are fine, paper tests are horrible because you can't understand any of her information. Also is VERY hard to reach outside of class because she is 'unplugged' even though her students need to reach her.

I'm not really sure how this guy is a professor. He has incorrect material in his quizzes (which students in past courses and I have corrected him on). When correcting him on his mistakes, he gives credit to the reporter, but doesn't fix the answer in Canvas! I can only assume that the other people got screwed by his error. Easy class, bad prof.

You will learn HTML, CSS , BootStrap, JavaScript. The assignments are fun, creative and engaging. For the final, you got to create a personal website and then redesign a website as a group project. The lectures are good as he is teaching and coding side by side to show real time results. A lot of cute puppies will be seen in his lectures and HW.
One of the better Professors within the department by far. Course material can be hard but for a starter it's beneficial. He keeps his classes engaging and you can tell just enjoys teaching.

Dr. Caporusso was an awesome professor, INF 286 was by far my favorite class this semester. I picked up html and css easily and really enjoyed the creative freedom allowed for the websites. One of the final projects is a group project so be careful to pick good group members.

Dr. Caporusso is one of the best professors I've had. He provides all the resources and help needed to learn and do really well in this course (and get an A!). Classes are interesting and lectures effectively explain the content. He offers a lot of time outside of class to help students - he is passionate and dedicated. Assignments are also fun.

He is a great professor. He gives you the materials you need to learn and offers as much help as you need. Hes a very nice and understanding professor, i HIGHLY recommend taking one of his classes. Also, he loves giving cookies and talks about cute puppies!! How could you not want him as a professor?

Dr. Caporusso is easily the best professor I have studied under.  He is an incredibly talented educator and software engineer, and is passionate about passing down his skillset.  Each class period is full of useful information that feels practical and worth learning, so I would strongly recommend attending whenever possible.
This Professor is awesome, He help you understand what you are learning but also except you to put the work forward. I loved every moment of this class

This was easily one of the better programming courses I've taken. The focus is on learning through engaging projects. The projects tend be quite involved so getting behind will make things extremely difficult. This course is not test-heavy however, if you don't pay attention and show up to class it will be a very difficult struggle.

Professor Caporusso is a blessing. He is incredibly engaging and always puts the work in relation to our future careers in software development as well as in relation to technology in general. This class is fairly easy, though you need to make sure you pay attention to the semester project.
Trash!! B.S contents, waste of time!!

Most amazing professor I have ever taken a course with at NKU. All CS classes am the guy who has no idea what anyone is talking about because the Professors assume we know the words they are using and I dont, they are technical terms. This Professor teaches at your level. You will never be lost in this class!

It is difficult material but taught in an accessible way.  Professor Caporusso will take the time inside and outside of class to help you better understand it if you ask for help. Definately worth it to ask questions in class and participate even if you don't know the answer.

Does not care about students at all. quizzes are worth 15% of grade only and the exams are with 60% so make sure you study for exams. She is very unclear with her teaching so you have to do a lot of self teaching. She doesn't get back to students when they have questions. Overall she is bad.

As a person, I really enjoy Ms. Brinkman. She is always willing to help you if you come in during office hours. But, the lectures are kind of boring. She will go through topics fairly quickly without a chance for you to understand first. If I could recommend anything for future students, make use of her office hours if you need it!!

Gives very less information. Doesn't let u retake. Class is based fully on exams. She don't know haw iMath works. Sometimes she'll go over a problem and not get the right answer herself. Still grades that quiz. Doesn't recommend taking this class

There are a lot of online quizzes that you complete on you own time over material she doesn't explain well. She lectures the whole period and leaves you very confused. She doesn't fully understand how to use iMath, where we take quizzes, and gets wrong answers herself. She's very hard to follow. She shows up late and will keep you later than said

This class was definitely boring, but she's a really nice lady. She really is willing to help and pretty much always offers test retakes. There are a lot of iMath quizzes, but she extends the due dates often and goes through them with you in class.

This is the worst class I've ever taken. The prof was so bad. Do everything you can to avoid taking this prof. She was very disorganized and I didn't learn a single thing. I am a straight A student and walked away with a C

. Units 1 and 3 are simple, but the middle unit was difficult and I almost failed the exam.  she offers retakes on the exam and provides a video explaining the questions for the retake. Hard to get adjusted to but was okay toward the end. She does require a lockdown browser but allows formula sheets and Z-Charts to be used on tests.

Amazing teacher and lady, Her class was okay school is boring in general but this class was okay to me. Sometimes late but no judge maybe something came up. Being there was not mandatory so that's cool but defiantly try to make it everyday. Overall I would defiantly take again

AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! Doesn't even try to offer a coherent course. Assignments appear at random with no instructions, lectures don't exist, and if you ask for help don't expect any meaningful response. I can't even begin to describe what a disappointment this course was. DO NOT TAKE!!!

Most people do not reach out for help. This is where everyone goes wrong. If you ever need help John is available almost at any time in the day. He can help you online through discord or if you actually show up to class he can help there. Although he doesn't lecture often, the point of going to class is for 1 on 1 help if you need it. Great guy.

Professor Musgrave is one of the most understanding professors I've ever had. When I had to leave for a family member's funeral, he extended a turn-in date for me way past the original. Even though attendance is not mandatory, he provides extra credit for the students that show up. If you run into trouble, he's more than happy to help you out.

Musgrave gets a bad wrap.  He is extremely intelligent in his field, and helps students with any questions.  The course is extremely easy and he will support you if you are stuck.  Definitely take him.

Musgrave seems to have developed as a teacher a lot since a lot of these reviews have been posted. He cares a lot about his students and is always able to provide help. His assignments are easy to do if you pay attention and show up to class.

Professor Musgrave class is easy especially for a GEN-ED, but he doesn't explain HOW to code, he explains how it WORKS. Final exam is a project w/ a partner, not a test which is nice, but his midterm exam had nothing to do with what we learned. I did not do well on the midterm, but do all the assignments and you are guaranteed to get at least an A-

This guy is hilarious. Ended up giving D although I had b plus grade in the canvas. When asked, he never replied. All those assignments were really tough although it was an introductory class. His lectures were crap. He literally finished java script in first day and moved on to the tougher concepts. Never take his classes

He takes forever to respond and is of no help when he does. He assigns homework that is impossible for him to help with, therefore you are on your own entirely. Takes forever to grade anything so it's hard to know how you're doing until it's too late.
He goes way too fast and gets mad when you don't understand something. Assignments are hard and not really explained. Doesn't like when you ask questions. would never take his class again.

Professor Ali is an okay teacher. The work isn't too hard except all the case studies we do that are worth 70-80 points. He's really bad at answering emails and gets annoyed when students ask questions in class. I would suggest finding another professor because he's not the worst but definitely not the best.

I literally dropped his class after the first day. He expected us to know everything and got mad at us when we didn't know the answer to a question (on the very first day of class). He seemed so annoyed with everyone and acted like he hates being a teacher. I would never take a class with him.

He was no help. To be frank, he made me feel like I was stupid. I reached out so many times with questions and he would not help. He takes days to reply. Another review said this course would have been better without a professor and I completely agree. I feel like I was stripped the opportunity to exceed in this class because of him

This class is more difficult than it should be and the instructor is of no help. He is unreachable and when he does reply, he "can't help" with the issue. Assignments are automatically graded on Cengage. It would be beneficial to actually teach the class before assignments. An instructor is basically useless for this class.

He was not able to explain Discrete Math very well. In fact, he makes students do the work with multiple "presentation problems" every class, taking up way too much time. Worse, he doesn't even correct us when we're wrong! He doesn't seem to understand the material well, and it's fairly difficult material. At least his exams are cake.

GREAT professor. Loves what he does. Assigns homework every class...but only 3-4 problems. If you keep up, take notes, and put forth effort to learn, you'll do OK. I had to work HARD in this class b/c I'm awful in math-but pulled out an A. He lets you have an index card of any cheat notes, f&B on exams and a whole page f&b on the final.

He was an awesome math prof., having previously taken this course at NKU and with a different prof. (and failing) I can positively say he is the best prof. to take if math isn't your best subject.  Really understood how to teach a low level math course, understood how to help students and wasn't too boring, homework every night, but not to hard

Nice professor. He's pretty good at explaning math concepts. Only a couple of HW problems a night, and a few exams. Textbook wasn't used except when you had a project to present. I didn't enjoy the student presentations. Sometimes I had a hard time understanding what they were explaning and didn't understand the homework problems every time.
Great teacher. mer with me outside of class with this class and even ones he wasnt teaching me. Great guy and very nice and explains it like u dont know it, so he gets it into your head.
I think his MAT114 class is really easy and he is very thorough in his teaching!
Great teacher, very enthusiastic! I love vector spaces!!!

Professor Wilkinson is a wonderful professor, who will take that time to explain problems in you need extra help.  Not a lot of homework, and plenty of time to finish the homework he does assign.  I ended up with an A in the class, and word problems are a whole lot easier to do now.
Great teacher.  Easy to deal with.  Grades very fair.

He is hte best math teacher I have ever had.  I got a 97% on a math test, I have never gotten above a B in math since the 5th grade.  Very nice, very clear, and very good at bringing somewhat difficult math down to your level.
Don't take this class unless you like Geometry.  Graded on grammer.  Takes a point off for being late.

Math professor so most of the programs assigned were math based. Not always clear on what we were trying to learn, but he did his best to help if you shot him an email. Only complaint is that you didn't know what you're grade was because he didn't post them throughout the semester.

I hate math, but he is Cool. I had some problems this semeseter and he was very understanding. Homework is easy, only 3 or so problems, and grades easy. Allows us to make a "cheat sheet" for tests which HELP!!!  First half of class attendance is recorded, after that he doesn't care. I recommend him. Highest score i have ever gotten in a math class.

Easy class if you pay attention and take notes. Lets you take in an index card cheat sheet for tests and a whole page for the final. Have to write a research paper and do a presentation, but he grades very fair and it wasn't hard at all to get an A in this class.  Homework every day, but 5 or less problems.

Weird guy, Super excited about mathmatics. Good teacher, really understands teaching a low lvl math class, He is very smart. Willing to work with students outside of the class, and very understanding if you have problems. work includes, some geometry, problem solving,and probablility. Good class to take, minimal homework, easy A if you do the work.
Great Professor! If you have a problem with something,he will work with you outside of class. Also, math is his passion, therefore, he knows his stuff.

I think he is an excellent calculus 2 professor. He is very clear, and uses many examples to demonstrate concepts. He makes it clear what will be on his exams, so as long as you do your homework assignments and attend class, you should be fine. I think he's kinda goofy, which makes the 5 credit hours a week less tedious.

Nice guy, but does not know how to take control of a class. During my section several students spoke loudly during his lectures making it near impossible for me, who is bad a math anyway, to hear him. He said nothing to these and continued on lecturing. Very frustrating

Professor Wilkinson is kind of a dork.  We got weekly assignments he makes up and gives assignments from the book everyday, but he doesn't grade book assignments that hard.  Tests were difficult but you're allowed to have a cheatsheet for notes and whatever you want.  Attendance not required, but his notes are rather useless unless you're there.
Good teacher, available outside class, tested over material that was covered (no trick questions), homework every night but I didn't have any issues keeping up with it.
Sweetest man you'll ever meet. If you have any questions, he's more than willing to help you.
This man is an angel sent to the mathematical world. No one on Earth loves math as much as this man. He admits to being lazy, but you can't blame him because he's a mathematician.
Professor Wilkinson is such a great guy. He's dorky and loves math a ton. This class was an absolute cakewalk if you had basically any kind of programming background.

I did every assignment and never understood a thing we learned in class. Online learning was extensive difficult and he did not teach enough. He was helpful outside of class but there is so much homework.

He is so well organized it's scary. You could teach yourself the class just by reading his notes, and you'd have fun too. I wish I could've taken more math classes from Dr. Wilkinson because he takes even relatively difficult topics and makes them effortlessly easy. If for some reason you do have trouble, he's more than happy to help you.

I had him in my second semester for MAT 229. He was an easy grader, very nice, and willing to explain to you everything in case you don't understand. Tests were a bit heavy but if you put effort into studying and do practice exams everything will be easy.
Very chill professor, pretty boring but is very helpful and nice to students. Work for this course in particular is incredibly light and easy, as well as the exams.
Steven Wilkinson is one of the best professor I have come through.He is an inspirational teacher .He makes thing very easy. He is least strict and teaches in very friendly.
Very lenient- even after missing many classes I was able to get an A in the class he was very sweet and would answer any questions you have

He was very unclear in lectures and would rely on students for answers, then realize halfway through lecture that there was an incorrect answer, leading to a lot of unclear notes. A lot of assignments, and some group work. I am not sure about tests as I did not stick around long enough. Lectures left me confused and looking for answers elsewhere.

Dr. Wilkinson is a good guy. For a 5-credit math class, I don't think anyone died, but it was pretty tough. He gives an insane amount of homework, which usually have pretty challenging problems, but his exams are very straightforward and easy. He also spends like the first half of every single class going over questions anyone had on homework.

He's very knowledgeable of the content, and his exams are easy if you understand the basics. There is a lot of homework, but heck it's a 5 CREDIT HOUR CLASS! I would take him again for future classes.

I might not have done half as well in my calculus class if not for Dr. Wilkinsons engaging lectures and great feedback. He always gave plenty of time during class for questions on homework. I would love to take more calculus with him.

Poor communicator. Open response exams with short times. Unclear feedback, assistance, and lectures. Tough grader, poor course outline, and inappropriate political rants. Poorly represents the department. Other GLY professors really care and support their students. Content isn't difficult but the deliverance is painful and hard to interpret.

I find it hard to believe this woman has a PhD. I had to remind her to post 3 out of our 4 exams and had to email her at least once a week about opening canvas modules. She threatened to stop posting lectures she recorded LAST semester for us and to just let us read the textbook for the rest of the semester. I honestly think she forgot ab our class

Dr. Mihindukulasooriya was a bad professor. Several times we had issues with the information she was presenting and she basically just told us to figure it out and would not give any guidance. There were times where she actually gave us the wrong information and corrected it a week later after the class had already done the calculations. BAD!

Do not take this class. you will spend 2-5 hours attempting to listen to boring lectures each week; her three midterms are insanely difficult as the info is different than her study guides; ; she simply copies and pastes from other courses. I am a straight A student who read all the negative reviews and still took her class--learn from me!

I'm a little thrown off by the other reviews here.. Her class is difficult, yes, but as long as you do the work you'll be fine. Some tips: Copy and paste the quiz and assignment Q&As into Quizlet to study for exams. Take notes on the lectures so you'll remember them, and don't be afraid to look up stuff on google. 
As a person, she seems sweet.

Gave very unclear instructions in half broken English on class presentations that are 20% of your final grade. The schedule is buried deep in canvas along with the instructions (not discussed in class). Is generally rude in person and in announcements.

Overly complicated class page. Participation activities were pointless. Lots of work but I didnt learn anything from it. A lot of nonfunctioning/incorrect assignment or lecture links. Stayed behind in grading and posted lectures late. I cant tell if shes unprepared, struggling with canvas, or not paying attention.

This online class is so disorganized. She never posts lectures at the same time - some days 8 am, others 8 pm. Her tests are on quizlet so it was easy - but the questions dont even come from lectures! So whats the point? Its so hard to understand her english. No clue what shes saying most of the time. Terrible class, terrible professor.

This class is quite hard just like other med/surg classes but she is straight to the point. Lets us know what is important and tells lots of stories. She is very funny too. Very test heavy but that is expected. I have learned a lot from her. Lectures are interesting, but teaches very very fast so gotta keep up :)

This class was made very challenging by this professor. She would fly through class and the information and tell you not to study specific material and then ask very detailed questions over the topics she told us to not learn for exams. Exams are unfair and she treats students with little understanding.

During the last week of this class my Dad died and she made this time much more stressful. She continued to recommend that I drop the class and restart next semester, after finishing the class. I failed the final 3 days later and she refused to sign my application for late withdrawal. I was then dismissed from the program after years of work.
Professor Kelley really cares about her students and will always email back quickly. She uses lots of class activities and makes class fun. Shes one of the best professors Ive had in the program!

She was the best I had in the program. In class, she moves quickly so you have to pay attention to pass exams- but she's hilarious and down to earth. I was hospitalized during her course and missed several classes so she spent 8 hrs with me outside of class to make sure I passed the final. Anyone who fails probably shouldn't be an RN.
Dr Kelley was my favorite professor.  You do need to attend class but she tells lots of funny stories to make it fun.

Erin Kelley is one of the best professors in the program. Lectures are fast paced, but fun. Always made herself available outside of class and was always willing to reframe content to make it understandable. Exams were very straightforward and so is she. Her teaching made this medsurg the easiest by far.

Best teacher I've ever had! I'm excited for every class because she's so engaging and always has awesome, hilarious stories. If you're struggling, literally talk to her. She's kind and happy to help. Occasional group work in class, never busy work. Everything she teaches/assigns helps prepare for the test. Just listen + study the ppts --> succeed
This instructor rushes through lectures then makes exams on information that was not covered.  This is a hard class to complete with this instructor.
DO NOT TAKE!

This was the first Stats class I've taken and it wasn't terrible but also not good. All lectures are prerecorded from a previous year. Examples she uses are irrelevant and hard to understand. The homework for this class was very pointless. Quizzes each week give you some kind of idea of how the exam will be. Choose a different professor if you can.

worst professor I've ever had.  I hope she has to give teaching up.  her class isn't hard she just wants to feel like someone important and try and grade hard for that reason. if you can avoid taking her I would advise that. hopefully NKU decides to get rid of her. NKU seems to have great professors and I hate for her to keep the bad rep around.

I really like Dr. Herman's online teaching methods. Using a lockdown browser is forcing me to actually study and learn the material necessary, instead of BS-ing for a grade. She is effective at teaching, and I think a lot of people don't like her because she is not lenient on deadlines or extra credit, even though that was outlined in the syllabus.

I would rather drop out and forget my degree if I have to take her again. Her lectures are recorded but she just reiterates what's on the document she's recording. Having to use lockdown browser is unnecessary stress for students which very likely will cause a lower grade, myself included.

I appreciated how this course was laid out by Dr. Herman. Her lectures online show exactly how a question should be answered on a quiz/test. She is a tough grader, but gives some leniency (i.e. taking the lowest 2 quiz scores off). She is ironclad about her deadlines, but it's all in the syllabus. I don't understand why her rating isn't higher...

Awful professor her teaching method is atrocious, its impossible to learn from her you have to teach yourself. She piles tons of homework on you and provides absolutely NO feedback. I had no choice but to take this professor, but honestly if I could go back Id literally take this course at another university online to avoid her!

Anything math-related is definitely not my strong suit, but I really like Dr. Herman's teaching style. I took this course online, which I was nervous about at first, but ended up doing well. Dr. Herman is very responsive to questions and is very willing to help you if you speak up and ask for help when needed.

DO NOT TAKE ANY OF HER CLASSES! More than likely most of her positive ratings and comments she has received has been posted by her. She is THAT person. Hard to understand her she talks so fast. Tells you "come seek me out" for help outside of class but when you do you get 10 mins. I know several people who have failed her class. Horrible Professor
Easily one of the best professors I've had. Classes always have a good balance between lecture and discussion, and she'll always take the time to give you feedback you can understand.

Dr. Parker is one of THE best professors I've ever had. You can tell she cares deeply about all of her students and wants to make sure you pass. The class is pretty easy as long as you keep up with the short, 3 question reading quizzes and the occasional short paper. She explains the content clearly and will answer any question you have.

I had issues with her taking points off of my in class assignments for tardiness. I explained my sitituation and she continued to take points off, however she referred me to someone that can help which I appreciate
The class was very difficult and easy to fall behind in if you do not understand one topic.
She is easily the best professor I have had. She takes students' needs into consideration and really cares about learning over grades. I highly recommend taking any of her courses if possible.
Nidhi is my favorite professor at NKU. Unlike other professors who say they're passionate about teaching and act otherwise, she truly shows it. she cares about her students.
Great Professor! Very knowledgeable about the subject matter. You have to try hard to fail her course. Highly recommend!
Nice and awesome teacher. will get easily A in her class. very helpful with any questions you have, even about your career. Love her.

Honestly, while professor Patel is very knowledgeable, she is by no means passionate about teaching. She pretty much just read from the power point slides, which were general overviews of the subject matter. This was a 3 hour class, but we were always done in 1. She didn't really teach at all, this was mostly a self learning course.

She has been one of my favorite professors to date, she is caring and understanding and an excellent professor. She tries hard to fix any misunderstanding you might have. She accepted late assignments!
