A great professor who really knows her stuff. Contrary to what others have said, I found her to be very empathetic and helpful. Her course is lecture heavy, but I would not say it is that difficult necessarily. If you pay attention you'll be fine.

Fearon has promise to be a good professor but I don't think she quite understands how difficult she makes this should-be-simple class. There is an INSANE amount of memorization that you have to do for the 5 exams (not including midterm or final.) On one test, there could be 40+ terms you have to know ALONG with everything else you learned. Terrible

Jamie is a great teacher in that she will go to great lengths to explain content when you ask for help and is a very upbeat well spoken professor. Beware her 100 level courses are harder than upper level courses . The workload and reading is heavy. Skimming through content and you will not pass. Must be prepared and be dedicated to pass.

Here is how bad Professor Fearon is... I'm taking the time out of my day to create an account on this website to write this review. This is a 100 level class that was harder than graduate level classes I took as a senior before graduate school. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR FOR ANY REASON UNLESS YOU ARE OKAY WITH CONSTANT STRESS AND ZERO HELP!

For any freshman that is reading this-- DO NOT TAKE PROFESSOR FEARON!!! Save yourself the trouble and stress of being her student if you're new to college courses. If you're interested in wanting to pull your hair out 24/7 and have a professor with zero empathy, she is the one for you. Otherwise, please do NOT take her!!!

Here's the deal. She is a great person who genuinely wants you to succeed. I have gone to every class, watched her prelecture videos, read the book, done all assignments, and still feel lost every class. She tries to help, but sometimes it doesn't click. Prepare to do extra work if physics is hard for you. curves exams and offers EC for off. hours

Although her lectures are confusing at times and she struggles in explaining certain topics, she truly cares about her students and wants us to do good and will help as much as she can. Gives awesome partial credit on exams if you are on the right track but I spent a lot of time teaching myself outside of class. Extra credit for going to office hrs

This was her first year as a professor, so she may improve. However, I had an AWFUL experience. She was always late to class, didn't have an open door policy, couldn't answer questions about the chapter, and made everything 1000X more confusing than it needed to be. The grade I earned was all thanks to myself from the work I did outside of class.

As her first experience as a professor, Dr. Senanayake certainly has things to improve on, but overall my experience in her class was great. Though lectures and homework could be confusing at times, she was willing to offer help. Hard work on homework and exam study guides made the exams a piece as cake as well. Dr. Senanayke wants you to succeed.
Great professor who understands the struggles of being a student.

Evans is a great professor. Although your grade is weighed a lot based on the exams, he makes it easy to take notes to help prepare for those exams. If you attend his class and put in the work its an easy A for such a confusing subject.
Evans is amazing he makes sure you know everything and wont hesitate to help you if needed
caring nice teacher, I am horrible with numbers but, he makes the class so people can get through it without too much stress. Him or another stats teacher? -- take from him.
He is the best teacher I have ever had!!! Makes everything so easy!

He's fantastic! Best math teacher I have ever had in my entire Life. He actually helped me understand and pass math comfortably. I have disabilities and he worked with me. He gave me the feedback and encouragement I needed to pass. He's amazing! I highly recommended choosing him and talk to him if you're concerned during and after class!

I have never good good at math and he really helped me pass this class. Definitely cared about his students and wanted you to succeed. Called me one time to discuss why I wasn't coming to class and ways to really help me get better at math. An amazing professor.
Im terrible at math, but professor evans makes it easy. Youll take guided notes everyday and will have a quiz due every Sunday. Easy A

I would definitely take this professor again! I had J. Herman the semester before and got a C-. Her lectures were monotonous and confusing. I never knew what she expected and many times the exam would not be at all what I expected. Mr. Evans makes it very clear what objectives are and what is going to be tested. I give Mr. Evans an A++++.
Very easy going professor. Attendance is not needed and lectures are recorded. Lots of homework but theres time to do it and theres also a lot of quizzes but they are good practices

Accent/stutter is tough to listen to (English is not his primary language. For most instructors, this isn't a problem. For him, it's debilitating). Cancelled MANY classes spur-of-the-moment. Example code often featured bugs he couldn't fix but promised to by next class (he never did). HW assignments were beyond hard. Avoid.
Gives good feedback and always available to answer any questions you have!
Fabulous teacher

Classes consisted of this professor reading straight from the PowerPoints. While the PowerPoints are generally okay, sometimes they just have incorrect information. Also, he mostly focuses on the ideas behind the concepts of AI, but doesn't explain how to implement them. This makes it really hard to do the projects that he expects us to do.

Reads lectures straight from PowerPoint slides and rarely actually shows the implementation of what we are doing, making assignments difficult at times. He also hardly graded anything for most of the semester. He is however very kind willing to help as best he can outside of class.

Professor Tao clearly cares about all his students and is happy help. I recommend taking advantage of office hours if you don't understand something. Additionally, I felt that the amount of extra credit available for CSC 360 was more than fair. If you put in the effort, you will succeed.

Doesn't teach classes, just uses and makes TAs' do everything. Doesn't grade tests or assignments until after exams. Uses previous professors slides, tests, handouts, that he doesn't understand. Doesn't actually teach anything that will be on exams, just relies on you to already know it somehow.

Lectures are literally lectures from OTHER PROFESSORS. Like is that even legal? Never ever reaches out. The TA does everything for him. The lectures are usually pretty confusing considering they're not even his. The TA has to give his own lecture after to clear things up. Basically makes us figure it all out ourselves. And a ridiculous of reading.

Uses other professors lecture vids, slides, and assignments. TA does all grading including answering emails which Rana does not. Tests, assignments, and the midterm were assigned over spring break. Massive amounts of reading. Rana literally does not do anything in this class other than put his name on the syllabus. That is not a joke. Do not take.

Doesn't make lectures or assignments. Uses other professors and doesnt understand them. Doesnt answer emails. TA does everything including the grades. Multiple assignments were assigned over spring break along with the midterm. Very rude, short, and unhelpful in the few emails that he actually sends. Dont take any of his classes you will regret it.

Avoid this professor. He was late on our first day of class. He seemed to have a chip on his shoulder like he was overqualified for the class. Ph.D. seems to be his whole personality and I question the legitimacy of his title, because how do you get that far and not know how to make your own presentations. Our TA taught our class 100x better.

If she could slow down while talking and realize that not everyone just got out of high school Chem.  She might be a good teacher.  I am glad she is in college though, I would not want her teaching my son in high school. AVOID AT ALL COST!!

Mrs. Fields is an awsome lady! She is very helpful to all her students. She does take attendance, and you do have to study for the tests. She has alot of fun with her students, or at least she did with my class. I got a B and did not buy the book.
A pleasure to attend this class!

Very helpful! She really helped me to understand such a difficult subject. She's doesn't hand out grades by any means, but if you put the time in and make sure you keep up with the course load you should do well in her class. Definitely not an intimidating Organic professor.
She is a great teacher. She is a little fast pace. She gave quizzes once or twice a week, but that wasn't a bad thing, it helped you practice what you need to work on. I recommend her.

Not very happy with her willingness to help clarify any misunderstandings from lecture.  She seems bothered when coming to her for one on one after class, and almost regards you as a dunce when it is just something you can't grasp.  I would not recommend her if you don't like math.  Fields is very speedy with this part.  Which is most of the course
She works to make the class interesting, and is always available for help.  I enjoyed her class.

I took Fields my 2nd time around for organic CHE and I didn't have to study even half as hard for her class as I did in the previous Professor's.  She explained the material so clearly that all the homework seemed relatively easy and with a some studying you can get A's on all the exams.  Very approachable, always available for help. Read the book.
Okay very diffucult class. Make sure you ask questions
Yikes... This class is HARD... she is the best out of the teachers.. but man she is hard my friends
SO HARD and she got a major attitude with me more than once

I had her for organic lab and her lab exams were easy (at least compared to the other available profs).  She was always ready to answer questions and had a very good attitude towards everyone in the class.
very hard class unless you have next to perfect attendance dont expect too much help
No Comments

Gwen is an awesome teacher!  She is more than willing to meet with students in her office for extra help.  She even held some extra instruction classes to help (even came in on her day off for this!) Tests are kind of hard, but lots of 5 pt. quizzes to help bring up grades.   I would highly recommend her for this class!

ok, pretty intensive in the summer, but seriously makes chem interesting..but the material was pretty hard and even with her explanantion though mild it still doesn't allow the students to grasp everythign she throws at you on the exam and quizzes.  lab was pretty harsh too, a lot of experimentation and writing up formulas...
She is an excellentg teacher.  If you are having trouble understanding something she tries her best to work with you.  She is very very nice too!!

I should just write "UGH!".  That's what she wrote on my homework once.  I really thought that was kind of immature and rude.  Her attempts to get people to ask questions all the time mean nothing with an attitude like that.

Mrs Fields is super nice! She makes class fun and interesting.  She tries her best to make sure everyone understands. She gives a LOT of quizes that are only around 5 questions. Her exams are pretty tough too. I would recommend taking her for chem if you love taking quizes

She goes so fast, bring a vidoe cam to record if  you cant write 100 words per min. And if you don't understand something to bad.  There is no help[ with SI for this class in the first month, nor is there help with tutoring since they didnot get tutors untill 1 1/2 months after class started.
I've had Prof. Fields for several classes.  She's awesome!!!  Chem lab is a breeze!  If you don't understand go to her, she will break it down for you!

Dr. Fields is the best! I highly recommend her! I took her in prechem, gen-chem, and now organic! If you are willing to work you will be rewarded! Her lectures are clear, her study guides are awesome, and the grading criteria is specific. I've taken other Chemistry professors and none of them compare to her!

Will give extra credit at the beginning of the semester and on tests. Weekly quizzes but will drop a few of them. Expect some owl homework, but it's not a lot and you get several attempts. You won't pass if you skip class. Great professor, explains everything as much as she can and will elaborate if you ask. Have taken her for all my chem classes.

Her Assignments are not easy, and she grades tough on lab protocol and report! Her tests are a little easier though! She is an amazing teacher, and is willing to help if you work hard! She is my favorite professor!

Very good lecturer, especially for lab. I felt as though I could ask her a question at any point during the lab and she would do her best to explain it thoroughly. I would definitely recommend taking her for any class, whether it's General Chemistry, Organic or Biology related.
Great professor, tough class but she gives a lot of opportunities for success.
Had her for two labs in a row. Nice, approachable professor that wants to see you succeed. Quizzes and tests are fairly simple if you actually do the readings and take good notes in lab.

I had her for Organic Lab and although she was a very sweet and personable woman, she grades extremely hard on your protocols and post-labs. Also, her tests were near impossible.  I loved her for lecture but wish I had a different lab profesor.

I had little to no background in chemistry coming into this class, and I ended up with an A. Dr. Fields gives concise instruction and goes through concepts very thoroughly. She doesn't hesitate to go over questions if you are unclear about something. Lots of homework, but you learn the material. The only time I used the book was for extra review.

She is sometimes difficult to follow, she likes to rush through a million things in lecture. She is not a very caring professor, you get the impression she does not care about her students. Meeting with her outside of class does not get you anywhere, if you ask for help she'll just tell you to go to tutoring.

not clear about assignments/deadlines. Looks for any excuse to take off points. YOU WILL NOT GET FULL CREDIT ON ANY ASSIGNMENT EVER. Class regularly runs over by 30 minutes. If you turn in anything even 10 seconds late, points are taken off. Horrible experience.
Great professor but irritating voice
Shes awesome

Easy if you attend class and take good notes. The text book is used for your own practice to do problems. HW is online and is easy if you pay attention. I thought that Mrs. Fields was a great teacher and I would definitely take her again!!

Mrs. Fields is a wonderful professor. Although she is a firm believer in partial credit, her lectures are fantastic and you can do well if you put in the effort to study. She is very accessible and helpful outside of class during her office hours and she goes out of her way to plan study sessions before exams.

Mrs. Fields was an adorable teacher! She really cared about the student's grades and if half the class missed something she would not count it. She offered an extra review session and gave previous tests out for practice.

Prof. Fields is one of the best professors I've ever had. She explains everything very clearly, chemistry is difficult as it is but she makes it so much easier to understand. She is very strict about assignment deadlines though, no late work is ever accepted.

Her lectures are in depth and thorough. If you are one to skip classes, this will not be the class for you. Missing 1 class can mean missing a lot and falling behind very quickly. 3 or 4 tests plus a research paper/presentation. I didn't care for the research paper/presentation because it was a group project and I had lazy group members.

Not easy class, difficult lecture, too much simple maths (you will hate conversions). Pay attention to quizzes and OWL. MC test. The book is your salvation, it is very clearly. I'm a foreign and even with my poor English I could get a B+ almost an A-. Buy the book in Amazon is better or look for the Student Facebook to buy and sell your books.

Best chemistry teacher. She is very good at explaining the concepts and is easy to understand. This is a hard class but she does her best to help you out.  In Organic you really need to spend the time studying your notes and reviewing the material- this is not an easy class. Do your OWLs, study for quizes and especially for tests.

She is a good professor, she can be hard though!! But I really like her, just participate in the class, and answer questions she asks even if youre not 100%!! I'd take her again for 102, and I'm taking her for 120!

This class is very easy if you pay attention and do the OWL homework. Her tests cover pretty much exact examples of what she shows you in class. She explains everything very well and is very willing to answer questions. I highly recommend her classes.

Took her for chem 102 & Im currently taking her for chem 120. Class isn't mandatory, but if you miss you will get behind. Always keep up with OWL homework because it's a lot, but she gives plenty of time to do it so don't wait. She writes ALL notes on board, and always ask if anyone has questions. Frequent quizzes to keep you up to date. Loved her

Chem is not an easy class... Great instructor! held in/out of class reviews b4 tests. Teaches several upper chem classes, super knowledgeable, if you get confused tell her, goes out of her way to help. Pract tests are similar to test, but not exact, but all info taught and on owl. Participate, practice, and answer ?'s in lect and you'll do fine.

Dr. Fields comes off intimidating, but she is really sweet. If you go out of your way for help during her office hours, she is more than happy to help. She is very articulate in her explanations and specific about her expectations. She grades extremely fast and is a pretty tough grader. The course is naturally difficult, so you HAVE TO keep up.

I love how she explains everything in detail, which really helps connect the ideas. I did have to take 1st 310 and 311 with other profs and they were much, much harder to learn from and less informative, plus more boring. Dr. Fields is a pro lecturer, rather than researcher, so she isnt judgy and cares about your learning. Good luck with your 310!

Professor Fields does a great job at explaining in class, you will definitely need to take notes or you will not have a clue what is happening. One thing that really stands out about her class is that the class before an exam she will send out a practice test and then go over it in class, which is extremely helpful.

She is amazing lecturer and really good at explain stuff. However, she is super smart and sometimes I have trouble understanding her. I love her but if you get sick you can't turn in stuff late. If you struggle with taking test and test timing I would recommend not taking the MWF classes. She is great professor though!

Really good lectures and offers lots of opportunities for help. It is a hard class with difficult content, but if you pay attention in class, attend SI sessions, and prepare for the exams, you'll do fine. She gives lots of opportunities for points. She doesn't accept late work, but drops some quiz grades and stuff. Highly recommend.

Amazing lectures! We always went so in depth and I was never afraid to ask a question. Be sure to do your Aktiv HW every night, it will impact your grade a lot, and it was honestly the best way for me to study and get practice.

Although you have homework every night, they are easy points because they are only two points and she grades very easy on them. If you attempt them, you get at least 1.5/2. Also, she gives practice test that are the equivilent to the real thing, just changing values and some multiple choice. I recommend.

Although she has homework every night, they are only two points and she grades them easy. Also, she gives practice tests that are very similar to the actual test. She just switches some multiple choice and changes teh numbers in the math sections. Overall, a good professor.

Absolutely one of the best professors I've ever had. While chem is not an easy subject, she gives so much help. While there is homework every night it's super short and only worth 2 points. She does review days before the exams, and she gives you a past exam that is almost a copy of your exam. If you can take her, you absolutely should!

Great as a person, but doesn't give good, clear feedback and takes off points for every little thing. I'd have her check my notebook before I turned it in and she'd still take points off. Didn't email back when I had questions. I've heard good things about her for lecture, but skip her if it's a lab.

Dr. Fields doesn't make Organic Chemistry lab any harder than it needs to be. She is explicit about what needs to happen in the lab, and will remind you that you're not graded on how well your experiment went. She can be intimidating, but very easy to actually work with.

She is a terrible teacher because she will give you problems to balance and you have to put charges and state it is in and if you don't you will miss half the points. She doesn't understand that students need longer than 45 minutes for her test.

As someone who isn't very good with chemistry, I ended up learning a lot. Her explanations of the material is extremely clear and as long as you go to class then it shouldn't be difficult to catch on to the materials. She never minded answering questions or going over the materials if someone was lost. She offered study sessions before every test

By far the best chemistry professor Ive had. She is very clear on the first day of class about her expectations and how she teaches. no powerpoints or recorded lectures. She writes everything on the board. Therefore attendance is key. Its important to note: NO MAKE UP WORK. She answers questions and is available through email or office hours.

Worst professor I've had a NKU. She doesn't give anything to look at in lectures, she just sits there and talks and draws/writes some things on the board. She doesn't seem to care at all since I tried to meet with her multiple times one-on-one and she told me to come to her office hours which were on zoom with others included. Don't take her.

There were a LOT of assignments. This includes labs and homework assignments. The good thing about this was, if you bombed a couple, the other ones kept your grade up. I had trouble with the final and last two tests, but other than that I learned a bunch.
Great Teacher. Covers a lot of materials and gives a lot of homework, but I also learnt a lot. I highly recommend him. And he is very hot too!
Awesome laid back professor though he told us he is much more harder for his CS classes. Learned a lot. I would recommend.

He is a great professor and will do anything to help you understand the concepts behind html or javascript code. He demands a lot out of you. 16 homework assignments, 3 group projects, and 4 exams. I did walk out of his class knowing that I learned something though.

Absolutely the best CSC professor you'll find. Very cool, laid back; not arrogant...he's kind've like an extremely intelligent student; listens to cool music in his office and while he's explaining things to you.

Please Don?t Take Fox class. The Course May Be Easy but He is Hard, His Grading is Terrible and Will Frustrate You on Little Mistake Other Prof. Might Wave. Be Advice if Fox Is the Only Person Taking a Class You Must Take To Graduate. Please Wait Till the Next Semester to Take It with Different Prof. This guy will make you hate turning on your lapt
Took online course. Assignments and projects graded promptly and fairly, answered all miscellaneous questions via email. Helpful and learned something from the class. Recommended.
loved his class. he is sooo hot too! take him, will help anyone

Test are very hard.  Very intelligent professor but goes through the material very fast and tried to cram so much material in that I don't remember much of it at all. Would be better if he would slow down so you can actually learn the material.  Explains very well but again goes VERY fast.
Great professor. Goes through the stuff fast and is easy to understand and makes the topic somewhat interesting most of the time, making the 3 hour class semi-bearable.
He is very concerned about being fair to the students, a lot of work but I learn better that way
VERY good professor! I would take him if I could. Expect to do a lot of homework but also expect to learn a lot. Very fair grader and very good at explaining things.

This professor while brilliant is in my optinion an utter failure as a professor. I am currently taking this professor for 2 classes (currently fall 2006 semester). He goes over coursework extremely quickly, does not give adequate feedback. Does not answer basic questions on his material. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR - AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
Good professor with a lot of enthusiam for the material. Covers a lot of material quickly, but will stop and go over things if asked. Definitely one of the best profs in the department.
Gives hard tests, good thing the labs are much easier.  Other than that, seems like a good guy, I'd recommend him.  Doesn't take attendance, and you don't need the book for CSC 150.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! I DO NOT agree with other students who say that they learn a lot from him just BECAUSE he has difficult tests / assigns lots of homework.  It is better to learn fewer things but have enough time to digest the practice rather than fly over the material, try to learn, but have problems because of the pace of material presented.

This class was extremely tough, but not because he is a bad teacher. The reason this course is difficult is because there is such an unbelievable amount of material to cover, at no fault of the professor. Dr. Richard Fox is unarguably the best teacher I have ever had.  I learned more in this class than in the entirety of high school.

This is a tough class because of all the information that needs to be covered.  Dr Fox offered plenty off extra credit with the discussion boards so make sure to do all  of them. The tests are extremely tough because the are over 5 chapters each. Very knowledgeable, he wrote the text book. Great Professor!
Test are super hard, our class average for the fist one was in the 50's. However, there is an endless amount of extra credit you can earn on the dis. boards. Labs can be long and boring.

Dr. Fox is a very excellent professor. If you miss more than one or two classes, you'll definitely be struggling, unless you're already an expert at this stuff. I feel like he really tried to make his office hours clear and open. Anytime I asked for help, he lead me down the right path. Don't be afraid of CSC 362. Fox is there to help.
he is very enthusiastic about the topics in the class so he tends to make his class very demanding but if you pay attention you will learn a lot.

Dr. Fox is a very good instructor; he explains things very well, is very knowledgeable, and advocates your success. I was a little bit put off by how hard his tests are and how hard he sometimes grades things, but he is otherwise a very good instructor. From my experience in Fall 2016, he didn't enforce attendance, but he strongly encouraged it.

Dr. Fox is a superb professor. He knows what he's talking about and is able to answer basically any question. If he doesn't know then he says that rather than making up some answer. The class was incredibly difficult though. He taught it well, but there is a TON of material in it so nothing gets particularly focused on.

Dr. Fox is a genius. This class wasn't too bad, but programming in old languages was a bit of a struggle because of how few resources there are out there. There are quite a few assignments but no tests. The final was essentially just asking us what we thought of the class. It's a fun elective if you have room for it.
Great teacher! If you want to learn the subject, TAKE HIM!!!!! He is SUPER teacher!!!

Except about 10 hours of homework a week outside of class. One assignment took about 20 hours.   Exams are very long, but he only allots 75 minutes to take them.  They usually have 30 questions, a third of which require you to write time consuming scripts.  Not lax on grading, but very forgiving of his own mistakes while explaining material.

Dr. Fox is one of the best professors in the computer science department. He's able to effectively explain complicated material which would stump a lot of other professors. If you're taking CSC 362 prepare to take a pretty hard class. The material itself isn't too hard to grasp but there's a lot of material that needs to be covered for the course.

Dr. Fox is a very good professor. He will go out of his way to help you succeed in his class. In this class, quizzes are very difficult, but he gives numerous opportunities for extra credit. I got over 100 points extra credit just by doing discussion board posts. I never scored higher than an 80% on any quiz all semester and got a B+ in the class.

Very laid back but genius professor. He even wrote the required textbook. Lectures do leave a lot to be desired. Very hard quizzes/final, very easy labs. Offers tons of extra credit.  You will pass his class if you try.  However, he fails to make the subject interesting. Cant say I recommend him but there are much worse professors at NKU.

VERY knowledgeable and good at teaching. Quizzes are online, timed, and open book, but they are difficult. Suggest studying before hand and marking pages for quick reference. LOTS of extra credit opportunities. Not an easy course, some effort is required, but overall it is not terrible. So keep that in mind.

I took his Computer Systems class and while I struggled a bit in the latter part of the semester, he really cares about his students that want to do well and pass. His tests are fairly long, but they are very doable, assuming you put in the time to study. He explains things very well and is always willing to meet with you, should you need help.

The CSC 362 class is a very difficult class that is unlike anything else I have taken in the Computer Science track, focusing on the very base of computer software and hardware. HE does not seem to know how to use Canvas correctly, requires homework to be sent into him by email, and posts all grades out of 0 points.

This class is very tough. Definitely the hardest I've taken so far. However, I think Dr. Fox explains things very well and in depth, and is always willing to answer questions. He responds very quickly to questions whether it is through email or a zoom meeting. He does grade pretty tough but after a couple assignments it becomes clear what he wants

He is by far the worst professor I have ever took. what he teaches is nothing like the HW and exams he gives. He basically teaches 5th grade math and gives you college math for homework and exams on top of all that he doesn't give you enough time on exams and his reasoning is because the  exams are open note. extremely strict on grading.
He really cares about his students and will always be there to give detailed explanations to any question you have. Would definitely retake him.
Fantastic professor! He really cares about his students and does his best to make sure everyone understands the course material.

I took this class specifically so that I could have him as a professor again. His classes are incredibly challenging but there is no chance of you finishing the course not understanding the course material as long as you worked on the homework. Generally a fair grader and is always willing to help you with any topic you don't understand.

Dr. Fox was an incredible professor. He is very smart and is very good at teaching the class material. The class is a little cramped but he still got through everything without having to skip over anything too much. He genuinely cares about the success of his students. He is a hard grader, but a fair one.

This teacher is SOOO hard!!! dont take him if you dont have too... His tests are SOO hard.. your grades come a lot from the tests so if you dont do well on them forget it.. His study guides for a test are 5 pages long :(
SO BORING. I am interested in biology, but he made it incredibly boring. It was hard to go to when I had to go. The tests were hard if you didnt study for them. hated this class

He was very enthusiastic about his class, but in order to pass the tests you definitely can't miss any notes.  He is always will to help you too if you have trouble. Not much for bonus but what he does give helps a little.
He was very HARD I mean very HARD but as long as you go to class and DO NOT MISS his CLASS at ALL then you are FINE....
I liked Dr. Dahlem a lot-he was pretty cool..but hard practicals unless you study a lot!! He does offer extra credit which helped! He says "Or whatever" a lot lol!
He is very helpful and willing to help! This class is hard if you can not memorize because the study guides have everything you need. He is very excited about this class though.
Really not that hard of a class. I skipped a lot and still got a B. He is very nice and helpful and he knows what he is talking about. Take him for lecture and lab if you can.

Great professor.  Made me love sciece.  Wish I could have taken it without all the stupid losers just looking to get by without studying.  If you love science this is a great class.  If you hate science go back to Taco Bell where you belong.

I took Dahlem for my BIO 120 Lab. He's very clear on any notes, what's expected, and how to prepare for quizzes and tests. The class is MANDATORY. So many people skipped it and failed. Quiz every week and 2 big tests. Very helpful professor though. Gave Extra Credit (most labs don't). Really wanted everyone to succeed.
All I have to say is do NOT take him if you are planning on sliding by and not doing any work. He is very nice but expects a lot out of his students.

I loved this teacher! He helped me decide to change my major to biology because i just loved coming to class. You can tell he loves the subject and the lectures arent bad at all. Take him for lecture and lab if you can. Always study!

If you need BIO 120 with lab take Dr. Dahlem for both.  He is fair and a good teacher.  But, be prepared to work. You cannot give minimal effort in his class and make it through.  But, the good thing is he is just as willing to work hard and give as a teacher what he expects from you as a student.

He was amazing as a teacher! Asked for a lot but was always helpful and had a smile on his face. If you payed attention and studied, there was no way you could fail. Of course, some people skipped a lot because he does not rate attendance, but those people also failed extremely hard in a class you had to take to graduate.

He is very enthusiastic about the class. If you bring in a bug - any bug - he will tell you all about it and get super excited. The class was easy if you took good notes, which was also easy because he literally told you what to write down and what to blow off.

This is an okay class. Test are difficult. I would study 7 hours for each test. Gives really good study guides. Lectures can be long. Did not like science fair project he had us do. It was dumb. Not an easy grade. Be prepared to work for everything!

Dr. Dahlem moves way too fast in class. He goes through the slides quickly and gets annoyed if students ask him to slow down or go back. Many students missed parts of the notes because he goes too fast and won't post the notes online. He made us do a science fair project that took tons of time and effort and then decided to make it only 50 points.
Great teacher.  He is soo wrong about evolution though.  Jesus made the world.
Extremely hard teacher, and not much fun.
very nice and very helpful. he is willing to help if you are willing to try.  go to class take notes do the work and you will pass. love the half mullet and ponytail!! haha, good teacher though
I loved his class, very intersting and nice teacher
I didn't like this teacher. He made my time in Biology unbearable.
He was very nice and very clear.  He had a good attitude towards students and his research on fly species was actually kind of funny.
He tested kind of hard but told you everything you needed to know before the test.  I feel in love with science after his class and I am now studying to become a vet tech.
I sure missed the intelligent design lectures!
The class was pretty hard but he has a great attitude towards his students.  He was very helpful and even gave opportunities for extra credit which helped alot.
Very nice guy, but his tests are very difficult!
Horrific, this man goes out of his way to help you fail. and the ponytail has to go.

Course was a dream.  He is very clear about what he expects of students, explains material thoroughly, and is very fair.  Offers substantial extra credit and is fair and reasonable.  I would definitely take another course with Dr. D.

Clearly knows his stuff. Explained things very well. Quizzes were cake if you studied. 10 point extra credit assignment and the last quiz is extra credit if you've taken them all, or counts for one if you missed any. I found this to be a fun lab class, and I am not a science person at all. I'll miss it.

Nice guy.  He loves to talk.  All lectures are on power point.  Tests can be difficult.  Expect to study a ton of material for each test.  Do the extra credit, you will be kicking your butt if you don't.  I would take him again if I could.
dahlem was clear about what he expected of students, gave extra credit.. This guy loves bugs. not a bad class. he was very enthusiastic.
AWESOME PROFESSOR!!!  Would take any class he taught.  He's THAT good.  Remains enthusiastic after all these years, a pleasure to take his class!

An okay class and okay instructor.  His tests are difficult and you can't blow class off at all.  He goes through the Power Points a little too quickly, but other than that he was a nice guy and offered plenty of extra credit.

I thought he was an awesome biology teacher. You have to go to class everyday and as long as you take the notes and look over the study guide you will be fine for his test because they come straight from the notes. The textbook isnt necessary. He tells you to read it, but i never even bought the book and I got an A in the class.
He was an awesome professor. He keeps you all until the last minute of class. He loves to teach. His test were ok, they came straight from the notes.

This professor gives hours of homework and a pop quiz every class. He doesn't explain the right answers to the homework so it's hard to know if you're studying the right material for his tests but if you don't answer the test questions exactly how he expects then he marks it wrong. Avoid this class by all means possible!!!

Toughest class I've taken by far. Professor Dahlem doesn't offer any help outside of class nor does he explain anything in class so if you're taking his class prepare to teach yourself all of the material from the book. I would suggest taking this class with a different professor if you want to pass.

He wasn't very clear in the material and if you ask for help he says he will help you but never does effectively. I did not enjoy this class at all and it's a 100 level class that is as hard as a 300 level plus tons of work. I studied two weeks for tests and still didn't do well.

His lectures are scripted, and he never strays from what he was going to say. He reads the powerpoints to you, even though they're posted on blackboard. "Pop quizzes" are always expected, you'll have them every week. Exams are extremely hard if you can't memorize the book. I don't recommend taking him if science is not your strong point.

It was nice to have a professor so passionate about what he does and willing to share that passion. He expects work but is not difficult. One of the most fun classes I had (ento) and changed my career path completely.

You will work harder in this gen Ed course than in some higher level classes. Hours of homework each night are required of you want to pass and the lectures will bore you to death. If you don't love biology don't take Dahlem. He's a tough grader and you'll have quizzes almost everyday.

He's a great guy. You have to read and do a worksheet before every class because there are pop quizzes. On the exams you have to give the exact definition of terms. It's okay to skip class but I never did.

This is way too hard for a 100 level class. He is nice but he just reads off the powerpoints. He has too many quizzes and his tests are over too many chapters so it is hard to really learn anything and retain it. All of the tests besides the final are 60 percent short answer and 40 percent mulitiple choice (A-E). Do not take this professor.

Dr. Dahlem is a great guy. Passionate about his field, but the amount of work you have to do in this 100 LEVEL class is insane.. every day of every week something has to be completed. You can skip class, attendance isn't a grade but each class is worth 5 points registered through a clicker device you have to buy. I DO NOT recommend taking him!
Very hard. Quiz everyday, homework everyday. Tests are way too hard, study guide doesn't help too much. He's a nice guy but needs to stop with all the testing, trick questions and hard quizes.

While I would agree with the majority of other reviews that Dr. Dahlem's class was work intensive as well as difficult, overall it was not a bad class.  With nearly every lecture came a worksheet to complete, but these served as study guides for the tests.  Lectures tended to be boring, but attendance is one of the many grades in the class.

Hardest class I've ever taken other than Organic Chem. Great guy, sweet, passionate about bugs. Tests and quizzes are really hard but homework is really easy. Must be there for labs and have to study. If you dont study you will not pass.

I loved Dahlem he makes it easy to take notes and understand information! If you need help in this class he is always happy to take time outside of class to help you. Tests are a little harder but if you communicate with him and study you should be fine!
Greg is tough and does not really know intro to BIO but he has the best mustache.

This class is insanely hard for a 100 level class. Excessive amounts of homework and quizzes, this class was seriously non stop with the work load. He needs to realize that we're not all biology majors and stop making the class extremely difficult.

Dahlem's BIO120 class is a great intro to biology class. He provides worksheets that you can fill out and use on open notes quizzes, and exam questions come straight off the worksheets as well. 2 very easy writing assignments are required. As long as you fill out the worksheets and study a little bit, you'll pass easily.

While it can get a bit boring, he tries to keep it interesting. His tests are generally easy if you come to class and look at the review guide. He is very enthusiastic and actually had a whole section about cats. Piece of cake as long as you show up and pay attention.

As far as lab goes the quizzes he offer are straight from the study guide. I just hated studying 4 pages of material and only needing to know 10 answers. As far as lecture I literally did nothing but sit on facebook every class. You dont have to go to lecture so I would recommend you not as long as you are good with study guides. :)

You will get what you put in. Decent professor but expects so much technicality when looking for vocab answers on exams. Lecture is boring and irrelevent outside of class participation. overall as long as you are good with long study guides you are fine, if not stay away!
You get what you put into it. Tries to make it interesting but only succeeds 50 percent of the  time. You can not pay attention and pass

This is the toughest class I've ever taken. If you're not prepared to spend two hours on each homework assignment and 5-10 hours of studying for each test then I would suggest taking this class with a different professor. He is super specific on the short answer section of the tests which happens to be 13 of the grade, wish I could have dropped!

While he is a tough grader and his exams are difficult, you can easily pass the class if you participate and attend (aka put in some effort). His exams are very specific, so taking some time to study everyday is essential.

He is very through. He expects exact answers on test, which are short answer and multiple choice. There are lots of grades, which gives you a good chance to bring them up, but also many chances to take you down. You do alot of work and alot of studying. Prepare to really study 3 hours for every credit hour for this class.!

I'm probably judging harshly but for a general education course, this class is unnecessarily hard. They test are complete BS. He doesn't put anything from the notes actually on the test. The majority of the questions are trick question. You go over an entire section of notes and get tested by him putting the word and you writing out the entire def.

Dr.Dahlem's Entomology class was the most useful and informative class I've ever taken. It was also one of the more difficult classes I've taken. He takes the time to answer everyone's questions and gives you all the tools necessary to succeed. Gives the opportunity to earn extra credit by bringing bugs to class.

Fairly hard for an intro class. Lots of quiz grades. Preparation is needed. Exams are short answer/multiple choice. Dahlem is a good professor, I just think he makes the intro class a bit tougher than it needs to be. Online textbook was required for reading grades.
Great teacher!  I enjoyed science for first time

dahlem is great person but zoom lectures literally just consists of him reading a powerpoint. theres a worksheet for every class with in class activity worksheets and quizzes.. so much that grading is never up to date. honestly, this class is practically self taught.

Pretty good professor. Very smart...maybe a little too smart at times. He seems to find it a little hard to dumb things down and teaches more than necessary. An over-achieving professor. Tests seems a little rougher than normal too. Other than that, he's very good. Friendly and willing to help.

I would not take him again. I loved being in his class. I just think his way of teaching is not for me. His exams are pretty tough but passing is possible. He curves a lot so even if you fail you always can bring your grade up to passing which helps. I would say that you will be spending a lot of time in the calc lab if you take him.

I would not take this class!!..Long would be a great teacher for Liberal Politics but as for Math of the Liberal arts not so much. This is a VERY hard class the Class AVERAGE of both tests were in there 50's.. Long's teaching method does not seem to work he tends to go all over the place and force his HIS political views down students throats.
Some concepts weren't crystal clear.  He's a good Prof, but he should probably teach upper level.

Good Prof. He's really into applied mathematics. Tests are hard and long, but he will give credit when credit is due, hes not as conserned about the right answer as he is with the thought process. He is very approachable and willing to help.

If you're looking for a math class to finish gen eds or to fulfill some requirement, DO NOT take class with Andy Long. He's condescending and annoying. You'll find yourself laughing at him more than you pay attention. He doesn't say much during office meetings and I didn't find him very helpful at all.

Though he is enthusiastic about class, he is vague about EVERYTHING-homework, exams, grading.  He will dock points if you are messy, if you have typos, etc. His teaching style is one method and one method only, and if you don't understand, don't bother to come for extra help b/c he will just tell it to you the same way again.

This teache is not very helpful at all, he's very smart but he makes students feel dumb when they don't understand.  I don't agree with his ways of teaching at all. He's nice but only to the kids that are on the same level as him.

Nice guy, but not a good teacher. Not very clear in his lectures and when you don't understand something he'll come up with an analogy to help explain the problem to you which didn't really help.  Don't take him. Sorry.
He can be annoying the students who don't understand mathematics. He makes fun of the student, if he or she asks a dumb question. Tests are very hard. Take him at your own risk.

He's a nice guy.  That's about it.  He's vague about grades and almost everything about his class.  I am about to end his class for the semester and literally....what have I learned?  Nothing.  Cares more about your grammar than about your understanding of math.  Take this class from another professor and do yourself a favor.

If you are an English Major this is the math class for you.  If you are a math major this will be the worst class of your semester.  I enjoy my proofs class more.  I wrote more papers/pages in this class than my English class, and got more points taken off for grammar than content.

If you like English and Hate Math, he is a great teacher, but when you sign up for a math class to do math instead of getting points taken off for grammar, it's not a very fun class.  I also wrote less in my ENG 101 class.

Do NOT take this professor. I absolutely love math and was very good at calculus in high school with no troubles. In his class i was always lost and confused. Too smart to teach in my opinion. Knows his stuff but picks the hardest examples and describes things in odd ways. Online and book homework all the time. Exams are HARD :( Take at own risk!

I'm not a math person, but concepts can be easy for me to grab with any teacher but him. He's nice, but asking him a question means going way in depth and explaining things in the same way for a second time. Not clear at all and I wouldn't recommend him unless you really want a challenge.
He is definitely a unique professor in that he engages the students. As meeting a General Education requirement I think this class was easy, and the teacher was helpful.

Not a good class.  Only one test at the end of the semester, which means you have to remember information for an entire semesters worth of work.  Forces political views on students.  Also, he is not very helpful.
great teacher, very intelligent.
Super nice guy.

Prof. Long is a gifted mathematician and incredibly kind, but his class is difficult. He lectures the whole class, and struggles with teaching at a level everyone can understand. His tests are also very tricky, but he grades them fairly, You will need a study buddy/group outside of class if you plan to pass.

Dr. Long is a great person, and you can tell that he enjoys and has a passion for math. However, this does not translate to the class. He often leaves examples unsolved and problems unanswered. Our class was not allowed to use calculators on the exam, which would be fine if he did not use difficult functions. I would not recommend taking him.

Kind professor, and he wants you to succeed. However, he lectures the entire class, and if you don't get, which in my case I often didn't, there's no going back and you have to figure it out on your own. Find a buddy to do homework with and you'll be fine. I recommend him as a whole, just expect to do outside work to fully understand the material.

Professor Long is a kind person and has a clear love for math but is absolutely terrible at explaining the examples you do on the board.  His tests are hard because the questions on the tests are nothing like the problems on the quizzes or homework however is is a lenient  grader on his tests and quizzes

Literally do not ever take this class. Save yourself the stress and tears. He doesn't use blackboard and he not clear on your grade when you ask him. He is actually the worst professor I've ever had. He is not consistent with grading at all. Seriously take this with a different professor!

DO NOT TAKE HIM as a professor. He is a nice guy, but he does a lecture every single day with horrible hand written notes, very poor at explaining. Quiz every Wednesday, too old to understand blackboard, & iMath is literal hell. The only good thing about this class is that he only makes you spend $20 on StatCrunch.

DO NOT TAKE WITH HIM at all. He is the worst professor I've ever had. His tests are very hard because the questions on the tests are nothing like the problems on the book or homework. Doesn't teach what other professors do. He did not give a lot of example. He did not use the board at all. He has very bad hand writing. I don't recommend him.

Mr. Long is a Awesome professor.  He is like the Bill Nye of the mathematics department. You have to be there for classes. Those who complain about him probably didn't go to class regularly, he doesn't slow down for Slackers. I don't like math much at all but he made the subjects really interesting. Tests are hard but Great Professor! Recommended!

Well, Prof Long is an absolutely great guy, but an extremely tough prof, Calc 2 isn't an easy class either. I feel like I didn't learn much at first due to his tests, but that's not true. I learned quite a bit compared to those in other classes, he just has killer tests. Do the HW & you'll pass. He's just on another level intellectually.

Well, hardest class of my life. Nuff said. He's a smart, very approachable prof. But he is ridiculously difficult. The exams were a about 15x more difficult than homework and practice problems taught in lecture. Though, I feel well prepared for Calc 3, compared to the other class, I wish the exams would have been easier, and grading less stringent.

He is a GREAT professor, he knows what he is talking about. If you show up to every class, listen to what he has to stay, ask question and study you should do fine. If you don't understand something don't be afraid to ask him. His goal is for you not to like math but for you and math to be friends. I was definitely recommend him to anyone!

Worst Professor I've ever had. He doesn't explain everything and he wasn't very helpful when I met one on one with him. There is a ton of homework and the tests are nothing like the homework. He gives you problems that you have never seen before and are a million times harder than the homework. Would not recommend him to anyone.

There is a ridiculous amount of homework, and the homework is way harder than the examples in class and in the book.  Also the book really sucks - 1 or 2 easy examples and then a ton of insanely hard problems in the book.  He seems nice, but just doesn't explain the material very well.

NOT a good professor. Doesn't teach what other professors do. The concept wasn't difficult. The fact of understanding something he hadn't yet taught angers him and he is too full of himself and his own intelligence to help others who don't understand. You either get it or not. Called me stupid in class for answering in a new way. NOT RECOMMENDED!

I LOVE professor Long. He has the cheesiest humor and I love it. HIs methods are odd but they keep you interested. I've never missed a class because I feel he would hold me accountable. Students skip a lot and get angry with him when they fail but clearly its their fault. This dude is awesome and would take him again in a heartbeat.

Didnt mind him too much since it was online and reading from the book. As a teacher, I would not give him many stars since he is terrible at explaining anything. He clearly knows what is going on, but express it in class. Compared to other math professors I have had in the past, he was average.
Terrible teacher. Do not recommend. Doesn't answer questions when asked. He is extremely rude. If you can take someone else, do so!

Out of all of my years of schooling, I have never had a teacher give out as much homework as he does. You receive homework for his class every single day. I'm not even joking. iMath is hell, he's not tech savvy in the slightest, and I find him very condescending. He's a nice guy, sure, but he can't teach even if his life depended on it.
Worst class ever. Do not take even unless you need it for your major. Homework dropped my grade. None of the material am I going to need for life later on

only take her if you have a pretty good prior knowledge of the subject. you cannot understand her first of all, and she jumps right into the subject matter way ahead of time, expecting you to know what is going on, i dropped this class and am taking it again with Richardson,GREAT PROF. we are doing things now we had to do the 2nd day of class in Z'

Ok, so she is EXTREMELY nice, and will help you to the best of her ability.  Verbal communication is hard, but her emails are very helpful.  You basically teach yourself though.  Lots of in class homework, lots of reading the textbook.  She tells you specifically what to study and the tests are multiple choice.

This class should have been completely online, considering she didn't teach a single thing.   If you had any hope to learn anything it was on your own from this poorly rated book.  Also, verbal communication is painful.
No Comments

Not only is she hard to understand, but she barely teaches! She reads off PowerPoint but doesn't describe anything, even homework assignments (which aren't on the syllabus, she springs them on you halfway thru the semester). One of the worst professors I've had.

She is a very nice lady, who grades pretty generously. There are not many out of class assignments other than a main project. She gave us time in class, almost every period, to work on the final project. Exams are not cumulative, and are online based (at home). I would recommend taking her if I had the option again.
She is very knowledgeable. I learned a lot from her class. She always responds to students emails promptly.
Great teacher! She is able to make me understand statistics. Highly recommended.
I enjoyed her class. Her exams are hard but fair. She told us what to study for.
Very knowledgeable and accessible.
I took her database class. She was very responsive and very helpful
The project was very time consuming but she was helpful and patient with us. She was also flexible on some deadlines.
The class itself I found very interesting. But I felt like I was in A Ph.D class. Way too much work. She is a nice professor, but I spent more time on this class than any class I have ever taken.

I took introduction to database design with her. Class consisted of going over power point presentation notes of each chapter and some exercises from the text book. All assignments and notes were online. If you had any questions for her in class or otherwise she was extremely helpful :D
Great professor, always willing to help though the class is too intensive. Too many assignments.
Not really sure how this class is benefiting anyone...we're learning Oracle 8i...9i was End Of Life in 2003. This is 2010.
She is an amazing professor. She always spent time with students who need help.

I really enjoyed this class over all.  If you come to class you will be fine. Yes, she does have a accent BUT if you choose to listen and sat some what close you would easily understand what she is saying.  Ignore all these people who say they couldn't understand. Come to class, and actively listen during class and you will pass this class EASILY!
She is more than willing to explain anything and everything at any time for me. I really appreciate her help.
E-Commerce and we are learning HTML.  Terrible teacher, and does not understand anything.  The project is a job and very unclear.  Wow.
She was well prepared for each class. We worked multiple in class examples and she made sure we understood the content. The tests were fair and covered specific material.

VERY difficult to understand.  This is a basic programming class.  Why do I have to learn programming language from someone that doesn't speak my language?  We are learning to program for 1988...can we please learn something that is used in today's world?

She seemed like more of a proctor than a teacher. Poor English--she cannot understand you, you cannot understand her. But for some reason prefers to give feedback on assignments & project verbally--refuses to give written feedback (I asked her for it). Vague assignments & project + zero feedback + poor instruction in the first place = confusion.
Not a good teacher.  Hard to understand accent.
How some people get a PhD, I'll never know.  Terrible professor.  Knew very little and spoke broken English to boot.  Shame you HAVE to take her to make it through IFS program.
One of the worst teachers I've ever had.  Can't speak english, doesn't understand the material. E-Commerce class and we were taught basic HTML!  Very bad!

Poor Instructor.  I'm non-trad. Great student w/another M.S. degree in Engineering & has taught.  Dr. Zhang is terrible.  Covered 5/25 chapters in book.  Tested 2.  Tests = ridiculous and ambiguous essays.  Answers she wanted were no where need the question.  SAP labs make up for the tests.  She explains them well. I will avoid her in the future.

This professor is a joke. I took online. Exams and assignments are easy, group project sucked. WAY TO MUCH WORK INVOLVED, and she doesn't explain any of it worth crud. Stay away from her if at all possible.

half of the class dropped because he gave out so much homework and his tests were all long essays. He was NEVER organized. you never knew when he would want you to turn in hw or not turn in hw. he never did his lessons according to the syllabus, and his class was a freakin anthropology class instead of GEOGRAPHY!!!! (what it was supposed to be!)
Horrible. Dont take .
Dr. Metz is a great teacher. He is always available to answer questions. He is kind and fair to everyone. If you are confused then you didn't bother to ask him for clarification.
I gotta agree with the favorable response. Dr. Metz is really good - and always makes himself available for questions.
Stay away if you can.  Worst teacher I ever had.  Very unorganized,  does not even know his own lesson plan.

In a world where there are dire issues at hand, Dr. Metz provides you w/concrete and historic resources to make morally correct decisions as both a consumer and citizen. In Res. Man. there was alot to read but he gave all points of view. Tests are hard but a true testament to how much you learn. He is a most excellent teacher. i will def take again

Dr. Metz is a good guy! All videos all the time. A ton of one page papers and readings, but quizes and tests are pretty easy. You will be challenged a lot, but seriously this class has nothing to do with geography. Read read read!!!

Dr. Metz is a good guy, but his lesson plan is very scattered. He is very helpful if you do need. The only bad thing about this class though, is that the class (GEO-108) will be a SCI 308 next semester. He is teaching it like a 308 class. Not fun

No need to buy the books, he posts everything needed on blackboard. If you pay attention and attend class, tests are extremely easy. Kind of unorganized and all over in his notes, but if you read the slides and take notes on them yourself you will be fine.

runnnnnnnnnnn!!!  this is a science class people not a geography class.  VERY unclear, VERYYYYYYY unorganized and VERYYYYYYY unprepared.  be ready to gets tests and homework papers with missing sheets and multiple choice questions that doesnt even have the right answer as a posibility.  please stay away for the sake of your GPA.

He has a very scattered and boring teaching method. It is hard to stay awake. He take a -/10 attendance grade for the semster. I did poorly on his tests but ended with a C because he gives homework assigments that are do every class. He gives extra credit and the exam essays are given in advance to prepare. He wasn't too bad, but it was difficult.

class is based on his liberal political views.  Everything graded is based on his opinion, not fact.  Nice man but unorganized!!  If you speak out in class he will try to embarrass you if he doesn't agree with you.

Lectures were scattered and difficult to follow. However, Dr. Metz is very helpful and will work with you one on one until you get it. He wants students to do well, you just have to ask! He's also very accomodating if you miss a test you can make it up and just make sure you get all your assignments turned in by the exam
Very unorganized. Very scattered in lectures and very confusing. Needs to updates the books he uses in classes. Books are pretty old.

Not very organized at all. Very confusing on what he wants you to know for the tests. Gives places to know on both tests and quizzes which is kind of ridiculous. I sure hope they could find a better teacher.

Recommend do not take his class. If you are a history major, or are looking for a history credit, this is not it. Crazy unorganized. Have to take a GEO 300 course for history major? DO NOT TAKE HIM. You will regret it, as I and many others have. Nice enough guy, bad professor.

DO NOT TAKE THis class . Hes the only professor for this class unfortantley. Hes very all over the place . His tests are hard and he quizzes you on things before he teaches you . Hardest class ever . Professor Metz is a nice guy, but when it comes to his teaching, he is all over the place with his lecture. The quizzes he gives out before test are almost 30 questions and are harder than the test. Great Professor, but you have to listen. Listen actively and class will be a blast. You'll learn a lot and he'll respect you. He is very intellegent, and seems to act like he knows it. He is a pretty tough grader, who likes documents done precisely. This gets to be a hassle, but it is good for preparing you for the next level.

Dr walters is a great professor. He definatley makes the class interesting. The tests and quizzes are very simple as long as you pay attention in class. He makes the concepts very clear and easy to learn.

This guy is the most organized, on the ball teacher I have ever seen. He teaches well, posts all lectures online in video format, offers many tools for help and gives decent sized tests (for more points, right?). Very willing to help and very patient. Best chem teacher at NKU.

It is a ton of work!! Be prepared to work your butt off! It can be very time consuming with this class. He acts like his class is the only class you have for the semester so be prepared to constantly do homework for his classes.

Awesome professor! Highly recommend him. Records each lecture, streams exam reviews if you can't be there. Just an awesome teacher, and funny too. I'm taking him again next semester for 121. Can't wait!

Walters is the best chemistry teacher at NKU. No other professor is as fair, organized and tech savvy as he is. Dr. Walthers is not the professor to take if you are looking for a science gen-ed. He is very organized and very prepared, but I am an A student and I ended up with a D+. Dr. Walters is a real good fellow. He records his classes so if you're a sleeper like me, you can catch 'em, though you'll get docked on the attendance, and lets face it he's hilarious. Def. not an easy A but still worth it.

Dr. Walters is a dmn good fellow. He records his classes so if you're a sleeper like me, you can catch 'em, though you'll get docked on the attendance, and lets face it he's hilarious. Def. not an easy A but still worth it.
Hard class.  He is very willing to help just ask.  His classes have online segments.

Extremely helpful. He will dedicate hours on end outside of class (and in class) to help answer any questions you have or clarify any topics. Even if your not in his lecture or lab, he will happily help you out. Be prepared for essays on the exams.

Dr Walters is an awesome professor. He is THE most organized person I've ever seen. Lectures and review sessions are recorded. Starts and ends class EXACTLY on time. Inorganic is an inherently difficult subject.  He made it appropriately challenging.  He was obviously excited about the subject, especially the excitation of a compound with light.
Very helpful.  Notes are accessible to students.  If you enjoy powerpoints, this is a good class.  If you prefer teachers using the board, this will not be easy for you.
Wonderful teacher.  Always willing to help no matter what.  Be prepared to use the internet A LOT.  Hard class, but if you study its a piece of cake!!
had him for lab and he was very helpful. Great at explaining, but the lab reports you have to write are long and hard. Very helpful though. Great guy, and very nerdy humor but hes really cool.

He is always there to help you and holds study session i the evening before every test.  He's super smart and really knows his stuff. Very good teacher he explains things very well and holds review sessions for the tests.  He helps out a lot before the tests

This is a awesome professor i am accounting major and i hate chemistry i took him and found out its a piece of cake. He just really cares about his students.

Incredible professor!  I have never understood Chemistry, but he teaches in a way that makes it much more simple.  I plan on taking him again for CHE 121 and anything else i can...i highly recommend him!

Great professor.  The best Chemistry teacher I've ever had.  Great sense of humor and makes the class fun.  Whether you are a chem wiz or not, this is the professor you want.

Best chemistry teacher I have ever had. Its a lot of work but its worth it in the end. He is always willing to meet with you and explain things until you understand it completely. Definitely a professor I will never forget. Take him if you get the chance!

This is a weed out class but if you really finish the homework and pay attention in lecture, you should be alright, but he will always answer emails and stupid questions.

He was fantastic! If you're not a math person take him, the pace is slow enough to really understand the subject. He was very willing to help.

This guy knows how to teach.  He has a good balance of teaching and joking around.  It makes it easy to enjoy his class.  If you get the chance to take Calculus with this guy, do not drop out.  Calculus is tough enough but having a teacher other than this guy is going to make it harder.

Absolutely awesome. He is a laid back profeesor who teaches you exactly how you want to be taught. He does not do anything tricky. He maked the class as hard as possible. He gives a study guide then tests over other material. If you can avoid. He is funny in class but he will atempt to fail you on the tests. You can study, get help after class and still end up with a bad grade.

Pros: Very funny, makes class interesting, willing to help when you need it, approachable and understanding.  Cons: Tests are impossible (I took Calculus in high school and still made B's and C's), difficult homework, moves very quickly.
I love me some Jimmy Rankin! He is sooo nice and just a good person.. he makes lame math fun. will truely work with the students!
very funny

Dr. Rankin is so funny.  He makes math fun and has a great way of making the difficult stuff seem so easy and can explain it very clearly.  I'd want to have him again definitely!!

very funny man. class is fun, especially with Rankin's comments. take this class if you do not like math but need a math class. very few calculations. more everyday math than menial aritmetic.

He made the subject fun! He acts like he has no idea what he is doing but he really does...thats his way of making the students think! He is halarious and I enjoyed every class. The class material is not easy so you have to work. But John will help you in any way he can.

Sometimes he seemed to be teaching himself as he was going.  Lets you out late every day.  Really great guy, but not the best teacher.  Very funny.  His voice always cracks.  MAT 185 is a tricky math class, all about logical, you really have to think and learn a new aspect of math.

Great Guy!! I had him last semester for mat 109.  If you work hard in his class and pay attention and put forth the effort, you will do well!.  Enjoy his class, he is very funny and I hope I have him again in the future for another math class.

The class was a little rough, but Steve always tried to make it somewhat entertaining.

Dr. Rankin is literally SO helpful and even though his lectures are usually clear and easy to follow, he is always willing to stay after class to answer any questions you may have or set up appointment times with you to help you work on homework. He makes everything easy. He takes his time and  is great at finding common ground with his students.  His teaching experience shows. John was exceptional. If noticed a lull in the class he would start a story or make a joke in order to keep us focused. He was very accommodating. I could tell that he is there to help the student succeed. He is very wise in mathematics. Would take again.
Very funny, approachable for help, and I enjoyed the class

Great teacher, very funny, and he explains things very well. Not so great w/ email and blackboard, but if you approach him in person he'll take time to answer all your questions. Great guy. Highly recommended.

This guy.. is AWESOME! He is HILARIOUS and makes class so fun. He always makes sure everyone understands before moving on and is very easy to approach. He loves his stuff and loves his class. This professor is hilarious. I enjoyed every minute of his class. He put math in an entirely new perspective to me. He cares about his students. DO THE HOMEWORK. in my opinion, I did not feel  he was a good professor. in class he makes it look easy, and only uses the simple problems. Very approachable and laid back. Always ready to stop and explain anything if you get lost.  Easy to understand, takes things slow and steady. He's hysterical in my opinion. I hate math, and can't wait to be done with the class, however he makes it very enjoyable. Funny, approachable. Class absolutely sucks, but he's a great guy.
Amazing teacher! Dr. rankin really cares about student success and makes class fun! Do not stress about his class! He will make sure you get through it! Awesome guy and very funny!
Nice guy, but very confusing.

Super awesome guy. I was nervous about this class going into it (5 credit hours!) However cheesy his jokes are, they are still funny. Only down fall is he will skip some "Algebraic Jumping Jack" steps sometimes and get you lost. I would take him again in a heartbeat.

This dude is hysterical. I HATE math, but he made it fun and enjoyable for me to spend time in class. He jokes a lot with students, and uses a lot of anecdotal word problems. Tests are hard, but he offers plenty of opportunities to make up for it.
