You either like him or you dont honestly. Hes a good guy! He will call you out if he doesnt think youre playing attention or if youre on your phone but he gets to know you as a person and has good stories and dad jokes. I would definitely take him again.

He tells pretty good jokes and is a great guy but is very old school with how he teaches and his ideology, not a class to get on your phone (he will call you out). He doesnt use canvas at all. He learns your name and wants to get to know you but with that he does randomly call on people to answer questions. He also tells good stories!

Nice guy, teaches the topic well. Takes breaks throughout the class to tell a funny story to maintain the classes attention. Would take him again however the only thing I didn't really like was that he didn't use canvas and I couldn't follow my grade throughout the semester.

I've never seen someone so in love with statistics, which makes for a very enthusiastic, entertaining prof. Dr. A was very clear in his explanations of everything, and I never felt like I was being left behind in his class. He's very organized, always prepared, and knows exactly what he's talking about. If you have to take stats 212, take him!
This man was very nice, but when teaching it was hard for me to follow.

He is the worst teaches at NKU. He is all over the place when he is teaching and talks way to fast and you can't read his hand writing. He doesn't give you any aids to help study for exams and he doesn't use blackboard so you never know what your grade is & he uses minitab for homework assignments which can only be accessed from the library or FH
Very knowledgible and definately willing to stay behind and help.
he is awesome

I had Dr.A for stats 205 and he was awesome! He makes the class very easy and as long as you attend class you should easily get an A. He does change notes very fast, but puts everything on his website. Very good teacher.

Great professor!  You need to come to class to keep up on notes though. He posts things on his website but it really helps to come to class to work through his examples. Easy to approach and willing to help.
Excellent teacher- funny, nice, easy to understand and willing to help.
No Comments

Awesome professor. Some class time is spent going over notes and much of the class time is spent working out examples as a class - he really makes it simple to learn the material and get good grades. Take him if you have the option.
THEY WERE VERY HELPFL I THOUGHT HE WAS A GOOD TEACHER DOES ALOT OF EXAMPLES IN CLASS AND THERE ARE POP QUIZZES SO GO TO ALL CLASSES
Good teacher, did a good job of explaining the material to the students.
Really boring, but he is a good teacher and does a good job explaining the material. I just couldn't stay awake, tests were REALLY HARD

if you write down everything he writes down on the board including examples you will get at least a C.  he also lets you use a note card on tests... he is boring but you have to stay awake so you dont you wont do so good.

I took him my first semester of college, and I was scared to death to take a college math class. But 113 is really easy, and he is a great professor to take it with. The homework is always really easy, and I almost always got As on his tests. I definitely recommend him!

His class is boring but easy.  His examples are great and they are really helpful when it comes to studying for exams. He lets you use a formula sheet on all tests. He gives enough tests so that if you do really bad on one, you can bring your grade back up. Gives homework and quizzes that really help grades as well.
He is great! He gives great examples and is really helpful, hes so easy to understand he makes the class easy even if your terrible at math
He is a wonderful teacher.  His notes are clear and organized. He is always willing to help.Attendance isn't mandatory but I suggest going it really isn't that bad.
Extremely helpful Professor. He really made things easy to understand. I hate math and usually do very poor with it, but I did really well in his class and really enjoyed it.
very good. you can actually understand him!

This guy is very kind and extremely helpful.  He knows his stuff, and he knows an effective way to teach it to you.  You will have no problem following his lectures in this dreaded subject of statistics.  But if you do, he WILL help you.  I've stayed after class for further help on 3 occassions seeking the answer to a few extra questions after clas

This man knows how to teach! He is wonderful.  I'd taken Stats twice before with other professors and did horrible - he really knows how to explain things - I HIGHLY recommend him! If you go to class, take notes and participate you should do well.  Tests aren't cake - but if you do your part, you can pass them.
Totally difficult and hard to grasp concepts, jumps around way too much to get a passing grade
This is a pretty easy class, but it is very boring, and you write ALOT (expect about 2 to 3 pages of notes a day, if not more)! He is very helpful though. Overall... ok class.

I really like Professor Agard because he moves quickly but will stop if you are confused and also gives plenty of examples. Hes really nice and statistics is boring so the class isn't Fun but he makes it bareable

Very good professor, I personally understood his way of teaching quite clearly. His tests are pretty easy, just do the homework problems from the back of the syllabus and you'll be well prepared. Very willing to help out if you need it during lengthy office hours.
Take good notes and do the assignments. Lectures are 100% copying down his work.

By far the most confusing math teacher I've ever taken. Math has always been my best grade but the notes in the class are so unorganized and all over the place. The tests are based on the notes and were very difficult. I would not take him again.

Dr. Agard is in love with stats, but he is very confusing on notes and tests are VERY difficult. Math has always been my highest grade, but this was the hardest class I have ever taken. He is very upfront and expects assignments to be on time and completed thoroughly.
His lectures are dry and will put you to sleep, especially at 8 a.m. He's a tough grader... you'll never get 100%. This class is my first B and my only B this semester.
Really helpful, easy material!

Dr Agard is by far my favorite professor at NKU.  Make sure to introduce yourself day 1 and have a personal relationship with him because your class will be large.  As long as you show up to  class and take notes and do your homework, the class is not impossible.  Showing up to office hours is important too.

Dr. A was a good professor to have for STA 212. He would post all of the notes and what was done in class that day on his website. Make sure you go to class, however, so that you get plenty of examples for the chapter. He also posts study guides and practice problems to study from for tests so that you are well prepared.
nice teacher

Dr. Agard was great! You can tell he really loves stats, and wants you to leave about them...and understand them too. He took time to full explain the concept then went into examples. Class was basically examples. You have 13 homework assignments, he keeps the 10 best,three exams, and my class only had 3 quizzes.It was a great class!I recommend him

Professor Agard is in love with statistics and is very willing to stay behind in order to help you. However, his notes are very confusing and the exam questions (based on the notes) are incredibly more difficult. I am excellent in math and could not understand what he was trying to teach. If you miss even one class you are way behind
very dry lectures

Dr. Agard is a good professor and he knows what he is doing. My only issue with him is his grading. I did not know my grades the entire time because he does not regularly use Canvas and only puts in grades at midterms and end of the semester. He does answer questions that you have but like I said, you're kept in the dark about your grades
AVOID!!!
I was scared to take Statistics at first, but with Dr. Agard I am having no trouble with statistics and I actually enjoy his class with the various real life examples he gives us.
Dropped this class because it was too hard and BORING.  He doesn't even try to make his lectures even a little interesting.

I use to like stats but when I took Agards class he made me hate it. I even had to drop his class because he was SO boring and SO hard! Like someone else said he doesnt even try to make his lectures interesting....
Very nice man, will do anything outside of class to help students
Extremely difficult to understand
Very helpful if you find the time to talk to him.
He really helped me in class and did an amazing job at his lectures. He is a great professor! Highly recommended!
One of the nicest teachers in the nursing program, very approchable. I wish her the best of luck with everything.
So nice! Very helpful!
She did an amazing job. Her lectures were always fun and interesting which made it easier to learn from and remember.
Beth is a good teacher. She will do her best to try to help you as much as she can. I recommend taking her if you can.
am i the only one who found her worthless and offensive. so ok maybe you are christian, thats great, does that mean that everyone has to have the same belief system as you? NO!
Great teacher!!!
Talks about her kids and tells stories too much. Wish she would keep on track minus the stories.
Good lectures. I found her approachable, even though I am NOT a fan of her politics and abstinence only stance.

I think Beth is a great teacher, especially when compared to some of the others. But it is true that she mentions her religion and god in a lot of lectures. Other than that I thought she was clear about her subjects and I really liked her stories.

Very nice, very helpful, and a good instructor. Lots of examples (okay, maybe a few too many)to help you understand the material. I don't think she mentioned her religion much at all. Gives a TON of stupid little assignments that take up a lot of time, and they don't count for much towards your grade.

Beth is the absolute best professor in the nursing program. She welcomes us to text her outside of class with any questions, and she will answer your question through a phone call in her off time from school. I highly suggest choosing Beth for any course she offers.

Beth is my favorite professor in the nursing department. She cares about her students and helps calm you nerves during the skills test. She is funny, frequently gave us candy, and is great at explaining things.

Professor Hickey is amazing and clearly loves her job and her students. Her caring goes outside of just class and she is always available to students in any situation. A lot can be learned from Professor Hickey and I wish every professor were like her.
Sproat is the man. He is not a hard prof if you just pay attention however be prepared to study atleast an hour for every hour spent in class, and that is after you read the chapters.
Best class ever!!!!!!
Sproat is the man! A man who cares about his students and truly loves what he does.  Gateway is lucky to have him!!
Dr. Sproat really cares. Not only about his students, but about the information as a whole. His tests are not that hard if you "read the notes!" It's college, not play time.
He is a very good teacher. Explains everything thoroughly and relates them as needed. Exams make you think, but come straight from his notes. You don't even have to open the book

NKU is gay, this was one of their best teachers, worked with students outside of class, he met with us for study sessions before tests at like 6 pm and stayed late into the night never complaining. Was one of the greatest teachers I've ever had. NKU needs more professors like him, he really cares, his class was hard, but he was always helpful and extremely clear on his notes.

He's a great guy, lots of fun, but I just don't see why his tests are strictly MEMORIZATION. We all just took the worst test of the year, and it was a matter of completely memorizing his notes word-for-word. Most people probably failed. Let's learn concepts and ideas, not memorizing the scientific names for the phyla!

One of the best teachers in biology dept., lectures always interesting, informative, and fun. Sometimes treats upperclassmen as children and midterm field practical was a terrible experience. A lot of memorization of skins and skulls. Learned a lot in the class, if you had Sproat for 150 and liked his style definitely take this as an upperclassman.

This man is one of NKU's best. He would come to study sessions late at night before tests on campus to help us, and answer all questions we had, he is fantastic, his tests are tough, but it is worth it, he gives you a great education in Biology, he is an amazing teacher, if you don't like bio, I highly recommend him, he'll help you without a doubt!

he sets his students up to fail. his tests are extrememly difficult and unless you are willing to do nothing but study his class and ignore the rest of your classes getting an A is nearly impossible.  he blows off the students who go to him for help. he is very animated so you won't fall asleep but you won't learn anything either.
He is the coolest teacher I have had thus far!
He teaches so that everyone will understand.
Tests are hard. The best average he ever had is a 79 on an exam

His tests are a bit tricky, you must read the questions very carefully.  His style of teaching is very confrontational and application based.  He's very good at making the material interesting, but sometimes it seems like he's trying to psyche you out.  Funny at times too.  I ended up doing much better than I though I would.  Participation required

Had him for lab. VERY helpful; would have study sessions for his students til 8pm! Works with you, makes sure you get the subject. Very clear. Compares subject matter to you personal life, so you remember and understand. Best teacher i've ever had, and i'm a senior! Helped students with lecture classes too! Very knowledgeable, very fun. Quiz every

he is absolutly the best biology teacher ever!!  i dont understand how people can say he sets you up to fail...i only studied maybe 2-3 hours before test and i still pulled B's on all his tests!  he is there for you when you need help...and his teaching style helps a bunch also!! dont be afraid to ask questions cause thats key in passing the class!
WOW!! HE IS AN INCREDIBLE TEACHER!!! I THINK HE IS AWESOME AND HE'S NOT BAD TO LOOK AT!!

He is difficult but probably the best BIO teacher you will find, it is mainly the context that is hard.He is always, always willing to work with you and is understandable.Only thing I didn't like is when he picks you out in class, but it's worth it
Hated this class.  Tests were too hard, but he was very into what he was teaching.
This was one of the best professors NKU ever had and he was denied tenure, and dismissed despite the multiple petitions from students. The university lost out on this guy and he will be missed!
Best teacher I have EVER had! Truly cares about the students. Very helpful. If you go to class and pay attention you will pass.

Probably the best professor I've had in 5 years of college. I wasn't particularly interested in Biology, but he made the class fun and he was always willing to go out of his way for students. I highly recommend taking him for Bio 120 if you've got a science elective to fill.
Nice Guy but very hard tests.  He cares a lot about students and will help any way he can.  Also an environmentalist nut-job.

Very good teacher, very nice person, fun class. However, his tests are DEATH. Extraordinarily hard tests that are extremely picky - multiple choice Scantron tests with choices like AB AC AD AE, etc, instead of just A-E. Make sure you can recite everything in your sleep if you take the class.
Dr. Sproat is a very caring but tough professor.  He challenges his students to learn but in a very effective manner.  I wish I could have taken him for BIO 151!

useless! is the most boring teacher ever. Everyone in the class is asleep. We do not use the book unless you want to use it for the take home tests-but not necessary. Labs dont make any sense. For tests-write directly from his notes and still wont get an A. Papers he wants you to be very creative and is a hard grader. Do not take this class!

I LOVED Dr. Vogler. All tests are take-home and there's 1 small paper. The labs accompanying the class were fun, short, and very easy and included no tests/quizzes. For ex. we made a musical instrument as our final project. Class was a bit boring but I def recommend this class to anybody trying to fulfill a gen ed requirement with a guaranteed "A."

The class is sooooo easy but it's a snooze class. If you need to catch up on sleep, do it here! Lecture all the time, occasional movies. It's not mandatory you come to class though, so that's nice, and all exams are take home. There are 2 papers and they are easy as well. Easy A

You can really tell he loves teaching astronomy.  He grades really hard and you never know what he is really asking you to do.  All the tests are take home but it is impossible to get 100%.  The papers are confusing but the labs can be fun.  The lectures are sooo boring but it is a good science class to take.

Most of the grade is based on take home tests.  Bring a pillow to class- on an average day, if I went 1/5 of the class was sleeping.  Tests are all take home, and the two papers are easy, though he grades very differently for each topic.  ex.  I wrote a very factual paper about religion and science,and got the same grade as less thought out papers.

I generally do not sleep during class, but this class made it extremely hard not to.  The professor is pretty helpful if you have questions and the take home tests are hard, but I would have failed if they were in class.  The labs are super easy.  I recommend this class to people who do not like science and are looking to get their lab over with.

He doesn't care about your grade. When he gives back papers/exams, he just assigns points w/o reason. 7/10 on that question! Why? Who knows?! Coming from someone who is published and has won awards for writing, I'm shocked that my papers which were done in proper format and well researched got low grades assigned w/o comments or suggestions. Bogus.

Vogler is a joke. He talks just to hear his own voice. 1/2 the class is asleep the whole time but he keeps talking and looking up at the ceiling. He is easy when grading labs, but don't expect that with tests. His tests are take-home, but all questions are paragraph responses with really vague prompts. Takes off points w/o reason, so no 100's there

He too his 110 class and copy/pasted it for his 115 class. They are identical. I'm disappointed that I am learning nothing new in this course. Doesn't care about his students unless you are very vocal, looks at the ceiling when he talks, ignores questions, rambles on and on. Tests questions aren't about what was discussed in class.

TAKE THIS CLASS! He's SUPER EASY! I sat in the back and worked on my other homework in his class. The tests are take home which is awesome. I really didn't learn too much in this class but I'm going to have an A. If you just do the work, and go to lab, you'll do fine. If you suck at science take this class!!!!

His Einstein class is pretty simple. Sign attendance, watch biographies/documentaries, do very basic level physics problems, etc. He's very lenient on deadlines, and knows what he's talking about, but dumbs it down for just about anyone to understand. I respect him as an intelligent professor, though I'd rather take an upper level class of his.

Avoid at all costs if you have any respect for your own intellect. Blatantly gets things wrong all the time, but mostly fairly intelligent. Unfortunately, he talks to hear his own voice. Exams are take home but graded strictly. Cannot recommend on any level.

AVOID!! This proffesor is the most annoying guy ever. He rambles on and on about nothing during class and because he takes attendence you just sit there bored out of your mind. Tests are take home so they're somewhat easy but he never talks about what's on the tests, you have to look them up and sometimes I couldn't find the answer. LEARNED NOTHING

He is the worst teacher that I have ever taken in my life. Half of the class is sleeping while he is teaching. Sometimes, he even gets a nap showing some videos to the students. If you suck at PHYSICS and don't want to learn anything. this class is for you.
This man is a waste of our tuition money. I was extremely disappointed - and I consider myself a good student.
he got very off topic and then would still test you on what should have been covered that day
Good guy...deadly dull class.
Great professor!  Knows his stuff.  Would highly recommend him!

Okay, I know all of these other ast 115 comments say that his tests are take home but they are not.  They are extremely hard. It is so hard to pay attention in his class because you are in the planetarium and his lectures make you want to do anything else rather then listen.  He does give some chances to get points back on tests.  No Attendance tho

Coming into this class having a high interest in planets, stars, and such, I figured this would be a fun class, if not the most fun that I'm taking. Sadly, total opposite, despite it being a 100 level class, it is 3x harder than  the 3 300 levels that I'm taking at the same time. Nothing on any of the 3 tests came from the power points  or book

The class is hard and its a lot to study but the content makes it worth it. Vogler is detached and says he open to helping but he comes off as unapproachable. Make friends in the class and study together. Keep up on the chapters and download the powerpoints after class to better your notes. There was a lot of extra credit on the tests.

I'm a good student, and I have never had problems staying awake in classes that I found boring. This was the first class I fell asleep in. He would drone on about things not relevant to what was on the slides. This class is entirely lecture, with a HEAVY weight on the 3 exams he gives you. Lab is only worth 15% of your grade, tests are worth 85%.

Need this class for a gen ed. I have been on the Dean's list three times, and i have never seen a class as difficult as this one. Yes, his lecture's are boring but he does talk to you about book material. He makes a study guide for you, but the tests are still next to impossible to complete.
The class was extremely bored but the 3 exams were take home, the two papers were short, and the homework was easy.

MOST BORING TEACHER IN THE WORLD.  I love astronomy, but sitting through his hour long lectures made me want to kill myself.  He just sat up front rambling through his powerpoint slides as the whole class slept.

Do NOT take this class. He changed things so now tests are NOT take home and they are hard. Class is so boring and he rambles sometimes. Lab is easy and is going to be the only way I pass this class. I am an A student and have never struggled so much in a class. He's a nice guy just not the best teacher.

Dr. Vogler is an amazing professor. He answers every question his students have, wants his students to succeed and provides interesting examples in class. I was dreading this class, but Dr. Vogler made the class very manageable. Homework takes many hours, but are useful for tests. Tests are open note/open book. Essays are interesting and simple.

Amazing Professor, explains everything extremely well, helps with everything! I just turned in my take home Final Exam and he was in his office from 8-11 to help anyone with questions on it. You don't get that kind of dedication from just any professor. I'm sad i can't have that class for the rest of my life. It was a lot of fun! TAKE HIM!!

Listen, Karl is such a nice guy but his lectures are super boring. The great thing is that he posts them on blackboard so class really isn't mandatory. Tests are take-home so you can use the book. Easiest class at NKU. The material is actually pretty interesting too.
Awesome Professor! Probably the funnest Summer class ever! The test are easy, labs are not complicated in the least. He is all around a nice guy. TAKE HIS CLASS!

I would never recommend him, but because the department is so small you probably won't be able to avoid it. According to him he hadn't taught the class in a decade and it showed, make a point of finding instructional videos, or other material outside of class because he he can't explain anything. Nice guy, easy grader, but terrible at teaching

Dr. Vogler is a very nice man, so my review is nothing personal. His lectures were very boring, he didn't seem to care if we showed up or paid attention, and it didn't seem like he really wanted to be there (this was a summer course). His exams were open-book, open-note, and multiple-choice. Just take notes, use them for your exams, and get an A.

Important information you'll need for quizzes and tests will be glossed over in lieu of his own personal musings. I got the impression that Dr. Vogler makes things unnecessarily complicated as an attempt to exert intellectual superiority. Don't let the pretentiousness of this course affect a spirited interest in Astronomy if you indeed possess it.

In an age where many topics are perceptibly grossly over-simplified, Karl will introduce you to the rigor of scientific thinking in subtle ways, challenge you to make accurate and rational observations and hold you accountable for success as a college student. He is an inclusive and enthusiastic educator.

Duuuuude ... prepare for a real crash course! There is a LOT of content covered in this class . Karl will give you all of the tools and information you need to be successful tho. Show up, use technology that scientists have worked hard to create, read closely, take good notes ... you'll be great.
Astounding and dedicated lab assistants.

Dr. Vogler is the worst professor Ive ever had. In the beginning he told the class and had on his syllabus that he would drop the lowest test and a week before the final he told us he wasnt doing that anymore. Tests were way too difficult and he does a horrible job at teaching. Im a good student and I work very hard but this class was awful.
I was looking for an easy since credit and I passed with little difficulty. However, there were some concepts I had to figure out on my own because he didn't explain them well.
